reviews.review: The quieter side of Sydney. Went over on the ferry yesterday, took 30 minutes from Circular Quay. A long beach with lots of surfing opportunities especially on a windy day. Also did the walk around to Shelly Beach along the seafront. A good beach in the afternoon when the main beach is in shade.

There is no beach like a Sydney beach!. Manly Beach has a special feeling which is unique. Actually it has a real tropical feeling. The shops nearby are reasonably priced and there are great restaurants, bars and coffee shops. Manly Beach is a must see if you come to Sydney.

My Favourite beach. I've been living in Sydney for 3 years now and everytime I go to Manly, I feel like I'm on vacation. The corso, have lots of good restaurants, a lot of beautiful and friendly people everywhere. The beach is just breathtaking, I always try to go during Sunday to take advantage of the $2.50 all day public transport. :)

Love manly beach!. Loved visiting manly beach it is a lovely beach! Just off the beach they have a fish and chip shop which is great being British, I haven't found many out here. Would defiantly recommend a visit as the beach is lovely.

Best for shops . If you go to Sidney you have to go to Manley .Its one of the only places you can listen to Aussies talking and it's great for shopping so much cheaper than the city .Sidney is expensive so look around before you buy anything water from 99 c to $7.5

Manly Beach of Corso. Every visitor to Sydney should take the Manly Ferry to Manly and walk through the Coros to the beach nad then enjoy the promenade along Manly Beach. Have a swim if its warm and enjoy Aussie beach culture.
Dining and walking. Dining at the Pantry is a good experience and it can be followed by a walk alongside the beach. Plenty of other restaurants in Manly as well plus fish and chip takeaways.

Nice promenade & even better surf school. Our family lived at an apartment at beach side of Manly for a week, while visiting Sydney. We enjoy the beach promenade a lot, and went running almost every day. Even better was the surf school at the beach. We had several morning lessons and learned some basic! Recommendable for families with early teens and tweens like us.

beautiful. No where near as busy as Bondi, absolutley gorgeous beach which was clean and the water was crystal clear.
Plenty to see and do around the beach and lots of great food and drink options.
Can't recommend a day trip out to Manly enough!!

Nice beach to walk along. You can take a very good boat trip from Sydney Habour and get an excellent view of all the well known sights of Sydney. You can walk along the beach for a couple of hours, swim if the weather is good. We regard this you a must when in Sydney.
lovely beach!. clean and nice to take a stroll with friends and family. we had brought a small picnic blanket and simply watched the waves. it was a very laid-back, relaxing afternoon.
A beach is a beach! . Lovely golden sands. They do surf lessons and have volleyball nets. Lovely relaxed atmosphere and very close to the ferry and shops/restaurants

Good day out. It's a lovely place for a good day out. Leisurely long walk, beautiful beaches & good food. The walk along Shelly Beach to Boathouse restaurant was superb. Lunch at Boathouse was something to shout about as well.

Pretty. Taking the ferry from Sydney to Manly is a nice way to break up a city stay. It's a cute beach town with a huge and beautiful beach. It gets very crowded so get in early to stake a spot. The current can be a bit strong so inexperienced swimmers be advised.
Lovely beach. Lovely clean beach, lots of activity. We took the boat trip from Circular Quay and had a lovely afternoon. Great place for a wander.

If you are not surfing... its better than Bondi. Manly is a great place and the beach spectacular. Waves not as big as they are at Bondi on average but the surrounding infrastructure much better - with the added bonus of sailing on the ferry if you are not local.

Chilly But Still Worth Going. I had a little get together at Manly in mid-September. It's a great place to chill and have fun with friends and some tunes. It was relaxing just sitting on the concrete wall that lined the edge of the beach.What to see: there's a lot to see. Loads of restaurants, little boutiques, grocery stores and souvenir shops.Some Tips: - It gets chilly near sundown, so bring a warm blanket or a good jacket.- I'd say bring cash if you can. $30 would be enough to enjoy half a day there.

Gorgeous and fun. Spent a late afternoon and evening here. A fun beach town with a lively community. It is a short ride from Sydney to Manly, there are great restaurants and bars. Lots of beautiful people here!

Love This Place. Caught ferry from Circular Quay. Looking forward to today as it is the Manly Jazz Festival weekend. Arrived early Sunday morning and visited the Manly Sealife Sanctuary. Really enjoyed this. Walked down to the beach and had a very quick and chilly swim. Walked along the promenade the came back to sit in the New Brighton Hotel. Had a couple of drinks and listened to the music. Very enjoyable and a beautiful sunny day. Relaxing

Best Beach in Sydney!. If you're visiting Sydney, don't even bother staying in the city-book Manly. They have everything and it's much less touristy than the city or Bondi. Plus it's only a 30 minute ferry to the city!

Pretty much something for everyone. Spent an afternoon on Manly. Plenty of fun watching surfers, playing in the sand, and taking a long walk. Many people swimming. Room for about any kind of sport on the beach. It seemed to be crowded. The waves were quite high in my opinion. Tree lined and large. Take time and enjoy. Toilets available.

Watched the whales. We stayed in Manly for a week and had a lot of fun on this magnificent beach. We walked along it, paddled and jumped the waves.One highlight was when my husband and I went out at 7am for some milk from Coles. The beach was busy with joggers and swimmers as we went to the shops. We bought a coffee on our way back to the house and when we approached the beach a local said she could see the whales playing out at sea.The beach was still busy and as we stood sipping our coffee on and nice Ocrober Monday morning we could see the whales coming out of the water a bit and the spray from their hole. We watched this for a while then we both thought "how better to spend an early spring morning" - you don't get that back in Scotland in October!!This is a lovely beach with loads of facilities, some other beaches are quieter up the coast but this has it all.

Iconic Australian beach. After staying in central Sydney cbd, it was great to head out on the ferry to Manly for a Sunday stroll. There are many restaurants, bars and retail shops right near the beach, so we enjoyed breakfast overlooking the beach. We walked through a Sunday market, then did the walk from Shelley beach to queenscliff. It was great to see hundred of children, doing nippers events for the surf life saving early on a Sunday morning. The beach was relatively busy with a mix of young to old locals, with a splash of tourists enjoying the sun, sand and chilling on the grass verges. A great place to relax, enjoy the view of the beach / coastline and people watch.
Great views. Quick ferry trip (around 30mins) from Circular Quay takes you to Manly Wharf. Quick walk down the Corso and you arrive. Great atmosphere, nice sandy beach.

A Day at the Beach. Took the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly Beach and walked to Shelly Beach. Spent the whole day exploring the beaches, very interesting path overlooking he Beach from the cliffs. Had lunch at The Boat House at Shelly Beach. Great place for lunch in a perfect outdoor setting. Highly recommend.

Great beach for all. This beach has it all. Surfing, swimming, volley ball comps, great wide pathway for walking and another for cycling, playgrounds and grass areas for picnics or sitting to eat food from local cafes and resturants. And the Corso /shopping mall right there too

Lovely stretch of golden sand. Just a short walk along the Corso (pedestrian plaza runs from the ferry terminal direct to the beach) and you are greeted by a big smile of golden sand. With the pine tree lined promenade and laid back feel of the town its easy to see why its Sydney's 2nd most famous beach.Pity we saw tourists feeding seagulls so our stay was short lived and we moved onto Shelly beach - calmer waters and no seagulls!

Beautiful beach.. The perfect beach to sit and people watch and to take in the amazing views that surround you.On the road behind the beach there are an array of shops and bars and restaurants that are offering all you could want or need.
Great surfing. This beach is right along the road in the town of Manley. Close to shopping and eating. It's an average size beach. Clean and good for surfing and swimming.

A slice of paradise.. This is one of the most happening beaches on the East Coast. Beautiful views. Excellent infastructure (path way, cycle track, volleyball, kids parks, cafes, bars, lifesavers, tight tope walking, good coffee and much more). Its a real pleasure taking a dip in the beautiful Pacific or just walking along the path. Awesome sunrises. Very popular place. Parking can be a hassle. Many excercisers, families and surfers taking advantage of the great location. Certainly a proud slice of Aussie culture on show for all to experience here. A cool and happy vibe flowing along on Manly Beach.

Family friendly and delightful!. We took the Manly Ferry over from Circular Quay and had just a wonderful time near the beach. Lots of great gift shopping to be found and on Sundays, there are is a market in the streets. Bought a gorgeous scarf. The beach was so much nicer than Bondi Beach and I wish we could have stayed there longer. We had a tour scheduled for the afternoon, so our time was limited. Could easily have spent about 4 hours there.

Beautiful beach. A beautiful beach which we would love to visit again.Appears clean with a lovely blue sea. Just behind is a street with plenty of shops and restaurants.Easy access from Sydney using the ferry from Cicular Quays.
Pleasant afternoon. After taking the Manly Ferry from Sydney, had a pleasant afternoon sitting on the beach promenade, watching the surfers and the other beach activities.

Best beach in sydney. Manly beach is one of those old fashioned Australian beaches, great sand with volleyball played, great surfing and good surf life saving. Beach front is full of great restaurants, shops etc. easily accessible from other parts of Sydney, by ferry or jet at. If you are coming Sydney you must see Manly.
Great beach. Even mid week in October - popular! People swimming and soaking up the sun. Friendly and safe feel. Families enjoying the spot also
Beach + wifi. Always good to get free wifi! Beach is semi-sheltered and is a good swim. Nice soft golden sand. Limited good eats around this area though, quite pricy.

Manly Beach and surrounding area. I am biased, as I live in the area but where in the world can you enjoy a beautiful beach with a promenade, a stunning harbour and beautiful bush walks offering ocean and or harbour views. Take the harbour ferry to Manly and walk 500 metres to the beach or anywhere around or just have lunch/dinner at the many cafes and restaurants or just eat by the water.

Even in the rain, Manly is beautiful and should not be missed. I had a short visit in Sydney, but wanted to make sure I made room for a trip to Manly beach. It was raining virtually every minute of my trip, so I decided I'd head to the beach anyways. I arrived around sunset, and it was raining but it was still a wonderful experience. The surf culture is really quite fascinating, and it's the perfect spot to watch the sun set. The ferry ride is definitely a highlight of any trip to Sydney.
Love Manly beach, so beautiful!. Manly is a great northern Sydney beach! There is plenty of good places to get fish and chips and bringing it on the beach -- just beware of seagulls!

Worth the ferry ride!. I wasn't sure I wanted to make the long trek out to Manly, but I'm grateful I did. Stunning. Once you get off the ferry, walk right through the wharf building without stopping. It seems that's where all the tourists go, but make your way out and cross the street. You'll see charming shops on a boulevard and better places to eat! Continue on that boulevard for a brief bit and you'll come to the actual beach. Beautiful! If you can wait, here's the place to grab a bite: at one of the many cafes overlooking the ocean. You can stroll the beach, rent surfboards, or just sit and watch the waves roll in.

Favourite Beach. Of all the beaches we visited in the Sydney area, I would have to say this was the one I liked the most. Bondi was just a beach whereas this place was vibrant and busy with lots to watch and see. The Corso is full of a variety of shops from low to high end values. People watching is one of my favourite things and there is quite a mix here from the beautiful people to the maybe not so. Swimming is monitored so young and old can enjoy it. There are nice open walkways and lots of benches. Lots of places to grab food of all kinds.

Awesome Beach. We really enjoyed our day in Manly. The beach is very beautiful and the town is interesting. It's an easy walk through a pedestrian mall from the ferry point to the ocean beach. Recommended.

See the locals, bring the sunscreen . Very, very popular beach for the locals. It's especially busy during school holidays and there's thousands of students soaking up the rays. The walk between Manly Wharf and the beach has dozens of shops, restaurants and bars making it great for anybody people watching too.
Lovely day trip . Nice little beach, lots of people watching opportunities, choice of food and drink either on the wharf or down the street. A lovely day trip.

Wonderful Beach!. If you're coming from the city, Sydney, take the ferry & get off at Manly, walk up The Corso, to Manly Beach. You can surf & swim there, with Norfolk Pines acting like a border. You can walk to the hotels (pubs), coffee shops & restaurants, which are across the road, & along the Corso. There's plenty of shops as well. A wonderful day out!

Great beach. Easy accessed by a nice ferry trip from Circular Quay, we found this beach better than Bondi. Once you leave the ferry terminal it's very straight forward to reach the beach through the Corso. Though it was a bit windy and chilly we loved the vibe and the fact that it's extremely popular among the locals. Nice place to hang out and swim, in my opinion if you can only go to one of the most important Sydney beaches, I'd go to Manly. Must see!

Good beach, not too crowded. We were a group of friends who went to this beach as we heard it is less crowded than Bondi beach. It was a nice and clean beach, there is a bathroom as well where you can change if needed, you can also surf on this beach. The surrounding area is nice as well, there are various restaurants just 20 meters from the beach where you can have lunch, dinner, drinks etc after you have been on the beach. This beach is also a short walk from the Manly Ferry pier.

Better than Bondi. I like the ride to get to this beach. Plus I like the area. The conditions are better here than Bondi, and a nice place to swim and hang out. More quiet than Bondi and Coogee, but still a popularity place. Plus other small beaches around.

FUN! FUN! and FUN!. Take the ferry close to the opera house to Manly Beach. When you get to the beach it's going to look like any other Beach buuuuut if you walk to the right (looking to the ocean) is where the fun is, a little very quiet beach. On your way to there you can rent snorkel equipment and swim to there. I did that and I saw little sharks and stingrays!
Beautiful. Manly beach and the surrounding areas were a sight to see! Would visit here again for sure. The beach was. Lean and tidy, the surrounds were beautiful and the locals friendly to talk to.

Hikes at Manly Beach. we visited Manly Beach a few times and did different hikes there.
the beach area is lovely and we enjoyed the hikes as well,
it is fun to go on the ferry, see the sights, and enjoy the day out.
Some of the hikes were called 'medium' to 'tough', and they
certainly were,,, just be aware and bring plenty water

Local place. This place is much more local than other beaches you can go to in Sydney, so it is very nice. It is not in the city, you have to get there by boat, unless you have a car, but, the voyage by boat is also nice, specially if you return in the sun set on the boat, you will catch nice views of sydney from the vessel.
great place for fish and chips. great trip from Sydney harbour by ferry , run all day and into the evening. lots of fish restaurants and lovely beaches. lots to see and do
My fave. I used to live near manly beach so i always have a soft spot about this beach..very laid back and relaxed..not to crowded, very recommended if you visit sydney

We chose the wrong weekend. Arrived at Manly during the long weekend to find a jazz festival in full swing. It was PACKED! There was no where to sit and everywhere was busy so we had an ice cream for lunch. The atmosphere was pleasant and we saw lots of people enjoying themselves but we found it too crowded so we left. It looks like a great spot to visit on a less crowded day. There are loads of cafes and restaurants all along the beach and some great surf wear stores as well.

Lively and fun day out. What a lovely place to wander the little street with some hidden cafes. Their are great shops and nice places to sit in the sun or in the corso. The 3rd Saturday of the month their is a manly school market with great food, new and second hand stalls. Night time is also a great time to sit in front of the beach for a nice dinner, plenty to see and do!
Another great beach. Well worth a visit for the day - get the ferry from Circular Quay - another great beach would highly recommend and would visit again.
Amazing . Love love love Manly, has to be one of my favourite spots. The magnificent views, lovely spots on the beach to just sit and relax. And the fish and chips shop was a hit with the kids.

A jewel in the crown of Sydney. Let me start by saying that the day of my visit could not have been more beautiful; the sun was shining brightly and only popcorn white clouds spotted the horizon. My son drove on this day and we came out of the car park into the shopping area, which on that particular occasion, was also full of stalls selling fabulous wares, like handmade jewellery, paintings and wood carvings. There are two sides to Manly, the area where you disembark from a ferry, to which we walked first and found the most bedazzling tranquil sea lapping against the golden beach - colours ranging from gold to acquamarine to emerald displayed in the sunshine. It was a pleasure just to sit on the boardwalk and absorb the beauty. If the view does not fulfill you, I highly recommend the chocolate shop inside the terminal building - heaven for chocoholics & some great gifts. Once we had experienced the quiet side, we walked to the other side of the precinct and found yet another stunning coastline with froth topped waves tumbling onto the sandy beach, more of a surfers paradise. This is lined with palm trees and a back drop of blue sky. Here we found a multitude of restaurants, all with reasonably priced menus and superb looking food and took a leisurely lunch. Onto Shelley Beach following this, a more secluded corner of this gem and from there my son and I decided to walk to North Head through the sanctuary; not a walk designed for flip flops I discovered but we did it on the spur of the moment so I use that as my excuse - it is long - make sure you have plenty of water - The walk offers stunning views, with plenty of photographic opportunities. Beware however, it is a long walk and seems to take a lifetime walking back (apparently you can get there by car !!) but completely worth it. I loved Manly and went back on my last day to just sit on the beach, enjoy the spring sunshine and watch the surfers, waiting with my phone camera to catch THE shot ! - Go, enjoy, feel the wonder - it is superb and you may even see a whale from a number of vantage points.
Beautiful beavj. A beautiful beach with plenty of trails to explore and take in the sights! It has a promenade to walk along and seating on the beach. Plenty of places to eat and things to do.

Australian Travellers. One of the popular northern beaches easily accessible by the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay. A short walk from the ferry terminal at Manly and through the town area, brings you to a very relaxing, scenic clean beach area with dedicated flagged swimming areas. Restaurants and eateries line the Esplanade area and special water bottle refilling stations have been provided along the beach front. A great family spot for a day out or picnic but watch the seagulls as they swoop on food if left unguarded!!
Great for chillin. Went for day here, beautiful beach, great for just relaxing and watching the surfers. Nice cafe on beach that does great food. Very laid back atmosphere
quiet & small beach. A quiet and small beach ideal for spending a few hours picnicking and snacking with your family or for couples

Relaxing and chill . Manly beach is a super chill beach where you can just plop down a towel and hang for the day! There is plenty of places by the beach to grab a towel, sunscreen or food if you forgot it! Not super crowded or touristy which was nice. You can choose what you want to do, lay, pass the footy, swim or surf! The water is clear and clean. You can take a ferry to get there which is fun to look at the sites, the only serious bummer is it has to be on an opal card and you can only top up in increments of $10 and we only needed to top up like 12 cents on our last day. That was seriously frustrating that you can't top your card up to make it what you want... so you tend to be way over on the money or under :/ otherwise beach is fun and worth making a little trip if you have time!

It;s a nice beach but not sure where all the fuss is about. Manly Beach is a nice beach but what makes it so special. I honestly don't know. Together with Bondi Beach the two most famous beaches of Sydney but I think there are more nice beaches. The whole town is super touristy with "cheap" (food wise simple, price wise expensive) restaurants and shops. The ferry ride to get there is my favourite part! And if you want to have a nice lunch/dinner, go to Hugo's on the ferry dock, really good food. Or head out of town to the South Head for a beautiful walk along the cliffs and hopefully see some whales.

Beautiful . Step off the Manly Ferry and walk straight ahead through the main street past cafes and shops and you can't miss this beautiful beach. Great for all ages. Watch the beach volleyball while eating an ice cream, go for a swim....heaps of things to do before going back to Circular Quay by Ferry.

Far but it worth it. Actually is a little bit far from Sydney but it worth take the trip and some hours to relax in this beautiful beach. During the Sunset is really nice and quiet. Forbidden drink alcohol as a lot of beaches in oz

Manly Beach - Not to be missed while in Sydney. A very nice and relaxing place. After taking the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly, the shopping area was superb and shopping with a great fun there. We made lot of purchases for souvenirs from the shops, cheaper than the shopping area adjacent to Opera House. In the middle of the street are fountains and comfortable benches to take rest before heading towards Manly Beach. It is, indeed, one of the best beaches and the scenery around the beach and buildings and hotels gave a mixed impression of modern world in the lap of nature. We reached there around 4.30 p.m. and there were not too many people. We went for a long walk and enjoyed the fresh cool air in the beach area. Wished we had brought snacks, drinks etc. etc. and to lie down near the beach. This was, however, compensated by taking ice creams and walk around the beach.Took some pictures of this lovely tourist place. Would like to visit again Australia to stay there for a longer period. One week is insufficient to see the beauty of Sydney.

Nice boat ride to Manly Beach. I took a nice excursion tour to Manly with a guided tour company. I could've taken just the normal transport, but the purchase of the Travel card, charging it up with money was too much of a hassle particularly as I was only in Sydney for a couple of days. If you are staying longer (not that i see a need to as Sydney can be seen in two or three days anyway) then I would suggest purchasing this and using the normal ferry transport to see Manly beach.

great beach. This was a great beach to visit and spend the day. It wasn't too crowded and the water was great. It was a bit cool since the weather was cool but the beach was enough and walking around was great as well.

Ferry from Sydney to Manly Beach. Must do!. Take the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly. Trip takes approximately 30 minutes. Stunning views to Manly and back, ex Opera House and Bridge. Beautiful views of Sydney Skyline.
In Manly, stroll along the beach, have coffee and cake, or lunch in one of a variety restaurants.
A great way to spent the morning, afternoon or evening!
Paradise. White sand and crystal sea make a perfect view of Manly. You can sunbathe, have a picnic and enjoy an unforgettable day
Best surfing and beach experience ever!. If you want to surf, play volleyball, jog, swim, chat or see the sunset, then this is the best location to be in the world!-great coffee too!

Holiday. Nice clean beach
Recommend swimming on this beach
Good eating places around then go on picnic.
Good for couples and families.
You should visit Manly. It is kind of a must see in Sydney. You enjoy the ferry and the beach. You should have your swimming suits with you, the water was so nice in september

Make mine Manly. Our coach toured the lovely northern beachside enclave of Manly this day. We walked around - charming pubs , accommodation ( plenty) shops cafes and lovely waterside terrace houses built many years ago.Good long swimming beach with walking esplanade . People out enjoying themselves, strolling and exploring.Obviously would be a very pleasant area to live in.Ferries to the city and VV from Manly.

Best beach in the Sydney area. Definitely my favorite beach in the Sydney are. The waves are big enough for surfing but not to big for everyone, including small children, to go swimming. It's right across from the corso, so there's easy access to all of Manly's cafes, ice cream shops, stores, etc. There's surfing lessons, volleyball clinics, and the manly life saving club. There's also an ocean pool for anyone who prefers to swim laps or doesn't like the waves!

Don't miss Manly Beach!. Manly Beach is a lovely destination - with lots of markets and small shops to visit. The coffee shops and eateries are abundant. It offers a relaxed feel away from the buzz of the heart of Sydney.

Fantastic beach. This is really a must visit. Outside Bondi, I think it's the most well known. The beach is great but so is the entire area. There are great walks, as there are all over Sydney and the Northern Beaches. There are much more quiet and local attended beaches a short walk to the north and south. Even at high tide, there is a decent amount of space on the beach. At low tide, there is ample space.To top it all off, it's just a beautiful setting with all the amenities you could ever want.

Surfing and local experience. If you want to experience the locals habits and like surfing or taking some time with in a wonderful place, this is the visiting you must do. It is very easy to access the Manly Beach from Sydney Downtown using ferry. Place full of locals and ideal for surfing. Take your time to relax there in a full day.

Day and Night. Manly is in my opinion the best large beach in Sydney (Better than Bondi)and the area is serviced from the City of Sydney by a great ferry service and this alone is a scenic trip to your destination, the beach is more family friendly than most.My only negative is late at night/early morning when the pubs close and many drunks hang around the Corso area you would not feel safe at all, But during the day it is fine.My night experience was observed from our balcony around 2 am at the Manly Pacific Hotel a few years back maybe things have improved?

Its a must. . Visited manly september 19 spring time. The beach has a charm of its own. That time was crowded. The street looks fun and vibrant. Flyers and invite vouchers are everywhere. Shopping and food will not dissapoint you. Its a good family destination

Nice ambiance . Pretty beach with nice ambiance. You may encounter surfers. There is a trail near the beach and you can choose between a short walk with nice views of the ocean and Manly or a 5 hour hike.
Relaxed atmospere. When arriving go directly across the road to the Corso which is like a very wide mall but very relaxed plenty of food shops and a great bakery

Magnificent City Square and Beach. Coming out of wharf and crossing the street in fron transports you to the beautiful City Square full of designer stores and eateries. Across from the city square lies Manly Beach which is comparable in beauty with that of Bondi Beach. We had travelled one way in regular ferry and on way back has chosen faster Manly Ferry as a culmination to day spent enjoying ourselves.

Great beach, great location . Lovely beach to sit and watch the world go by. Surrounded by restaurants, shops and bars located just a few steps away. A little market is usually there on weekends which is a great place to pic up some souvenirs! Also a great place to grab some fish and chips and watch the surfers! Will be returning for sure!

Great area for casual shopping and everything beach. Ferry lands in heart of area. Easy walk to beach. Huge bay. Walk follow end to end, up to lookout point. Nice day out whether want to be on beach or just shop, stroll....
Charming Place. Took the ferry from Sydney Harbor and enjoyed nice walk along the beach area and visited some charming shops.

Beautiful beach, great restaurants... This is a place you should definitely go to when visiting Sydney. Just a short 30 minute ferry ride away. Fun little shops, great restaurants, and beautiful beach area. Don't miss!!

Stroll on the Manly beach - a must do. Love to visit this place. The beach is clean and charming. I recommend going for the walk around to Shelly beach. It has nice and shallow. There's a nice fish and chip shop there too.
Beautiful beach. Only 20 minutes from the ferry point in Sydney Harbour and a long beautiful beach with shops and restaurants close by.

Such a lively happening place. Each time I come to Sydney I love to visit this place! It is always full of life and buzzing with people young and old. They have lovely places to dine for dinner or a light lunch. A few places to find a decent ice cream as well. The beach is always clean and has that charming feel. I recommend going for the walk around to Shelly beach. It has nice and shallow if you have little kids and has that cosy feeling. Theres a nice fish and chip shop there too.

This is one of Sydney's great beaches.. This is a big beach, several kilometers long with distinct sections that are different to visit and swim at. Surf could be very good in one area but average in another. It is worth checking our conditions and wind direction before committing to spending some time in any section.
Gorgeous!!. Love this place!! Beautiful buildings, great cafes and restaurants, awesome shops, amazing Sea Life Sanctuary, glorious beaches!! Could spend several weeks here and not be bored!!
Love the stroll at manly. Manly is a very clean beach.. lots of food options.. we recommend coming by ferry.. the manly to apit walk has some really good views.. Nice place to relax on a sunday

Manly Beach, Sydney, AU. Manly Beach, Sydney, AU is a beautiful beach area full of life and a fun place to visit. The beach is beautiful, there are lots of shops in the area and it's a lovely place to visit whether for a day trip or just a ferry ride adventure. A must see if you are in Sydney, whether you like surfing or just people watching.

Better than Bondi. This is a really cool area. Very hip, lots of fun restaurants, and of course, excellent surfing. I liked the atmosphere and location/sights here much better than Bondi beach. While the latter is more famous, Manly has a much better and intimate vibe. Highly recommended.

Birth place of surf.. We had an incredible sunny day walk. Plenty of surfers learning their craft in the mild break, and more advanced further on the north part of the beach. Great for watching, free drinking water bottle refill. Plenty of shops from the ferry pier to the beach. Lots of room to walk 4 a breast.

Beautiful beach. Unlike Bondi Beach which is much more accessible from Sydney CBD and surrounding suburbs, Manly Beach is 7 miles away from the CBD by ferry hence the crowd is much smaller.The smaller crowd means you have more personal space while enjoying the water and the beach.The water was cold and waves strong when we were there so we did not swim. It was safer to swim at the Manly Cove next to the Manly wharf. However walking along the beach and having lunch at one of the many tables and benches were priceless experience.

Touristy but beautiful and conveniently located. I work in Manly and find it a little touristy but it has easy access off the scenic Ferry from Circular Quay and great shops and eating choices. Just make sure you get off the main strip for food. Don't do the Corso.

Great beach a short hop from the city. Went over to Manly on the ferry from Circular Quay. Took about 40 minutes and was approx $8. Nice small little town with some great shops.Walk through the main street and you are on the beach. Great clean beach. Toilet facilities and water fountains (or bubblers I think the Aussies call them?)Weather was clear when I was there ( early Sep). Not really warm enough to sunbathe as such but nice couple of hours on the beach. Plent of people on a weekday, some having surfing lessons, others just walking and chilling. Very laid back vibe

Adam. Manly is a great spot with beautiful harbour breaches & a great surf beach with a beautiful ocean front promenade. Make sure you walk up the pedestrian friendly Corso with it's many shops & restaurants. I would definitely recommend Manly as a base if you are planning on staying in Sydney. It's only a 15 minute fast boat ride into the city and you can swim in the ocean for most of the year. Definitely worth a look.

a great day out. the best way to visit Manly is by ferry from Circular Quay in the city, then wander down The Corso to the ocean beach end and around to pretty little Shelly Beach, or the ocean baths in between, then back for a yummy lunch at one of the many eatery options available, either indoor or al fresco.

...prettiest EVER !. Couldn't wait to take the ferry over and see this lovely beach again! Not too many swimmers in winter, but the setting with the lofty pines along the walk is just wonderful. The pedestrian arcade for shopping actually offers quite a few items actually MADE in Australia - which is pretty unusual.

Beautiful. One of the world's most iconic beaches. I walked and ran on Manly Beach. It is busy but not too busy. It is dangerous (sharks, rips and shore dumps) but not too dangerous. It is a great place to sit and watch nature, or to sit and watch people (which is possibly the same thing). It has lots of amenities and a great variety of good restaurants, cafes etc. from which to watch and eat. On a warm day it's hard to beat with fresh water showers and shade, walkways and ice-cream shops. Highly recommended.
Manly beach. Love this place family friendly great choice of bars restaurants. Fab beach friendly locals. Easily acessible via ferry from sydney scenic route

Can't match Bondi but worth a walk. Fun to walk on the beach. Usually surfers to see. Sometimes a bit exposed to the weather and if you come from the ferry you have to go through a promonade that is one long tourist trap.
Wonderful laid back beach. Manly Beach is fun to go to and relax. Nice ferry ride from Circular Quay on the slow ferry. Get you Opal pass.
A nice little beach in Sydney. Worth a quick stroll but nothing exceptional. Took the slow Manly ferry to see the place. Quaint old town feel to the place.

Magnificent Manly. After catching the ferry across, we arrived at beautiful Manly. It has a lovely beach, which I preferred more than Bondi. It has a lovely vibe and we enjoyed walking along the promenade on a cool winters day! No swimming for us. Many shops, restaurants and pubs to choose from. Great tourist information centre. Great place for tourists.

Location. Love the ferry trip from Circular Quay to Manly wharf.Best view of Opera House and Harbour Bridge from the ferry ride. Short distance walk to the beach, cafes, restaurants and shops from the wharf. There are shaded seating area with benches, close by restroom and walking track along the beach. Recommend ferry trip a and day out at Manly beach.
City Beach perfection. Excellent original surf beach close to city, beautiful sea breezes, clean environment, friendly local businesses and plenty of eateries at reasonable price close by,

It's almost relaxing moment, until the birds get near you. I love the beach and the waves. There are a lot of tourists as well. You can buy food from the food chains around and eat in the benches or along side the shore. The water is clear and the beach itself is clean. The only problem is the birds. If you're a tourist, better not feed these birds. They will fly from nowhere and try to get your food.

Delightful. This is a great place to visit. Transport by Ferry from Circular Quay, or bus from various places. You can enjoy a walk along the beach, which is a stroll along Manly Corso, weather permitting, go for a surf. Around the Corso, and along the beach front there are many good quality restaurants and hotels. I can recommend The Ivanhoe. Sure you will enjoy this place as I did.

Great afternoon trip. If you're looking to kill a few hours, or see one of Sydney's other beaches, Manly is a great option. Relaxed vibe, good restaurants, basic eateries, and terrific beach. The ferry trip is a great way to see a bit more of the harbour as well.

Totally overrated. For the life of me in trying to work out why thousands love this place!! It's a beach not even a special one, there are way nicer beaches in West Australia. Granted the ferry ride is lovey, but if you're going to take the ferry rather go to Watson's bay, far prettier. Don't waste your time or go on a Sunday when at least the ferry is $2.
Lovely area. We went to the beach and it is just beautiful. At this time of the year it isn't extremely busy. Furthermore, near the beach there's a lovely town that you should walkthrough!

Better than Bondi. Each time we got back from Manly with friends from other countries, they would ask me "Why Bondi is more famous than Manly?" I answered, "Maybe because Bondi is a more Aussie name?" I think many Sydney people would prefer Manly. The beach is better. There is also a market nearby. (I know Bondi has a market, too. It is bigger, but the price is also... you know, Bondi price.) Lots of cafes. And one thing important: it is easy to go with public transportation.

Good place. If u have time visit this beach ... It's very scenic and has something for everyone . Lots of places to eat too, and some shopping arena . Ferries from circular quay get u there or the tourist buses or public train

A perfect place to spend new years day. We decided to spend new years day at Manly Beach. We couldn't have made a better choice there are tons of restaurants and gift shops. The people are very friendly and the views are amazing.

Superb beach. When I was in Australia during 2011-12 I used to stay in Manly area. Manly is one of the happenening place in Sydney area.Manly beach also one of the attraction here.Very clean beach.Good for morning walk,evening walk, jogging and many more things such as water sports.Nearby there are many good redtaurants, cafes and bistros in this area.

One of the best beaches sans enough parking. Can anything negative be said about Manly beach? Absolutely beautiful beach, wonderful atmosphere, even more so summer time, reachable by bus or ferry, next to a big mall, plenty of shops and eateries, beautiful girls (if you are lucky they will be playing beach volleyball), fine sand, enough surf, hotels and restaurants along the esplanade, lovely and friendly locals walking their dogs (once I felt this was a dog show in itself). The lust goes on. Darned autocorrect! I meant the list goes on. But the answer is yes unfortunately. Around manly beach area there is no parking to be found. On more than one occasion we have visited manly with family and simply left after driving around for 20 minutes or so and not finding any space to park.

Beautiful and clean Manly Beach. We visited Manly last week, then we really enjoyed the atmosphere. The Corso has a lot of shop you can but what you want. The beach is clean, many birds, the face the open sea. Nice beach to explore.
Love it. Still clean and pretty. Heaps of activity and even a lovely market on the weekend. The area has lots of seats. Great family spot
Australian Vacation. Liked this area better then Bondi Beach.If you only have time for one, I would pick this.Charming town.Nice beach front restaurants.Beautiful views.
Wonderful Walks. Great day trip to Manly on the ferry from Circular Quay.. Lots of places to eat, and fantastic walk ways along the beach.

Fun for everyone. Hop on a ferry from Sydney and within minutes you leave a big city and find yourself in an elegant, fun small coastal town with plenty to do and see for everyone in the family. Lots of nice little stores, lots of places to stop for a snack or simple lunch (with local fish), playgrounds for kids, bike and walking trails, but most of all a clean, wide and beautiful beach with decent waves for those who surf. We spent a very nice afternoon walking, shopping, eating and enjoying the beach.

Another memorable experience . The slow ferry ride with views of the harbour and its surrounds was just the start of this memorable day. Manly was bustling when we arrived in the early evening on Sunday. We walked to the beach and chose from the multitude of eateries to dine at. Fish and chips was unforgettable for its quality and the attentiveness of the wait staff. Manly is clean and user friendly even though this is my first time here.

something for all. A trip by ferry from Circular Quay to Manly is a relatively inexpensive way to see Sydney Harbour. At Manly, you can swim in the Harbour or walk down The Corso to the patrolled surf beach. Retail shops and cafes abound and there is often free entertainment and markets. A walk along the beach to the north leads to Queenscliff but you can also head in the other direction and walk the path around the headland. I would recommend take away fish and chips eaten while watching the surf or harbour. If pubs are more your scene there are a number to choose from.

Great beach, great surfing lessons. Just happened to be there at the right time for our boys to have a surf lesson with the fantastic Manly Surf School. There were about 4 of them in the lesson which gave a fantastic start to surfing- really great staff who were skilled and very friendly. We even saw whales breaching on the horizon whilst we watched.... a great beach to walk.

Sun, surf and good walking. Manly is a great year round destination for walks. Once you get off the main drag called the Corso you will find great shops, restaurants and cafes. The beach is great for swimming and surfing. A shirt ride by ferry from Circular Quay.

Nice beach and surroundings. Took the ferry (slow one to take in the harbour). Nice stroll along the main street where there is a wide variety of eateries and shops to cater for most tastes - stunning beach and views.
Well worth a visit

Beautiful beach a quick ferry ride from Sydney. Here's a good tip. On Sunday, you can ride the ferry all day for about $2.50. If you don't have the one of the cards used to pay the fare, it will cost you a little more to get started, because there is a $10 minimum to get going, but it's well worth it.During a work trip to Sydney I had a free Sunday, so I bought a pass and took the ferry over to Manly Beach. The journey across the water made the trip a success from the start. It doesn't take long to get to Manly and, once your there, there is a nice promenade down to the beach full of shops and restaurants. On the day I visited, the beach was packed. I stayed just long enough to walk around before taking the ferry back to Sydney to continue exploring.

Awesome. Staying at my daughters, was a short stroll down to Manly beach and all the restuarants. Spoilt for choice for breakfast, lunch and evening meals. Going back and staying longer. Fantastic place, people and scenery.

Great way to spend a casual afternoon. After taking a leisurely ferry ride walk down the main mall past all the shops. Make sure you visit the market which is temporarily located because of work to the mall. Had great drinks and snacks at the corner hotel styne. Took the fast ferry back at only $1 more but half the time.
Would love to return. Loved Manly Beach & its town, would love to return here. The people of Sydney are so lucky to have it so close.

Best beech in Sydney for coastal walk ……... It’s very well connected with ferry’s .restaurants here are very limited but the food quality is was awesome .Must try some Mexican food nearby….. It has amazing views and many people are here surfing even during the winter. The trip here by ferry from the harbour is excellent. 45 minutes with great views of the harbour bridge and opera house Very good coastal walks close by too
God's Country. Stunning, beautiful and Iconic Manly beach is a must so much to see and do loads to eat and drink. Pretty beach.

Beach and Shopping, what more could a tourist want?. For a Manly Beach, there sure a lot of women there too. This is one of the most famous beaches in the Sydney area and if you go on a holiday or weekend you will find out how crowded it can be. The beach itself has plenty of room but parking is difficult even on a less busy day. Manly is perfectly situated for the right amount of waves and sun. For beach/shopping stay around the main drag and you will find plenty of both. Tons of tourist shops and restaurants that are all good. If you are looking for a little more quiet, family friendly swimming, go further south around the bend and you will find it at Shelly Beach. Here the water is more protected and the swimming and snorkeling are wonderful. Overall this is a perfect area to get lost for a day or two on your next visit to Sydney. Dale - TravelingU

Easily accessible by public transport . If you stay in Sydney is brief Manly beach is ideal as it is easily accessible by ferry (more so than Bondi beach).The ferry terminal is roughly a five minute walk. The restaurants along the esplanade cater to all budgets with a mix of chain and high end restaurants.

My favourite beach of Sydney.... ... because it has amazing views and many people are here surfing even during the winter. Very good coastal walks close by too. I could of sat here for hours just listening to the crashing waves.
The trip here by ferry from the harbour is excellent. 45 minutes with great views of the harbour bridge and opera house.

Crowded beach on a day off. Beautifull beach beautifull bodies. Perfect place to relax on a day off. U can get ther by ferry or a bus. I choose ferie because its more convenient and beautiful scenery of Sydneys skyline.

Picture perfect . The beach side of Manly offers so much....strolls/cycling/skateboarding along the promenade, a surf beach or a quiet dip up the southern end near the lifeguards. A walk around to Fairy Bower and then further along to Shelly Beach for a dip. Plenty of places to eat looking out towards the beach. A great places to spend a day. The harbour side of Manly is a quieter and smaller option..but also beautiful.

Nice walk. We took the ferry from Sydney harbour nice trip round to manly,once there we took a steady stroll through the shops then onto manly beach.the day was windy but good for surfers.Hard to think you got a beach like this in what seems like the middle of

Stunning . Wow what a coast line this is!! We had a wonderful walk along the beach watching the surfers and chilling out in the sun. Really pretty place clean and beautiful. Lovely long highstreet full of lovely shops and food outlets to get to the beach from the ferry. Highly reccomeded place.

Stunning beach.. Beautiful beach with nice people. Been here 2 time and this time for 2 week. Surfing competition were on when we was here. Love to walk from queenscliff to the end of the beach. Many good restaurant just cross the road from the beach.
Would be nice in sunny day. Rainy day, kind of windy, too, upon my arrival. The city was also rainy so I got wet. It would have been nice if it were fine day!
VEry packed but nice. I loved Manly beach. Is very full on summer time, but the neighboordhood has heaps of restaurants and places to see
What a great place to hang out. We loved staying in Manly there is lots to do great restaurants and a really good vibe. The waterfront was really busy but there was plenty of room.

What a lovely spot.. Pleasant ferry trip of about 30 minutes from circular quay to the lovely area of Sydney.The area was flat with some good shops and the beach was stunning. lovely afternoons enjoyment.
Manly . Great beaches with fantastic scenery. Lots of places to eat and drink and great shopping too so something for everyone
Worth a Visit. Take the ferry from Sydney Harbour to Manly. The beach is lovely. We visited in the Winter and walked along to Shelley Island. It was like a summers day.

Day trip . The day we went it was quite windy ! The actual place reminded me of a surfers town. The main parade of shops to the beach were very surfer orientated, which I thought bondi beach would of been like.
People were friendly, would of been a better day had it not been so windy.

Lovely place for cycling. We went to Manly from Sidney on the regular ferries: lovely 35 min sail with great photo opportunities around the opera house and harbour bridge. When we arrived at the wharf we rented bikes to have a lovely cycle around the place, along the beach and up to North's head for spectacular views. Easy for kids to pedal. I suggest a visit.

Spectacular view. This is a place in Sydney you need to visit . Spectacular views, good restaurants and cafes and shops. A nice beach to walk , take pictures with your friends and family.Definitely a place to be

beautiful beach near Sydney. Easy amazing beach near Sydney if you are short on time. You can access it via ferry or by car. We did both, the ferry ride was beautiful! Eat at the food court outdoor street if you are on a budget. Fun place. We rented paddle boards and wet suits, lots of fun.

Awesome beach!. This is one of the best swimming beaches in NSW. There are also lovely eating places and a beautiful walkway alongside the beach. However, Parking is VERY expensive at the Beach, so it is better to catch Public Transport.

lovely walk when the sun is shinning. A stunning beach front with a great selection of places to eat and shop. Often there are various forms of live entertainment in the Corso and lots of food options to sjit your budget.

world renown and it is worth it. amazing beach, great amenities and wonderful family time. Not a bad people watching site as well. has lots of great Australian fish and chip shops around the vicinity. Just watch out for seagulls.

Don't feed the Seagulls. Being a resident of the area I love the scene here. There is a massive selection of restaurants that cater to most tastes for breakfast, lunch and dinner.A word of warning to any of those not familiar with the area. If you buy takeaway and want to enjoy it sitting at the end of the Corso looking over the beach, be aware that the seagulls are extremely aggressive and will actually steal the food from your hands if you are not careful.So, DON'T FEED THE SEAGULLS
Great Place to Relax. Manly Beach is a fantastic place to chill and watch the local surfers; if you are not surfing yourself. A lot of young families enjoying the views and small town feel of Manly.

Lovely Evening Walk. We had a beautiful stroll along the beach at sunset.
The beach in well kept and has lovely views over the Pacific.
Fab. Beautiful beach and relaxed atmosphere. This is a must see. Grab a coffee or beer in a wharf bar before heading straight down Main Street to beach. Very busy, even on a winter day! Recommended!
a fab place. Lovely Manly beach was a joy to visit, as well as a beautiful beach, lots of shops and friendly locals.

Great day at the beach. My family wanted to surf on a Saturday morning so we booked a lesson at this school. I must say that although it was a funny day it was not what we expected it to be. First of all when we booked it we thought it would be a private class and instead it was a group of 15. Second, the instructors were more interested in flirting with the girls of the group instead of teaching. The only one that was doing her job was an Italian girl, that was really good and helpful. This was our second surf lesson, and comparing to the first one in Yallingup surf school it was very very average.

Locals and Tourists Love Manly. Manly is a favourite for locals and visitors alike, beautiful walks, harbour contrasting to beaches golden sand, rolling waves, grab some fish and chips, relax and breathe
Beautiful Beach. We loved the beach. Watching surfers and walking up and down the beach made for an amazing day. I would love to go back in the summer.
Looking straight out to sea!. After a lovely ride on the ferry, explore Manly Beach and its surfers, shops and restaurants. Great aboriginal art stores and souvineer shops.
The Perfect Beach :). We visited the Manly Beach for the afternoon. The small township has good architecture and is a sight for sore eyes. The beach is my new happy place.

A DAY AT MANLY. Nice small beach which reminded us of many places in the Mediterranean. The main road from the ferry to the beach is a short walk with shopping and restaurants available.Lots of places to eat and drink near the beach and very relaxing.
Boho . Loved Manly in 2000 and still do. The ferry is a nice way to travel. The beaches are clean and beautiful anywhere on the peninsula. Great Harbor Bridge views; opera house. Harbor

Love this beach!. We're from Florida so we know beaches and this is wonderful. Pretty much one of our favorite places in Australia! Our teens surf and between the beach and the Corso and the convenience of the Ferries...we loved it!
very fine whhite sand. it is just wonderfully this excellent white fine sand beach and is not so crowded as the bondi beach, excellent

Lovely Beach. We were having a self tour around Sydney and decided to have lunch at Manly.
Sun was in the sky and it was a pretty, sandy beach, exactly what it says on the packet!
lovely beach. lovely clean beach. lots of surfing to watch. nice and clean and nice place to watch the world pass by

Honeymoon stay . Absolutely amazing . Best beach by far !!! Way better than bondi !! So lovely and clean and great atmosphere . Great shops and bars in walk upto manly . Love it here !!! The boat over from Sydney harbour is fab too , try and go back at night as sun is setting .... Beautiful !!!
Great Beach. Besides Bondi, this is another famous beach in Sydney. Very easily reached by ferry from Circural Quay. Along the beach is full of places which has a nice view of the ocean.
Sunday Lunch . We took a ferry from Circular Keys. We walked along this popular beach which was very busy for a winters day. Had a lovely Mexican lunch. Enjoyable day.
Visited as part of bus tour . Huge, relatively calm beach. We did not stay there long, but took some pictures and enjoyed our 20 minutes there. Not a surfer's beach.

Stunning part of the world. . What a beautiful beach with awesome surf! Beach is very clean too which is nice. Shame people feel the need to feed seagulls as they often swarm if you eat there. Should have a sign to say don't feed the seagulls, they deter tourists, and it's not good for the birds themselves!

Great walks!. We caught the ferry to Manly Beach and enjoyed the trip as it also feels a bit like a harbour cruise for a fraction of the cost. The ferries run very frequently and the cost is great value for money.

Fun Ferry Ride to Manly Beach. Taking the ferry to Manly Beach gave us a great chance to see some famous sites from the water.  They always-on-time trip is exactly 30 minutes.  The Manly Corso is filled with shops and restaurants.  We decided to eat at the Manly ferry terminal.  There are many options there, and we chose a good one (Guzman & Gomez).  The beach is beautiful.  It has a very strong rip, so be very aware of that.  We were there in the winter, so only played in the sand.

Better than Bondi! . Manly has everything for a city beach and is worth visiting over Bondi as it offers shady trees, a laid back outdoor shopping plaza for essential ice cream purchases and, most importantly, a huge beach. There's more room than Bondi and temperate waters with big waves to play in for confident swimmers, as well as clear shallows suitable for everyone. The beach is patrolled with designated swimming areas for public safety so if time permits it is worth setting time aside to see it for beach-lovers.
Beautiful beach.. This is a beautiful beach, even in winter. We got there on the ferry from Circular Quay and walked through to the beach. Wonderful experience!

Iconic! Love it!. Manly is definitely worth visiting, and the Manly ferry ride from Circular Quay is a great way to also see Sydney Harbour. If the weather is stormy the water can become a bit turbulent. Magical ride on a beautiful sunny day. Lots of shopping at Manly and lots of cafes and restaurants. The beach is just beautiful, worth sitting on the sand (perhaps with an ice-cream!) and just soak in relaxation. Shelley Beach, close by, is also definitely worth visiting.

Nice day at the beach. Manly is a great place to spend the day. They have a great market and a beautiful sandy beach for swimming. The trip across Sydney Harbour getting to Manly is stunning. All in all a great place to visit.

Fabulous beaches. We walked from the ferry drop off pass some typical seaside shops to the beaches.Walked along Manley beach to the right hand side and saw some dragon lizards on the rocks and got to another nice little beach. We scaled to the top overlooking the beach and had a nice nature type walk with some stunning views along the way.

Just fun seaside attraction. You know exactly what you're going to get. Sun, sea and souvenirs. Some traditional old buildings, and a bit of history, if you fancy a small culture fix. I suggest walking from Manly to Shelley Beach. Grab an ice cream to fortify you and have an enjoyable few hours. Lunch at the Boathouse in Shelley. That's a must! Just a simple, fun day out.

Pristine Beach. Took the ferry to visit Manly from Central Quay in city. $8 ish and every 30 mins. As you leave the ferry dock walk down the main drag about a km till you hit the beach. Unspoilt, clean and lovely. Walk the prom to Queenscliff and back. One of the best beaches.
Stunning place. Well worth a visit , beautiful location , excellent walks and spotlessly clean - quick trip by Ferry and you are out of the city , its an amazing contrast
What a great beach. Enjoyed some fish and chips here. Watch out for the seagulls they are brazen. Could not get a better view watching the surfers.

Living the dream. Whether on your own, couples, young children or friends there is nothing quite like people watching at manly beach. Bold & tjte beautiful ageing swimmers start off the day in the south Steuben then moving to the surf ski paddlers and surfers. Nippers on Sunday's and joggers all year round. Simple wholesome Aussie activities
Stunning beach. Stunning safe beach, life guards, clean sand, cafes close and a real buzz. Good for people watching.

Manly, a beach each side of the town. At the end of a ferry ride is Manly, an interesting town which has a beach each side of it. I believe that it is possible to drive from Sydney but why miss the experience of a ferry ride. I haven't swam from the beach but there are plenty of people who do. It looks lovely but the sea can be a little rough at times, and the Sun can be very intense. Highly worth a visit.

Visit the ocean. A beautiful stretch of coastline. Great walk around to Fairy Bower on the path, but if young and adventurous, take the rock walk, manly beach is a great place for kids. If too cold to swim, then just sit on the edge of the promenade with a coffee, watching the waves or the people going by with their dogs and prams or just out for a walk or a jog.
Nice even in winter time. Nice area of Sydeny for spending a winter afternoon.. just walking along the beach, and enjoying the views of the sea
Manly visit . Great range of shops near the ferry wharf , waffle icecream great for desert . Thai restaurant next door to Italian restaurant was great value for late lunch
Manly Beach more Peaceful then Bondi. A beautiful beach with many good restaurants, bars, and cafes. Went on a Sunday and it was not crowded.
Great beach. Had a nice day at Manly Beach. Took the ferry from Circular Quay walked the short distance to the beach. Enjoyed the Mexican place and gelato at the ferry port as well..

A Nice Beach. I took a fast ferry from Circular Quay. The beach is only a 10 min walk from the Terminal. There is a good boardwalk that goes the entire length of the beach so for taking a stroll on a sunny day it's just ideal. A quick ferry back to circular quay and it only took a couple of hours.

Lovely beach. Very clean beach with a variety of visitors from old and young to surfers. Within good walking distance of the shops and eateries and the ferry. Don't be fooled by the small beach near the sea life centre carry on walking down the main shopping street and you will find the wonderful beach.

Nice to walk along. My friend and I got a room in a hotel just next to this beach with an ocean view room. Incredible experience for both of us. As soon as you feel bored you go and take a walk in this beautiful beach and get relaxed. Not suitable for swimming though. Much fun for kids and families.

Great beach. Went on a Sunday and took the ferry from Circular Quay. Transport costs are capped at $2.50 for Sunday only, if you have an Opal card. It was busy, but not overly crowded. Great beach to bring the family to.
As good as Bondi. A lovely long beach with restaurants and cafes behind. Well used but not as packed as Bondi when we visited.

What a Great Beach. Manly Beach is one of the best beaches in the world. The beach is clean, easily accessible and has everything that you could want. It has 3 Surf Livesaving Clubs Manly, North Steyne and Queenscliff and is flagged & patrolled. The promenade is great for walking/running or just taking a seat and relaxing. It also has kiddie areas and tables for picnics. Easily accessed from Circular Quay in Sydney via the Manly Ferry, then a short stroll down the Corso. There are a ton of restaurants and takeaways in Manly to choose from for meals and after a stressful day at the beach, there's even a couple of good bars to quench your thirst.

Peaceful & beautiful Manly. We encountered Manly Beach as we had booked in with a snorkel adventure, Eco Treasures, and loved the area so much we returned a second time during our holidays. Loved the Corso plaza for shopping, the beach front was gorgeous, food over at Boat House Café on Shelly beach was delicious. We visited during winter, so can't imagine how lovely the beach would be in summer!This area is easily accessible by a ferry from Circular Quay & makes a wonderful half day/full day excursion.

Manly v Bondi. Forget Bondi take the ferry - that in itself is a great trip - to Manly but dont be fooled this is not the beach!. A 5 min walk along The Coso pedestrian way to famous Manly beach. Unpretentious clean great surf. Plenty of good restaurants n cafes. Go walk to Shelley Beach or back to city via harbour walk.

A nice beach to spend a couple of free hours. The Manly beach is a very clean beach, and is about 10 minutes walking distance from the manly wharf. Visit the beach for a nice lazy time. There are a lot of sea-gulls that you can watch as they flock together looking for food. Children, families and youngsters visit this place to spend a relaxed time.

Weekend away . Wow !!! What can I say about this stunning place ... Caught the ferry across which was great and had a walk along the beach . Great cafes , shops , walks and a lovely spot for site seeing . I'll be going back for sure ...

Better than Bondi. The ferry ride to Manly is enjoyable. The beach and ferry get slightly crowded on weekends. There are many shops close to the wharf. Food, swimwear.. you can find everything here. There are change rooms and bathrooms on the beach.There are plenty of eateries around the beach. Do take a walk from Manly to Shelly beach. There is one restaurant on Shelly beach which is usually booked for private functions.
Beautiful beach. So nice to cross the harbour and spend time wading in the sea very clean, well kept area. Lots of great eateries in the area. Fish n chips on the beach great holiday lunch.
Nice Beach, Pretty Boardwalk. Manly is nice part of Sydney. Spent the day hanging on the beach, Eating some Take away Fish and Chips. Easy Ferry ride to Manly

A Gem of a Place. Manly has that holiday environment feeling and could be a million miles from Sydney, but it isn't. It is a popular home base for many Sydney commuters and the relatively short ferry journey is pleasant and relaxed.Manly Beach and promenade are clean and tidy. In late afternoon you will find power walkers striding out along the prom.There are a good choice of restaurants available and prices are reasonable.All in all this place is great for a day visit or longer stay.
A great beach. You're in sydney you should go here. Kids will love the water and there are some nice restaurants around too. You can make a complete day out of this

Beautiful Beach. Beautiful beach, with lotta eateries around. Great place for a family outing or to hang out with friends. I personally prefer Manly over Bondi. Can get crowded during weekends and public holidays.

better than Bondi. Manly Beach was recommended to us by our neighbour who is from Australia,and we're so pleased we visited. We preferred it to Bondi Beach,but would never have gone there unless he'd told us,as it's not as well known .We had a great lunch over looking the beach,where we saw a surfing competition,and also enjoyed browsing the many shops.

Another great beach but use the toilets at your peril.. Cannot fault the beach, there were many surfers the day we visited. Lots of shops nearby and places to grab a coffee/bite to eat. Went for a walk then realised I needed to use the toilet at the beach. Probably the worst toilet I've been in, think of Trainspotting's toilet seen and you will have an idea. Feminine hygiene products (used) lying about on the floor. The needle boxes were over flowing and the actual toilets

Nice beach town close to Sydney. Great excursion after you have hung out in Sydney for a little while. Nice but busy beach. Lots of shops and restaurants. Whale watching boats leave from here, too. Short walk to get to Shelly Beach. Calmer ocean than Bondi Beach (better for kids).

A lovely chilled day . A quick ferry hop from Sydney Harbour and you can have your feet in the Pacific Ocean. Really lovely, clean beach which has nice restaurants and a great little market. If you have a free day it is a lovely way to relax.

Beautiful beach. Gorgeous beach. We were here in the winter. Lots of people I am sure many more in the summer. Really a beautidul place e to walk along the water or stroll along the sidewalk. Many places to eat and even hotels to stay.

Sydney's best beach babes. If you want to see Australia's golden brown surfer chicks, visit Manly. Manly is in the Northern Beaches area of Sydney. Best way to get there if you are a visitor to Sydney is to take the ferry. The ferry takes around 30 minutes and rhe fare won't break the bank. In summer, the beach is packed but less so during the week. The sand is golden and the water is blue -- what more could you want?
Great beach - overcrowded. This is a great beach whether you want to relax and read a book or get in the water. However, it is overcrowded and it does get hard to find a place to lie down.

Nice short trip. While in sydney we got the ferry and in half an hour we were there. Nice quiet place to visit for a day a nice pub next to the ferry station for a drink. In my opinion it's a must while in sydney
Nick60. Although this is supposed to be a better beach than Bondi we felt this was not that great, and when we visited it was really crowded. The water was cold too.

Nice Trip on the Ferry. We caught the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay in the City, and passed by all the Sydney harbour icons on a pleasant trip out to Manly.On landing at Manly Ferry Terminal, we followed the crowds towards the beach.There was a large outdoor pedestrian shopping mall on the way.At the beach, we found a coffee place directly on (well, over really, as it was raised) the beach, and watched the surfers and even a whale further out over coffee.It's a nice beach, with a great atmosphere and a top spot for tourists or locals to visit.I posted couple of photos of Manly Beach to accompany my review of the Manly Ferry, including the distant whale. I don't think TripAdvisor will let me post the same photos again.Great to get out of the city and see a Sydney beach, with the added bonus of the return ferry journey.
Great beach. We took the ferry from Sydney to Manly beach and once we were there found the beach to be very clean and beautiful. We watched surfers and just cruised the shops
Lovely!. We lived in Manly for 3 years and each time I walked the beach and trails I would find something new. It is definitely worth visiting!
Best beach in the World. Forget Bondi, This is a real beach, with trees, surf, and all the bars etc as well. Great for families as well as young people, old people, and everyone.
Family visit . What a great beach, clean & sandy . Great to see so many young people enjoying themselves surfing and catching the waves or sunbathing & swimming. A must for a bucket list to visit .
Better than Bondi. I simply loved it. Quieter and cleaner than the famous Bondi which shall also be visited. I like the whole ambiance and the variety of food.
Nice beach. It´s a nice beach, less crowed than Bondi and with all the services and restaurants to offer. It is a place that you need to visit if you are in Sydney.
Lovely beach. There are some lovely beaches all along the coast and Manly beach is one of them , we had a lovely pic-nic and day out
Nice part of the world. I had never visited Manly before and was very impressed. The beach is nice and clean and surrounded by buzzing cafes. Worth the trip.
better beaches. there are so many amazing beaches in Sydney, this is not one of them.Always crowded and busy, and it isnt worth it, just for a photo on manly beach..

STUNNING SURF. I always make the time to visit Manly Beach and eat fish and chips there.. take a surf.. walk along the beach.. the weekend markets there are lovely too.. make a great place to pick up a nice home made souvenir :)
Beautiful . Had a day visit to manly beach from Sydney on the ferry. It is a beautiful beach very clean and tidy. There are also restaurants and shops close by. Beautiful place

My favorite beach in Australia. I highly recommend booking an ocean view room at Sebel Manly beach,those waves make the perfect harmony to resting. Then the morning sunrise walking along the beach front is very pleasant. Plenty of coffee shops and restaurants in Manly. If you really need to visit Sydney city then a relaxing ferry ride will deliver your Opera house and Bridge..but there's plenty to explore around Manly so the city isn't absolutely necessary. Sebel Manly beach is very nice.
Beautiful water!. Enjoyed walking along the coast. Loved watching the wind surfers, kayakers and surfers. Lots of pine trees (what this area is known for).

Relaxing and extra friendly . I visited this beach area alone one day while my husband was in the CBD for work. I had a very nice ferry ride from Circular Quay followed by a relaxing stroll along the beach and costal walk. But the best part is that I lost my phone while there and someone turned it in to the police station! Once I figured that out (via location app) I called the police station and they held it for me until I could get back a few hours later. The officers were so nice and helpful about the whole thing. The stranger that found my phone and the police officers turned a very bad day into a great day!
Delightful. Manly Beach is very nice. It's much larger than I had expected. There is a plethora of restaurants and shopping. Definitely must see.

An iconic place to visit.. A 'not to miss' beach in Sydney...great fun to 'HAVE' to go by ferry to get there...and then a gorgeous beach with a plethora of places to visit and eat in. A walk through the mall, sight seeing shops, and then the beach...WOW in every respect.

Crowd beach even in Winter. Surprisingly, I have never expected so many people during the winter. The sand is clean. Unfortunately, it was winter, so were dare go in to the water.
Several shops are around with good foods. You will need a whole day for this area.

Surfers. I came over here on the ferry. It's a nice ride coming over. Once here, you can sit and watch the surfers. They also have water stations to fill up your own water bottle..eco friendly area. It's a great day trip from Sydney, or just a few hours as well.

Relaxing. Nice area to hang out and just sit on the side to watch people come and go or just watch surfers. I've seen people jog in this area too. Just a 10 mins walk and you'll be in the manly wharf area where you can find lots of souvenir shops.

Fantastic Beach!!!. Sydney has quite a few beaches such as Bondi, Manly, Dee Why. Manly Beach is in North Sydney, accessible by road or ferry from the Circular Quay Station. The beach is very tidy and good for swimming during Summer/Spring season i.e. between October to March. There are a few food joints close to the beach. Parking spaces are limited, so its advisable to use the public transport, i.e train and or ferry to reach Manly Beach. Overall it was a wonderful experience visiting the beach with family. The only thing this beach really lacks is shower facility, wonder why it was not built.

Nice beach but nothing special. We took the ferry from Sydney harbor to Manly, about 30 minute ride. Round trip (called a Return ticket) was 12 Australian dollars per adult. Beach is about a 5 minutes walk from the ferry wharf along the main shopping/dinning street. This is a world famous surfing beach, but having grown up a Southern California, to me it was just another beach. Plan to spend at least 3-4 hours for round trip, eating and just walking around. If you are limited in time for your visit to Sydney, you might was to spend this 1/2 day doing something else that is more uniquely Australian
Not impressed. The beach itself isn't really impressive. Maybe it's because I live in the Caribbean. But I liked the atmosphere.

Calm and nice beach. I went there by Aatkings tour,and i thought Manly was the exciting place where you must go while in Sydney.Beautiful place,relaxing....you can look people bring their dogs there...

Sydney's Iconic Bondi Beach. No visit to Sydney is complete without a trip to Bindi - great place to sunbake, surf & just poeple watch during summer months but ca be very crowded especially on weekends. Has a patrolled surf beach so great place for kids. Very easy access to a huge range of eateries & cafes etc. nearby. Transport to & from is best by Manly Ferry from Circular Quay.
Hong's Family Trip 2016. Beautiful beach and landscape surround this area, there is bench and table for picnic lunch, many seagull flies and nice to feeding them.

Enjoyable. Manly is a nice stretch of beach which offers lots of options for surfers or just spending time. Kids can play around and have fun and lots of options to eat and drink. Great place for a nice day out with friends & family regardless of age !

Loved. We took the ferry to the zoo then after the zoo took the ferry to manly beach. Loved it there what a quaint town and enjoyed the harbour and shops and he beach. Ate lunch at Hugo's which was fantastic then strolled up the street looking at the different shops and went to the beach and hung out and enjoyed all the street artists in the evening
Beautiful and big . I visited in the winter briefly very nice and convenient to get to by ferry. Lots of restaurants and tourist shops.
easy access and unspoilt beach. good surfing beach. Also so easy to cross over on ferry and walk up the corso to be on a good beach. Great eating spots right next door.

Crowded beach. Manly Beach is a fairly crowded beach approximately 30 minutes (best) by ferry from Sydney Harbour.Once you arrive at the Manly Wharf there are signs that guide you to the beach. It is approximately a 400 metre walk to the beach from the wharf. Along the way, there are plenty of small hotels, restaurants and shops.The beach itself is nice, yet quite crowded with locals and tourists. Not the worst thing, yet know this before you plan a day with the family- there is not lots of space to roam and play.The best thing here is to find a decent cafe on the waterfront for lunch and people watching before a return trip. The ferry leaves every half hour and operates until late in the evening.

Worth the trip. Although it's a little too touristy, o do think the trip is worth it and we really enjoyed watching the crowds walk past with a coffee and ice cream. The ferry tickets can be bought easily and the views from the ferry are worth the trip alone.

Best Beach in Sydney..Nicer than Bondi. Manly beach is a must visit for those to Sydney. Located just 30 minutes Ferry from Sydney City, its white sands, great shops and restaurants are a better day trip than Bondi beach. But if you have time try to get in both. The Bondi to Coogee walk is amazing.

First of the Northern surf beaches. Catch a ferry from Circular Quay and see the Harbour en route. To get a feel for surfing sign up for a surf lesson at the Learn to Surf School. You won't be ready for "Big Sur", but you will have a lot of laughs.

Must visit in Sydney . You can take a ferry from Circular quay and it is approximately 30 mins from there. Once got down, right across the street comes Manly beach. The beach is great and gives a good view. The waves are strong and it can be busy during the day. We walked from there to the Shelly beach and went for a short trekking to a nearby rock cliff. It was a lovely experience and we really enjoyed the trip.
