Great beach.. Manly Beach is much more than a great beach. Several streets have been closed off to allow shoppers to brouse without worrying about traffic. This also attracts buskers and is great for families. Lots of variety especially if you are hungry.
Good beach.. After travelling by ferry from Sydney and a walk along the Corso to a great beach with lovely Norfolk Island pines.

Best Beach in Sydney. For me this is the best beach in Sydney not a busy as the over hyped bondi so that's a plus, has more places where you are allowed to swim in the sea but also offers plenty of room for surfers.

A lovely place to visit so I moved there. I grew up visiting Manly beach and I ended up living there. Lovely beach's, great restaurants, great cafes and North Head Reserve and Manly dam only five minutes drive away.

Great place to stay and relaxed. We had one night in Manly and well recommend it for beach lovers and if your after a relaxing time at the beach. Lots of restraints to choose from or coffee shops and cafes. As well as plenty of places to great a beer if that's more your thing. Walks along the beach side fantasist with great walking tracks and paths.

Parasailing was a great experience. Went Parasailing in manly, this was a great experience. Even though I'm scared of heights this was very relaxing and fun. The staff were friendly and ensured we had the best time.
Surf resort. Charmy (and crowded), both the city and the beach is worth the ferry ride. Shop, eat and relax, strolling through this small summer resort away from the big city pace.
Gorgeous beach. Unfortunately closed for swimming when we visited, but you can swim in the nearby rock pool or round at Shelly Bay which is just as beautiful. Highly recommended

Australia with kids. There are the two very sheltered west-facing beaches on each side of the ferry terminal and then the rougher beach facing east on the other side of the Corso. You can also take the Fairlight Walk (some stairs) to Fairlight Beach, it's quite sheltered as well and has a tidal pool.

Lovely clean beaches. We love getting the manly ferry from circular quay it takes about an hour. There are 2 lovely beaches in manly one to the right as you get off the ferry this one also has a kids playground. The other one is at the end of the main shopping street which is right in front of you as you get off ferry. There are quite a few shops and numerous restaurants here too.

Must do for your visit. Manly Beach definitely draws the tourists but it's a neighborhood and there are plenty of locals there as well. The beach is nice, it has a nice board walk along the beach and just off of the beach are plenty of restaurants and shops. It's a great day outside of central Sydney.

Lovely Beach. We took the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay. It was then a lovely walk from the Manly Ferry Terminal along a street with numerous shops, cafes etc to the beach. The beach and the promenade cater for everyone. There were activities for children and restaurants/cafes to either buy a meal or ice cream. We really enjoyed sitting there watching the world go by. Having also visited Bondi Beach, we much preferred Manly. It just had a nicer feel.

Stroll on Manly is Worth the Effort. Manly is a very scenic beach. Spending a few hours here getting lost in the over commercialized shopping district or just people/surfer watching adds a great deal. The drawback is distance from Circular Quay. You have a few choices to get out there and all involve time and/or money. The ferry is the fastest and most direct route but several bus companies offer tour bus service to get out there. If you want to be on your own time schedule I recommend taking the ferry so you aren't rushed into leaving or forced into staying when you want to leave. To be fair, we visited during the winter so it has less appeal as a destination because only surfers with body suits were in the water. In the summer it would be a great place to spend time soaking up the sun and experiencing the water with the locals.
take ferry to manly beach. once you get of ferry walk down the street with all shops and cafes to the end and sit at the beach and just people watch always something to entertain you.
Great beach lovely clean sand . Great place to visit and to walk up to Shelly beach. This was the first beach we had visited and we have since found them all to be very clean and wonderful to be on.
Super family orientated beach. Took the ferry to this beach and had a great day .So clean with lots of activities for the kids and a safe swimming area supervised by lifeguards.
A great way to spend the day!. a beautiful beach town on the Tasmanian Sean, easily accessible by a lovely ferry ride from Circular Quay. Gorgeous sea walk, beach and shops.

Love this beach!. Every time I am in Sydney I always make the trip over to manly, this is a great wee place to visit or stay, great vibe and surfing to be done. Great place to take the family on a day trip, highly recommended.

Surf's Up at Manly. A 30 minute journey across Sydney Harbour on the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay, to a great beach suburb on Sydney's North side. You arrive at the calm side, where tourists paddle-board and lay on the beach in the afternoon sun. A short walk and you are facing the Pacific Ocean, where some strong waves pound the shoreline. On your way to the ocean beach you will pass a wide array of cafes, restaurants and pubs all vying for your attention, at meal times. It is a great tour destination, where it doesn't take much effort to get there and if you don't want a return journey on the harbour, you can return to the City in a bus. I definitely recommend a visit, even just to walk barefoot on the soft yellow sand, on a sunny winter's day or a hot summer's day, it is a popular destination for day trippers. The ocean beach is quite long, if you like to walk in the sea air. Enjoy!
Beautiful little beach. Easily accessible by ferry from Circular Quay. Enjoy fish and chips on the beach, then swim in the beautiful blue-green waters. Enjoy the mix of old and new architecture.

Best beach. We spent a fabulous day at Manly beach having traveled there by ferry from Darling Harbour. The weather was brilliant and the beach amazing. The sea and surf were just the best. Bondi has the fame but for us Manly was far better.Everyone we came in contact with was just so friendly and welcoming. What more could one ask for.A great memory. Thank you Manly

touristy but nice. so this area reminds me of a touristy beach other places - think lots of souvenir stands, trendy restaurants, etc...
teh beach itself is wide and sandy, but there seemed to be lots of grass/seaweed in the water that washed ashore - could have just been the season though (winter)

Beautiful sight but very crowded!!. We came here on February to watch Australian Open of Surfing 2016, it was amazing to feel the ambience, as city beach life like Manly Beach. It was very crowded during the event, but i guess it is less crowded during normal weekdays.The beach was quite clean, organized and the ambience is very "australia"! They had food vendors on the beach's park and the beach itself not far from Manly's outdoor shopping centre.

Beautiful beach. The ferry ride across to Manly is enjoyable and provides a great opportunity to see the city from a different view. The beach offers some beautiful scenery and is a great place to spend the day.
Beautiful. Terrific Beach! Take the ferry from Sydney through the Harbor, then walk up the Corso. Rolling waves. Beautiful to walk along, as well as swim. Enjoy

Nice place . Pretty ferry ride over. You walk through town (about 5-10 mins) pass shops to the beach . Beach is long and pretty. We did not go in because it is winter time but would be fun in the summer.
Place to go!. I just went with my friends and enjoyed a lot!! It was fun!!We had lunch my the beach, well managed and not too crowded.. This is a place to be!!

popular and worth a visit. Lots of great resturants and cafes across the road, very hard to get parking and parking is extremely expensive. Best to come over on the Manly Ferry if your coming from the city side
one of the best beaches in Sydney. jump on a ferry to spend a day in Manly: beautiful beaches, surf, good food and great spots for adventurers who like hiking and coastal walks

One of Sydney's finest . In a city pretty much full of excellent beaches Manly is right up there among the best of them. If you are are a tourist then by all means cross Bondi off your list but if you want to see a much nicer beach which also happens to have much better restaurants etc then jump a ferry (itself a brilliant experience) and pay Manly a visit
A favourite. I Ioved our visit to Manly. Beautiful beach with plenty of places to eat and drink. A definite must for any visit to Sydney.

Better than Bondi. Manly is much prettier than Bondi, I am always amazed that tourists flock to Bondi when Manly is definitely a much better beach. Manly is larger, with clean white sand, clear water and offers more space. You can wander up to Queenscliff beach, walk up to the headland or lunch at the many resturants and pubs.

My favourite place in Sydney. I first visited Australia 30 years ago (!!) and I loved Manly beach then and it is still my favourite place in Sydney. It is such a beautiful beach/place with the Norfolk pines, gorgeous beach and cool vibe. It is the second place that someone should go (after walking around the Harbour/Sydney Opera house/Royal Botanical garden) - but it must be sunny when you go to Manly.The ferry from Circular Quay is lovely - 30 minutes of being in the Harbour (in the sun) - then you arrive at Manly and stroll along the main strip (with good shopping) that takes you to Manly beach. You walk along the length of the beach and admire the surfers and the beautiful setting. This time we had an amazing lunch at "Salt" and just enjoyed our outing to Manly so much. It really is a special place. We visited in late June - Australia's winter and it was a lovely, relatively warm day - about 18 degrees - warmer in the sun.If I am fortunate enough to visit Sydney again, I would definitely visit it again. It is a special place!

One of Sydney's most popular beaches. A long wide sandy beach with surf there's almost always a surfer or two in the sea all year round. Good for a walk along the esplanade or for the more adventurous there a cliff top walk (info & map available from Tourist Information offices). Beach view cafes & restaurants provide for great outdoor dining if the weather allows. Retail opportunities too. Best way to get to Manly is in the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay.

a must visit if in sydney. manly is just lovely. ferry from circular Quay, less than 8 dollars. Every half hour. manly beach 5 mins walk down a lovely shopping street. manly beach is wonderful, there is free wifi in the centre of manly. walk over to shelly beach again a beautiful place.

Fantastic Beach, very active, so much to do. Manly Beach is one of the tourist spots in Sydney, just like Bondi Beach. It's a favourite spot, for people to have their exercise out in the fresh air. Their are a lot of races, competitive tournaments at this beach, jazz parties, big events. It's a buzzing beach. Very popular and safe. There are life guards and there are areas you can swim in between the flags that are constantly monitored. The Beach is surrounded by public toilets, for your use, with showers. There are lot's restaurants, cafe's, shopping centre, large grocery shopping centre, lot's parking. The only downfall, it gets very busy and you have to pay for parking on the street. Unless you park in a shopping centre car park and you can get 2 hours free. Love Manly Beach, it's a must to visit.

Easy 15 minute ferry ride from Sydney. From Circular Quay, it's only a quick 15 minute ferry ride to Manly (make sure you catch the Fast Ferry, or you will be stuck on it for 45 minutes - which also isn't a bad thing if you want to enjoy the scenery of the harbor). From the Manly harbor, there are tons of restaurants, bars, and shops.

Beautiful. This is a small lovely beach just a short 10 minute walk from the ferry port. The pedestrian area is very nice, surrounded by trees which give shade from the sun, and there are many benches to take a rest on and take in the views!As with most beaches, its full of sea gulls thougb which can be annoying when chowing down on some fish n chips.

I walked the full length of Manly beach last weekend with my dog!. We walked for about an hour, visiting the craft stalls along the promenade and then chose a great restaurant that accepted our poodle behind the plastic covers where it was lovely and cosy!
Lovely sandy beach. An unexpected delight was the unpretentious beach shack restaurant which served delicious seafood, with seating right the beach and overlooking the surf.

Swim and Sun bathe . My fav beach in Sydney. Open sea lots of waves ideal if you want sun sea surf and shop. My fav is to swim and then just sun bake. Getting there is half the fun with a 30min cruise on the ferry from Circular Quay. The Corso has some fun shopping spots food for all tastes Hotels that cater for everyone. Great summer spot or just a cruise even on a nice winter day. Very cool place.

Beautiful beach. Manly beach is not only a nice beach for swimming and sunbathing, but it is also great for a game of volleyball, or any beach sports due it's large size. It also has a concrete promenade stretching the entire length of the beach that is popular for skate boarding, bike riding and dog-walking. The nature strip boasting huge pine trees behind the promenade also lends itself to these activities. Aside from this, manly beach is within very close proximity to many shops, cafes and restaurants nearby as well as the ferry port. You will not get bored at Manly beach.

Manly Beach is magnificent.. Buy fish and chips, kick off your shoes and sit on the fine golden sand wiggling your toes as you eat. Bliss as long as you don't feed the sea gulls! Saunter down for a paddle in the ocean (Pacific) or, better still, have a surf between the red and yellow flags. You will be safely protected by the famous lifeguards that patrol the beach. Building a sand castle with your children is a must! Take the photo to prove it! Families have done the same for years. Look for times of the local artesian and fresh produce markets at weekends. If you are lucky, you may catch a concert on the beach.
Be sure to visit. Enjoyed the ferry ride over and great beach to visit,swim ,and walk about .Fun to people watch too.Nice shops and places to eat.

It`s a must!. Manly beach is a fun, easy going, one of the most famous beaches in Sydney. It`s really good to have lunch or dinner beachfront. It has a great nightlife, shops and nice hotels too. Good for surfing or just walking with a view.
Manly beach. Over rated. far too many tourists. If travelling to Manly try and make an effort to go along another 5 to 10 minutes to Freshwater Beach if possible. Much nicer and not as crowded.
Manly Beach & Surrounds. A visit to manly Beach is a must.Great main beach and walk to Shelly Beach.Lots of Cafes/Restaurants and Bars along with shops along the Corso

A Nice Beach, but Isn't a Must See. This beach was pleasant and everything, but it wasn't anything that stood out from any other beach in Sydney. it was clean and had bathroom facilities, but the beach was quite narrow leaving the road to be very close by. Another thing was all of the nearby restaurants were fairly high priced, because this is considered a richer part of Sydney. Nonetheless if you have money to spend, and in the area it's a good place to hang out, where you can also grab a beer across the street after.

Manly Beach. Took the ferry from Sydney harbor. Nice except it got spoiled by smoke from "controlled" foliage burns taking place outside Sydney which really deteriorated the air and views. The walk from the ferry to Manly Beach is about 15-20 minutes, mainly through a commercial area of stores, restaurants etc. Manly Beach is quite nice, popular with the surfers. Plus it has restaurants across the road from the beach. We had a very nice fish and chips lunch closeby at a very reasonable cost.Manly Beach is a sort of pleasant laid-back area if you have some extra time on your hands.

Another beautiful Sydney beach. It's amazing to have such a beautiful surf beach in Sydney and I can see why the suburb is such a drawcard with expats and visitors.Parking can be a real problem so be prepared to park some distance from the beach or take the ferry from circular quay if coming from the city - the Manly ferry is a lovely trip on a sunny day
The best sydney beach together with coogee.. This beach is less crowded and more natural than Bondi nice mall with many eating optionsLeanne & Paul
Iconic. This beach is beautiful , walk down the manly Corso , past fabulous coffee shops and eateries , or fish and chips by the beach , and then take a dip , this beach is a patrolled during summer
Great half day trip!. We loved it! Heaps of shops, great atmosphere, nice beach. 30 mins away by ferry from the harbour. :)

A quick ferry ride to another world. By fast ferry, I was at Manly in 20 minutes, and watching a big time surfing competition and people of all shapes and sizes walking along the strand with dogs and surf boards and strollers. It's a great way to spend an afternoon.

Nice beach to people watch. Not too far away from the CBD. A lovely 20min drive north of the city. Watch out for crazy morning traffic!! Once there its quiet and relaxing. Close enough to the shops if you feel the need to spend.
Beautiful beach. A beautiful beach and tourist shopping area great place to visit 30 min trip on Manley ferry a must do if visiting sydney

Lovely beach. A quick ferry ride from Sydney to this lovely beach and worth the trip. Pace is much slower here than in Sydney; its a nice respite if that is what you need! Cute boutiques, plenty of coffee shops and bars!

Very good. Went by ferry to Manly Beach on the 20th of May .
Ferry cost was about 15 Australian$/2way .
Loved Manly Beach I walked about 6km.

Nice beach. Was a nice suburb outside of Sydney. The pace was nice that the beach was quite big and long. The surf was also strong from the looks of it. Worth a short visit to take you out of the big city for a small place charm.

Sand not as white as Bondi Beach. We had only 45 minutes to walk around I the morning because we were on a half day tour trip with AAT King.
Had visited Bondi Beach in year 2006. Comparing these two beaches, I personally preferred Bondi Beach.
Surf is up. Manly Beach is great for Family's, restaurants near by some shops different varieties Nice to have a walk around

A nice clean beach just 30 min away from Circular Quay. Away from the hustle, just 30 min ferry ride from Circular Quay. Within close walking distance from Manly Wharf and Manly SEA LIFE sanctuary is a nice stretch of clean, fine sandy beach. Good for surfing and chasing after the cute little seaguls. However, do note that there is only two shelters (one with tables and one with only benches) and one bathroom.

Wide and decent beach.. The weather was perfect when my friends and I went. Nice, clear skies, a bit warm but I didn't venture into the water. Lots of people sunbathing. Great views and nice place to people watch. I actually liked it better than Bondi.

Feels like Malibu, CA. If you want to go to a beautiful beach town of the rich and famous, Manly is the place to go. We got to see many cool surfers riding waves and have a very nice (but expensive) lunch.

nice. the highlight part of reaching Manly Beach is taking the ferry from circular quay to manly beach, that journey was really incredibly GREAT! Beside that, you could have many nice restaurants and cafe nearby there. could see Lots of surfers as well. even during winter in Sydney !
Overrated, I'm afraid. Seagulls were out of control, and it was so crowdes everywhere! Shelly beach, 15 mins walk along the water, is much nicer and secluded

beach for home and away. made our own way to this beach on the service bus taking approx. one and half hrs but well worth the visit if you are a fan of the soap. Just our luck the soap was not filming when we went.
Not That Great for a Mumbaikar. I am from Mumbai and a beach / marine drive is not a new thing. Even as a neutral I didnt find it a great attraction

My favourite Sydney area beach. Manly beach is a great underrated beach area, never very busy except in the heat of down under summer but a great long stretch of beach with warm water, not too many things in the water and any time I have been here whether last week or 10 years ago we have always seen whales jumping off in the distance which is always quite a sight. Manly beach is worth the trek whether by car or Manly Ferry which is cheap and easy to use.
Beautiful beach suburb. Lots of choices for a meal. Wouldn't recommend the pub on the waterfront...food was pretty ordinary and expensive for what it was.

I really like Manly. Manly is a little area with a corso for shopping, walking and eating. There are some really cute places and excellent aboriginal artwork shops. Walking along the beach is very beautiful.

Quick 20 minute fast boat ride from Sydney . For $6 USD we took the high speed ferry manly. Great way to see and tour the harbor and visit a small quaint beach town.
Fish and chips and cold beer -back on the ferry every 30 minutes. Great crew and trip.

Mall and beach. We stayed at Q station and walked in to Manly for a day. It would be better to take the harbour ferry over for a visit. The town has a nice pedestrian mall which you walk through to get to the beach from the harbour. Good restaurants and things to see or stroll Round. Good bus to the quarantine station if you want to visit there.

Leisurely place . Nice beach to hang out with many cafes along the beach. We didn't go into the waters cos its winter! Besides the beach, there is a scenic walk beside the harbour and it's worth taking a nice Long walk along the scenic walk path during the evening time. U will meet many local residents bringing their dogs out for a stroll.
Great for a stroll. We caught the ferry to Manly and spent a couple of hours. There are plenty of restaurants to pick from. My favourite was to get an ice cream and sit across from the beach.

Something for everyone. I just love Manly I go there every second week in summer great beaches restaurants and bars go on a Sunday public transport is just $2.50 unlimited 30 minute ferry ride from Sydney circular Quay the ferry ride alone is worth $50
my favorite ozzy beach. i love coming here since the aquarium opened, its a friendly cozy beach with beautiful golden sand....a must if you are in sydney

Nice walk to Shelley Beach. Manly is quite famous, though not the different from many other beaches. The walk to Shelley Beach is nice and not too long, if you then go on around the wooded head - you can run into some lizards - Water Dragons who are sunning themselves.

ferry and fish a brilliant day out. What better place to have fish and chips but on the steps of manly beach,hot in summer but on a perfect warm winters day just brilliant and the trip over on the ferry is not bad either.Either the harbour side beach or the surf side they are both great for a days or 1/2 days excurtion.
Ferry ride destination . Went during winter months so basically just walked around town. We wanted to take a ferry ride from Sydney so we chose Manly Beach
Bike on Beach. My friends and I rented bikes for 2 hours and rode around the island. Great views and many bike paths to make it easier to get around. Would recommend biking during nice seasonal days.

Great beach. I spent a lovely afternoon at the beach with the locals and it is very clean with great public facilities near by. Lots of great local eating places as well and the local caught seafood is a must

Lovely beach. A lovely beach area, beach is amazing on a sunny day, plenty of activities going on - surfing, swimming, walking etc.Walk to the end of the beach to the right to Cabbage Tree Bay to a secluded beach area. Walk past the swimming pool built into the rocks.Well worth a visit over on the Manly ferry for a day visit.

I'm from Melbourne and travel the world and manly is the best location on earth!. I love manly.I love the fact it is busy... Full of all types of people from young to middle aged.. The surfers are knobs like on the Gold Coast who have a chip on their shoulder ... They are typically older and just love surfing. The fact that manly spans from the ferries on the harbour to the ocean gives you lots of options to shop... Eat and play... You can snorkel, scuba dive, swim , kayak and surf on one side of Manly or swim, take a boat out or ferry from the other side. There are plenty of walks along the water and around North head too which my wife and I did ... But it is long... And then there is Shelley beach... The coolest and best little beach I have had the pleasure of spending time at... If you have little kids... Come here!!!The pictures are from the coffee shop on Shelley beach looking at Manly...
Manly. Beach is always good. Can be busy but worth a visit - especially in the summer. Walk along the shoreline is nice.
Well worth a visit. Not to be missed. We had a great day at Manly beach. We had a swim and dried off on the lawn. There were showers and plenty of water fountains and things to do.

Good one. Went here with my family. We took the ferry from Curcular Quay, and it goes below the sydney harbor bridge and you can see the opera house on the way. Stunning views on the way. After we reached there, and went to the beach. Clean and nice. There are many places to eat food as well. Try the ferry ride to reach there, it's worth.

Relaxing. Caught ferry from Circular Quay for a nice day out. Very relaxing walk through mall to beach. Buskers in mall playing good music. Beautiful day watching the surfers on the waves, and having lunch and a few drinks.
Manly Beach on a beautiful Autumn day.. We walked from Manly Beach to Shelley Beach, it is such a nice easy walk and only takes a few minutes.
My favourite beach. They say Bondi is the best there, in my opinion this one is the best! The surrounding around is just wow, I loved it there so much! Take a ferry, walk around, you will enjoy it!

Definitely must visit place in Sydney. My family and I enjoyed our visit to this beach. I never get disappointed. It's nice just to stroll and enjoyed the beautiful scenic views. Added to that to reach here, we caught the ferry from Sydney Harbour. I liked the atmosphere.

Beautiful & Scenic place. Beautiful beach to take a stroll on & take scenic pictures. Remind me of Lugano in Switzerland with the waterfront houses on the hills & setup of the town. A few hotels available in manly beach would definitely stay 1 or 2 nights in Manly in future to soak in the goodness of the town & scenery as well as the crisp fresh air. Charming little town & friendly people. Definitely must include in your travel itinerary. If you travel with kids it's worth visiting the manly sea aquarium. Will come back again.
Must see. Recommend this beach to tourists all the time. Nice beach, plenty of places to eat. Get there by ferry for a nice trip across the harbour. Better than overrated Bondi!
Best Beach in Sydney. Bondi is the more famous beach but in my opinion Manly is the better beach. It is also a delightful boat ride from the Quay with a wonderful view of the city.

Famous beach. No need to mention - one of the most famous surfing beach on Sydney. Best is to be here in the morning, when lot of local people are surfing here before work.Be careful about jellyfish and enjoy
Better then Bondi. Prefer this beach to Bondi, lots of small jellyfish in the water when we were there but didn't stop us having a paddle
great beach. Great for surfing or sunbathing. Lots of places to eat on the road between the ferry and the beach. This beach is nice and sandy and has some good waves. it's a decent size too.

Always a nice area to visit. We took the Ferry to Manly and wandrered the shops and beach area. Stopped in at one of the many restaurants overlooking the beach area. Very pleasant and well worth a visit
Lovely day out. A nice ride on the ferry from Circular Quay, a slow wander down the Corso, a browse through the markets, a walk along the beach and lunch at a beached cafe makes for a great day out.
Average Beach. Nice ride on the Ferry, nice sandy beach, patrolled in summer. Gets lots of day trippers. Not a huge beach

Beach and Headland really nice hike. The beach looked clean and expansine. Great access via Manly Ferry from Circular Quay. Just a short walk from the ferries past some interesting souvenier shops, but before you do that be sure to stop in at the visitors centre outside the ferry terminal, they were very helpful and sent us on a hike up the headland to see some really cool history from WWII. Can see downtown Sydney from there. Took the fast ferry back as we had an evening engagement and it was fun. There was lots to do in the area but we were limited for time so we will have to go back, worth another visit.

Beautiful beach that is close to the city. If you want to kill two birds with one stone, take the Manly ferry from Circular Quay across Sydney Harbour to Manly. Manly beach is only a short stroll down the Corso in front of Manly wharf, a distance of about 300 metres. The beach is great for body and board surfing and the promenade along the length of the beach is great for walking and jogging exercise.
One of the best beaches in Sydney. Grab the boat from circular quay to Manley, 2 min walk beach then a really nice walk along the coast

Lovely Beach. I will Manly beach better then Bondi. Though people say Bondi is best but Manly beach is huge and Manly market and shops are better then Bondi. Very peaceful and nice place to spend good time.

Nice laid back vibe. This is a great way to see the Harbour if you catch the ferry out to Manly beach from the Harbour instead of paying for a Harbour cruise. The beach wasn't too crowded and there's plenty to see, do and most importantly, eat. Slightly touristy but doesn't take away from its charm. We spent the day there instead of going to Bondi.
Beautiful Beach. Lots of eateries and bars, the shops are fairly ordinary, but the trip over to the beach makes the trip to Manly all worth while.Very picturesque

Calm and relaxing!!. The beach is really clean and one can sit for hours under the sun and enjoy the salty breeze of the sea. It is at a walking distance from the ferry and the Manly Sea life!! There are some eating joints and souvenir shops nearby. Overall it is a place worth visiting for people who want some relaxation and also for shopping fanatics!
Good day at the beach!. Travel with Fairy (boat) needed to get here. Really good beach. Great food along the beach. Super markets are close and within walking capability.

Beautiful beach, but crowded. Worth a look though.. Iconic beach, so obviously popular. Good food around to grab a bite and enjoy the view. Stroll south along the boardwalk though and there is more to see, including an oceanside free pool.

A must do whilst in Sydney . Caught the ferry from circular quay across to manly .Took about 30 mins and the passage was rough - kids loved it! A short stroll through the shops to the beautiful manly beach - heaps of places to eat and shop - Also have markets at the weekend - well worth a visit

Food and wine festival . Visited on the last Sunday of may for the food and wine festival on manly beach. You buy a commemorative glass on the way in for $15 and subsequent glasses of wine are $5. But the real star of the show is the food: bbq skewers, French crepes, burgers, Italian, cakes...delicious. and the perfect activity for a lazy Sunday.

Lovely beach, not great for swimming.. We regularly visited Manly beach whilst living in Clontarf. The beach is clean and good for surfing but not great for swimming due to the high current. We really enjoyed strolling down the beach after an evening meal out. The beach is great for surfing and is manned by life guards.

What a great hood. This place has an entirely different vibe than Bondi. Great beach, outstanding coastal walks and roaring nightlife are the main draws to come here. Great place to pick up souvenirs at half price vs. Sydney as such.
Not to forget the ferry ride out here is one of the best attractions around.
Really nice. It's such a lovely place to get away from the busy city. The beach and the ocean are so amazing. There's a long walkway to trek too.

Not much to it although the harbour fish restaurant is nice. We took the ferry from Sydney. This was packed and a bit of a fight for a good place. Manley beach itself was very busy and not that attractive.

Lovely seaside resort. Probably the quickest seaside resort to reach from Circular quay with the ferry. The trip takes about 15 minutes and runs every 30 minutes. On arrival walk across the road to the street opposite with shops on both sides. At the far end is the beach and many restaurants, some with upstairs balconies. Lovely views and altogether a very pleasant spot for a morning trip and lunch.

Family outing. We are a family of 5 so finding somewhere that we aall want to go to can be a challange. Manly beach is the perfect spot. And some of the group get bored, they can always wonder off to the nearby shops and cafe's for some r and r. The beach can be accessed via one of sydney ferry services. Lucky for us the ferry leaves from our doorstep right to Mannly.

very similar to Bondi Beach but - in my eyes - better. Manly Beach and Bondi Beach are very similar. They have both a lot of surfers, a nice boardwalk to the next beach, a pool and hills on one end from where you have a nice view over the whole beach, shopping opportunities, etc. ... both common city beaches as in many other cities in this world. Anyway, if I could go back, I would have just visited one of these beaches, namely the Manly Beach. Reasons:+ more shopping opportunities+ due to the shopping opportunities maybe, the beach is less crowdy+ You can get there by the ferry, if you stay in Center of Sydney.- Only reason for Bondi Beach: the walk to the next beach (Conogee) is little bit nicer.

Clean beach but seagulls can be annoying. Was up north in Manly from Sydney for a short getaway. Weather was great with cool wintry winds but surprised to see many surfers and runners despite weather reaching about 15 degrees midday. Water may be warm. Really good place to relax with families and for couples. Lots of cafes and ice cream shops (ben and jerry's nearby) you can take out to enjoy at the beach's many bench. Seagulls can be annoying and bully you for food though. Parked at one of the garages further from the beach to save money.

Lovely to potter about for an hour or so. Crossing on the ferry from Sydney Harbour (not expensive), spent a relaxed afternoon in this 'seaside' area. The usual gift shops and cafes along wide streets leading to the beachfront. Tree lined walkway along the beachfront with communal barbecue areas and picnic areas. One or two places closed as it was not 'high season' but still very 'buzzy' with a lovely atmosphere.
Amazing place. I can tell you that if I would went to this place on my twenties I would stay forever, I love everything about it, the vibe, the food in the bars, the weather... ALL.

A windy beach, best enjoyed at night. Like most of Sydney, you get frequent breezes and wind. Manly beach is best enjoyed at night. Just sit on the many benches provided, enjoy the night sea breeze and relax. Also a good idea to snack on fish and chips, or a burger and a cool drink. If you come during the day, you can also enjoy the sea and the beach. Not as crowded as Bondi beach, but still a good place to get a sun tan. There are also water refill stations at this beach.

A good 1/2 day trip. I took a ferry to Manly Beach and it was a good half day trip, plus a relaxing time on the boat. I walked around there and saw some exhibits. Some good places to eat near the water as well.

RTW trip. Manly is one of the closest beaches to Sydney city centre. Ferries run from Circular quay frequently and regularly. A trip to the long and sandy Manly beach is a good way to combine the city with the shore and could make for a perfect weekend combination
Awesome. Best city beach I've seen near a major city worldwide. Improving selection of shops, good selection of restaurants.

Nice beach with boardwalk. Good beach for families,has a small township feel with the boardwalk,quaint shops,restaurants and also residences nearby.The beach itself was pristine and ideal for the kids.Accessible by ferry from the city.Also visited the manly sea aquarium which was ok but not a must see

Nice beach to swim or take walks along. From our hotel balcony we could see this beach. When we were sleeping we could here the ocean swooshing. Since it was very close to the hotel, we would take long walks along the ocean. We did swim in it but I don't especially like salt water. Also, there is shark nets which made me feel a little bit safer when swimming.

one of the best beach I've ever been. For some reasons, Manly beach is as good as the beaches in Hawaii. In many ways, it is even better. To see people walking their dogs, pushing their babies in prams, jogging, having picnic on the beach, water is clear, sand is very fine. It is like paradise. How we wish we could stay there forever

Lovely walk. Take the ferry to Manly Beach and walk along the Corso to the beach and turn right to follow the path to Shelly Bay. Lovely views and pretty sandy beach at the end. Enjoy lunch at the Boat House and soak up the sun.
A trendy spot. A very trendy place to visit for lunch and to take and enjoyable walk. Lots of cafes and restaurants .

The best Sydney beach! . Early in the morning manly is amazing! Going for my morning walk is the best part of my day. when I'm in Sydney manly is my favourite place, it's a must for anyone who wants to relax and watch the world go by.

Best beach visit. We probably picked the best day to visit Manly beach as it was Australia Day and the weather was brilliant, sunny and hot. The beach was busy with lots of barbecues, smiling faces and brown bodies. Great bars to stop by for a drink. Lovely afternoon.

Manly Yes....But I like it too. A great beach for Volleyball and a quiet day with the family. This beach is beautiful, clean and a short ferry ride from Sydney. Prices are not as touristy as Bondi beach area and you can buy all your souvenirs here as there is a significant price difference in your favour. You can have a great meal at one of the many restaurants located across the street from the beach or pack a picnic lunch. This is a smaller, quieter beach than Bondi but still very much worth spending a day here.

Beautiful beach, great for surfing and people watching. Jump on the quick manly ferry from the centre of Sydney and you'll be there is less than 30mins. Beautiful kept beach that is wonderful just sitting and watching the world go by. If you fancy it then have a go at surfing or perhaps head back and grab a coffee. Very relaxing place.

Beautiful City beach!. Easy to get to via the Ferry, Manly is worth a wander round. There is a lovely beach, and often beach-side Markets. There are lots of restaurants and cafe's to choose from for a leisurely day by the Sea. We met some friends and they walked us all around the bay to Shell Beach where is there is a cute Cafe/Restaurant.. its about a 15/20 minute walk but worth it.. It's a lovely beach there and worth the walk. There is a great high street with lots of shops and also worth having a drink at the Bars on next to the Ferry station for a view and bayside drink!

Wow what a place to play and visit. We came for short tour but stayed much longer. This is a wonderful beach and town full of things to do. If you come on Saturday you can visit the local school and buy some cool stuff. Or if you are really lucky a wine festival will be going on and you can experience some local and overseas wines. Be sure and eat, drink and see all you can. This place is a don't miss for Sydney beaches.

I have lived here for over 15 years. Amazing beach, secure and relatively clean. The tourist drop rubbish everywhere but we pick it up.There are markets, shops, cafes, walks, hikes, swims and plenty to do. Get there by ferry so there is no issues with parking.Keep our beaches clean and please swim between the flags!!!
Nice clean beach with good faclities. Great beach to spend a day playing in the waves and soaking up the sun.Easy stroll from the ferry port and surrounded by lots of shops and places to eat.

Bay Beach to Surfing Beach in a Few Blocks. Definitely worth ferry ride from Circular Quay to Manly Beach. Fun and Feel Good Vibe. Fantastic tourist trap bargains. Sand on both ends of wide venders street- no ca. Restaurants, clothing , gift. Totally a fun vibe. Surfing on beach at other/ocean side. Can walk on beach north or south. Aquatic museum nearby.
Highly commercialised . This has really become built up since my visit 26 years ago. It is still a beautiful beach to visit with amazing views but the shops are now very tourist based!!
Great beach.. Sydney boasts some great beaches and this is one of them.Lots of surrounding shops and market stalls. Enjoy a coffee overlooking the beach.Only swim between the flags !!
Lovely!. One of the best beaches I've been to. The beach ia super clean and has huge number of changing rooms.

Manly Beach. Sydney has been blessed by some great beaches, however none as good, fabulous and interesting as Manly Beach is. Some other Sydney siders would attempt to dispute this, but Manly is hands down the best. A terrific surfing beach, combines with the beauty of its location, the vibrance of its unique lifestyle, the array of great eating places and of course, the magic of offering the great and picturesque harbour-side as well as the magnificent vista of the open sea, both just a short five minute stroll apart. One can access this unique place by car or by bus as well as the more enjoyable and delightful trip across the harbour by a 30 minute ferry ride or even by a 15 minute fast ferry crossing. No other beach in our beautiful Sydney can offer this experience to our esteemed visitors.

Great beach. Manly beach is my favorite beach in Sydney area. You may take a ferry from Sydney to get there which is s great way to see Sydney Harbour. The Manly Fast Ferry gets you there in 15-20 minutes but it's more expensive. If you have the time you can take a Sydney Ferry which is slower but less expensive. There is plenty of shopping on the way to the beach. The beach has great sand. You can watch the surfers or swim in areas specified by the lifeguard.

Iconic beach. A good friend of mine lives here and I never get to visit it enough. Getting there from the city is a fun ferry ride away but can be a logistical headache if your looking for A big night out. The beach is great and the people friendly. A must visit destination in Sydney

Fun fun fun. A destination with something for everyone. Enjoy a surf lesson or a coffee, beer, ice cream - plenty of places to choose from. Plenty of eateries & bars behind the main beach front. Worth exploring. A great walk is from Queenscliff along Manly beach & end at Shelly beach, a small beach cove which is ideal for snorkelling & younger children who'd prefer a surf less calmer waters. Toilets & refreshments are plentiful. Weekends are far busier & parking can be expensive & lacking. If coming from Sydney the Manly Ferry is a good option to consider.
awsome but not the best of beaches. only one day on this beach but has to be done when in Aus!! if you are in sydney you may as well tick the box
Better than Bondi. If you want a better beach than Bondi go here. Surrounded by bars and good eats. Plenty of waves to surf and lift guards on duty for swimmers

Great swim from Shelley Beach to Manly & back. Manly is a lovely beach southern side where rocks are along path to Shelley Beach great for snorkelling & divers. So many fish. Many swimmers swim from Manly to Shelley Beach & back or in reverse 1.5km. Scares you to death when see divers in black wet suits long way down. The fish are incredible. Can swim from the small pool 1/2 way to Shelley Beach if want a shorter swim.
Beach, walks, and the main shopping strip. Great beach with easy access to the main shopping area and some easy close by walks to Shelley Beach and beyond.
lovely area. we didn't have much time here either but the shopping is great and the beach is lovely. We got off the hop on hop ferry and walked straight to the shopping mall.

THE beach to visit on a trip to Sydney. Fantastic beach resort. Take the Hop on Hop off ferry to Manly. lovely boat trip across the Darling river estuary. Easy short walk from the Ferry Terminal to the beach. Beautiful white sandy beach, unspoilt by any deck chairs or parasols.
crowded but fabulous. worth getting a ferry over from Circular Quay to spend a lovely laid back beach day - wish we had done it earlier!
Beautiful beach!. Beautiful beach, get a room with a view if you can. And take your swimmers for a dip in the ocean - amazing swim club goes swimming every day!
Beautiful beach. It is more than 2 km long，beautiful pine trees with very nice walk way between tree and beach。 besides the corso - shop and restarant area is very nice 。

Wish I would have had more time. We came for an afternoon trip using the Manly ferry and proceeded directly to a beach. The water was called so we skipped swimming . There is a lovely restaurant, the Pantry, serving local food right on the beach. After late lunch we walked to the left passing a serene cove with some swimmers and another restaurant serving lunch. The shore has also man made sea water pool that would be lovely in summer. There is a hiking loop through the nature that brings you back to a ferry. It was getting dark so we turned back. Definitely worth a day time trip

Best Part of my Trip. Sydney was amazing, but when I go back this is where I am planning on staying! The town is perfect and this beach beautiful. So worthy of every minute I spent on this wonderful beach.

The beach and shopping street are beautiful . The beach is perfect for kids and adults alike but if you also want to go shopping and like surfing stuff then I'm not sure there is anywhere better in the world. Everything from QuikSilver to Oakley and Reef to Billabong! I was in heaven

Clean and fun!. My 2.5yo had so much fun. Love the clean and fine sand, clear water, cooling n windy air and even the scorching sun! It is soo pretty and relaxing and fun place to be at. Even in May near to winter, it is nt too cold. Be sure to bring along slippers, tees and shorts! Or even a towel and swimsuit if u would like a dip! If nv bring nvm, u can buy them from Chinatown Paddy's mkt 1day before. Hahhaha

Nice Ferry Ride to Famous Beach. We too the Ferry from Circular Quay twice. A nice walk following with a shop and cafe lined street directly to beach. Beach is beautiful from end to end. Go south in the beach trail to see the beach rocks just past the life guard building.Have drinks and lunch at one of the hotel bars which overlooks the ocean.Trip alone is worth it!

Gorgeous beach, quaint beach village, picturesque walks. We visited Manly Beach on a lovely fall afternoon, taking the ferry from Quay 3 using our Opal cards. The beach is at the end of a short walk, perpendicular to the ferry port, and is a nice sandy cove, with big rocks at the outer ends. We sauntered along the path to Shelley Beach, and up and over the hill, where the 'bush' path wraps around for a view of the ocean just behind Shelley Beach. Cannot wait to go back for lunch at one of the two beachside cafes we passed. Worth a visit even in fall when it's a little too cool to swim. Charming beach town that's not as crazy-crowded as Bondi. And, the sunset ferry ride back to Circular Quay was a bonus with beautiful colors behind the Harbor Bridge and Opera House!

Fun surfers beach, waves to knock you down & great shops nearby. Take a ferry to Manly beach from Circular Quay; it's a fun way to travel like a local and is inexpensive. Ferries are frequent so you can go nearly anytime during the day.From the ferry you get to walk through a shopping area that has a surfers paradise feel to it. You'll see singers entertaining the crowds and walk by a number of shops built for the beach (think Roxy, Quicksilver, etc). You'll also walk by a number of restaurants and bars which you can hit up when hungry!The beach itself isn't as crowded as Bondi and you'll see a ton of surfers doing their thing. Bring your gear as you'll pick a spot and just chill under the sun. Restrooms are nearby and no-one bothers you while on the beach (unlike the Philippines were sellers are always pushing their wares on you. I live there). The water can be cold and you gotta watch out for the surfers. Don't become a travel story for the other tourists as you get taken out by a surfer...Fun beach, good mix of locals and tourists, and less than 45 minutes from circular quay via ferry. go and enjoy!ps...the shops close early...like super early (6pm) so be mindful of hours of operation)!

The best beach in Sydney. Manly Beach was the delightful end result of our trip on the ferry. To get to the beach we just crossed the road up a pedestrian street lined with plenty of shops, restaurants and bars. So actually getting to the beach took longer than expected especially if you happen to be with someone who is unable to pass a shoe or dress shop. The beach is probably my favourite one in the Sydney area – a really pleasant promenade to walk down or just find somewhere to sit in the shade – if it isn’t already occupied that is. There is plenty of room on the beach and but beware of getting sandblasted when it’s windy. However, like all Australian beaches take heed of the lifeguards and the flags as the sea can get quite rough when it’s windy. We went midweek which is probably best as the world and his dog is there at the weekend. The added bonus is finding great places to eat at the quay waiting for the ferry home
Nice Family day out. Manly is always buzzing. Something to do always. Many great restaurants, pubs and a nice clean beach.

Good day trip.. Reach Manly Beach by ferries from Circular Quay, wharf 3. Check the electronic boards in front of the wharf for times. Once off the ferry at Manly, cross over directly in front of the wharf to the pedestrian walkway, called The Corso. It has many shops, restaurants, bars, souvenir shops, etc. At the far end, only about a 10 minute walk is Manly Beach. The promenade along the beach will take you from one end to the other. It is very enjoyable, the walkway even and paved, ok for wheelchairs. Benches along the way and a tiny grassed area between it and the street. The beach is pretty much flat and easy walking or lounging all the way out to water line. The street along the beach has restaurants and bars, a Novotel and smaller hotels. Although we visited during the day, there are many bars, many with outside seating, so it could be very lively at night. A pleasant day trip, between the ferry ride, Corso, lunch and beach.
Great beach. Plenty of sunbathers on when I visited. Very clean, big beach with plenty of shops around as well as cafes etc. Lovely experience.

A Sydney Icon, mostly reached by the Manly Ferry from the city. Large and beautiful well safety monitored beach. Very popular with locals as well as tourists. Lots of stores in the town, few old hotels (Pubs) with accommodation and some higher end hotels. Great views, good breeze, and easy to reach from the city. A memorable visit, again one not to be missed when in Sydney.
If it were possible i'd live across the road.... Manly is one of my most favourite places in Sydney region. So much to do, so much to eat, so pretty.

Beautiful beach. Took the ferry from Circular Quay on Anzac Day and the ferry ride was very pleasant. Upon reaching Manly, we were amazed with the crowd there. The restaurants, the shops and walkways were packed. Must be a favourite destination for locals. Even the beaches were crowded with families having their picnics there. As usual, the surfers, swimmers and snorkelers were out in force on this beautiful sunny day.We managed to spend about 4 hours enjoying the walk along the beach and had lunch at a nearby eatery.Nice place to visit on a cooling sunny day.
Bikinis & Boards!. Manly Beach. It's Australia all over! Beautiful golden sand, awesome waves, a great place for a surf, a swim, or just to sit & enjoy the gorgeous view.

A good outing from Sydney. Its the whole experience that is good - from taking the ferry, to walking along to Shelly Beach (where I had a delicious lunch at the Boat House) and then meandering back later, and jumping back on the ferry. The main street in Manly is rather seaside town-ish with lots of cheap shops underneath fine old Edwardian houses, and the beach is huge and very busy. But its great to see school kids playing games and sports on the beach, people swimming, snorkelling and surfing even if at 20 C it seems a bit cold for me! Everyone is happy and relaxed and it is a good outing.
Surf surf. Good place to surf. You can either rent for as low as 10AUD. You can also learn how to surf for around 90AUD. Go early before 3pm tho as they close at 5pm.
Manly Beach. My husband and I took the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly Beach, which is quite a nice one, and said to be better than Bondi Beach.

Beautiful beach. Beautiful beach here and it seemed like most of the people from Sydney came here. People surfing and people in the sea as well as on the beach. Restaurants and bars really close to the beach as well. A lovely day out.

Nice beach to visit and relax and people watch. Nice expansive city kind of sand beach to relax and read a book or magazine at.
there are tons of restaurants, cafes, and coffeeshops as well on the main street next to the beach and you are about a five minute walk from the ferry if you go to the beach.

Day trip. Nice seaside town with a good main stretch and choice of shopping. Especially if you like the surfing style of shops. Enjoyed eating fish and chips on the beachfront but watch out for the theiving seagulls! They're aggressive!

Great for a day at the beach. Manly is a great day trip out from Sydney. The ferry ride across is a good way of getting to see the many bays in the harbour and some great photos of the Opera House and Harbour bridge.If you are thinking of going at the weekend, be prepared as the ferry can get very busy and there is often very long queues to get onboard, but going and coming back.The beach is lovely and generally busy at the weekends. Great to walk along the front and there are plenty of places t eat and drink and towards the East is another lovely little bay, which is safe for younger ones to swim.
Love to live here. Loved how the area feels like a resort. Beautiful! I want to live in Manly after my visit here! Great walk from one beach to the next.
Lovley Beach. Had a great afternoon on Manley Beach with the kids, its close to town and close to ferries that come from Sydney harbour

Nice place to have lunch at fhe beach . I took a ferry from the circular quay to manly. It a 20 minutes very nice journey. In manly there r a lot of restaurants and pubs which r mainly for tourists (in my opinion). The beach is amazing with a lot of surfers, and most of the restaurants are located right next to the beach so you can a have a cold beer and enjoy the beach

Beautiful, lively beach and surroundings. We took the "hop on hop off" ferry to Manly Beach and spent the afternoon walking around and just enjoying the beach. There are many nice shops and restaurants on the short walk from the ferry dock to the beach. And it happens that we visited on ANZAC Day and saw people gathered to pay tribute to those who served. The beach itself is beautiful and very different form any American beach I've visited, so much more vibrant and active. This is definitely a must see stop.

Beautiful. Manly beach was recommended by my colleagues as I was toying between Manly and Bondi. Took a ferry over to Manly.... enjoyed the view and sunset before heading back to sydney harbour.
I regret for not bringing my family there when we were in Sydney in Sept that year.

Day Trip. Took the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly Beach,good for day trip but will not stay overnight,nothing very much to see.Many people on the beach enjoying themselves. We had lunch at a Thai Restuarant which was quite good, there are many small cafes along the way to the beach

Interesting beach with lovely views. We took a ferry that goes past Sydney Opera House and reached Manly Beach in time for lunch. Good to have a picnic lunch, so we bought fish and chips and sat down at the benches near the beach to enjoy our lunch. Do be careful as birds may snatch your food. Good walk along the beach to an area where we walked to the top - great views here!
nice beach. looks like a nice beach for weekend getaways.. chill out and relaxed.. i was here on a rainy day but still pretty. people surfing so must get good waves

A great day trip.. We had to spend some time here during our April 2016 trip to Australia. Staying a few days in Sydney, Manly Beach was one of those places to visit on our list.It was so easy catching the bus from our hotel to the Circular Quay and a short walk to the Manly Beach ferry terminal. We even used the same Opal bus pass for our ride in the ferry to Manly. After the short ferry ride we entered into the terminal where several shops were preparing to open for the day. Opening to the main thoroughfare, there is a visitor center which provides helpful information. Crossing the street and to the right you can walk down Corso Blvd. straight down to Manly Beach. Shops line both sides of the of the street which can easily distract you from your main objective, the beach.Manly is a white Sandy crescent shape beach which invites you with the sounds of the waves breaking on the shore. There were people in the water enjoying all sorts of surfing and just getting wet. Many others were along the beach enjoying themselves.As we approached the beach there is a rode with vehicular traffic in both directions. We headed down to the right continuing along the coastline. This path takes you along the cliffs and many scenic spots where you will want to stop and take time to enjoy.There is a spectacular swimming pool cut out in the rock formation with seawater being pumped in. As you continue there are a couple small boutique shops where you finally come to the end of the path.This is Shelly's Beach! We had to make this trace as my wife's name is Shelly. There is a restaurant here for those who need to recuperate.

Good for nice swim. Entering from the ferry side the bay is still and sand is yellow--nothing exciting here. We thought from reviews that Manly had upscale shops and cafes but soon discovered that perhaps our tastes thought it might be more of Palm Springs quality and not tourist gift shops and basic cafes with lots of fried foods. There are a couple of good shops and restaurants but they are few and far between. If you are going for a day in the sun and on the beach and grabbing a hot dog is fine, then this is your place. Waves can be big enough for a fun ride. All in all glad we went. Took the ferry using the Opal card.

Better Than Remembered. Last time I was at Manly Beach was in 2000...maybe the wonderful Norfolk Pines are larger, maybe it was just the gorgeous perfect weather and Tasman Sea conditions, but I still notice the no swim warning signs: 24 hrs following rain due storm water run off. Pollution, some things never change! Such a lovely place. Sad.

Manly Beach... for people who like beaches.... I'm not a beach buff myself but I love that people spend all their time here so that I can more walking space on the board walk. If you really like beautiful beaches with blue water and golden sand then this is your place for sure. Enjoy!

Nice for a stroll and maybe some food.. After walking around and taking advantage of the great photo-ops we stopped for lunch. NOT overly priced, in comparison to other Sydney spots and the Salmon I had was very well prepared.

A private and quiet public beach. It's an open beach but it's quiet hence with privacy too.You may enjoy the beach the way you wish to either on your own, with your loves one or with all your family members

Lovey place. Beautiful spot, very relaxing. We visited on a perfect day on school holidays and the place was packed. After a walk along the esplanade, we found a spot at a window in a bar and knocked back a couple of cold drinks while listening to an awesome busker just outside. What a shame the transport options back to CBD are not more, I could have parked up there for a while.

Easy to visit from the city. Sydney has many world class beaches but if you are staying in the city Manly beach is the easiest to visit.From the Circular Quay number 3 wharf the ferry goes to Manly about every half hour. The high capacity ferries take you to Manly cove on the harbour and from there it is a short walk across to the beach. The surf beach has sections for board riders and swimmers and lots of sand for sitting.Nearby are coffee shops, restaurants and bars along with great walks.It is one of the best beaches in Sydney
Very commercial. Good for bouncing from beach to bars/rest/shopping. Nice beach and good for walking. If Manly is on your list, make it one of your first stops.

Local review. A amazing atmosphere where sea meets town, the beach itself is absolutely beautiful and i would highly suggest if visiting to do the walk from manly to Shelly beach. Trust me you won't regret it

Beautiful beach on a beautiful day.. Having taken the ferry to Manly we were pleasantly surprised to step into a beach side suburb with something for all. Restaurants, shopping, cafe bars and the beach itself. A well kept seaside area and a place for families to enjoy a day out in the sun and surf. There is a friendly rivalry between Bondi and Manly but both have their positive points.

Pleasant but crowded on a Sunday. A wonderful ferry ride to get here. just beware of seagulls and your lunch !. Just have to move a little further up beach towards Queenscliffe to get away from most of the crowd. Plenty of space around on beach or on grass. Lots and lots of dogs and dog droppings just left along walkway, yuk, yuk, yuk ! spoilt the walk as had to keep looking carefully.

Best of the beaches in Sydney! . Took the water bus to this beach and really think it's much better than Bondi! Much bigger and seemed nicer! Many people we meet including locals feel it's the better beach.Highly recommend.
Beautiful beach. Highly recommend a visit here above Bondi, beautiful beach, and sands the town is great to shop and the local amenities are on hand near by .

A must see. We were repeatedly told by locals to visit Manly over Bondai beach. We were not disappointed. Manly beach was what I imagined to be the perfect beach. Something for everyone. Watersports, sun bathing, ball games. We walked up to a quiet little cove (10 min walk up the beach) where it was so peaceful and the water was totally still. Perfect for nervous swimmers like me to have a paddle!

Fun Day Trip. We had to choose between Manly & Bondi for our last day. We chose Manly and were very happy. We took the Manly ferry from Circular Quay, which started us off with instant scenery and relaxation. The main esplanade is touristy of course, but the beach is lovely and the water is beautiful. We walked up the path along the coast, to the little secluded beach (Shell by the Boat House restaurant. We didn't go in, but it looked like a nice place to enjoy a meal in a quieter area. Met a lot of very nice locals and watched the surfers for awhile. Finished off with a drink by the ferry dock as the sun set, then ferried back to hotel. Great day! We will plan to stay there overnight next time.

A wonderful beach area. Manly Beach is a hidden gem from wha it could see. We talked with a local on the flight to Australia and asked him what he would do if he had a free day in Sydney and he said to take the ferry to Manly Beach. He was right! The beach is wide with nice rolling waves and manly families were on the beach. The beach was clean and maintained. There was absolutely no trash or rubish.They are big on recycling so free water bottle refill stations were everywhere as were recycling containers for used bottles.There were many nice shops and restaurants available and plenty of shade areas to get out of the sun.A very pleasant beach area away from the maddening crowds!
Amazing. The beach is so beautiful. Easy to walk, fitness equipment, playground fro the kids, volleyball courts in the sand and waves for those who like to surf.It's paradise!
Great veiw . Been going here since I was a kid Many memory's of topples woman and people changing on the beach lol so funny and love watching my parents faces when they see .

Lovely beach. Great for all the family, and taking surf lessons. Loads of cafes and restaurants, and things to do and see in Manly.The ferry trip to/ from Circular Quay is as must, stunning views from the water.

A must visit. Instead of paying for a harbour cruise, hop on the Manly ferry and spend a few hours in the village. There is a surf beach and a harbour beach, shopping and plenty of restaurant and small bar choices
Nicer than Bondi. Everyone heads for Bondi, Manly is a far nicer beach, less crowded and its much more fun takinf the ferry from Circular Quay!!
Great beach. The ferry from Sydney harbour is the quickest way to get to Manley Beach. Great fish & chips in Manley

Lovely beach, ideal for families!. A very calm beach, good for a swim and ideal if you're travelling with young kids. They'll just love it. If you're travelling from the city, pretty easy to get here. Arrive at the Circular Quay, and then take a wharf from there directly to Manly Beach. Just takes 1/2 hour and costs 7 odd dollars.Just takes a 5 min walk from the wharf point to get there. If you don't have swim wear, don't mind, plenty of shops around offering swim wear at decent prices. A good number of diverse restaurants around with plenty of variety as well. The beach has changing rooms as well. Be mindful though as if it had rained on the previous day, the council advises not to get into the sea within 24 hours of rain due to the effects of pollution.

Stunning beach. Manly is one of the beaches I visited this time; each and every beach I went in Sydney is different and I won't say which one is better than the other, they have their own characteristics and charisma. I enjoyed Manly very much because the sand is soft and the day I went was warm and sunny.

Good day out. Went to Manly beach when we were in Sydney for a day. We took a ferry from Sydney Harbour to manly beach which took 20 min and ran every half hour. It costed $7 on Opal card. The journey was great with good view of sydney harbour and opera house. Manly beach was a great place to be with family and friends. It wasn't as picturesque was Bondi and seemed a little empty but it may have been because it was a little cloudy. The waves were quite high and saw some surfers. We spent some time hiking around the beach which took us less than an hour before heading back. It was a good day out. Now that we have been to both Bondi and Manly, I would recommend Bondi if you have limited time and have to pick one of these two places.

One of my Favourite Sydney destinations/locations. Manly represents an excellent option for anyone visiting Sydney. Views, atmosphere, are excellent, and there's also a wonderful walking/exercise option beachside. I'm a local, and I visit manly very often.

MANLY & FRESHWATER you can come by car, bus or ferry. Manly Beach and Freshwater alongside, is not up to Bondi popularity for O'seas visitors, but a much better beach for young and old regular Aussie visitors.

Better than Bondi...... .....sorry about that! I love the cosmopolitan feel of both Manley and the beach. I'm not a surfer so I can't compare the two from that aspect except that there are annual championships at Manley so it must be good. Great prom and cafes too.

Very commercial and "touristy". The best bit about visiting Manly was the trio by ferry over there. It's a beautiful beach but seems extremely busy now and full of fish and chip shops like most seaside resorts.

Far better than Bondi.. This is the better city beach by a long shot. Take the ferry from the city, then don't be fooled by the little stretch of sand nearby........that's not Manly beach: you need a short walk through town, to get there. It's worth it, as the sand stretches a long way, and there are plenty of things to see - or dive in, and enjoy the water. Nice relaxing cafe's or ice creameries line the beachfront, but perhaps the best treat is back opposite the ferry, at the Manly Four Pines Brewery > good locally made beer, and decent grub.
Beautiful. Put it on your to do list when visiting Sydney. The beach is beautiful and the little village of Many fun to walk around, make a day of it. Many great places for lunch as well
summer time any time. stroll along and see the sites on the way to the beach take your swimsuit and have a dip when you are finished have lunch

Lovely beach !. Forget Bondi Beach which is just a name, Manly beach and Manly in general is beautiful. Make this a must do on your trip to Sydney area. PS - Take the fast ferries instead of the normal ones. A lot quicker for about $1 more.

We fell in love with Manly. What can I say other than we fell in love with Manly...the beach is just gorgeous...lined with trees it just looks idilic, kids enjoyed body boarding on the waves. Safety was well managed by the lifeguards...Visited several times during our holiday using the Manly ferry to get to and from Sydney Harbour.

Lovely beach. We took the Manly Ferry from Sydney Circular Quay. The ferry terminal is at the beginning of town and you walk through the shops to get to Manly Beach. It was a very hot day and later turned breezy,we hired beach chairs and an umbrella and sat there for about an hour. We then walked back to the ferry terminal and returned to Sydney Circular Quay, lovely view of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. Very glad we went there.
Best of both....... The Manly ferry ride shows the harbour in all it glory. The beach at Manly is world renowned and the eating places are plenty.
Quiet and beautiful. Since this was April, the beach was quite empty. Enjoyed sitting and watching the waves. Beautiful sand and lovely water.

A nice beach among so many nice beaches. . We were recommended the ferry ride to Manly by our I'm Free walking tour guide ( see separate review) and as we disembarked we headed straight to the Tourist Information Office to take advice on what to see and do. The main beach is a 10 minute walk through the town and we took a pedestrianised street route past many bars,restaurants, cafes and shops. It was charming but touristy. The beach itself, like all of those on the seafront as opposed to within the Harbour, is exposed and windy, great for surfing and walking or watching surfing. We decided to walk around to the more sheltered Shelley Beach which was a pleasant 15 minute stroll and we were told that there are other walking routes around the headlands. Personally, I found it a lovely beach for a bracing walk and people watching but too windy for lying/sitting on. We did enjoy our visit though, a young, buzzy and busy spot, popular with backpackers and shoppers, but we wouldn't go back.

ONE OF MY FAVORITE PLACES!. I LOVED MANLY BEACH!!!!!!! You definitely have to go there, I might even dare to say that I loved it way more than Bondi beach, it just has a special charm and everything. It feels very local and familiar.

Relaxation time. We attempted a wedding at nth curl curl & the following day strolled along manly beach. Whilst the beach wasn't that clean there was plenty on nippers doing their stuff The most unfortunate part is the migration of the homeless who have taken hold of the seats & shelters

Better than Bondi!!. Of course I'm biased, but it IS! A long sweeping ocean beach of manicured golden sand backed by grand Norfolk Island Pines. Long enough to contain THREE patrolled swimming areas -- always swim between the red and yellow flags! Many pubs, restaurants cafes and fish shops. A pleasant waterfront walk around the southern end of the beach to Shelley Beach. Plenty of tourist shops. Good nightlife.

Manly Beach and Manly. Manly is a fantastic location. The beach is beautiful and maintained well. The location is great for public transport, variety in eating and wharf is all within walking distance.Great selection of shops including coles in main mall.Can't wait to return to this beautiful place.
Nice beach. Interesting with Surfers and beach walkers. Not overcrowded as during the week. Easily accessed from the ferry

My Local Beach, beats Bondi hands down.. Great surfing beach, with good swimming opportunities at South and North Steyne always swim between the Flags. If you don't like waves there is an ocean pool at North Steyne and a small pool at Shelley Beach.
Too Crowded...to be expected, but still.... It is an 'OK' beach - but just too popular, and crowded. Better to walk around 500 meters or so south to the Shelley Beach area.

A great spot for Sunday lunch & a walk. Simply my favourite destination for a Sunday lunch & a walk to work off the calories. Parking is generally reasonable, up to 3 hours for less than $10 is good by Sydney standards.
Of course the beach is great for swimming, people watching, etc.

Always a pleasant beach. We live in Sydney and have been to this beach numerous times. There are many excellent restaurants lining up the streets, and kids play in the playground and water sprouts along for hours. Cycling, running, skateboarding, snorkelling,surfing, swimming or BBQ...Shopping is a breeze too you can get almost everything in the shops nearby. It has so much to offer!but remember this is just one of the many stunning beaches in Sydney!Only downside,the beach can be very crowded during weekends and holidays.
Aussie culture . Not as busy as Bondi but possibly more beautiful. Definitely worth visiting for day taking the ferry from circular quay.

Great Sydney Beach. I love this beach, why? Because its on the Ocean, its a beautiful sandy beach, its virtually in the middle of Manly (at least its within minutes of the centre), the scenery is wonderful but what I really love is the fact that you can hire sun-loungers so you don't have to sit on the sand or heave deckchairs etc to the beach. Why other beaches don't do the same around Sydney I'm not sure? This is s great beach!

Always buzzing and beautiful. Manly Beach is a beautiful place with lots around it. Loads of restaurants, coffee shops and bars plus some shopping.The beach is nice and better swimming here than Bondi as the water isn't as cold

A nice day trip from Sydney. We took the ferry from Sydney harbor. The tour offered beautiful views of Harbor Bridge, Opera House and Sydney skyline. When in Manly, it was a nice walk to the beach through the town with lots of shops and restaurants. The beach was all we expected and seen on all the photographs and in movies. Since it was not the swim weather, we spent some time lying in the sand and watching the surfers have fun, took a nice long walk along the whole length of the beach and had a nice meal in one of the cosy restaurants close to the beach. Then we did some shopping in small shops along the Main Street. The last ferry to Sydney runs rather early in the afternoon, so be sure not to miss it. All in all we spent a nice day on Manly Beach. I can recommend it to everybody who has time to do the same.
Heaven on water. I love a day trip to manly, great shops, restaurants, hotels, pubs for lunch or dinner, but that beach is heaven on earth. The walk to Shelley beach too is great fun.
Beautiful beach. This free beach is just one of many in Sydney. Cliffs surround the beach and the surf (waves) are just beautiful.

Beautiful view of Ocean... We went in afternoon and after an hour walk had lunch in one of the older cafes. The signages by the side of road narrate the historical importance of Manly Beach and it's surroundings. Good for all age groups including children.. better to avoid during rainy day.

Best til last. Last day of holiday and we decided to go to manly as we heard loads of good chat about it. Well people aren't wrong. Beach is lovely and is very clean. Good facilities and shops and cafes nearby too. Great day to end our holiday and only 18 mins by ferry from circular quay

Not at all what I expected.. Caught the ferry to Manly with hundreds of others, mainly to visit the aquarium as my daughter loves penguins. Spent a couple of hours walking around the town and along the beachside and decided that if we come back to Sydney again we'd like to spend a few days in Manly instead of the city centre. It has everything you need for a holiday and so much to see. The coast walks are great.

Reminds me of home. Visited: June 2015When I get the opportunity to travel to different places, I definitely get a little homesick. Manly beach definitely reminded me of some of the beaches back home in California. People walking their dogs, nice sand and cool breezes made my experience at Manly.
great beach. great beach for a walk. it's a long beach with really nice sand. there are also a lot of people walking their dogs so you will also enjoy looking at the dogs.. :)
Big and beautiful. It was a beautiful beach, no trash, not too many people (we were there in the week during a school break).
Wide and beautiful. The sand is a nice, pink-ish kind. The beach is very wide and long, plenty of space. Nearby shops offer a good selection of well-priced souvenirs and food options.

Good for a walk. There is manly scenic walk that you can follow or you can choose the short route to walk from Manly to Shelly beach. Along the way, you'll see the water dragons on the way or if you are lucky, you'll see many other original Australian animals along the path. Also, there are many nice restaurants that you can enjoy the food with a good view.

A lovely place for beach lovers. A place for relaxing activities for having sunbath at beach or talking a long stroll at walking path beside the pine trees. It's also a place for swimmers and surfers for excitement and fun in the water. Moreover, it's easy access from the Circular Quay by ferry for only 30 minutes ride. It's truly an amazing place.
Good family beach. Good family beach. A little busy at times & sometimes you will find rubbish either in the water or on the sand.

Beautiful place well worth a trip. There is quite a lot of fuss about this place but when you get there you will see why. This is not the big city this is a beautiful little town with small shops and local restaurants and cafe

Great Day at Manly Beach. Took the Manly Fast Ferry from Sydney harbor (wharf 6) it was about $18 Australian per person round trip but the trip is fast and very comfortable. It is a short 5-10 minute walk from the ferry to the beach with lots of little shops and restaurants along the way.
