Manly beach is very large with a number of rest rooms and changing stations for you to change into your swimming suites. the waves and the water were awesome but you must swim between the signs set up on the beach for safety reasons. Wish I was still there. Everyone we met there was very helpful so don't be afraid to ask for help if you need it. People are very friendly.

Head to Manly on a Sunday for $2.50. We traveled here from Circular Quay on the ferry on a Sunday and it was only $2.50 with an Opal Card. The beach is lovely - with white sand, excellent life guards which kept the surfers away from the swimmers and a nice walkway under the trees for when it gets too hot! The only reason for 4 stars is that it was extremely busy when we visited - however everyone still manages to find their own spot so it was fine.

A must in Sydney. Manly is easily accessible by ferry or fast ferry operating from Circular Quay(city)to Manly Wharf, the short walk up the Corso leads to the ocean beach. Surrounded by the ocean and harbour on three sides, Manly is unique with its 18 small cove harbour and ocean beaches it lays peacefully as a peninsula with stunning and breathtaking views. Now a major tourist beach resort with million dollar homes it has become one of Sydney's most popular beaches and International destination for overseas travellers. Manly is everything Australian, it is our culture. A lively Sydney beach resort with excellent accommodation, restaurants, cafes and pubs. Its alive with screeching seagulls, long sandy beaches, small coves , inlets, swaying Norfolk Pines, bikinis, cold icy beer, surfboards, festivals, music, flip flops, pink zinc, fish and chips, yachts, boats, divers, fishermen, & lifeguards..

Lovely Beach. We took the Ferry to Manly Beach and walked from the ferry terminal to the beach, then up to another beach area and back down to the ferry through a different walk. It was really a nice beach, people everywhere. The water was very cold, so we didn't swim. If you love the beach, it is a good one.

Manly. The boat ride to Manly from Circular Quay is fun and only costs about $10.00/person for a round trip ticket. The beach is beautiful and is about a 10-minute walk thru town. The town itself was a surprising disappoint. Scads of people make their way from Circular Quay to Manly so you’d think the town would be a thriving little village. But we found it decrepit. There’s a bunch of crappy little discount souvenir stores that will not tempt you to enter. If you have kids and want to go the beach then for sure go here otherwise, skip it.
Beautiful. Manly is really beautiful.The beach is lovely .nice walk to Shelly beach too X plenty of shops in town and plenty of places to eat ,would love to live here x
Really like Manly beach. Its much quieter and not a packed as Bondi beach and beautiful. Lots of food and shopping and a great place to hang out.
Nice Beach - Nothing Special. Manly Beach is pretty good for surfing, also not bad for diving, its pretty big so it doesn't get too crowded... but i still preferred Bondi

More beach beauty. There was an International Volleyball tournament in progress when I was there. And the beach was as beautiful as every beach that I visited in Australia. Definitely work the ferry ride from Sydney.
Fantastic beach with soft golden sand. a highlight of any visit to Sydney - it is a beautiful beach which should also appeal to junior and learning surfers

A Beach that you have to take a Boat to. We took the fast ferry out to Manly Beach. It only took about 15 minutes and cost $7-8 Aussie dollars. The town was lovely. My daughter wanted to lay on the beach, so she settled herself, while I perused the town. It is a typical beach town but also has art work and upscale shops. I thoroughly enjoyed myself shopping while my daughter swam and tanned. When we were both finished we found an outdoor restaurant that was lovely, then strolled down to the pier where we stopped at the Brewery to have a beer. It is advisable to get there early because on the weekends it fills up rapidly.
Just love it. Nice beach!we had a nice time!take some take away food and a coffee and enjoy in the sand&sun!kids loved even it was in April

beautiful place.. we took the ferry, it was raining and 20 degrees but still a beautiful trip :). I've been to Bondi, Coogee and Manly beach now.. I think I probably prefer Manly best. It was a gorgeous and affordable ferry ride from circular quay.. we had dinner at Fishmongers fish n chips - gourmet, beautiful food! Good mixture of shops, not overly touristy or pretentious when we were there.. I'm sure it gets a lot busier in Summer however!

A curved sandy beach with lots going on.. We just love to people watch here and dipping our toes in the ocean. The lifeguards are interesting to watch as they whistle to get swimmers to move away from any danger. Nice walks along the coast to Cabbage Tree Bay where we saw a water dragon sunning on the rocks. Memorable day.
Sand, restaurants an ferries. Great Sunday destination. I was spoilt for choice of food from fast food to silver service food at the restaurant I chose was great as was the service.

Stunning Beach!. We stayed at the Novotel Manly Beach and this beach was directly across the road. It is definitely one of Sydney's best beaches and had all sorts of activities going on along the beach and on the foreshore ... lots of volleyball nets, fitness groups, cyclists, rollerbladers, runners, walkers, prams, picnickers ... so much to do! The water was as blue as and very clean and the sand is lovely ... highly recommend it if you're looking to chill out on the beach somewhere. And lots of nearby places to have a bite to eat!

Hard to get to for no reason. Not very scenic, not a big deal really, costly to get to, and not to mention taking alot of time to get there, ferry frequency also too low, the shops are creepy and old looking.

Wonderful . Beautiful yellow beach with blue crashing waves which is as popular with the seagulls as with the tourists. There are loads of cafes for lunch just a very short walk away so you can stay all day. There are free showers to use near the beach as well.
It's time to take a dip. This beach was exciting, clean and just fun to watch people if you don't want to go in the water. There was a boardwalk to eat and entertainment everywhere.
great place. This is what you imagine an Australian beach to be. Full of people surfing or relaxing on a great beach. We enjoy the walk along the promenade. It is a fun place to be

Pleasant ferry ride away. This place is very popular for daytrippers and beachbums. Wonderful places to eat and many souvenir shops. Manly beach is a relaxing short walk away. There were buskers and families enjoying the beach. They have a great Aldi's Supermarket at the Wharf.

Best beach in town. Manly beach was the best day trip experience of all the beaches we visited. We drove, but you can get there by ferry from the City Centre which is probably easier and more fun. Manly is a pretty smart area, somehow more sophisticated than Bondi (which was a bit bling you), the beach is long, sandy and beautiful. I liked it most because I get easily bored and there is plenty to see locally and only a short walk away. Could easily spend a whole week there, and it is a great base for exploring the rest of Sydney
Beautiful sight. Great waves and place to eat. There is a public park where on can eat and watch the beach goers. The beach strip is long.

Walk around to Shelly Beach . We went across to Manly for lunch. It was a lovely sunny day, but quite windy. We walked along the path to Shelley Beach where it was sheltered. On the path are some lovely sculptures of local fauna and activities.
Stunning. Fabulous beach with life guards.A little windy the day we went but stunning anyway. Would have loved more time to go back.

Seaside perfection!. Swimming, surfing, sunning, sand-castling .. Manly Beach is a paradise for water activities and walking enthusiasts. Surfing contests add extra interest for the sporting enthusiast, I was blown away at the skill and boardcraft of many competitors. Sometimes a little windy but definitely one of Sydney's top beaches to visit. Highly recommended!

This is a lovely beach with golden sand. The Manly Beach can be reached from Sydney Central by bus or ferry. The beach is patrolled by surf lifeguards who have several patrols as it is a long beach. There is a real holiday atmosphere as the shops nearby are open even on public holidays. There are many beachwear shops so if you have forgotten your bathing togs there is a great selection to choose from, also many food shops.

Best Beach. Manly Beach always been my favourite beach in Sydney and it is th e most beautiful, the atmosphere is always alive.You have many choices of places to dine in with your loves ones.Manly is a place for everyone and it is a must visit if you are travelling in Sydney.
family dog friendly beach. lovelly beach clean and lots of shops restaurants bars etc nearby and lots of little cafes so much nicer than bondi beach well worth a visit

A night walk along the beach. We took a night walk along the beach here after dinner one night. It wasn't very well lit but there was some light from the street and cafes nearby. We were pretty much the only ones out there even though the restaurants nearby were pretty busy. This beach overall seemed less busy than Bondi or Cogee when we were there.

We keep coming back. Over the years, we have kept coming back to Manly Beach several times. It has never been disappointing regardless of season or weather. We don't swim or sun but rather stroll the beach and all the shops near it. And, of course, sample the food.
Great Beach. One of the best beaches we have been too. Great atmosphere away from the city. Many good food options, shopping as well. Definitley a great family day out.

Great on a hot day. Easy to access to Manly from Circulr Quay via the fast ferry (15 min). Then a short walk puts you on a gorgeous beach white fine soft sand. Plenty of inexpensive food options around. Beach had clean bathrooms and shower facilities. Lifeguards were present to keep swimmers away from the areas with rip tides.

Beautiful Beach. It was a little overcast but the beach was still gorgeous! Surprises how many joggers, bicyclist and other fitness activities were going on. There are a lot of nice restaurants to grab a bite,drink or coffee. Lovely area!!

Lovely beach, not as touristy as Bondi. If staying in central Sydney, it's a lovely ferry ride to Manly. There are some laid back shops and restaurants and certainly lots of people, but a far cry from the overwhelming swarms of tourists at Bondi. Walk awhile down the beach and it quiets down. Beautiful sand, shark nets for the shark wary! A great place to spend the day.
Most amazing Beach !. Manly beach is just beautiful ! The beach in itself, the surfing activity, the walk along it, the restaurantes and cafés on the Corso, just such a great place !

Anticlimax. Not sure what all the fuss is about Manly beach. It is a long beach with a number of sewage outlets. Signs warn against swimming if there has been heavy rain (due to sewage washout). I think this primarily a beach for surfing. The seafront at Manly is quite developed like most of Sydney, but less attractive than many of Sydney's other areas.

Beautiful but packed . It was a beautiful warm day and the beach was packed however that wasn't that off putting. It is a beautiful beach and the water looks so inviting. Golden sand and clear water. Plenty of shops and bars/restaurants/Cafes within close vicinity.
Well worth the trip. Forget Bondi Beach...catch the ferry to Manly; Great scenic ride with amazing views of Sydney harbor, Great select of food places and a spectacular beach.

Better than Bondi?. If you are staying anywhere in the area take the time to visit Manly. The beach is as good as Bondi (although smaller) but it has one thing that Bondi doesn't. ... Shelly beach. A fantastic cove, great for snorkling, picnicking or just catching the sun. After a relaxing day on the beach try out one of the great fish and chip shops along the high street, remember to save room for an ice cream.
Fantastic beach. It's hard to impress people from Sarasota that live on a top rated beach but the surf here was so much fun. The boardwalk and town are great for tourists.

Manly beach awesome. Great beach with the Norfolk Pines all along the beach. We walked along the walk path to Shelly beach looking for the water dragon and to enjoy the shelly feeling of shelly beach on uourfeet. Saw a few on the way back. There's a fabulous swimming pool on the way too.Highly recommend this part of the world. The trip from Sydney by ferry was very fast, pleasant and efficient.

Fabulous weather for our visitors. Visited beautiful Manly beach on the holiday Monday with visitors from Canada. We walked to Fairy Bower from the wharf and back along the boardwalk to South Steyne. They walked on the beach and dipped their feet in the water like small children and couldn't believe they were on the iconic Manly beach.

Beautiful beach!. We sailed on the ferry from Sydney you get off the ferry and you are almost on the beach lovely soft sand and clear warm water Lots of bars and restaurants line the beach and plenty of shops a most enjoyable day out

Best Sydney beach. A lovely beach a short ferry ride from Sydney harbour. Plenty of cafes but the few times I've been always seems nice and quiet. The aquarium is worth a visit for an hour, mainly to see the Penguins.A full day here might be too much but easily fills half a day.
Well worth the ferry ride from CIrcular quay. Good beach to swim or surf (when the waves are good), great views and plenty of places to picnic or snooze :)

one of the most beautiful urban beaches in the world!. I did a month long trip to Australia that ended with three days in Manly Beach. Probably not a great idea ... I DIDN'T WANT TO LEAVE!!!!!It offers a bit of everything. A great surfing beach, fantastic walks along the Steyne esplanade, sunbathing and beach volleyball. It is the kind of place where you can go and just feel your blood pressure drop!

Nice but best bit is Shelly Beach around the corner!. I live in Sydney and know the beaches well! Bondi is better for swimming (Manly is often rough with rips and the swimming is squashed into a small area where the lifeguards patrol - lots of whistle blowing and often loud music!). However, a great day out and worth it for the ferry ride from CQ. There is also a summer ferry from Watson's Bay (where I live) if you prefer quieter and calmer harbour beaches. The best thing to do is walk to the south around to sheltered Shelly Beach and snorkel from there...it is a marine reserve with LOTS of fish and very safe and sheltered - you can exit from the stone stairs if you don't want to swim far. Sit in the shade under the Cabbage Tree Palms and look out for the gorgeous local lizards (water dragons), there are also excellent bush walks around North Head.
Holiday. Nice place plenty of shops and great food cafes resturants . Beach is ok . Nice place for a visit . Great walking around and looking at shops . Nice place

Great day trip. Art Deco architecture, interesting for all ages, good nature trail, swimming, snorkelling, surfing, walking, eating, shopping. Take the fast or slow ferry from Sydney Circular Quay. A must do for a sunny fall or spring day. Beautiful, historic.
Happening!. Visited this beach after dusk.It's a nice places and a good place to stroll after dusk.Lots of pubs, eateries, shopping, just great!Manly ferry adds to its charm.

Busy beach on Easter Saturday. Manly was certainly buzzing and alive last weekend. The streets and cafes were packed and the beach was crowded. The area between the flags was a pea soup of people, so busy, but the sea was great. Nice changing rooms and showers.

WAS IT OAHU - WAIKIKI. We can say based on our personal experience that Manly and Waikiki as so much alike, so clean an so popular that you can have an Hawaiian experience right here in Australia, as we did, The walk along the beach, the sands, the waves, surfers and sun lovers could not be distinguished and if not for LHD cars you could be easily mistaken. The young folk were just as sun goddess and bronzed tan guys as you would se anywhere. And the Corso is an amazing place as well, a great walk from the Ferry Terminal about 150 metre so to the beach, with lots of trendy shops and food places, a lot of pubs, backpacker accommodation. A real relaxing place to be and to add to your list of day trips in Sydney.

Go if you have to see it. We took the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly on a Saturday earlier this month, more for the trip across the harbour than a visit to Manly. I have visited Manly a number of times and years ago, stayed at there for a conference, but I have always thought it to be incredibly over rated.We stepped off the ferry and wandered, with hundreds of others, up The Corso, to the beach. Between the DJ screaming out whatever promotional message he was spruking, to the cyclists who didn't seem to give a damn about pedestrians, I really didn't have my view of this over populated strip of beach changed.If you have always wanted to see the iconic Manly beach then by all means go. If you just want to go to the beach there are a dozen better and cleaner options.

LOVED this place!. Decided to visit Manly beach the last day of our vacation and we had so much fun! Such a great ambiance. Beaches were beautiful and our dinner view was spectacular. A must for a relaxing day in Sydney!
Manly Beach. This beach, like Bondi, is close to Sydney, and easily accessible. Was there during the International Surf Competion, which made it rather fun, but other than that, it is a So Cal beach.

Proof that it’s not just the journey but also the destination that counts. Surely the Sydney to Manly Ferry is one of the worlds very best commuter journeys, but for those taking the trip to Manley the destination is one of the jewels in Sydney’s crown. The beach is busy, but specious, clean, with good surfing ‘swells’ , it’s well watched by an active lifeguard crew & is close by to a host of local amenities from beach showers, shady outdoor seating, ice cream parlours & loads of high quality local shops. The beach, which is Ocean side rather than harbour side always seems to benefit from the cooling sea breezes. I love Sydney, but if i had the choice (& the money)- I’d live in Manley, by this beach

Lovely Relaxing Beach. Staying in a Darling Harbour, we took the boat out to Manly which was nice in itself - a great way to get there. Walking through some great shops & restaurants you eventually get to the beach. Great mix of Sun worshipers, surfers, fishers and a great beach. Great way to spend a day or just a few hours.

Ferry to Manly Island. We caught the ferry to Manly Island for the day. Manly Beach is great the only trouble is not much shade and very hot. There is lots to see here and lots to do. Shops of all sorts and we had a great Thai meal not far from the beach.
Nice visit. We went over by ferry having been advised it was better to visit than Bondi - can't compare because we did not get to Bondi, but found Manly Beach lovely.

A great excursion from the Sydney CBD. My wife and I took the ferry out to Manly after work. It was very quick and easy from where we were in Sydney CBD near Town Hall. The ferry took 30 minutes and dropped us off right in town.  There are a plethora of restaurants and gelato shops all the way (short way) across the peninsula to the beach, and then there are more! Shopping like crazy. the beach was nice and clean with great views from the cafe we ate at facing the beach. The city is very clean and well kept. Nice walking town for sure. An outstanding little excursion to a close by beach that is way less crowded than Bondi.
Nice city beach. nice city beach, good sand, lots of surfing. There are sufficient toilets nearby and plenty of eating places.

Superb beach, restaurants and shopping too!. Manly beach - gorgeous!! Beautiful sandy beach, that you can walk along or relax and sunbathe on and watch the surfers and the word go by! Even better, go grab some fish and chips and chill and watch the waves - just watch the seagulls! Go and check out the restaurants and shops, also take a walk along to Shelley beach, stunning! Just watch the currents here, swimming can be limited to a small area that the lifeguards designate but this is for your safety as there can be strong rip tides.

Nice respite from Sydney. If you're looking for a quick get-away from Sydney, then an exhilarating ferry ride from the Sydney ferry terminal to sun-in-the-fun Manly beach is for you. Breezy and full of fun restaurants and wonderful sea views and walks, Manly Beach was a surprising "find" and refreshing break from the urban excitement of Sydney.

Beautiful Manly. We travelled to Manly for a few hours and so wished that we had decided to stay there for a few days. The beach is amazing with beautiful clear water, and lovely shade trees along the Esplanade. We will certainly be back !

Lovely small town with beautiful beaches. The ferry ride from Circular Quay took about 30mins to get to Manly ferry station. It was a hell of a ride as the ferry fought against strong sea winds and huge tide waves. Nevertheless, Manly itself was an amazing small town with lots of dining options and a dazzling beach. Take a walk along the Manly Scenic Walk along the coastline as it gives you spectacular views of the town on one side and the pacific on the other:)
Manly Beach. Loved the day at this beach - plenty of waves, babes and boarders. This is an Awesome place its big and has everything except shade. Lots of shops between Watson Bay and the beach too.

Manly beach. I prefer this to Bondi as it was not as busy plus the people were easier to get on with, plus there was better food on offer and it seem to have a safer feel to the place, it was also easy to get to and from.
Good beach. I'd say good, not great. But getting there, then walking to Shelly Beach, that's just about 10 minutes, makes it very good!

Much better than Bondi. We visited Manly via ferry, using our Opal Cards. Get off the ferry and walk straight ahead. There are plenty of shops, bars and restaurants. Continue straight ahead and you arrive the beautiful beach. We were lucky and visited during the Australian Surf Championships, with MTV and other major sponsors in attendance. We loved Manly and are only disappointed we did not visit it a second time, during out time in Sydney.
Better than Bondi. You have more space at Manly for your family to enjoy. Easy accessible by ferry from Circular quay. Lots of restaurants in the area.

Perfection of Manly. It was a perfect sunny day. My sister and I, out on a spur, went to Manly and we seriously enjoyed the time we spent there. Word of advise: allot at least half a day to enjoy the island.

Fun beach to visit. Took the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly Beach. Would suggest to head there a bit earlier if going on the weekend to miss all the crowds and enjoy the beach. Had a great time there! The market on the weekend is great too.

Manly Beach Tour. Take a ferry from a wharf to Manly beach. Take the upper deck sitting while on ferry for a spectacular view of Sydney Harbour Bridge along with a view of the world famous Opera House. Many is quiet beach but good for surfing and bathing. A good day outing trip.
Beautful beach. Took the ferry over the Manley. The beach was fantastic, watched the surfing and the day we went there was beach volley ball competitions going on, lots to see and do, great place.

Five Miles From Sydney and A Thousand Miles from Care. I have been going to Manly, a couple of times a year for over 50 years....the Corso is as crowded as ever, but the food is good, mostly cheap and plentiful.The ferry ride from the City is always a highlight, its the closest I come to sea time nowadays, no matter how calm it is outside you always get a bit of a swell crossing between the heads, its fun watching all the tourists turn green around the gills and watching those that crowd into the bows running aft when the first "greeny" (a big wave) pops it head over the pointy bit (bow). Although the Corso and the hard stand directly opposite it are always crowded the sand tends to be not so crowded and there is enough of it to get away from the crowd anyway.The walk around the south end is always worth it with the little cafes on the way and then Shelly Beach with it cafe/restaurant as a reward at the end of it.Most places in the City have changed beyond recognition since I was a "tacker" (a little child), but Manly still has its coastal cool vibe going strong.

Quaint beach area. Manly has either the quiet harbour or the rolling surf beach so something for everyone. The walkway around the waters is exceptional with several picturesque waterside cafes and restaurants to choose from.

The best all round beach in Sydney. What makes Manly beach special is that it isn't pretentious and there is so many restaurants, shops and cafes on offer in easy walking distance. There is a market on the weekend in the Corso and many great events take place there, such as the Food & Wine Festival, Jazz Festival, Surf and volleyball competitions. The place attracts a mix of families, young and professional adults and travellers. There is an aquarium on offer, plenty of water sports, a library and you can get there by ferry or bus if you don't have your own car. There is plenty of parking but if you cannot find one on the beachfront then just make your way to one of the many council car parks.

Beach Beauty. Went with our Aussie friends via a ferry from Sydney Harbor. This is a must, surfers and beachgoers galore.. Nice and clean. I would have liked to buy a tee shirt that said, "Manly man, but it is not made. Thought it would be nice. We had prawn sandwiches at a picnic table, purchased them nearby. Add seafood sauce to the fresh bun, and viola!

Amazing Beach. Found this beach to be much better than others, including Bondi Beach. The town of Manly is easily accessible using the Sydney Ferries. The beach is ideal for families and plenty of cheap places to eat nearby.

Worth the Ferry Trip. Manley town, or at least the little bit we saw, was much smaller and quainter than Sydney. there is some very nice architecture that hints at how wealthy this suburb must have been. the main street are full of shops, ranging from the 'tat' to the 'boutique'. The beach is long and attracts lots of surfers, as you get to the beach on the right is the bathing area. A walkway following the cliff, takes you around the shoreline to a much smaller sheltered beach. Various eateries and waterholes are available.

Take the Ferry. One of the best things about the trip to Manly is the ferry ride from Circular Quay. When you arrive it is a pleasant stroll across the shopping district to the beach.There are dozens of great beaches and Manly is one of the best.There are some very pleasant strolls from the beach walking in either direction along the coast. These are highly recommended.You can swim or relax, stroll or jog, eat or drink. Simply enjoy.
Beautiful. Caught the ferry to Manly, beautiful beach and lots of seaside shops on the way to the front. Really lovely place

LOVE MANLY!. So much to offer, it leaves the Eastern Suburbs beaches for dead. If you are in Manly on a Sunday, get there early and watch the Bold and the Beautiful swimmers leave Manly at the very southern end of the beach, for Shelley Beach at 7am. Their pink cossies and caps are quite a spectacle. This club is in the Guinness World Record books, as they have swimmers swimming everyday of the year! There is so much happening on the beach during the morning, from volleyball to Nippers to boat crews training, it is fantastic! Coffee and great breakfasts are available at any of the restaurants and cafes across the road.

One of the best beach walks. We took some American visitors for a stroll along the path running alongside the beach and it was terrific. About 4 in the afternoon the heat of the day was gone and the views were superb. Plenty to see with a few surfers out, some volleyball folks playing a few metres from the sea and dozens of people like us just walking along enjoying the sea air and views.

Good Day out. Manly is one of my favourite beaches! You can spend a whole day here. Either came by ferry or you can drive and park. They have alot of good cafe's and restaurants to have all three meals of the day. The beach itself is quite big so heaps of room to sun tan and they also have alot of shady grassy areas for picnics etc.

Nice beach for surfers and good swimmers . Nice beach for surfers and good swimmers. Not suitable for kids due to the strong currents, nice shopping close to the beach. It's a really nice beach with nice sandy dunes. Recommend a trip just to watch the surfers!

Beautiful beach has everything. Manly Beach has everything. It is a beautiful beach, lovely promenade for walks, hire bikes, skates, skateboards or surfboards, close to lots of restaurants and cafes, nice park and children's playground, good facilities and easy access from the city via the Ferry. On the weekends there's lots of action with surf clubs and volleyball on the beach. What more could you ask?

Seaside by the City. A quick half hour ferry ride out of the CBD (Circular Quay) brings you to a wonderful seaside town experience. You'll find great restaurants and pubs with a relaxed seaside atmosphere. Let's not forget the amazing beaches and views. A corso that is made for strolling or exercising with shops, people, beach time buzz. There's a shopping mall that has live performances and buskers, restaurants (both indoor and outdoor) and a hubbub that leaves you feeling you're on holiday. No matter whether it's summer or winter, this seaside town right of the harbour only half an hour from the centre of Sydney is an amazing gettaway experience. Whether for the day, the weekend or the week.

Beautiful beach!. Manley Beach is very beautiful and has a very trendy little section of the city all around the Corso. I was there for the Australian Open of Surfing and it was spectacular. There is also a nice little walk over to Shelley Beach where waves are at a minimum. Great little shops and restaurants. There is also a great open market with artists, craft people and food every weekend.

Take the Ferry to Manly for Lunch. We are interstate visitors to Sydney, and upon each visit, we jump on the ferry to Manly just to check out the beach, and enjoy a good lunch. What a lovely way to spend a day. We get to sail upon Sydney Harbour as well as enjoying a great destination. We're not that supportive of their Rugby League team, but I guess you can't choose the locals. Still, it's not enough to keep us away, and highly recommend Manly to visitors to Sydney.

Fabulous. Manly Beach is one of the most popular beaches in Sydney. It is not hard to see why. Miles of lovely sand forming a sun lovers delight. The walk along to the sun trap at Shelly Beach is really pleasant.

Busy but Beautiful Beach!. We spent a Sunday afternoon at Manly Beach. It was very crowded, but still lovely. We especially enjoyed watching the surfers who were there helping children with disabilities surf.

Pretty beach with great accessibility from downtown Sydney. Bondi Beach is easy enough to get to from the center of Sydney- a train to Bondi Junction and your pick of buses to the beach- but Manly Beach can be gotten to simply by sauntering into Circular Quay and hopping on the big ferry for a 35-minute cruise. So instead of being packed into a bus or a train car you get a cheap tour of Sydney Harbor (granted, on a busy day you'll still be packed, but at least you get some fresh air...)Manly has a classic beach-town setup with a long straight (though narrow) beach backed by pavilions, an esplanade, and town full of little shops and restaurants (and a bunch of mid-rise flats and hotels- eh, nobody is perfect). Completing the view is a row of pretty Norfolk Pines that line the main beach street. It's only a few blocks and a straight shot between the ferry terminal and the beach.Bonus trip: If you walk up to the end of the beach, cross the inlet, and walk through the neighborhood on the bluff you come to little Freshwater Beach, It's not as scenic but also not as crowded as Manly.

Nice. Took the ferry to Manly Beach on a gorgeous day. The beach is beautiful and there was even a surf competition going on! The town has many shops and places to eat. This is a good place for a day trip.
Great beach. We spend a few hours at Manly beach. The beach and the view is great .we also walked around the Corso which was fun. Lots of shops and lots to see. We will be back.
Beautiful. Beautiful beach, just a short ferry ride away from Sydney. Crowded on the weekends, but not as much as Bondi. Great place to do surf lessons.
Great. Lovely long beach with good facilities, also only a short walk to Shelly Beach if you don't want too much surf.

Great place to stay or visit. Visited Manly for the day from downtown Sydney by ferry. Beautiful location , fab beach and plenty of shops, cafes, bars, restaurants. Lovely walks from each end of beach. while the place is clearly a haven for surfers theres plenty of space to chill out and unwind if you want to, went on a weekday, not sure busy it gets at weekends.

Probably good for surfing but totally packed.. I'm not sure how they managed to get this photo here (with just sand + no people) - went here on a warm Saturday during March and it was thoroughly packed with people (no room to swing a cat as they say). So, you can probably forget a nice quiet relaxing day on the beach here - but if that's not what you are after then you'll be fine.There's lots of restaurants, cafes + shops on the esplanade + slightly inland so plenty to do if you get bored of the beach or hungry.Surf looked good - might have had more fun if I had a board + wetsuit - however was just visiting for a short while so not an option.

Iconic.... Lovely sand, great surf and a great atmosphere. We went in late March and the beach was very quiet. Lots of good eating places. Easily reached from Sydney using the Manly Ferry - 30 mins each way. If in Sydney, it's almost a 'must do'.
Overcrowded. This beach is a nice beach, but there are much nicer and much quieter around.1000 people arriving on a ferry every half hour is not my idea of fun or relaxation.
Awesome views. Manly is a very charming beach with a nice promenade. The views are stunning. Nice places to eat. For visitors to Sydney a must do!
Lovely beach. Great beach at back of town, clean and spacious with lifeguards and flags for safety. Toilets close by and cafe next to beach. Not a surfer but looked ok. Very hot!

Clean, lovely beach popular with surfers.. A great one if your into surfing saw no end of locals showing their skills. The beach itself was clean and people around this area were all so friendly. We had breakfast at a site on the beach good start to our day while watching folk enjoy their selves and kiddies from the local school having games lesson.

Great waterfront location. Excellent beach with many bars and restaurants along the road and waterfront. A popular location for backpackers and a relaxed atmosphere in the town with a walking malls away from the traffic.

Wonderful Stay for our Anniversary trip. Manly is only 30 minutes from Sydney but it is a beautiful place and the beach is stunning.The lifeguard station is at the each end of the beach and flags are set out to show safe swimming areas. Surfers can spend all day here and can surf more or less anywhere subject to the lifeguards instructions.The sand is soft and the water a good temperature in season.The are restaurants and a good number of hotels across the road.It is a fantastic walk from one end to the other and back with super views of the bay's and the ocean. Wear good shoes and allow at least one hour at reasonable pace to do that trip. It is flat so anyone with average fitness can do it .Another great walk is Shelly beach which takes about one hour return as well and has the superb Boathouse restaurant fur a snack or lunch to break the journey.

"Whatever" - dont understand the hype. My first time to Manly and my first impressions of the beach and surrounding streets was 'whatever". The beach itself while large was extremely crowded. The foreshore streets looked old and tired. The worst thing about it however is the parking. It took us and age to find a space and then had to pay the ridiculous amount of $16 for 90mins. That is an outrage. Your not providing a valet service or even undercover parking, its street parking and it was Sunday. being from Brisbane its the first time we have seen parking meters being enforced on a Sunday.My advice is if you want to see nicer beaches and not have to pay for street parking on weekends come to the Gold Coast. Or if you are prepared to drive 90mins south go to the northern beaches of Wollongong which are also much nicer.

Has to be seen - surfer and sculpture heaven. A great beach - popular and cool. Surfers and swimmers and families and joggers all piling in and having a great time. The coastal walk here is peppered with beautiful metal and rock sculptures.

Quintessential Australian beach. Great beach a short ferry ride from Circular Quay.A street with ample shopping and restaurants connects the ferry station with the beach. The street has a slightly Mediterranean vibe.It is a bit crowded on the weekends. But you can surf and live the Aussie lifestyle.

Good vibes . I spent 2 weeks in Sydney as a solo backpacker. Manly was in my top 2! It was the Australian Open for Surfing so lots going on. Shops food, beach, lifeguards... loved it. Also love the amount of water fountains on almost every steet. Makes such a difference in this heat.

Surf beach. Get the ferry from Circular Quay to Many and walk to the beach via the Manly shops. The beach has shade and plenty of seats Great for families. The sea is really blue and there is sometimes surf.

Fantastic Huge Beach. An enormous beach that is clean and has life guards. Plenty of people swimming and surfing and although busy it is so big that it didn't feel overcrowded. Just make note though that swimming is not always allowed due to sharks!

Great way to head off jet lag. We visited Sydney and NZ for 3 weeks in Dec/Jan. We have close friends living there on expat assignment and they strongly recommended heading out to Manly beach while the hotel preps our room after the early morning LA arrival. We did and were very glad of it. This was a great intro to Sydney because you get to see the harbor on the way out, experience the Aussie beach culture and enjoy some great food yards from the beach. We came back reenergized after the 15 hour flight and made it through to dinner and into a Australian sleep cycle.

You can't beat a visit to manly. . Just a hop on a 'Manly Ferry' from Sydney CBD and you'll be there in after the best value cruise you'll ever take. From the cbd, go past the harbour bridge, right by the opera house, across Sydney harbour for about $7 or so. Arrive manly and your in heaven. Pubs, cafes, restaurants and shopping. One of the best city beaches you'll ever see. So worth a day trip if your visiting Sydney. Take a towel and your sluggos (costumes for the non locals) and have a cracking day. Just do it.

Nice beach. Iconic beach a must see well worth the trip out spend the day and do the walks along the beach head the water was warm and the life guards are very aware of where people are in the sea important if you take children

Getting away from it all. Manly is said to be "seven miles from the city, a thousand miles from care." Manly is an affluent suburb, along Sydney's Northern Beaches. Manly Beach is a great place for a dip, take your togs, as Sydneysiders say, if you make the trip. The best way to get to Manly is by ferry, my favoured mode of transport in Sydney.

The cleanest beach of Sydney, perfect for a surfing session with some friends. Whether you are looking to swim (in the waves), surfing or bodyboarding. This is the right place to go. Be sure to look online to see the waves height and currents before going (just look up online on google to find a proper website). The place is easily accessible from the manly wharf (3 min walk down the Corso) and is very convenient as you will find most of Manly's food places, bars and shops at a walking distance.
Great beaches. What a wonderful asset this is to all the people of Sidney, lovely sandy beaches within 30 minutes of central Sidney.
Lovely spot for a stroll. This is an easy stroll from the ferry. Keep an eye out for the small brass sculptures along the way. Lots of interesting shells on the beach.

Beautiful beach, great shops & cafes. An easy ferry ride from Circular Quay - choose either the public or fast ferry service. The main surf beach is about 500m from the wharf in Manly, located at the end of a traffic free open air shopping strip - really gorgeous place to visit. Great shops, cafes, restaurants and the beach is perfect. Must do! My son hired a surf board for $25 for 2 hours from the shop just across the road from the surf beach. He had a great time. Great coffee kept mum happy while he enjoyed the waves!
Great day trip from Syndey. The ferry was quick and easy. I like the shops along the main strip. Check out the food trucks at the beach, the food was excellent.
Sydney beaches. We have been to several beaches but Manly is the best for us. Clean, not too busy, life guards and plenty of food outlets.

Great beach. We came to manly via the ferry service from circular quays,the sun was shining,the beach was very active with people ,surfing and sun bathing,but it was also very clean,we found a lovely spot , and just sun worshipped for a few hours,every thing you would need for such a day is all close by
Beautiful beach. Must visit while in Sydney, you can easily get lost on this amazing little beach. I loved spending time here.

Lovely atmosphere. Caught Ferry to Manly Beach and absolutely loved the feel of the place. Some nice little shops leading up to the beach, which is very clean and full of surfers down one end (Australian Open Surf Championship heat was on that day)
Some good reasonable restaurants and Yogurtland was amazing after a long day on the beach.
Great little place . Lots of shops and cafes available aswell as a huge beach with good waves and sunshine! Nice place to visit for a relaxing day

Manly Beach. Another fabulous experience...even if you are only people watching. Simply stunning place to visit.People are really friendly and when you come off the beach so many restaurants to choose from.

The best in the world. The Northern Beaches of Sydney are some of the cleanest and most beautiful in the world, they are lined with excellent restaurants and are easy to accessed by car or public transport. The surf is great and the people friendly. Enjoy, their a secret !

Manly - city escape. Gorgeous beach - combine with ferry ride from the CBD. Stroll along Manly Corso, cafes and buskers. Swim or lounge in sand; embellish with a beer or two and a meal. Walk to nearby bays or if ignoring the ferry_ a quick drive up the hill from the beach to the Sydney Heads lookout - and a panoramic view west back to the Bridge; coupled with a wonderful expansive sweeping view of the coast south past Bondi to Maroubra
This Beach Kills Bondi. Manly Beach is not only beautiful in its own right, but then it is just a short walk to the Harbour beaches. So you have the best of both worlds - waves and no waves.

always alive!. manly is that wonderful balance of both locals and tourists. it is always alive and buzzing. I will leave my neighbourhood early in the morning before anyone is moving about, and arrive in manly 10 minutes later only to find that it is already in full swing. everyone is out running, surfing, swimming, snorkelling -- it just makes you want to move. it caters to all ages, there is food for all tastes and there is always some added attraction making it the place to be!
Very trendy . Very trendy beach nicer than Bondi and less crowded , many hip and cool cafes stretched there . Lovely for a day out with kids or couples with lots of choices to dine around .

Great Beech for a good swim. A lovely beech with plenty of facilities amazing waves which entice you into the water. Plenty of surfers but for those that like jumping the waves this was the place to do it. Fabulous. Very busy at weekends as it seems everybody from Sydney come here
Very clean beech. Didnt actually swim here but lots of other areas nearby to do so. Very clean and not too busy- lovely setting
Manly Beach. This is a lovely clean beach, with lots of surfers and beach lovers. There is a beach bar and facilities if needed and the shops are opposite. Worth a visit.
Iconic Beach. About 30 minutes outside of Sydney City, Manly Beach rivals Bondi as top beach in New South Wales. Certainly worth a visit when visiting Sydney.
Day tour. Perfect spot, beautiful beach, plenty of shops and places to eat/drink. Would love to make a return trip.
Good Sunday afternoon. Easy access via ferry. Relaxing beach with plenty of walking areas. Good surf side restaurants and shops. Head over for brunch, lunch time on a Sunday and enjoy.
Nice compact beach close to the ferry. We took the government ferry from Sydney Harbor to the lovely town of Manly. Great little beach adjacent to the ferry terminal.
Breakfast and surf. Had a beautiful brunch at a restaurant right on the beach. Then managed to rent a couple boards from a surf shop and had an enjoyable surf!

Great surfing beach. As part of my business trips I stay in manly abs often take advantage of the brilliant beach.
A great surf beach with good restaurants and shops close by but not with the ridiculous number of tourists you get at Bondi

We preferred Manly to Bondi - more going on. We were fortunate to visit Manly beach when there was a rowing boat competition in progress - very exciting watching them battling the waves. Surfing probably not as spectacular as Bondi but still well worth a visit.

A nice beach, but always crowded. Manly beach is beautiful but with all the locals and tourists alike, finding a car spot is almost impossible. Good luck if you go there on a Saturday. While the beach is nice, you end up walking a lot and not be able to find a spot alone on the sand. I rather go to a less crowded and just as beautiful beach.

Lots of visits. The beach is best during the week when most people are at work as its quieter but lovely all week long nonetheless. I've visited both with friends and on my own, its a nice place to chill and there's a pool if you don't fancy a dip in the ocean!

Surfers Paradise. Golden sands stretching for what seemed like miles. Manly Surfing Championship 2016 being held when we visited and lots of spectators as well as competitors training. Beautiful area and several other beaches close by that were more suitable for swimming. Did visit one such beach later on during our visit. (Next to Manly Ferry Port) safe calm waters ideal for relaxing paddle or swim

Lovely beach. Manly is a wonderful place to spend a day for sunbathing, swimming and surfing. The beaches are really gorgeous and much nicer than Bondi especially if you want to avoid the crowds and the noise. There's lots of great places to eat and drink too. Highly recommend!

Beautiful Beach. It is well worth travelling a short distance from Sydney to enjoy this beach. The sea was crystal clear and the beach itself very clean. Although very busy there are plenty of shops to browse through and many restaurants to grab a bite to eat.

Just the place to be on a balmy night. Had a great early dinner at Hugo's then strolled down to Manly beach. Surf Carnival atmosphere, lots of people, gentle summer breeze and the sound and smell of misty surf. Just needed to think back to those heady days of the 70's sitting on the beach, with the Exacto windcheater pulled down over the knees, sunkissed face and the touch of sunburn keeping you comfortably warm. Salty hair and sand between the toes. Yum! I felt like a teenager again.

Great Place. What a great place this is. I enjoyed this day looking around Manly the ferry ride over and the great feeling on Manly beach.It looked very clean and inviting but did not bring my bathers. Has great pubs to have lunch or fish and chips on the beach.

Wave actions amazing. This is a must for several reasons. The beach is beautiful. There are surfers and the waves do a crazy dance. When the out going wave, (The tow is so strong it makes a small out going wave) meets the incoming wave it makes a rooster tail water spray all the way down the beach. Don't plan on swimming, the under current and rips and deep holes make it great for surfers but not swimming. The food in the area is great. There is a great fairy ride from Central Quay and a short walk. Steps going down to beach. Australia is not friendly for those with disabilities.

Wonderful Beach. We went on a lovely day by ferry. Rented chairs and an umbrella. They have change rooms available for you. The water temperature was great and the waves nice. Water was lovely and clean. Later on in the day people were only allowed to swim in the guarded beach area. My husband was able to play in the waves there. When it was time to go home, we walked back to the ferry and had a nice ride home. Couldn't believe the lovely beach so close to Sydney.

Lovely beach and atmosphere. Really enjoyed our day trip to Manly beach on the ferry from Circular Quay. We arrived a few days after a large surfing competition had taken place and some dismantling of stages etc was happening. None the less we thought it was a lovely place to visit and are going back there today with our swimming gear! Beaches were clean and tidy with lots of shops set back along the roads leading up to the sea. Fish and chips were recommended to us by friends who had visited prior and we can whole heartedly do the same!

Great Beach. Arrived mid-morning on a Sunday in time to watch the Surf Rescue Boat Racing which highly entertaining. Beach Patrol much in evidence and not slow at reminding people going into the water that a shark had been sighted that morning. Good size shopping area with many cafes and plenty of walking for the more energetic

Beautiful place. I must admit that I had never heard of Manly before our Sydney visit but having made the trip here I was not disappointed. The beach was beautiful and very well looked after. Safety was obviously a big concern I have never seen so many lifeguards on one beach before. Weather was really hot whilst we were there and I got quite burnt! Nearby shops and restaurants were also a delight very well maintained and a very nice walk through the main street back to the ferry through a pedestrianized walk way full of fountains and water features.

A lovely place to watch the surf roll in. We caught Captain Cooks cruises late in the afternoon. On arrival at the terminal in Manly, we decided to have a Chinese massage to relieve our aching joints. Well worth the cost. We then walked along the pedestrianised shopping street to the beach. Daylight was coming to an end, but we had a lovely visit.

Manly Beach. This is a venue that has everything you could wish for. Big breaking waves, perfectly clean and plenty of places to go for a quick bite to eat or drink just across the road. This is not only a place that is popular for tourists but also for the locals many of whom live on site so to speak.Stay here long enough and you will witness many sporting competitions on the sea front with some world class performances from Kite surfing, Rowing Boats, Surfing, Swimming and the like. This is a trendy place to be seen and to be. Definitely not to be missed.

Lovely beach with all utilities nearby, fabulous. One of the best beaches if you want variety of choice. You can sunbathe or surf then pop across the footpath and road to many restaurants and fast food outlets. Anything you need is available. Love it have been many many times. There are quieter beaches nearby but none so convenient

Best beach. We spent a fabulous day at Manly beach having traveled there by ferry from Darling Harbour. The weather was brilliant and the beach amazing. The sea and surf were just the best. Bondi has the fame but for us Manly was far better.Everyone we came in contact with was just so friendly and welcoming. What more could one ask for.A great memory. Thank you Manly

Lots to do. Wonderful and exciting beach area. There was a surf competition, a skate board bowl completion, a fitness competition....and the GoPro set ups were very interesting. We had the best pizza we have ever eaten! Shops all around with many varieties offered. Restaurants all around. Water and beach was clean.

If only . If only the sun would shine like this on the North Coast! (Northern Ireland) Sea to swim and surf in.Sand warm/hot and golden!With sunshine!!!!! Easy access from the ferry and to the local shops cafes restaurants etc. Lifeguards on location. Public announcement service giving warning and advice! Brilliant.

Better than Bondi!. Bondi Beach may be iconic but in my opinion Manly beach beats it hands down! The white sand and blue sea is like a magnet to visitors and can be easily reached via a very pleasant ferry ride (which runs hourly) if you do not want to go the long way round. There is a wide selection of shops and cafes along the sea front which is paved with plenty of seating, shady areas, toilets, and drinking fountains.
great day ou. Spent a day here. great promenade restaurants and beach, not over crowded like Bondi. Great family day out.
Nice beach. I couldn't get too excited as it's only and people seem to get excited because of the name. It's large and sandy and wasn't too busy when we visited
Sunshine City. The beach was awesome. People were very friendly. The shopping was excellent. A great place to spend the day. Easy access by ferry.
Sardines. Unfortunately we visited this beach on a very very busy weekend it was so busy we were packed like sardines. Make sure you visit during the week if you can

Beautiful beach and area. Taking the ferry to Manly is just one of those things you have to do when you are in Sydney. The walk from the ferry dock to the beach isn't so great (lots of uninspiring shops and eateries) but its worth it when you get to the beach. There is a nice walk along the cliff to Shelly beach that offers wonderful views looking back at Manly.

Clean and impressive!. The first thing you notice is how clean the beach is. The day we visited was the start of a school beach/surf competition. Almost every section of the beach was being used! A great way to engage in the Australian beach lifestyle.
Fabulous beach. What a wonderful experience to visit Manly beach! Gorgeous place with lots of people enjoying themselves.
Preferred over Bondi. Bondi is more touristy but this beach although it has its tourists its a nice beach with shops on esplanade ,take ferry at most time to manly and in nearly a hour you are there
Lovely Beach. Do you want to run away from the hassle and bustle of the city? Then, go to Manly Beach. This beautiful long beach is surrounded the cases, bars ans restaurants.

Nice long beach for leisurely activities. Bustling place with lots of activities for all ages. A bit busy though with lots of people around. The views from north head it just awesome during the sunset. Definitely a place to go if you like long walk / hiking. Its a scenic walk throughout the trail.

Nice beach . Soft sand good waves, cant ask for more. Good choice of restaurants nearby which are reasonably priced. Plenty of beachside playgrounds for the kids. The only two issues i had was the beach seemed to be closed for swimming every time we went (aka swim at your own risk) and the stormwater pipes run right into the beach. Not much of an issue when its not raining though. All up a great beach for the kids and grown up alike.

Less Swimming, More Surfing and Sunbathing, and People Watching.. You can catch a ferry to Manly, which is just 45-minutes and offers beautiful views of Sydney Harbor. I think the land-bus or car will take much longer. With this in mind, do not take the last ferry out of Manly! If you leave by ferry, try an hour or more before the last one. Hundreds of people try to leave at the same time.Anyway, Manly beach is a long, sweeping beach, with swimming allowed near the south end. Most of the middle is dominated by constant waves, swells, surfers, and life guards whistling--if you hear the whistle near you, and you're swimming, you know you need to stop. Most people who aren't surfing, just wade into the water to cool off. There is a lot of beach to lay upon. Restrooms for changing are here and there, but quite visible along the sidewalks. I have to say, eye-candy is abound here. I'd assume, many people come here to: Show off a beach body, surf, and sunbathe in that order.There are Blue Bottles, or man-of-war jellyfish. They aren't the kings of the stinging world, but they still hurt. So be aware of them, as they really can be quite huge. As a courtesy to others, it might be best to bury them under the sand so others don't trample them. At night, the waves will carry them back out to sea. The Corso nearby will provide you with all the food and drinks you'll need. Along with some interesting entertainment. The Valentine's Day I visited, there was a three-member boy band, literally in their early teens, like eleven-teen, singing songs from the 70s and 80s, because, you know, all kids like songs made twenty years before they were born. And they were quite good.Anyhow, the protected side of Manly has a beach near the ferries which is better suited for swimming, smaller waves, etc. So that's also an option nearby, but you'll miss out on--the beach bodies, the surfing, but you can still get the sun-bathing down.

crowded, hip, expensive. I liked the atmosphere, the beaches and the waves in generall. You have to come early in the morning, the beach fills up quick and seems crowded specially on weekends. What I did not liked is the fact that the beach is very big, but for just going in the water and do some body surfing, the life guards give you only a few very tiny spots in the water, which is so overcrowded that it is even dangerous, becaus the board surfers have to be at the same spot. On the other side most of the beach is for the "real" surfers even for the most unexperienced ones.But said that, the trip with the ferry is great fun, there are plenty of hikes around, lots of shopping and eating.

Manly 1000miles from care!. Manly is for everybody. Beach, walks, shopping, dining, nature. Catch the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay. So much to do and all within walking distance. Tidal pools from Queens Cliff, Esplanade, Corso shopping & music, surf, swim, beach volleyball, walks to Shelley Beach, meals, drinks, the natural beauty of North Head and spectacular view of the harbour and Sydney CBD, back to the ferry wharf for drinks and food and catch the ferry back to Sydney. Manly my home town for the first 6 months in Oz.

Good beach resort for a day out.. Manly is an easy and cheap ferry ride from Circular Quay. The town is very touristy with reasonably priced bars and restaurants and a good range of shops. You get off the ferry and walk along the main shopping street to get to the lovely beach. I think Manly is a nicer place to visit than Bondi and we go here if time is limited but you want a beach day. It's a lovely little place.

Beach Fun. We went to Manly on a Sunday. If you love crowds and activity at every turn then Sunday is the day to go. Lots to see and do. We walked along the path to Shelly Beach which was more of a family beach. All very fun and high energy, great place to people watch.

Go here instead of Bondi Beach. This was a beautiful beach with a relaxed atmosphere. We've been to Bondi and Manly and I will always choose Manly beach! Lots of shops and restaurants to pick from. There are 4 public parking lots that offer free parking for 2 hours each within a few blocks.

Golden strip of heaven. After the trip from Sydney and a short walk it's like walking into another country. A beautiful long beach that didn't feel crowded at all. The sea was a little dangerous the day we went so swimming was to be taken with care.
Manly Beach. Take a ferry from the Circular Quay and spend a day at Manly Beach. Lot of places to eat and shop and the beach is very nice

A must visit when in Sydney.. A short ferry ride (30 minutes on the slow ferry, or 20 minutes on the fast ferry), followed by a 5 minute walk, Manly Beach is well worth a visit when visiting Sydney. With a long golden sandy beach, it's far larger than Bondi. There's several bars and restaurants along the promenade, on the corso (the pedestrianised street between the wharf and the beach) and at the wharf.Tip - the Spit to/from Manly walk is worth considering if you enjoy a bit of bush walking.Tip - sundown drinks at Wharf Bar highly recommended for enjoying the sunset.
Great beach. Very family-friendly, clean, nice beach. So, what to compare it to? Nothing. It's very unique, just a great Australian beach, and charming little town. Go.
Beautiful. Clear water, Sandy white beach. A little crowded but worth visiting. Just a short ferry ride and a short walk and you will be transported to another world of sun, surf and sand!!

Lovely beach and surroundings. Visited here whilst in Sydney and glad we did. Caught the Manly ferry over, which is a must as it is excellent value, and walked over to the beach. The beach itself is clean and facilities are available. There are loads of nice places to have lunch or get a drink. The sea can be a little rough, after all it is the Pacific, and with strong undercurrents the lifeguards are very wary. On weekends it does get very very busy so if you go on a Sat/Sun get there early!
Beyond Heaven!. Manly is beyond heaven. Be it beach or the walk from the beach in the narrow lanes or the food joints there. Never seen more lovely place than this.
Nice beach . Very good for a swim and a day out. Nice restaurants. Excellent options for shopping souvenirs.This beach and the whole experience is highly recommended.

Better than Bondi. Less crowded than Bondi, fewer tourists and more accessible restaurants and shops. What's Nwot to like. The ferry is also a far more efficient way to get to the beach than the bus or bus and train combo to Bondi.
A wonderful beach. A wonderful beach to visit in Sydney but if you only have time to visit one beach in Sydney I would recommend visiting Bondi!
Great beach experience. Catching the ferry from circular quay is all part of the experience. Once you arrive the beach is beautiful and there are plenty of eating options nearby. Great day out.

Full of things to do!. I love Manly Beach for its variation in activity. You can go around to shop, tons of good seafood restaurants are located here. Even you can rent a bike and go around Manly which is a very great way to explore the other sides of Manly. However, it will be crowded of students during February and March to go here. Be careful of the tides, shellfish underneath of sands also.
Beautiful. First time going to Manly on 27/2/16, first day of the Australian Open of Surfing, great surf and sand. Travelling back this weekend!

Great Beach and beautiful views!. Manly beach is beautiful. Perfect place to relax and enjoy the sun. The views are fabulous and there is plenty to do while you are there. Lots of venues to eat, shop, and relax. They were preparing for a surfing competition while I was there. Waves were pretty good too (and I do not surf). Watched the sunset and it was absolutely breathtaking. Would definitely recommend. I had a great time at Manly Beach. Take the Ferry over, it only takes 18 mins.

Must see in Sydney. The whole Manly area was very cozy and beautiful. The beach was much less crowded and touristy as for example Bondi Beach. The Beach itself is wide so there is enough spots for everyone. My favorite beach in Sydney :)

Cold and wet ..... My wife and I were enjoying our first full day in Sydney as part of our tour of Australia. After a morning of sightseeing we decided purely on impulse to jump on the ferry to Manly from Circular Quay. The morning had been fine, sunny and 25 degrees. Unfortunately as we arrived in Manly the weather started to turn for the worse and it became windy and overcast. Nonetheless we made for the beach, which was very impressive, and paddled briefly in the cold sea. We checked out some of the shops and called in for a drink in a bar on the sea front where it was very busy, it was late Saturday afternoon. By now rain had set in, the temperature dropped considerably and it became very cold (it was as though we had been transported home to London). We decided to head back to our hotel in Sydney so sadly we were unable to make the most of our time in Manly or its beach.

This is my favorite beach. Manly Beach is great. First the beach has all you want in a beach, lots of sand but also rocks to climb on and explore tide pools etc. There are fish swimming around the people, that is kinda cool. But the real great thing about Manley beach it the walk to the beach from the ferry to and from down town. IT is a 2 block walk lined by stores with anything you would want, including 2 Coles. You can buy all you need for a picnic on the beach at a reasonable price or spurge and enjoy the many good restaurants. I cannot think of a better beach anywhere in the world.

A highlight of a visit to Sydney. We visited Manley beach on a Sunday and were impressed by how many locals were using the beach in organised sports activities. It's no wonder Australia excels at sports when they put so much passion in from such a young age. It was lovely to see families enjoying the beach and surrounding town. It was busy, but not crowded and all very relaxed and chilled. Great day out and only a short ferry ride from Sydney.

Best City Beach I have seen. Manly beach is famous for a reason, it's an upmarket inner-city beach with a high quality 'kiss-me-quick' feel to it. If you are like me, you will have been lucky enough to drive down the South Coast to find your own personal beach, but you must not compare. Considering this beach is in a city, it is fantastically well cared for and everyone behaved remarkably well. Compared to UK seaside towns I would say it is less tacky and not quite as outrageously expensive to wine and dine around. If you are staying south of the harbour, I certainly recommend taking a ferry.

Best beach in Sydney and one of my favorites ever!. Manly Beach is absolutely 100% worth the ferry ride from Sydney CBD as it is simply stunning. The Bondi to Coogee coastal walk is beautiful but those two main beaches were far too packed and even the smaller ones in between had a lot of visitors. Manly is beautiful with great views, great waves, and an overall wonderful vibe with lots of shops and restaurants along the Manly Corso (like a boardwalk/pedestrian mall) and nearby. We went to Manly Surf School (highly recommend!!) our first day and then surfed again with rentals the second day. The waters at Bondi or Coogee would have been way too packed to surf and Manly was just perfect all around.It is hands-down my favorite beach in Sydney and is also one of my all-time favorite beaches ever. Would absolutely recommend this for your swimming/surfing/beach day in Sydney!

Crowded beach with private pockets. Headed to Manly Beach on a summer's Sunday and it was crowded! Good atmosphere, just too bad we were not equipped for the beach. Took a stroll through and found many benches and pockets were the sea could be accessed by the more cliffy areas, which were more private.

A worthwhile stop while in Sydney. I had the opportunity to visit Manly during a work trip in August and would go back in a heartbeat. I caught the ferry from Circular Quay which was a great experience and allows you to see the city from a very different perspective.I spent the day at Manly, walking up and down the shoreline at the beach and stopping at shops along the pedestrian outdoor mall that connects the ferry drop off point to the beaches. I also stopped in at a very charming cafe for a four course meal that was absolutely phenomenal.

Incredible!!. Our hotel Concierige recommended Manly Beach over Bondi Beach. Beach wasn't crowded, had no problem renting chairs/umbrella. Breathtaking views and watching the surfers was very entertaining. So clean, huge waves. A perfect day!

Don't miss this beach. A great beach with tall pine trees, a lot of places to have a quick bite, bars, cafes and shops selling souvenirs. We took the fast ferry from Circular Quay using the travel card. The sea was calm and hence the ferry ride was smooth. We then took a bus and went around. Came back had coffee. Took a walk down the promenade. Overall a great trip and enjoyed the day.
Favorite with locals. Forget Bondi this is the beach to go to on a hot sunny weekend. Good amenities in terms of hiring beach furniture and an excellent choice of eateries and coffee houses.

Popular beach. We visited Manly Beach after catching the ferry from the Rocks. The beach was clean and being well used by locals and tourists alike.There is also a lot of nearby shops and cafes to take advantage of break. Its a pretty typical Australian beach and definitely worth a ferry ride from Sydney harbour for a look.

Showing overseas visitors around. Caught the 8am Sun ferry from circular quay. Thought I would show my friends Manly before it got busy !Strewth !! We had arrived on the day of the beach carnival, so we were rewarded with a spectacular experience which our visitors absolutely loved.We all loved Manly for its vibrancy and dining choices.I think its a "must see" for Sydney visitors
A day well spent. We took the Manly ferry from circular quay . A short walk from the ferry to the beach. It's straight down. Some good shopping on the way. Great restaurants as well.

Amazing beech. Lovely beech.. Natural little village setting... Sea was very rough and there was a ban on swimming you could only do so at the southern end of the beech but understandable as it was soooo rough!! Really clean beech... No smoking zone... We came here on the hottest day of the year in Sydney for nearly 150 years and went home looking like we had! I would recommend this place !
All ages can have fun. You wont be disappointed. Food for all budgets and lots of souvenir shopping places. Beach is great with lots of lifeguards
First Time Visit. For first time visit, before going North to Queensland, come here for a prelude is not a bad idea. Now is late summer at Sydney, come and enjoy the good weather.
Lush. Fab beach with a lovely walkway! Got here during the week which was fab as not many people about! Great selection of bars and cafes
Too Touristy. After the ferry ride over which was peaceful, the manly beach area seems pretty commercial, we found a decent place for lunch near the water, but not much else.

Surfer's dream. We stopped by Manly for a quick day trip while visiting Sydney and I'm glad we made time to go there. We walked over to the beach and it was definitely less crowded than some of the other beaches in Sydney. There were plenty of space on the beach so just pick a spot and relax. The waves at this beach were huge and there were plenty of surfers. Just be cautious because the surf is very strong there and you will be dragged out if you are not careful. There is surf rescue all along the beach just in case something happens.

A Quality Resort. A truly exceptional tourist destination.We spent the day walking around, seeing the sights, sampling the food and soaking up the sun, (possibly a little too much of the sun).Every visitor to Sydney must take the time to visit and enjoy Manly.We will return.

The best beach in Sydney!. Manly is a great beach town. The Corso is packed with shops and has the best prices on souvenirs. Take the Manly Fast Ferry from Circular Quay to get to Manly. Walking from the Corso to the left stop at Hemmingway's for a lunch or coffee/beer. Very friendly staff. Walking right from the Corso go all the way to the end.....a great walk through a nature area to Surrey Beach and have lunch at the Boathouse. I got these tips from a local I met on the ferrry and they were spot on. Talk to people in Sydney..they are pretty friendly..even to Americans:)

Take the ferry to Manly for a wonderful day trip!. Ferry ride is beautiful way to see Sydney Harbor. Manly is a cool place with golden beach and tall conifer trees! Take the walk down to Shelly Beach and take a dip in the shallow waters. Great outing for couples and families!

Lovely!!. Got the ferry over to manly beach, sorry to say we couldn't have picked a worse day, thunder and lightning. Manly beach was lovely, (it did dry up for an hour), on a good day I could honestly say I could of stayed there all day. We seen the whales right out in front of us (a bit away) but it really was lovely to say we seen them jumping out of the water.
Lovely beach. Manly is a much bigger town than people think and it has a lovely long beach with promenade walk. There is plenty of shops and eating houses within easy reach
Beautiful beach. A lovely beach, easily reached by a ferry ride and short walk from Circular Quay. Good selection of bars and restaurants.

Great beach to walk, swim and surf.. We really enjoyed this part of Sydney the best. Large beach, great walking area with cafes along the way and just overall really nice. I liked it better than Bondi.Surfing was great too as the water was perfect. In the middle, current was strong so stay more on the sides with smaller kids.
Great vibe. Nice beachGreat feelObvious mix of locals and overseas visitors in a laid back atmosphereHeritage feel about the place with the older architecture

A nice beach, but there are better ones close by if you prefer swimming to surfing. This is one of those places everyone says you have to go in Sydney. Sure it's a nice beach but it tends to be busy and it's more for surfers than swimmers - prepare to battle waves if you do go for a swim. We've found much nicer beaches for swimming like Shelley beach which is just 10mins walk from Manly beach.

Rhyl but not as you'd notice!. Good stretch of clean sand well patrolled by lifeguards. Our visit coincided with an unwelcome visit from dozens of stingy jellyfish which was unusual so we were told. Loads of eateries and a pleasant promenade area. Very busy at the weekends.
Great.... Loved manly beach and the surrounding area leading to the very clean beach...one tip dont get the sunbeds very extortionate...have fun

Beautiful Beach but can get a little crowded on the weekends.. Our family really enjoys visiting this beach but can get a little crowded. Also watch out for the blue bottles at certain times of the year and when the winds are strong. They can give a nasty sting.
Excellent. Far more impressive than the more famous Bondi. Leave the ferry then walk through the shops to the wide open space of Manly Beach. Plenty of room and lots of places to eat and drink.

Go swimming and shopping . We went there too go swimming and shopping and we did we didnt swim on the beach the waves were ruff but swimming in harbor we did 2 separte times 1 time it was little ruff and alot blue bottles the second time it was calm and no blue bottles at all the shopping is great and we ate the this place hugos serve pizza and had some drinks great place right of the pier next too the harbor we did see the beach of Manley beach lots of surfers nice beach lots of people !!

Great beach - go to Manly by ferry, don't drive.. Manly Beach was on the list of places to see when my uncle showed me around on my first visit to Sydney in 2001. With the ferry from Circular Quay and the beach it really is world class as a day out. I now live in Sydney on the North Shore and Manly is a bit of a nightmare as the only way to get there is to drive. Parking spaces and prices are a nightmare - on a sunny weekend, finding a parking space is a major challenge and can easily cost $20 for a couple of hours. If you are visiting Sydney and can get to Manly via the ferry, do it - absolutely. It is up there with Star Ferry and Staten Island Ferry as cheap public transport accessing stunning places. If you've hired a car, leave it at the house/hotel and get the ferry. Loads of places to eat and drink. I'd recommend the 4 Pines Brewery for both. Other end of the "Corso" from the beach, but great beer and food, with a less touristy feel than some places near the beach.

greatly overrated!. While it may be a great ferry ride to Manly, that is about all! As far as Australia's best beaches, in my eyes it doesn't even score. Qld and WA's beaches everywhere are better and Manly is full of tourists. It has a storm water drain, the sand is not white and pristine and it is crowded and full of hotels, apartments and tourist shops, Maybe you need to categorize your titles for voting better!!!

Family day out . Manly beach has so much to offer whether you are looking for a nice place to stay eat or a place to take the kids....my kids love speding the day at manly.....one of the nicest beaches in Sydney
Buzzing. Lovley beaches and a great "Fun" area.The Bars and restaurants on the Quay are a must visit to experience everything that is Manly
Great day trip from Sydney. Easy ferry ride from Circular Quay. Beautiful beach...great surfing!!! Lots of shopping and food just a block away.

one of my favourite places in the world. I just love going to Manly beach. I am never disappointed. There are some changes, the showers at the beach seem to have disappeared and the ladies loos now leave a lot to be desired, quite smelly and neglected and not a good place to change out of beach gear. The beach is still lovely and the swimming great although the sea was rougher than I've ever seen it.

Wow!. What a great trip to a beach! Hop on the fast Manly Ferry $8.50 each way, and in 25 min you are at the quaint village of Manly. Beach is beautiful and clean. Life guards on duty, beach chairs and umbrellas for rent. Great selection of restaurants, great for singles, couples or families .

Chilled and just a great place. Catch the ferry from Circular key and head to Manly Beach. Great Surfing, nice bars and restaurants are waiting. Walk along the coast and have lunch in the Boathouse its just great.

Our favourite beach in Sydney. Manly Beach, what can we not love about it. We believe it is one of the top city beaches in the world. Along its shores you will find many cafes and restaurants. It is a surfers paradise.

Fabulous vibe and a great ferry ride from Circular Quay. Having visited Bondi before everyone said we should try Manly and we had a really great day there. They were hosting a life guarding competition there and the near end of the beaches was full of competitors, lots of gazebo's up full of people having either competing or supporting. It was great to walk the length of the beach in the surf to the quieter end, then walk back on the beachside road stopping at a restaurant for some calamari and a salad. A fabulous and wide beach with big waves and plenty of surfers, not a place for a sedate swim!

I was disappointed.... I had always heard that Australian beaches were so lovely but this was just average.
