Perhaps we are spoiled from being close to the beautiful Caribbean beaches but this looked sort of like the Jersey shore. There is shopping and cafes nearby, I can see it would be a very touristy area in high season.

Fun for Everyone. Manly beach is a great place to be on a summers day. The beach is well patrolled by lifesavers, and you can choose from a quiet bay with little waves like Shelly beach or surf the waves on Manly beach. The area is reasonably flat, so is great for going for walks along the beachfront, or shopping on the mall, 'The Corso', lots of restaurants and cafes to choose from day and night.

Great beach!. Beaches in Australia just have to be done, so instead of Bondi, check out the less busy but still buzzing Manly! Beach front life, amazing cafes and restaurants, incredible beach, particular in the summer!

Top pick for best of Sydney beaches. Beautiful beach and easily accessible via Sydney a ferry. This beach is a top tourist attraction so it's a very busy place. Don't bother driving because most of the time you will struggle to find a park.

A great beach with lots of actions. This is a beautiful beach full of actions. Beautiful clean white sand and warm blue water. Need to have lots of sun block - the sun is extra strong. There is a lovely restaurant right on the beach, and I enjoyed a most delicious meal while enjoying the breezes.

Busy, busy, busy. Crowds day and night, restaurants crowded, some good seafood to be had. A nice super market right there. Didn't sit on the sand but was quite happy overlooking the beach from the comfort of a restaurant.

Best for coastal walk. I love the place. You get to enjoy the view. Very relaxing and laid back. i would love to visit the place and try surfing or snorkeling. Too bad I wasnt ready for any water sports activity when I visited Australia last week!

Quite touristy but I can see why surfers like it. Like every beach I've been to around Sydney, it looks fantastic... white sand, blue waters. But the issue is, there are currents, big waves and sometimes jellyfish.The lifeguards will keep an eye out and tell you where to swim and what to watch out for but it's not very relaxing. You HAVE to be a strong swimmer. And don't bother if you don't like waves; most of your time in the water will be spent fighting them anyway. Good thing is, there is more than enough space for anyone as it's HUGE!
Great beach. A beach that's very busy on weekends but you still can enjoy your own space! People were very friendly!

One of the best in Sydney. The Manly Beach is one of the best and most popular in Sydney. Easy to get to by ferry and a short walk. Lots of places to eat around it too. It's always pretty busy though so some people may not like that.

you have to go there for an afternoon. Big nice clean well guarded beach for swimming and surfing. I Loved the ferry over and back and the walk through the little town got an aboriginal painting. Rented a surfboard and surfed.

Stunning. Well, this is my birthplace so I can tell you that it is absolutely beautiful. A 2 kilometre stretch of sand with tall pine trees all along the Esplanade. In the mornings and evenings the pines are full of rainbow lorikeets (very colourful, noisy little bird...for our international visitors)Great surf on the right days. Very busy at the shops and cafes at the Southern end in Summer. Divine in Winter as you stroll in the warm sunshine. Wander (or run if you prefer) North to Queenscliff or head along the coastal path to cute and gorgeous Shelly Beach...Good for snorkelling, diving, swimming, surfing, relaxing, walking the bush trails, cafes.

Beautiful and busy!. A sunny summer Sunday and obviously busy, but still room to sit on the beach and swim between the flags.Immaculately clean sand and sea.Cycling along the path was a little chaotic with people everywhere but it just added to the sense of fun
Nice beach town. Very nice beach town and the beach itself was beautiful. Lots of shops and restaurants and souvenir shops. Could easily spend a family beach vacation there
Relaxing. Its the most relaxing place to sit on a beach. the shopping area is also very good with bars and eatery's. The surf here is very good and the beach is life guard manned.

Love the beaches! . I grew up here and by far it is the best place other than north curl curl in sydney! Has a great atmosphere, no city smells or sounds, the people are so relaxed and everyone just seems to be on the same wave length

worth the trip from Sydney. The main Manly beach has heavy surf making it ok for waist deep bathing but not for swimming. If you fancy a swim try the smaller beach on the harbour side of town next to the ferry.

Great way to enjoy a summer's day!. If you want a laidback day at the beach, Manly is ideal. With shops, bars and restaurants nearby you won't feel too out of touch if you need to make a run for sunscreen or a drink after being in the sun too long! Beach is clean and not too crowded, but be aware of the blue bottles if you've never encountered one...you can spot them washed up on the beach or floating by the in the water and they can really sting. If you're not a surfer, join the crowd getting washed by waves and then dry off on the toasty beach and people watch.

Very good beach but no access consideration for disabled ,wheelchairs or pushchairs. Very disappointed to arrive here at the end of the Corso to find only steps down to beach no ramp. Was told there is a ramp at very far end, as far away as possible from main road to beach, which looked to be in the water when we were there. How come this so poor here when most others like Bondi have rampS .

Great Beach. Enjoyed a lovely day over at Manly. Take the ferry over from Circular Quay it's worth the journey. Just$2.50 on a Sunday so it was busy so best to go early. On the way back you'll get great views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge so ride up front. Great places to eat around town and lovely big beach with lifeguards all around so you'll feel safe. Big waves here to take a surf with the many others, I prefer to sit on the beach with good book and watch the surfers out on the ocean. Great day out from the city!

Fantastic Beach. This is the best beach I have ever been to, very long and sandy with areas just for swimming and areas for surfing. The beach has a grassy area to the rear and a cycle path running the full length, parallel to this is a road and cafes, bars and restaurants. There's is lots of stuff happening along the beach front, I had a surfing lesson here and it was great.

Good But Not The Best. Had the delightful pleasure of a pretty chocker ferry ride over to manly (only $2.50 on a Sunday with your nifty Opal card). Manly beach was nice, there is very little to complain about. However when compared to the better Freshwater Bay, just moments around the corner it has to lose points.Again not a bad option but would recommend Freshwater over Manly if you can muster up the energy to go. Cool water, golden sand and slightly sheltered. Living the dream!A very respectable 3.406/5 for Manly nonetheless.

Coast walk and fish & chips. A must not miss place - a ferry ride to remember followed by a brilliant clifftop walk a swim in the waves and a filling excellent tray of fish and chips and beer what else can one ask for.
Take the Ferry. Arriving by ferry allows for amazing views of the harbour during the short crossing. The beach is popular so recommend going early. Many beach shops and restaurants available too.

Wish I could have stayed Longerrrrrrrrrrrr.. We took the ferry from the Quay to Manly Beach. It is very different from Bondi. It cateers to a wider age range. There are well kept walking promonades and tree lined streets. It is handicapped accessible. The walk out to the point is peaceful, beautiful with many benches on which to rest or view, metal sculptures of earth and water creatures. What a lovely day in the park. Walk all the way to the point and you find a protected beach of warm water, shell beach, walks in the wooded area, an outdoor café and lots of water fountains along the way. This will be one of my favorite remembrances.
Simply beautiful . Throughly enjoyed an afternoon here one of my favourite places. And just a short boat trip from the hustle and bustle of Sydney.
Good day.. The ferry trip down the harbour is nice and then lots of places for lunch in Manly. Cool off in the clean water and have a surf. A good day in Sydney.
Touristy beach. Manly is a very popular beach. I think Manly is too touristy though. It can get really crowded especially during summer. It has a lot of nice shops though.
Great place. A great place. But watch out - most of the restaurant kitchens close at 9 pm, so head for dinner earlier.

Beautiful beach. Went to Manly Beach instead of Bondi to avoid the tourist hype. This beach is a quick ferry ride from Sydney Harbour. Seemed like more locals than tourists here. Nice restaurants, bars, beachwear stores, and other shops. Very relaxing. Watched some people surfing and enjoyed the breeze.
a must go. its a wow factor of a beach, white sands blue sea, just off the beach is the shops with restaurants on both sides of the street

Catching a ferry to Manly is quintessential Sydney. Catching a ferry to Manly is quintessential Sydney. Plan this for a sunny day and depart from Circular Quay. When you arrive in Manly, after a sensational harbour ferry ride, walk down The Corso to Manly Beach. Plenty of cafes there for a coffee and also a stroll along the shared path on the beach. I recommend this highly to all our international guests.

great beach and area!. Manly Beach is a really beautiful beach which while popular is not overly tourist-y. The beach is large, and is close to another smaller beach only a 10-15min walk away. There are many lovely places to eat nearby, and the very short walk across from the Ferry Wharf to the Beach is super lovely.

An average Sydney beach with access to great snorkeling. Manly Beach is regarded as one of Sydney's best beaches. However, it is as far as I am concerned about an average Sydney beach. However, Shelley Beach around the corner provides some of the best snorkelling in Sydney.

Magnificent, multicultural marvellous Manly.. Surfers, ferries, beach, bars and first class restaurants. That's what you get when you visit iconic Manly Beach. Acres of sand and tremendous azure blue water with a view to simply swoon over. What more could anyone ask for? Manly has everything. Take a ferry from here or swim all afternoon or even eat at one of the fabulous restaurants. You can't make a mistake here. Just do it.
Great area, nice beach. Went here for surfing, but the waves were not great. The beach is really nice though and so is the walking area to the ferry terminal

Paradise. Choose the Harbour side to swim, relax and eat, or choose the Ocean end to swim, relax, and eat, Manly has it all! Choose from 30 different food locations for all budgets, and all kinds of food offerings. And on a hot day, the beers overlooking the Harbour as you watch the boats come in are oh so sweet...........

Big, BIG, beach! Very popular in high summer.. Lovely deep and wide beach with plenty of room for all, drinking stations (water of course!), eight beach volleyball courts, lifeguard swimming zone, surf zone, promenade with shady areas, etc, etc.Bondi gets packed daily - Manly was a busy town in mid summer, but the beach didn't seem overly busy - it must be a hundred metres deep (at least) and maybe four kilometres long so there's plenty of space for everyone!It also seems safe: people were leaving their belongings on the sand and then jogging or showering (fresh water showers to rinse off the sand and salt) or paddling or whatever else they wanted to do, and they seemed very relaxed about the safety of their items. Good to see!!Would I go back? Oh yes!

Iconic Sydeny Beach. Manly is a great beach for couples, friends or families from Queenscliff in the north to South Styne at the southern end of the beach there are plenty of places to have a swim, sunbake and enjoy the sunshine. There are plenty of cafes and a couple of pubs opposite the beach. take a walk from Manly beach to Shelley Beach which is a much quiter, sheltered spot for a swim and pinic. There is anew cafe there where you can eat and get takeaway coffee. quite easy to spend a day exploring all Manly Beach has to offer

Boring. I think Sydney and the greater are has so many nicer beaches even some labour beaches are better. WE have so many nice water ways I really don't get why Manly favoured. Over crowded and dull people
Sydney. Purely gorgeous sun and sand and water cant think of a better way to unwind and relax soak up the sun and chill out

Good Surf and Sand. We took the ferry to Manly and walked 10-15 minutes to the beach. It a an attractive stretch of sand with good waves for surfing, which was going on along with a competition for lifeboat crews. Great fun, although serious business. One crew member was hurt when her boat capsized. Excellent people watching.

I think Manly Beach is living from old glory days.. Seriously nothing special here, the name brings people to see the surf and lots of bars, restaurants, nothing out of the usual, no exclusive or you must visit, so if you are short in time don't bother to spend time there.

Lovely beach. It is a big beach ,it is one of the most popular as Manly is a holiday place ,full of shops and restaurants, but it is clean and safe and most of all easy to reach especially for turists coming with the ferry from Sydney .Not my favourite as I prefer to drive north ,but good for everyone who wants to swim and surf and be watched by the great lifeguards .The nices thing to do is walk along the footpath that takes you right to the end of the beach to a smaller one called Shelley Beach where children love to swim .

Another beautiful and easily accessible beach in Sydney.. I was lucky enough to go to Manly twice. The first time I went to Shelly beach which had no waves but was perfect for beginning and intermediate swimming plus you could snorkel there and see plenty of fish.

Very relaxing and not too busy. We went to the beach at Manley today and despite the ferry over being really busy the beach wasn't actually that bad. It is a pretty long beach so everyone is quite spread out. We paid $10 each to rent a sun bed for three hours, which we didn't think was too bad, but if you are organised you could take your own towel and just find an empty spot to lie down, of which there are plenty. You could also hire towels, deck chairs and other beach equipment. We just wanted to relax and enjoy the sunshine for a couple of hours, but there is plenty to do out there should you wish. There were people surfing, body boarding, swimming, playing beach volleyball, table tennis and skittles.There is a 'safe' swimming area, which the life guards keep a watch on, but you can go elsewhere if you are confident. The lifeguards do tannoy the beach occasionally to remind people outside the safe area that the under current is strong and to move back in unless they are confident surfers.The beach is really clean and they have litter wardens, who I presume make sure that people are not dropping rubbish. There is free wifi along part of the beach and there are public toilets which are ok, just needed a tidy up, but had soap, water and toilet paper!If you go to Manly you can't really miss the beach and you certainly wouldn't want to.
Manly. Very nice beach but too many tourists everywhere. If you have a family walk to the end, closer to fresh water beach. There are less people and some nice spots for kids to play
Lovely beach walk even on a dull day. Took the ferry from circular quay walked through the cordon and then to Shelley beach very nice and easy. Could recommend even on a dull day.
Cute. Cute small beach, on a fine day not to miss opportunity if you are in Manly.Many shops and cafes on the road. Week day in Feb was quiet.
Nice relaxing afternoon. First time I have visited Manly for over 15 years. Had a nice trip over on the ferry. It was a bit windy but the scene was nice and I had a nice lunch at the pub.
Rainy Day. We went to Manly Beach out last day in Australia. Lots of shopping and restaurants. The beach itself is very nice but the rain put a "damper" on this experience.

Must see for first time visitors. If you have a choice visit on a weekday, it will be much less busy. Go early if you are going at the weekend... as the days goes on busy becomes incredibly crowded. The beach is clean, well taken care of by many lifeguards. This is a swimmers beach in my opinion. The waters are too rough and churning with riptide currents. If you stay in the shallows no problem. If you do venture out further you should be a strong swimmer but not idiotic enough to disobey the lifeguards instructions. Great place to cycle... to walk along the promenade which turns into a seawalk. A very beautiful place to relax.
Very nice community. We have been to bigger and nicer beaches but what makes this place so special is the pretty residential community and great restaurants and shops along the pedestrian mall.

Beautiful small town and beautiful beach. We took the Manly ferry to visit Manly Beach and really enjoyed the town. Getting off the ferry you immediately walk across the street to a wide open street that is pedestrian only lined with shops, bars and restaurants. At the end of the street is the beach which opens up a wonderful view to a very nice beach. It was a bit cold the day we were there but all of the kids were in the beach and water swimming and trying to surf as it was a week off for school holidays.
Great Beach for a swim. I've been to manly a few times and it was also great. For surf lovers it is a must see & surf in sydney. You can also chill by the beach and grab some food and a beer around.
Good day out. We catch the ferry across and then you have lovely street full of shops amd eateries to walk down then you come to the beach. Great day all for all

Beautiful. The most beautiful beach i've ever visited. The sand and waves are perfect. Althou it might be dangerous for those who can not swim or small kids.
Don't miss the beach walk as it is amazing.

One incredible beach. My wife and I have visited many beaches around the world, but Manly Beach instantly ranked amongst our favorites. The beach is clean, expansive, and has great views. We recommend visiting in the early evening as the area starts to calm down. Easy to reach by the Manly Ferry, and a great way to spend an afternoon.

Now this is a beach!. We were brought here by a friend that lives in Australia. She recommended this beach versus Bondi as this beach has less tourists and is much prettier in her opinion.We were not let down at all, as the sand was so soft and water and sky were so blue that day. Sitting on the beach with Ice cream, who could ask for more?!
Lovely beach. Great beach (apparently good for surfing) I chose to sunbathe... plenty of bars and restaurants in the area and a good shopping esplanade.

Excellent . You must go to manly beach if you go to Sydney it is out of this world I lived there for roughly about a year and all ways went back to manly to relax and take in the beauty it takes half an hour on the ferry little shops at the wharf and walk threw manly to the other beaches and at night when you walk by the beach where the street lights are you can see the sting rays coming in awesome and at night the large fruit bats fly by an experience not to miss I hope to return one day with my wife .

Review. Had an awesome time here. Great beach to relax an close to get food. Nice waves to catch a surf or to watch surfers. Make sure you see this beach. You can use public transportation to get here.

Nice beach but packed as holiday time. A really nice beach but we probably picked the wrong day to go as was rammed - I must mention the life guards who were extremely vigilant and pro-active to keep bathers safe and sound - great feeling to this place and would recommend a visit.

Beautiful beach. We loved Manly because it was so friendly; it's a smaller, nicer version of Bondi, where you can access the beautiful beaches without being surrounded by a million other people; the beaches are clean, soft white sand, plenty of water sports available all the way along the beach, and the people are friendly and helpful. We travelled by ferry from Sydney on impulse, and so glad we did! We will definitely go back next time we're in South Australia.

stunning. you have to visit manly beach I suppose when in Sydney.
even though the ocean was freezing cold the sand and sun was hot :-)
lots of place to shop eat and drink too.

Surf Carnival . Had a great time at Manly Beach.
Caught an easy ferry to Manly wharf, then a short walk to the ocean beach.
A beautiful beach with great waves and people watching especially since we arrived during the summer surf festival.
What a hoot. Had a nice beach side lunch at the Manly Grill.

Magnificent beach!. Most folks think of Bondi beach when considering Sydney area beaches. I would recommend Manly Beach as an great alternative. You can catch a ferry from Circular Quay over to Manly (only about 1/2 hour). There is about a 4 block walk through a great pedestrian boulevard to reach the beach. The beach and water is beautiful! Wonderful beach to rent an umbrella and spend a relaxing day!

one of my favorite beach. We'll catch the ferry just to come here to enjoy this wonderful beach. I like this beach better than Bondi. Always lots of people, great place for families with kids to play on the sand. Lots of nearby places to eat.

So much to choose from at Manly. Manly has the surf beaches of Queenscliff, North Steyne & South Steyne... plus Shelley beach, Little Manly and Manly Beach on the harbour. So much choice, and all of them wonderful.
LUNCH ON THE WHARF. We took the fast eco hopper over to Manly for lunch. There are lots of places to eat. we had fish and chips right on the wharf watching the boats come and go,

Best beach in Sydney. Get an Opal card and take the ferry to Manly. The main street is crammed with shops and just sitting down to watch the world go by is quite entertaining. The beach is great with clean white sand and good for surfing.

Great atmosphere. On one side you have the ocean beach , on the other you have the harbour beach, in the middle you have lots of shops and restaurants. The whole main area is packed with tourists and locals making a nice buzzing atmosphere.

Nice area great beach. I went to Manly beach with my wife to spend one day there.We used one of the hop on hop of companies to go because we want to go also to Taronga zoo.But the cheapest way is to use the ferry direct to Manly beach.Go to Circular Quay platform F1 to Manly beach.Its approximately 30 minutes.Then you have everything there.A lot of local shops restaurants Caffè and bars.Go also to the famous beach for swimming surfing or just for a nice walk.On the way back you can stop for dinner at Watson bay before return to City.
Gorgeous Beach.. This beach is one of the best I've seen. The water looks so inviting and the golden sand just makes you want to stay there all day. Well worth a visit during your stay in Sydney.

Average at best.. First time in Sydney from the U.S. and Manly was the only "city" beach we had time to visit. Taking the Manly Ferry and seeing the Opera House and Sydney skyline from the Harbor was the highlight for us. We weren't too impressed with the beach itself or the long walk through the touristy shops. If you only have time to visit one beach while in Sydney, I would do my research and pick another one.

Was expecting AMAZING, but what we saw was just GOOD. After living in So Cal, visiting many islands over the years, and living in Melb myself, I had built up Sydney beaches in my mind as the be all end all, well they are not. Its a pretty stretch of beach, with lots of activity and a nice beachy community.

A Must in NSW. There were several deliberations on whether to visit Manly or not. had I not it would have been a loss. Lovely beach and very friendly waves. Lot of shops on the way from Wharf to beach. The boat ride from Darling harbour to Manly itself is an experience by giving you nice view of the Harbour bridge and Opera house. This beach is a must visit in New South Wales.

Strong currents, surfer's paradise, shark attacks = Manly!. From Circular Quay, take F1 ferry to Manly (30 mins cruise) with stunning views of Sydney Harbor. Then take a city block walk filled with tourist shops to the entrance of the beach. Not as long as Bondi, but better waves for rowing, surfing, etc. In fact, these were the biggest waves I've ever seen up close (and I've surfed Hawaiian shores). Note: only one public restroom to use or change (and horribly dirty, disgusting, fifty probably from the homeless people).I managed to take a quick swim in a destination swim area, due to the strong currents, before the lifeguards shut down the beach for strong ripping waves. Now I know why they call this Manly Beach.
Large beach. Yep it's a large beach with lots to do after your done with beach scene. They have several volleyball nets set up. You can spend an entire day here. Restaurants and shopping.

Brief but enjoyable visit. Walked here from the wharf and briefly looked at the beach. The waves were breaking near the beach and lots of people were out playing in the water. There appeared to be life guards as well which was nice to see. Beach seemed very user friendly. I hope to come here again sometime. Hope you enjoy it too.

Favourite spot in a beautiful city. My third visit in 3 years, I love this spot! This last day trip saw the beach closed due to wild surf but the kids enjoyed fish and chips on the beach watching a surf life saving carnival. Always busy but it's big enough to handle the crowds. Must see!

Manly beach. Great weatherAmazing waves and enjoyable sun.. Lying T the corner watching waves listening air waving water This apps keep asking for more words so here are more and more and more and more and more and more words

Beautiful Manly. Manly Beach is beautiful blue clear waters of the Pacific Ocean. Swimming and diving through the waves is excellent and refreshing. However you do need to watch for rip tides and it is best to swim between the flags. When we were there blue bottles started to wash ashore but the lifeguards gave warning and information.

One of the best beaches I've been to.. Where to start! This is like a scene from a movie. There were beautiful people, amazing surfers, white smooth sand. I spend most of visit here. My favorite part was the less crowded area by Queenscliff. There are plenty of water fountains to refill water bottles and get a sip of filtered water. Additionally, a long strip of grass runs above the beach and provides a shady spot to sit underneath trees when you need a break from the heat. I also found this spot a great place to go for runs and walks. If heaven doesn't look like Manly, I don't want to go.

Superb laid-back beach and area. A quick trip on the Manly Ferry and a short walk, you are at this beautiful beach with a laid back attitude and a relaxing atmosphere. Well worth the short trip for a visit. It's worth choosing over Bondi if you had to pick a beach to see in Sydney.

lovely beaches. there are 2 beaches in manly the first one is to your right as you get off the ferry and the other at the far end of the main street in front of you. they are very clean beaches and were crowded when we were there last week we had very hot weather I think it was 42c the day we went. if eating outside watch out for the seagulls as its a frenzy for them !!!!!

Peaceful beach. I love Manly because its more laid back. I also like how there are many stores nearby (the boardwalk) where you can buy not just food but also your usual clothes and accessories (Ripcurl, Sportsgirl, etc). They even have a Chemist Warehouse. About the waters, it was abit late when I went to visit, so I didn't really swim. I just sat on the shores and ate fish and chips. I also like that I can take a ferry going here. Would definitely visit Manly again. :)
Beautiful!. We visited Bondi Beach and found Manly Beach...well, better. Not to mention the delicious "Fish and Chips" we had for lunch across the street from the beach.
One of the several excellent beaches in Sydney. Easily accessible by ferry, huge area of beach, life guards everywhere, easy on the eye. Lots of shops and eateries near by.

Beautiful family beach. The ferry to Manly from Circular quay is beautiful and the beach itself is great for families. There is a big food court space near the beach so plenty of food options. The beach also has markets which is cool and arty.

Must visit. Compared with Bondi is a much nicer beach, and has a classier feel. The ferry trip from circular quay is part of the fun, and runs till very late. Son hired a surfboard for a couple of hours while we did lunch at Garfish, a memorable afternoon all round
Very nice. Absolutely stunning. Be careful of the seagulls though when you have food. And dont forget to take in the sights as well. Definitly come here if your on holiday in Sydney

Timing is everything........ We visited Manly Beach on a hot summers day in school holidays, and it was insane. While it is a reasonably attractive beach, it can't be forgotten that it is a city beach, and our experience of over-crowding will not be uncommon - I'm sure there are quieter times where you can appreciate the place (as I'm sure the locals will tell you), but the time we visited was not one of them.Walking from the ferry terminal along the Corso to the beach was like queuing for a footy match - we were all following the crowd like lemmings. Every food venue along the Corso absolutely packed, and with big queues. A very unpleasant experience on a 37 degree day.When you get to the beach and swim between the flags, you're crammed in with a shoe horn, and have about 2-3 square metres of water surface to yourself, which is not much when the rough surf is bumping everyone into each other. Quite simply, no real chance to swim or any other aquatic activity (leave your boogie board at home) other than getting wet.The big positive of the day is the ferry ride from Circular Quay to Manly, which is incredible. It is worth going just for the ferry ride alone, even if you just turn around a go back.
One for the tourists. Locals will,tell you to head a couple of beaches up to queens cliff or freshwater for better surf. Lots of nice cafes along the adjacent street if you like your coffee.

Nice. It's a nice beach to visit and fun to get too. We took the ferry from the harbour to Manly which I'd never done before but went smoothly! There are a number of shops in Manly for food, cafe, bar etc, if you forget anything before you arrived you will be able to find it here!Don't forget sunscreen!!

Swim between the flags!. Stay safe when swimming at Manly Beach and swim between the flags. The day we were there there were strong rips in unsupervised areas along the beach....it was also very crowded.

An incredible beach just a ferry ride from Sydney. It seems unbelievable to find a clean and well located beach next to such a major city. Manly Beach is a short and entertaining 30 minute ride from Circular Quay. Once there you just cross the street from the ferry station to the "Corso"; walk along the pedestrian mall filed w restaurants and shops for a few blocks and at the end, a beautiful white sand beach awaits you. There are restrooms and an outdoor shower to rinse the sand off when you are ready to leave. While hardly deserted, it's nothing like, say, Jones Beach on Long Island in the summer. There's surfing here as well as boogie boarding. If you like to stroll in the sun, there are adjacent beaches to explore while walking through the rocks at either end. There's even a sea water pool at one end. An enviable place to spend a sultry summer day.

Relaxing Manly Beach. We were lucky to have a tourist guide who went an extra mile to regale us with stories of Sydney and brought us everywhere. From the posh suburbs we went to Manly Beach. Manly Beach was packed at that time because it’s Christmas season. It was also our first time to experience December on a hot season; more like summer if you ask me! The beach was perfect because at that time it was a bit cold. Strolling along the beach with the cold breeze was wonderful even though the sun was up. You get to see so many people walking in bathing suits in coffee shops and restaurants-- everywhere as the beach was just nearby. Cars were lined up starting at 7am.. and got pretty crowded and traffic at 10am. Some people were playing volleyball or having a picnic or just a walk with their toddlers. The area was meant to make you relax. It was very clean with lots of friendly people. The area has hotels but the ambiance was resort- feeling. It was pretty laidback and enjoyable.
Beautiful beach . Love manly beach!You have to get a ferry from the harbour which is such a lovely trip. The shops , restaurants and bars are great here!

Manly Beach. Top beach for the North side. Bit lumpy on the parking front, very expensive if there for any time over 2 hours. Beach is well patrolled, Surf school is a great attraction and the beach volleyball is always entertaining and easy on the eye; whether male or female...!Great food at the Steyne Hotel which also caters for the kids and some good gear on the market stalls outside.A visit I'd always recommend to any tourist / backpacker.
Cool Place. Best beach I have ever seen, surfers dream and the restaurants are brilliant, a must go when in Sydney

Great beach!. The front desk agent while checking into the hotel recommended Manly beach above Bondi beach, so I went to both. Manly is an easy 30 minute ferry ride from Sydney. Plenty of shops and restaurants, and it wasn't as crowded as Bondi beach. If you can only do one beach, this is the one, though Bondi was also nice. One note of caution, there is very limited ability to rent umbrellas at Manly or Bondi, so make sure you get there early and bring sun tan lotion!

Bliss, total bliss. Manly is a HUGE beach and much less touristy than Bondi. The north beach feels like a different world when compared to foreshore near the spit. Great food, good bars and a lovely lifestyle.
A great beach. A very nice, clean and scenic beach. The trees at the back make it all the more interesting. Would definitely return

Beautiful beach. Amazing and huge beach of soft sand. The wind was coming in from the South so the waves were rather small which was perfect for our surf lesson. Good amount of shops and cafe's for a bite to eat.

Much beloved by locals and tourists alike. Large beach that always has lots of people swimming, surfing, sunbathing, and playing volleyball. Running and biking paths along the beach. Usually the business of this scene would make me shy away, but the beach is beautiful and large enough to make it all worth it.

Beautiful beach. I felt this beach was much better than bondi as it was less commercialised. The whole scene was so original with the surfers, beach goers etc. There are plenty of nice eateries. You can hire some bikes to get around , it was added fun. You can bike through the shelly beach or head to Northhead lookout for some amazing views.
Beautiful. The trip by Ferry to get there is reason enough to visit Manly. But the beach is lovely, plenty of placers to grab a snack, a coffee or more and the place always has a bit of a buzz.

Classic Australian Surf Beach. Close to Corso and all food and other activities it offer, Manly Beach is very busy with tourists over the warmer months. Patrolled and popular, it provides an excellent spot to enjoy the typical Aussie summers day
Awesome spot. We never tire of manly and love arriving on the ferry. There is a great atmosphere to manly and the esplanade. It's clean, lots of shops and has a great feel to it.

Take the ferry there. Really nice! Not too crowded and nice waves, big enough to surf (for a beginner), but also small enough to actually swim in. We rented some boards at the beach which was great fun, and then had lunch at a small but nice restaurant. Would definately recommend to go here with the ferry from Sydney, it is a experience itself with beautiful views of the opera house and bridge.
Surf City. Panoramic beaches at South Steyne, North Steyne and Queenscliff. Surf, swim or suntan or enjoy a walk on the esplanade. And a great selection of cafes.

Very cool beach and town!. If I ever moved to Australia I would want to live near Manly Beach. Great area and great beach. Easy to access, clean and great waves. Also have free facilities to shower and change.
Manly. Manly was a lovely place to visit by ferry and would go over again.. Nice walks and the beach was beautiful for a spot of lunch
Overcrowded beach. Great to see the famous Manly beach, but to us it is overrated. Far too many people, food overpriced and many any more beautiful beaches in Australia to see!

A bit "touristy" like Bondi, but plenty of places to escape.. For people visiting Sydney, Manly is a bit like famous Bondi, but without quite the hype, only a portion of the tourists and an infinitely nicer journey there (the Manly ferry as opposed to the Bondi bus!). From the Manly bus terminal or Manly Wharf, don't be fooled by the two pretty beaches either side of the Wharf, for neither of these is Manly Beach (though both are lovely). Instead, walk through Manly along the very touristy Corso to reach the Pacific Ocean and the "true" Manly Beach. A walkway/bike path runs along the full length of "Manly beach" (divided into "Queenscliff, North Steyne and South Steyne beaches from North to South, but it's all the one stretch of sand). Most people cross the road and stop at the beach there. What a mistake. If you turn right (keeping the Pacific on your left), you can walk all the way around a pretty cool promenade - Marine Parade - to delightful little Shelly Beach. Shelly has a private feel, is shady (good on hot, sunny days), is sheltered from the ocean swell so there are almost no waves (great for little kids), is amazing for snorkeling (it has a cool-water reef and aquatic reserve) and a nice little cafe/restaurant (The Boathouse). Or, you can turn left (keeping the Pacific on your right) and you will pass the up-market Pantry restaurant which gets good reviews but is pricey. Further up you will reach the North Steyne Surf Club which houses the Manly Surfing school (excellent surfing lessons from great staff), and the beach volleyball courts. If you keep walking to the end of the beach you will reach Manly Lagoon (not for swimming unless you are one of the many dogs running around like mad-things here) and it's kids playgrounds or you can keep to the coast (probably crossing the tidal stream to the lagoon - look for schools of fish here) and reach the Queenscliff ocean pool which is a great spot for a "pool" swim. The length of the walkway is shaded by huge pine trees and most of it is grassy, so picnics are an excellent option if you want to avoid the expensive restaurants which line the road facing the beach. If you do want to spend some money, there are some great bars and eateries. Skip straight past the crowds downstairs (don't be put off) at the famous Steyne hotel on the corner of the Corso and head upstairs (there's a lift) to the classy and secluded Blacket's Bar or the even cooler outdoor patio overlooking the beach, at the rum and cider bar (Moonshine), I think this is one of Manly's hidden gems and has live music some nights. Nearby Hemmingways is good for coffee. There's more, but I should stop. Contact me if you want more info. Enjoy.
Disappointing.. I may be picky but I was not amazed by it at all. Avoid if you’ve been to Honolulu and Waikiki. The ferry ride to get there was beautiful.
Day out. Great day, beautiful beach. Very clean, plenty of parking, mixed group on the beach, families, groups of teenagers etc

Great pace for a day out. We took the ferry here and as it was Sunday the fare was reduced. Its a bustling place and we had lunch in a sort of bar restaurant type of place. The fish and chips where a bit disappointing. We went on a walk around the bay and this was good as we was different coloured birds and colourful trees and eventually came to another small beach. Well worth seeing.

Good Trip Even If You Don't Want To Sit On The Beach . This is just a 20 minute pleasant ferry ride from Circular Quay ( the ferries run frequently). The beach was very nice and not crowded as some people complain about. We went on a cloudy Tuesday so maybe that was why. There are lifeguards on duty. There are plenty of shops, restaurants and bars to keep you busy if you aren't into to beach. There is also a nice scenic walk that we enjoyed that had wonderful scenic views so don't miss visiting the Manly Beach area.

Manly is an experience all its own.. There's so much more to Manly than just the ferry ride or the main beach. There's the Corso alive with travelers, shoppers, sometimes music and the Saturday Markets.You can learn to surf at Manly beach, swim, go snorkeling and take diving courses. There is so much to do there. The sunrises and sunsets magical.

Fantastic and relaxing beach. Very beautiful beach and only one ferry ride away from the city. Has a very relaxed feel to it. Would recommend for anyone visiting Sydney for a while. but there are better attractions if you are only in Sydney for a short time.

Safety first. A beautiful beach located at the end of the shopping strip It is well patrolled with lifeguards issueing warnings if required about safety practicesas tides change during the dayIt is a very long beach good for walks and surfingThere is a walkway which features a pool to the south of Manly Always take water and sunscreen and be sure to take your rubbish off the beach at the edge of the day
beautiful beach. great place to visit lots of restaurants and bars to choose from. highly recommended a little bit of a hike but well worth the trip. great place

There's a Reason Everyone Raves about Manly. Easily and enjoyably accessible Manly has a fabulous beach vibe! Still busy by all means but a bit more relaxed vibe than Bondi. Great eateries, with lots of variety this day trip is worth the effort!

Best beach in Sydney. This long beach 1.8 k approx is home to three surf clubs and three flagged safe swimming areas. It is important to swim between the flags. The lifeguards are on duty through the warm months.

Lovely beach but poor life saving. I went here with my grand daughter and the beach is beautiful but we were told to get out of the water and swim between the flags, which is fine if you can see or find the flags

Want to go back. Spent the day there. It was a perfect beach day - 28 degrees. The beach was busy but there's always room for a few more. Manned by life guards. Beach was very clean. I love beaches anyway so I was in heaven. Love that the shops go all the way to the beach. Good selection of eateries

Great Beach and a wonderful walk along the promenade. We go to Manly regularly to walk, swim and try all the cafes along the beach. We park and start our walk at Queenscliff end and walk the whole length of beach and then around the coast walk to Shelly Beach and return. The time for a swim and breakfast at one of the many good cafes. We are very spoilt in Sydney for great beaches, but this is one of the best.

Very busy beach. Just a short ferry ride from circular quay and you reach manly. About 10 minutes walk and you are at the beach. Plenty of amenities close by and lifeguards always making sure the beach is safe.

Great beach, relaxed vibe . I loved Manly beach, it was a more chilled out, less touristy version of Bondi with better shops too. Plenty of dining options nearby and easily accessible via the ferry from Circular Quay.

Great beach for sun and relax. This beach is easy to get to with the ferry, with great amenities close to the beach (restaurants, cafes, souvenir shops, supermarket etc). I can easily stay for the day just relaxing and soak in the sun (in summer of course).

Great to visit when spending few days in Sydney!. I hopped on the public ferry and got to Manly in about 30 minutes (Tip: if you travel on a Sunday, your Opal card is capped at $2.50, which means you can go to Manly and back for just that price! so I wouldn't bother with the expensive ferries, just get on the public Sydney transport one!)Manly beach is lovely, and you will be able to get surfing lessons if you wish. On the day I went, the weather wasn't the great, so I just stayed on the beach and rested for a bit.

Great beach, plenty of facilities.. A great beach in the heart of Manly, enjoyed by locals and visitors. Plenty of facilities - changerooms, toilets, and patrolled by the great people from surf lifesaving Australia. Pack a beach bag, take the ferry to Manly, walk to the beach, get changed at either of the pavillions, enjoy lunch at many of the nearby cafe's. Great activity for a nice day!

Great place to go swimming. The lifeguards are on top of the action at the beach. They are trying to keep all the swimmers / surfers / boarders safe. This was a great place to swim. You are able to shower off the salt water after the swimming - the showers are on the board walk. Very convenient and very fun!

Beautiful Beach. We took the ferry over here for dinner, we had time to walk along the beach as the sun was setting. The views are beautiful. There are a ton of restaurants along the waterfront that are great to eat at while watching the ocean!

Easy access to Manly Beach. The easiest way to reach Manly Beach is to ride the Manly Ferry from Sydney Harbour Circular Quay. On leaving the ferry it is a short walk down a traffic free road to the beach. There are many shops on the way to stock up with beach essentials. The beach itself is served by good surfing waves, but there are warnings of dangerous currents where appropriate.

Great Beach . I love Manly beach! The surf is HUGE but the lifeguards are abundant and very good and ensuring no one swims in the dangerous areas. The beach is long and beautiful white soft sand. The shops and cafes are great! Lots to do and lots of shade. The Manly Fast Ferry was $18 round trip and about 20 minutes.

A Busy beach in the holidays!. We spent a day in the holidays at Manly beach and it was incredibly busy, this may have also been because 3/4 of the beach was closed due to dangerous conditions. It was difficult to find parking, so I would advise against driving to the beach, a ferry from circular quay would be the best option is coming from the city. Further North was not as busy. A great place to visit and must see when visiting Sydney.
Easy trip from Circular Quay by ferry. Definitely worth taking the ferry from Circular Quay over to Manly. Beautiful beach and heaps of places to eat or drink

Lovely Beach with fun Surf and cute town. Upon arriving by hop on hop off bus out of circular quay we only wished that we would have arrived much earlier with all our beach wear. We would have loved to spent the whole day there and will go back. The Beach and ocean are great there is a board walk across from the beach with Resturants and shops as well as a nice open air cute mall area. It would have been nice to stay through sunset but we did see it as we travelled back past a few more beautiful areas. There is a nice area on the beach side with places to sit too.

Beautiful . We went for the morning to get some beach time before the crowds arrived and before the sun got too hot. It is a beautiful beach and the lifeguards are excellent at ensuring the surfers stay away from the designated swimming area. The Ferry to and from Circular Quay only added to the adventure. Totally worth the trip.

Gem of a beach. I visited both Bondi and Manly beaches during my recent Sydney visit. I loved Manly more due to its cafes, shops, oceanarium, tourist traps, etc. The ferry ride alone is a lovely day out too.
Manly beach. Crammed with people yet everyone has a space. The tide was high and that made the fun even better. Great food places around the place and only a few metres away from the ferry quay.
Beach lovers. A beautiful beach with other little beaches skirting its edges, Manly is a popular place for all. Little cafes, restaurants, shopping areas abound close by. Watch the surfers.

Great Beach. For someone that comes from Miami, Manly beach reminded me a lot of Miami Beach and the ambience and comfort of the beach. From the ferry to the beach, there's plenty of shops and restaurants to complete your day of sand and surf. Once you've worked up an appetite head out and enjoy some food. Definitely worth the ferry from Sydney.

Amazing beach to rest . Really enjoyed the beach during visit Manly for a day. Take half hour on the ferry from Sydney harbour to get there. There are lot of shade from the big trees to hide from the sun. What amazing place to escape
Lovely. Lovely area to have a walk and enjoy the beach. Be warned though, it's quite busy during the holidays.

If you want a normal beach with close to shopping this is a good place. This is not my beach for sure, but if you've kids it can be good. I'm more into the wildness and scenic view at Bondi and Bronte.

Great Sydney excursion. Apparently there are regular super fast ferries to manly - I think you can get there from circular quay in something like 20 minutes if you get the right one. Anyway we ended up driving which was fine but parking was not so easy - we used our phone to find paid parking. It's a lovely stroll along the waterfront. You can walk up the pedestrianised area but to be honest it's mostly pretty tatty shops. The beach front is the nicest.

A pleasant day. To get out of the CBD and to a beach, Manly is a good option. Once on the Ferry at circular quay you are already enjoying the scenery. Walking around the beach and shops, restaurants is easy.
Regular pit stop. Only used Wharf side and mainly for the restaurants which are all very good. Had my birthday lunch in Hugo's..small drawback of having to wait 20 mins for our pre-booked table

Home sweet home. After travelling the world full time for over 5 months now, I think its safe to say home sweet home! Manly is my home area, and after living here all my life its easily enough to say it is one of the most beautiful locations around the world. with its touristic and lively atmosphere full of nightlife, beaches, actives, restaurants and holiday houses its no wonder I spend my summers along Queensclift beach (on the opposite side of manly, once you walk through manly cross you will be at Queensclift beach)If your travelling around Sydney then I would defiantly recommend hopping on a ferry or even catching the bus the L90 from central station in the city to get here! If you can, try to spend a night at a hotel along the beach such as the Seable which is beautiful, modern and right on the water. If your a backpacker then skip Bondi - Its way to touristy and come to manly instead! There are cheap backpackers and so many cute bars and fun nightclubs along with beaches to explore along the northern beaches coastline.I am still travelling the world and miss Manly almost every single day!

Do yourself a favor and spend the day at Manly!. We took the ferry over to Manly from the CQ. Nice ride over and beautiful weather for a beach day. We didn't stay all day, but I wish we had time. We hung out on the beach, ate a little food, walked the corso, and took the ferry back. Beautiful day out.
Better than Bondi. A really lovey long beach worth the ferry to get here from the city make sure you also walk up to the headland you will not be disapointed
Lovely beach. This is a lovely beach in a spectacular setting but be warned, it is incredibly busy with both locals and tourists on a nice day.
Very busy but must see. Being over christmas this attraction was very busy, We however enjoyed the ferry ride and a walk on the beach

Heaven. Manly beach is a beautiful beach very clean very cool vibes and manly overall as a suburb is somewhere to visit as it's got a hippie feel to it. Lots of shops, bars & restaurants and it's much better than bondi. The waves are unreal if you are a surfer.. Would definitely visit again!
Fun place. We spent our first day in Sydney at Manly Beach. The vibe is fun, lots of good places to eat and shop. Beach was great too!

I am a frequent world traveller but I have lived close to Manly Beach for many years.. Manly Beach is a short wondrous ferry ride from Circular Quay in Sydney where for around 20 -30 minutes either by slow or fast ferry one can experience sailing through beautiful Sydney Harbour before arriving at the foreshores of Manly. Manly township is situated between Sydney Harbour Beaches at the ferry wharf end and a 7 minute walk down the main street, Manly Corso, leads you to the magic of the Pacific Ocean and a beautiful stretch of white sand which is Manly Beach. It is a surfing beach and there are three sections of safe surfing and swimming supervised by lifesavers. There are many and varied eating places that would suit both budget minded travellers and there are upmarket eating places as well for those who may wish to have a glass of wine and a hearty meal. To the right of Manly Beach there is a beautiful 20 minute walkway along a winding promenade to Cabbage Tree Bay which is both scenic and relaxing. There is a swimming pool on the way around as well as cafes that suit all budgets. There is a picturesque small beach at the end of the promenade walkway surrounded by parkland and benches to sit back and enjoy the scenery.

An amazingly beautiful beach!. Manly Beach is extraordinary! The beach has everything. Some people were snorkeling, some were surfing, some were swimming, some were sunbathing, and everyone was having fun! There are many shops and restaurants nearby just across the street from the Manly Beach esplanade. Unlike some other beaches, there is a good assortment of shops (not just t-shirt shops) and restaurants if you need a diversion from the beach. The beach is deep and wide. The surf was rough, but not overwhelming. Take the ferry from Circular Quay, and visit Manly Beach. It is nearly perfect!

Manly Beach. We stayed in Manly over the 2015/16 Christmas holidays. It isd a great place as it has a village atmosphere yet is only a short ferry ride to the City, Having a car you can also get to the northern beaches. There are great walks. On the foreshore there is a walk to Shelley Beach but on the harbour side there is a 10Km walk to the Spiit through bushland and beach. Manly beach itself is ok but it was disappointing that with a vast expanse of beach the only patrolled swimming areas were at the far south and far north of the beach. There are Volley ball nets and there are clean public toilets.
Paddle Board heaven . Manly beach cool vibe and access to SUP from $25 per hour, paddle around the moored boats and to the lovely Manly beach, great fun for all

Great day at manly . We caught the ferry to Manly and had a wonderful time shopping and ate a delicious fresh seafood lunch on the beach..a great place to spend the day. ..great shopping and a beautiful beach
Nice and clean. I like this beach. It is long, clean, sometimes crowded, sometimes not. It is so relaxing, cafeterias nearby. Even in rainy and windy day you can see runners.

Lovely beach patrolled by lifeguards all year swim between the flags. Have been swimming at manly for many years lovely waves feel very safe to see the lifeguards patrolling the beach all year always swim between the flags toilets and bathing facilities available eating shops just opposite beach

Better than Bondi. Sorry Bondi, you've got the name but Manly's the place to go. The main beach across the way from the ferry dock is the big one but there are two smaller ones, more for the little kids in the flock, on each side. Late evening Manly Beach has beautiful character with the long shadows from the trees on the promenade - a photographer's must-visit.

Beauty of a beach. This beach is well worth a visit by getting the ferry from circular quay in sydney. Even if you don't like to sit on the sand you can sit on the wall overlooking the beach and watch the surfers and the people learning to surf. Plenty of cafés and bars for every taste over the road from the beach.

Iconic manly beach. Ok so firstly parking if you drive. Parking in secure parking has early bird deal or find a park in a street . Most are limited to two hours only. We found a spot up in the hill and walked down - easy. Public toilets at the far end - ok . So many people just relaxing watching the surfers as cold day when we visited . Best coffee at showbox. Take a stroll along the pathways around the point just lovely

Lovely Beach and you can actually find parking.. We tried to go to Bondi and Bronte beaches on New Years Day but it seems so did everyone else in the city. No parking to be had anywhere close, terrible streets to drive as well so went up to Manly Beach which was less crowded, and easier parking. We were happy we got to at least one beach on our visit. You do have to swim only in designated areas, and there are lifeguards on duty which is good. You need to watch out for jellyfish this time of year.
Lovely beach. Visited here with my partner and it really is a lovely beach, not as over rated and hyped as bondi beach! Lots of shops restaurant and bars in the area also!

Lovely beach. Visited sydney and got the ferry across to manly and visited manly beach. What a beautiful beach. Remember to stay between the flags as the waves are very strong... even the shallow ones will knock you off your feet. Lovely experience all in all.
Windy and crowded. Good alternative to Coogee, Bondi and the beaches at Watson Bay. But it was really windy and crowded. Not recommended if you have kids in tow.
Ferry trip to manly. Great views coming in to manly on the ferry . Small beach either side of the jetty .town looks good with loads of cafes etc

Leisure . Every thing was good except for the food .
There was this Turkish kebab outlet ( Manly seaside kebabs) located in the street linking the wharf with the beach . We took it talk away but when opened the chicken skewers were given to us raw also it tasted horrible .

Beautiful beach. If you are visiting Australia from Europe you'll LOVE LOVE LOVE our beaches. No pebbles to hobble over, no sore feet getting into the water and lovely lovely white sandy beaches. Manly is certainly one of those. It is only a short 5 minute walk once you get off the ferry and you are there. You do need to ensure you swim between the flags and take notice of what the life savers tell you. We have volunteer life guards in OZ who give there time to watch out for people in the water and make sure they don't get into dangerous situations. They can't be everywhere though so it may seem like the observation area is small but it is important to observe especially if you have children with you or you are are not a strong swimmer. The currents at Manly can be strong and the pull of the surf can unbalance you if you are not sensible. In saying that body surfing, body boarding and surfing are such fun as long as you take notice of local advice. Wear sunscreen if you are out in the sun for more than 20 mins and wear a hat, t-shirt or rash shirt. Coffee shops and eateries line the beach and folk are all out for a good time so ENJOY!
Busy Beach..... This is a very busy beach and on the weekends it can be extra busy....but don't be discouraged there is plenty of sand here for all to use!

Hustle and bustle . Manly beach was pretty crowded when I visited. It's very nice but unfortunately the currents were too strong so swimming was not allowed that particular day. Facilities were adequate. The surrounding area is filled with lovely shops and the hustle and bustle of the beach crowd. Very enjoyable day.
Walk on the beach. It is a beautiful beach. Nice white sand and clear water, etc. the food shops and shopping on the walk ways are also fine.

Beautiful and world class. Beautiful and world class beach, although the public facilities (restrooms, changing areas, etc) are old and not well maintained - they can be pretty filthy. But, the beach is gorgeous and clean and there is surfing and designated swimming areas. Be sure to swim inside the designated swim lanes only or the livesavers will blow their whistles at you!

Who needs Bondi. We did the required pilgrimage to Bondi beach & was not impressed, however we then went to Manly and we were very pleasantly pleased. The beach and the foreshore were far better than its more famous neighbour, the restaurants & shopping were excellent. We can recommend Manly every time over Bondi, there was even more surfers at Manly despite the surf being the same.

A bit too crowded . Visited Manly Beach on December 29, 2015, and it was really crowded, which it makes it less enjoyable. We did a walk around it, but, again, full of people. I guess, if we'd visited it on another time of year it would be a great place to chill and enjoy the beach.
Cracking beach fully services. The beach is great. Crystal water, good waves for the kids. Lots of food and beverages around. Top pubs like the Steyne and 4 Pines. Must visit.
Fun beach. You take a ferry to a fun beach town. It's a nice beach with life guards. Fun to talk and watch and swim. Lot's of touristy food and shops make for a fun walk.

Lovely place for a long walk. We took the Manly Ferry to Manly for the day from Circular Quay.
There are good shops and restaurants as well as a great walk to the national park from the beach. Spend some time watching surfers on the front while eating an ice cream.
The ferry itself was worth the trip - the views are spectacular.
It amazing beach. it was great day and very beatiful beaches so if you are in sydney you must go see it this beach so you will love it highly recommend it
Sand and sun. Come here for your fix of sand and sun. Chose your dates wisely however to avoid the mass herds of sun worshipping tourists and locals.

Where if you stand long enough in one spot the world will walk by.. A trip to Sydney would not be complete without a day trip to Manly. To get off the ferry and walk along the Corso to the Manly Ocean Beach. The only word is 'spectacular' Golden sand and countless waves as they break onto the beach. Summer or winter Manly is a fantastic destination all year round. You can hear accents from all over the world as visitors enjoy the myriad of shops, cafe's and restaurants. One of life's great pleasures to order take-away fish and chips and eat it overlooking the beach. Watch out the sea gulls will want some of your chips too. Spend a couple of hours or a week or two staying in Manly area. It will be an experience of a lifetime and one you will never forget.

Better than Bondi!. Took the ferry from Circular Quay and although busy was a very efficient journey. The walk from Manly Wharf takes about 5 minutes and is through a reasonably attractive shopping area where there are many options to buy food for the day. There are also the usual tacky souvenir shops as well as some nice clothes shops. The beach itself is lovely and well controlled by lifeguards. There are dangerous currents and warnings were given regularly to swim in controlled areas. The breakers were great fun. There are options to sit on grass behind the beach and trees for shade. The journey back was easy and the overall experience much better than the previous day's visit to Bondi.
Nice Place. We went on X'mas eve which was quite crowded.Grab some food from Coles supermarket to chill and relax at the beach

A Great Beach for Families. Our son and his wife live in Manly. He surfs almost every day that he's in Australia. I don't blame him. I like it because, if the surf's a bit rough, I can swim in one of the enclosed pools. I cannot swim as well as when I was a surf lifesaver on the Gold Coast 50 years ago, but a swim between one of the flagged areas of Manly Beach reminds me of the joys of living near the east coast of Australia.

Lovely, cheap boat trip across and a laid back, clean resort. Well worth a trip for a beach day out with a ferry seeing most of the harbours attractions. Nice restaurants and bars near the beach and supermarket just off the ferry if you want picnic food
5 thumbs up. just what the doctor ordered, de-stress, exfoliate skin, sanitise body, salt wash nasal, vitamin d intake increased, laughter for longer living etc etc highly recommended
Awesome Manly don't miss it!. Manly is a great place. A lovely town with lots to see and the beach is lush. A perfect alternative to staying in Sydney centre.

Great Beach with shops along sea front. This is the 4th visit to Manly and we will be back twice more before we leave Aussie in March. This is one of the best beaches. It has all the amenities you could wish for and the Corso which is the shopping main street just steps away. The beach is very long and walking along you will see several net ball courts that are used all week for matches which is a pleasure to watch from the raised pavement running alongside the beach.

Not for those used to great beaches. Coming from Queensland, I was not impressed by the beach. We were stuck there due to Sydney-Hobart yacht race, so spent a few hours there because of ferries being stopped.

Beautiful beach and views. Manly Beach is just a ferry ride away from Sydney. The beaches have soft sand an shallow waters. There are several historical attractions nearby. A also several restaurants on the pier.

Easily accessible away from the Bondi crowds. Only a short ferry ride from Sydney City (with spectacular views). Australians leave Bondi beach to the tourists, Manly offers it all.A well patrolled beach, with golden sand, spreading near 1 km, you will always find a quiet patch for yourself. Once you have enough sun, take a stroll along the shady promenade or enjoy one of the many nearby restaurants.
Love this beach. After being in this area I want to move here. It's easily one of the best beaches in town. Take the ferry here and walk to the beach easily. Great shops and restaurants nearby.
Stunning!!. What a place! Clean beach, big waves, clear water, good surf, volleyball nets. This is a MUST SEE beach if you are in the area.

Awesome Daytrip. Caught the ferry (Opal Card rules... Was classed as an extension of a previous train trip=free) around lunchtime. Straight ahead off the ferry and through the main shopping area and in 400 metres or so you are there. As beautiful as Bondi without the distance of sand to cross to get to the water. Every type of food available. The oldies had fish and chips which were great. We had meusli/fruit/yoghurt from a little cafe at the right hand end of the beach. Great value and coffee was good too. Would go back in a second.

Seaside with sun...... Spent an afternoon strolling along the beach walking as far as Shelly Beach. We didn't go in the sea with it being stinger season and not yet having purchased a suit. Easily accessible from the ferry terminal with lots of the usual tourist shops along the way. Plenty of places to eat on the sea front. Nicer than the seaside back home and with sun!

Big beach quite and comfortable . It's a quiet beach not too many people surfing which was good for family but not having too many people at a beach is weird so would prefer other beaches the food around there is awesome but !!:)

Beautiful beach. Came here not to get into the water, we just wanted to see what Manly beach was all about. Overall, it's beautiful and would be a good spot for a picnic or just laze around under the sun. When we were here, the weather was overcast with high chance of rain so we just snapped few pictures and headed back. Didn't spend as much time there as we wanted. Wasn't as crowded as Bondi but honestly, if I had to choose which beach to visit between Manly and Bondi, Bondi would be my choice. Don't get me wrong, they're both beautiful but Bondi definitely has an extra kick to its sight!

A Slower, quieter Manly pace than Central Sydney.. Regular ferries in & out. Lovely Beaches, shady trees, plenty of cafes, bars & restaurants to choose from. Walk strait off the ferry and short walk along The Corso or Wentworth Street to reach the coastline beaches & Tasman Sea.
Just another beach.. We visited Manly on our trip to Sydney, can't say we were impressed. There is nothing really special there, we've been to much nicer beaches. Toilets were disgusting too.
Easy to access surfing beach. Nothing better than catching the Manly ferry , walking down the esplanade, buying some fish and chips and watching the surfing

Nice beach with nice wave. For foreigners like me people usually come to Bondi beach when visiting Sydney. I did a little more research and found 2 nice beaches in Manly: Manly Beach and Queenscliff Beach. I came here a bit earlier in the morning to avoid overcrowding during Summer. It was a really nice beach with nice wave..

Amazing atmosphere. Super atmosphere, right from Many Ferry wharf down to the beach. The 1 km odd walk is full of shops and restaurants, and many artistes are around- painters and singers- strutting their stuff! A lovely experience- the beach is not big, but is quite clean.

Great in winter. Too crowded in the summer time.. The one thing I like about Manly is the fact that the Council has been brave enough to lay down rules. If you want to swear, drink to excess, graffiti public property, skateboard down the esplanade, 'Go elsewhere'. Setting standards pays dividends. A brief visit to Singapore shows you what adoption of a philosophy of respect can do for a city, a suburb, an entire nation.

Chilled and Cool . Loved it here. Being a Brit it was nice to hear the Brit accent here. Lots of backpackers. Beach was very busy but beautiful. Lots of bars. Restaurants. Ice cream. Shops. You name it. Manly has it. We took the ferry from Circular Quay. The views going and coming back were breathtaking. Memorable trip.
Surfers spot. A bit disappointing on a grey day but nonetheless, a great location to look at surfers. Lovely walk to the park nearby.

Beautiful beach. Went here for the day what a wonderful clean beach and it goes on for quite some distance It has guards patrolling beach and flags to warn people of dangers There are lots of shops on walk from ferry to beach and a lovely takeout from the Ocean fish shop to eat in the centre in the beautiful sunshine what more do u need ...a 5 minute walk and you are back at ferry to return to circular quay
place that seems to be over-rated. went here by ferry, it is supposed to be a place to visit and being great, however it is quite ordinary. found other places I \liked better.

Pretty beach, cold water. The beach is lovely, the walk is lovely. The sea dragons are amazing, but the water is freezing (at least to me). I lasted a record breaking 9 seconds in the water before finding a seat in the sun and trying to warm up again !

Iconic and justifiably very popular beach. This is the Pacific beach of Manly (another beach with calmer and warmer water is on the harbor side near the ferry terminal). The beach is several miles long, with beautiful sand and water. It is bordered by restaurants, bars, hotels and condos. There are usually rather big waves good for surfing. The problem with this spectacular beach is that the swimming areas, defined by flags, are unreasonable small, often no more than 100 yards, so that the swimming area is crowded and even dangerous. For a swimming you may consider Shelly beach, a 15 min walk toward the south.

Sydney = beaches... beaches = Sydney. Do you know beautiful cities (sydneys:-) that have beautiful beaches? Think of Barcelona... Think of Sydney... And yes, Manly Beach is one of them: take the ferry, take the walk to the beach, take the walk back and enjoy your day!
Best place. Young people, a lot of surf, beautiful beaches, good nightlife, and the quiet of a place near enough Sydney CBD.

beautiful spot in Sydney. A 25 minutes ferry ride from Circular Quay, leaving every half hour, Manly Beach is a very nice place not to miss. A short walk from the pier, along an avenue with shops, Manly Beach is big, half moon shaped, calm water to swim, restaurants across the street, with a pleasant pathways to walk to Shelley Beach.

Find your patch of sand & claim it. It's a great day trip over to Manly if you are staying in Sydney but I preferred some of the other beaches on the island to Manly beach itself. Manly beach is really popular as it sits in prime position at the end of a strip of shops, bars & restaurants which means that the beach is really busy and you will struggle to find a spot to yourself plus, you will be stalked by seagulls if you have any food and there will be a constant stream of base heavy music pumping somewhere nearby. What didn't help matters but is just an unfortunate coincidence was that there was a HUGE number of blue bottles on all of the beaches on the island the day we visited which meant that swimming in the sea was likely to end with a few stings!

Beautiful sunset. I went later in the day and the sunset was so beautiful. I live near the ocean so going to the beach isn't s big deal to me but it's nice to see a sunset from the beach and the view from here is stunning

A splendid natural beach area. My wife and I decided to stay a few days in Sydney after our cruise. We took transportation to Manly Beach.. Manly Beach is located away from the urban areas and is a very scenic, natural beach. We found the walk along the beach enjoyable. I would say it was well worth the visit, if not just to gaze out over the beautiful ocean. Parking nearby. A peaceful and pleasant location.

Beautiful and quieter than Bondi. Lovely big beach. Easy to get to. Enjoyed a lovely walk. Fun to watch surfers. Lots of nice restaurants and shops. Ferry from Circular Quay a nice trip around the harbour to get there.

Beyond beautiful. An early morning walk along the beach to see yet another spectacular sunrise. Clear waters see keen early morning risers in for a swim and there are plenty of cafes buzzing with locals before they travel to work. If only I could find an apartment, I'd live here and feel like I'm on holiday all year round.

One of the cleanest beaches I've seen in a while. Manly beach doesn't get the attention it deserves to be honest. It's a very clean beach and since it's a long beach, there is more than enough space to relax without feeling like you're surrounded by heaps of people. Even during the holiday season, it isn't overcrowded. If you want to sunbathe in a quieter area, I suggest walking down towards the end where there are less people, because the most crowded area is right in front of the Corso (the shopping street leading to the wharf). Manly Beach is also a great place to surf and swim, and some people also prefer to walk their dogs or jog along the path that runs parallel to the beach.
40,000 Santas. We went last Sunday and every young person was dressed as Santa or Santas helpers. Great atmosphere, lots of shops,busy and bustling.

Beautiful Manly. Ahhhhh this place is fantastic. Bohemia at its best. Feel the new age here and the hippytastic 60 are still clinging on. A great place to eat out, beach out and a blooming good night out
Lovely beach. This beach a lovely beach on a nice day. Very busy. Lots of restaurants around. Fairly sheltered. Just a short walk from ferry terminal.

Classic northern beach. Clean, large and great beach for surfing. Life guards on duty till 6pm. We saw a 'shark spotted' sign here but people were swimming and surfing all the same. Reach this beach from Sydney by taking the Manly ferry (public transit, uses Opal card, 30 mins) or Manly Fast Ferry (no Opal card, 15 mins, $8.50 pp) and walk 10 mins to get to the beach. Restrooms and plenty of shops and restaurants nearby.

Preferred this beach to Bondi. Hop the Manly ferry and then take the short walk to the beach. The water was amazing, you can take a surfing lesson (wish I did!) and there is lots of shopping and restaurants nearby but it doesn't feel overly touristy or crowded. It was great! I preferred it over Bondi beach.

Great beach! Wish I brought my swim suit!. So, I'm not a huge beach person. I thought it'd be a bother to take my swim suit and deal with being dirty for the rest of the day. But I took one look at the beach, felt the soft sand beneath my feet, and envied all the people around me having so much fun. I even considered buying a swim suit and joining in! The boardwalk along the beach is excellent. My family loved popping in and out of the shops, and we even found a great Thai restaurant that ended up being our FAVORITE meal of the entire Sydney stay (name of Thai place: Manly Thai Gourmet). My sister is gluten free and they handled that like pros! I love my Thai food - and have sought out the best Thai in NY, Boston, etc. I'd go back there if I get to go to Sydney again!Anyways, this is a review about the BEACH right? It's definitely worth going to. I love the walk around Bondi beach, but this beach is the nicer one to lounge in. It's more high class than Bondi and a great place to spend a couple days relaxing.

I'd live here if I moved to Australia!. Manly is THE beach to visit. Very long, well-kept, safe, and beautiful. There are excellent restaurants and shops from the ferry to the beach, and a lovely walk round from the beach up on the rocks (with a smooth walkway). This is not to be missed. I'm tempted to go back!
Lovely place to visit. Beautiful trip by ferry, lots of families enjoying themselves, lots of restaurants, nice just to walk about as long as not raining OR too hot.

Gorgeous urban beach. Took the Circular Quay to Manly ferry on a weekday, so it was quite "sedate." Arrived in Manly wharf, took a walk around Federation Point, which is beautiful. Then took a short walk to Manly beach. The beach itself is a long strip of sand, with its views not compromised by any oil rigs. I just took some time to sit there and just enjoy the views. It was windy, yet still warm. There seems to be plenty of places to sit and just relax. There is also a long pedestrian walk beside the beach which is great for walking, biking, etc. As great a beach as one can get, IMHO.The surrounding area also has plenty of shops. The area seems to be extremely safe.
My favorite part of Sydney. What can anyone else say about Manly. Fantastic beach great shopping and pubs. If your into surfing or just chilling this is the ideal spot.

Amazing Manly Beach. Our first visit to Manly beach will always remain firmly in our mind, the first glimpse of the beach as you walk through the pedestrian precinct for the ferry was just WOW, what a sight with the golden sand and clear blue ocean. To my mind as good as or if not better than Bondi, but without the commercialism, spot on.

Not on a cloudy windy day. My bf and I went on Dec2. It was a cloudy and windy day. so there are not many people along the way and at the beach. So we felt a bit disappointed and nothing much to see at the market area. Anyway, We sat down at a bench and enjoy the cheese and biscuit we bought earlier. Maybe should go on a day with better weather.
Sun and Sea perfection. We went in November and it was lovely to be about to just chill with food and drinks on the warm sand and cold down the cool crisp water.
