Something for everyone - a must for visitors . The beach is great for swimming - fun waves but not too strong. Excellent restaurants and food for all price points. The ferry from Sydney to Manly provides great views of the Opera House, bridge, and downtown.
Best in Sydney. By far one of the most pleasant beaches in Sydney, definitely worth the travelling hussle. Clean, safe and not overcrowded!

Very Nice Beach To Spend A Day At. Great, clean beach. All the necessities are close by. If you want to spend your day at the beach this is the beach in Sydney to go to. If you are in Sydney, you just need to get on the Manly fairy, it is just a 20 minute ride and little bit of walking.
Better than bondi beach . Famous and cool enough. Deserve more than a walk . Going to Shelly beach , at the Est end of this amazing walking . A paradise on the earth :-)

Catch the ferry to Manly. The walk from the ferry is about 500 mts. The beach is very nice sand what more can you say about a beach. We had a meal in the Styne hotel, barramundi and chips, best eaten inside as the seagulls think they can share.

Great beach. Lovely stretch of beach. Lots of eateries with Corso nearby .Only negative is the parking prices along the Esplanade, that was $10 per hour and maximum 2 hours. Tip is park in council car park about 1-2 blocks back better value
Son of a BEACH! Manly BEACH!. Great beach, good for surfing - quite a strong rip last tim we were there almost visited Manly and China in the same day.

Not For The Young - Expensive and Old Demographic. I went to the beach for the first time in Manly on a nice dayThe beach is average in comparison to beaches like Bondi or ClovellyFood is expensive with one serve of Fish and Chips costing $18The place is full of older retirees and touristsNot for the young at heart or those watching their pennies
Nice beach with waves . It's a nice long beach where you can enjoy a nice time. It's surrounding by a lot if restaurants and bars. You can also walk along the small beaches near the wharf.
A Peaceful Beach. I come here quite often. The restaurants are very close by and at late night, you could just lay down on the sand and breathe while looking at the stars if there are ~
The place to catch the ferry to!. Bring on the memories and the best Australia has to offer! Love Manly and the Sunday markets with my kids!

Such a special beach. So easy to get to by ferry and wonderful for a tourists day trip - more enjoyable than Bondi Beach with its openness (and less concrete) , long beach and easy to swim for the whole family.Great choice of bars, cafes and restaurants and plenty of shops.

Great beach and delicious fish and chips. Not only the beach itself is great but also the way to get there is great. You take the ferry over and during the ferry ride you can just enjoy the beautiful views. On Manly itself is great with a beautiful very long beach. You can get some fish and chips at the local shops and enjoy your meal at the beach.
Too windy and crowded. Sydney has so many lovely beaches, I don't know why so many people crowd into Manly. If you are going ot go I suggest using public transport.

Amazing. The size of Manly Beach just trumps Bondi Beach, which is still a worthwhile visit. Once you dock at the Manly Ferry Wharf (yes, take the ferry) walk straight out, then walk straight and you will hit the beach within 2 minutes. If I didn't come for business I definitely would've brought my family here as there's so much that can be done, other than making sand castles. It is a beautiful place and you can just walk up and down, then sit down somewhere to take it all in. Plus, there's loads of shops and restaurants in the vicinity. The hardest part? Deciding what should I have for lunch. ☺

Nice Beach, Happening Town. It's an easy ferry ride from the circular quay in downtown Sydney directly to Manly. One walks through the town (very touristy with lots f shops and restaurants) and arrive at a beautiful expanse of sand that is Manly Beach. While there were lots of people, it wasn't overcrowded and very pleasant

Great Beach. We took the Manly Ferry to the town of Manly and took the short walk down the Corso to the beach. Lots of nice shops and pubs where we enjoyed a pint. The beach is both clean, white, and less crowded than Bondi.

Think you're in Hawaii?. When I saw Manly Beach for the first time, I did make this mistake. Closer examination with such proof as cars driving on the left leaves one in no doubt. The view, the surfers, the roar of the waves and the screeching of the gulls make this a timeless and delightful place. A walk along the Esplanade - looking for the beach volleyball players who forgot to go to Spec Savers - will make a perfect appetizer before grabbing take-away fish and chips on the Corso. Wrap it all up on the ferry back to the CBD and your day will have been a ten out of ten!
Good for something to do. Nice place to go for something to do. Lots of cafes and a pretty place. Nice to go by ferry and then sit at this beach.
wonderful. very peace and calm place. Loved the afternoons there. The sunset looks amazing from here. A family walk at the evenings is a must to do for the locals, and sun bath for the tourists.

Quaint and Beautiful. The little "downtown" area is quaint, beautiful and a delightful stroll between the ferries and the beach.The beach is gorgeous (why not, it's the Pacific Ocean) and the "boardwalk" is fun to walk as well as needed exercise after dining at one of the restaurants bordering the beach.
Place to go. Great way to see harbour as u ferry to manly, then touristy shops after u land, and a beautiful beach for swim, surf, boogie board. Stop for a cool one before u leave and head back.

Locals and tourists destination. If your heading to Sydney, make sure you hop a ferry and go to manly to see how the locals like it. The fast boat is worth the extra money as it reduces the travel time go 20 mins. Walk down the mai. Drag of the steyne, shops are beachy not fashion but a treat is the Sunday markets where I recommend you take your credit card as there is interesting jewellery and leather bags that could tempt. The best part is walking along the whole front beach and going around the corner to the safe beach at the end called Shelley beach. Have a fresh juice or coffee to refresh or enjoy a meal at the boathouse.

"Memories are made of this". It's a beautiful view of the harbour from the the beach - the water was blue and the beach was clean. This time we drove, and parking wasn't too difficult because it was midweek, but we know from experience it's not easy at the weekends. We love the ferry ride from Circular Quay to Manly. Arriving by ferry to Manly is a delight - you see it in all of its splendour. It really is a lovely place. .

Sydney's most amazing beach. I'm a local resident and regularly walk from Queenscliff Beach to Shelley Beach (via the iconic Manly Beach) and back again, and believe this is one of the best walks/locations on the planet. This is an ideal location and highly recommended to any Sydney visitors (just jump on the Manly Ferry and visit Manly Beach). You can also incorporate a lunch at one of many beachside locations.

Good beach for surfing, sunning, families and fun. A lovely ferry ride from Circular Quay Manly is a great beach . Less crowded and less touristy than Bondi. The ferry ride from the city is outstanding! The views of the Harbour, the Opera House, the Bridge and the beautiful houses along the waterfront priceless!Manly is a beachy town and can get a bit loud and touristy and in the night there is a bit of a drinking culture.It's a great place for swimming, and surfing. The boardwalk is perfect for a morning run or afternoon walk. Good beach for families and childrenWalk around to Shelly Beach and up to North Head for an amazing view.

Great Beach to Visit. Manly is a great place to visit, you can drive there although parking is limited, or you can arrive by ferry. Plenty of shops, bars, cafes and restaurants to choose from. The harbour beach is nice, along with the ocean beach. Highly recommend the walk around to Shelly Beach, nice views back to Manly Beach, and if your lucky you might even spot some Water Dragons. Restaurants & Cafes are located at Shelly Beach. It is also a great place to swim or snorkel.
Austrlias Best City Beach By Day. A great spot to visit during the day, amazing overall spot to watch the sun rise, the waves roll in.

A mornings walk at Manly. Watching the sun rise or soon after is a must for tourists to see the early morning swimmers, in their pink bathing caps, swimming from manly surf club to fairy bower beach and back. On the walk you will see, hidden in the walk side gardens the water dragons posing for the tourists. Many mums and dads, coffees in hand pushing the little ones in prams and strollers, bike riders, and oldies (like me enjoying the fact they can get up and walk,) greeting the day with smiles.Manly is a real tourist spot and should not be missed, lots of cafes, take a ways and enjoying the ferry ride to get there is all part of a days travel exerience. Makes one glad to be alive.
Superb!. World class beach with heaps of pretty fit people all around.Shops and restaurants nearby to cater for everyone's needs.Provides a real holiday feeling, especially in summer.
Great beach. This was a great trip to the beach . The area is clean and inviting . We rented bikes and rode up & down the coastline on a bike trail .

Great Day Out. We took the regular ferry to Manly beach. The ferry is old and if you cannot find a space outside is not so enjoyable. I liked Manly and the shops along the way to the beach. We hired a lounger for 3 hours which was just fine for time. I actually preferred Bondi beach itself - the sand is nicer. Nothing much else to say - a day at the beach is a day at the beach - but a lovely beach in the sunWould recommend
Nice part of Sydney. Manly is a lovely part of Sydney. Beautiful beaches, nice cafees and restsurants. From Sydney center only 25 minutes by ferry.
Great beach. This is a really nice beach, and the area around it is also nice bit feels like lots of locals frequent it, which is nice. Well worth the visit. The ferry ride over is really cool.
Great beach. Walking down the Corso brings you to the beach. I preferred this to Bondi. Lots of local market stalls very close by too.

Surfing, Relaxing. Brilliant place to visit, make sure you are packed for the day. Get on the beach book a surf lesson or just hire a board and go for it the beach is very clean and the water is a little rough but absolutely perfect. If you walk down the beach you come to a small cove in the corner with rocks to climb upon for that perfect holiday picture..I highly recommend Manly
Old. We came here 20 years ago and it now looks dated and old. Full of surfers and teenagers and the beach was closed for swimming!
Clean place to visit. Impressed with cleanliness of this public beach! Beautiful views, especially sunsets. Would liked to have had more time in Sydney and on this beach.

Pleasant day on the beach. Nice beach to spend the day. You can go by the stores on main street, the market, there are nice restaurants around. Also the charm of getting the Ferry Boat from the Circular Quay to get there.

A Beautiful Beach with shade. I travelled from Circular Quay by ferry and arrived at Manly after about a 30 minute commute. I walked through the Mall and bought an ice cream, crossed the road and sat under the trees and enjoyed the view. I then had a beer at the North Styne Hotel. A great day.
A must visit. . Manly beach is a must visit for anyone. The beach is stunning with a lovely feel to it. It's safe and spacious.The facilities are all there but not in your face!

Beautiful Relaxing Escape from the City. One of the most beautiful beaches I've visited. Packed full of restaurants, shops, water sports and anything else you could need for a fantastic day in the sun. Head over early as the ferry and beach can get very busy in the afternoons.

Hip Beach with lots to do. Beautiful sandy beach with great surf. A large number of signs warning about swift currents but there were lifeguards around and dozens of people swimming and surfing. Water was colder than expected but it was just the beginning of the summer season. Had a great afternoon walking along the surf watching the surfers, and finished it off with some cold pressed juice across the street.

nice little afternoon visit. even if beaches aren't your thing. Lots of little shops and eateries. Nice pharmacies where I was able to pick up Australian and New Zealand products (Manuka creams which I decided to bring back as gifts). Accessible with the manly fast ferry, local sydney ferry and hop on and hop off ferries ( associated with the hop on and hop off busses)

Beautiful emerald green and turquoise blue waters. The ease of access and choice of hotels on this beach made me resolve to come back and stay here for a couple of nights the next time I visit Sydney. A day trip here is just not enough!The restaurants lining the waterfront offer the choicest of cuisines. We opted for spicy Mexican and we weren't disappointed at all! The ferry ride to Manly is equally picturesque.

"Make this a must visit beach". This beach is always on our list to visit as it has great sand wit good facilitys with changing near to beach. The current can be a problem for swimming but there is a safe lifeguard area for this. Surfing is good to watch with competitions on occasionally. Shops just off it for food and drink on the corso.
Stunning!. What a beach! So much going on too! Wonder the prom or try the surf or beach volleyball if you wish - just the beauty of the bay makes this a fantastic spot

beautiful beach for a nice walk or surf. I went to Manly beach twice on my last trip to Sydney. My husband surfed while I just strolled along the beach. It was a beautiful spring day in Sydney. I walk pass by so many joggers, tourists and surfers. The beach was long and sandy, it was such a pleasant walk to see all the people exercising on the grass and so many people picnic with family there. There are so many restaurants choices too along the water.

EHK. Spent a full afternoon at Manly beach. Plenty of shopping, gift shops, coffee shops. One of the most beautiful beach that Australia have. Excellent weather with a cool sunny day. We had dinner at one of the local residents overlooking the beach. Spent in forgettable romantic time.

Nice beach and nice town. There are nice restaurants along the beach. It's easy to get to Manly by taking a ferry from Circular Quay by the Sydney Opera House. The ferry ride is about half an hour. On the day we went, the last ferry back to Sydney was about 1 a.m. When you get off the ferry, there will be a small beach. This is NOT the beach you're looking for. Take a short walk through town and you will get to the real beach. There were a lot of surfers there the day we went.
Great Beach. This is an excellent beach to walk along and chill on, good cafes near by and plenty of activities to do round about.
Wow what a beach!. This is a fantastic beach with something for everyone. Clean, soft yellow sand and a surf. Great walks, well supported by great cafes and shops

STROLL ALONG THE ESPLANADE OR TAKE A SWIM. Manly Beach is beautiful. Sun bakers, surfers, school children all enjoying themselves at this iconic Sydney beach. Take a stroll to Fairy Bower Beach, where you will find gentle waters to take a dip in the Pacific Ocean. Food lovers will like this place as there are plenty of restaurants to choose from. Definitely worth the time to explore this place.

Great views. I went for a run along the front at Manly beach. Such a great place with beach volleyball courts and lots of surfing going on. Makes for a lovely run, water fountains are situated along the front which is handy for runners.
Beautiful beach. We took the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly. The beach was a short walk from the wharf and it was a beautiful place to spend the afternoon!
Sunday visit. Take Sunday ferry as you can go as many times as you like for 2,50 dollars. Very busy but worth going if you have time. Lots of restaurants and beautiful people in the wharf.

First time visit . Our family was here for the first time back in August. Had a wonderful evening with some great friends. It was actually our first beach visit in Australia! Our 15 year old loved it.

Nice beach. Great place for relaxing and a fun day out with family and friends. Love the waves and cool sea breeze. Will be better if the washrooms have shower facilities cos the one I went to did not have.

A city beach. Manly is a beautiful beach I know I live here! It is however a city beach and with good ferry access from Sydney it is always going to be overcrowded. With that comes expensive prices for everything as well. They do keep the beach nice and clean but you only see that at 5.30am! If you want a beautiful quiet beach, manly is not the place to go. If you want a city beach and don't mind crowds then manly is for you. Good for learning to surf and people watching.

One of the most beautiful beaches seen. Manly is really beautiful. The way to the beach is indeed amazing going through its marketplace with fountains, good beach stuff shopping. Beach water is little rough but locals do lot of water sports here.

Visited it dozens of times. The two things that make Manly Beach are the Corso area that leads to the beach, and the walk from Manly to Shelley Beach. The Corso is lovely looking and great for kids to splash out, eat, shop or just sit and people-watch. The walk to Shelley Beach is a leisurely 15 minutes and quite lovely. There are little touches along the way, small sea animal figurines placed along the way so good to keep your eyes open to the surroundings.

Super beach. Lovely clean sandy beach to relax on. Wore 50 sun cream and still got some colour so not much shade around. Sea is lovely and clean but can have some strong currents so take care if not a strong swimmer. There are plenty of lifeguards around and the beach does get busy especially on a Sunday morning when there are lots of swimming classes and surfing lessons for children. As with all busy places, take care with your possessions as the lifeguard did announce one day that some belongings had been taken. Whilst we were on the beach, we saw many bags left unattended.Worth a visit.
Lovely, family friendly beach!. Lovely beach located at the end of the Manly shopping mall, family friends and lifesavers patrol the beach. Well worth a visit if in manly.

Lovely Beach. Definatley worth a ferry over from Sydney Harbour. Very pretty, clean beach. Lots of choice of places to eat and drink. Next time I would probably book a room for the night and stay over as it looks as though it would be a nice place to spend an evening eating and drinking.
Just perfect. A beautiful beach area with plenty of shopping and rests for all tastes and pockets. Better than Bondi IMHO and worth a visit.

Really nice clean beach. Great facilities, lots of life guards present, and it's a real pleasure to get to via Ferry from Sydney. The beach can get crowded but you can always find a spot to settle. There isn't much shade on the beach so be careful of too much sun.
Stunning. On a warm Saturday morning we watched the surfers and enjoyed a coffee in this beautiful place. Get the Ferry from Darling Harbour.

Lots to Do. Took a ferry to Manley. The beach was very nice, wide and pretty calm. There was a lot of restaurants in Manly of varied menus. The toen has a lot of shopping and has an open air market on the weekend. We had a really good day in Manly.
Worth a ferry from Sydney Harbour. Enjoyed a stroll around Manley before embarking on a mini bus tour. Lots of historical places to see .
Iconic Beach. If the weather is right then a visit to Manly Beach is a must...great sandy beach...if you are a poor swimmer then be aware of the rips that sometimes occur here...

Waiting to check in. If you arrive early in the morning into Sydney, while waiting to check in to your hotel, you can take the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly Beach. From the ferry you can get great shots of the bridge and opera house, enjoy the refreshing cool sea breeze and have some fish and chips in Manly. While away the morning, and get to see the harbour without having to pay the high price of the harbour cruise.

Surf watch!. A lovely, quiet beach -- ten minutes' walk from Manly Wharf. Grab yourself some fish'n chips on your way down here and sit on the steps and watch the surfers catch their waves. A lovely way to spend an afternoon!

Beautiful beach setting. Manly Beach, looking out at the Ocean is always a bit of a thrill. Easy to get to from central Sydney on the ferry we always enjoy the short walk down the Corso to the attractive beachfront to watch the world go by. Plenty of cafes and restaurants too.

Lovely Day Trip. We took the Manly Ferry to the town of Manly and loved the town and the shops. It was sunny and warm, the beach clean and white. We stopped at one of the local pubs and enjoyed a pint while looking at the beautiful beach. Much less crowded than Bondi Beach.

A great day at the beach. This is by far the best beach in my opinion. Step off the ferry, cross over the road and follow the pedestrian walk way to miles of golden sand and surf. Free wifi available on the beach too. Just beautiful.
Favourite beach in Oz. Bohemian vibe, great to watch the world go by or try surfing. Plenty of shops and cafes. Nice walk to Cabbage Beach just around the corner.

Manly ferry and beach - good half day out. get the ferry from Circular quay, A$15 return, nice to see the sights along the river, Manly bigger place than expected and beach is clean and not too busy, if you walk to the far end, as sun very powerful, only managed to stay for a couple of hours, but that was enough.

Better than Bondi!. I booked a hotel in Manly after Wotif told me I could get a luxury 3 bedroom apartment for the price of a good hotel in the city. What a great decision I made! I'd never been to Manly before, I didn't even really know it existed. I've been to Bondi many times and Manly just takes the cake. It's less crowded, has a better shopping strip with better cafes, fantastic views of the surrounding capes, and cheaper, more varied accomodation. Not to mention the ferry from the CBD has spectacular views of all the landmarks from the harbour!

Not so white sand. If anyone been to those Island at Thailand, you might realize that the sand at Manly beach is not so white and it feel too soft to walk properly. However, it is still a good place to enjoy and relax, no matter you are swimming or surfing or just sitting at seaside.
Paradise!. most beautiful place Manly!If you are lucky you can spot penguins on the beach! very peaceful and refreshing place

Better than Bondi!. I'm not a surfer, which is why I believe this beach is better than Bondi. There are fewer people, smaller waves (easier to swim) and more sand. Access to the beach front shops, restaurants etc is easier too.

Favourite beach. Fantasti beach in a chilled area. Its a great place to visit especially if you take the eco hopper during the day from darling or circular quay. You get a great trip and too see the areas outside the main parts of sydney. The area is lovely with some great fish and chip shops. Also good picnix areas although the seagulls can be a pest. Definately recommend this area and plan to visit more often

Quintessential NSW Australia. This is a beach for everyone. You can surf, snorkel, ride a bike, swim, and was for Kms. There are place to eat and things to see. It has pedestrian shopping areas and great supermarkets and the there is the very!Pity about the politics!
Large beach with plenty to see. We didn't swim here due to the weather but is a lovely beach with plenty of shops nearby and lots to see and do

Alaways a great View. Whenever in Sydney you should take the time to visit Manly Beach. From Downtown you can take a quick Ferry from Circular Quay to Manly. Once on the strip, a cold beer and some lunch, then complete the stroll to Manly and enjoy the surf.

A day at Manly. We arrived at Manly via the ECOHOPPER via the 9 other destinations but you could easily take the fast ferry straight from Circular Quay( about 20 minutes) we took the fast ferry back! What a beautiful spot and a casual stroll up the Corso leads to many beautiful shops, cafès, pubs and restaurants and Manly Beach. Even found a beautiful old welcoming church. There is definitely something for everyone here. I was pleasantly surprised by the restaurant and Cafe prices there. Very affordable.

Lovely beach. Caught the ferry from Sydney to Manly beach and I'm so glad I did. What a beautiful place, there is a lovely walk round the beach area. So glad I visited. Lots of places to eat, drink or snack. Well worth a visit

A Sunday walk. Manly is a place you can visit any time of the year. It's great to stroll along the beach, grab a bite to eat at manly grill, do a spot of shopping at the weekend markets or simple to relax with a three beans coffee. Manly has something to offer for everyone and is a must to visit when in Sydney. If traveling in from the city catch the ferry from circular quay.

A great side trip. We took the Ferry to Manly Beach after hitting Taronga Zoo and Darling Harbor on an "all day ticket". The beach is quite nice and there are a variety of restaurants in the area. We didn't spend much time there, but it appeared to be quite a safe and scenic beach.
Beautiful but too many people . A wonderful beach in the North. But if you wanna enjoy a more quiet day on the beach you should choose maybe Palm Beach further North!
Beautiful!. Took the Hop on Hop Off ferry & spent an hour walking on the wharf & down to the beach. Well worth the stop!
First trip too manly.. Can't wait too return. Amazing location. Very trendy. Lots of places too choose fr too eat. Beach is clean n well looked after.
Shark nets. This is a lovely beach close to Manly Ferry Wharf but for your own safety make sure that you swim within the shark nets

One of the two iconic Sydney beaches - Manly and Bondi. Manly is one of the two iconic Sydney beaches, arrive by ferry from Circular Quay, walk through the Corso and you are there, enjoy the beach and if you have time walk out to Shelley Beach and have a drink

Nice beach, good shops.. Manly is a nice day out. The beach is clean, quite busy on a hot day. Shops along the streets are interesting and varied. The smaller beach next to the ferry terminal is also nice but has a shark net :(

Forget Bondi. After going to Bondi as you must when in Sydney we took a boat to Manly and it was head and shoulders better. We had a lovely day,strolling around and had a paddle in the ocean. Much more relaxed and laid back
Alternative to the Bondi Beach. Manly offers a laid back atmosphere with many quaint small shops and beach-facing cafes. Nice beach that looks longer and less crowded than Bondi.

Very nice beach area and interesting small town. Took the ferry from the Circular Quay in Sydney NSW which took us to Manly wharf. It's only a short walk to the beach. Very fun walking around all the interesting shops along the beach. Took the walk out to the north beach site - kind of cool.

Manly in a rain-storm. Ferry trip to Manly provided more insights into Sydney's attractions; situated on a promontory across the harbour. There we saw a small museum of fine needlework and art and a terrific sea-life aquarium (feeding time for the penguins was great fun!).

Not so crowded a must see beach. If you are Sydney, you must visit this place. This is the second beach after Bondi but I liked this place more than Bondi due to very less crowd. Which actually gives some peaceful time to your self to enjoy on the beach. This beach is much bigger than Bondi beach.

Lovely beach and shops. It's a 20 minute walk from the ferry terminal to the beach but there are some lovely shops to browse along the way. We watched the school children doing their life guard courses which seem par for the course around the costal resorts. If you can , walk round to Shelly Beach and have lunch at The Boathouse - the prawns were amazing!

Manly beach. Took the ferry from Circular Quay in Sydney NSW which took us to Manly wharf. It's only a short walk to the beach. A must do is to buy fish and chips and take them to the beach and enjoy. Lots of cafe's to dine or maybe the local pub and a must buy is some fabulous ice cream. Of course a swim between the flags for your safety is not to be missed. Suggest you take water, towel, sunscreen, hat and sun glasses.

Manly is a Must See!. Every tourist visiting Sydney should include this on their itinerary! Take the ferry from Circular Quay as its a lovely way to get to Manly.Do the short walk from Manly Beach to Fairy Bower Beach which is lovely. For a drink and lunch Manly Wine on the beachfront is nice or try Daniel San or Wharf Bar. Easy to spend a fun day in Manly.....

Manly vs Bondi. It is just who you ask, but Manly and Bondi are the two strongest contenders for best and most popular beaches and surf spots in Sydney. Visit both and decide for yourself. Both also offer excellent walks along the cliffs. Manly has a bit more family chic feel to it, while Bondi is more a young crowd (Brazilians could compare this with Rio beaches of Leblon (Manly) vs Ipanema (Bondi), both great. The advantage of Manly is the extra ferry ride experience from Sydney and the choice of restaurants nearby.

Lovely area. Quaint town with lovely beach. Nice beach, lots of souvenir shops, great central walkway. A must do if you are in Syndey for a few days, better then Darhling Harbour, in my humble opinion.
Must visit. If you are in Sydney, spend half day in Manly. The trip there by ferry its amazing with nice views for photos. The beach its nice, there's plenty of restaurants to choose and shops.

Great Day Out In Sydney. To me one of the great day trips to visit in Sydney. By taking the Manly Ferry from Circular Key, next to the Sydney Opera House, for a very small ticket fee you get the BEST views in Sydney. The photos you can take of Circular Key, Sydney Opera House, Government House, the harbour islands, the beautiful Sydney Harbour itself and that is just your trip to Manly.Once you depart the ferry at Manly, you cross the road and a 200 metre walk to the Manly Beach.A great beach to swim, surf, walk and Manly itself has many many cafe's and restaurants to enjoy.I lived in Sydney for 30 years and I still love going to Manly Beach (yes, better than Bondi Beach)

Manly - worth a visit. We bought unlimited day tickets for the Sydney Ferries and took the trip to Manly. The town is a popular place for Sydneysiders to travel to for a day out. Good beaches with surf!

the best beach in sydney. Manly beach is the most awesome beach in Sydney........ forgot the ''copies''...Msnly Beach has the views... clean sand..... stunning healthy ocean.......CUTE Lifeguards to boot......lol

Manly is a Must.. Manly offers something for everyone whether you arrive by car, bus or the wonderful ferry. If you like surf, it's here. If you like the bay, it's here ( just munutes from the surf) If you like fabulous view, back toward the opera house taking in all the harbour bays & yachting activities, walk through natural wonderful bush land to North Head. If you are a walking enthusiast, check out the harbour walks either to Shelley beach then up to the lookout to see our glorious coastline or a gentle stroll from the Harbourside of Manly west along the Harbour walk to Fairlight beach while enjoying the magnificent harbour views. If you stay overnight, be sure to visit the Quarantine station Ghost Tour. There are art galleries & a great aquarium at the western end of the harbour side beach.If you are more energetic, there is a walk all the way around Middle Head to the Spit bridge where you can catch a bus back to the city. You wont find better views anywhere.After expending all that energy, there are many, many restaurants, pubs & coffee shops coffee shops where you can sit & relax while admiring the scenery. All the above are located within a short walking distance of each other so once you get here, you will be spoilt for choice & wish you had arrived earlier or staying longer.A great day or more is guaranteed.

Swim, Surf, Snorkel or Just Relax. Manly is, in my view, the best beach in Sydney. Better than its rival Bondi.Protected from prevailing southerly winds, the walk to Cabbage Tree Bay/ Shelly Beach along the oceanfront is special. Snorkel in the bay and witness the myriad of fish just off the shore.Plenty of restaurants to cater for all budgets and coffee shops abound in the side streets. If the summer northeasterly wind blows then visit the Harbourside beaches for more of a European experience and feel. Visit and you won't be disappointed and will return I am sure.

One of my favourite beaches to visit. I have been to this beach a few times and it is a great little get away. It is clean and just beautiful. Easy to reach from Sydney CBD but parking insn't always easy.

Beautiful beach and area. Visited here for a day whilst staying in Sydney and actually wished we had stayed for a few days. The beach was stunning and set in amongst a lovely area of cafes, shops and bars. It was very low key compared to bondi but ten times better. Very clean and a lovely journey by boat to get here from Sydney. Definitely worth a visit.

Lovely beach . Lovely beach. We spent some time there and it was quite pleasant. There are some pay areas for children alongside the walking paths, and a few beach volleyball courts set up for whoever wants to play. Life guards seemed to be very proactive too. I really liked it.
Best Beach Ever. I love this place. The beach is wide, clean and long. It has a wide 'boardwalk' and I wish I could live here.
Beautiful beach. The Beautiful and clean beach in Sydney. A lot of restaurants and Cafe along the beach. The idea for perfect brunch on Saturday /Sunday afternoon.
A bit like bondi. ... Nothing special but worth a wander since you are already at manly.It's right at the end of the street across from the manly wharf, about 10mins walk through the shops

Always great. I've lived in manly for the past two years and now that we're planning our return to Texas I'm beginning to see all the things I'll miss.One tip, visit on a weekday if you can, the weekends get insane with ferry after ferry of visitors meaning waits in the restaurants. Weekdays are quiet and beautiful. The walk up to North Head is fantastic and the views are amazing. The food in Manly isn't great, but then again if you just want good food why go through the hassle of going to Manly :) The views are the selling point, simply stunning.

MANLY BEACH. Most visitors to Sydney head for Bondi Beach simply because it was touted a surfing mecca. Let me tell you to forget Bondi with it's grubby side walks, small crowded beach full of backpackers & dangerous rips. Head for Circular Quay for a relaxing half hour ride on the Manly ferry, watching the length of Sydney Harbour slip by until eventually you dock at Manly Wharf. Cross the road into the Manly Corso & wander up the length of this beachside village until you get to the ocean laid out in front of you. A 1.5km beach spreads itself as far as the eye can see to Queenscliff. Turn left along the beach front & wander down towards the best surf life saving club in Australia. Manly Life Saving Club is the earliest surf life saving club on the north shore, beginning around 1903. Feel free to walk into this club house & view the amazing history of the club & that of swimming & surfing here. You'll be very welcome by any club member & most probably be invited up stairs to the awesome sun deck, which views over the length of the beach & further up the coast. This is a relatively safe beach, so have a swim, whilst our professional life guards watch over you. No lives have been lost on this beach for very many years. Wander back up the beach until you get back to the Corso. Cross the road & head into one of the oldest pubs here, the Steyne Hotel & imbibe a schooner or two of icy cold ale. Manly Beach, God's country...!!

Always pleasant year round. I go to Manly a few times a year and it is a clean, friendly beach that's great for everyone.Personally I prefer winter as even on a sunny day you pretty much have the beach to yourself.

The Best Beach in The Sydney City Area. Stayed in Manly with the Great Britian Masters Rugby League Touring team . Maybe a little far out from Central Sydney , but Manly has everything needed for a realaxing stay, Bars Restraunts Shops etc ,while the beach is arguably the best around Sydney , certainly more appealling to me than Bondi .While here went swimming in the sea which , following my trip to California in 2013 ,means that I have swam on both sides of the Pacific Ocean .
nice area. we in our 60's brought the age group up byat least 20 years but still enjoyed seeing it. Had a great dinner Not a "must see".

Really Relaxed Atmosphere. I've visited Manly Beach a few time. It a nice change as a bit of a break from Sydney. A few nice Sushi trains that are pretty reasonably priced. We also found a Mexican right outside the ferry station, I think it's a chain but it does a burrito that will blow your socks off!
Great beach close to the city. Just a beautiful beach close to the city! Not as crowed as Bondi, but we were able to buy lots of surf gear and enjoy a beautiful day in there!

Cool place to hang out. It was a really nice beach with a promenade teeming with shops and restaurants. You can also just sit on the steps and watch the day go by with the cool breeze. I imagine it to be more packed in the summer.

Good beach to go to. The beach is nice, so many people there surfing or having sun tan.It is easy to get to and not as busy as Bondi. It is more like a local beach for me. People who go there are mainly local people.

Food in the Sun. . Better than Bondi, Cooler than Cipher.
Manly Corsica & Manly Beach has it all.
The hotels offer excellence in atmosphere and the local restaurants all are superb.
Enjoy a day out at Manly.

A great way to spend a couple of hours.... Its not the biggest beach around but its very different from other Sydney beaches ...Manly is lovely & different & the beac is similar in vein. Sit & watch the surfers ,eating fish & chips on the front ,but of course watch the gulls ..!!

What a dream!. Get up at 5:00 am and go jogging with all the Aussies going surfing, jogging, rowing at the crack of dawn. Breathe the fresh air and enjoy the simple, unpretentious, genuine local way of life. If you go into the right place you can even buy a beer - but not in the super market... What a great place to live and work in - or even to commute to Sydney from - half an hour to the harbour on the ferry, a real treat.

Good place to see the Harbour and the Ocean all in one trip.. Easily accessible by ferry and a pleasant ride. We found food and drink prices to be quite reasonable and lots of good spots to dine on the ocean side with outside seating. Very clean town and ocean beach. One can get there by car but we recommend the ferry as part of the experience.

Manly Beach.. A ferry trip to Manly is a must dofor all vitors to Sydney not only for Manly itself but also for the great photo opportunities of the harbour, the bridge and the opera house. Manly itself has a great laid back feel to it and has many bars, restaurants and shops. The beach is stunning, clean, has lifeguards and safe swimming areas.

Beautiful Beach a Short Ferry Ride from Circular Quay. One of the nice beaches that is a short ride from downtown Sydney is Manly Beach. Once off the boat take a short 7 minute walk the beach which had cafes and bars nearby. If you are energetic, walk to the right a short distance to Shelly Beach which is smaller but less crowded and in most folks eyes, the prettier of the two beaches. Take a bottle of wine or a cold beer with a snack and enjoy the day
Nice beach. A beach with very fine sand. There is as well a shop to rent surf boards.It's just next to the center of Manly. You can reach it easy from Sydney by ferry.Nice place to relax.

Manly Beach is famous right around the world. I was about 12 years old when my mother bought me to Manly on a bus trip from Newcastle and I immediately fell in love with the beach and its environs. Its beautiful golden sand and is lined with tall pine trees. I then decided that this is where I want to live when grown up. If you wish for something long enough, it comes true and now I have been a resident since 1973. Cities are nice places to visit. Manly is where you come to visit and never want to leave. If you cannot come and live here, then definitely come for a visit and take some photos to remind you of the time you visited one of the worlds most beautiful beaches. Manly Beach NSW Australia.

Great daytime excursion. Leave the bustle of the city to experience the laid back atmosphere of Manly Beach. Rent a bicycle and head out to North Head, but mind that first incline! The second one is a doozy as well!
Nice ferry ride to Manly. They say this is the best beach in Australia. I don't know, maybe we weren't there at the right time of year. It is hugh, its nice but I have seen better

Better than Bondi. I visited both Manly and Bondi beaches, and I have to say that Manly was better. There is beaches both sides so even when it was really windy, the beaches on the other side were a nice and warm places to be.

Arrived day after the Cyclone hit. We flew into Sydney in the Cyclone!!! The next day it was still raining we took a tour of the City and visited Manly. The surf was extreemly churned up and the sand was all the way back to the street. The water and sand had gone through the beach buildings and everyone was busy cleaning up.

love this place. this is a great place to visit. great beach. awesome snorkelling from shelly beach round to main beach. good walks onto north head to watch the sunset. great cafes and restaurants and plenty of accomodation.
Beach. What a beach this was a great place to swim and for suffering lovely white sands great for family. Lots to do best to get the ferry from Circular Quary very cheap. Place to eat and shop.
A good alternative . Manly beach is a good alternative to Bondi. But smaller and not so crowded. We enjoyed strolling on the beach and sip a coffee in a coffeehouse near by.
Small but fun. Not as big and busy as Bomdi but great place to visit even if for a short day trip. The beach is clean and child friendly with plenty to do.

Beachin'. Very big and beautiful beach. It has very nice restaurants lined up along the beach which makes it a very easy place to be in. There is possibility to rent surf boards. Its the ideal for friends and family.

More birds than people when we came:). We just love ferry-accessible Manly Beach! Aside from the wide clean beach, there's Ben & Jerry's ice cream, fish & chips to buy, Coles supermarket and Hungry Jacks nearby, and sports & souvenirs shops having sales. There's an Aldi by Manly Wharf, too. Swimming, eating, and shopping in one go:)

Family friendly beach except for the hungry seagulls!. Good clean beach, golden sand, sea not too rough except in one place where the surfers were enjoying themselves, elsewhere for an Austrain beach fairly safe with not much undertow.

Beautiful but remember its a city beach!. This place is great and has everything around it for you to stay all day. It obviously gets very busy because it is a city beach where everybody goes. If going in the ocean be sure to stick to the swimmers side so you dont interrupt the sufers....you'll get hit.

Catch the ferry across!. After catching the ferry to Manly, which is great, it is good to walk around the Harbour side for sightseeing. It is well worth the walk to Manly beach, which takes 10mins.If you enjoy shopping, there are quite a few to enter. Many cafes & restaurants, with many that have outdoor seating. Being a coastal area, lots of fish & chip shops offering fresh produce.Don't forget your swimmers if you enjoy a day at the beach & there are safe flags to swim between.You could spend an hour here, 2 hours, half a day or a full day soaking up the experience. Relaxing & pleasurable.
Great Surf Town.. Great little surf town with clean wide beach and many sidewalk cafes. Good place to rent bikes. Easy ferry ride to and from Sydney Harbor

Better Than the Others. If you are trying to choose between Manly Beach and one of the others in and around Sydney, you must do Manly. I particularly agree with those who say that it's better than Bondi. It has everything that Bondi has with a more calm and relaxed feeling. People at Manly seem as though they want to be there where as people at Bondi seem as though they have to be there.

Manly beach. For several years I have been going to manly every week or so to mind a grandchild. The beach is a popular place for all, beautifully clean with lots of amenities, eateries and coffee shops. A short walk down the Corso from the ferry, with lots of attractions along the way. A must for the visitor to Sydney.

A “Must go” point in NSW. Simply took the 30-minute ferry from Circular Quay to Manly Wharf, then 10-minute walk via Corso, you could see the gorgeous view of Manly Beach. Just enjoy the sunshine & breeze there.

Absolutely the best!. Manly Beach is WAYYY better than Bondi Beach. Very well organized, clean and accessible. Lots of activities (anything from surfing to high-end shopping). Very lively and pleasant. (and, by the way, the commute to Manly -- by ferry -- is a lot more pleasant than driving/commuting to Bondi).

Good place for a swim and a barbecue . Together with some friends we had a barbecue in the weekend at one of the free barbecues that are provide by the city. It's a nice place to swim. If you walk the path to the cliffs you can spot many lizards.
Good waves. Great waves, great surveillance by the surf guards in yellow and red. Lots of activities: kids training, bloody long walk, surfing...nice relaxed atmosphere.

Lovely Day to Manly. Visited Manly Beach and Shelly Beach but stop short of covering going into the Sydney Harbour National Park. Weather was extremely hot with clear blue sky. We were also not attired for the narrow pathway into the Park. Walk along the two beaches was fantastic with very scenic view and photography.Do take an umbrella on a very hot day and carry a bottle of drinking water.

Year round simple pleasure and delight!. Young or old, with or without company, Manly the must see place to go, experience, enjoy! Walk The Corso, take the ferry, sit awhile, smell the clean air, walk to Shelly Beach watch for penguins or a beaching whale. Hire a bike, roller skate, eat an ice cream, just sit, relax, wind down with a great coffee, maybe a wine. Pack a picnic although plenty of eateries available close by on either end of The Corso, from Italian to African to Bulgarian to basic good fish & chips, Scandinavian ice-cream and all inbetween a pub or two. Promenade with a wheel chair, pram, easy access, parking available. Great shops for a swimsuit, towel, sandals, hat, newspaper, book, postcard. Bring your camera, allow time to Relax, enjoy! Ferries available every 30 mins. so no stress either end. A simple 'must do' when in Sydney for a day, week, yearly, with or without kids, friends, family.
I wans't impressed. Nice Ferry ride to average beach town with packed beaches- not inviting.I did enjoy lunch at The Pantey, small 2nd floor restaurant overloooking beach with very good food.

Great beach!. We loved our visit at Manly Beach. It is easily reached via a 30-minute ferry ride from Sydney. The main street, Corso, is filled with shops, restaurants and hotels. Looking forward to going back!

Nice place. Manly Beach is lovely. We were there in the morning and found it to be very quiet. There were a few people exercising on the esplanade. We imagine it would get busier as the day go on.To be honest we prefered the Ferry side of Manly.

One of the Must see places in Australia. Bondi gets most the international publicity as THE BEACH in Australia, but Manly is WAY better. The surf at Fairy Bower when it's big can be almost world class. Probably the second best wave in Sydney when it's doing its thing.The night life is great - awesome pubs both beach and harbour sides. Good restaurants. Shelly beach is a must to checkout. Great shops. The Manly Ferrys to the CBD are also a must. Would be a great place to live, especially if you're in your 20's.

Surfer's paradise. A much bigger and longer beach than Bondi, although you would have to take a half an hour ferry ride from circular quay. The wave seems to be stronger, so probably a better place to do surfing if you wish. Along the market street there are lots of shops selling swim wear and surfing equipment. A nice and young place to hang out.

Not just for tourists. The more you visit this beach, the more you find more and more locals also spend time with small children there despite it is a weekday. One reason could be the friendly walkway besides the beach which is wide and safe for children. One of the best.

The best beach in Sydney. Manly beach is a great beach and offers literally kms of sand, surf and fun from Shelly Beach to Queenscliff. Bondi beach pales in comparison. But frankly Bondi being famous does us a favour as everyone goes to see it and this leaves more of Manly Beach for us! The beach is a short walk from the main concourse of restaurants, pubs, shops and eateries. There are also pharmacies, banks and bureau de change as well as places offering surf and bicycle equipment for hire. They have a great market on the Sunday, plenty of events (Food & Wine Festival, Jazz Festival, International Surf Comps, Volleyball comps as well as 8 volleyball courts which are a hive of activity on the weekend.
Spend the day here. Lovely sea breezes, great views, plenty of nice places to eat and drink and only 20 mins from Sydney by ferry. A must do if you're in town.
love it. it has become a commercial place for the tourist.so many places to go to and the best part is the trail walk.many places to shop and eat at.

Great Iconic Beach. The beach is readily accessible by bus or car but if a visitor to Sydney I would suggest catching the ferry from Circular quay.Once there, there are a myriad of cafes, pubs and restaurants to enjoy a drink or meal. The promenade lined with trees makes a great frontage to the beach itselfBe warned that it can get very crowded on a weekend.

Must Visit!!. It is one of the happening areas in sydney.
Outside the manly beach are amazing restaurants to enjoy your evenings.
I would suggest to take the ferry from circular quay to manly beach to make ur visit more interesting
Go on a nice day!. We went on a wet and windy day so the beach was empty and only a few surfers in the water. The place would be stunning in the sun so be sure to pick the right day.
Beautiful area. What a lovely beach in main resort and lots of small coves nearby for family friendly barbecues. Busy town area but lots of lovely little shops.
One of the best beaches in the world. Not just sand and surf, lots to do around Manly. Walk along foreshore, walk to North Head, Walk around harbour, restaurants, bars.....

Best beach in Sydney.. Best beach in Sydney. If you wand the buzz sit at the end of the Corso, if you want peace and quite walk north until you get to a quiet spot. If you want waves head where the surfers are if you want flat water go to the southern corner or the rock bath at the northern (Queenscliff) end. Its all there. Buzzing and full in Summer empty and lonesom in Winter take your pick.

Mature lady. Get the ferry over from Circular Quay, from there walk around to Shelley Beach. A new Restaurant called the Boat House lunch is a must. Or have lunch at the Brighton Hotel on the corso . Or just get fish & chips and eat on the beach front. It really is a slice of heaven .

Nice spot!. The ferry from Circular Quay to Manly during the day and back during the night is one of the must-do's on a Sydney trip....nice eating and shopping options near the beach....met some very warm people at the place....good feel of the sea in a warm setting!

Do yourself a favour. And spend 1 full day in Manly (not talking about just the beach). Regardless of whether is it a 1 day trip or more, this place is a must-go for me. It triumphs over Blue Mountain, Watson Bay, Opera House, Taronga and even Bondi and Congee beach walk. Manly has so much to offer.What I like:1. Front row alfresco seating on Manly Ferry from Circular Quay2. Cycling along Manly beach to national park3. Best coastal view in Sydney4. 4 pines beer and fish and chips5. Whale watching on a speedboatThere is just so many things to do here.
Loved everything about it. Manly stole or hearts - saw a surfing competition too! Beautiful beach area and wonderful wee place!
Fun surfer town. We took the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly. Walked around the shops and along the path to Shelly Beach. Lovely little beach.
<3. A 3km long beach with beautiful sand. Great spot that one shouldn't miss if visiting Sydney, Australia. I want to go back so bad!

Eating Place of Value... The Ivanhoe Hotel in the Corso. Friends from nearby Avalon/Palm Beach joined us for a lunch in Manly Beach for special memories of our earlier Wedding Honeymoon in this panoramic location. The Ivanhoe Hotel is a famous eating place offering a wide eating cuisine for travelers from around Australia and International visitors to Sydney Harbour.

Every time we walk along Manly Beach it is different and wonderful . We regularly walk along the beach from Queenscliff to Shelley Beach and it is a always good , the sea , is always acting , looking different. The surfers , the beach volleyball, the fitness trainers and their groups , the locals and the tourists make it a great place to sit and enjoy and people watchThere are plenty of places for coffee , breakfast, lunch and dinner I would recommend to anyone coming to Sydney to check out Manly Beach ( in particular the ocean side )

day visit. Went there last Sunday just a wonderful clean beach markets are on every weekend in the manly Corso and plenty of good quality places to dine only one thing spoiled it a bit was we went into tommy Bahamas and there were 2 staff on didn't get a greeting or can i help you nothing amazing as we were the only customers in store sure get better service in America .
Manly Beach!. Make sure to pack your surfboard because this is an excellent beach for surfers.If you don't know how to surf make sure to visit The Manly Surf School.

Must go!. The area around Manly beach is beautiful and to walk around is an experience waiting to happen.The walk from the ferry point to the beach is barely 10 mins and on your way to the beach you are bound to find many food joints that will tempt you.Even a wine store! :D

Spend a lovely half day for full day on this upscale island. Reachable by ferry from Sydney. Beautiful beaches if a bit windy. Great shopping with many bargains at the discount/souvenir stores and pharmacies you will encounter on the main drag. There are also dozens of restaurants offering very reasonably priced fare. We stopped a random sandwich shop and had delicious food.

Lovely even when you don't swim. It was mid autumn (fall) and the beach was reasonably quiet. A bit too cold to swim though one or two were out in the water. I could imagine if the weather had been 27 degrees Celsius (80 F) rather 20 degrees (68 F), there would have been a lot more people on the beach and out on the water. The broadwalk was busy, the shops nearby doing a brisk trade so it was still a great place to visit and the mall was filled with interesting performers. It was daytime and we felt safe and the children were kept amused by the playgrounds and the running along the sand.
MANLY. Usually clean and safe for family's. Can get jellys on the sand at night so be careful where you walk
You can choose your activity!. Long beach to walk, to play volleyball and relax too! I prefer this one to Bondi even if you live in the city is more far to reach!
manly is the best. i love manly beach because it is so much nicer and relaxing to noisy and crazy bondi beach so go to manly for sure
Love Manly Beach. October long weekend and the place was packed. Still managed to get a spot on the beach. Busy but no complain the sun was shining.

Good but crowded. We visited Manley Beach on a Saturday. The beach was good but was crowded.It seems to be for young people, not for families with small kids. Parking was limited and quite expensive at $10 per hour. Maximum 2 hours allowed. After 2 hours have to come back and buy another ticket! Roads around are quite congested, took long time to get out.Not recommended to visit by car on weekends, public transport should be ok. However if you are looking for a beach in the City this may be an option, otherwise choose another beach.

Beautiful white sand beach, but windy.. Beautiful white sand beach, very find sands. However, it can be very windy. It has 15 miles per hour wind when we were there. It's spring, and the water was very cold.
stop over. Visited here whilst on wy to the Gold coast to see friends. Nice beach as you would expect. clean and lovely friendly people
Great place to get away from the grind. Great place for a day trip to the beach if you want to get away from the daily grind of Sydney. If you are not a beachside like we are then this is great.

beautiful Manly Beach. we have visited Manly Beach and surrounds many times and never get sick of going there for lunch coffee to look at the shops or just to the beach night time busy and good lots of interesting things going on to see parking a bit of a problem

Sunny Manly. It was our first time visiting Manly. Was there to join in the Manly Jazz festival. It was filled with crowds with many activities taking place at the same time, including the Jazz festival, a bazaar etc. The place is recommended for those who want to get close to the seaside. There is a nice seaside walk, although short and not meant for trekking. But a good view. I recommend to try the Copenhagen ice cream along the streetwalks; the ice cream was nice and huge.

Best way to treat yourself in summer. A best way to get out and a social gathering with your mates and not far from CBD and i deal for those who like surfing. Easy to get around it and preferably by Ferrie
Manly Beach. People rave about it but at the end of the day it is just a beach and one that over the years has become very tired.

Great family day out. We went during the Jazz Festival on the NRL grand final long weekend. I have never seen so many people packed into a small area. The beach has a lovely sand area with concrete steps overlooking the beach. The water was good for families on the day we were there. Lots of takeaway and restaurants within walking distance. Great all round beach area.
Go on, go for a dip. Catch the ferry over to Manly, walk through the mall to the beach. Walk the promenade and go for a swim in the surf or the sea-water pool at the end of the beach. Great place.

Not second fiddle to Bondi.... Stunning beach, great for walking, sitting or swimming. Take the time to walk both left and right when you arrive from The Corso. Much quieter that Bondi and some good restaurants.

Beautiful beach. Beautiful beach, the kind you always think of when a Brit imagines Australia. Golden sand, blue sea, full of surfers - we went during July, the middle of winter, and there were plenty of people out and about enjoying the beach. We took the Manley Ferry from Circular Quay, then enjoyed a pleasant walk along the main shopping street in Manley to the beach.

Great place for walking, swimming and eating!. If you're looking for a place close to Sydney that provides a variety of things to do, Manly is a wonderful place to spend a day, or to make your vacation base camp. On one side of town is a beautiful beach that during the summer is a great place to swim (lifeguards on duty). On the other side is a paved, waterfront esplanade where you can enjoy a walk with beautiful views of the Sydney skyline. In between are a wide-range of restaurants ranging from fast food to fine dining. We have enjoyed our visits to Manly so much, we're now talking about renting an apartment and staying there for a few months in 2017.

Day trippers. You can make it a short trip or a long trip, depending on what you do. The fast ferry from Circular quay took a mere 15mins and provides wonderful views of Sydney Harbour. This was our second visit here after a 15year break and we did notice a lot of changes around the wharf area.There are a wealth of restaurants, some can be pricey and looked very much 'Friday in crowd' however plenty of cheap eats about. Unfortunately for us, it was a very cool windy day. We had originally planned to hire bikes (as we had done it the past), but older legs and a strong head wind put us off.The Saturday Market was not as big as I had remembered and really did not take up much time.Had a lovely plate of Nachos and a few wines at the Manly Wharf hotel (family friendly), before heading back to Circular Quay.
Great place. What a jewel in Sydney's crown is Manly. A very nice, and very pleasant place to spend a day or two !!

A beautiful iconic beach. Located just north of Sydney heads Manly Beach is a long stretch of clean golden sands. The ocean is clear and the surf club is located on the south end. Well patronised by locals and tourists as well. A nice promenade runs all along with many people walking along it. Easy to get to by ferry from Circular Quay and a walk along The Corso. Well worth a visit especially on a sunny day.

Nice Beach and Great Ferry. Came on business a day early and after walking around the Opera House, hopped the #3 ferry to Manly Beach. Exceptionally hot day on a holiday weekend. The Beach was packed Lot of live music on the walk to the beach. Fun Place!!!

Lovely beach - boring market. Headed over by ferry for the day but, there wasn't that much to do so we only spent less than two hours there. The beach was lovely and was a little windy this day but there were still lots of people settling in for the day. Headed to the market which was extremely poor - not a lot of vendors. Several restaurants to eat as well as take-away options. I thought being a spot for tourists that there would have been a better selection of shops but, what was there was ok to browse in. Worth the ferry ride over though.

See This Icon of Australia for Yourself!. Synonymous with great beaches and great food, Manly Beach has been an icon of Sydney and Australia for decades. Known for its great sandy beach, the promenade, the variety of restaurants and eateries, Manly Beach draws visitors and locals by the thousands every year. If you ever visit Sydney, it would be extremely remiss of you to forego a trip to see Manly Beach for yourself. Say 'Hi' to the locals for me!!
Surfer's paradise in Sydney. Excellent beach for surfers! Big waves and salty sea water make it fun to jump in the waves. One of the best beaches in Sydney!

great if u surf. This is the beach to go to if your a surfer, if not then head to Bondi. I enjoyed my trip to Manly and Manly beach, the beach is 100% the best for surfing (so im told ), as I don't surf I just relaxed and watched those who do. The trip across on the ferry was enjoyable and I would recommend going if you have the time to do so. If your on a short time scale or not interested in surfing then id give it a miss.

Worth a visit. A bit tired and over rated. Can get very crowded. Shopping very poor considering the volume of people/ tourists that frequent the area. Better restaurants and cafés found away from the main mall.

Fantastic. So much happening, beach volleyball, surfing, swimming, walking, lots to do. Great waterside walking tracks with coffee shops and restaurants along the way.Great for families with playgrounds and picnic areas as well for the kids to play in. Lots of restaurants and ice cream parlour along the esplanade, and great shopping.Really good markets at the weekends, what more can you need. Manly is great and lots of fun.
Got to go and see! A must!. A great beach to hang out and take a swim. We dipped or toes in the water. Great food option all a rounds, plus many great shopping spots.

A BEAUTIFUL BEACH. We had a ball at this beach. The water is wonderful; but always be on the alert for sharks. When we were there they just put up a sign SHARKS SPOTTED.: so enjoy but be careful and smart.
MANLY. What Can I say about manly. Just Love it. The Beach, People, Restaurants, streets. It's an amazing and relaxed place. Nice to take Ferry from Sydney Harbour
Lovely. Get the ferry to manly and spend the day walking round the shops, watching the surfers and ferries coming and going It's a lovley little place and the ferry ride over is fantastic
Summers coming. A great place to wander or sit and enjoy a cold one. The Esplanade can get very busy with people meandering along.Lots of beach space for everyone.

Nothing special. This beach is just too big and usually crowded with people. Also, the transport to get there takes too much time... There are much nicer and quieter beaches all around Sydney to go in Sunday afternoons.

Clean patrolled beaches. Competing with near by Bondi, Manly Beach offers clean, open beaches patrolled by life savers. Parking can be a bit of a problem but can be found with a bit of a walk. Cafes and restaurants are plentiful.

Busy But Nice Beach. Even on a cold spring day Manly Beach was quite busy. I can only imagine what it it is like in the middle of summer! I can definitely see the attraction though. Manly is a quaint little town with lots of great shops and food, the beach is nice sand, and it looks like there could be some great surfing here. There are also great hiking trails along the shore off the end of the beach. For only $15 round trip on the ferry from Circular Quay it is definitely a great place to stop by.

Manly. MANLY Manly Beach is one of Sydney’s better known beach resort town. Other beach resorts stretch along the Northern Beaches to the northern coastal town of Palm Beach. Considered by locals to be the best beach for surfing, there is a school to teach surfing for first timers.It is a typically Australian seaside resort with locals having a laid back attitude and contrasting with lively activities like surfing, kayaking, playing volley ball on the beach and swimming in the sea between the marked flags. There are bike rides along the beach front or off road mountain bike adventure to Manly Dam. Manly Bike Tours offers 20 kms of dedicated bicycle tracks to explore this coastal town. There are whale watching tours during the season from mid- May to mid- November and walking adventures for walkers.Manly Wharf is a short ferry ride from Sydney’s Circular Quay, on the Sydney Ferry which passes by the Sydney Opera House and the ferry journey goes across the harbour, round Middle Head to Manly. A short stroll from Manly Wharf takes one to Manly Beach. Manly is also accessible by public transport and do take note of the times when the Spit Bridge opens for boats to pass through.There are facilities at Manly Beach such as public showers and toilets and ocean swimming pool (Babbage Tree Bay). The beach is patrolled by life guards. The surf school is located at Manly Beach and conduct lessons for those who do not have any experience in surfing at all. Manly offers quality accommodation ranging from international hotels, fully serviced apartments, motels, guest houses and back-packer accommodation. Across road from the wharf is The Corso and Esplanade where the main shopping area and places for entertainment are located. There are many souvenir shops, restaurants, cafes, bars clubs, pubs, Takeaway Cafes and Internet Cafes. Manly Council Surf City offers free Wi-Fi high speed wireless broadband internet access from your mobile device at hotspot locations around the Corso, Manly Wharf, Manly Art Gallery and Museum and Manly Plaza. Known only to the locals there is a colony of “Little Penguins” also known as “Fairy Penguins” inhabiting a certain area at Manly Beach. These Little Penguins come out at night to play and dance in the moonlight. They are so cute and the baby penguins look like small furry balls. When one is lucky enough to be strolling along Manly Beach at night, the appearance of these penguins is an absolute delight! A group of volunteer conservationists have taken on the task of protecting these penguins from harm from humans, cats, dogs and foxes. When the weather has been bad and the penguins could not go out to fish for food along the shallow waters of the coastline, the volunteers brought fish to feed them. These people must be applauded for their dedication. The location of this colony is a closely kept secret to preserve this colony of penguins. This colony of penguins has been declared and protected as an endangered population.A visit to Manly is recommended for travellers who wish to experience a little of the lifestyle of this seaside resort.
Great experience. A great place to spend a few hours or even the entire day. Lots of shops and restaurants and a great beach too. Access is best by ferry from Sydney.

Don't drive there, catch ferry or bus .... We drove to Manly and it was our big mistake as we couldn't find parking anywhere.Once we did it was only P30 so we couldn't fully enjoy Manly beach.It is really nice place to relax but you need few hours to do that. Still recommend to visit Manly as it is worth it.
very nice surf beach. Very nice beach, with a different appearance than Bondi beach! perfect for surfing,nice village next to Manly with real beach feeling.

Excellent for a beach outside of Queensland . When you arrive at manly beach you enter an oasis of tranquility, a pleasant change from the chaos of Sydney. The waves are clean, regular and smooth, the sand beautiful and the nearby rocks and cliffs stunning. It reminds me a bit of Caloundra with its beauty and calmness, and I suspect it would be s great place to holiday. Still, I suspect the cost would make that unreasonable, and why would you stay there when there are better beaches in Queensland? At least tony Abbott should be able to enjoy his home beach more now he has more time on his hands.

A good trip at anytime. If you are staying in the city make sure you catch the Manly Ferry to Manly. You will get a great view of the harbour, passing right next to the Opera House. When you get to Manly you can walk around the Wharf area (there are a few great restaurants) but I suggest walk along the Corso to Manly beach. There are great restaurants along the beach front or grab some takeaway and sit on the beach. If you walk to the right when you get to the beach there is a great short walk to Shelly beach which gives you a fantastic view back to Manly and up the coast.
Treat for Spring & Summer. Dont miss out this beach when you are at Sydney. Must watch and time to relax yourself during this Spring and Summer Season
Awesome Beach. A very long stretch of beautiful sand and sea. The beach can get busy on weekends in summer but is definitely worth visiting.

Better than Bondi!. There's a lot to explore in Manly- shops, restaurants, pubs, the wharf, aquarium, scenic walks and, of course, the beach. There's 2 hour free parking in the council parking lots, which is enough to see most of Manly if you're walking around. The ocean can get a little rough at times so if you're not a strong swimmer definitely stay between the flags to make it easier for the lifeguards to see you in case you get in trouble. These guys and girls do a stellar job. If you're looking for a quieter swim, walk along to Shelly Beach and have a dip there- it's much calmer. Manly's a great place to visit on a sunny day and there's plenty of places to finish your trip with a cold beer/cider/ince cream/gelato.

Take the ferry to Manly. Beach much better than Bondi.. If your time is shotr in Sydney, do this beach and not Bondi. Very relaxing overlooking ocean with loads of youthful surfers and swimmers, Popular with locals which is why it was better watching surfers here. There seemed to be fewer amateurs, Big bonus for coming here was ferry ride where you can achieve some stunning views of Sydney skyline,Opera house and Bridge.

Another great beach to visit in Sydney. Manly is very touristy like many other Sydney beaches, but it is also laid back and has something to offer any visitor. It's a great place for a swim, a bite to,eat or a relaxing walk to take in the sights

A great beach to visit, not far from the city of Sydney. Manly with many shops, great beach, sometimes great surf. This is a beach with lots of restaurants, beach volley ball, and typical Aussie beach atmosphere. A must to visit and is just a short ferry ride from Sydney, which has the best harbour in the world.
lovely beach. amazing beach...the walk to the right end into split sand beach which is amazing. would recommend anyone who is visiting Sydney to go to manly.
Nice city Beach. A nice beach a little bit out of the city noise. Pretty crowded though at the weekends. The Beach lis directly after some shops and restaurants so food is easy available.

Manly Beach & Manly Grill. Beautiful beach especially on a sunny day, with beach volleyball nets and surfers, paddle boards and sail boards etc to watch.we spent many a Sunday afternoon at the Manly Grill, enjoying a wine and beautiful meal out the fron across the road from the beach. Have to try the magnificent scallops there!the manky market was also a nice place to browse around before heading to the grill for a late lunch!

Just another beach. Have been there a few times and hoping it improves but have always been left disappointed. Beach is okay, many restaurants tend to be on the expensive side. Locals do not seem as friendly as the ones further south. Best part of the day was the ferry trip over.
Manley beach.. Lots of activities on this beach, and it always seems to be windy, with plenty of waves. lots of people, but plenty of room. Busy town behind.

Beautiful and great surfing lesson. This I would totally recommend even ahead of Bondi as a beach to go to in the city. It is pretty busy still but worth it with a good surf school and a large array of beach shops to supplement your needs.
Manly is great. Manly is definitely worth a visit, the town has great shops and eateries and the beach is lovely. Its a good day out on your own or in a group.

this is one of my preferred beach in Sydney full of fun and activities. a stunning beach in Sydney where great locals will be found. full of fantastic place to eat like one of the best famous fish & chips the beach is clean very large and safe.The Bondi beach with less tourist and more localsthroughout the year sporting events do take place.A visit at the Sydney shark aquarium is a must visit and to get there from the city a 30 minutes ferry or a fast ferry will take you.

A nice clean surf beach close to the city.. A popular Sydney beach that is a pleasant Ferry (boat) ride from the Central Business District of Sydney. The beach is patrolled and generally safe and good for families. Very picturesque with golden sand and beautiful water. Good for both surfers and swimmers. Plenty of shops and eateries nearby on the Corso.

Oh to be beside the sea. Came over from Sydney on the ferry and it was certainly different from the city. Arrived in the Ferry terminus and walked through town along the Corso to the beach. Long stretches of golden sands with some surfing schools trying their best. The weather was hot and sunny and really brought out the best in Manly. The town itself is very touristy with a lot of tacky gift shops but overall the place is very good. Would definitely recommend.
The beach. . This is the beach of all beaches. You haven't lived until you have been to manly beach. Wish we could extend Nd widen it to fit more people in :)

Lovely beach. we only had a quick visit, but it was a lovely big beach, very busy we used the toilets, and on the way to the sink my daughters leg went down the drain which had popped off due to the bubbles, so her whole leg was bruised and scratched up and almost lost her shoe, which we had to throw out anyway because the water and bubbles wrecked it

A must visit! From a biased local ....... A resident of close to 30 years, the place has gone from a much quieter beach suburb to the current hipster it is. The crowds on summer weekends and holidays can be enormous, but it is a definite 'must see' for visitors to Sydney with the ocean beach running from Queenscliff at the northern end to Manly at the southern end. But, it doesn't stop there as from Manly Beach the path continues around the water to Shelley Beach, a small but stunning swimming, snorkelling and eating spot. Then, of course, there is the harbour side where the ferry comes in, a picturesque scene with moored boats bobbing in the water, kayak & boat hire available, an aquarium and water slide & eateries aplenty including swish Hugo's and cheap eat Chat thai on the wharf, both with fantastic food.Walks? Everywhere, depending on fitness and preferred scenery but my favourites are up to North Head via the Quarantine Station and back down over the top ending at Shelley Beach. Stunning scenery, bush, historical sights. Food - well what do you want? It's here!! Every conceivable cuisine & often multiples of some. All along the beachfront, down the Corso, in the back streets and laneways & in nooks and crannies along the walkways. BIG CLUE - if you're visiting at peak times get an early ferry so you can enjoy the place before the hordes arrive.

Go early and spend the whole day - Just an amazing place to visit. Just a short ferry ride from Circular Quay and you are in beautiful Manly. and what would be a trip to Manly without going to the ocean and spending time on the famous Manly Beach. It is just simply a beautiful beach, that everyone must make the effort to visit. Fantastic walks, outstanding restaurants, surfing, swimming, there is just so much to do. this place is just so alive, enjoy the feeling of being on the ocean.try taking the high speed FastCat back to Circular Quay, just to change things up
Love this place. The best beach in Sydney by far - i loved this beach and spent a lot of time on it. Has great facilities and the sea is a bit calmer than at other beaches.

Manly Beach - a must!. Ferry to Manly! Wonderful way to see the harbour. Arrive on the harbour side of Manly, walk through the Corso and the surf beach is at the end. But, don't stop there. Walk to the right to Shelley Beach along the promenade. Have coffee at Fairy Bower or at Shelley Beach. Venture into the side streets to see more cafes, restaurants and local shops, just off the Corso. Little Manly beach is a bit of a walk, but a lovely and secluded local beach with cafe! From the harbour side, walk to Manly Sealife Sanctuary. Walk up the stairs behind the Sanctuary and follow harbour along to Fairlight beach! Beautiful views along the way!
Best beach. My favourite beach in Sydney. Lovely restaurants here and the beach is really nice. Everyone should go here.

Beautiful Manly Beach. The walk from Queenscliff around to Shelly Beach is fabulous. Kids can ride their bikes or scooters and there are so many lovely cafés on the way.
