Manly Beach has beach volley ball courts permanently erected on the beach and there are plenty of places to sit and watch the world go by. The beach is well patrolled.

So much nicer than Bondi beach. So easy to get to on the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay, beautiful walks, wonderful restaurants, swimming, surfing snorkelling, parasailing, kayaking, Aquarium, water park, fishing, eating , drinking by surf or harbour and shopping too. Much more upmarket than grubby Bondi, fewer hoons, safe. Love love this place.

Great beaches - dont miss out on the amazing snorkelling!. If you come to Manly be sure to get into the ocean. Cabbage Tree Bay is a wonderful marine reserve which is home to lots of beautiful sea life. Enjoy the beaches and the many fabulous cafes and be sure not to miss out on what lurks beneath the surface. If you are a swimmer join the Bold and Beautiful swim group ( free) at 7am any morning for a 1.5 k ocean swim.

A little piece of heaven. You have to get up for a sunrise on this amazing beach. You might be lucky to see a whale or dolphin. Go for a swim with the Bold and Beautiful or just grab a coffee and wiggle your toes in the sand!
A great beach. A lovely beach to visit. As it is a large beach it does not have the crowds like Bondi Beach. Easy to get to either by car, bus or ferry. Parking stations near by.

Great trip on a Sunday. Take the Manly ferry from Sydney on Sunday for $2.50 with Opal card. It's a great beach town to walk around, get some food, catch a wave, play some beach volleyball, etc. It's a beautiful beach.

Manly Beach.....scenic and relaxing. If you want a relaxing day at the beach, then go to Manly beach. The Corso is the shopping area that leads to the beach and have lots of surf shops and a very good fish and chips shop (I can't remember the name)! The Corso and the beach itself have a relaxing feel to it and you can spend the whole day on the beach just people watch or swim. The scenery is totally different from Bondi beach, Bondi is more commercialised with the white sand and surfing. Manly is more scenic, a sort of raw beauty. Only thing to watch out for is the seagulls! 100s of them....made it hard to eat my fish and chips on the beach haha!
trip to manly. took the ferry to manly did the tourist thing,worth a look if you are in Sydney,beware of the sea gull trying to eat your fish and chips,very very very aggressive.

The most bussiest beach. We took Tour around the Sydney Harbor in early this year and our tour guide and also the owner of the boat is Sydney Police.Very interesting and he can show us the famous people house there along the harbor.One of the agenda of the tour is stop over at yhe Manly beach.It was summer time and we got there is around lunch time and its a bussiest ever.Its a very nice beach but too much people for me. You cannot really enjoy yourself.

Fun area, good facilities, great beach. If you're visiting Sydney, take the fast ferry over to enjoy the Manly Beach area. We rented bikes at Manly Bike Tours across the street from the ferry dock and were at the beach in no time. The beach is very large, clean, and there are plenty of facilities - restrooms, rental shops, volleyball nets, etc. Sit and watch the surfing lessons and paddleboarders while you have an ice cream. There are lots of shops and restaurants so you can make a day of it.
Great view of Opera house!. Lovely coast town worth a visit if you have time. Wouldn't say it is an essential, but you get a great view of the Opera house on the ferry over.

Great beach to relax, swim or just enjoy the view.... You can catch a ferry from Circular Quay to Manly and go enjoy this beach. It is a beautiful stretch of sand and great waves. Nice footpath along the beach too and shops and restaurants not far from the beach.
Beachy. Not great on rainy days as it's a beach, obviously, but even on a rainy day it's a great experience to get a ferry down to Manly form the Quay

One of the greatest beaches in the World, one of the best in Sydney.. Beautiful local beach for all. In the summer it gets very busy, as does the rest of Manly.The beach is a great walk when the weather is warm, and there are plenty of fantastic eateries spread around Manly.

A hipsters paradise.. Not what is used to be by a long shot. what small space there is between the flags is filled with too many people who aren't there for the swimming, if you want a swim go around the headland to queens life or curl curl beaches, if you want lots of shops of tourist stuff and expensive cafes then this is the place for you,
Trip to manly. Friends took me to manly and it was great to see people actually with surf boards and surfing. The atmosphere was great.

Worth a day out. Great beach surrounded by excellent cafes and bars. Visit here and make a day of it by walking the Corso and visiting the great establishment around the Ferry Terminal. Great family day out or a night out on the town without having venture to the other side of the harbour.

Stay in Manly instead of Sydney CBD. What I love about Manly Beach is that even though it is a major tourist destination these days, you still feel like you are visiting a small community beach. I watched the local surfers riding perfect rolling waves on the weekend, it was mesmerising. You are literally across the road from the main shopping and entertainment district, which has so much to offer. Manly is a must do for international tourists, for those who prefer the small town feel to the city, I would recommend staying here and taking the ferry across Sydney harbour to visit our famous landmarks.
It's a beach. A typical seaside beach with accompanying shops, cafes and amenities. A brisk on shore wind ensures a good head of surf.

Nice Beach. Manly beach is quite relaxed and not as crowded as Bondi Beach but I honestly prefer Bondi Beach over Manly. There is also a salt water pool which your kids can play in. The only annoying thing about Manly Beach is that there is sooo much seaweed, It can be annoying when you're playing in the water and then a massive lump of spiky seaweed wraps around your leg. The seaweed is quite sharp and you can cut yourself on it.Transport- Train to Circular Quay then ferry to Manly Beach.The ferries can be crowded on some days.
One of the country's finest beaches.. One of the finest beaches anywhere - forget Waikiki! The Norfolk pines are lovely and it's an easy walk from the ferry.

Great beach town an easy ferry ride away. We rode the ferry to Manly to spend the afternoon visiting this beach town and beach. The ferry ride itself is a great part of the experience with views of the city and points along the harbor. The waves were quite large as we crossed the mouth of the harbor, but settled down as we neared the ferry dock on the harbor side. A short walk across the isthmus past shops and restaurants leads to the beach along the open ocean. The street leading to the beach has been closed off to create a pedestrian mall. Several booths of art vendors were set up when we were there. Many has a wide sandy beach with a paved promenade separating the beach from the street. More restaurants and shops line the street along the shoreline. We saw dozens of surfers riding the waves and many people strolling the beach or the promenade.

Ferry ride to Manly beach . Sydney's biggest beach. We took the ferry ride from the Circular Quay. Beautiful views of Sydney's CBD and the skyline and the Harbour bridge. The ride was comfortable, the ferry was available every half an hour. Took us about 15 mins to reach Manly, a beach town.

lovely coastal walk. my first trip to sydney was going to this place daily on the hydrofoil which has been discontinued.this is a very interesting place and we had our fortune told for fun and spent the whole day there.we took the coastal walk too.it has become a very touristy place .not what it used to be in those days.but a fun place

Catch the ferry over for a glorious day at the beach. . Well worth a visit if you are new to Sydney beaches. Catch the manly ferry over for a glorious day in the sun. Hire a bike while your there and you will have a ball riding along the foreshore.

Best beach in Sydney!. Even if you just have a few days in Sydney, please make sure you visit Manly Beach! This is my favourite beach in Sydney. It is more relaxed than Bondi beach and its more beautiful as well. You have to take a 30 minutes ferry from Sydney Harbour, but it is totally worth it. On the plus side you get really magnificent views of the Sydney Opera house, both when travelling to Manly and when you are coming back. If you are leaving on the morning/day time, you will also get nice night views of the Opera House from the ferry. Manly itself is a nice suburb with a nice esplanade with chic cafés and small boutiques.

magical moments. beautiful trendy cafes and the locals come out to play in this area a lot. There is plenty of beautiful beach space and parking may be a problem but magical moments are there waiting for you.

Overated.....dont bother. The journey from Sydney harbour by ferry was good but the beach was very dissappointing.It was crowded but worst still,we saw raw sewerage coming from a pipe ,spilling on the beach......disgusting

Manly Beach for Everyone. Visiting Manly can be preplanned or on a whim! Whenever we are in the city (Sydney) depending on the weather, we sometimes just jump on the Manly ferry around lunch-times. The ride takes 28 minutes and is very scenic through Sydney Harbour.When we arrive it Manly Warf, we walk past the shopping mall directly towards the main beach. (15 mins ) Buy some sandwiches and coffee on the way at 711 on the corso, find a bench facing the beach and enjoy,,, don't get sun-burnt! Also watch the time, as it just flies... Return to Sydney by Ferry, it leaves about every 30 minutes.. altogether a nice way to pass the time for everyone.

A grand (30 minutes!) journey on Sydney Harbour at the price of a commuting ticket!. Whichever way you look at it the ferry journey to Manley is awesome. Do it during the day, or do it at night. Or better, do both! As you will have different perspectives on the wonderful city of Sydney. Leaving in the evening from Circular Quay, or returning there after dark from Manley - is just awesome! The city, the Sydney Harbour Bridge, the Sydney Opera - all in their full glory on the harbour.

Nice beach. Enjoyed ferry ride to Manly. Shops were good as we walked down to yet another lovely sandy beach. I prefer this beach to Bondi. There is an Aquarium at one end, places to sit in the shade for a moment and watch the fun being had on the beach and places to eat. Another great place to visit.

A must for every visitor in Sydney. You can't come to Sydney and not go to Manly! And Manly beach is the star of Manly. Huge, boomerang shaped beach, it's perfect for relaxing, swimming or surfing. However, the swimming between the flags area is restricted to 2 areas only, which, in the summer, can get quite crowded

Knocks spots off Bondi!. As the title says - Manly definitely did more for us than Bondi Beach! With a more traveller, laid back feel to it the streets have a good selection of shops, restaurants and bars leading down to the beach. Will definitely be staying in Manly when we return!
Serene and friendly. 40 mins ride from Circular quay and you are in Manly , enjoy the gozleme at the only halal turkish joint close to the beach and ice creams at Copenhagen.

Beautiful beach.. Manly Beach is a lovely stretch of sand along the crashing blue Pacific waves, made even prettier by the stands of pine trees that tower over the walkways and form a backdrop to the beach. Very clean, nice facilities, and right off all the amenities of Manly's Corso.

Gem outside Sydney. Took a ferry from Circular Quay and took just about 45 mins to arrive at Manly. The weather was a bit chilly but the sun was enough to make up for the cool weather. Clean beaches and numerous cafes and restaurants. A stroll up to the hill is a must to get the great view of the Pacific. Water fountains were available along the beach to refill your water bottles.

Very Lively Place. A 15 minutes ferry ride from Circular Quay, Sydney drops you at Manly. A walk from the ferry station to the beach makes you stop at the roadside shops offering very attractive articles at a concessional rates. The beach is full of life with visitors sitting on the payment around the beach. The walk around the beach was very refreshing. One can have very tasty seafood at various types of food stalls. Overall a very joyous experience.

What Bondi Beach should be.... I've visited Sydney a couple of times and after having visited Bondi and Manly beaches on my first visit, only Manly Beach got the nod for a return visit.While not as famous of Bondi Beach, I would recommend visiting Manly Beach in a heartbeat to any tourist visiting the area. The beach is seriously long, has enough room for loads of people and has lots of food and drink choices along stretches of the beach.In other words, it's what (in my opinion) a good beach should offer!

Sydney at it's finest. Manly beach is easily accessible on a day trip from Sydney City for visitors.With an expanse of orange sand, Norfolk Island Pines fringing the promenade, a dizzying array of cafes, enough world class restaurants to make you wish you had a week here, main stream shops, unique boutiques, great souvenirs, heritage pubs, five star hotels, an art gallery, the wonderful Manly Aquarium, a wet water slides park, wonderful waterside picnic areas, ferries, surf, and of course sunshine enough for everyone.....why wouldn't you come to visit Manly?Manly.....named by Captain James Cook of the Endeavour, when he saw the beautiful Aboriginal people standing onshore, and commented that they were very 'manly'.This beautiful suburb is trendy and oldfashioned all at once, has the best of the elite, yet the most casual of clientele. You'll fit right in.Come by Manly Ferry from Circular Quay, it takes 40 minutes on the regular ferry. (Don't forget to buy an Opal Card for all your transport needs, they're great value).Or drive over the Harbour Bridge, taking Military Road through Mosman, over the wonderful Spit Bridge, and take a Right down Sydney Road to Manly. Watch it, though, it's hard to park. Try the Whistler Street carpark.Or take a bus. There's a big bus station right out the front of the Ferry Terminal. Some buses come straight to Manly, others terminate at Warringah Mall, where you can go across the road to catch another to Manly.If you can afford it, stay here in one of the hotels or guest houses. There's bikes to hire, and just so much to see and do....not to mention relaxation!One of the most beautiful places in the world, and a gem of Sydney's Northern Beaches.Perfect for families with children...a ferry ride, an aquarium visit, a beach play (on the quiet, still water side), an icecream and a stroll up the corso to see fountains, shops and have lunch. Perfect!A great place for singles, couples, families, friends....

Dine and Wine in Maly Beach !. There are a lot of changes in Manly than previously ! There are much more people go there now. Full of people or tourist ! There are much more activities on the beach for competitive . Much more young people participate the games or competition to show their muscle to show their fitness ! Very nice to watch the young females involved the games as well !

The lesser known beach.. Manly Beach is not as well known as Bondi, but I think it is a much better beach because it is less known. It is easier to find a spot to relax and swim in the sea. Manly has all the benefits of Bondi with a fraction of the crowds.

Great beach and wonderful spots nearby. Manly beach is a must do for all Sydney visitors. Wonderful open views, great beach and the manly corso brimming with street performances and great eating places. The nearby North point offers unparallel view of the ocean, Sydney CBD and the main city.

Fantastic Beach. We were here alongwith the city explorer open top bus at around 11 am. The expanse of the beach is vast and the sand soft and clean. The water is brilliant blue and the waves are quite attractive. The eateries and cafes alongside the beach are very good.

Great views, great vibe. Manly is one of the best beaches I've been to near Sydney. It had a great vibe and even in the winter was alive with surfers and people of all ages looking to just relax and take a walk. It is located near great food and great shopping stores.
Nice and quite. One of the nicest and quite areas in Sydney. I took a small hike in the area. The Pacific is never far away and always impressive.

Day spent relaxing. Manly beach is a must visit if you are travelling to Sydney. Travel by a ferry to take wide view of the city, harbour bridge and opera house. The beach is clean with good sand and yummy food stalls. There is lot more to do here if you are not interested to swim.
Beach. Manly is a lovely little place,nice beach,with shops close by. Easy to get to by catching a ferry. Also there is a sealife aquarium 2 mins walk from beach.
Nice beach. Beautiful beach, there is activities there all the time even in winter. You can watch people surfing. Plenty of shops and restaurants. Less crowded than BondiAccessible by ferry

Its a nice beach but nothing special. The best thing about the beach is actusally getting to it on the ferry because of the view... As for the beach itself, its nice and clean but you can find a beach like this one anywhere in Europe or elsewhere in the world. I really liked the pines though, and you can relax in there.

Beautiful beach, less crowded. Manly Beach was easy to reach by ferry (from Circular Quay), and provided a nice place to relax. The beach is clean and less crowded than Bondi (although we did visit during the winter), and has plenty of food and shopping nearby.
Less crowded. Easy to get to by ferry, less busy than Bondi - very relaxing, the time went so fast. A good place to just stop moving. I loved it.
Loved it ! . Manly beach is a really amazing beach. The day I was there , the waves were high and a lot of surfers were outside. I loved the feeling and atmosphere at this beach.

If you go to Sydney, visit Manly beach.. It is very near Sydney, you cross the ocean in a ferry. It is a long beach and it is clean all the time. One of the reasons, I recommend this beach it is because it is safe and lots of tourists go, but because it is big, they are not near you. I think it is one of the most popular beaches near Sydney, Australia. I visited this beach in the year 1997. Probably, it is the same or change a little.

Lovely beach, easily accessible . Manly beach is just a 500m walk from the ferry terminal. Be sure to visit the information office at the ferry terminal. The walk to the beach is dotted with shops and cafes. The beach itself is lovely, large and scenic.

Beach Bliss. Great fun for beach lovers. Beautiful beach on a nice sunny day, lots of activities you can do including surfing and playing volleyball. Lots of bars and food places to grab some lunch and dinner or just go for a drink.

Serene - calm & peaceful. On a beautiful sunny day we took the ferry to manly, We had a very pleasant visit and enjoyed the walk on the beach, the shops around & the live music that was playing for some event.

Beats Bondi hands down!. Walk through The Corso from the ferry to Manly Beach (don't think the harbourside beach is the beach to visit. Follow the walk around to Shelley Beach lunch at The Boatshed and enjoy the vista north to Palm Beach. One of the most beautiful places in the world. Swim and snorkel at Shelley Beach which is a marine reserve.

Love Manly Beach. Wow this is a beautiful beach. Wide footpaths and beach is just stunning. Lovely spots to sit and relax and enjoy a bite to eat or a swim if your game as its cold for us Queenslanders. We had the amazing weather so the sun was warm. So much beach to walk. Who wouldn't like it.
Wow. What can one say ... Beautiful .... After a trip on ferry from Circular Quay and walking through shops, cafes and street entertainment. You come to this beautiful beach.

Beautiful beach on North side of Sydney. Best beach in Sydney you can take the ferry from circular quay and when you get off the boat you can walk through the shopping centre to the beach you can buy fish and chips and sit on the wall over looking the beach or get some ice cream but watch out for the sea gulls they will steal your dinner

Spectacular. Took the walk from Queenscliff to Shelley Beach. What a great walk. Stopped in at a few of the coffee shops on the walk. Great views of the surfers and some die hard swimmers. Recommend it highly.

Amazing experience . Visited Manly Beach with my wife and two year old kiddo, it was amazing. The weather God also seems to be at our side, it was nice warm and a bit windy though. We had our kid covered with warm cloths. Just take care of your food, if you want to eat anything in the open, as pigeons will disturb you a lot but it is fun too.. Playing with them and offer them some food too.. Did some souvenir shopping from the high street near to the beach.. Amazing place, amazing people and lunch by the ferry terminal, on a warm sunny day, was just special.

We Loved Manly!. We took the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay on a busy afternoon. Manly was pretty crowded but we had a wonderful time walking around the beach and surrounding area. There are many restaurants but we went to a place where "locals" go called Aloha Restaurant where we had wonderful fish and chips and a good hamburger with a piece of pickled beet on top. Different and good. We saw volleyball players on the beach...children learning life saving...it was a beautiful day to walk around the beach. It's a wonderful area...a must see if you are in Sydney!

Lovely walk from Manly to Shelly. We took the bus to Manly - visited as a couple. It was a bright and sunny day. Planned for lunch at Manly Fish Café. Having had the yummy lunch at the café we then went to the beach. Manly seemed to be surfers beach. We did a walk from Manly to Shelly Beach. Its called the Cabbage Tree Bay Eco-Sculpture walk. It’s a short 15 mins walk. Shelly Beach is a lovely spot for a small picnic or barbeque gathering with friends or family. Or simply carry a blanket and throw it on the beach and relax!!We relaxed on the shelly beach for a while and then started stroll up to the lookout - beautiful views of the Beaches. So wonderful to sit at the lookout and gaze at the sea. We could do it all day, but it was time to leave. We took the ferry back from Manly to Circular Quay. Boarded the ferry at around 5 pm and what a perfect timing. We could see the sunset right while crossing the Harbor Bridge. It was an amazing sight.

Great seaside location to spend an afternoon. We went thee in the winter, July, so we didn't go into he ocean, but all the sorrounding are excellent, the blue water, the yellow sand, the sunshine, the cool bars and cafes at the beach road, the no cars streets. We spend the afternoon there just lying down in the sand and walking around. In the evening we had some beers in the waterfront.

All promised and more. Lovely beach lined with gorgeous Norfolk pines. Beautiful sand and surf. Plenty of facilities on the beach for dressing, toileting, clean up. On town side there are innumerable shops, restaurants, hotels (pubs). There is something for everyone. My son went surfing while I swam and strolled. Also enjoyed watching a national youth life guard competition which clearly evidenced how serious the Australians take their sea side safety.Picturesque and surrounded by fun places and great people.You have so much to choose from but we had a great time, food or drinks at a number of places. Breakfast at The Pantry was wonderful. Fantastic well prepared food and a gorgeous beach side view. And for the surf shop people...a must stop is to visit Mark and his Manly Long Board surf shop. Great gear and hand screened "tees". Suggest later going up to roof top bar at the Hotel Steyne. The Steyne has bars on 3 levels and are great at pouring for all tastes. But upstairs is the darkened old rum bar; a good selection of regional Aussie draft beer , and maybe the best selection of draft ciders in the Sydney area...plus a great view from the outside balcony.
Not as good as Northumberland, UK. Weather apart, which is a major factor ... not as good as Tynemouth, Whitely Bay, Durridge Bay, Beadnell, Bamburgh.

Love and adore. It was nice to find in this city such a beautiful place like this beach.It's awesome even in winter time.Short walk and you will be happy for the whole day.Will try to return in summer time

Relaxing Afternoon at Manly Beach. Rode ferry to Manly, with its shops, restaurants, and beaches. Bought ice cream and strolled along the area. Took a side bus trip to Warringah mall for some shopping.
A truly classic Sydney spot. A really important Sydney place to visit. Lovely to stroll along and people watch. Also a great surf beach. Highly recommended for all visitors.

Relaxing walk on calm beach. We visited Manly beach on a cloudy day with few drops of rains in the air and very less people on the beach. it was very relaxing to spend some time there with nature & watching some surfers. If you are looking to enjoy some good food as well, there are plenty of options available across the road with multi cuisine menus. It is an ideal place to play beach volleyball also.

Great place to stop and rest. We book an apartment above a fish and chip shop with a view of the beach. Great place to stay. the beach is supurb. Great for swiming or just sit on the beach and catch some sun. Lots of places to eat, where takeaway or dine in. We used public transport to get from the airport to Manly and the ferry trip was fun. if you have time take a night ferry trip to Sydney and back

Fabulous beach for swimming and strolling.. This is an amazing beach for both locals and travellers as well. Stroll along the promenade and people,watch, have a swim, of dine in one of therm any cares and restaurants all along the street. The fish and chips shop on the corner is famous and there is always a queue. There are surf board riders and swimmers and the beach is patrolled all the time. This is perfect of families and couples, and the water is clean and clear nearly all year round.

Best beach trip in Sydney. Catching the Ferry from Circular Quay, gives you a great trip through the harbour, past the Opera house, dodging the yachts and water taxi's as you go. Manley beach is a short walk from the jetty, a long expanse of sand open to the Pacific ocean. There are great facilities, surf schools and some of the best cafe's in Sydney line the waterfront. Worth the trip, if not for the ferry alone.

Beautiful beaches on the ocean and on the bay. The ferry trip from Sidney is also 5 stars. Manly is a must visit for every visitor in Sydney. It can be reached by bus but the 40 min ferry (not hydrofoil) offers a spectacular vie of Sydney, the bridge, the bay with the various inlets the heads and Manly.Manly has many beaches: the most famous is a long beautiful beach on the atlantic side. It is lined with condo, hotels and restaurants on one side and Norfolk pines on the other. There are areas for swimming and for surfing.The other beach is on the bay site, next to the ferry: the water is calmer and warmer and there is a beautiful view of the bay and Sydney. There are additional beautiful beaches nearby: Shelly cove at the southern far end of the Manly beach, Freshwater is the next beautiful large beach north and, on the bay side there are many quite beach on the walk to the Spit

Lovely walk around the beach.. Manly is a nice beach, probably not the best beach in the world, but still a great attraction to visit when you're in Sydney. There's plenty going on at Manly beach, with a lot of places to eat at when you're there.

My favourite Of the beaches.. We really enjoyed Other beaches in the area but this was our favourite. A wonderful walk watching the sea what more could you want?Plenty of things going on and everything you need close by.
A get away beach!. Its like stepping into a different world, if you want to escape everything this is the place to go! Beaches, shops and street music. Stunning views and fresh air!

Wide, sandy, good for surf, sandcastles and fun. Had a couple of hour visit. There were a few surfers and a few visitors. The beach looked better than Bondi - better cared for, tidier and if we were to visit a beach this would be it - in July is was pretty deserted so we had a couple of glasses of mulled wine at the local café and moved on!

Busy Beach. The beach itself has really nice sand and I'm sure the waves are generally pretty good for surfing (I'm not a surfer myself, so I'm not the best judge) but everyone wants to go to Manly so the beach can be pretty packed - more so when there's been a shark sighting and most people are confined to the beach! Still worth a trip though, even if you just laugh at all the 'Manly' shop names...
Fantastic beach. Our first time in Manly and we were impressed. Great beach and great cafes. Easy to find your way from the ferry terminal to the beach. Would love to go back and stay longer.

Manly Beach is beautiful. The sand was perfect but since we only had 4 hours we opted to walk through the town and down the beach towards the rocks on the right. The scenery was stunning and there was a gift shop that was so cute I could have bought one of everything. The lady running the information center is also very helpful
Amazing beach, laid back environment.. I loved this beach, very laid back environment, clean safe and warm water. When I was there there was little market stalls to mooch around.

good for a tourist look. worth a look, but these beaches are not a patch on Perth beaches, they are the best in the world, surf is not much good at Manly, good for family as safe beach in great location.

LOVED Manly!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!. We took the Sunday ferry (flat $2.50 all day) over to Manly from Circular Quay and arrived around 9:30 AM. The surfers were out but the Corso and the beach itself was still quiet. It was a beautiful day and by 11:00 AM the place was bustling with people and it had a great energy. We walked the full length of the beach before doing the scenic walk and then returning for lunch and another final beach stroll before taking the ferry back. We enjoyed some Thai takeout on one of the beachside picnic tables.Outside of the harbour itself, this was our favorite place in Sydney. We truly LOVED Manly Beach!!! We visited Bondi the next day and it was a huge disappointment - not even remotely close to being as nice as Manly.So go and enjoy Manly! My daydreams take me back here on a pretty regular basis :-)

gorgeous stretch of sand and blue seas. manly beach was amazing, long stretch of beach, great bars restaurants, along the frontto cool down in after a long days activity at the beachwould definitely visit again, a much need get away from the city of Sydney

"Man"ly Beach. We took the ferry on one way as our friends parked the car in Manly before picking us up from our hotel. While ferry was enjoyable, the moment we landed we decided to take a stroll along the beach. It was quite refreshing especially after we grabbed a coffee on a windy cold day. The beach was quite clean with some surfers, some playing volleyball and many walkers.Quite an experience.

Amazing!. The ferry through Sydney harbour to Manly was enough for me to leave my two-cents on this -- the trip back welcomed the spotting of a whale. The atmosphere of Manly is really fantastic, the hustle and bustle of the shopping area is only eclipsed by that of the fantastic beach. Of my few days in Sydney, Manly was the highlight for me!

Beautiful Beach and Surroundings. We took the bus here and was a pretty cool experience and the views coming in were great, the beach itself was amazing, clean and large and all though busy it didn't feel it, the whole surrounding area is nice to walk around

Better than Bondi for tourists. I went with a friend on a whim during winter. You must take a ferry from Circular Quay. Because it was winter, there were not many people, but we had lunch of very tasty and fresh fish and chips there. It was a lazy day so we just walked along the beach looking at all the expensive homes that dotted the shore. I went to Bondi previously and this beach is so calm, clean and more spacious in comparison. Bondi felt cramped because there was a neighborhood adjacent to it. But, Manly Beach is more relaxing.

Absolutely Beautiful.. My friend and I went here an Sunday afternoon a couple of weeks ago and we traveled by ferry (see earlier review Gorgeous View). Since we traveled here on a Sunday it really wasn't expensive at all, but it would cost a lot more if we had gone any other day of the week. Like seriously a lot more, so go there on Sundays! If you go there during the Australian winter you should definitely bring a jacket or sweater or something as it is quite windy. And you shouldn't take a swim since the water is freezing. But this beach is absolutely beautiful, I definitely regret not bringing my good camera, there were some gorgeous scenery. Even though it was winter the beach and it's surroundings were quite active. There were people everywhere (not too many though) and I'd say they were all quite young, late teens to late twenties. So it's a good place to go to be social and make friends. There were also loads of ice cream shops (we visited one of them) and nice restaurants and small shops. There's also some nice Swedish shops in Manly, which I'll definitely visit the next time I go there to stock up on Swedish candy. This is a must if you go to Sydney, it's lengths better than Bondi since it's not as touristy and over-priced. This will definitely be my beach of choice in the summer.

Try taking a bus there. Went during winter but there were still many people on the beach! It was a nice experience taking the bus to Manly from Chatswood and returning to Circular Quay by ferry. In that way, we had 2 ways to explore Sydney.

Gorgeous Beach. Manly is a great little town with picturesque harbour on one side, and a large sweeping beach on the other. The town offers a wide variety of shops and restaurants and offers a nice break from the hustle and bustle of down town.

Lots to do. beautiful beach and great for people watching....the restaurants and shops have tons of choices. Go during the off season for bargains. Take the ferry from Sydney to complete the experience.
A great beach experience with good nearby cafes. Manly is really enjoyable - coffee on the beach in winter, icecream in summer. Good for beginner surfers. Lots of space, park benches, seating, trees.
Wish there are more restaurants to choose from. Great alternative to Bondi Beach but couldn't find any restaurants that interested us. On a bright side this beach is relaxing with less people.

Unique!. Manly offers you so much. On one side you have the ocean and beach and on the other you have the harbour and beaches. Manly is in perpetual party mood. You can get there by road, but why do that when you can catch the famous Manly Ferry? Families love to have children's birthday parties here, travellers love to explore the coastline and harbour and in the Summer, have a surf. Pubs abound, walking plazas abound. You want fairy floss, they do fairy floss. Up the hill is the gateway to the North Head National Park. Manly is the beginning of the swathe of North-side beaches for which Sydney is famous. Go by ferry, plan to spend the day, take you sun protections and take your camera.

What´s not to like?. No, seriously. What ´s not to like? Great surf, good parking, good bars and shopping, surf or SUP rental right on the beach, beach volleyball nets, rock pools for the young ones along the coastal walk towards Shelley beach, wonderful views, no crowds, the beach seems endless and stretches over for way too long ... why would anyone want to go to Bondi? The only thing Manly beach lacks actually - is a good beach playground for the little ones.

so accesable from the city by ferry. Catch the ferry from Circular Quay and 1/2 hr. later you are on the harbour side of Manly. Continue straight ahead and within minutes you reach Manly Beach famous for surfing and sun.

Great beach - even in Winter!. Broad expanse of white sand with scenic views. Shops also interesting in the main mall. Had an English visitor with us and she loved the beach on a winters day as it was better than her beaches at the height of an English Summer!
good waves. great Waves for surfers and the sun is Always shining. the beach is not that crowded either. So it is a good beach but it is not outstanding

Great outing from Sydney. Leave the city for a day and hop on the ferry to Manley. The ride itself offers great views and Manley is charming. We were there during a jazz festival and crowds thronged the streets with groups playing at either end of the main tree-lined thoroughfare. Stroll along the beach and grab a seat on the wall to watch toned and bronzed bodies of both genders playing beach volleyball against a backdrop of crashing waves. There are a number of cafes to grab a beer and lunch before heading back from your day at the beach.
manly and the beach. very clean nice big beach only thing not good big pipe in middle of beach shops close by andd bars /places to eat one of the many beaches there to see

What a Great Beach and Gorgeous!!. So the beach is so clean! The view is absolutely gorgeous with surfers and beach goers playing volleyball..I can't wait to take my family to this beach because its worth going to if you are in Sydney..

Manly Beach是個雪梨近郊的海洋小天堂. Manly Beach,a little happy paradise out of Sydney!比起Bondi Beach遊客絡繹不絕，在雪梨北部的Manly Beach也是當地人熱愛的海灘勝地。 Manly地名的由來很有趣，是1788年新南威爾斯首任總督 Arthur Phillip 船長命名，因為當時當地原住民族「自信且極富男子氣概（manly behavior）」的作為令他印象深刻，故把這裡取名為Manly。來到這裡可選擇搭渡輪，雖然距離大城市雪梨只要半小時，但來到海濱小鎮Manly就能感到如世外桃源般清幽，心情大放鬆啊！你們看躺在沙灘上的在曬太陽的人們表情就能瞭解啦！後來我還在前LMFAO團體中的歌手Redfoo曾經在曼力海灘拍過MV-Let's Get Ridiculous喔！還沒到那裡不如先看看MV感受一下吧！

Manly beach is a must-see in Sydney. Manly beach is a must-see in Sydney. On a sunny day, catch the ferry across the harbour - you will see many of the more affluent suburbs, the Heads and beautiful views. When you arrive at the pier, what you see is NOT Manly beach as some tourists thought (they were underwhelmed and stayed on the ferry -thought they had seen it already). Follow the crowd and walk through the the Corso- some cafes, restaurants, children's play areas and shops - then cross the road to the beach. Take a walk around the esplanade, either North, South or both-all good. If there is a cool southerly wind, head around to the south and sit in the sun. All flat walking, ideal for older people and prams etc, sand galore for littlies. Plenty of options for lunch or snacks, markets on Sunday. Better than Bondi for a day out!
City suburb + beach = great. Provides for a day of great variety. Walking, cafes, shops, beach, surf board or bike hire; everything that you could need for a relaxing family day.

Great place to see and visit.. Manly Beach and the Manly area is a great place to spend time. The beach is a safe surf beach with clean sand.Along the foreshore are plenty of Restaurants with great food. Plenty of shops to see and Pubs to drown your thirst. There is always a great atmosphere about the place.

The most beautiful place in Sydney. From penguins to breath taking views of the city to some of the best surf in Australia Manly has it all. Be sure to walk off the beaten track and don't just stick to walking up and down the corso.

Great place to take the kids for a day!. Great beach,and for walking! The Corso has plenty of great cafes,restaurants and pubs,lots of great shopping and the kids have plenty of paved area to take a scooter whilst you walk your dogs, as well as a skate park close by. a good, inexpensive day out for the kids during the holidays....

Spoilt as a local!. You tend to take things for granted if you are presented them every day. Manly Beach is tops, it is a lifestyle to those who flock tyhere year round to enjoy the surf, the san and sun and the great shops nearby. Great for families and lovers alike. I like to stroll around to fairy Bower at the South Eastern end and then back for a coffee at my favorite coffee shop overlooking south steyne...
Great Manly. If the ferry ride is not enought having bite in one of the many cafes on the beach strip or a swim on the beautiful beach tops a great location

Seemed like a nice beach. Unfortunately, we were here during a downpour, so not really beach weather. But it seemed like a nice small beach. I would love to go back when there is better weather. We took the ferry from Sydney to get here.
MUST SEE THIS BEACH. a quiet and calm which having comparasion with any other beach in Austarlia, must see for people who love romance.

Nice little Sunday afternoon trip. Took a Manly Ferry over and spent an afternoon walking along the beach, playing a bit of soccer and having some scrumptious seafood at one of the nearby restaurants. It is well worth it to walk down the stretch of Manly Beach, into Shelly beach. Along the path is the Cabbage Tree Eco Sculpture walk which gives an insight into the unique marine life, plants, animals, history and attractions through eleven unique sculptures.The footpath is flat and paved, but further along into North head, could be a bit muddy especially if it just rained.

you'll miss a treat if you don't visit.. Not as popular as Bondi but just as spectacular. There is about a mile walk through the town from the ferry terminal to the beach which takes about an hour as there are so many shops to visit on the way. The Beach restaurant is excellent and the eclectic mix of restaurants along the sea front will have you staying long into the evening. Make sure you know when the last ferry leaves.
Beautiful Beach. Lovely beach on Sydney's northern beaches. Plenty of shops and restaurants nearby. Lifeguards are on duty. Great beach for families.

Another place to relax. After a pleasant ride from the Sydney ferry ,right outside the wharf there is a visitor center and each visitor were greeted with warm welcome, map and and a ton of answers to each of our questions. I commend that lady. Several activities can be enjoyed there but my family just opt to enjoy the winter breeze along the beach sharing each one's food even the seagulls were trying to join. There are also diverse shops to browse around. Nice to visit again.
Surfers will love Manly beach. Beautiful beach with lots of surfers. The town is fun to visit with lots of food and shops. Don't miss it.

6July 2015 Sunny Day. Wonderful view
Good to see sunrise
Recommended to go during morning and afternoon
Lots to do, eat and drink in Manly.
Relaxing

Stroll to the beach from the ferry. The ferry ride from Circular Quay to Manly is a highlight of any trip to Sydney. After stepping off the Manly ferry, it is just a short stroll along the shopping precinct to the concourse and Manly Beach, a popular spot for surfers, joggers, exercisers and sightseers. There is plenty of seating available to sit and watch the activities or enjoy a coffee or take-away.
Manly is the place for surf. The Place to be for Triathlon, with a blend of multi cultural people from all around the world. most beautiful beach

Make sure you take pics from the ferry!. Beautiful part of the world and a great view of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House when you're on the ferry. It's a lovely place to sit and relax and escape some of the bustle of Sydney.

LOVE THIS BEACH--hope to return soon someday!. LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this beach. Easy to get to by ferry--quick walk down the promenade. Easy to rent a bike and go exploring. Just loved this casual, easy going beach.
An Australian flavour. just a flavor of what Australian do enjoy in their daily life, great place to go and have and ice cream while walking along the beach
Great Sydney beach . Great Sydney beach for a day out. Catch the ferry over, have lunch on the corso, have a swim, then walk around to shelly's beach.
tye shelly beach instead. manly beach is ok but nearby shelly beach is a gem, just head to southern end of manly(near the surf club) & follow the path
A must see beach. This is one of the most popular beaches as you can catch a ferry over the harbour.There is also a great walk to Shelley beach and lots of shopping opportunities.

Awesome view from the top. This is Manly beach. I took ferry from circular quay. Roughly journey to manly is about 30mins. The ferry ride was enjoyable. I able to see the Watson's bay and other places. Reach the Manly wharf, i was looking around for any info guides and i saw Manly Bike Hire just across the road. Super convinient for solo traveller who wantsbto explore Manly whole day. I went to North head to enjoy the view. Totally worth it!

Lovely sea resort towm. We sat on the benches at the beach and watched the surfers and paddle boarders. Much to our surprises a pod of Dolphins passed by leaping out of the water several times as they passed by, then they turned around and went past again. Great picture opportunity. Food there was expensive, two small ice cream for $14.00.

AFTER SEEING THIS BEACH, ON THE BOX, MY WIFE WAS AFRAID OF SHARKS. Lovely beach, except for the litter and seaweed left strewn at high tide level. It was only 5 minutes from our hotel. One day it was really hot, so I decided to have a swim, the water was lovely and cold, However as a legacy of the film directed by Steven Spielberg, when I was swimming with my head under the water, I couldn't relax, as all I could hear playing in my mind, was the haunting theme music from Jaws. It wasn't long before Macho man came out of the sea trying not to run, and maintaining my dignity, but it didn't fool my wife, who said you looked frightened, I replied, don't be silly, but when she said whats that black thing sticking out of the water, I did run.

Great Escape. Catch a ferry from Circular Quay to Manly beach departing every half an hour. The ferry ride is worth the price. Beautiful views of the harbor, bridge and opera house. Manly beach is a short 5 minute walk from ferry landing. Great place to chill out.
Just lovely..... Such a lovely place. Well worth a visit. Preferred this to Bondi Beach. Lovely setting and a choice of local shops too. The beach is beautiful.
Nice beach, by ferry from Sydney. Great to use ferry from Sydney and rest a day in this beach and go for near nice coastal walk with great views.

Worth it! . Take a boat from Sydney harbor to one beautiful island. You will be able to take beautiful pictures of the opera house from another perspective.. There you can take a hike to s hill or spend the day on the beaches. Don't miss the several markets of crafts

Great experience !!!. The beach is superb. Not to miss in Sydney. What i loved the most was the cliff that's on the right side of the shore. There is a way to reach to the top of the cliff. Once you reach at the cliff, you get a panorama view of the beach and the sea from a height.

A truly beautiful beach only a ferry ride from the city.. Manly beach is actually a strip of three beaches. Queenscliff to the north and North and South Steyne to the south. Always a hive of activity with board and body surfing, nippers activities and beach volleyball on the beach, and cafes, restaurants, shops and markets across the road from the beach. At the height of summer there are often surf carnivals and promotions happening. The atmosphere is somewhat cosmopolitan and it is almost mandatory to walk a dog (or dogs)! There is a scenic walk starting from the Queenscliff Surf Club all the way to Shelley Beach, which was voted one of Australia's most beautiful beaches. At Shelley Beach there is paddle boarding, snorkelling and a connection to another walk up to North Head. Definitely worth the effort.

Manly - getting there is half the fun!. Manly Beach is probably my most favourite beach in the world. Just even getting there is a major experience - take the ferry from Circular Quay in Sydney, journey past the iconic Opera House, and head out to Manly. Then, when you arrive, follow the crowds along The Corso (Manly's main street - pedestrianised, too) until you come to the ocean beach.Once there, behold the surf! And if you love the sun, sit on the beach; if you prefer the shade, there are plenty of trees to protect you from the rays. Plenty of foot-shower points are positioned along the beach after your sea adventures, and then nearby are countless shops and restaurants. Manly... one of the great Oz beach experiences!

Love this activity. We drove to Manly, and parking was difficult. Others got ferry and enjoyed that. Lunched at local hotel, and walked the streets eating ice-cream and window shopping, looking at the sights and listening to music that was available.

Beach vistit. Manly is a nice clean beach, even though it was June there were many there and it had a good vibe.
Plenty of surfers in the water. Great pubs/shops and eateries to choose from. Would love to spend longer next visit.

Boathouse Shelly Beach, Manly. Caught the Manly ferry from Circular Quay, then a taxi to the Boathouse at Shelly Beach for a lovely lunch at the newly opened café. Great food and service even through they were obviously very busy. We then did a leisurely walk along the promenade back to the ferry. Perfect afternoon.
Beautifuly place.. Loved Manly. Had been there many years before. Preferred it to Bondi. Very pretty place, lovely shops and nice places to eat.

holiday. i love manly beach .i am so jealous if you live here.the surfers are up every morning at daylight..the swimmers too...even pensionersswim across to the other beach.young mothers jog pushing the prams..you must have the fittest dogs .no dogs allowed on the beach ...no dog poo ..because you provide free bags..so clean ..as the wee mannie is up early cleaning the beach and streets.the coastal walks are amazing and there all these little beach cafes ..lots of different bars..its amazing all the scottish people who you bump into.all australians i bumped into were all friendly.we will be back

Good Scenic Walkway! Peaceful!. There are many reasons people go to Manly. People go there for surfing, shopping, dinning, picnic, or walk along the coast or Sydney Harbour National Park. I took a 30-minutes ferry ride from Circular Quay to Manly Wharf . It was a natural beautiful scenery during the ride. This was the way to see Sydney. When I arrived Manly, I walked to the beach and there were many people swimming and surfing during the winter month. Then I continued wondering around, and saw this beautiful outdoor shopping district " The Corso". I picked up a Manly Scenic Walkway map from the Manly Visitor Central outside the wharf. I started walking along the coast. It took 4 hours walk between Manly to the Spit Bridge. I highly recommend this walk as you will see many different views and life of the people there. From the Spit Bridge, I took the bus to City Centre.

Nice beach for all visitors. Whether you area surfer or a swimmer or just a stroller, this is the ideal beach around Sydney and beats Bondi anytime. 30 minutes ferry ride from Sydney is worth it, nice clean beach with lot of eateries and cafes around. Adults and kids alike would love this beach.

Nice for a day-trip from Sydney. We took the Manly ferry from Circular Quay and hired a bicycle from Manly Bike Tours. They provide you with a map and a few suggested routes depending on fitness level and how much time you have. We went all the way up to North Head where we enjoyed the fantastic view over the bay and on Sydney. The day ended with a beer and chips overlooking the harbour at sunset. A perfect one-day trip

Visit. We went at 10am on 16th June in a morning tour of aat kings who left us there for half an hour. Beach is clean with fine sand. Restrooms at regular intervals. A jogging track all along the beach on road level with wide green lawns dotted with trees and flowers. Lots of white sea gulls and across the street is rows of shops and cafes. You can see joggers,mothers with young babies in strollers,tourists and wind surfers. This beach is very popular with surfers for almost 100+ years now. A must visit.
Wow what a place. We spent the day here after taking the ferry from Sydney. A fantastic picturesque beach which stretched for about a mile. Loads of cafes and restaurants on the beach front.

Great place to watch the sun rise. We stayed in Manly recently for a wedding - got up early to watch the sunrise over the Pacific and take a pre breakfast walk along the shore - certainly a great way to start the day
This beach beats Bondi Beach!. We visited both Bondi Beach and Manly Beach and by far, Manly was the more beautiful and relaxed of the two.
Wonderful beach and town. I think this is a must-do. We took the ferry from circular quay. The beaches are clean and beautiful. The town is charming, and there is a great aquarium too

Fun on the beach. Manly is a great place for people of all ages.wether you just want to stroll,swim,eat or sit or do all three Manly is the place to do it.If the surf isn't for you there is the netted area inth harbour to swim with plenty of shade.Very safe through the day,a bit noisy around the Corso area at night.
Relax by teh sea. This is the best place in Sydney to come and relax, watch the ocean and take a stroll along the beach.

How to get there. It was only $3-4 by boat from Circular Quay and took prob around 45mins.From the platform at Manly you just need to cross the traffic lights, go straight through the main shopping street passing the church on your right, and the beach is right ahead. It was pretty busy so we walked to the other end of the beach and found a more peaceful spot away from the many tourists.
Great trip to the beach. My wife and I came over on the Manly Ferry, had a great breakfast, then got ourselves an ice cream from Ben & Jerry's and sat by the beach enjoying the morning. Perfect.
Lovely beach. Not far from the city but a relaxing and enjoyable sail from Circular Quay, you find this lovely beach, small shops, restaurants, and scenic walks.

Best Beach In Sydney : Amazing and Gorgeous. Manly Beach, a golden ribbon of sand is absolutely amazing and gorgeous. It is one of the most beautiful and famous beaches in the World with Sand, Sun and Surf! It is very clean and beach. It is a heaven for sun-bakers, swimmers, surfers, joggers, cyclists and casual walkers. You can enjoy beach volleyball or water sports. On the weekends and public holidays, there is Manly outdoor Arts and Craft Market on the beach front featuring locally made creations.You can reach Manly by a bus from Wynyard, but I prefer taking the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay near the Opera House. This gives a beautiful view of Opera house and Sydney Harbour. I have visited several times with my family. If you have a car, then drive up to the end of the beach to enjoy spectacular views at the turquoise bay.The Manly Beach is less crowded than Bondi. There are more than 75 restaurants offering cuisine from around the world. You can enjoy shopping while walking down to the beach from the ferry wharf.
Loving Manly. I lived in Manly for 6 months & had the time of my life. A great place, good food, good beaches & some really nice surf when its on.

Best beach in Sydney. In my opinion Manly is the best beach in the Sydney area. It is very close to the city and just the ferry ride alone is worth going there. Fantastic view on the ferry and then Manly is like a little escape from the busy city life. Nice, calm area, especially during the week. The Corso is pretty cool for shopping surf gear and clothes and the beach itself is cool as well. Watch the surfers, surf yourself or just get some sunshine :)
best beach around Sydney. This was easily the best beach around Sydney and also had a nice walk to Shelley beach and back.The ferry ride was a added bonus

Relaxed. We went across to Manly for a look it took about 30 minutes to cross by ferry stopped at garfish for lunch best fish and chips ever had a bottle of white wine.Cost under $100 for 2 of us great value highly recommend

Fitness beach!. We took an early morning stroll along the beach/promenade & never seen so many fitness fanatics!. Jogging, skating, scooters, roller blades, bikes, running, baseball........most on mobiles or i-pod........out of puff telling you! We decided to sit down & people watch good to see people keeping fit but they looked so serious & dressed for a sports magazine photo shoot. Thought it should also have an element of fun;-) The beach & prom were clean. Eateries just off the prom nearby. Enjoyed our mornings and often strolled in the evening pretty beach to visit.
Best beach area close to Sydney. Great beach and surrounding area. Very clean, safe and great to watch surfing.Plenty of restaurants and shop close by and easy access from Sydney
Nice. Fun place to walk around and see the sights. great restaurants and shopping. too cold to use the beach, but it was beautiful

Lovely beach.. We used the ferry that takes you to beautiful Manly from Circular Quay. It's a great ferry ride passing the Sydney Harbour Bridge and The Sydney Opera House. We got there nice and early so we had breakfast to start off. The lovely large beach which is patrolled by lots of easy on the eye lifeguards ;-)) It was a great day out. Emma and Gary.

Surprise at Manly. We took a ferry trip to Manly. We bought a multi trip ticket which was the cheapest option for us at $24 each for the day. We caught a ferry from Darling Harbour to Circular Quay and then the ferry to Manly. There was a food and wine festival at Manly which was a pleasant surprise. Some of the streets were closed and there was music, ffod and wine sso we ended up staying from 11:30am to around 4pm. Manly is a lovely beach and there is a nice walk with views. I am not sure that there is a lot to do in the colder months but it is a nice ferry trip, a lovely beach and I am sure some nice places to eat along the waterfront. DEfinitely worth taking the trip if you have the time.

Beautiful Beach. Manly is very beautiful. There are plenty of shops and restaurants to enjoy, but the beach, ah that is the beauty. If you are lucky enough to hop on the ferry over to Manly, you have a wonderful afternoon in store.

For tourists. My Aussie host told me that locals would not be seen dead on this beach and cannot understand its appeal when there are so many better beaches locally. To me there appeared to be little to lure me there and it is by no means picturesque - I too wonder why it is so globally well-known.

Great, however go in summer. Arrived at manly beach on our 2nd day tour of Sydney via the ferry which was the cheapest thing at Sydney! Only $2.50 for the return trip. The beach was clean and sprawled for kilometres down the shoreline. If do want to explore I suggest take a bike there.

Only there for s couple of hours but was nice!. Just a quick visit as this is where my mother grew up. Nice area, small beach which looked great in the weather. Had some cold rock as we sat on the beach. Was great!

Lovely Sydney Beach!. We utilised the excellent Ferry Service to do a day trip to Manly. This trip takes roughly 30 minutes. Once you arrive you will appreciate the tranquility of the area in comparison to the chaotic and busy Sydney. Its so near yet so far JFrom the Manly Ferry terminal it only a short walk through the mall to reach the excellent Manly Beach. The area has lots of shopping options, trendy cafes and lots of excellent beachfront dining venues. Whilst it was too cold to swim I loved the beautiful white sandy beach.

Beautiful & Quiet. This beach is huge! Now it depends on the day & the weather as to how clean it is, the first day i was there hardly any seaweed and the second there was a bit. But there is so much beach you shouldn't have any problems finding a nice spot. They do have showers and changerooms as well they are on the far end.

There are better options. The water at Manly Beach is absolutely gorgeous. But, you can get this kind of water all along the Australian coast. I thought the beach was nice enough, but it was overcrowded and smallish. Most restaurants were off of the beach strip, so you had to cross the street to get food. It also apparently experiences regular rip tides, which can be dangerous for people who aren't strong swimmers. I would recommend finding a beach off of the beaten path to get a better feel for the Australian beach scene.

Manly is worth a visit. This is a fun day outing and a nice way to see where the locals go. Recommend taking the ferry to Manly. Take in the harbor view going and coming. May thru August is a good time to visit Manly. It's off season for the locals so it's not too crowded. Have lunch at one of the restaurants facing the beach.
Great Beach. Manly beach is wonderful. We didn't want to leave. We watched surfers and the water was beautiful. This is definately a Do Not Miss beach.

Better than Sydney beaches. My trip to this beach is unplanned but stayed half day after visiting the Sea life Sanctuary. The walk from Manly wharf to this beach is really wonderful with lively experience of shopping,restaurants & live music and open markets.Went to this place on Anzac day made my day so special with lots of good memories of this area. Beach is so beautiful&clean..walk from here to Shelley beach is pleasant. If you visit Sydney don't miss to spend whole day for this Manly area...we get lots of choices to eat..i had hot&crispy Fish&chips with my fav drink enjoying live music on guitar..lovely weather and music made my day very special.Loved every bit of my time here..

Better than Bondi. Got the ferry over from Sydney harbour which takes about 35mins and the ferry terminal is about 10mins walk from the beach.Manly itself is lovely very clean and tidy, lots of tourists as expected (me included) but didn't detract form the place.Got to Manly beach and it is lovely much preferred it to Bondi and a lot less touristy and much nicer in general.

HOME TOWN. What better place to enjoy a walk, Manly Beach is not just "Manly Beach", to walk from Queenscliff to Shelley Beach (about 4km) you cover it all - "Manly Beach is in the middle. Coffee shops, restaurants, swim, surf, Scater HQ offers roller blades, bikes and much more to hire for some fun along the paths. They are in central Manly opposite the beach. The Corso takes you for a stroll from sea to harbour. Manly Ferry takes you to the city. A must when in Sydney and in my part of "home town".

Great for long walks & swimming. This is a beautiful beach - perfect for evening or morning walks and has shade during the day. Shops and cafes close by is an added advantage. The beach has soft sand and is very clean.

best beach in the world!. Manly Beach. It has it all. Cleaner, longer and MUCH prettier than Bondi and MUCH easier to get to.Just jump on the ferry or fast ferry and you are there in 20 mins from town.One of the highest density areas for bars and restaurants in Sydney. Amazing choice of food and, with so much competition, places that are not superb usually don't last... Well, except for the ones on the Corso that capture the tourists coming off the Manly Ferry... Just don't eat in the Corso.Go there on Tuesday nights for the best deals like Donny's bar for a fantastic quality $5 steak

Wonderful walk and a swim. The walk along the ocean beach front is fantastic. Lined with giant Norfolk pine trees.Manly beach has life guard patrols all year around at the southern end with 2 extra patrolled areas during summer making it excelent for a family swim in the waves! So many exciting restaurants and pubs to suit all budgets.

Pleasant place to sit. I just stayed in Manly a couple of hours, lots of tourist shops but not enough to do for longer than that, for me as solo traveler. Sitting on the beach was pleasant but there are a lot of very high standard beaches in Australia and Manly Beach isn't one of them.

Wonderful place to sit...... We went to Manly for the afternoon.....it is busy but enough room with the beach and the shops and restaurants that you don't feel crowded! We got ourselves an ice cream cone and went down to beach to people watch. Everyone is very friendly and there are a lot of bench's for you to sit and just watch the beautiful scenery! Had a wonderful afternoon!

7 Miles from Sydney and a 1000 miles from care.. Manly beach is a great place to go. It is very close to the CBD of Sydney and you can catch a ferry from Circular Quay or you can get a bus. The beach it self has good waves and the water is clean. After a refreshing swim you can go and have a cold beer at the Steyne Hotel or go and have a lovely coffee or tea at the many coffee shops or eateries Manly has to offer.Please remember to swim between the flags.
Beautiful!. Clean, clear and fantastic! The atmosphere is so much fun and there is so much to do here! Many restaurants just across the road and a perfect place to relax and have fun with friends!
Good visit. Another famous beach definitely worth a visit and a swim if the weather is warm, buy a stick of bread, some salami, cheese and olives and have a picnic lunch like we did.

Very Clean, Beautiful Beach. A group of 6 of us just got into town and decided to take a fairy ride and this is where we wound up. We walked the beach however it was chilly so no swimming and then the horrible storms with 2 very large boats crashed onto the beach. :( But the sand was very pretty on a better day it would have been inviting. The restaurants were slim and the shops were not worth visiting however we went to the main walkway across the street and wished we had more time to play. Some very nice shops and found a good restaurant called FishMongers ticked away off the beaten path. Very nice! Inside/Outside seating with resonable pricing. Would like to go back there but the beach? I would head straight across the street. The best part was coming back into the harbor after dark. WOW!!!! Make sure you don't miss that one. The lights of the Opera House and bridge, the farris wheel...the whole photo is just beautiful!!!

Gorgeous!. Mnaly as a whole was fantastic, and a gorgeous beach! Definitely preferred Manly beach to Bondi beach - much more swimming areas and a larger stretch of beach! The walk to and from the ferry is brilliant and there are shops, restaurants and bars dotted along the main strip to the beach. Would make a fantastic day out! Not to mention the famous Sydney to Manly ferry boat trip!

Prettiest beach in Sydney. Lovely atmosphere, walking around the beach is fantastic.
Make sure you walk up the hill around shelly beach to the top where you get to see an elevated 180 degree view of the ocean

Go and visit this place. Sydney is beautifull, but this little place is so peaceful, you have many option to lunch near the beach with a great view, walk around the area, swim, well everything. Try to spend a quiet full day there

Lovely beach.. It's nice to go here on the ferry from Circular Quay both for the ride and for the beach especially if your time in Sydney is short. You will get lovely views from the water and when you arrive a short walk from the wharf takes you to the surf beach. I have been to Manly in the height of Summer when the shopping part looked rather a mess, simply because of so many people out and about. But this time we were there on a warm day in May out of school holidays and I found it much more pleasant. For a suburban beach it's impressive. Our children preferred the beach to Bondi. Lovely to sit and watch the surfers or go for a swim. It's a place to sit or swim and relax. Just chill out and watch the world go by then tootle back on another ferry and enjoy the ride.
MANLY BEACH. manly beach is a must visit place. The beach is very lively and the walk around the beach is quiet a nice way to explore and enjoy the beauty of the place.

Gorgeous beach and restauarants. Gorgeous long beach. Lots of great cafes. Promenade walk also good for kids with scooters. Bicycle track also. Surf lessons available. Great place to exercise, take a walk or just relax on the beach. A few playgrounds for kids as well.

Tourist Icon. If you are doing Sydney you MUST do Manly Beach. My dad was a lifesaver here and I love going for the walk from North Steyne to Manly it is great. Also must do the walk around to Shelley beach and sit down and do some "People Watching" best free pastime :-)

Worth visiting if only for the wonderful ferry journey there and back. Manly is supposedly where surfing the waves first began in Australia and it is still a main focus of the town today. Really enjoyed people-watching as we sat on a bench in the partial shade of a huge old Norfolk Pine tree with a hundred or more surfers trying their hand on the waves, some better than others. The waves weren't at their best as, although the tide was coming in, the sea was fairly calm. The lifeguards put out a couple of messages over the PA system as we sat there. The first was to urge people who were swimming to only do so at the South end of the beach which was the most sheltered area as this was the part they were watching and the second was to warn people that the incoming tide was bringing a high number of bluebottles - jellyfish - into the shore. Headed back along the busy main street to the wharf which is a hive of activity with restaurants and cafes etc. There are small sandy beaches on either side of the wharf offer a much calmer sea than the surf beach, much better for children.

A leisurely half day near Sydney. A lovely beach even if it has no shade for the easy-to-burn folks. Spacious, clean, easy access to food and drink. Loads of souvenir shops as you walk from the ferry to the beach. The ferry ride alone is a tour of part of Sydney's beautiful harbour. Well worth a half day excursion.

Without a visit to Manley Beach you have not been to Sydney!. Leaving busy Sydney centre by ferry, traveling to Manly Beach provides a break and total environment change. From the ferry harbor, walking the Corso to Manly Beach provides opportunity to see on this great pedestrian road an eclectic array of shops, restaurants and people. The beach is magnificent, clean and very busy, a fun place to see and enjoy.

Beach with debris . Think the recent Sydney storm wrecked havoc here. It was a disappointing sight to see the manly beach after overrated brochures and Internet photos. The sea life aquarium is less than average

Beautiful Beach. We walked the beach however it was chilly so no swimming and then the horrible storms with 2 very large boats crashed onto the beach. :( But the sand was very pretty on a better day it would have been inviting. The restaurants were slim and the shops were not worth visiting however we went to the main walkway across the street and wished we had more time to play. Some very nice shops and found a good restaurant called Mongers ticked away off the beaten path. Very nice! Inside/Outside with resonable pricing. Would like to go back there but the beach? I would head straight across the street. The best part was coming back into the harbor after dark. WOW!!!!

Peaceful and relaxing. After a not too stressful drive from Sydney we had a relaxing afternoon at manley watching the numerous surfers and sitting in in the mall with a feed of fish and chips.from manly there are ferry trips to Sydney and Darling harbour.

A Sydney Icon. While it can get really crowed on the weekends, the boadwalk and the beach are truly wonderful destinations. On Sunday they have the markets and you can catch the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay

Best thing is the ferry ride. was disappointed by Manly Beach. The beach is ok and the town area is a bit dated and shabby. Felt touristy to be and there are better beaches and bays to visit. Best thing about Manly is the ferry ride although at high season weekends the ferry get very busy. Think that it better to spend time getting the bus or train to Bondi, take in the cliff walk and take a beer at the boat club at the top end of the beach.

Worth visiting!. Liked the vibe of this place! Walkway towards the beach was great. The beach itself was spectacular. Nice view, nice people, everything is just so nice! I can spend the whole day just lying in the beach doing nothing!

Manly Beach - The Best. We are continuously visiting Manly Beach, both in Summer for swimming and for Winter morning walks. The scenery is magic. Add all the local Brekky, Lunch and Dinner places, makes for a top venue. Travel there buy vehicle, bus and ferry. The ferry ride adds to a great day out.

Beautiful Beach. After a relaxing and beautiful ferry ride we arrived at Manly Beach and weren't disappointed. The walk from the Wharf to the beach is nice, a line of shops and restaurants among the palms, reminded me of a less crazy Venice Beach. The beach itself was great, cool sand when we were there, waves big enough for surfing out further, but you could also go out in the water without getting crushed. Great views on both ends of the beach and there were lots of places to eat across the street. The only drawback is after a big rain storm there's no swimming for 24 hours because the stormwater is drained into the water in the middle of the beach, so that could be annoying.

Catch the ferry!. Travel inexpensively with the locals. Wander up town and over to the beach and the Board walk for a stroll along the beach or camp on the beach and sun bake. Lots of great restaurants. Interesting area to explore

It must be the one. In my opinion, Manly beach is the best (at least in Sydney). Quiet street, empty road (not applicable on the weekend). And exciting on the weekend for everyone from youngster to elderly. Tiny place with hips of attractions that's waiting for you to discover. The best place to study English and relaxation at the same time as it's safe, beautiful beach, great eating out, nice old accommodation, minute to Sydney CBD, Come and stay for a week then you will love it.

Just as good as Bondi?. Look, for a short visit to Sydney, Manly is more accessible by a more fun way (the ferry), it's a beach which looks nice, it's clean, the are lifeguards and there is a really nice cafe right on the prom which serves lovely food and margaritas. What more could one need?

So nice. Took the drive once and the Ferry once. You need to do so to see this place properly. There is a good and reasonable restaurant by the corner at Manly wharf. Good grills and always busy. Sit there, enjoy your food and see the crowd.

A nice beach in Sydney. Under good weather conditions it can be very crowded as usual on Sydneys beaches. Not only because of its nice sandy beach this place is worth a visit. Also because you can take the ferry to go there and stroll around the great shops. Go to Copenhagen ice cream shop and take a look around. It's a place that wants to be discovered.

Very nice but limited swim area. This is a great beach to good and hang out in the sand or go to a shop or restaurant ajoining the area; however, the swim area is very limited to the south end. Take a fery and enjoy the ride over.

Lovely beach and town. Manly is the perfect place to chill out. Although only 30 minutes from the CBD it really is a world away. Surfers love it too, for obvious reasons, but shoppers won't be disappointed with the range of shops and the selection of restaurants is very large.

Sand and Sea. What a beautiful beach and so easy to get here. We walked up to the local shops. Many different kinds of shops. After making some treasured purchases we got fresh fish n chips and had them on the beach. A great afternoon and a ferry ride back again.

Family fun. Manly Beach is great for all kind of family water activities. Remember that it does get a bit crowded in peak seasons. the ferry is a great option to get there. There are two walks around in the area as well

ON OF THE BEST BEACHES. Amazing suburb not too far from the city; half an hour ferry to get there, and the view is amazing. There are different beaches, all of them different but very nice. The area is full of shops, pubs, restaurants, good for sports addicts and perfect for a night out with friends.

Lovely walk along sea front exploring rock pools. Had a lovely stroll along the beach and enjoyed exploring rock pools finding two foot octopus hidden under a ledge. Lovely walk along the cliff top worth a visit.

Superb !. A huge golden sandy beach with great surf, all you imagine an Australian seaside resort to be. If you don't feel inclined to relax on the beach there is a huge prom for walking and cycling with plenty of cafes for refreshment. A wide and terrific boulevard leads to the beach from the harbour with an amazing variety of cafes, bars, shops, chemists etc - something for everyone.
Solid Beach. More open than Bondi once you get to the sand. Cool little city with tons of shops all around, lots of volleyball nets, and great atmosphere. Just missed the surf contest by a week.
Sea View Walking. It's hard to find the parking in this area. But If you find it, the good air will come to you. Many interest food and shop stand on the way.

Surfs up. Trip from start to finish was very good. Informative and enough time given in each stop off point. Glad we chose not to do the extra cruise lunch as we enjoyed time spent exploring Manly a little more-gorgeous place, even better than its famous counter part Bondi Beach. Stunning scenery in parts. Driver was the commentator which was great, had enough time on each stop, he even asked where we would like dropping off afterwards too. Felt really personalised the whole trip, got enough information about Sydney, surrounds and also view of the city too. Well worth it. Pick up and drop off poins very clear at all times. Thoroughly enjoyed the day out, even the children had no complaints.
Lovely Beach. It is a nice area to walk around both day and evening. There are lots of little shops and eating places. There is no shortage of coffee,cakes or ice cream.

So much to offer. Don't be fooled when you get off the ferry in Manly to think that Manly beach is that little strip of sand in front of you! (I was )Walk through the Corso, past all the shops, and there it is - one of the best NSW beaches. On any day you will see Surf Carnivals, Volley Ball Tournaments, Surf boat races - or it may be a quiet day and the beach will be yours.Many great coffee shops, bars and restaurants in Manly to choose from.

Beautiful and relaxed beach..... I love this beach. It is really beautiful and also exciting if you like surfing. Always something to do, plenty cafes around and really good vibes. I do recommend this beach if you are around Sydney.....

A beautiful beach. Just a short walk from the ferry through the town you arrive at the beach. It has the wow factor when you first see it, very busy lots of people enjoying themselves. It has a promenade to walk along, a grassed area to have a picnic and plenty of cafes and food of every description in the area. A lovely place to spend the day.

Absolutely gorgeous !!! A MUST SEE !!. I personally think that Manly beach is the prettiest beach in Sydney.People rave about Bondi & Marourbra etc but Manly is just idyllic.Definately worth the effort
The Beach. Spent a leisurely Sunday there, caught the ferry over from Sydney Harbour - was very busy, guess because it was a Sunday, got to the beach and as the day wore on the beach was packed.
