Manly, North and South Steyne and Queenscliffe Beach.. Manly beach extends to all above, and is the busiest beach of all the North bays. Parking is chargeable, but very close to the waterside and well groomed sand. Cafes restaurants and surf shops abound, where city life suburbia meets the ocean. The safest part of the beach is on the south, and always bathe between the yellow and red flags, as currents can be fiercely strong.

Nice beach after a relaxing ferry ride. We arrived via ferry from Circular Quay and followed the crowd from the pier to the beach after making a few stops to see the goods in some of the shops.We approached the beach and saw people of all ages sunbathing and playing in the water.This is a great place for a family day trip to the beach as there are many restaurants to choose from and the water is calmer than the other beaches further south, such as Clovelly and Bondi. If you are looking for even calmer water for little children, the perfect beach can be found beside the ferry pier on the cove side.

My Fave. I recently made the ferry journey back to Manly. As a teenager I kept my surfboard in a mates shed up the hill in Fairlight. This to me is the best beach in Sydney. Walking the Corso from the Ferry Wharf and arriving to the sight of pumping surf is an awesome spectacle. For tourists with limited time in Sydney I would definitely pick Manly as the one beach that is a must.

Beautiful Beach. We spent one day in Manly, walking through the town and laying out on the beach and it was well worth it. We had a great lunch, shopped and got some sun with some of the nicest locals you can meet. We also rented bikes to go to North Head and saw the amazing views after a 15 minute bike ride. Great time!

A great beach but busy. Manly beach is worth the time to go there. We went to Bondi which was okay but Manly has it beat by far. The ferry trip to Manly is fun and fairly inexpensive. Once there it's an easy and interesting walk to the beach. There are lots of restaurants along the street but they are on the far side from the beach. We found only one right on the beach. The beach itself is wide, flat and open. It can be pretty busy with surfers but there are also lots of places to sit and watch the surfing. Manly beach is a definite must if you are visiting Sydney just to ride the ferry and get out of the big city.
A nice place to visit. We went to manly beach and found it amazing. Everything was good about it. The market closeby was lovely too and the ferry was excellent.
Lots of activities. Short ferry ride, you can just lay out on a beautiful beach and when you need a break from the sun there is plenty around.

My favoured beach over Bondi.. Manly is very quaint and a nice beach but can have a bit of a current when attempting to swim, but well policed by the many life guards. Waves are awesome and beach is clean and nice shops and bars and restaurants close by and toilet facilities.

Great beach to spend the day!. Manly Beach is a beautiful area. The beach is top-notch and there is a very nice and wide walk going the entire length of the beach. If you’re not into sun and sand, there’s also a very nice park area with trees and a few benches as well as a great eating/shopping area adjacent to the beach. All types of activities going on…volley ball games, surfing, building sand castles, swimming, collecting sea shells, etc. Great place to spend the day!
Must visit. Take the ferry and visit this place. Walk along the beach and have a beer at the restaurants. A very pleasant boat ride and place to visit.

Love it here. Sydney is huge, but Manly is worth getting to. It's perfect for a relaxing beach day, but it also has a lot of great shops, restaurants and bars overlooking the water. Definitely worth spending a day, or at least a half-day, here.

Very good, but it will be crowded on a busy day. A wonderful place to visit and so many things for young children to do. We took the Syndey Ferry over from Circular Quay and spend the afternoon there. It was mad crowded but the kiddos aged 3 and 4 earlly enjoyed their time there. Make sure to pick up some gelato before you get on the ferry, it is to die for.

Beautiful Beach. This is our second trip to Sydney and our second trip to Manly Beach. We got off the ferry and took a stroll around the area and then found a restaurant right on the water. The food was good and the view fantastic. Lots of locals enjoying the sunset. After dinner we took the ferry back to Sydney.

Worth a Visit & Stay. Wow what a beach, so neat and clean, so family oriented, Plenty of cafe and shops adjacent to the beach. Lots of tree for shade, very dog friendly. A beach worth visiting with your family.

Best beach anywhere! . Even in inclement weather this beach has no parallel. Beautiful foreshore walks, plenty of room for the thousands of tourists.
Smaller beaches, pools jutting out into the sea. We have to leave Australia to appreciate its beauty.

East. We took a ferry over to Manly for the afternoon and evening, a bite to eat and a look around. It was full of surfers, families and people like us strolling about in no particular rush. We found a bar (didn't take long) right on the beach and after wetting our whistle we treated ourselves to fish n chips and then headed for the city again. It was only later in our trip that we realised that we'd visited the most easterly part of the world for us in Manly. Significant to us but probably not to you. :0)
Great. Always a great beach for a swim, and when your not its perfect to watch the waves and even better to watch the hot bodies...

A lovely beach. Absolutely loved the beach. Walking along to Shelley Beach a lovely cove for snorkelling and very calm. Very clean and relaxing, one of my favourite beaches in Australia. Plenty of places to eat and shops to look at as well. Lovely trip on the ferry from Circular Quay. Would recommend it to anyone.

A day out at Manley!!. My husband and I went for a day to Manley, we went on the beach which was very nice, then had walks along the esplanade lots of people playing volley ball on the beach. We later went for a few drinks to the Manley Hotel which was ok. Manley has a very nice shopping centre and lovely little streets. We came over on the ferry from circular quay, lots of ferries go from the main ferry terminal.
Very nice indeed. A lovely beach, very clean and the water was a clear blue. Lots of places to eat and shop nearby. The sand was very clean and plenty of space for everybody

Trip to the beach!. We enjoyed our trip on the Manly Ferry. A lovely late breakfast, stroll around the shops and then to the beach. We hired an umbrella and seats. Lovely clear water, lots of surfers. Time in the water cut short by a shark siting. Very enjoyable day.
Manly. Take the ferry to Manly for a great day out, plenty of shops and eating places, and of course the beach and board walk. We enjoyed the friendly atmosphere and the easy pace.
Manly beach. was lovely walking along the Corso from the ferry to Manly Beach plenty of shops to look in and plenty of gifts to bring home.

Total freedom from stress. Its very unique and very close to the mainland.Numerous ferries moves up n down the Manly Beach from quite early in the morning till late evening.The ferry is scenic all along the route.Suggest too carry good camera with moderate zoom.There are countless food outlets up there and yeah remember to wear total beach wear although shops at Manly has quick buys though.Family,solo,group name it .....this place is for everyone.

Lovely family resort.. Beautiful beach with volley ball at one end and lifeguards in attendance. Limited swimming due to undercurrents but some wind surfing. Town behind the beach is small but filled with fast food outlets, shops, hotels etc etc. the beach is 5 minutes slow walk from the ferry and on the inland side near the ferry is a smaller sheltered beach. Both beaches are golden sand and very clean.

Wonderful clean beach with good lifeguards. We visited here and loved the atmosphere of the whole beachfront. The local lifeguards were friendly and informative about the water conditions and about the history of the beach in general. We walked the road walkway to this beach and had some great beer in the local bars, saw family activity and "water play stations" and met so many friendly people!!
Nice Beach. Nice beach and surf. You will need fins, board and a wet suit to get out to breaking waves area. For those walking around Manley enjoy all the shops and people watching.

People Watching Galore. We took a ferry over to Manly from Sydney Harbour (a highlight in itself), went to the Amazing Sea Life Sanctuary and then walked through the town to the beach. We simply sat and watched what was going on in terms of sand games, surfing, sun tanning and so on. Grab something to eat and enjoy.

great for surfing...or just watching!. manly beach is not only the beach...it's a nice area in Sydney to come for a dat at the beach, to go surfing or just chilling at the beach and eperience a young and dynamic atmosphere away from a bustling downtown. There are plenty of cafes and coffee places to take a break from the beach and have a snack. Go for a walk along the beach, enjoy the breeze and the sound of crashing waves...fantastic!

Just got to do Manley. Great ferry cruise from Sydney into Manley Wharf down the Croso and onto Manley's spectacular beach with surfers zipping along the blue ocean.Great shops with lovely cheerful staff make the stroll a happy experience.Lunch overlooking the Pacific.A great day out would have loved to stay longer.Great coffee shop on the wharf.

Great place. Manly beach is a great place to be, always something is happening. Great beach with nice waves. Restaurants everywhere. Absolute worth to go to when you stay in the city. I would advise different, stay in Manly and go now and then to the city.

Nice and relax. The ferry ride is very pleasant offering stunning view of the harbour.The walk off the ferry pier to Manly Beach is a lovely stroll where one can find typical souvenir shops, restaurants and little eateries. There is also a market place with stalls selling handicrafts.The beach is absolutely beautiful - 180 degrees of blue sky blue water yellow sand. Sand is so fine and water is so cooling. There are tons of people but the beach is so long it doesn't feel too crowded. There are paved sidewalks for joggers or bikers or dog walkers or people who simply want to walk along the beach without getting sand. Water fountains are available and toilets are clean.The Manly Scenic Walk to the left of the pier is also a must do, though one may not have time to complete the whole 9 km. Looking back Sydney downtown from the north. Equally beautiful and tranquil walk.

Wonderful but. The day we visited Manly beach, most of it was closed due to dangerous currents. The lifeguards did an excellent job communicating where you could swim, but since this was just a small piece of the beach, it was very crowded. If you want the swim, wad into the walk, walk down to Shelly Beach on the way to Fairfax lookout (5 minutes). Here you can swim all you want, no waves.

Beautiful Eclectic Tourists Delight. Manly provides everything for locals and tourists. Dine on the Restaurant on the sand while watching the people sun bake, surf or paddle on the waters edge. It offers something for everyone. The Corso has every type of shop from Pharmacy, clothes stores, beauty therapy to grocery shopping. It is BUSY. Enjoy and take home your own special memories of this beautiful place.

Better Than Bondi. Way better than Bondi Beach. Seaside town. I would recommed walking away from Manly to Shelley beach where it is less sandy but more picturesque. However, it is one of the nicer beaches in Sydney

MANLY. It's one of my first stopping off points whenever I'm in Sydney. I just feel so relaxed there.Manly’s motto is ‘Seven miles from Sydney, a thousand miles from care.’ It’s the best known of the northern beach suburbs and definitely the most laid back. The Manly ferry – or the ‘famous Manly ferry’ as it says on the Sydney Ferry ships – has an almost iconic status locally. The journey takes half an hour from Circular Quay.You can head for Sealife, the seafront aquarium where sharks in giant tanks swim above your head. Or ramble along the Manly Scenic Walkway, a 10km (6 ¼ mile) jaunt from the town to Spit Head, with stunning views of Sydney and the harbour. Or, do what most of us do and head for the beach! From the ferry wharf, cross straight over the road to the main street, The Corso, then keep walking until you hit the seafront. Avoid the joggers, then find your spot…and relax on the sands.The Corso and the seafront are full of cafes and restaurants, so you won’t have far to walk for a bite or drink.

A nice day out. Across the sunny harbour (the traditional Manly ferry queue far too long, leaving the fast ferry at $8.50 a very attractive option - and at a 20 minute ride compared to 30, pretty good value).A tasty lunch at Papichulo Restaurant on the Manly Wharf and then a nice walk along the harbour beach, before a walk along the ocean beach (stopping for a while to watch some beach volleyball), and then back down the Corso.

A stunning beach!. This beach in the suburbs of Sydney is my idea of a perfect beach. Golden sand, blue sea & some good surf. Easy ferry journey from central Sydney & a really cool beach life atmosphere.

So beatiful. Manly beach is one of the coolest places ever. There is so much to see and do as well as if yoou just want to relax on the beach. In The Corso you will find all kinds of stores and restaurants as well as super markets and hotels. The beach is so nice and you can even rent a chair and an umbrella for the day and just sit there and enjpy the beatiful beach, people watch and chill out.

Ferry to Manly. It's a nice outing especially by ferry. The beach is pretty and if you go on a Sunday and you have a family, you can enjoy the family day fare of $2.50 per person for transportation throughout Sydney! There are plenty of souvenir shops and we all bought really cheap T-shirts that were identical to the ones being sold in Sydney for twice the price. On Sundays there are markets with fresh baked goods and arts and crafts too. There's no end of restaurant choices should you get hungry before catching the ferry back.

Beautiful beach, loved it here!. Took the Captain Cook cruise to Manly, which in itself is a great experience, the captain tells you about all of the various places you pass on the way. When you arrive at Manly you are at the harbourside, Manly is a peninsula, and you need to walk across the road and through the small town to arrive at the beautiful sandy beach on the other side to the harbour. The small town is lovely, very clean and tidy, and the beach itself is gorgeous. I loved it here, much nicer than Bondi!
Great Beach. Good beach with lots to do! Lovely golden sand. Busy but not as busy as other beaches in the area. Lovely ferry ride over from the harbour.
Good for Surfers. Good beach to surf or watch.Can be very hot and busy but beautiful sand.Lots of bars /cafes to eat and watch from in the shade.Very laid back.

wide clear beach with great swimming and other things to do!. My opinion is that this is a much better beach than the famous Bondi beach. Swimming was lovely and a good variety of shops and restaurants which surely must satisfy every taste! Easy access from Sydney on a very scenic return ferry ride which offered lovely views of Sydney and the surrounding bays! This is a "must not miss opportunity" for all visitors to Sydney!
Average, Nothing Special. Dear PlannersNothing Special, Just a normal beach, Go without expectationYes For all those who like to surfer on the waves, nice place for you guys

Great place to relax. We took the fast ferry from Circular Quay to Manly. This was part of our experience as it is a nice way to travel and see the city from the water.This a beach town and reminiscent of similar town I've been to in the USA. We walked the beach and relaxes by the store. We enjoyed a nice view over beers in the harbor. In March the weather was pleasant and the demeanor relaxed. If you'd like a slow day and a nice view, assuming the weather cooperates, it is a good option.
Scenic and Quiet. Terrific place to go with your friends and have a barbecue and have some beers. It is so peaceful out there.

Time for me to chill out on the Manly beach - great way to chill. I've always been drawn towards the sea , during my short trip to Sydney I needed a break from the touristy stuff I need to chill on the beach.So it was a no brainer when browsing thru my things to do in Sydney it said go for a trip to manly "winner winner chicken dinner"When the ferry left circular it was grey and wet but on arriving in manly the sun was out , I brought some fish and chips with extra crunchy batter and then headed to the Beach to chill and catch some rays .Lovely white sands and I managed to get a power nap in before heading back to the madness in Sydney.Great way to spend a few hours.

Beach town. Arrived by ferry,we took the 1/2 hour ride to this quaint town. To reach the beach we walked through the town centre lined with many shops ,bakeries, cafes. We rented beach chairs,3 hours/15$, spent the time sunning and walking the beach. Of course had to have fish and chips for lunch after. A great ,relaxing day!

been going there since a child. Great restaurants on the beach and of course the seafood is sensational. You know there's nothing as good as absolute freshness with seafood and on the beach you can get great fish and chips, not as rough as Bondi beach to swim in but still a nice swell and easier to swim in than the other beaches on the south side

great place to relax.... indeed, a great place to relax.. watch the surfers challenge the waves, the bikers pedaling along and some children play in the sand... the place is clean, of course windy and with plenty of shoppes/restaurants around.

Great view strong currents. We went two couples by ferry to the beach and also rented some chairs. The weather was good, about 25 degrees. We went bathing in the area between the flags. Big waves and clean beach. After a while though I ended up in some strong currents so had to get help from my boyfriend getting up to the beach. Scary. Recommend the Ben &. Jerry ice cream.

Great Day Excursion. We took the ferry and enjoyed a great view coming and going to Manly. There are 3 areas of interest. The Manly Harbor, the pedestrian area, and Manly Beach. All are worth exploring. The beach itself is beautiful. Very nice. We didn't go swimming, but we enjoyed the view. We highly recommend a visit to Manly/Manly Beach.

Loverly place. Well worth a visit and the ferry ride across.
Great place without the large crowds in other parts of sydney.Many eating places things to see.
Loved it. warm friendly beach, clean and not many waves,that day! Calm, and warm, very nice to spend a few hrs on,if you just wanted to relax for a few hrs

Iconic manly beach far better than Bondi. I am a local and with that knowledge and experience of Sydney beaches I rate Manly including North Steyne and Queenscliif beaches as the most beautiful City beaches of Sydney. 30 minute ferry ride from central Sydney Circular Quay the beach is surrounded by lovely headland to the north and southern area including the secluded Shelly Beach and marine park which is used regularly by scuba divers and learn to scuba dive courses. Many cafes and restaurants definitely worth a visit for tourists visiting Sydney.

Great Ferry Ride. Take the ferry to this great beach suburb of Sydney. It is a short walk from the ferry to the beach and the atmosphere is laid back small town for such a short ferry ride from downtown Sydney (20 min). It's a great day trip.

Nice Beach surrounded by Touristy Town. Manly Beach itself is beautiful, lovely fine tan sand and aquamarine waters--the problem is the surroundings which is totally honky tonk touristy. The place is painfully crowded except for the beach which had few people on the Sunday when we were there.
My favorite beach in Sydney. I loved Manly beach. It was my favorite beach in the Sydney area. Plenty to do. Restaurants, bars, sightseeing and shopping.

Great day at the beach walking along the prom.. we arrived at manly after catching the ferry and walked along the sandy beach which was full of surfers as there was a surf completion talking place this meant that the place was a hive of activity which just added to the whole attraction. The sun shone and the sea looked a magnificent blue. The sand was walk and smooth as it sealed between you toes. The whole place was just as it says a surfers paradise. One not to kiss if you are in town.

A lovely escape from the hustle and bustle of Sydney. Manly beach is a short ferry ride (17 mins express of 28 mins on the normal ferry) from downtown Sydney, but it feels like more. The beach is long, so doesn't feel too crowded. There are a lot of restaurants and bars along its length and a promenade for those who prefer not to walk on sand.
Lots to see and do. We had bad weather on our day at Manly but there are great restaurants (4 Pints) and some shopping so still plenty to do. Used the Ferry system to get out there.

Superb destination. This has to be the destination to go to if you only have time for one trip around the harbour in terms of beach and picturesque town.The Corso ( main street) is a bustling thoroughfare with shops and eateries to appeal to all. A wonderful beach but better still if you prefer a secluded one that is less crowded and is protected from ocean waves, walk the 15 mins or less it takes and go to Shelley Beach further round the coast - sand, sun and safe swimming.

Just Lovely. Took the ferry from the circular quay....beautiful sites of the harbor and opera house. Once at Manly we enjoyed the walk to the beach on the pedestrian way past the shops. The beach is gorgeous. a great day!

Beautiful Beach!. Manley Beach is the "everyman's beach", all types of visitors come to swim and watch the surfers. There are changing facilities/bathrooms right on the beach.Plenty of cafes right across the road from the beach so you can make a day of it.
Great Beach for outdoor fun. When we visited it was not to crowded and we were able to enjoy without the crowds on some of the more popular touristy beaches.
A nice place to chill. Lovely 'Promenade' lots going on. Really nice beach fronting areas af shops and restaurants. Lovely area to explore in countryside outside town

Great spot for younger crowd. It felt like another beach after having seen other beaches in Sydney. It was nice to stroll, but there was nothing extraordinary.The restaurants are overpriced,though there is a place or two to get a cocktail and listen to live music. The ferry was the best bit, though. The place is for the younger crowd for sure.

Gorgeous beach. It is a short walk down a wide concourse to the beach which stretches left and right in a curve bordered by pine trees. The sand is wide and white. Families, surfers and swimmers of all ages were enjoying the water. We loved it and walked to Shelly Beach on the well maintained walkway.

manly a wonderful,cosmopolitan place to visit and relax. great Restaurants and bars..shops and walks.A wonderful place to take the family and enjoy the beach,the walks and the Aquarium...To our country family it is a "Home away from home" and easy access to the C.B.D.with a beautiful Ferry ride!!

Really awesome time. On my first day in Sydney I took the ferry to Manly and had an awesome walk all around. I spent several hours enjoying it all! There was a surf completion as well as a boot camp type of completion going on. Lots of people enjoying the beach, the surf and looking at beautiful people!

Beautiful beach lots of shops/restaurants. Yes the beach is a large sprawling beach. The water is beautiful. It reminds me a lot of a large Coronado, CA beach. My family loved the beach but I was more interested in the huge amount of shopping and there were so many wonderful restaurants to choose from. Even the Ferry terminal shopping and restaurants were great. It's a must see!The reason I say there is a fee for this is because you have to take the beautiful ferry ride to get there but once you get there you don't have to buy anything.

Ferry. Fast ferry took about 20 mins to get to Manly. Great views all the way. Had lunch at a hotel in the square opposite the church . It was a great lunch . Big portions , reasonably priced . I remember it was around $50 for the two of us . Great for surfers.

Pasific Ocean. we were there on may JUne but it is summer time for Australia. beach is nice. Pacific ocean was not calm. was many people there. some of them making surf. water was very cold winter. we aet ice cream. took much fresh ocean air. got cold.
Peaceful. Nice and relaxing for a nightly stroll. Sort of inspiring with all the fitness fanatics circling around :)
Better than Bondi. Visiting Sydney and only time to visit one beach? Manly is the one. Loads of places to eat, drink and Sandy scenes all around.
Nice Beach. Worth a visit to the beach and all local shops, cafes etc right next to beach. Accessible by ferry from Sydney Circular quay.
for sand lovers. lovely beach, nice nik nak shops local, plenty of places to dine and good value considering the location
Much better than Bondi. This is a lovely beach with plenty of eating places to choose from. Can on the south side walk on paths to Shelly Beach which is protected from strong winds.

Good little haven away from the hustle and bustle of sydney. A short and fairly cheap boat ride takes you to manly,on which you get a great view of the harbor and bridge. Manly is a lovely little beach spot away from Sydney with a lovely art gallery
Fabulous beach. well worth the ferry ride. Public toilets could do with a refurb but beach is beautiful. Also a nice walk to the nature reserve to the right hand side of the beach.

Great beach, shame about all the tourist trappings. If you could just get off the Manly Ferry and be at the beach, it would be great, but you have to run the gauntlet of half a mile of tourist shops and restaurants to get to the beach which is inevitably grubby. The beach though is great with wonderful surf and lot of lifeguards to keep you safe.

A must ferry trip from Circular Quay. The cost of a return ticket on the ferry is reasonable (although you can get to Manly by car but it is a long way round). It was a glorious day and a lovely couple of hours on the beach. Loads of street cafes and restaurants - great fish food options! Lovely little shopping area. Definitely recommended and unbelievably close to the beautiful city of Sydney!

Maybe it just wasn't my day.... We went to Bondi beach two before Manly and thought it was glorious - sunny with magnificent views despite the throngs of people. Manly beach was kind of disappointing compared to that. We heard that it rained heavily in Sydney the day before, and it was drizzling slightly on the day itself so maybe that was the reason the beach looked gloomy. There's also a rather unsightly sewer or water pipe from the town going into the water right in the middle. That alone would knock off one star. We took a coastal stroll to the nearby Shelly beach and while it was decent we didn't find it particularly great.

Manly a Must to Visit. After the hustle & bustle of Sydney Manly is a great place to relax where you can surf & swim, have a drink in one of the many bars or eat in one of the many excellent restaurants!The easy way to get there is by ferry from either Darling harbour or Circular Quay. ferries sail every 30 minutes.

Love this place, very nice & shopping area.. We had the day over in manly, we enjoyed the day there, lunch sitting outside very nice food, To finish the day off with ice cream, I would totally recommend this place.Reminds me of mini gold coast.
Best beach. Excellent beach ,nice walks and lots of shops and eating place. Easy to get to on ferry which is a nice ride out.
Beach. The three main sections of Manly Beach are Queenscliff, North Steyne, and South Steyne. it's a nice beach and there is a nice water.

good day out from Sydney. Ferry from Circular Quay takes 35 minutes and is enjoyable in itself.Manly is a nice little resort town with a good choise of restaurants and cafes. The shopping there is mainly tourist related but there are a few more individual shops. Big draw is the ocean beach which has great waves and is safe for swimming.There is an excellent coastal walk to neighbouring bays if the temperature isn't too hot.

Manly is always a great place to visit. I used to come to Manly when I was a kid and I am pleased to say that it is still a great place to visit. Catch the ferry from The Quay, wander down The Corso, grab fish & chips or ice cream at the beach end, then walk around the beach front from Shelly Beach to Queenscliff. What a great way to spend the day.

Another Australian icon. Aussie sun, surf and sand at it's best. A lovely place to while away time in the sun, have a swim, enjoy fish and chips under the trees and people watch. It's clean, safe and has Surf Lifesavers on patrol.
Great to sit and watch the Nippers on a Sunday:-). terrific to wander along the beach front - heaps to see - Surf club were out and about and great coffee across the road .
great waves. Nice beach with big waves. Great if you're a surfer, not so great if you just want to swim. Lots of shops and restaraunts.
wonderful beach beautifully cared for. A very different atmosphere to Bondi and beautifully laid out. Well worth a day visit in only 30 minutes form Sydney and a great place to relax in.
Beautiful bay. Beautiful place to bring your dog, paddleboard, set up a picnic, or watch the sunset. The water is calmer at this beach since it is a bay so it would be great for kids to play.
Better than Bondi. Worth the visit, much more beautiful and less touristic than Bondi. We hired a car to get there but think by bus would be as easy.

MANLY BEACH. A cyclone was brewing in Queensland so the ocean was fairly rough but it was still great to see such a lovely beach. Many food outlets with great food on offer. Well worth the trip on the Manly ferry to have some quieter time out!
Go and surf !. This place is awesome for the surf or just to eat an icecream watching people on their surf ... Enjoy your day here !
A Nice Place. Got the ferry to manly beach and had a short walk past the lovely shops and restaurants. Beach was great too with lots of people enjoying the sun.

A Definite Highlight to Our Trip. We could have easily spent the day here. It's probably one of the most beautiful beaches we've ever seen! From the Manly Ferry, you just continue straight ahead out the exit and there it is. A short walk past lovely shops, restaurants, and pubs. A definite highlight to our trip!
Great beach, near downtown.. We enjoy our family holydays in there. Great beach to go surfing,only a few km from sydney downtown.

Beats bondi by a mile!. Get the ferry to manly beech. You see the harbour in all its glory, then it's a short walk past lovely shops and restaurants to a fab unspoilt beach. Really beautiful. Def worth the trip. A must see!!!

Absolutely Gorgeous. I'm gonna write a minimal amount here, but all you need to know is the newest version of 'The Great Gatsby' was filmed right up the road. Another good thing to know, the lifeguards are world famous for their safety, so get in the water already!

Excellent example of an Aussie beach. It was exciting to watch the surfers, shop and eat at the restaurants along the beach front. It was a bit rough and windy for us to swim, but we enjoyed sitting on the beach.

One of Sydney's great iconic beaches. Manly Beach is one of Sydney's iconic beaches. Has been a place to go for many years. Easy to get to by public transport, especially the Manly Ferry. Great food options on The Corso and plenty of places to sit and watch the world go by. Fantastic place.

a walk at the beach. nice long beach....
lots of people picnic, resting, playing along the beach...
wave is quite big...
can swim a bit at this area...
nice view also all around the beach

Even on a dreary day, worth the ferry ride & short walk - bustling & interesting for everyone. Even on a dreary day, worth the ferry ride & short walk - bustling & interesting for everyone. Plenty of food (and not just fast), cafe, pubs, souvenirs, drinking water fountain, play ground for kids.

One of the best beaches in Sydney. Manly is the North Shores Bondi, minus the pretentious muscle heads and girls who go to the beach in full make up.
More chilled laid back, and consistent waves for a fun day surfing or swimming. Some great shops and bars, restaurants. A surf school and volleyball nets. This is a great day out for all the family.
A picturesque spot. A lovely town and beachside walk with plenty of reasonably priced restaurants and bars. Good for swimming and clean beach.

Can't leave without visit. Always a great stop when in Sydney. Very clean and safe. Get the ferry walk down to back beach. Tempting to get off ferry and stay close by but 5 mins walk and really great beach. So much to do shops , restaurants and bars.

Loved this beach. Had heard so much about this beach so was worried it would not fit the bill. It did! It was clean, great waves to jump and well staffed. The day we visited so did a shark, but it was well managed.

Fun in the sun!. Took a ferry to get to Manly was a enjoyable ride. Stopped at the Aldi to grab some drinks and snacks. Short walk from ferry to beach. Upon arriving at beach we rented chairs. Beach is very nice sand is soft. Water is clean. Life guards in area, while we were there they closed a section of beach due to rip rides. The waves were awesome many people trying to surf. Would visit this beach again if in Sydney.
Just Perfect. Don't miss this place it's a must if your holidaying around Sidney. There is something for everyone in the town and about 5 beaches including the main Oceanside Beach.

Beautiful Beach. We took the ferry from Circular Quay and visited Manly Beach twice during our stay in Sydney. Manly has a great corso with shops and restaurants that leads to the beach. The beach itself is very nice and we swan between the flags at the southern end. I enjoyed Manly because it was easy to get to and is beautiful.

clean, good view, great shops and streets. good beach, nice people, clean and functional facilities, e.g. parents room, public drinking water supply, etc.
just a little bit crowded, though we didn't visit Bondi Beach and cannot make a comparison.

One of Australia's Best Beaches.... Beautiful white sandy bay that stretches for 1.5kms....great for a stroll, surf, swim or sun laze (in the shade of an umbrella of course). Great beach activities and plenty of great restaurants, cafes, shops, banks and services right near by. Leave the car and catch the ferry or bus to Manly to avoid hefty parking fees - or ride your bike, there are convenient bike racks too. Spend a day or a week and you'll want to come back for more...
expensive. from the overpriced fish n chips and the hire on beach rippping us off,.. i dont know why i would go back
Nice !. Nice beach but not exceptional . Plenty of caffe's and restaurants across the road and a lovely walk around the sea wall to park land and other caffe's

Great fun but perhaps not suitable for young children. Great walk from ferry to beach and then arrive at lovely stretch of clean, soft, white sand. The obvious thing is to go directly ahead into the sea but there were regular warnings from the increasingly-fed-up lifeguard, telling swimmers to go to the small swimming area at the right. So, if I went back, I would choose a spot on the sand nearer these flags. Even the so-called "safe" area was pretty rough. Great fun to jump over or dive into the waves rather than having a relaxing swim but presumably this varies a lot. Very pretty area and would like to have done the coastal walk above the beach.

Perfect beach to go while you in Sydney, not just families but all. Good atmosphere and you can find all you need, area with waves area without and that you can swim. close to restaurants etc. A bit far and best to go by ferry but worth it

Just 30 mins away from city centre. I took the Manly Ferry from the circular quay in Sydney Harbour, It took me around 30 mins reaching the Manly beach, while you arrive, you will feel the peace around, nice people and great sea view that is different from the city life, go to have a look if you have time.
Fab Manly!. We loved everything about this town - including the beach - which to our untrained eyes was better than Bondi

Beach lovers should be here. . Clean and one of the well known beaches close to Sydney. The beach is always filled with people sunbathing, relaxing under the garden shades enjoying the beautiful sea view. Plenty of shops nearby if you decide to take a last minute swim or forgotten the important stuff to enjoy the day by the beach. Plenty of F&B shops as well, but mainly Western food and sushi. Close to walk to from the main wharf. Walk across the road all the way straight follow the crowds, you won't miss it.

12 years on.. 12 years ago I took my breakfast on the balcolny of the penthouse suite (they had overbooked us!) of the Manly Pacific and soaked up the view. I was facinated to watch surfers dice with death (I thought, not being a surfer) then after an hour,return to their cars. dry off. put on shirts, ties and suits and drive away to their 'high powered' jobs in the city. What a life and what a sight. There are surf schools and instruction for most water sports i.e.. canoeing, kayaking, paddleboards. Cyclists can hire cycles for the day.Manly is a superb beach for all manner of sporting activities but also for a gentle stroll, as opposed to the Power Walking so in evidence these days. There are numerous cafes/restaurants along the beach road. I love the laid back atmosphere of Manly, which is more evident on weekdays.We love it because in the evening or a quiet morning, when the crowds have gone, it is simply beautiful.What we don't like- it's become too popular, too crowded.So forget all I've said good about it. Don't waste your time there. Find somewhere else. Please.

Surfers' Paradise. We had a lovely walk along the promenade by Manly Beach, watching the waves breaking on the beach and the surfers waiting for the perfect wave (the national surfing championships were underway).

Best beach. Sydney and beaches ... one rinks of Bondi. Manly, from my point of view, is much better! There is the beachside to the harbour, no waves and shallow water and there is the beach side to the Pacific - great! The pedestrian shopping area is well looked after, shops of all kinds are there, even supermarkets. The Pacific beach side is framed by restaurants, bars and coffee shops - something for everybody. Do not miss Manly beach!

Extraordinary Beach. Absolutely a MUST if you travel by Sydney, the beach is beautiful and full of live, has public bathrooms and sweet water showers. In the surrounding areas you will find nice coffes and restaurants.
lifeguards on duty. Very clean and fun. My son had a great day here. Showers and bathroom facility available. Would have liked to have a beach chair.

Iconic. Manly Beach is one of those places that have to be done.We caught the fast ferry from Circular Quay and it rained as we arrived. A short run from Ferry terminal takes you to a long road to the beach which has shops with covered walkway. Rained stopped halfway down and arrived at beach which was clean and well used by surfers and beach volley ball. Couple of restaurants on road opposite beach for coffee.Next time hope it will be sunny... but still nice

Worth the trip for the views alone. While visiting Sydney I took the chance to catch up with my nephew who has lived in Australia for several years, married a lovely Aussie girl and now has a young son. He suggested a day trip to Manly beach and we set off on the 30 minute journey by ferry from Circular Quay (NB a return ticket is $15AU - just less than £10). On disembarking from the ferry we headed for the beach along what is known as The Corso and our noses quickly picked up on a delicious aroma coming from a fish n' chip shop where a queue had formed. A quick show of hands resulted in a unanimous vote to grab something from this shop and 'dine' on the beach rather than seeking out a restaurant or bar for lunch - and that choice didn't disappoint! SEE ACCOMPANYING PHOTO FOR DETAILS.The beach itself is pretty spectacular although I have to confess that I prefer the beach at Bondi. There, I've said it! However, I think that may simply be because when we visited Manly they were preparing for a big international surfing contest and there was a lot of building work going on on the promenade which was both noisy and a bit intrusive. That said, I much preferred the shopping area around Manly to Bondi, the latter being a bit too 'touristy' for my liking.All things considered, it was a good day out and Manly beach is certainly worth a visit - the ferry ride alone with its spectacular harbour views justifies the trip!

Beachlover. We spent a lovely afternoon on Manly Beach in February 2015. It is just a great pace for swimming and surfing and we found the changing/showering facilities to be good,likewise vigilance from the lifesaving dept. truly a beautiful beach.
Great Beach. This is a beach where you can chill out on and it's not quite so hectic. Great place to swim and the surf is awesome!!

Highly Recommend. Manly Beach is reached by ferry from Circular Quay in Sydney. It is about a 30 minute ferry ride. An absolutely beautiful beach with a meandering walk way that leads you to Shelly Beach and hiking trails. When you get off the ferry across the street is an information center. Life guards are on duty where you will find surfers catching the waves, a large sandbar to walk out to and a netted swimming area that catch jelly fish and probably other undesirable critters. There are water fountains for filling bottles as well as drinking fountains. We purchased some fruit and a couple of snacks from Cole's grocery store on Wentworth Street before heading to the beach and hiking trail. When we were there it is a Sunday, up around 90 degrees and the beach didn't seem crowded at all. While walking around don't forget to look for the water dragons.

Visit during Sundays . I used to visit this beach with family while I was in Australia, taking the advantage of Sunday Funday in public transport in Sydney. My daughter would enjoy playing in sand, making sand castles. The ferry ride to and from Circular Quay was nice. We also used to take ferry sometimes from darling harbour.
Great beach. Well worth the trip we took the ferry there and back about 30 min each way great beach, coffee shops and shopping.

MA says "the best". Took the ferry over from Sydney which in itself is a lovely trip.For me this is a much better beach than Bondi. It's a lot smaller but it is spotlessly clean and has a much more classy feel with a promenade . The buildings along the frontage add to the charm of the whole place and is a must on anybody's itinery.

Nice beach near shopping centre. It's good clean beach that very close to the shooting centre,manly ferry port and others stuff.. Use manly ferry from circular quay on Sunday opal card cheap traveler family fun day $2.50 ( u only pay once $2.50 for unlimited travel on Sunday)

Better than Bondi. On my recent trip to Sydney I visited both Bondi and Manly. Bondi is much larger and the waves are too if surfing is your thing. But unless you have a car getting to Bondi is difficult and even with a car, you will have a lot of traffic. Manly is just a short walk from the Ferry wharf. 30 minute ferry ride over to Manly, then walk to the beach. (Actually there is a pretty good beach on the harborside of Manly, where you get off the ferry.) The water seemed warmer at Manly as well. There are lots of food providers just across the street from the beach. So you can purchase food and take it on the beach. Be sure to visit the Steyne Hotel for great selection of beers.
Great Beach. Great beach located in Sydney. Across the road from the shopping and restaurant district where you can find almost anything your after.

Excellent day trip, 30mins from Sydney. . Visited on weekend in between business trip. A$15.20 return ferry tickets from Circular quay wharf 3. The 30min ride itself is a treat!The beach itself was busy on Sunday but surely not quite as busy as Bondi. The real relaxing thing is the small town in between the beach and the ferry terminal. Small little town with good selections of food and shops, back packers hostel and some hotels. Free freshwater quick raise areas available off the beach but don't expect anything more than that. (Or maybe I don't know proper shower facilities are available) Impt - swim ONLY in between the flags and always listen to the lifeguards about jelly fish warnings among other instructions!
Manly Beach. A lovely beach and lots happening around. Good to watch people have a great time on the beach and surfing.

Famous Beach, Must-See. The Manly Beach is THE waterfront beach to-seein Sydney. The beach is wide, clean and presents a big place to bathe, catch some sun, or simply to take a walk. Get there by ferry or bus.

Great Beach to vist!!. Took the ferry from Sydney to Manly beach. The ferry ride is amazing, its very pretty with lots of scenery. Had gellato and roamed the streets for a couple of hours. Exceptionally clean and wonderful shopping and the sea coast was spectacular. Exceptional food and history in this town.

Rough Surf. This is a beautiful beach , nice touristy pedestrian area and nice walkway around the beach area. It was a very windy day when we were there and the surf was fierce. Perfect for surfers but not for swimmers or waders. The walkway around the beach was a nice little hike and we enjoyed seeing it.

Long and Beautiful Beach. I was in Sydney for 5 days and it was relatively cool each day except my last one, where the temps went way up. My first thought was to get out to the beach. I took the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay. Ferries run every 30 minutes. The hot and sunny Sunday I went, was also the 2nd day of the Australian Open of surfing, so ferry lines were very very long. The ride out takes maybe 20 minutes or so. You get off the ferry and pretty much walk straight into the main street of Manly. Naturally there is lots of touristy stuff, but just keep walking and you dead end into the beach. The beach is long. I only walked north and it still took some time. When I was there, it was the surfing event, so there was a lot of event stuff there. Otherwise it would be a pretty open area to walk through. I walked north to the surf club and cliff area. You can climb around on the rocks along the shoreline and probably even go further north, but I wasn't feeling adventurous that day. Theres lots to do on the main street and its offshoots too. Plenty of places to eat and drink. Shopping. There's also lots of places to fill up your water bottle and public restrooms.

Nice beach, lots of facilities. Busy !. Lovely sand and water, with all the facilities you need nearby. Easy access from Sydney on the manly ferry. But all these good features attract a lot of people !

I do like to be beside the seaside. Beaches both on the surfside and harbourside. A long strip of sand stretching about 2 kms. Lots of pubs and cafes/restuarants nearby. A nice day out by ferry from the city. A series of walks along the beach or nearby bushland and national parks. Plenty of shade from the pine trees on hot days. Harbourside is popular for picnickers. Very busy on weekends and public holidays.

Gorgeous Manly. We have visited Manly many times and we went in Feb 2015. Really good mix of shops and restaurants and also a great beach - great family feel! Worth the trip from circular quay for the ferry ride alone!
Beach life. Nice Beach. Very over crowded With mass tourism. A lot of strong stream in the water. Many resturants and cafe opportunities. And shopping stores

Iconic view. The best thing about a trip to Manly Beach is the ferry back- an iconic view of the Opera House and Harbor Bridge. There is also an Aldi in the ferry terminal if you want to stock up on Tim Tam cookies.
Nice Beach and shops. Around 40 min by ferry with a nice and long beach and some good restaurants within walking distance.

Excellent beach. A long and beautiful beach. There are lifeguards so safe. The breakers are not huge but could be intimidating for poor swimmers. There are other beaches close by but the main beach is really worth a visit. Manly is a lovely place with shops and plenty restaurants. A really good place to get away from the city and experience a holiday atmosphere.

Loved, loved, loved Manly Beach. We had no idea of the breadth of Manly Beach. The town is lively and charming, with lots of eating and shopping choices. The main street had these cool looking, low fountains bubbling up in a row, and we loved the many stations where you could fill your bottle with good drinking water. There was a public restroom on the beach where we could easily change in and out of our swimsuits. We thought the ocean was pretty chilly, but the beach itself is beautiful. Everything is easily accessible from where the ferry lands. Great way to spend a sunny day!
Amazing Beach. It was the best beach I saw in Sydney. Also the area around it has old world charm and love the frisco kind of roads. Ate at an Indian restruant close by.

Lovely beach. Take the ferry and walk to Manly Beach through the business district of Manly. ( the upper floors of the businesses look old and quaint but the shops are very touristy and new). The beach is big and lovely and uncrowned on the day we went. Much bigger and nicer than Bondi Beach and easier to get to.Interesting that part of the beach was closed due to shark spottings, but even families walked past the signs and were in the water. You are supposed to only enter the water on Australian beaches between posted flags as those areas are deemed safe but everyone seems to disregard them. No wonder every beach has an active lifeguard building and many lifeguards patrolling.Take the walkway to the left of the beach and see the surfers close up. We also spotted a lizard sunning himself, posing for pictures next to the path.Nice restaurants next to the beach with outside patios. Local barramundi available and delicious, although like everything in Australia, expensive

Manly - Alternative Beach Little Penquin Beach. Do go and see Manly Beach but it is "blowy" so be warned! It is ocean side and very rare for it be calm ..... similar to Surfers Paradise! Well worth going to sea, but if you are looking for a calmer beach .... then when you get off the ferry and leave the wharf turn immediately left, and there is a lovely protected sandy beach, safe to swim as it has a shark net etc and very relaxing! Tends to be used by locals to avoid the bustle of Main Beach
Great beach area. Beautiful beach, many cafes and restaurants. A great place for people watching and catching some rays( from the sun ) of course.

great beach. Handy location where you can easily get there. By ferry or by bus. There is shower facility provided, coastal walk along the beach. Only walk cross the road, there is a shopping arcade, so convenient in every thing. A great place you can't be missed.

Nice and Clear water.. Manly is a great place to relax in Sydney, easy to get to from Circular Quay. The beach is very wide and popular. It has nice sand and great waves. The water is very shallow so you can walk a long distance and enjoy the waves (most people do just that, not many people swim).

Lovely Beach after a Lovely Ferry Ride. The Manly Beach is lovely! In my opinion, a lot more beautiful than Bondi Beach but probably not as well known. The ferry ride over is really cheap and a lot of fun and includes specatactular views of the Opera House and Sydney skyline. The lively and colorful street from the ferry station to Manly Beach is a lot of fun with many bars, cafés, restaurants and shops.

Best beach. Love Manly Beach so much that we came to live here.Surfing, Nippers, restaurants, people-watching-what is not to love?easy to get to on the ferry-sometimes people mistake the small harbour beaches at the ferry station and wonder what the fuss is about (lovely as they are). Walk down the Corso and jump into the surf.
plenty to do. Love this beach and surrounding area. Lots of cafes, walks and great beach for everyone to enjoy. Good shopping too
Too small to be Manly. Rather small and not so clean..had a net to protect dirt and possibly sewage from seeping in...a very urban definition of a beach...The ferry ride is good..

Excellent beach, just minutes from Sydney. Take the ferry from downtown Sydney to Manly Beach.Enjoy an excellent day at the beach. It's supposed to be safer than Bondi Beach.We also enjoyed the surf classes: where the tourists try to surf for the first time. It's entertaining to see them struggle.It's notable that even the beaches in NSW are smoke free. So walk to the other side of the road to light a Marlboro.Enough places to grab a coffee or lunch around here.Walk one block away from the beach to get a better value for your money.

Beach day. Great beach. Clean sand and shady areas along the prom with fantastic mature trees.Pity about the sewage smell at the Manly Life Saving Club. I hope it wasn't raw sewage going to the sea here because there was lots of people, including children, in the water.Lovely walks in either direction along the beach and beyond but I hope this doesn't get spoilt on the beach or in the town by the introduction of trashy attractions or shops.Only 40 minutes by ferry from Circular Quay, Sydney by ferry.

lovely beach. we got te fast ferry over here which was nice. spent the morning on the beach watching surfing which was fun missed a surfing a music festival which is non the following week from our visit that looked like it would be good to c

Very nice beach. Manly is a great place to relax in Sydney, easy to get to from Circular Quay. The beach is very wide and popular. It has nice sand and great waves. The water is very shallow so you can walk a long distance and enjoy the waves (most people do just that, not many people swim). There are life guards on the beach so everything was safe and sound. Around the beach you can find many interesting animals like Eastern Water Dragons. There is a very nice scenic walk to Manly that starts from the beach.

Great atmosphere and beach. Take the ferry to Manly for a relaxed day at the beach. Nice clean beach, great swim, friendly crowd and enough options for lunch. Lot's of nice shops if you need swimming gear on the way, we didn't see any umbrella's or beach chairs when we were there, not sure if you can rent anything.
Watch out for sharks. Lovely white sand, breaking waves, blue sea, busy and popular. Loads of places to eat and drink to suit all tastes.

Great day at the beach.. Good day at the beach but there was not a place to rinse or shower anywhere. We would have liked to go to eat lunch somewhere but because we could not change or rinse off we went back to our hotel in Sydney.

Manly. I Like everything about Manly ... BUT I a local so as a local I do not tend to go there at weekends because it is so LOVED by the traveller. Been there today and did the PARASAIL with 'BALLONS ALOFT" Embarrassed to say after living 25 years close by I had not done it before - FIVE STAR

Like going to a British beach...only better!. I don't think a lot of Asian-centric Aussies are going to like this but Manly? It feels like going to a British beach...only without all the crappy amusement arcades and with far better eating options. Its what Brighton, Southend or Weymouth COULD be like. A nice long clean beach, nice and warm. On the shore there are loads of excellent restaurants and theres a great pedestrianised high street with lots of shopping. All in all, ignore Bondi. Its overrated. Instead, get the ferry to Manly instead!

The Real Jewel of Sydney's Beaches. Bondi is perhaps the most famous beach in Sydney, known around the world. But for my money Manly beats it hands down. Then again perhaps I am biased because I live here.If you are taking a holiday do not miss Manly. take the 30 minute ferry from Circular Quay and plan to spend the day browsing through the shops on Manly Corso. Laze on the beach (making sure you use sun stop lotion) and take a swim in the Pacific Ocean.Manly is also a famous surf beach and a short walk from Manly Beach is Shelley Beach, which has fabulous snorkeling above coral reefs. This area is a national park, so some of the fish, including a giant groper, are very tame because they are used to humans.Manly has so many restaurants it is difficult to chose. But as you are near the beach, opt for fish or seafood. There are many great seafood restaurants, or a cheaper option is to buy your fish and chips from a fish and chip shop and take them to the beach to eat.But watch out for the seagulls. They are always looking for a free meal.
The charm of experience.. Excellent. You will an extraordinary charm when visiting. Warm weather and blue sky, sounds of ocean.
Chill. Nice place to relax. Even children are very well behaved. No screeming only squeals of pleasure. Restaurants and shops all close by. I enjoyed the ferry trip there and the whole experience.

A day in paradise. Manly beach was amazing!! We lounged on the sand, swam a few times (the water is so clear, warm, and wonderful!), and soaked up the sun. It doesn't feel too hot because of the warm breeze coming in off the water. Watching the surfers was always fun, and jumping in the waves couldn't be beat!

Best ride in town. Hop on a ferry to Manly. Such a great way to travel and the trip is so cheap ($6.20 each way). The ferry leaves from Circular Quay regularly (every 20 to 30 minutes depending on time of day) and passes the Opera House, the Sydney Harbour Bridge, various harbour beaches and points, beautiful harbour side houses, bush reserves and the 'Heads' - the opening to Sydney Harbour which can get a bit rough sometimes and give you a thrilling ride as the huge waves from the open sea rock the ferry from side to side. Also view the yachts, boats and ships as they move around the glorious harbour - on a clear sunny day it is magical. And Manly at the end of the trip is a little treasure - a mall of fast food shops, cafes, pubs and surf shops with the harbour down one end and the famous Manly beach at the other. Try to time your return so that you are coming back into Circular Quay at sunset with the Sydney Harbour Bridge as the backdrop. Magical.
Hard to beat. Soft sand, friendly surf, warm water, and lots of restaurants and bars. A great place to visit. Can get crowded weekend afternoons.

Fabulous beach. been to this beach on numerous occasions so easy to get to just get the ferry from circular quay takes about 30 minutes than a 5 minute walk through the town through all the shops and restaurants .Beach is clean and has sun beds and deckchairs for hire .loads of places to eat try the fresh fish and chips numerous takeaways eat them on the beach while taking in the great views.

Beach. Excellent. Walk around sit along the beach and enjoy the views and the weather. The pedestrian walk way was nice and wide with a park like setting with lots of shade There are nice little places to sit and get a snack. I liked the separation from the beach to the road and parking.

Holiday of a lifetime. We visited this wonderful beach and town as part of our stay in Sydney, woh it was a fantastic addition to the city trip offering relaxation and tranquility. We would have loved to spend the full day there, but had a busy schedule

Great day out on Manly Beach. Took a first time visitor for a a day out in Sydney and chose Manly as the destination. Did the whole thing took the ferry, a must do, sat on the beach, swam in the warm sea..it was a Sturday so it was busy with plenty to see and do, we enjoyed a couple of beers in a local bar over lunch and watched the world go by. Given its location so close to the City CBD any visitor, especially you business types who has a spare Saturday before returning home should make Manly a must do!

Walk or swim. There Is a footpath for walking so you can walk quite a long way from Shelly Beach, right along Manly beach and as far as Queenscliff. The beach itself usually has some good surf and is quite clean. Often there is a man displaying a giant sandcastle, there are changerooms and toilets and numerous eateries just across the road from the beach. One of my favourite beaches to go to. Great family place.
swimming. easy walk up the Corso from the ferry , surf very safe and patrolled . showers and plenty of eateries and a lovely walk around to Shelly Beach with a pool on the way.

Day trip. Do yourself a favour and catch the ferry from Circular Quay. Stroll along the Corso to the pacific ocean. Then walk along the beach front. Watch people surfing etc. If you go left you can walk to North Styne and back ( 45 mins) and if you turn right you can walk along a lovely pathway to Shelly beach. Once back at the Corso , there are a stack of nice cafes to pick from -all good - or you could have a beverage at one of the handful of nice bars .There is a great aquarium on the harbour side thats worth a visit . While you are waiting for the return ferry be sure to pop into the wharf bar and meet the trendy locals. It can be a whole day trip , there is plenty to do and see. The trip across alone is worth it. As the local say 7 miles from Sydney and a thousand miles from care.

Great atmosphere. I preferred this beach to Bondi. It is a bit of bother to get there. You have to take a ferry from the Opera House area which was a bit of a dash and busy as I went during the New Year period, but the ride was nice and you get to see another angle of the Opera House. Manly Island is really lovely and the beach was much nicer than Bondi in my opinion. Manly town was so charming too. I would definitely recommend a day trip out there. There are plenty of restaurants and cafes to chose from or you could just take a picnic and spend the day on the beach. Lovely waves and I saw many surfing schools out teaching beginners which was fascinating to watch.

Beautiful area to visit. Great spot and easy to get to from the city if you're a visitor to Sydney. Always plenty of action. Lots of cafes, restaurants and bars and of course one of the fantastic beaches on the northern side.

A great day out. Take the ferry to Many, walk down the corso to Manly beach then the walkway to Shelly Beach. This is a great place for a swim, gentle rolling waves, not too rough, great snorkelling, good manly views, plenty of park and shady trees , take a picnic , nice walk. Alternately go back the same way and have a bite to eat at Manly.

Manly beach, Sydney. This is our favorite beach, we think it is better than Bondi . and if you walk from the beach to Shelley beach, which only takes fifteen minutes, you find yourself in a little paradise, not unlike the beautiful French Riviera beaches, perfect for snorkeling !

A SAFE FAMILY BEACH. How wonderful to have a day catching a slow ferry from the City to Manly, spending a few hours on the beach or walking around Manly, then either a fast ferry or the slow ferry again back to the City. If you are on a busy schedule of sight-seeing a day like this is very relaxing. There are still things to see in Manly - the Art Gallery (turn left when you exit the wharf and walk to the end of the harbour beach area) (donation appreciated), Manly Sea Life Sanctuary is next door to this if this is more your thing.(charge but worth the money, especially if you watch the shark feeding).
Fun. I really love manly it it so much better than Bondi and the surf was way better. I loved the food and the beach and the people it was the highlight of my holiday I would love to do again

Manly Beach is not the end of the world. I would return to Manly Beach so I could eat at Chat Thai on Manly Wharf or walk from Manly Corso to Shelly Beach or to walk from Queenscliff to Freshwater via the hidden tunnel through the cliff.

Perfect beach day. Manly is a great beach town to visit. We first stopped in at the tourist info center and got great recommendations for food, drinks, beaches and shops. If you can plan to be there on a Sunday give yourself time to wander the market - lots of great handcrafted decor, clothes, gifts, art, etc.Be sure to check out Shelley beach and give yourself lots of time so you can go at a lazy pace and enjoy the beach and pool along the way.Lively atmosphere but relaxed people. In general, a young crowd on the beaches and at the bars.

beach. I love Manly beach, I have been going there since I was a young teen. The restaurants & icecream shops are very good, the pubs are great also you can sit in one of them, eat your lunch , enjoy a wine & see the beach just across the road.There is always a beaut sea breeze coming through the big windows.
Worth a trip. A good day out, across on the ferry (can be a little rough), nice safe beach, good eating places and people watching.
So close but far enough from city bustle. The only way to travel to Manly Beach is a 30 minute ferry ride followed by a few hours at the beach followed by fish & chips or a cool drink
Take a picnic. The beach at Manly is lovely but I think the Cafes are making a living out of average food. It's not on the top of my list of Sydney attractions.

Manly Beach. This iconic beach is just a short and delightful ferry ride from the City. There are plenty of restaurants and cafes to suit all price ranges. The hotel on the wharf is a very popular spot with twenty-somethings at weekends.The beach itself is long and patrolled areas for swimming are at both ends.Manly Beach was always popular with country folk who years ago always spent their annual holidays there.There are often interesting markets held along the beach front and there are many Surf Carnivals and Music festivals held there.
Better than Bondi!. Perhaps it's a "north shore" thing, but I've always reckoned Manly Beach to be a better destination than Bondi. Great refreshment choices too.

Manly. Seven miles from Sydney and a million miles from care.. The best part of Sydney is Manly. Manly is the crown jewel in the magnificent city of Sydney. Great surf beaches, idyllic harbour beaches, excellent walks, great pubs, restaurants, cafes and nightlife. Everything you need to have a very enjoyable stay and all within walking distance.
Serene and long beach. One of the best beaches I have been to. It is a long beach, open for swimming and surfing or just relaxing. The vegetation around gives it a very typical look.

Sun, sand and surf or just chill. The beach is lovely and golden. Very clean when we visited. Shops and restaurants on The Corso as you walk from the ferry; more along the beach front. Patrolled by life guards until around 6pm but awesome surfing waves. Take care where you swim - use the flags as guides. Lovely just to sit on the beach and watch the world go by
My beautiful local. Accessible, clean and beautiful. Great for a walk along the promenade with shops close by for refreshments.

Enjoyable. By catching the Manly ferry from circular quay. You enjoy your ferry trip of about 25 mins and walk straight ahead through an outdoor shopping mall with eateries galore and right onto this wonderful beach.
Great atmosphere with beach facilities and what a view.
Fantastic day out.

Between the Harbour and the surf. Wow, take a ferry ride to Manly and experience crossing open water between South and North Heads... on a rough day this could be exciting! once you get to Manly, walk along the Corso. There are many eateries, souvenier stores. The surf is great on its day and you can take a walk to Shelly Beach or up to North Head where you will find St Patricks Cathedral and the Archbishops Palace (now an International Hospitality School) and the old Quarantine Station to name but a few of the attractions. Come and see for yourself!

In Sydney...Ya gotta go to Manly. If you're in Sydney...get a ferry and go to Manly. Manly is a cool lil surf town. Home to a pro surf contest but then back to being relatively quiet. Lots of cafes, ice creams and the major surf branded shops.A little more intense and quite a bit more commercialized than Bondi. But it also has better surf. The say I was there...waist high and blown-out on shores.Good surf and a good beach.Easy ferry service from Sydney. If you surf, make the pilgrimage.There's also a way cool coastal walk (about 2 hours). It's worth it. I took a cab to the bridge spit and walked back. I liked this walk better than Bondi to Coogee. Much more varied walk and terrain. I say do both walks. And then eat at a lol each cafe wherever you end up.
Crowded Crowded. If you are into the young beach scene and surf etc then great. If not then it is like a very crowded Costa Brava.

Manly a must. We took the ferry to Manly in the evening and had dinner, drinks and wandered around. It was extremely windy. Dinner was exceptional at the Italian restaurant. Lots of shops, bars and restaurants.

Better than Bondi !!. Manly Beach has an atmosphere all of its own with its wide , clean sand areas. Easy access to The Corso allows you choose any level of lunch or dinner from take away to fine dining. Try the take away fish shop close to the beach - excellent food and good value. My favourite ' Yoghurt Land' - and don't miss "Saltmotion Gallery' - tucked away behind the New Brighton Hotel in Market Place. Their photos of Manly are absolutely stunning. A must to see

A must visit. 30 minutes by ferry, lies a small hamlet off Sydney harbour. Once off the pier there is plenty to do walking into the small town that has everything ,including some great sites.For food there are some Michelan starred establishments but my favourite was Hugos, right on the pier. The atmosphere, drinks, food et all were superb.
Nice sand and waves.. Got a nice sunny day with some waves and this time of year the water was so warm. Very clean water and the sand is kept so pristine.
Golden sand, laid back vibe. Lovely beach, cool atmosphere, lots of shops, bars and restaurants. Also, less crowded than Bondi. Fun place to spend the day.

Great tourist destination. Manly beach has always been a favourite place of mine since I was young. Not only is it great to cool off in the water on a hot day but there are also many great restaurants to grab a bite to eat

Great day out. Began our day by catching the ferry from Circular Quay. The trip was refreshing and the scenery magnificent. Lunch on Manly wharf and the a short stroll along the Corso to the beach and Pacific Ocean is recommended. We had afternoon tea at one of the many Cafes and then headed back for the ferry ride back. A really relaxing and enjoyable day.
Nicest beach.. The sand is golden, the water is so clean and plenty of eating places. Nice ferry trip down the harbour too. You can easily have a day over here.

Beautiful beach. Manly beach has a nice feeling to it along with the surrounding area. Quite a shallow beach with a good area for kids to paddle in There is also a pool at the left hand side of the beach which would be safe to swim in if you were worried of being drawn out to see on the mail beach. Plenty of cafes and places to eat nearby

Great day in the sun. Great atmosphere , plenty of choices to eat , great bars . The beach is clean , safe with regular loud speaker announcements warning of any dangers ie rips , bluebottles etc . Great beach for the whole family.. Surfing , body boarding , body surfing or just having fun..
Australian discovery trip. This is a very nice beach with lots of good sand and a boardwalk that is first class. Clean good security clean water an good surf. Good beach to go to

beautiful shells. i loved many beach as this was the first beach i had visited on my first trip in 1986 and i had collected amazing shells then.after all these hers i went back to the beach and was disappointed as there were no shells and it was not as beautiful as the first time.so i guess i may not visit manly more than once

Breezy but hot. Love this beach but please make sure you use plenty of sunscreen! We made the mistake of having a quick lie down without any sunscreen on and suffered with soreness and peeling for the next few days!

Great place to stay. Manly beach can get crowded at the weekend but during the week not too bad....great place to watch the surfers and take a stroll around to the next bay either way. Lots of places to eat and pick up snacks...not too far from the ferries.

Not bad, but I'm a Bondi Boy myself. Not bad, but I'm a Bondi Boy myself. This beach is less hectic and crowded (at least when I was there). I preferred the more vibrant beach scene at Bondi, so if you can only visit one, I recommend Bondi...sorry Manly fans.

Dirty!. The beach was disgusting, rubbish everywhere! There was a man walking around with a bucket trying to clean up an area for his children to play in because it was that disgusting. Was far from impressed with the beach & would definitely not be taking my children there.
Nice Beach. For us this generally was just a nice and enjoyable beach, nothing really special about it except for a lot of people :)

A great place to see in Sydney. Manly beach is a nice place to hang out especially during the summer. There are a lot of great places to eat. The breeze is just right, relaxing and cool. It's so near just by hopping on a ferry.The ferry also offers a nice view of Sydney as a consolation. Overall, a nice scenic and relaxing break from the City.

Beautiful. We spent a few hours here. It was lovely. We did the scenic walk which we really enjoyed. It was fun watching all of the surfers. We love the area and considered renting a condo in this area next year. Lovely!
Great Beach. Much better than Bondi. Lovely clean sand and clear blue water. Off the ferry from Sydney and five minutes walk through bars cafe's and shops to this beautiful beach. A must visit place.

a must visit whilst holidaying in sydney . forget Bondi. 30 minute fun trip on the ferry with amazing views of Sydney harbour and opera house. see hundreds of boats of all different shapes and sizes .disembarking at Manly and ambling down a fascinating and fun promenade arriving at a super beach join the ozzies at play on the beach and in the surf. . bars, restaurants and shops .great for all ages . we loved it

Amazing place. To get off the ferry from Sydney and walk into Manly is just breathtaking . Amazing beaches, coffee shops everywhere. Beach is huge, no issue with over crowding and a great place to have a bbq. Loved the whole place

Beautiful beach and area. The beach is located a 5 to 10 minute walk from the ferry terminal down the promenade of designer shops and nice restaurants. It's beach is very popular with surfers as the waves are excellent. There's a long stretch of fine yellow sand which was soft and free of pebbles. We could see why many people prefer this to bondi as its so much quieter.
Great surf. Watched the young Aussies ride the waves and race kayaks over the surf. Great entertainment. A place to sit and watch it all happen.

Great time body boarding in Manly. We loved the beach here. If you're looking for quiet or secluded Manly will be disappointing. However, we loved the bustling atmosphere, watching the surfers, and feeling like we were in the center of the action. We love boogie boarding (body boarding) and the waves were great for this. You can rent body boards, surfboards, lounge chairs, towels, snorkels, and all kinds of gear from the Manly Beach Hire Tent on the beach at the end of the Corso. You can also rent a locker for the day to secure valuables, which we appreciated. There's some decent snorkeling down the path on the way to Shelley Beach.

A must not miss moment.. Took the hop on hop off ferry ( $40 per person ) from Circular Quay.A great way to see the Harbour - especially as are 8 stopping points and ferries run regularly from 0800 - 1700hrs and ticket is a 24hr ticket.Manly beach is beautiful - white sands, turquoise waves crashing onto the shore and surfers.Just sit and watch.

An perfect afternoon trip. We took a ferry from Circular Quay to Manly one afternoon. We wandered around and walked on the beach. We stopped and grabbed some food (tacos and fish and chips) at some of the local stands. We also got a beer at the German spot on the pier. It was a perfect day and we enjoyed the slower pace of the beach. Kids were playing, everyone was walking their dogs and we had a chance to relax before heading back to Sydney.

Gorgeous beach. Really liked this beach due to the tree lined board way. Really beautiful and scenic setting. The walk via Shelly Beach and over the heads back to the ferry terminal is worth it. Just bring good shoes to walk the trail. I didn't and my feet were singing by the end of it and I'm an avid walker.

Good to walk around. A good trip for you if visiting and want to take the ferry across to Manly from Circular Quay (not if its a rough day on the water though)..when you get off at Manly Wharf, take a walk through the Corso (seats etc are available along the way) stop and eat at any of the many fast foods and then make your way to the opposite end where you'll find the famous beach and some more restaurants.. a great trip if you don't have a car to get around in and to a beautiful scenic place - return on the ferry as well

Where did the sea weed come from?. Visited on a public holiday, beach was beautiful and well looked after but it was packed. Virtually no-where to go. Don't know where it had come from but most of the water was riddled with sea weed. Don't let that put you off though apparently this is rare

Lovely day!. This is a nice day trip to take from Sydney. The beaches aren't super, but it's the atmosphere and feel of the area that are nice. From taking the ferry, to having fish and chips by the sea, to just enjoying the hustle and bustle of the main promenade, this was a really nice day. I especially enjoyed the small market selling local crafts.

What a beach!!!. Being from the UK beaches are something we migrate to while on holiday and of this quality! It was busy when I visited briefly as had a lot to fit in, I dare say full of tourists but you can't have everything right

White sand and blue water. We caught the ferry to manly it was a great trip not knowing what to expect once we arrived. We found a beautiful beach , white sands and crystal clear blue water. Many , many restaurants to choose from to dine in .well worth the trip if your in Sydney .

Overrated - Unless you're a surfer. This place is loud touristy and dirty. The best part of Manly is the ferry ride across which is always quite fun not matter the weather. I would suggest taking a short walk (follow the signposts) and walk up to Cabbage Tree beach to get away from the crowds and the sea gulls.

Amazing beach. Wolrd famous, and for a very good reason. Great surfing conditions, nice to swim at and not usually too crowded. People often compare Manly and Bondi, both have their own reasons to be great, I prefer Manly.
