So much activity. We visited Manly Beach on 24th January. Sorry we didn't take our togs as the day was hot and the beach looked great. Big lifesaving carnival taking place with so much activity we didn't know where to look and all for free. This is a must do beach in Sydney.

Go.... The whole trip was an excellence outing. From the ferry ride ,to wandering the streets, shops, eating whilst looking at the beach just opposite, to. Paddling in the ocean. Very relaxing to be away from the bustle of the city yet still be so close. A great outing and worth a visit.

Does summer in Sydney get any better with an ice cream in hand here!. Within walking distance of the ferry and ice cream stores lining the sea side. This beach is clean and clear if not a little crowded.
Very beautiful and user friendly. There are plenty of restaurants around if you wish and the beach is very close to the ferry terminal, a very efficient service.

Wonderful beach. We didn't spend enough time in Manly and especially the beach. It is very clean, has great waves and has a real family atmosphere. There were plenty of surfers the day we went and a lot of families walking and carrying small children,
had a great time. great beach, it feels good to be looked after by the life guards in Australia. they make sure you are safe....

Nice beach but swimming off due to sharks!. It is certainly worth a trip to Manly, busy and bustling and fun. The beach is busy but pleasant. Swimming was off as a shark had been seen in the area disappointing all the surfers and swimmers. Life guards on duty ensured safety.
Great day out. We were lucky and visited on a very hot day when the place was buzzzing...the beach was full and the beer was flowing...had a huge ben and jerrys on the front...memorable
Well worth the visit. Every time we visit Sydney we always take the time to catch a ferry to Manly Beach. The beach is very pretty and has plenty of restaurants close by.
Great Beach. what a beach.you will be one with the nature. Take a ferry, it is very easy to reach.I liked the colour of the water.the sand,the suffers every thing is great. No dislikes.

A lovely beach to take in the views on a seat.... Another lovely sydney beach, where restaurants are close by, toilets are close by. There are loads of seating and places to have a picnic. And a place that is inundated with people. Personally it's one of my favourite beaches in Sydney. But people have different opinions as to what defines their favourite beach. You can walk down from this beach to the spit, which is awesome. One of my favourite sydney beaches.

Best waves to play and swim in. Spent the day in Manly and played for about an hour until exhausted in the surf, between the flags.I'm a good swimmer but was very careful because I'm not used to the surf. After a while was ok out deep away from the crowd and managed well. Always checking to stay between the flags. Loved Manly so much will go back and stay for a week next Summer.
Nice beach but overrated. Ok this beach is different than Bondi. It is longer and not so noisy and you can easy find space for your shelf. I found it more windy and not easy access

Lovely Family Friendly Beach. Visited Manly in January, thoroughly enjoyed my time here. There was lots of space to chill out, or indulge in water sports etc if thats your thing. The whole place was very family friendly, with lots of places to eat etc...lovely to come for a day or a week!!

Nice beach but a little over-rated.... Before we arrived there, we'd read that Manly Beach was often preferable to Bondi Beach but the locals. Well from a tourist perspective, I much preferred Bondi Beach and therefore didn't really hang around at Manly Beach for more than 30mins! We caught a bus from Manly up to Palm Beach, where Home & Away is filmed and thought that was absolutely stunning. So my advice is to by all means visit Manly Beach, but use the opportunity to 1) enjoy to Many Ferry that offers great views, and 2) take the bus up to Palm Beach!

Perfect beach I really enjoyed it here. I really do prefer Manly to the Bondi beach, here it is more beautiful and becuase the beach is much longer there is more room, not as crowded with people. I also found it here better for swimming. In all I would recommend this beach over Bondi if you come to Sydney for a vacation and you want to find a nice beach to swim and tan.

Beautiful Beach. Great beach in Sydney area. There are many trees and public areas where you can make a picnic. Besides, there are many restaurants, cafes, shops. Take de ferry and enjoy this beautiful place.

Ultimate Beach Town!. Such a beautiful beach, it reminded me slightly of Lake Tahoe, with all of the tall trees on the edge of the beach. There is a nice trail that you can walk along to go to another beach area, or just to get exercise. Lot of shops and places to eat near the beach, it was such a cute waterfront, it was one of the highlights of our trip to Sydney, such a highlight that we made sure to take the ferry twice to this amazing location!
Nice but overcrowded at times. Nice beach but there's nicer around Sydney, I'd take the time to travel up north to Palm Beach or go to one of the bay beaches (Watsons Bay, Shelly Beach or Rose Bay)

Loved this area. What a pretty area. We caught the ferry to Manly, wandered the markets, watched Surf Life competition on the ocean side and wandered the back streets looking at the beautiful historic buildings

Iconic Beach. Manly is a lovely, long stretch of sandy beach well suited to bathers, swimmers and surfers. It's quite common to find a Surf Carnival in progress during the Summer months. It is also very popular with walkers - it is only a short 15 minute walk to Shelley Beach or you can take on one of the longer walks that form part of the Manly and Northern Beaches Walks. We took the short option being a very hot day. Keep a look out for the Water Dragons that are common throughout the region. You will often see them sunning themselves on the rocky outcrops. Manly's iconic main strip, The Corso, has a wide selection of shops, pubs and eateries -make sure to grab a gelato. You will also find water refilling stations on the Corso so you can refill your water bottles.
A fun beachy vibe. Took a really short trip over to Manly but I loved it. Once you get off the ferry you can walk straight down, through an area with some shops and to the beach.
What a beach. Beautiful beach ,lovely and clean with shops / bars etc all around went a couple of times and loved it
The place smells. What a disqppointmentBeaches are averageFood places are way too expensiveFinding parking is hopeless

BETTER EXPERIENCE THAN BONDI. We took the ferry from Circular Quay which is a great 35 minute ride offering lots of opportunities to photograph the Harbour Bridge and Opera House from the water. On arrival we wondered about the small quiet beach near the ferry terminal and felt short changed. This of course is not the main beach and a 5 minute walk later we arrived at the beautiful blue/green water with lovely surf. Lots of cafes and gift shops with a short bus ride to a very big shopping mall. Having heard for years about Bondi Beach I felt some disappointment when I visited, however this was more than erased by a visit to Manly which for a variety of reasons I much prefer.

Ah... Too crowded. Sydney beaches are not the most pleasent obviously... If you want to experience a good ocean you better catch a train to suburbs like Austinmer. Manly beach is too crowded and people are so self aware. This is what I don't like about city beaches.

Bondi Beach is a better beach experience.. Manly Beach is a nice, little beach that is reachable by a ferry from Circular Quay. The ferry ride to and from Manly Beach is breathtaking. You could take some nice photos of the Sydney Opera House and the Harbour Bridge on the ferry. Also, there are shops and restaurants along the walk to the beach when you get off the ferry.Strictly comparing the beaches though, Manly Beach isn't as good as Bondi Beach in my opinion. Manly Beach was a lot smaller than I had anticipated, and the sand didn't feel as nice as Bondi Beach. It also happened to be incredibly windy the two times I went there. I don't know; maybe I missed something? It's not a bad beach, but if you're looking just for the beach experience (sun, tanning, etc.), I think you'll have a nicer time at other beaches.

Best beach in the world. I love this beach so much that i decided to move here. It's spotless, family friendly and popular with both younger and older generations alike. Forget Bondi, go to Manly Beach!

Excellent beach with a very active lifeguard service. Beach clean . Nice walk on promenade . Plenty of shops , possibly too many "cheapy " shops. Backpackers / surfers paradise. Unfortunate experience in Oceanvue cafe in that the sandwich I ordered came out twice wrong and then didnt arrive at all . Overall a nice experience but in future I would go around the corner for food as restaurants are nicer and better value.

Beautiful place, much nicer than Sydney. Manly is simply a better place to walk, go to a beach and shop in our opinion. It is quiet, less crowded, decidedly upscale from SYD. We had friends meet our ferry and we strolled with them.. beautiful.

A trendy beach with nice atmosphere. This is a lovely area with lots of shops and fast food restaurants. If you are looking for a relaxed chilled out day on a quiet beach then this is not the place but its worth checking out

Fun time!. We took the ferry over from Sydney which was very reasonablly priced. We walked the beach from one end to the other. It's amazing there is a beach this nice just a short ride from a city the size of Sydney.

The experience starts at the ferries. For someone who lives in a city on the coast of a tropical country, it will be another urban beach. But beaches are beaches. Try to reach Manly using the ferries from Circular Queue. If you are staying in the suburbs, it will be a quite long journey (more than an hour to get there), but you'll have the chance to experience the effectiveness of city's transportation system and the landscape on both sides of the rivers that lead to the Sydney Cove. When leaving Circular Queue station, don't forget to look back and take a good selfie with Sydney CBD skyline as background. When at Manly, enjoy the walk at The Corso. Some goods at gift shops can be found with better prices compared to the souvenir-Mecca of Paddy's Market. Very nice restaurant at the left corner facing the shore.

Pleasurable experience. I make sure to go to Manly each time I visit Sydney. I love the ferry ride over and back, strolling through the main street with its many shops, shaded places to sit and now little water fountains that you can walk through (good for getting the sand off your feet after the beach). The rip can be quite strong at the beach at times as it was when I visited a couple of days ago. I got slapped in the head twice by the waves due to not paying attention and it was quite strong and discombobulating. Trying to get out past the strong breakers exhausted me in the end, but I still went back for more later. I love the atmosphere on this beach; great scenery, clean and it's always interesting people watching. It's nice to return to the ferry via the side streets to look at the beautiful period buildings and then to top it off with an ice cream whilst waiting for the ferry back. There's some good eating spots there too. A great day out.

Worth a visit for the ferry ride and Harbour views. At Manly itself it is just a small beach and some bars at the pier.However there is a great microbrew pub Four Pines across the road from the pier that has great beers brewed on site and excellent food.

Manly Beach. We caught the ferry from Circular Quay about a 20 minute ride.you get off at the harbour and walk through the town on the otherwise to reach the beach, good shops and restaurants on the way to the beach, and what a beach a lovely white sand very long bay and very exciting to see the surfers trying to catch the surf!!.

AMAZING. We stayed on Manly and the beach was just amazing. The best beach I have ever visited! It was great just to sit and watch the waves. Yes it was a little busy at holiday time, but that is to be expected. Don't get me wrong there was always somewhere you could sit and watch the world go by.

Crowded!. We visited Manly Beach twice. It was crowded on both occasions due to the holiday season. Our first visit was on Christmas Day and it poured with rain. We have a sad photograph of me standing on the beach under an umbrella, holding a suitcase!Our second visit was on New Year's Day whe it was hot and sunny. On both occasions it was crowded but the place presented itself in a much better light on the second occasion and we stayed a good while. The ferry trip alone makes the trip worthwhile - resommended if the weather is OK!
Great place. Just catch a ferry at Circular Quay and its a 30 min sail. A nice friendly little town and picturesque beach

Boogie boarding fun. Amazing view along Manly Beach as you walk down the south end steps. Great body surfing with kids and well controlled by lifeguards. Some weed during morning swim but long gone by arvo. Cold water showers after swim great to get sand off before walk back up to car. Love this place

Busy but Still Space. I had a day of beach time in Manly. In between sun bathing on the sandy beached i enjoyed strolling around watching a volley ball tournament, popping into cafes and enjoying the beautiful surrounding.
good to visit for a day trip. take the ferry from sydney main harbor for a great view. walk through town to the beach and explore shopping, dining and the beach scene.

Fantastic. Manly Beach was fantastic. We took the ferry from Sydney to get out there. It's not a bad ride. At the beach the water was clear and there were some nice waves. It was a little chilly, but not bad. There were a lot of people out there. Everyone did have to come out the water at one point due to Bluebottle Jellyfish. After getting out we could see lots of them washed up on the beach. I would definitely recommend making a trip to Manly Beach if you're in Sydney.
Amazing. It's an amazing place to relax, have fun and to live as well. Beautiful beach, good lifestyle and close to a lot of others pretty beach and also just one hour from City.
Great beach. Enjoyed my day relaxing on the beach, watching surfers do their thing. Perfect for topping your tan.

Nice day out from Sydney. A day to Manly is a nice way to get out of Sydney.Catch the ferry ($15 return) every 20 minutes or so, around a half hour ride to Manly.When you get off there are lots of places to eat and shops to look around.The beach is really nice. There is a flagged section with lifeguards. You can also hire lockers here for $8 to keep your valuables in while you are in the sea.A really nice, chilled out day.

A must visit beach. Love the vibe at Manly, the ferry ride across from Circular Quay is a must do, and the Corsi and beach are great places to people watch, some great bars and resturants nearby, a must day trip

Better than Bondi!. If you're from Melbourne, this is how I'd compare Bondi and Manly. Bondi is more like St.Kilda in it's heyday. Busy, lots of bronzed posers, bohemian and very cultura—but hot, and average for scenery…lots of crowds, lots of buildings, not a lot of shade and the beach is nice, but it's just a beach. Whereas Manly is more like Sorrento, a bit more upmarket, lots of shady spots, lots of posers (of course) but more family friendly without feeling like your begging to get a spot of sand.Manly is a clean, scenic beach with good waves and clean sand. Yes, it gets crazy busy, but it stretches out for a long way, and you also have other little beaches tucked away during the tourist walks, that allows you to escape some of the madness. The foreshore is littered with trees on the eastside, and the lifesaving club provides taps and showers to hose off your feet and legs after trekking through the sand. It's a friendly beach that even offers beach volleyball and had loads of bars and restaurants along the main strips to give you that holiday feel. I love it here.

Wonderful Day at the Beach. On our vacation to Sydney we took a trip to Manly Beach for a fun day at the beach. It was great fun and was very easy to ride the ferry out of downtown and head over to Manly. There is a nice downtownish area for food, drinks, and shopping. It's a bit touristy but was still nice. The beach was great, pretty clean with decent waves for a little surfing. For sure a great spot for a day when visiting Sydney.

Great beach. Manly really is a beautiful beach. After walking down the Corso, you see the great expanse of beautiful sand and blue water. The water was lovely and clean as was the whole beach. There is a great grassed area and paved walkway the whole length of the beach which is great.

Great place to Visit. Took the ferry from Sydney to Manly and wow what a great place, lots of places to eat and drink, the beach is fab u lus and well protected, I fell in love with it as soon as I stepped of the ferry, recommend a day visit!!

More chill, but not as breathtaking as neigbhoring beaches. This is getting a higher score because besides the beach the ferry ride from Sydney to this beach was amazing. To see the Sydney Opera House from a different angle was incredible not to mention the bridge and the harbor. Bring a jacket though!! Another unique part of this beach was part of it is a penguin sanctuary in which the penguins come out around sunset/dusk. I missed the march, but I did get to see one poor injured penguin wobbling around and the volunteers trying to rescue him to get the fishing hook out of his leg. Manly has lots of restaurants in the area, and explore and ask locals maybe for the local spot to swim because all the sections I saw I probably would not have swum due to all the boats in the harbor.

The best beach in Sydney don't do Bond do manly. the ferry is great as you go across the harbour passed the opera house aprox 30 mins when you get to Manly follow the people as the little bay is double sided a five minute walk past restaurants and cafes and shops and you're at one of the nicest beaches in Sydney The pacific surf golden sands and great views

Nice Clean Beach. After a trip on the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly it is but a short walk along the jetty where you'll find several shops and restaurants alongside one of the cleanest beaches in the Sydney area.Regularly combed and levelled it is well maintained with a fenced off safe swimming area.

Beach life. I loved that everything is right on the beach , nothing there to dislike , there was a little market with some very nice things for sale , lots of good coffee shops and an excellent ice cream shop , and great fish and chips, all together it was a very long but wonderful day out , would love a return visit in the future

Sunset walk. Wonderful end to a day's visit to walk along the promenade at sunset watching the hard core surfer try to catch the final wave of the day and the party animals start their evening entertainment in the numerous bars.

Second visit from Britain. Love the trip on the Manly ferry, the high surf where it's clearly marked for safe swimming and the constant attendance of life guards. Lots of food outlets, sunny and gorgeous

One of the Best in Australia. Took the ferry across to Manly from Circular Quay. Nice, cheap and a nice way to see the harbour.When getting off the ferry you just have to walk a short distance to the famous beach. Plenty of room, shops and places to eat.
Love Manley Beach. great place to people watch and go and watch the surfers, some great surf on days. Can get very busy

probably the best day you could have while in Sydney. You can chose to go for snorkeling or enjoy fish &chips at the Fish Market, or simply take a stroll on the boardwalk and enjoy the beach view. Or better take the walk inside the bay and enjoy the quiet neightborhoods, the woods and the small beaches. at night you might get lucky and see the small penguinscoming out from water after sunset.

If you like beaches, this is the one. Bondi beach is probably the most known of the beaches in Sydney, however if you are visiting a beach when you are in town, you are best to jump on the ferry and visit Manly beach.It is a much larger beach and therefor it feels quieter as there is more space for everyone. There are nice cafes and restaurants in the area too.

ok beach. Very long (ca 1.5km) stretch of single yellow beach. The other good part is all the shopping and restaurants on The Corso and nearby streets. Easy and cheap to get here from Sydney central harbour with ferry.

Manly beach. What can I say about Manly its a great place to visit and go to the beach it has a maxing beach and a great place to watch the surfing and its 100 times better than Bondi beach that place just has th name .Don't even bother with Bondi just go to Manly its only 40 mins from Sydney harbour on the Sydney harbour boat and cheap as well

Great waves and beautiful beach. We visited Manly on New Years Day. You are able to rent boogie boards, chairs and umbrellas for a reasonable price. It was crowded. My son enjoyed the big waves. The area had a lot of restaurants and shops. Our tour guideon another tour told us if you want to see tourist go to "Bondi". If you want to see Australians, go to "Manly".

great coastal strip. Lots of shopping and cafes along with a relatively busy beach. Good atmosphere. Friendly locals. Preferred staying in the city as you get better value for your money compared with accommodation at Manly Beach.

Better than Bondi. Overseas tourists always hear about Bondi Beach (which is terrific) however Manly Beach offers so much more paticularly if you are staying in the Sydney CBD as you arrive via the Sydney ferry.Once there there are three beaches to choose from. The small harbour beach beside the ferry wharf, the main surf beach and Shelley beach which includes a very scenic short walk from the southern end of Many.Great choice of restaurant, cafe or pub food (which is high quality) ensures agreat day.A return ferry ride afetr dark is very whorthwhile to pick up the view of Sydney at it's best from the harbour.

Good facilities, but rather crowded. Manly beach itself is definitely very nice, and there's lots of things to do (surfing lessons, gear hire, nice cafes etc.), but it's also very popular and gets rather crowded. It's a nice spot, although if you go to one of the nearby beaches (e.g. Freshwater), it's going to be much less packed.

The Beach at its best. We took the ferry to Manley Beach just to hang out. We found a great beach with surfers and sunbathers. Good shopping including an outdoor market with locally made crafts. Nice restaurants with good food and cold drinks.

Loved It!!!!!!. After seeing a lot of beaches in Australia and around the world, I thought that I will never fall in love with another beach. But I was wrong, I did fall in love with Manly Beach. The place just has a great energy to see and the people are sexy. Going to the main beach, you'll see a lot of stores, restaurants, and parks where you can just hang around and relax. The beach itself os gorgeous as well.

Don't miss a visit to Manly - great walks. I'm lucky enough to live close by, and most days I take my two dogs, and head to Manly for a walk. There are two fantastic walks I like to do. The first is along the oceanfront - from Queenscliff to Shelley Beach and back again. The second is on the Harbour side. When you get off the ferry and walk out the front of the wharf, turn left and walk along to the aquarium. Walk left past the aquarium, and then follow the path up the stairs and along. But if you have problems with stairs or you have a stroller, or a wheelchair, there is a path that leads you up beside the Manly Art Gallery (also worth a visit) and takes you to the top - stair free. It's a great walk along the foreshore and leads you to a a couple of little beaches and a beachside pool. Lots of gorgeous spots for photos too.

Surprisingly nice. Fantastic beach for surfers and water sport enthusiasts. Very, very clean (as can be said for most of Australia) and looked after. Take sun block and enjoy! Probably the best beach in the Sydney area.

Beautiful!. We visited Manly by ferry from Circular Quay. The front beach was so beautiful and great for young families or people who want still water to swim in. The surf beach was also beautiful, but you need to make sure you swim between the flags. Both beaches have toilets and shops close by. There is quite a lot of seating all along both beaches and grassed ares too if you don't want to be on the sand. Umbrellas could be hired at the surf beach. We enjoyed walking along the gorgeous coast line with spectacular views. Well worth a half day or day trip.

One of my two favorite Beaches in and around Sydney. As a lifelong Beach fanatic; who regularly travels to Beaches in the Caribbean and Pacific; I had a chance to try 5 of the beaches in and around Sydney during my recent visit.Where ever popular Bondi Beach is over-run with tourists and offers little respite from it all due to sub-standard bars and restaurants; Manly beach even though also full of tourists, offers so much more to do. Not only is the beach pretty (although also very large and lacking shade); it has fun restaurants, bars and shopping for every taste and budget. We loved it so much that we came back two more times during our trip; just so we could try some of the other cool restaurants/bars overlooking the beach. Highly recommended!

Family friendly. We took the Manly ferry and really enjoyed the crossing (1 hour). A great way to see Sydney Harbour and all the different headlands. Manly itself is a smallish seaside town with a nice beach - though it was blowing a storm the day we were there. We had fantastic fish and chips from a carry out on the main street which we ate on the promenade (beware of the gulls!) A great day trip at a reasonable price. We used the normal ferry from Circular Quay, but there are more expensive fast ferries if time is short.
Nice beach. Very relaxing with loads of buzz. Not really sure what the hype was about though as this seemed like just another beach

Possibly an iconic supertrip. with Bondi this is an emblem and if you cross the harbour to get there that is the best deal - finessing through the water entirety of Sydney - not improvable - you wi;ll observe and you will feel: the water element, sailing, views, wind factors and the revolving townscape

Average beach. Go to this beach for an hour but then go to the surrounding beaches for a better experience. It is a very large beach which was nice but there was so much seaweed which is hard to get over. On the days we went, the areas that we could "swim" in was very small since the waves were big. This means that its crowded in this area and is not that enjoyable. Instead walk along the path to Sandy beach and experience some amazing views and a breathtaking beach.

Lively & fun. A short ferry ride from Sydney is Manly beach offering a big wide sandy beach. If you walk further round the headland you will come across water dragons basking in the sun on the warm rocks. There are rock pools with lots of crabs and shells. There is also a sea water pool. There are an abundance of shops, bars and restaurants providing friendly & welcoming service. Spend the day here then travel back at night the see the Sydney skyline. It can get very busy.

Don't miss this!. My husband and I recently travel to Australia. We took the city Ferry which is green and yellow to Manly. The Ferry ride is fabulous and Manly is superb. Walk from the Ferry towards Corso and enjoy all the stores. We ate at Nando's because it was impossible to eat at Papi chulo because of the waiting time, but if you are willing to wait then sit at Papi chulo, because it has the best view of the Harbor.

Christmas & New Year family celebrations held here. What a great place just outside of Sydney city, very family friendly village feel with plenty to see and do. Lovely restaurants, bars, shops, a great beach and good transport links.A lovely afternoon spent on the beach on Christmas day with our family.Fabulous family friendly New Years Eve free fireworks celebration at 9pm, which is very common in Sydney and you could see the city centre and Bondi's shows behind the hills in the distance too (Manly's seemed to be the best and longest by far!)

Check out Manly. Firstly if you have purchased an Opal Card for buses and trains you can use it for the Manly Ferry.Don't worry about the crowds there are heaps of seats available inside the ferry. The beach is great for kids and adults alike. There is a coles express across the road from the ferry so you can avoid all the overpriced shops on the ferry concourse. It is a lovely walk around Manly from front to back..only a couple of blocks. Ferries run constantly so there is not much waiting if you just miss the ferry.

Better than Bondi. Such a nice beach. The town you walk through to get to the beach is small but has everything you need. I recommend taking your own water with you, as it is so expensive otherwise. The bonus of this beach is that you have to go via ferry $15 return, but this doubles as a harbour cruise with outstanding views of the city from the water. Not to be missed!!

Nice picnic place. My daughter and I packed sandwiches, chips and bottled water and sat in one of the benches to eat. There were birds flying around and most of them were so aggreesive and they will attack you for your food. I saw regular office workers having lunch. It must be nice to be in a place where you can have lunch by the seaside. I surely envy them. There's water fountain where you can replenish your empty bottle.

Summer or winter delight. The ferry right over and back displays the greatest harbour around. Manly is always busy, lots of food outlets nice beach and people watching. Walks around the area from the surf beach and the harbour side as well. You can also walk or ride to the old Quarantine station on north head for some great views.

Bold and Beautiful: Manly to Shelly Beach and back every day of the year. There is nothing - and I mean NOTHING - more life affirming - than a swim in the ocean. And when you can do it with a group of like-minded people in one of the most beautiful spots on the planet, you are elevated to that blissed-out zone that fills you with awe, wonder and respect for the great goddess Mother Nature.It is possible to get this natural high every day at Manly, on Sydney's northern beaches, where a sea of pink caps can be seen on a daily return swim trek from the surf beach to the quiet cove at Shelly Beach. The Bold and Beautiful swimmers meet at the surf lifesaving club around 6.30am (the stalwarts head off earlier) and sign up for the swim that is around 1.6km return (that's my guess). Each swimmer is provided with a B&B pink swim cap. Less experienced swimmers might prefer walking around to Cabbage Tree Bay, the half way point in the swim to Shelly, to enter the usually calmer waters from the stairs.At 7am the peloton heads off from Manly and swims through the surf break to 'the point' where everyone stops and waits for the whole group to assemble. At a shout of "let's go", the pink caps head to Shelly where everyone gathers on the small beach backed by shrubby bushland. After another cry of "let's go", the swimmers head back to Manly. Along the way, there is an abundance of aquatic life to be seen. Rays, gropers, sand whiting, flathead, white bait, and god knows how many other species go about their daily business as the horde thrashes above them. If you're lucky, you might get to see wobbegong sharks and dusky whaler sharks. This marine reserve is a breeding ground for many fishies and a nursery for dusky whalers. Respect the shark and it will glide beneath you, slinky and sleek, not at all interested in the commotion.I love this swim and the people who do it. They are, each and every one, ecowarriors. I reckon you'd be hard pressed to find anything else like this in the world. There is an app for the Bold and Beautiful that can save you signing on each day, and it allows you to keep track of kilometres swum. Highly recommended.

Magical Manly. Getting to Manly is almost as good as the beach. The ferry trip is very scenic - returning at dusk or in the evening gives a really different and interesting view of the harbour and its sites. The beach itself is not as good as Bondi, but there are great restaurants and bars nearby and lots of shopping if that is what you are in to.

Everyone has to visit sometime in their lives. Great beach to see and be seen at, the main beach is a bit too much for us though, we preferred the back beach near the Ferry, a bit quieter but just as much fun.
good. beautiful and lots of restaurants nearby, went there during new year's 2015, i like Bondi beach better though.

Great beach. Another great beach in the Sydney area. No were near as busy as Bondi. We paddle boarded for $50 dollars which was mega fun. Clean and tidy. Loads of exercise going on. Great bars and eateries near by and a nice little shopping street. Caught the ferry from circular quay for $15.20 return pp. definitely worth a visit!
Lovely Beach. Great ferry trip over and lovely beach to walk along and people watch. Lots of cool cafes and bars,and shopping if you don't want to spend all day at the beach.

Better than Bondi!. When in Sydney you have got to take a pass on bondi's tourist filled beach and head to the northern beaches suburb of Manly.Tourist filled yes but a lot bigger, cleaner and the view is a lot prettier. Take the walk along the beach to Shelley beach if you want a European beach experience. While in manly, visit the corso, a 1 km stretch of cafes, stores and boutiques. There's the markets on the corso on Sunday's selling all kinds of unique pieces and artwork.If you have the time and a car visit the surrounding beaches, freshwater, curl curl, dee why amongst others. Google "northern beaches Sydney" and you'll see what I'm talking about.

Beautiful and not overly crowded. Very nice beach and even though we visited during the Christmas "silly season" when all of the kids were out of school the beach was not overly crowded. The beach was clean and had many shops and food options close by.

The Beach. A bit more than a normal Beach , you can sit and enjoy the sun , people watch and take in the live surfing show , all free ...a great experience , it was a bit crowded when went over the holidays , but we've done it twice now , on and off season , we preference off ...

Manly Beach. in my view this beach is beautiful and outshines the famous Bondi! Beautiful and clean surrounding eateries excellent and lots of nice shops,particularly surf and sportswear.Just love this place and you can get the ferry over to Sydney which is a little holiday in itself! A must place to visit!
Great vibe!. Good takeaway, fun little souvenir shops, and just a fun vibe! Not as popular as Bondi, which means it's twice as fun!
WHAT A DISAPPOINTMENT. We were somehow expecting something more than mediocre and cannot see why it is so famous, other than it is a good ferry trip across
Definitely worth a visit. A very pleasant beach in a beautiful setting. Have fun playing in the surf but stay within the flags to keep the lifeguards happy.

Pleasant trip on ferry to Manly beach. The best way to go to Manly is by ferry from Circular Quay. There are excellent views of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House from the water. It is a great trip across the harbour to Manly. After disembarking the ferry, it is only a few hundred metres to the Pacific Ocean and Manly Beach. It is probably Sydney's premier beach, especially for tourists. There are walks along the beach front if one does not wish to walk on the sand, paddle or swim. Remember to swim only between the flags in the designated areas.
Better than Bondi. More chilled. More shade. Better town. If you are going to a beach while in Sydney go here. Market on Saturday. Pedestrianised centre - The Corso.

Beautiful beach but can be a bit windy. Great shops and restaurants around the beach. Although the sand is not as fine as in Bondi Beach, it is still a great place for getting sun bath and for swimming. Expect there to be a bit more windy than Bondi coast.
Lovely beach. Lovely beach but being New Years day it was very busy. Swimming was only permitted at small part of beach due to tides. Plenty lifeguards on patrol to keep people safe.

New Years Day at Manly. Very Crowded but still room on the sand if you need it, well patrolled by the Surf lifesavers. take a walk around the path at the Right hand end (near the LifeSavers club) to view or swim in the Rock swimming pool or continue on to the small beach in a Cove.Plenty of Free water Refill stations providing Cool clean drinking water, Well Done here.Also enjoy Great fish and Chips from the Manly Fish market.

Fun Day Trip. We were a large group visiting Australia, and all took the ferry. As expected, it was crowded but wasn't too long of a trip. Once in Manly, there were plenty of shops and restaurants to go to. The weather was good and it was overall a great day trip for everyone.

Beautiful day out!. We went to Manly beach just last week. The weather was beautiful and we had a great day. There were craft fairs going on, which added to the local charm. The water was blue and it was a fantastic experience. We caught the ferry service from Circular Quay. It took just half an hour to reach Manly.

Must see. Excellent location, like a smaller version of the Gold Coast. Buy an Opal card whilst in Sydney and on Sunday's you are only charged a max of $2.50 all day for travel on public transport, this means you can use subway to Circular Quay, Ferry (save $14) to Manly, just 30 mins, then lots of shops, bars, restaurants, superb beach with surfers everywhere, this is better than Bondai, Bronti and Coogee beaches, and costs about £1.60 for whole day, a must see.

Great walks. After the iconic Manly ferry ride the visit to Manly beach is a must and is a short walk along a mall from the wharf. Lunch at the Manly pub was great with a table looking out to the beach. Walk to the south of Manly up to the college where there are great views looking back. A bicycle ride on the many paths would be special. There are plenty of shops in the mall and the beach is great for a walk.

Spectacular views of the ocean. We headed to Manly Beach after a suggestion from our tour guide. We took the ferry from the harbor and 30 minutes later we were in Manly Beach . Lots of restaurants and shops....views of the beach were terrific. Must see destination.
Great beach. It was pretty chilly and windy that day. GOod surfing weather.Loved the views and the fish. The souvenir shops at Manly were very reasonable compared to all the other places visited.

Take the Manly Ferry. We loved this beach when we lived in Sydney years ago so had to bring our young kids when we visited Sydney last week. We drove to Manly on this occassion but would have preferred to take the famous Manly Ferry from circular quay, but we ran out of time. It was very busy but we love it. Max 2hr free parking on side streets & pay & display parking on N Steyne, beach front.

As amazing as expected. Don't miss a quick trip to Manly Beach - it is every bit as spectacular as they say it is. The beach is pristine, the water clear and the waves lively! The boardwalk is full of nice, yet casual, restaurants. Get there early to secure a seat beachside and relax with a gorgeous lunch / beverage. NICE! I would skip the shopping, it is mostly for tourists...you can find nicer things in downtown Sydney

A great place to spend the day. Have a swim by a beautiful beach, walk around the market , shops, and cafes, sea food is the favorite food, drive up to the heads for magnificent views of the Sydney harbor and city, and also the ocean, catch a ferry to the city and back.

New year's eve at Manly. Even when Bondi was probably absurdly packed with tourists, Manly Beach delivered pristine sand, clear water and restaurants happy to serve up a couple beverages and some food.

It is not bad for Sydney.. It is close to the CBD with a relaxing ferry ride to get there and back. But the first time I saw the famous Manly beach, I sniggered slightly. Sorry. But it is tiny and dangerous and crowded and mostly windy. If you are a true beach buff, don't get your hopes up and you won't be disappointed.

Lovely place for a day by the beach. We enjoyed a lovely day at Manly, we took the fast ferry from Circular Quay in just 20 minutes we were there.
Manly is a lovely suburb of Sydney, the beach is narrow but there are shaded grass areas behind to relax in.

The Truth. Manly is not laden with syringes and rubbish. It is however a major tourist destination so if you are hanging around the corso area of the beach you will be exposed to crowds and rubbish. I suggest you either walk to the left or the right of this area. Head up to the Queenscliff end, go for a snorkel of the Bower, have something to eat in one of the many places behind the beach out of the tourist trap, like Waka or Ash's Table. Hire a bike. This will ensure that your experience is enhanced
great beach. get off the ferry and take in the views,no more to say just visit for yourself.we took a beer in a bar started by a convict with buckets of prawns and live music what a day we had.

Busy, but so they all are.. Coupled with the ferry ride from Circular Quay this was a great day trip to Manly Beach. A popular and busy beach but it was easy to find a spot, and there's lots of room for a dip and / or a surf should you feel the need. Lots of shops, bars and restaurants to take your pick from.
A must. Ever in Sydney, than Manly is the best place to visit. One of the most scenic boat road and very relaxing place to be!

Beautiful on a great day. Long stretch of clean warm sand with perfect water temperature on a great weather. It can be crowded but it's worth a visit. There's a lot of restaurants within the area and you can also go shopping.

Go late afternoon... return in the evening.... We were told to visit Manly in the late afternoon for dinner and then sail back in the evening and take in harbour and the city view. So glad we did it this way, particularly as we only had 48 hours in Sydney and there is no way we would have seen the rest of the city as we would have just spent the day lounging on the beach. Manly is definitely a must visit when in Sydney.
Great Surf and Sand. All that I imagined it to be. A long stretch of warm clean sand and water, with lots of surfing and fun.

A nice day out. We took the ferry from Sydney harbour and enjoyed lunch at Hemmingways before doing the short walk around Manley (about 1 hour). For those who fancy a longer walk, there is a 6 km one too.

Breathtaking views and inviting beach and sea.. Despite the cloudy day didn't dampen our spirits to walk close to the waters edge. Soft clean sand and safe beach. Close by cafes and ice cream kiosks making the trip ideal for couples and families alike.

Beautiful. Staying with family in Manly and lucky enough to have the beach at the end of the road. Beautiful clean beach. A great walk down to the corso, lots of nippers swimming. Can get very very busy on holiday and weekends. Nice areas to have picnics under cover and parks for kids.

I preferred this beach to Bondi. Caught the ferry here with my family in December 2014. I much preferred this beach to Bondi to be honest. I know it isn't as famous but the beach is prettier, not as crowded, not as much concrete and cars everywhere and there are a lot more food options and shops here to browse. I would go so far to say that this is a must visit when in Sydney if you are here for a holiday.

Beautiful Clean Beach. Manly beach is easy to get to from the City, just jump on a Ferry and walk up the corso and you are there. The beach is made up of 3 areas Many Beach to the South, North Steyne in the middle and Queenscliff at the North. If you are swimming STAY BETWEEN THE FLAGS! Do that for all Aussie beaches and you will be swimming in a safe area that is patrolled. The sand is lovely and clean, there is no smoking on Sydney Beaches. There are 2 walkways that you can either bike ride or stroll on that the length of the beach and if your really keen on walking you can walk up do the beach walk from Manly to most of the Northern beaches area.Best Fish and Chips near the beach end of Manly Corso, nice pubs and bars and restaurants are all around the Manly area in waling distance. Give Bondi a miss and do yourself a favour and get down to Manly beach

A must see. Fish and chips on the soft sand is a must. Far better than Bondi, plenty of shady trees on the promenade. Grab a relaxing ferry ride from Circular Quay.. Also try and take a walk around to gorgeous Shelly Beach and have lunch. (facing the ocean, Shelley is to your right).The Corso itself could do with some updating, but all part of the seaside feel.
Body boarding expectular. Great beach monitored by life guards . Great waves sandy beach , toilets and fresh water for showers and drinking close at hand. Clean . Brill fun

Nice clean beach and 'boardwalk' area. We went on Christmas Day so most shops were closed and the restaurants that were open were too busy to patronize. But it's a great soft sand beach, filled with surfers, families, very clean, with lots of life guards, paved walkway above, green areas suitable for picnic, and water fountains designed to fill your water bottle. Thirty minute ferry ride from Circular Quay and a 5 minute walk from Manly Wharf.
Definitely worth a visit. Manly is our closest beach and we love it. Parking can be a nightmare on busy days but it's worth the struggle to find a parking. The beach itself is stunning.
Beautiful and peaceful,no crowds. Compared to Bondi beach the lack of crowds was refreshing! By late afternoon, we had most of the beach to ourselves which was nice.

shopping too. g8 beach
easy to get to by ferry
lovely weather
cheap food had a lovely all day english breakfast only £6 and first class
good shopping for cheap stuff much less pricey than sydney

Manly Beach overrated . Talk of the town, gotta visit Manly Beach. So, after having Tim Sum at Market Place (above Paddy Market)(Tim Sum was great by the way), we headed over to the pier. Paid A$55 for the 4 of us (next time bring a kid, then it will only cost A$10 for 4 people on Sunday's ), took the ferry. Ferry ride was great. Beautiful Panaromic views of cliffs, boats, the bay. However , when we reached Manly beach, saw lots of people. BUT, the beach was dirty and laden with sea weed. Air stank of rotten vege. We walked the beach for 10mjns. The kids were not interested. Suddenly Laguna Beach in California came as a comparison. We decided to leave and walk the shops nearby, That was ok. 1 hour later, we were back in the ferry back to Sidney proper, Visit Manly beach only if you got nothing better to do, beautiful place if city decided to clean the place

Always interesting site. We came here both in summer and in winter. This place is simply enchanting. Lots of shaded areas, places to rest with kids, places to play beach ball, walk, enjoy amazing views. In the vicinity great places to eat. Starting from the simplest "fish and chips" to more posh choices. You can't go wrong here :-)
Great side trip from Sydney. Took the iconic Manly ferry from Circual Quay, amazing view of the city. Manly is a fantastic laid back place, fab beach, great fish & chips, not to be missed.
My kinda place. Manly is a place where I could live, small,quaint,not too lively. Beach with white sand, atmosphere serene. Excellent

Beautiful northern beach and community. Take the ferry from circular quay and visit Manly if you are in Sydney. The small corso is pleasant and the beach beautiful but the ferry ride over and the whole day is spectacular. Nice aquarium also.

Urgghh tourist tat on the Corso...but the walk and ferry great.. We did a morning trip which extended well into the afternoon, visiting the old army training camp on the headland (caught the bus there) and then back via a lovely beach and lunch stop south of Manly. After that treat, the beach and town were just too 'busy'. Many thanks to the most helpful lady in the Tourist cabin by the ferry terminal who gave us good tips about where to go as a first visitor.

Manly Beach. I think it is worthwhile going here just for the ferry ride! the walk is lovely too along the ocean side. We did get ripped off with our fish and chips though, $50 for four of us and the food was ordinary. Much better value at Watson's Bay - much yummier and only $32 for seriously good fish and chips.

The one beach to go to in Sydney. Well, in my opinion, Manly beach is the best one in and around Sydney. The hype about Bondi beach being the best beach in Sydney are, in our opinion, without merit. We went to Manly in January, the day after a visit to Bondi, and we were really happy that we went there. Of course, there were lots of people at the beach, as Bondi, but Manly had a more to give. I recommend a visit to Manly beach to all in/around Sydney, we went from Circular Quay by boat, which gave us a nice view of the town as well.
manly beach. Nice place ,beach is clean and plenty of eateries .shopping has variety and the place is alive with people.
Great place to visit but greater place to Live!!. Definitely go if you love beaches and want to see one of the truly beautiful places in Sydney - Manly is stunning, especially at twilight.
Good swimming and shops.. What a cosmopolitan place - the ferry ride is good then it gets better with a lovely sandy beach. Finish off the day with lots of shops and cafes.

Best beach. Manly Beach is the best beach in Australia as it offers Ocean front and Harbour front and a great collection of restaurants and social activities. It is also basically a flat level walk everywhere.

Loved the atmosphere!. Loved the atmosphere! The beach is great for taking a walk, playing beach volleyball, surfing, or taking it all in! There are also plenty of cute shops and places to eat nearby.

Average beach with a great ferry. The Manly beach is nothing to rave about compared to other beaches in the world but its main attraction is the views from the ferry between Manly beach and the Sydney harbour.
The beach is nice to swim in though - it's just like a swimming pool.

White Sand of Manly Beach. Manly beach can be reached either by car/bus, or by ferry. Using the ferry will give visitors more interesting points to see. The ferry will travel between the Sydney most famous Icons, The Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Sydney Opera House, starting from Circular Quay. A very nice water trip through the estuary of Parramatta River, a lot to see, a trip will take 30 minutes to Manly Wharf.The Wharf is at the west side or the inner side of Manly Head, while the white sand beach is in the outer side of the head facing the Pacific Ocean directly.Between the wharf and the beach, at the narrow neck less than half km distance, located the town centre, with blocks of shops, cafés, restaurants, luxury hotels, backpacker hostels, apartments, travel bureau etc.The white sand beach stretches along 2 km facing the Ocean is beautiful beach for swimming or just leisure walks and relax along the beach. A good place to enjoy specially at bright, clear and sunny day.

WHAT A BEACH. This beach is fantastic. You can just lye there an watch the world go by. It is great for swimming and surfing, although I do not surf. The sand is soft and warm from all the sun it gets during the day. The sea is blue and cool just what you need on a hot summers day. There are lots of cafe and restaurants nearby. What more could you want.

Wonderful beach. Last weekend I visited Manly beach and wow what an amazing place is this.High waves full of surfers and a very nice atmoshpere on the boulevard with very friendly people.Really worth visiting, also the ferry from Sydney to Manyl is worth doing it with great views.

Nothing Special. Nothing special here, not even a surf club overlooking the beach(as opposed to the wharf) where you can get a nice meal. The public toilets were putrid and really need some attention and cleaning. Very disappointing.

Busy Place. Packed with many people, lots of shops across the street. Very friendly people and lifeguards.....You can walk for a long while along the sand or on the street side. Grab a snack have a seat and just admire the view.

Great for everyone. This place is a must go for all ages. Lots of shops, nice walk along the beach, beach volleyball, ease of getting here, etc are the USPs of this beach. Much better than the overhyped Bondi. I generally come here thru Ferry from Circular Quay which is awesome.

Beautiful beach better than Bondi. I preferred Manly beach to Bondi beach to be truthful. I found it less crowded (the beach is longer so it's more spread out) and also the food places were not as expensive here. The beach has lots of large pretty pine trees. It's a great beach to people watch and also watch the surfers. Some amazing surfers here in Australia fun to watch! A must visit when in Sydney

great family day out. great for all ages really and something for every one plenty of shops , cafes restaurants if the weather or the surf is a bit iffy. manly council do a great job in maintaining the facilities which is important esp for families (take note warringah) the harbour side is a lot more protected (less wind no surf) just a short walk up the corso with a protected swimming area. some areas and the council car parks have free parking for 2 hours. personally and being a dee why local I wouldn't come on busy days public holidays etc. great for a family bike ride on non busy periods, there are lots of bike paths that lead into manly and up to shelley beach, Have your finger on the bell though and ride defensively there are some idiots that dont look crossing the bike path to check out the surf. The southern end is good near the surf club which is our pick for a bit of an ocean dip with a coffee shop in the surfclub just a few metres away. If you're visiting and not surf savvy stay within the flags when swimming ,watch out in big surf conditions esp with your kids and you'll have a great time

Manly A MUST!. As we have been to Sydney several times and done most of the Sydney usual attractions I was running out of ideas to bring the family.Decided a trip to Manly would be great as it would mean a lovely Sydney Harbour ferry ride to get to Manly. The ride was short 30mins ride from Circular Quay at costs us less than AUD20 per person return.We didnt bring any swiming gear which was a big mistake as the beach was a lovely calm ( not too strong currents) clean long sandy stretch ideal for young swimmers. Had to buy a new outfit after the little one got dirty & wet playing in the sand. Yes it is definitely nicer than BONDI as other reviewers have mentioned. Cleaner beach and calmer sea.  Lots of eateries and shops high end and affordable. Definitely worth a visit or even a STAY at Manly.Will definitely be back for more MANLY action !

Best beach i've ever been to!. I love this beach very much. It was windy (a bit chill, but still was ok), blue sea, nice and scenic view, and also lovely people alongside the walk of the stores. Nothing more i can say that this is the best beach i've ever been to. i like this more than bondi.
Beautiful. Definitely worth taking the trip over from Sydney. A relaxed place to visit away from the hustle and bustle of the city.

Better than Bondi. This town and beach had real charm and none of the squash and hype that we found at Bondi. The ferry across from Circular Quay adds to the experience. Beautiful beach and great sea for swimming and recreational surfing.

manly - definitely worth to have a look. Great view starts from the circular quay, catch the ferry to the manly beach, it only takes 30 minutes. One of the best beach in Sydney, worth to have a look if you are from overseas.
Beautiful Beach. A great spot to enjoy Australia's Beaches and local hot spots. Water is a beUtiful blue and the waves are delicious. Don't forget suntan lotion here as the ozone has a hole.
Strong waves and windy. Very cold and windy on the beach even on the first day of summer in Dec. Beautiful beach on a cove and right in town. Easily accessible.

Quaint Little town. Took the ferry from Sydney to Manly beach. Had gellato and roamed the streets for a couple of hours. Exceptionally clean and wonderful shopping and the sea coast was spectacular. Exceptional food and history in this town.
Watch those seagulls. Great fish and chips everywhere but don't eat them at the beach - you will be attacked by aggressive seagulls!
Beautiful beach and walk. Lovely beach for a good swim, we also did few small walks like cabbage trail walk to Shelly beach and the north head look out walk . Beautiful views!!

Nice beach but watch out for the waves. We travelled to this beach on a Saturday by ferry from Circle Quay like most people I guess. We went around 10am and it was surprisingly quiet though got busier as the day went on. Not sure if this is typical but the beach was closed for swimming due to under currents and it was quite rough. The beach also has a good selection of bars, cafes and restaurants directly behind it and it is a really nice place to visit with a very friendly feel. Depending on the wind it may not be the best for young children however.

Beautiful Beach Minus The Crowd. We took the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly Wharf and the journey will take you 30 minutes. More scenic way to get to Manly, the beach was beautiful and there were less people if compare to Bondi. Plenty of cafe/eateries located along the beach should you feel hungry
paradise. Lots of shops and cafes near by. Nice big beach with plenty of surfers beach volleyball and many more activigies to do or you can just sit back and relax.

Nice Sydney Beach. There are a number of ways you can get to Manly Beach from Sydney CBD. Sydney Ferries from Circular Key or simply drive, bus or train. Manly Beach is a surf beach also offering a walk through street mall with shops, restaurants and pubs. There are many hotels to choose from as well at Manly Beach.
Great spot. A real Sydney icon - if you're in the city you gotta get here! A real tropical paradise and something special.

Make you way to Manly for morning outing. An easy walk through the Corso takes you from the ferry terminal to the expansive Manly Beach. Plenty of swimmers in the water and board-riders further out. Water way to cold for us northern visitors!

Great Beach. Manly Beach is a great beach for all who visit the Sydney area. The ferry ride from Sydney harbor is wonderful and scenic. When you arrive you get to the dock and walk across the street to the "Corso" this is a walkway area with shops, restaurants and souvenir shops. At the end of the walk you arrive at the beach. The day I arrived, the beach was packed with locals and visitors alike. It is a very large and beautiful beach the water was clean and there were plenty of lifeguards on duty. The surrounding area has small streets with all kinds of crafts being sold. The beach area is certainly a great place to visit.

Great 1/2 day excursion. When visiting Sydney we recommend you take the normal ferry from Circular Quay to Manly beach. Already only the ferry ride is worth going, it gives you a great opportunity to take pictures of the harbour, the Opera House, the bridge and some of Sydney's suburbs. The beach (2 in fact) are OK and clean but not that spectacular. Good shopping opportunity and last but not least have lunch at Hugo's (at the wharf right at the border of the water). Great food, we had the reef fish and it was excellent.

A must go!. Well this is the place which you will obviously go to, but do go only by the ferry. Also please keep at least half a day to chill here. Good place to walk around, shelly beach, north head etc. Can be a fun place with friends. Lots to do around the sea.

THE BEST !!!. Manly Beach is my home beach, I walk it most mornings. It's scenic, clean, friendly and has a great vibe. The ocean always has surfers and or swimmers and is a delight to behold. There are so many cafes and restaurants with great food and coffee for all tastes. If you like to shop there is a great choice for casual wear or sophistication.There is nothing that I dislike about Manly.
To do for sure!. It's beautiful, it's charming, and it's always a great place to go, nothing more to say as you should already have heard about it! I loved the mood and the beautiful landscape!
great place to unwind. nice ferry ride from town, really nice beach to go except on the week end where it gets too crowded to do anything.

Manly by Ferry. Great day trip. Catch the ferry from circular Quay. Wander down the Main Street to the beachfront. Lots of eateries from casual to upmarket. Retail outlets are in abundance including supermarkets, bakeries and surf shops.

Worth the ferry ride. Obviously the water in Sydney is coooollldd, so we didnt do any swimming. But worth going to to relax and to check out the shops. Some of the best shopping we did in Sydney was here!

Go there.. The ferry from Circular Quay to Manly beach is probably the most scenic ferry ride you'll ever take in Sydney. You get the best views of the skyline, the Opera House and the Harbor beach. The town of Manly beach is a typical beach town, similar to Huntington Beach in Southern California, with bars and many surfer stores. Regarding the beach: well, if you don't have a chiseled athletic body, are not a surfer, or are not generally young and beautiful, you might feel a little out of place. But it's beautiful, stereotypically Australia and must be seen.

Nice beach and great restaurants nearby. Love the beach and it's atmosphere. Less crowded than Bondi and there's Manly Wharf to catch up with friends and great nearby restaurants. I love unique jewelry stores with various gem stones and birth stones across Manly Wharf. They have Tarot reading too for fun

Manly beach. WE were on a cruise with 1900 Aussies and every one that we spoke to said we must go to Manly , its much better than Bondi . Well I was shocked , the place seemed such a dump and the beach with the 2 great overflow pipes going through it did nothing for me , a terrible let down .
Lovely beach. I could watch the sea all day! Lovely colour and soft waves when we were there. Beautiful sandy beach and perfect for families

Our little break. Manly Beach is one stretch of beautiful safe sand for young and old a like, the amenities around the shore line are very good, cafes bars shops restaurants public toilets very clean and safe. just a short hop from Sydney by boat our a short hop from Taronga Zoo.
Beautiful sight. Nice boat trip, good location for lunch. Lot of things to do. Definitely will go there again. Nice weather
Beautiful. Make sure you do the walk from Manly Beach to Fairy Bower, really love stroll with shop and cafes on the way.

Manly Beach- Perpetual pleasure. I've been going to Manly Beach since I was three years old. Thats over 60 years ago! Apart from the odd wet or windy day, its a perfectly reliable, pleasurable and enjoyable place to be. Always clean, always attractive, Manly Beach is easily accessible, ideally by Ferry from the City. The perfect way to go to the beach, no matter what the weather, the Manly Ferries complement the Manly experience perfectly. Better than Bondi, much more interesting for surfing and has the options of interesting walks to Fairy Bower and Shelly Beach.

A Great Excursion. This was a great day excursion starting from the ferry ride at Circular Quay to the little town of Manly Beach to the beach itself. With the Opal Card, it is $2.50 roundtrip for the ferry ride on Sunday (Opal card price caps at $2.50 on Sundays) but make sure you go early to beat the crowds. The town was full of small restaurants, cafes and shops and you could spend a couple of hours just browsing there. The beach however is beautiful. There is a great beachwalk that goes quite a ways that give you different views every few hundred yards. The beach is clean and the weather was great the day that we were there (I heard it was quite windy the day before). Since we were just visiting, we didn't bring our beachwear but would definitely do so on a future trip. This would make for a full day of relaxation.
Beautiful Beach. the ferry from The Rocks harbour was beautiful, and Manly beach was as well. There are shops, markets and restaurants in the area. It was a great outing.

Best of both worlds. 7 Miles from Sydney and a 1000 miles from care was a favorite saying about Manly.For years people have been escaping the City of Sydney and travel by ferry to Manly. Unique with it's Harbor and Ocean beaches joined by a pleasant stroll along the Corso. Many offers beautiful scenery along with many fine dining choices. One of my favorite places is the Manly Sixteen Footer Skiff Sailing Club which offers a great casual place to dine along with views of harbor.

Just Perfect. Travelled to Manley on the ferry and found it to be a gem. There is a small beach just as you come off the ferry. Perfect for young families. To the other side there is a larger beach. It has a Main Street that has many shops, cafes and restaurants. Manly was one of our favourite places we visited whilst in Australia. Would highly recommend it.

Disappointed. I was all set to spend a few days at Manly, having heard about it for years. But I wasn't able to get a grip on this town; the center seemed not to offer me much, and the places to stay did not appeal to me. So I booked over to Bondi, and that was a much better experience!

Lovely beach. Was lovely but very packed! Ate brunch a nice cafe looking over the beach and plenty restaurants to choose from and the mall had some nice stores to shop at. Highly recommend catching the Manly ferry.

Great surf and swim. The sand at Manly Beach is phenomenal. Relax on the beach or dive into the waves in the swimming areas or rent a board and try your surfing skills in the separate surfing sections. Heaven on earth. :-)

Manly is a great place to stay at. Manly is a great place for tourists to stay at. It is not as busy as Sydney. But with the ferry F1 you get very easy to Sydney city and with the busses 155 and 156 you can reach the Big4 Holiday Park Lakesides (which is beautiful) in roughly 30 minutes. Manly has also a very good shopping opportunities and great restaurants!

A SAFE BEACH TO SWIM. My surf life saving club is at the southern end of this beautiful beach & we spend our weekends voluntarily patrolling Manly Beach to keep it safe for the thousands of visitors that flock here throughout the year. When you get to the end of the Corso, as you've most probably just stepped of the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay, do turn right & walk down towards the surf club. Here you'll see the traditional red & yellow flags, that the professional lifeguards put up on the beach, to indicate the safest area to swim. This is a fairly wide beach with very clean sands that are scoured by tractor each morning. You'll see people using it for family fun, jogging on the beach, both on the soft sand & down along the water's edge or even using one of the many volley ball nets & courts a little further up the beach. Do enjoy our beach, but, PLEASE take your rubbish home with you or find a bin so others may enjoy the clean sand tomorrow.

White Water Restaurant in Manly. If you are in Sydney and have a few hours a trip to Manly by ferry is a sure to please every taste and age. A beautiful spot to enjoy year round. Walking to Shelly Beach is a relaxing experience and the views are breath taking. Lunch at White Water Restaurant overlooking the beach is a must.The Lobster for entre and the fish and chips are highly recommended. The service is excellent-Prices are reasonable and the views are spectacular.

Great Place for a Holiday. This is a holiday for all the family. Beach is clean and has plenty of room. There is lots of places to walk. Food and drink is just opposite the beach, with Cosmopolitan Food or fast take away. The Corso is truly a special place with lots to do.

Love it!!!. Manly is one among the cleanest beaches in Sydney. We went to Manly from Circular Quay by ferry on a Sunday late noon.Travel Time: 20-25 mins.Once you land in Manly wharf, one can take a spit walk or Go to the beach through "The Corso".You will be able to see penguin colony during the breeding season of Penguins.Taking a stroll in the beach with Mcdonald's waffle icecream was pretty nice."The Corso" is the walk from Manly wharf to Manly beach. It has good number of shopping complex, restaurants and cafes.Worth a visit..
A day at the beach.. Great day at manly lots of interesting shops to look at & a great selection of food at reasonable prices, then sitting by one of our beautiful beaches.

Best beach in sydney. if you come to sydney Australia you have to visit manly beach with it surfing beach nice sand alot of cafes and restaurants and the ferrys that takes you to the opera house and the harbour bridge it's a must see

A place to spend the day. My visit was only in the late afternoon and evening, however Manly beach is a place to spend the day. A heaven for surfers, a charming walking and shopping place, a unique front beach restaurant "Pantry Manly" with outstanding menu. You should try it!!

Very safe ocean beach for your first surfing adventure. After spending most of my childhood growing up in Manly I'd forgotten just how good the South Steyne beach precinct was for first time surfers. The beach shelves gently and is well protected from Southerly swells so it's not very often you get big waves - and that's what makes it such a good proposition for first timers. Manly Surf Lifesaving Club overlooks the flagged bathing zone and provides patrols to keep everyone safe in the water. Can get very busy at times, early mornings are best as the usual afternoon North Westerly sea breeze can be quite strong at times, blowing out any surf. So, give it a go, try a bit of body surfing and enjoy!! For those less adventurous souls there is a great walk along marine promenade from Shelly Beach to Queenscliff that puts you in touch with the scene and includes ocean pools at Fairy Bower (named after a colony of Fairy Penguins in the area) and Queenscliff.

Busy promenade. Small hub with loads of things to see and do. Explore the area, Quarantine Station, loads of restaurants and bars plus you can jump on a ferry and cruise across to Taronga Zoo or Circular Quay.
Ok - Just OK. Of all the Sydney beaches to visit this would be the most blah. The corso is dirty and unappealing. The beach is not that exciting. There are better beaches in Sydney.

Better than Bondi!. Manly Beach is a long stretch of golden sand that is actually three 'beaches'. South Steyne, North Steyne and Queenscliff.South Steyne is where all the restaurants, cafes, hotels, shops, pubs etc are located as well as the famous Corso which is the main pedestrian access to the Manly Ferry and its connection to the city.North Steyne is the central area of the beach and is popular with surfers.Queenscliff is at the northern end where Manly Lagoon spills out to the ocean. It's much quieter and is a good spot for littler kids.At the south end of the beach there is a very pleasant walk round to Shelly Beach which is tucked in under North head, the access to Sydney harbour. At the Queenscliff end you can walk round the rocks to the next beach, Freshwater by way of a tunnel through the cliff.Manly offers so much more than Bondi - a range of options along the beach; busy and bustling, active, and quiet and it's proximity to the harbour opens up another load of activities such as windsurfing, paddle boarding, kayaking etc.
Relaxing. Great place to get away from the hustle of the city and relax on the beach. Catch the Ferry at Circular Quay, sit back and enjoy the views

Laid back iconic Aussie Beach experience. Situated on Sydney's northern beaches, easily accessible from Circular Quay by the best and longest Sydney Harbour ferry ride, this iconic location offers any visitor, whether young, old or families an easy unrushed day of beach life.Pack your swimmers, towel and sandals (or thongs), bus or car it into Manly with reasonable numbers of paid parking, but the best means is the Ferry. It's part of the Manly Beach experience I never miss. The trip over allows you a view of the best Harbour sights, Bridge, Opera House, Garden island, Fort Denison and past the Eastern Suburbs and the Harbour Heads.Arriving by Ferry you'll be greated by the wharf and its shops, plenty of food and the Aquarium, then its straight across the road to the Corso (main shopping street mall) and a walk past some amazing food, wine, pubs or take away shops (and icecream to kill for) as you head for the beach. The best restaurants for those wanting a quality meal and surroundings are along the beach front, with takeaways along the Corso.The beach is wide, orange sand and plenty of room to take in the sun or swim lose to shore or even body or board surf further out. You'll never feel too crowded and mix with people from all over Sydney there just to enjoy the best of Aussie Beach fun.

Spectacular beach village. Great shopping, dining, swimming, and surfing all in one location. Prices were reasonable and the village vibe was good. Unfortunately the day we were there it was raining and windy...not a great beach day, but great for shopping.

Beach number one.. Manly Beach is easily accessed by Manly Ferry from Circular Quay at the city of Sydney. It is the first of about twenty beaches on the 'Northern Beaches' area of Sydney which start at North Head. Originally an area settled by the overspill from the city as people spent weekends in Manly and other beaches further north and then stayed and lived there permanently. Manly Beach has a lovely walk up "The Corso" from the Manly Ferry wharf to the beach itself. The Corso has ample shops, pubs, cafes and restaurants to keep everyone happy. The surf is about as Australian as anything, a little bit wild and fun enough for kids too. From Manly Wharf there is a very good selection of buses to take you to the other beaches further north. I think it's the 190 that will take you to Palm Beach, the northern most beach at Barrenjoey Headland, the "Summer Bay" setting for the Australian soap opera, "Home And Away". It is a journey of at least 45 minutes but takes you past every one of the beaches along the way. You'll look at the normal homes along the way and suddenly understand the expression, "The Lucky Australians".

Busy, clean, accessible beach with surf. Easily accessible infamous beach which can be reached via the Fast or Regular ferries - just a tip if you do the hop on and off ticket but the manly ticket at the same time as it only costs a few dollars extra via the cook cruises hopper where as it is about 4x the price bought alone.The beach was extremely busy when we visited as it's the start of the holiday season and weekend so full of youngsters/students, it does have an 18 - 30 vibe, although technically we are towards the latter end of this category, we aren't the drink/party animal types and this place does have that feel.Although it was worth a visit, due to it's notoriety and has a range of shops and street stalls which adds to the atmosphere we were quick to get the ferry back much preferring the chilled out vibe of Watson's bay.
just great!. not too growded, nice neighborhood with small cafes and restaurants. There is both surfing possible in main beach and smaller bay with scuba dive possibilities (no big waves present).

Beautiful!!!. We took the ferry over on a Sunday late morning. It was beautiful. There were surfers and dogs and lots of families on the beautiful beach. There is a lovely walking path that goes for several miles. The twon has lots of shopping and restaurants. It was lovely.
Nice beach. Beach accessible by ferry from Circular Quay is busy at weekends so get there early. Relaxing place to while away a few hours!

A Beautiful Beach with Good Surf. After our ferry ride through spectacular Sydney Harbor, we arrived at Manly harbor, and immediately had a very nice lunch. Some locals recommended that we walk over to the beach and back via The Corso. Surfers were already enjoying this long, sandy beach. Great architecture and shops walking back on Corso Street.

Perfect day trip from Sydney CBD. Personally my favourite beach in Sydney. Blows Bondi out of the water. We took the ferry over from Darling Harbour, it was a pleasant half and hour or so. Very helpful Tourist Info center which helped us sort out our bike rental for the day. We biked all the way along the coast to Shelly Beach as well (we took a tandem bike!). Beautiful sand, somewhat powdery. Lots of nice little restaurants for a drink and really fresh fish & chips. Not sure how packed it gets on weekends but we spent a whole day in the middle of the week and we pretty much had the beaches to ourselves (unlike the unpleasant throng of people which people may envision). Ended the day at a local micro-brewery called the 4Pines. Great atmosphere with a live act from 7pm onwards. Overall, a different pace from the Sydney CBD. Very chill and 100% worth a visit.
Much better than Bondi!. Super. Large bay, lovely sea and sand. Not tacky like Bondi.Ferry over from Sydney Harbour is cheap and efficient. gets very busy at weekends. Definitely worth a visit.

Lovely escape from the CBD. It's great to get a sense of a different kind of Sydney, and see the beach culture up close. The Main Street is a bit commercial but there's some great little bistros around for a very reasonable (and fresh!) fish and chips lunch!

Leaves Bondi for dead. Bondi may be the most famous of Sydney's beaches but personally I would choose Manly over Bondi any day. Better restaurants, much easier parking and very clean. Be careful parking on the beach front as it is very well policed but there are plenty of multi-story council parking stations near by.

Laid back and relaxing atmosphere. Took the boast from circular quay to manly for the day. Very relaxed compared to Sydney. Plenty of shops and restaurants and beautiful, clean beach. Stunning views out over the beach and lovely walks around the coast.

Great Coastal Area, Easily Accessible by Ferry from Circular Quay. Manly Beach sits at the entrance to Sydney Harbour and can be accessed by ferry from Circular Quay in about 30 minutes of a very scenic trip past icons such as the Sydney Harbour Bridge, the Opera House, and a lot of pleasure boaters. The views of Sydney's skyline are excellent from the water.Manly itself is very touristy at first blush but that isn't necessarily a bad think if you're a tourist! It means that there are a lot of facilities, e.g., restaurants, bars, etc. The ferry drops you on the harbour side but it's only a few blocks to the Pacific Ocean beach because Manly sits on a narrow peninsula. There are also restaurants along the beach (opposite side of the street--thankfully, the beach is public!). It's a very enjoyable place.

Best Beach I visited in Sydney. Went with the family on the local ferry, The ferry took about 25 minutes. The ride was cool and scenic. My son loved it.
