The beach was crowded, The weather was hot but the water was cold. The exotic shops and the eateries are very reasonably priced and a variety is available.A very nice place to visit when you go to Sydney. You should spend at least a day there to enjoy the beach. All depends on the weather. There are showers and changing rooms available which are well maintained.
A lovely day trip out of Sydney. Easy to get to, great food, lovely beach, bars. There's a great place on the beach for brunch, which I think used to be the public toilets and changing area!
Beautiful Beach. The beach was beautiful and clean. Water was pretty rough and the flagged area for swimming was not very big - it was warm in the water but a bit crowded

One of the best. Manly has a great beach and plenty of places to get good food and drink. The best way to get there is by ferry from circular quay, you'll get some amazing views of the harbour that way.

Obvious why it's so popular. This iconic beach, promenade and Corso is quite different to anything else in Sydney. Brings back memories of TV show Raffertys Rules. Eateries featuring local fish was a bonus. Stores along Corso offer a great range of interesting products. A really great way to spend a day.

"Best Beach" in Sydney. I know everyone thinks of Bondi Beach when they think of Sydney, but after seeing both, I have to say that Manly is my favorite. Many people that take the ferry thinks that the wharf is Manly Beach, it is no. Manly Beach is on the other side of the peninsula (5 min walk) facing the pacific ocean. So many people go to the ferry drop off and say they have been to the beach, not hardly. The beach is a long wide stretch of white sands and turquoise water. It is truly beautiful and a sight to see and enjoy. Take the ferry, enjoy Manly, eat shop and have a day at a very beautiful beach.

Softest sand. Spoiled for choice at Manly, you can choose to sit on the Harbour side or walk a few hundred yards to the coast side, either way you won't be disappointed. The sands are clean and tidy, safely swim on the Harbour side or if it takes your fancy surf on the coast side. Enjoy

Good beach. We often travel on the ferry and go to Manly Beach. It's fun and visiting friends really love it. Sydney has lots of good beaches and combining a beach day with something else like a ferry ride is fun. Finish off with fish and chips and its perfect.

Nice beach area. Took the ferry from circular quay, which is worth doing just for a different perspective of the harbour landmarks. Manly beach is a good size and is backed by a long promenade with bars and shops the other side of the road. We were sight seeing so stopping here for a little while was enjoyable but personally I prefer quieter unspoilt beaches, but for those who'd rather have everything to hand then I should imagine this is a popular choice.
Nice but still only a beach. i suppose because I'm not a surfer can't really se what the hype is about yes it's lovely but so are many others here I prefer glenelg in sa

Graat place. Honestly it reminded me of my holidays in Greece, such an European spirit- just lovely spot. Nice walking areas, great beach, coffee shops and restaurant. It will take you half and hour ferry ride from Circulat Quay and it is worth every min.

Beach is average. There isn't one thing that I can remember to distinguish this beach from any other. There are lots of tourists like myself and that's about it. Visit if you have the time, but Watson Bay has much better scenery.
Lovely promenade. Great place to spend a Saturday afternoon and finish off in beach bar ! Great buzz about the place and holiday atmosphere,

One of the top spots in Sydney. The ferry to Manly leaves from Circular Quay and is a fantastic way to see the Harbour from the water. It arrives right on the doorstep of Manly, with only a walk across a road to get to the main street. Along the wharf many bars and restaurants now provide a fantastic location for lunch and dinner before the ferry back to town. Manly town center is a quaint 1-2 street affair. It is pedestrianized so very relaxed. Lots of great surf shops and drinking establishments with the prize of a wonderful surf beach at the other end of the main street.Well worth a visit if you're in Sydney for a few days!
relaxing. relaxing place, good beach. good for going to the beach, walking around, or just having a meal. also nice ferry ride from the city with nice views. If you have 3-6 hours, it's worth it!

A lovely, lively beach.. Manly beach has a really European feel to it with paved walkways, cafés and a quirky market on a Sunday. The beach gets very busy at weekends but never feels too crowded. As with other Sydney beaches the waves are great for surfers and those who just want to have fun in the surf. It's a clean beach and the life guards were very attentive to changes in the surf.

Manly ferry ride is the best way to see Sydney. The Manly ferry is one of the best ways to see Sydney, the 40 minute ride gives you uninterrupted views of the harbour and I recommend sitting outside for the first 10 minutes for some Kodak moments.The beach itself is good, but not amazing. The best attractions in Manly are the ferry trip, the bars and the markets.Tips: - For something different, walk from Manly Beach to Shelly Beach - Ferries leave every 30 minutes, make sure you time your trip so you're waiting around. You can plan your trip at www.131500.com.au (the Sydney public transport website)- For a drink check out the bars by the ferry or for food, grab fish and chips and eat on the beach like a local.

Great place to watch the kite surfers. Late one Saturday afternoon I got the urge to jump on the Manly ferry from the Circulat Quay and take the 30 minute or so ride over to Manly. My aim was to get to the beach there to watch the surfers. However, it was getting late and most surfers had packed it in for the day. That left the beach, at low tide with the life guards clearing up after a long, sunny day and the kite surfers skimmimg on the waves in the shallows. Boy, can they speed through the water. I sat for ever just marvelling at the skills of the guys as they spun through the water and sailed high over the surf. What a sight! Eventually with wind swept hair I reluctantly returned to the ferry so that I would be in time for my self imposed appointment with a restaurant in Darling Harbour that evening.

A Must for Travellers. A trip to Manly on the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay is a must-do for people new to Sydney or any overseas visitor. It epitomises Australian beach culture, has plenty of good places to dine (or buy fish & chips on The Esplanade and eat on the beach) ice creameries, and surf shops. It also boasts nightlife, pub culture and several decent hotels as a lovely alternative to staying in Sydney's CBD.Always busy, Manly beach and its surrounding areas will provide lovely photo opportunities, and is well worth a visit just to say "Ive been there".

A bit over-rated. The ferry to Manly is better than the beach. The beach is no better/worse than many globally, with lots of apartments overlooking it, a few bars and restaurants, but nothing that makes it stand out. In my opinion, you're better heading to Bondi/Coogee.

Great Day out.. Make sure you catch one of the old green and gold ferrys for the trip to Manly. Lovely ferry ride across the harbour. Nice cafes on the Manly wharf and relaxed little inlet area next to the wharf. We had a snooze under the big trees.
Over rated ferry side, terrific seaside. Good restaurants and a fun stroll good evening away from the city. I can't say anything moe, no matter how much you push, TA!

One of the best popular beaches. Whilst many of Australia's best beaches are ones that aren't well known to the general public and are often far quieter and less travelled, Manly Beach would have to be the pick of the mainstream beaches, particularly around Sydney.It has the typical beautiful views of many of our beaches, but often isn't as crowded as beaches like Bondi. It is still very well known and well trafficked enough though, that it plays host to a lot of events and is a great surfing scene. It does still have a tendency to get a little over crowded, particularly down the southern end, but at least up North Steyne, it's usually a little quieter...assuming it's not 35º+ and everyone in Sydney's by the water.It's not too far to get to, is relatively accessible and has plenty to offer near by too, which is qhy it ranks so highly in my beach list.

Lovely day out. Nice to catch ferry from Circular Quay and stroll down the Corso. Lots of shops, takeaways, cafes and restaurants, both in the Corso or streets off it. Play equipment for the kids to play on. They have markets there on some weekends, which are great too.

Nice break from the city. There aren't many things better than walking along a beautiful beach looking out at the vast Pacific. At Manly Beach you can either walk directly on the beach or on the man-made walkway. No matter which you choose, you can't go wrong. It's such a lovely and relaxing setting. There are also several good restaurants and convenient shops at or near the beach.

Beautiful, but Shelly is a Must-See!. We took the ferry from Sydney to Manly and it's really a lovely area. Nice and clean, lots of places to grab a snack or sit down and eat. It's worth the walk though to check out Shelly Beach, I recommend taking the short walk, you're right there!

Revisit from 10 years ago. Caught the Manly ferry from Circular Quay. The mall leading to the beach could do with a major facelift and did not look like anything had been done in a long time. A shame as the Darling Harbour has had a major transformation. Walk the length of the beach which was enjoyable but did not get a buzz from the visit

Walk from Manly to Shelly Beach. We took the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly, only 30 minutes with great photos of the bridge and the opera house (depending on the side). The beach itself was beautiful, white beaches, not as crowded as expected and Shelly Beach was quiet and less crowded with calm waters. Beware the water is chillier than you expect. The walk along the path is easy for anyone, we saw a number of baby carriages, and canes, call can walk this. There are sea dragons to be seen along the path, but don't touch they are protected. There was a lovely salt water pool built into the rocks about halfway to Shelly beach along the path. A great place to sit and gaze at the ocean. There are a number of good resturants and shops right there along the way for you to pop in and enjoy. We had a great lunch overlooking the water. Worth a halfday trip and we would recur.
Lovely beaches. We caught the ferry to Manly from darling harbour. Was awesome. Manly have quite a few great shops as well. The beaches are beautiful.

On way to home and away . I visited this beach on the way to the home and away beach;) it's pleasant and very long. A lot less tourists here than bondi and in my opinion I prefer this beach. Clean water and soft sand
Excellent. Beautiful view for the beach. Great restaurants: seafood, beef, chicken. Excellent shops: Aldi and Woolwarth.

Great place to relax. I went over here to visit a good friend. She showed me around the beach and I was impressed by the view and atmosphere. It was relaxing and I had wished I had stayed overnight in a hotel. I would recommend this to tourists and even to local Sydney residents. i live in the west and it took me 2 hours to commute but it's worth a visit.

Half Day Trip at least Please, Enjoy the scenery and atmosphere. The scenery here might be similar to that of the Bondi Beach. But the atmosphere ,I would say was totally different. It's more peaceful, relaxing with sea gulls flying around, whom on and off trying to steal food from your "bowl or plate even covered up". Of course there would be far less vehicles in the area. Grab a drink, sit back and enjoyed at any cafe, bar or restaurant along the beach across the road. In addition, the ferry service from Circular Quay to here offers magnificent views of the Sydney Harbor alongside.

Living the Life. Born and breed here cannot beat it, so much to do and see, grab a bite at the local Pub or restaurant so many to choose from, or take out a picnic on the relaxing beach Gotta Love Manly

Good place to walk around. My wife and I spent most of the day here. We walked along the beach and then inland and back to Many which took about 2-3 hours. We then had lunch at a brew pub which was good and then souvenir shopped before taking the ferry back to Sydney. The ferry ride is well worth doing and only takes 30 minutes with lots of service times. A good day was spent here.
Beach is quite scenic. Maybe a little less than Bondi, but a visit to Manly is worth the trip. Take the ferry from Sydney and have a nice day.

The place to stay when visiting Sydney. We always stay in Manly when holidaying in Sydney. The Manly ferry to Sydney is a scenic half-hour trip and deposits you right in the centre of things. Once you have had enough of the hustle and bustle of town you can return to the relative calm of Manly. This beach side resort offers a great variety of accommodation, restaurants, cafes, walks and other splendid activities. It's wonderful to wake up in the morning and watch the surfers, runners and cyclists before they go off to work and to enjoy an ocean stroll as well. Manly has some of the most scenic walks around the Sydney coastline. If you come with children they will revel in the beach activities and you can enjoy a quiet waterside coffee. The hotels and restaurants are alive with young people having a great time.

Touristy beach, but beautiful nonetheless. Easy to get to, but highly recommend going early in the day/morning. Trying to get used to the time difference, I woke up pretty early and am glad I go here when I did, which was around 830a. You take the ferry (I took it from Circular Quay, and you don't need to purchase tickets ahead of time, at least not for that time of day.) It took about 45 minutes to get there, but I believe there are faster ones. You can check with the people selling the tickets.When I returned, around 11a, the line to get onto the ferry was very, very long. Back to the beach. As soon as you depart the ferry station, on the left is a bike rental place and also a walkway that leads you through some lovely scenery. There is also a German style restaurant that has delicious granola and lattes!You will not have a problem finding a place to eat or sit and have coffee/tea and watch people stroll by. The entire area around the ferry station and on to the beach has lots of shops, restaurants and cafes.The signs to get to the beach are pretty easy. Just walk straight and you'll know when you've gotten there.I did not rent a bike as I'd planned because I couldn't find the place I wanted and when asked, people around there were not familiar with it. Also, a couple told me later that it's a waste of money because you don't see that much on a bike that you can't see on foot and there are a lot of hills. I did see a lot of hills.So back to the beach: when you get to it, you can go left or right and walk along a promenade. If you go right, you'll also have the opportunity to take a walk off the beaten path (although it's paved) and take in the beauty. You can also rent some paddle boats and there's a small area for children to play in as well.

Beach. It´s nice but it´s only a beach. There are high waves so and at time it´s cold. On manly beach are a lot of surfers, here are showers (cold). The beach is clean no waste and its sand, no rocks.

Better Options Close by. Manly Beach is an institution when it comes to tourism, it is the Bondi Beach of the northern beaches, famous for its ability to transport large quantites of tourist to a place that has sand, surf, sun and shopping. Its a nice beach, no doubt, but there are other options for those wanting something else.Shelly beach is that small bay to the right, about a 10 min walk from Manly. And if you want to drive further up, go to Narrabeen beach (surfer heaven, but quite localised), or Whale Beach.Manly Beach comes alive at night with the shopping area known as The Corso is lined with pubs, hip bars and nightclubs. WARNING: at night the Corso is not a great place to be, plenty of violence from alcohol, i think it was rated one of the highest incidences of bar assaults in Australia (top 5). I know from my own professional experience (paramedic), a few years ago I was dispatched to the Corso one Saturday on 5 different occasions for assaults - most were from people assaulted randomly.

this is a small, ok beach. there's nothing much to this beach, it's small & pleasant, but I don't like the fact that there's a road right next to it. if you get the chance, go to the kayak place which is to the right when you get off the ferry from Sydney harbour, it's cheap & you get 4 hours in the kayak

Well worth short ferry trip. Manly has a lovely sea front restaurant along the wharf, and a great walk along the promenade.
Nice break from the city .
Great views on the ferry over of the bridge and the opera house, great for pictures.
Massive waves , lots of surfers and bathers.
Well worth a visit.

Wonderful Beach. Took the Ferry from the City to Manly Beach and spent the afternoon walking around checking out the surf, shopping and had a great lunch and cold beer in the local pub what a great area just loved it
Manly Beach. Well supervised by surf life savers our family enjoyed swimming there! We also had a meal at the Hotel Styne...brilliant oysters!!!
Early evening ferry trip across harbour. Great time to see harbour and city lights , plenty of restaurants to visit in Manly at night but for beach experience go earlier in the day

Average beach. This beach has been a little over hyped and is unfortunately not anything special. Yes, it's nice. Yes, it's clean. Is it anything to right home about? Not really. Worth a visit? Yes. Have a bite in one of the many seafront cafes, wander through the shopping mall and then stop for a beer overlooking the harbour and then move on.
Manly Beach a must do!. Great views on the ferry and a fabulous beach, Baramundi fish and chips and a cold Aussie beer on the beach....a must do!

A great place to walk ,swim, eat and enjoy. Manly is a great place to walk , from Queenscliff to Shelley Beach , every time you go the view is different and the sights. There are lots of great cafes restaurants and bars Ideal for all. We just love walking the dog in the morning and getting a coffeeWe are regular visitors but each time we go we feel like it is new

Great beach, straight off the ferry.. Manly, a great place half hour ferry ride from circular quay, leisurely walk from the ferry through to the corso, the beach is safe for both those who want to wet their ankles and avid surfers, board hire from the beach, for those who like a little walk, try the walk to Shelly Beach, easy walking wheel chair friendly, and a gorgeous walk, keep your eyes open for the Water Dragons sunning them selves, don't forget the sun cream
Loved the Place. Came on the ferrie for the day and did the shops & wonderful Sunday market. Such a great place to visit.
Manly and Hugo's Restaurant. Lunch at Hugo's on the harbour side of Manly. Delicious food and wonderful view but a little noisy at lunchtime. I'd like to try it one evening to see if it's quieter.

Great beach. Great place to stay. Lots of restaurants, pubs and nightlife. My family and friends love to stay here. Great atmosphere. Nice restaurants. Ferry to the city. Easy access. Only fault gets really busy on weekends.

Manly Beach. I grew up on Manly Beach so I would have to rate it much higher than Bondi which seems to be more famous and also much more crowded. Manly has a charm all of its own. It is generally a safe surfing beach suitable for families. There is a pleasant walk around to Shelly Beach which is also worth doing. Changing facilities are close to the beach.

Fantastic beach. lovely golden sand lots of action with surfers, volleyball and kids digging, the beach is well patrolled. Cafes, bars and shops close by and anice walk along the front all on the flat its all you want in a holiday spot

Manly Beach. Very beautiful beach. Surfers and swimmers seem to love it. The walking path along the shoreline is very nice. Shopping and restaurants nearby. Well worth the ferry ride.Sydney harbour area is a great place to spend some time.

Manly - NOT Bondi. So, if I was a tourist to Sydney, I would be aiming for Manly. A couple of reasons. First, it is way less crowded and pretentious than that southern beach. Second, if you take a ferry from Circular Quay, you get a nice harbour cruise, then at Manly, it's about a 200-300 m walk and you are at the beach. No need to worry about parking or having to change buses or trains or whatever.And - because it's a NSW beach - guaranteed to be a great beach visit (not that I'm biased or anything....). If you have to go to Bondi for some bucket list thing, enjoy. When you want a nice beach day and be relaxed, Manly is the place to go.

Iconic Haven. It has just about everything a beach could offer - wide level beach, beautiful soft sand, safe easy stroll into the cool clean surf, stunning views up the coast and at one end of the famous, vibrant, swinging 'Corso' thoroughfare! The perfect summer combination really - beach is professionally patrolled, has fresh water showers, beach volleyball nets, convenient facilities and across the road from the historic 'Steyne' Hotel and a selection of world class cafe's, restaurants & bars. It's more commercial and busy than years gone by but this has only added to it's charm, vitality and cosmopolitan international appeal - this place can never be spoilt - fun, relax, indulge, a wonderful day out - go Manly!

Spectacular. Manly Beach offers beautiful, clean water with great waves for surfing and swimming. The soft, pale yellow sand is fabulous for going for a beach stroll or just for lazing in the sun. The views from the beach are gorgeous. There are numerous café and eateries along the beach front and in the corso. Manly beach is easily accessible by ferry, which stops on the harbour side of Manly, also there's plenty of parking.
Better than Bondi. An easy 30 min ferry ride from Circular Quay. A beautiful beach patrolled by lifeguards. Great restaurants and shops. We preferred Manly to Bondi beach.

Sydney's favourite beach. For me Manly tops Bondi as Sydney's favourite beach but get past the Corso as fast as you can. The Corso is overpriced tours I rubbish but get past that to the beach and the neighbouring strets and you will see the real many, great beach, nice little restaurants facing the sea and a decent nightlife.
great beach. very safe with swimming places and supervised by the beach lifeguards, near to the shops and restuarants and a short walk from the ferry ,lovely golden sand

A straight walk from the ferry to the beach. Exactly a spot for tourist people, nice, clean, hundreds of shops. A very nice place to walk and surf (I am not a surfer), though with a country where beautiful beaches become uncountable, Manly beach suddenly falls out of the top list, in my view.

Work Work. Staying in Manly for work but too nice an area not to play a
bit.
So many great bars and restaurants.
Nice beach. Very nice and clean beach, enough space for everyone. Not much winds and lot of shops and cafes accross the road. You can also hire surf and skate boards from a shop located nearby.
A good place to relax. It’s a nice beach to swim at. The waves are just great for surfing. A good spot to also relax. Highly recommended...

beauty!. took the ferry to Manley, nice view during the trip.
very relax walking along the beach, pool next to the cliff, bravo!
love it.

Manly Beach - A Must See!. We just love catching the ferry from Circular Quay and cruising over to Manly. A hint - don't line up for your tickets at Wharf 3 you can buy them at any booth! Have lunch at Manly at one of the Pubs, we stopped at the Hotel Steyne and overlooked the beach - just lovely ! Food is average though. Enjoy a coffee at Criniti's as well and have a Canoli ! Enjoy Manly !

Manley. A family fun filled day out with a variety of shops and restaurants very close by. I took the ferry from Circular Quay which only took 30 minutes to get to Manley and only costing $17 (there and back). Manley is a lot less crowded than the famous Bondi Beach giving you a lot more to do. If you are into your sports (like me) then you can always run along the promenade, go surfing or even check out the volleyball nets that are allocated on the golden sandy beach of Manley.

Better option than the famous Bondi. Great beach well served with restaurants and shops. Easy walk from ferry drop off to main beach. Found the beach and promenade to be better served to cope with numbers than Bondi. Would definitely recommend to anoyone heading to Sydney and the surrounding areas.

Great Beach. A lot less crowded than Bondi and sheltered from the winds. Lovely walkway the length of the beach and volley ball courts along the back so you can watch them play. Benches to sit on and bars and restaurants in the area.
Manly. Second best beach in Sydney next to bondi. The beach is very clean with golden sand. Evenings get colder and windy.
Beautiful!. Can't skip Manly, it's definitely a highlight! A bit crowded but for good reason! Great swimming for everyone!

Great Beach!. One of the places that you must visit if you are in Sydney. Brought my kids there & they love it so much. You need to take a cruise to Manly but it is worth a visit. The beaches are great. Had fun with my kids there. A big thumbs up for this place!
nice and relaxing. go where the locals enjoy the beach, this has a nice layout and protection from the wind at one end. Very relaxed and no hassles beach.

Lived here for nearly 4 years; Excellent. lived the ocean front life for nearly 4 years and left in 2000; had a great time and have been back twice since. good bars and restaurants plus the beach of course

The ferry to Manly. I had no particular reason to go to Manly; I just wanted to take a ferry. The ride was fun and quick. I then had lunch at one of the many eateries. As it was a lovely day I sat outside on the deck, the only person to do so. Having put the waitress to the extra scrapping, I left her a tip. She came out, took the money and threw it at me, shouting obscenities. I threw the money back at her, called her a few choice words if my own, and left.

1/2 day trip. My wife and I visited Manly beach after being recommended by a friend.It's one of the nicest beach areas I have had the pleasure of visiting.The weather wasn't the best when we visited, but the beach was still busy. Lots of people walking along the beach front & catching waves.We had a beer & wine at the sea front with amazing views at a little cafe / pub.I really enjoyed the ambience of the area. Laid back attitude of the area.Ideal to sit back watching the world pass by.
Great beach. This was a really nice beach to swim at. It had very warm waters and lovely sand also. However, sharks do come and go so be wary of the shark siren sounding!
Loved it. Beautiful beach, easily accessed by ferry, which is a bonus, as you get to see some spectacular views on the way. Perfect for a day trip to chill, surf and for people watching

Life's a. It is a beach, it is in Manly, worth the ferry trip by the way, especially in stormy weather, a bit exciting. Cool suffer types and families messing around, as good as Bondi but without the cachet.

Better than Bondi. I went off season and it was crowded as heck! Don't think i'd enjoy it in the peak of summer.
We ate at the Pantry which had an excellent view, incredible food/cocktails although it was very pricy.

Great ferry trip. A beach lovers paradise, the ferry trip to get there gives a wonderful view of the harbour, on the day we went there were so many large yachts on the water. Some great walks along the coast from cenrtal Manly.
Love Manly. Take the ferry from Sydney Harbour and 30 minutes later you can be on Manly beach. Very popular with families. Lots of restaurants locally just a stones throw away.

Very nice place. It was my first visit to Manly. We walked along the beach on the scenic path, admiring the fantastic view. We did not get in the water but it was sad to see warning signs about pollution; some people did not seem to mind though and it was fun watching them swim from above. Back to the wharf, we had an ice cream at one of the cafe. Overall, an excellent day trip.
A great way to spend your afternoon. Surf boards are available to those who love to surf! Water very cold but a great location - lots of shops and ice cream parlours around. A lovely, lively beach

A surprise!. Manly Beach was not on my itinerary at all. Decided to ditch Watson's Bay and head to Manly Beach instead. This place surprised me. Firstly, there are rows of shops for the shopaholics. The beach was really clean and the weather was perfect. There were toilets available and quite frankly, a great place for families to bring their children to. Do try the scenic walk, you won't regret it.

Less busy, more low-key - makes it better than Bondi. I mean granted, Bondi is famous - but it's busy as all heck. Now I'm not saying that Manly is ever going to be deserted, any decent beach in Australia will be crowded with more bronzed Adonii and Adonettes' than you shake a pale limb at - but it's certainly quieter than many other places.It's sandy, good for surfing (check out Manly Surf School) and there's plenty of fro-yo places nearby. It's rare that a week goes by in my office that I don't wish I was on this beach.

A Heaven's Haven. Manly Beach, even for the avid solo traveller when it becomes the centre of your attention offers you the following highlights:1. Only a 35 minutes ferry ride away with a $7.50 ferry ride from Circular Quay and you’ll reach Manly Wharf in no time;2. A doorstep to the scenic Manly-Spit Bridge Walk at least 4 hours with secret beaches along the way to dive and dip;3. A haven for joggers, swimmers, fishing, snorkelers, beach volleyballs, etc; and 4. A café & restaurant paradise or order a take-away and heed off to Shelly Beach for R & R; and5. You can cycle Manly Beach and just quietly enjoy the sea breeze, the view, and nature.If you are a Hollywood fan, I am not, you could check out the Manly’s Cardinal Cerretti Memorial Chapel where Nicole Kidman and Keith Urban were married. Of course, many famous people have dined in Hugo’s restaurant at Manly Wharf like Jack Johnson, P Hilton, etc but then you would rather have a 5 star food service.For solo traveller like myself, I wouldn’t recommend an evening outing in Manly unless you are escorted by another fellow trusted traveller as the drinking culture can become almost like a New Year’s eve celebration without the fireworks but all the brawls.
Lovely!. Great clean sand and though it was too cold to swim there were some surfers out there. It's a nice walk along the beach and stop at the shops and grab some lunch.
Loved Loved Manly. We were there for the Jazz Festival just absolutely loved Manly We had a ball We had lunch at White Water Restaurant beautiful food We had views of the beach
The Best Beach in Sydney. Manly is great as there is so much to offer from the beaches, water sports, cuisine, natural marine park, hiking, cycling, live bands, etc etc . . . what's not to like?
GREAT BEACH. Absolutely beautiful beach. Patrolled by life savers. Very safe lovely views and close to a great variety of shops

Spend the day in Manly. I loved Manly! Get the ferry over and spend the day as there is lots to do! The ferry ride over is beautiful as you get to see other parts of Sydney and the view of the city is incrediable. The beach in Manly is stunning (better than Bondi IMO) there are shops, cafes and bars to fill up your day with.
Nice place. Had a lovely couple of hours at Manly. From the calm side to the short walk over to the waves. Food, shops, everything you need. Lovely day here
Average. small well mentained beach. nice water slide for children just next to it. Ok place to spend half a day. the wharf next to it is great.
My Favourite Beach. The beach is clean - long and beautiful - Very family friendly - want to surf, swim or just chill out its perfect. Nearby cafes and out door areas to enjoy lunch.

Nice Day out. Great shopping area down the mall and leading to the beach. The beach is not altogether swimmer friendly due to rough waves and undercurrent but good for surfing. Really nice place to sit outside and watch the world go by.
Great beach. We spent a few hours around the Manly area, and enjoyed Manly Beach. It seemed much quieter than Bondi, but it is not as iconic as Bondi. Great place to visit though.

Great day out.. On a recent visit to Sydney we caught the ferry for a day trip to Manly Beach coming from The Gold Coast we had high expectations an weren't disappointed was a lovely beach and a nice village feel to it with lots of eateries, markets etc etc well worth the trip a really nice day out abit cold to swim but good to see most who did swam between the flags.

Great beach. Manly Beach is another beach very popular with tourists. I found it not as busy as Bondi though. The ferry ride from Circular Quay to Manly is a scenic cruise through Sydney Harbour and past some of the islands and other beaches.

Nice place to spend a few hours. We took the ferry from Sydney Cove to Manly. Don't stay at the beach by the landing dock, rather, head across the street and down the promenade to the real beach. It reminded me a bit of Waikiki, with the shops, walking path, and beach. There's lots of shopping and restaurant choices, and plenty of benches by the beach to sit and relax. If you're into surfing, there's lots of local surfing and surf schools. Really place to spend the afternoon!

Nice Beach. We boarded a Ferry at Circular Quay which took only 20 min to Manly Beach.We used fast ferry`s which cost $ 9.00 one way pp. Directly at the ferry terminal are heaps of restaurants and Aldi, which was a nice surprise for us .Close by is a small Beach with a swimming area. It takes another 10 min by foot to the main beach, passing heaps of Restaurants and Shops.

Don't be confused by the beach at the pier - that's not it!. Took that fast ferry from Pier 6 ($18 Return, 18 minutes each way) which is a great sightseeing trip. Arrived at the pier and there are bars there (ate at The Bavarian Bar) with a beach either side which were ok but not 'wow'. It was only when I met a mate that he told me that the proper beach was the other side of the bay, a short walk through the town!When I got to the real beach it was excellent, great surf, clearly marked swimming areas and facilities, not the best beach in the world (Barbados?) but very good and well worth spending the day there.First 'official' day of summer so 28 degrees and burnt nose!

gorgeous. Super cheap ferry ($15 return) to get to Manly Beach and it is definitely worth it. It takes half an hour to get there, the beaches are gorgeous and were not too full when we were there (it was a Monday). There are plenty of places to eat and just walking around is great

Trees on beach, cozy walk through city center.. Unique town right on the beach. Loved the cozy walk through the city center that ends at the ocean with views of surfers riding the waves. Pull up to a restaurant with ocean front views and enjoy a beer.

Manly Beach in the winter. This beach is obviously very well known as our Ferry was full of tourists who seemed to know where they were going once we got off. We decided to follow them and they all ended up just sitting on the beach, even though it wasn't that warm. They obviously just go there to have a look at it, It is certainly a very nice beach and well worth the the in the Ferry to see it. The Ferry trip is very good and gives you good views of different parts of the Harbour.
Beautiful Beach!. Such a beautiful beach! A lot less crowded than Bondi with a more 'relaxed' and casual feel. Shops and bars near by and great cafe's on the main road

Better than Bondi.... This beach is great and I've always loved coming here. Doesn't seem to be as touristy as you have to actually commit and travel a bit of distance to get our here. Once here the beach is clean and uncrowded due to its great size. Lots of cafes and restaurants along the foreshore too.
World class. Manly is as good as any place you could go in the world. Amazing beach, great scenery, lots of restaurants and bars, a real vibe, easy to get to and value. I love Manly.

Better than Bondi. After a harbour cruise (aka Manly ferry), we got to Manly. The corso is a bit touristy but that expected. A fantastic beach, walked to Shelly beach and back and enjoyed the salty air and wonderful views. A few beers at the steyne hotel and another cruise back to the city. What a great day. Will have to spend a week or two there next time.

Another Iconic Beach. Unlike Bondi, Manly beach will let you have another perspective of the Aussie iconic beaches. You can enjoy a lazy afternoon on the turf and watch the surfing classes or just sip a cuppa or even enjoy the tasty fish and chips.
Love the Northern Beaches!. The food was quite good. The service throughout the entire experience was very friendly. The atmoshere was nice

Wow ... what a place. We spent the day here after taking the ferry from Sydney. Wow what a place. A fantastic picturesque beach which stretched for about a mile. Loads of cafes and restaurants on the beach front.

A brilliant day out at the beach. We had a lovely day out at Manly Beach. We caught a ferry from Circular Quay across the harbour. Beautiful experience with the kids. We had ice creams once we got to Manly. The beach was reasonably crowed, as it is very popular. There are steps going from the footpath down onto the sand. Lovely yellow sand beach. We would go back there for sure.
Long beach. Nice clean beach that you can take that nice long walk along with multiple coffee or beer stops the full length.

A great beach!. A great beach and while Bondi has the iconic name, you'll find that Manly beach is a clean and friendly place to go. Easy transport access and proximity to the beach and while parking on the beach is limited, there are a number of multi story council parking stations very close by. A great day out.

Nice place to spend the day. The ferry service to and fro circular Quay is very good and offers a spectacular view of the bay. There a many shops and restaurants at Manly. The beach itself is very nice and has a pedestrian and bycicle walkway that takes you over to the Sydney Harbour National Park.Be sure to taste some of the pastries from Criniti´s just off the ferry terminal.Before getting into the sea be sure to check with the locals since shark attacks have happened.

rough and smooth.. Sounds strange, but true. There are 2 sides to Manley beach. on the south side it's smooth, very inviting, warm. On the North side is the wonderful surfers beach, strong winds, bracing air and that long, long avenue of trees from one end of the beach to the other. BRILLIANT. There are also a multitude of diverse shops, restaurants and bars for those who don't like the beach.

Better than Bondi. Why is that tourists want to go to Bondi? Manly is far superior. Its longer, tree lined and has access to loads of great cafes and bars within a 30 second stroll. Bondi is soulless by comparison
Surfers paradise. This beach is a surfers paradise...take a ferry from circular q to recah here...it was raining when i went but i could see a lot of surfers around

Beautiful Beach to shop and just relax. We went to Manly beach twice! Their outdoor flea market is awesome. We spent a lot of money their but we bought a lot of jewelry that is hard to get in the US ( Thomas Sabo jewelry) Their prices there are more reasonable than Bondi beach.

Has everything. It's a beautiful long beach so you can enjoy the best of swimming and walking or just relaxing on the sands. The water while "refreshing" is now warm enough to swim. It is surrounded by many cafes and restaurants so you can enjoy it both day and night.

Hey scenery and walkways. I went yesterday which is spring time so it was not crowded at all. Very peaceful to be there and lovely weather. Did an 8km or so walk all along the beach until cabbage tree bay and it was lovely. Not challenging in the least but pleasant.

Excellent location for a short break away from the daily routine :). GREAT place to relax and laze the day away :) watch some attempts of surfing before lunch Excellent location for a short break away from the daily routine :)

Winter on Manly. We went to Manly beach in August when there were really cool temps. There was also a storm on the way but we were determined to go! We had heard a lot about Manly and knew it was only a quick ferry ride away.The beach is only a short walk from where the ferry docks. We walked on a pedestrian walkway lined with gift shops. Many of the prices were cheaper than stores we went into in Sydney. Once on Manly Beach, there are many restaurants overlooking the water. We got onto the sand and into the water just as it started to rain, but we enjoyed the view and just being there. I'm sure it is great in the spring and summer! I can imagine families there with children.

Fun for kids. Last Tuesday we took our three grandkids to Manly on the ferry from Circular Quay. It is such a pleasant journey over there, once you arrive there are plenty of shops to look in then a short walk to the beach itself which is patrolled and beautiful. The kids had fun hunting for crabs in the rock pools and the lovely walk around the headland. Fish & chips on the beach for lunch makes for a lovely day out.

Still Love It !!!!. After some 50 years, Manly is still my favourite beach. From the early days as a sunbaking teenager to now more as a walker and diner. Get the ferry from the city, it is such a lovely way to get to this beach. The huge Norfolk Island Pines that face the Pacific Ocean were planted in the 1880's and they are still so very special. They provide shelter and add to the atmosphere of the beach. If you head to the right it is South Steyne and a lovely walk along to Shelley Beach, the only west facing beach on Australia's East Coast. It is a pretty spot and very popular with families. In the middle of the beach is North Steyne and further along is Queenscliff. No matter which direction you take, there is plenty to do and see along the way.

Normal Beach. Nothing special on this beach. I am unsure if its because we visited it during Spring time where it was still cold, but the sand and the beach are just normal. Comparing it to Philippines' and Thailand's beaches, this is not extraordinary.

trmendous place to visit. from what i gathered there is a mutual dislike between the inhabitants of sydney and manly,well i like both placesduring the day of my visit the beach was clean and tidy and looked a fun place,with lots of places to eat and a great 2nd hand bookshopuse the ferry and have a great day out

If you are visiting Sydney, take a ferry over it's lovely. If you are visiting Sydney have a lovely day out and get on the ferry at Circular Quay and take the 35 min ferry ride over to Manly. Have lunch at the Manly Fish Cafe for great seafood, walk along the promenade and hop back on the ferry .A lovely day out and the ferry ride ( approx $12 each) provides a great way to see Sydney's divine Harbor.

Ferry ride best part. The ferry ride to Manly is a "must do" and affords wonderful views along the 30 or so minute ride. The town of Manly was pleasant but unremarkable and the beach, in my opinion, does not compare to Bondi Beach. Having done both, if I could only pick one to do over, I'd pick Bondi.

Feel Manly on Manly Beach. Manly spring is here so its time to hit the manly beach to enjoy the manly sun, sea and sand. Be manly at manly beach, so take off your manly shirt and enjoy the manly sea with a cooling swim. Play some manly volleyballs and build some manly sandcastle is a good way to spend a manly weekend. Lots of manly cafes along the manly beach for some manly meals. Remember to put on some manly sun tan lotions to get a beautifully manly tan.
Wow. That is nice. Wow jhfdycvnhfxvnhcfhnmjcdxcbnhcc bfdc ngxc. Bvfdxcbhgvnjkhvdycvbhtfcvnjjihggvbhgfdrgvn gvbnigsxvhuvf GB n h f DVD get v js

Beach Paradise. This is such a beautiful beach, the pictures don't do the sand, water and sky justice. The surrounding vendors are run of the mill but theres a clean accessible bathroom and plenty of sugary sand to sink your toes into. Well worth the ferry trip.

Promenade to your heart's content. Manly is the second best known beach in Sydney, maybe best known to the northern locals because is is a 1/2 hour ferry ride from the city. it's worth it if you are coming from that direction; the ferry ride itself is the best tour you can take, and a short stroll through the heart of Manly pedestrian mall brings you to the ocean beach. Walk south along the beach and you come to Shelly Beach, a small sheltered cove with a restaurant that offers calm water and a view along to the rest of Manly.
Manly it is.. just went here the other day, and the weather is just perfect. hang out with classmates and friends. nice beach.

An island beach. To get to manly you must take the ferry. It is not cheap but you should it. From the ferry you will have a great view of Sydney (look at the Opera !! ) and once in Manly, you will realise why its worth it.this is a small city with a beach. Has all a city has + a beach. Do I need to say more? I really liked this beach, though i wouldn't stay that long. Its more for families with children. For young people I would recommend Bondi Beach if you want to go to a beach during your stay at Sydney. Otherwise, just stay at the city which is really an incredible city.

Active yet peaceful. I couldn't do bondi beach and thus I am not in a position to compare manly and bondi. Talking of Manly alone, the beach was nice and very active with surfers training.I have been to several beautiful Asian beaches. Two things differentiate Manly :1. Green water in shores (which is not very often a case on Asian beaches - unless you go island hopping in Phuket)2. Professional surfing training on the beach. The action on the beach emitted a very youthful and energetic feel :)
Nice beach. I am not a big beach person and I also don't care for the crowds. If I were a surfer or a singles twenty-something this would be the best place to spend a day.

The beach refleshes you !. I can relax and have a good siesta on the beach . It''s nice to walk along the beach and have a cup of tea on the table beside the beach . Every time we have a beautiful weather brings me to the manly beach.
Manly. Just love Manly, walk from beach to beach via the shops :) Has great charm and the Ferry ride is just fabulous. Watched the surfers having a great time, good waves.

Great Beach.. We travelled out to Manly by ferry, a very enjoyable, relaxing and scenic journey. It was a really pleasant and sunny day so a trip to the beach was in order. The beach is a short walk through a street from the ferry terminal. The beach is actually outside the Harbour.It's a great place for a swim and we spent quite a time in the water. The atmosphere is quite relaxed and it's easy to feel at ease. There are free dressing rooms. Manly as a town has a village feel. Quaint and ordered in many ways with lots of nice restaurants to eat, snack or enjoy a cool drink in. We choose Crinittis near the ferry terminal. This was a lovely and perfect way to spend an afternoon.
Great Beach. It was too cold for us to swim, but we had a nice walk and a hot coffee. The view is great on an early spring morning.

So Manly. Nothing better then strolling along the beach during your lunch and taking in the view. The warm breeze wraps around your body and it's so comforting. It is the hot spot for surfing so take a couple hours and rent a surf board. Surf shops right across the path from the beach.. easy and convenient

Great Day Trip. A 20-30 minute ferry ride from circular quay and about a 5 minute walk to step on the sand. Second time here and we like this beach much better than Bondi. Bondi is more for the surfer or college aged crowd. Manly is more of a family, beach side community. Huge beach with only a 50 yard area allocated for swimming. Attentive lifeguards in this area. Had a great family summer day here.

Surfer's paradise. If you're looking for a place to learn how to surf - this is it. You have the chillaxed cafes next to surfer's shop. The whole beach and ocean is full of everything from beginners to experienced surfers. It's a good place to be if you're craving some waves.
Best beach in Australia. Top spot , suitable for all ages and start with Ferry trip from Circular Quay ,walk, swim, surf. eat sit in the sand , all possible and you can learn to surf..
Manly Beach. The trip to Manly Beach was fun and worth the trip. The shopping area and the beach are with the time spent.

Just as nice as Bondi Beach....but quieter. We took a boat over the Manly and were thrilled by the gorgeous beach. It was a pleasant surprise without all of the chaos of Bondi Beach. If you are looking for a, interesting small town and gorgeous beach without all the fuss, this is a great location.

Awesome. The beach is so beautiful and the cafes and restaurants are easy access and you don't need a car. Access to the city is only 30 minutes by ferry.The customer service is very friendly and very informative.
The Best. Brilliant beach side suburb with it all. From the Ferry trip across cheaper then a harbour cruise. So much to do that one must stay there.
felt like home. Manly felt like a home... quiet waves, beautiful sand, families all around... spent a great day there

Great access to a good surf beach. Where else in the world would you see people on a ferry either in suits to go to work in a major city carrying brief cases, next to surfers carrying surf boards. The beach is really good and has lots of places to sit and have drinks watching the action on the beach and in the surf.

So worth the ferry ride out here!. Loved the ferry ride over-- there is so much to do and see in Manly! Beach is a 5-min walk away, there is free wifi at the visitors center, lots of info, and they are very nice and helpful. Came here to see the Sealife exhibit, stayed for lunch and to walk around. Lovely restaurants, had a wonderful half day!

Fantastic to see the surfing with large waves. We walked along the boardwalk and watches the large waves coming in as it was a very windy day. It was fun seeing the board riders taking on the large waves and most were good riders

Cool as!. The restaurants, ice cream/coffe shops, the ferry, the people... Because I love it so much I moved to Manly few months ago and was amazing waking up everyday seeing how cool this spot is. Such a nice mood. Unmissable

Best Time To Go. Living in the western suburbs of Sydney, Manly is a great place for a day out. Best time to go is in November or February. Try and avoid the school holiday crowds in December/January.

An iconic place to grab some take away seafood & relax!. A nice relaxing walk, with great views, beautiful people and an iconic surfy beach. You could even spot some native dragons along the foreshore walk.

Fabulous Beach. I love going to Manly Beach. It can get a bit busy in summer and it is sometimes hard to find parking over busy weekends but the beach itself is fantastic as it has the sandy areas as well as the grass areas and plenty of places to eat.

Very relaxing place for holiday and visiting.. Some things may need to be updated for better see sighting. Colours around the place are little old fashion n boring. May need update the painting to feel current times. Make it more happier place.

Great food shame about the service. This is a must visit if you don't mind being treated by rude hosts. All the food is fresh however lots of fried food. Sushi, sashimi, gyoza, are all above average with the beef tough and chicken a little tasteless. A good local however for mine There are other options
BEACH. This is smaller than what I had anticipated, however had a fabulous time at Manley beach with our family
Awesome Beach. I love catching the ferry to this beach. Great view of the water, lots of shops and brilliant for swimming

An eyeful of Australian pulchritude. Sand, surf and fairly naked girls with good figures playing beach netball - what else can one say? Even the locals feel they are on holiday when they're at Manly...

Great boat trip. We took the ferry to Manley. Lots of opportunities for great photos. Manley itself was nice to walk around. We had delicious fish and chips for lunch. Recommend a visit if you are in Sydney.

MAN OH MAN. I love Manly wharf and beach. An icecream and walk along peir and beach is an unsurpassable Auzzie experience and then a stroll along the mall and the ferry back to circular quay. Way to go!
Worth the trip it's on the bucket list. We regularly drop into manly on our boat have lunch and a swim and relax in the sun plenty of clothing shops along the boulevards and many great buskers

Dont visit Sydney without seeing Manly. Manly is the jewel in the crown that is Sydney. Never fails to please no matter what the weather.So many great little restaurants and coffee shops and the standard is very high. Great spot for an ice cream or fish and chips on the promenade. If you like a walk, there are some great sight to be seen walking around Manly and surrounds. Catch the ferry either from or to Circular Quay and you will be delighted by the views. Manly is an eternal favourite for locals and visitors alike. Spend the day and you wont be disappointed. Spend a week and you will fall in love with the place.

Beach and surf. The beach is long so plenty of space, nice town and shops to visit, with amenities selling everything you need and or forgot...parking isn't easy or cheap so look around for the best parking deals, my advice is to park in covered parking back from the sea front as its cheaper. Take a look at The Manly Sebel to stay its fantastic location views and value.

Beautiful place!. One of my favorite places! It's a beautiful beach with many things going on. You can go sightseeing, take a walk on the Corso, eat fish and chips, drink a booze at Steyne or New Brighton Hotel... Everything at the same beach! Friendly atmosphere. Easy to get there and to fall in love! ❤️
Paradise. Beautiful manly with its relaxed vibe great beaches and gorgeous eateries! A must for tourists and locals! Everyone loves Manly!!!

MAGIC MANLY. As children from the country we stayed at Manly for our Christmas holidays. 50 years later the magic of Manly remains. We love nothing better than walking along the Corso from the Manly ferry wharf to the ocean beach, winter or summer. The beach walkway has showcased the beach even more and the Norfolk pines complement the beach setting with the waves rolling into the sand in the background. Manly beach just keeps getting better.

Great escape for a weekend. elegant , clean beach with white sand. lots of facilities are available. It is a great place to enjoy summer....even you can plan for a weekend trip and spend whole day there...!!

Beach break. Great place for an easy break. Lots of good places to eat and see. Great beach and easy to walk from end to end. Ferry into Circular Quay is a great way to see Sydney Harbour. Had a relaxing break.

swells. After an exhilarating ferry ride because of the big swells we enjoyed watching the surfers ride the big waves coming in to Manly Beach - a quiet break from the busy city and a lovely place to relax - also more shops and lovely seaside cafes and restaurants.

Super in summer. Manly beach is a great place to spend the day in the summer with its beautiful beach & plenty of casual & upmarket places to eatMake a even better day by catching the ferry or cat across the harbour
Manly. It is a beautiful there, winter or summer , enjoy a swim ,a meal and then wander round the shops before getting the ferry home

In winter, the shops are the best. Manly Beach, like most coastal areas, is best during the summer months. The day I visited, it had been raining. Only one surfer could be seen on the beach and a handful of people walking near the shoreline. Instead of a blue Australian sky, everything was grey - the ocean, the sky, the light. Manly had a long boardwalk from the beach to the Manly ferry terminal. Lots of shops, restaurants and cafes. It does seem a shame though to escape into those venues because of the weather. I would suggest that every tourist visiting Sydney takes the Circular Quay to Manly ferry ride (and return). It is a relaxing, economical way to see more of Sydney than just the city, traffic, shops and congestion.

Lovely Ferry trip from SYD harbor. It's an easy and nice trip taking the ferry from the Barbour to manly. You disembark the ferry and walk through the shopping street in about 5-10 min to the beach. The beach itself is very clean and very busy on weekends. Perfect 2-3 hours trip for visitors. Great combination of having 2 boat trips and a walk on the beach
Manly beach, Sydney. Great beach get Ferry from Sydney Harbour and a few minutes later you are on the beautiful Manly Beach. Best way to see Sydney Harbour Bridge, Opera House etc

BEAUTIFUL. Beautiful, clean beach with white sand. Lots of shops and restaurants. Pay parking.( $6/hour) We went in the August so it was pretty empty. Would love to go back to experience it in the Australian summer. I'm sure it would be even more amazing!

Forget Bondi, head to Manly!. Definitely a go for great views of the ocean & If you are adventurous to get to "North Head", you"ll catch a great view of the cliff & the city far away. There's also a heritage trail for those who are interested in the Australian military history. Do prep some light food & drinks as cafes are not available as you travel further in. Take note of the frequency & schedule of buses bringing you to "North Head".Picture-worthy!

Better than Bondi. I would go hear 10 times out of 10 over Bondi. Its a better beach and the main street has shopping and food right there. Skip Bondi and go to Manly. Hop in the ferry to get there as well and you have had a great day out.

Nice ferry from Sidney, but beach has little attraction. You only go to Manley because of the ferry from Sydneu harbour. Not a bad destination at all, and I recommend to do that at the end of the afternoon when the sun sets on the way back to Sydney. Manley is a small town, beach is attractive if you only stay in Sydney. Those that go up North will see much more attractive beaches

What a beach. Everyone talked about bondi beach before we went out there and although bondi was nice manly beach was just something else and the boys had a great time doing all the watersports was an excellent day just a shame we didn't have more time to spend here
Beautiful beach anf tons of shops.. Took the ferry here and enjoyed the beach along with the shops. There were tons of shops but it wasn't crowd and really got to enjoy everything it had to offer.

Loved this beach. A beautiful sandy beach with a lovely walk alongside. We saw Eastern Water Dragons up close, ate ice-cream and enjoyed the sunshine. The Ben and Jerrys store across the road was a welcome addition too!

Great beach. You can reach Manly beach from the ferry terminal in central sydney, takes you 15 minutes max. There are some nice restaurants along the beach and some shops to buy the necessary things. Its a nice long strech of beach. Wer were there for a lunch in one of the BBQ restaurants along the beach, which was good.

Lovely place for a coffee and a relaxing stroll. A trip to manly on the ferry from circular quay is a great way to spend a sunny day! The beach view is very scenic and there are plenty of cafes to enjoy a quick bite and coffee.

Best for relaxed beach-in time. This beach is not crowded as bondi beach. and is perfect for those who loves more space with loved ones, or for those who love little alone time. On summer this beach will be full of surfers, and we were there on august. and was not too crowded.

Lovely beach village. Manly is the sort of place most people would love to live if they were to stay for a year or more here. There is everything you could want, topped off with a beautiful beach with 'real sand' and tides that give you a challenge. As with most seaside resorts it is at its best during the Spring, Summer and Autumn. While a day trip is recommended it is probably best to take a direct ferry trip from Circular Quay - it is a third of the price you will pay for a 'organised packaged trip'. While I would recommend one of those 'trips', it is better to use it for some of the higher value trips. For example for 99 dollars you can get 1 + 2 venture/day trips. So better to not have a Manly journey included in this. But back to Manly. A really worthwhile visit and you can use it to bus around some other North Shore venues - Balmoral and Mosman. There are also as you will expect many nice restaurants and the food. for the most part, is good. A one way ticket will cost $7.50 per adult or $ 14 for a return.

Forget Bondi!. If you want to see the true Sydney, skip Bonding and take the ferry to Manly. While Bondi is full of (Kiwi) tourists and backpackers, Manly is a breath of fresh air with a more beautiful beach, excellent cafe scene and the ferry ride is worth it alone.

Glad we took the time...... Took the ferry from Sydney Harbor to the zoo and then on to Manly Beach for a walk on the beach and a quick bite. When you approach the landing there is a nice restaurant, spots to rent Bikes and a small beach front area. It is a couple of blocks to Manly beach from the ferry landing, but a straight shot so you really can't get lost. The walk gives you a chance to see a little more of the local area. Manly Beach is an expansive soft sanded beach with adequate facilities. The boardwalk area is a good size and we met a few interesting locals. The setting is very nice with stairs leading down to the beach and water. After seeing and walking a little of the beach we headed back via the Corso which is a nice plaza like area filled with shops and restaurants galore. It is a pricey area for the budget conscious and we were in a rush so grabbed a bite at the ferry terminal where the offerings were presented like a food court - edible and suited our needs. We wanted to make the ferry ( almost missed it but the ferry workers saw us and waited - thanks guys :-). Heading back to Sydney as the sun was setting was a great decision, the ride was beautiful with many wonderful photo opportunities. As the sun is going down the lights in the harbor are going on, just spectacular so swapping one evening meal for that sight was a good decision on our part for sure. We are often in locations with beautiful beaches but this one was worth the visit....

Manly versus Bondi. Manly is a great place for exercise ,food and family . You'll find a casual relaxed atmosphere with a clean and fresh feel . Beautiful beaches run into each other up the coast so don't stop here - Bondi has the view and an edgier feel but Manly has everything and generally a more safe and family feel to it.

Beware of the seagulls!. Beautiful beach and coastal walk. The beach and pathways were very clean. A few nice shops and the usual toursity tat! Delicious fish and chips but choose your picnic spot carefully and watch out for the seagulls- they are quite happy to steal your food from your hand! On our 2 visits here we were forunate enough to see whales just off the coast. Head up the coastal path onto the cliff top for even better views.
March in Sydney. Enjoyed every minute being on the streets and walking next to the beach...beautiful :)Ferry ride is very enjoyable.

Surfers' beach!. I reached Manly by ferries from Sydney. Manly is a very nice and touristic place. From the ferries wharf you can reach the beach walking along the Corso. It was a cloudy day and many surfers were in the ocean waiting for the right wave. After 30 minutes hearing the sound of the sea the waves arrived and it was really a show looking at them!

Tourist trap. As a Sydneysider I used to love coming to Manly Beach. Now it's over run by rude, pushy tourists and the food oitlets serve ok food at fabulous prices. Example: 2 scoop ice cream cone $7? Rip off.
Manly Beach. Beautiful beach, well kept park surrounds - well worth a visit. Good range of restaurants and shopping near-by.Cheers Niels and Mary, Humpty Doo, NT, Australia, Down Under
Good beach on the North Shore. Can travel by ferry or bus. Manly beach is worth seeing but not much else to do there. Very little shopping only the one street leading to the beach
Nice pristine beach. Soft sand beaches are clean and quiet on a winter weekday to stroll about admiring the surfers and picking shells. Did not brave the cold water which is pristinely clear.
Cold in winter. probably best visit in summer!!! it was fairly cold but nice to visit. would like to come back in a few months
Beautiful beach. I can't believe there is such a beautiful beach just minutes away from the hustle and bustle of the centre of Sydney!

Delightful morning swimming. Loads of old-world seaside charm.. Bondi and CoogeeBeach are fantastic beaches but they are busy, commercialised and highly regulated. A short ferry ride from Circular Quaystakes you to the smaller Manly Beach which is steeped in old world charm right from The Corso with the shops, cafe and Bavarian bier on the marina, to the beach which is safe, clean, with adequate picnic areas and facilities. We had a splendid morning swimming before heading back to the city
Great spot. When you go to Sydney, one must have a look and swin at Manly beach. Its great for surfing, relaxed atmoshpere and the place has a great vibe.A good way to relax and enjoy a Saturday

Great day and fab beach. We took the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly , which was a great start to our day, the dolphins followed us all the way there. Once we arrived at Manly, we had a short walk to through the town to the beach. We had a great meal overlooking the beach and them headed to the golden sands.All the beaches we visited in Oz have been spotless and Manly was no exception. The kids messed around in the surf as we chilled out on the sand. Life guards every 100 yards or so and walking up and down the beach.This beach felt a lot more swimmer friendly than Bondi.The day just flew by and a trip back on the ferry as the sun was starting to fade...... Beautiful!!

Manly beach. Nothing to dislike it was a lovely beach and the sand was clean and litter free.Preferred it to Bondi beach.It is a short ferry ride from Darling harbour and the ferries are fairly frequent too.
Just Glorious. Wow I've heard so much about Manly, it's so great, ferry ride was awesome the Manly Beach was so pretty those Pine trees are amazing too

You just had to be there. I have done this trip 4 pr 5 times now. I love the ferry ride across to Manly, and then taking a leisurely lunch on Manly Beach. Its just a quick walk from the Ferry Terminal. The beach is lovely and there are many great places to dine, suiting all budgets. A good family day out, or to catch up with friends.
Beautiful beach. Not as exciting as Bondi Beach, but definitely worth visiting. Beautiful hikes nearby. Restaurants everywhere, many of them clearly priced up for the tourist crowd.
Manly - best place in sydney. Manly is a great place to visit, live and experience!lovely beaches, nice pubs and restaurants. Perfect to sports as well!

Beautiful place. This beach was suggested to us whilst staying on Sydney and it was truly beautiful. With 2 small children (2&5) it's always handy to visit family friendly places and this didn't disappoint. The short ferry ride from circular quay to manly was great fun, reasonably priced and 20 minutes journey, with sites like the harbour bridge and the opera house right beside you it was a viewing delight. The beach was clean and beautiful with plenty of places to explore. We had a great day and I would suggest to anyone it's well worth a visit.

Fresh Air and Sunshine!. Rented a bicycle and toured around the beach area. Enjoyed the sun and some people watching. The beach wasn't packed but it was April after all. Still got the chance to see some people surfing (or trying to) and lots of other interesting sights!

cloudy day at manly. half sun and half cloudy so did not get the full beauty of this beach. we rented bikes to ride around the trail beside the beach and all the way to baby beach w/c my boys loved. still a nice day out and of course the ferry ride out is worth it.
Great Beach. We found Manly Beach to be not as busy as Bondi Beach and for that reason I am giving it a 5 star. Plenty of things to do, attractions, facilities. Great beach.

My favourite beach.. Manly beach has got everything you could ever want. The surf is great fun for all the family and the life guards make it safe for children. The cafe culture, bars and restaurants make this a great place to be.
Get on the ferry and go. Manly has everything. Beautiful beaches , snorkeling, seawall walk. So many restaurants and cafes. Nice ferry ride over from Sydney.

Fantastic Day Out!. Miles of white sand.... enjoyed sun-bathing, swimming, ice cream :)Lots of activities and good food joints. Parking can be a bit difficult to find near the beach. But, fantastic time with family!
Best beach in Sydney. Heaps to do here. Cool walks, swimming is great, ace bars, and very scenic. A great spot and the ferry trip is all part of the experience. Do this once in your life.

Beautiful!. We had a family holiday in Sydney and took in Manly Beach via the ferry. We were blown away by the sand and the beauty of Manly. It blew the beaches in New Calendonia away!! Lucky Sydneysiders.

Tourist Mecca has something for everyone. This beach caters for locals and tourists alike. The tourists tend to gather at the end of the Corso but there is a lovely promenade spanning both north and south where you can wander and find your own space.Got north to watch beach volleyball and surfers, or south to the surf club and patrolled swimming areas.Definitely worth a visit.

Chilled....... Even on a chilled winter day this was a cool place to be! Walked the walk......didn't quite surf the surf.....but enjoyed the day all the same....in the heat of the summer I can imagine this is one awesome beach!

Amazing place - take the ferry. Worth visiting when in Sydney. Take the ferry from circular quay. Amazing boat trip and then a short walk to an amazing beach. Totally different to Sydney city centre. Surfers galore. So worth the trip.

Old Worl Charm. Manly is a friendly Seaside Town that hasn't lost it;s charm & character ... Amazing Sea front with lots of lovely bars & bistros for all budgets .. We visited in Australia's Winter which was nice and Warm for us Brits & the place wasn't busy however, I imagine in the Summer months it would be very busy but we loved it

Got the ferry here.. Went to Manly for lunch and a bit of a dip in the ocean . The beach is very clean and it is right at the shopping centre. The ferry ride down the waterway is relaxing and a good way to see Sydney.

beautiful beach even in winter. This is well worth a day trip. We went in winter but the sand was still warm on our toes. It's a very large beach that our four year old could have stayed and played all day.
Great spot in Manly in a walking distance.. Highly tourist attraction with funky cafes and a multitude of diversity. And it seems to happen throughout the year. May 2014

A beauty!. Manly is a beautiful seaside area! Only a short ferry ride from the harbour. We really enjoyed walking along the beach on a very sunny afternoon. There are many things to do in the area.The beach-side artists were amazing as well. The beach was clean and well maintained! Would love to go there again some day.

One of the Best Beaches in Sydney. In my opinion this beach in Sydney's north is much preferred to Bondi. It has about 2kms of white sand and surf, a wonderful 2.5-3 km walk from the Queenscliff end around to Shelly beach, and all the shops you need from clothes to food. Fantastic restaurants. Not always easy to get a park so a great idea to catch the ferry across from the city.

Just the start of many great northern beaches. Bondi is the only place for tourists. Please ALL go there. But Manly is well placed with the most pubs, most eateries, more coffee shops than you can possibly get to, organised entertainment outlets. For transport it has ferry's to the city and buses regularly arrive, depart to various locations. Great scenic views from North Head catch the 135 bus at Stand J Manly Wharf. Manly Beach is world famous and well patrolled. Lots to please the eye as well. Parking can be limited. It has backpacker accommodation.

Manly Boutique Hotel. We recently attended a wedding in Manly and stayed at the Manly Boutique Hotel,we stayed in a family suite which had 2 Queen beds 1 single with a pull out bed under the single,kitchen/dinning area 2 lounges with tv/video also had a huge bathroom with very large spa bath & huge shower.The outside area outside our room had a loverly court yard with table and chairs it was very quiet and a great spot to stay only a short walk to the beach,shops,ferries.
Pantry Kitchen in Manly - fantastic!. Can't get any closer to the beach for café. If you like great eggs bene with fantastic service and the best views - this is for you. Its busy so be patient.

Best beach. This is a great long beach for young and old with some top surfing spots. Its a clean beach also, much nicer than Bondi. Plenty of sidewalk cafes, restaurants, pubs and shops to suit anyone. The Corso is a wonderful car free street linking the beach to Manly Wharf ( ferries to the city) for quick access.
Manly definitely awesome!. Manly is a great introduction to Australia. The friendliest people you'd ever want to meet and enoughchoice of drink, food and entertainment to keep the Davies clan happy.
Beautiful. Took the ferry, very easy, out to Manly Beach. Lovely beach, great sea life sanctuary. Little penguins were absolutely adorable. Wonderful rescued turtles!

Great family friendly beach. Manly Beach is a great beach just minutes from downtown Sydney. The beach is nice, wide, and family friendly. Just off the beach is a great shopping & dining area with something for everyone. A must see.

If you only have time for one ferry trip, make this the one. A beautiful ferry ride ends at a beach community 30 minutes later. Pretty cool. Not only that, but there was a surfing competition going on that day unbeknownst to us. Even cooler. A wonderful way to spend the afternoon.

Day out at Manly. Living in Sydney Manly is just a car ride away for us. But whether you live locally or want a short stay Manly is a lovely place to visit and has something for everyone. There is a lively concourse containing lots of shopping and souvenir places and cafes and restuarnats to choose from. Sunday is particularly fun because there are heaps of interesting stalls selling many handmade items of jewellery, leather goods and the like.For beachgoers the front is just perfect with a sweeping patrolled area and lovely views. There is a wonderful walk around from the beach to the smaller Fairy Meadow with a few shops and cafes along the way and you can enjoy spotting the wonderful bearded dragon lizards along the way and also the small bronze items of artwork which have been cleverly embedded in the rocks along the way. Well worth a visit. Accessible by ferry from Sydney.

Paradise. What a beautiful day trip from Sydney...catch a ferry from circular quay, wander up the corso to surf beach, enjoy coastal walk to Shelley beach for lunch.Manly beach is iconic Put it on your bucket list.

took mom to manly. had a chance to parooze around the beaches and had a chance to take my mom to manly. what a lot of fun!! the beach is nice. i personally like Bondi much better but manly is nice. the beach appeared to be extra crowded. we had a chance to walk around and take in the sites. the weather was a bit cold. it was july. we then had a chance to walk around the restaurant and the stores. lots of surfing stores as you would think. very fun.

Gorgeous views, plenty to do. Winter or summer, always worth a visit. From swimming, relaxing, taking surf lessons or riding scooters and bikes on the promenade. Parking is easier in winter than in summer though if you arrive early it is very easy. Lots of places to eat and get snacks. The views are beautiful and kids can be kept busy for hours with various playgrounds along the promenade. Weekend markets are always interesting. Great for people watching and dog walking as well. There is also the Manly Waterworks in huge summer.

Much prettier than Bondi. A ferry trip from Circular Quay takes you to Manly and a short walk through a varied shopping area to Manly Beach. We found the whole area to be clean and pleasant offering a good variety of places to snack or take a full meal. The beach is clean with pleasant views and nice gentle walks.

Sydney's Best Kept Secret. It has the harbour, the beach, the book stores, the markets, beautiful walks by the beach and around the rocks.Manly has the best of Australia with a little touch of all the things you like about the 'seaside' (for all the UK, Ireland visitors).

The beach goes on forever. We keep returning to Manly for the pleasure of walking along the beach and simply soaking in the sea and atmosphere. Plenty of places to eat around the place. Found a municipal car park one block behind the beach which solved the parking problem and which was quite reasonable. Many people buy take aways and eat them on the wall next to the beach, but beware of seagulls who will snatch a meal in the blink of an eye!

Manly Beach. One of SYdneys biggest beaches. A nice trail to familiarize yourself with the beach. It extends quite far and the views are excellent. Swimming here, highly recommended. Weather was very nice at the time. Stayed there for a day.

A must to see, great beach, good accomodation, fantastic atmosphere.. Even though I live in Sydney, I never tire of visiting Manly. It's a beautiful trip on the Manly ferry, a lovely drive or a scenic bus trip.Manly has a fantastic beach, and a lot of shops to peruse. Great pubs with great atmosphere too. The pubs are close to the beach, only across the road, and they serve reasonable food too.There are many places to eat along the corso, so you might choose to try one of the $15 meals sitting under the umbrellas or in an enclosed area. Alternatively grab some fish and chips or a kebab or just a coffee and one of the take away eateries. Can recommend them all haha.Take a stroll along the beachfront to Shelley Beach for a swim or snorkel...great photo opportunity as well.A cheap day out in Sydney to be had by all. If you are driving there is paid parking but also free parking too...which allows you a couple of hours to soak up the atmosphere. Promise you will enjoy it :)

Better than Bondi!. Manly beach is one of the best main beaches in Sydney and better than Bondi! Lots of nice bars and cafés around the beach is normally busy in summer but you can still get a good spot. A good place to chill out go for a swim and spend a sunny day!
