A beautiful tree lined beach!. We took the ferry to Manly Beach and fell in love with the place. It is so clean and the main street is a pedestrian walkway with many shops lining it. The beach itself was wide, clean and lined with Australian Pines. There were surfers enjoying the waves and families strolling the boardwalk. We had breakfast at a small hotel bar overlooking the water. It was a great place to spend the day although we were not able to. If we lived in Australia, we would live here!

Nothing special. Manly Beach is very famous, but I'm not really sure why. It's just another beach, surrounded by over-priced shops and cafes. The ferry ride to get here from Circular Quay is nice but I found Manly itself to be a bit lacking.
VERY PLEASANT BEACH. Great beach, convenient thanks to ferry, lots of pines, surf school, lots of waves, many shops in Manly.

A beautiful place. We were recommended to take ferry from Circular Quay to Manly. The ferry ride was very fun and Manly was very pretty but perhaps for us it was too much walking on a very windy day. Also we went on a weekend which seemed very crowded. If you time your trip better then we did then I,m sure Manly would be even more beautiful with less people.

Never disappoints.. Even on a cold winters day manly beach with its iconic Norfolk Island pines is perfect to stroll down. You can do this either on the promenarde or if your brave down on the sand with your shoes off enjoying the waves. Catch the ferry from circular quay and walk through the corso to enjoy the beach.

Beautiful place to be explored!. We took a ferry from Circular Quay to Manly Wharf, and the sights of the Sydney Opera House, the Harbour Bridge and cliffs along the way were nice. We rented bicycles and cycled along Manly Beach, which is a very long stretch of clean sand, deep blue waters and fresh Spring air. Apart from Manly Beach, there are other smaller beaches/coves/lagoons with pristine waters which are worth exploring! There were four cycling routes we could take, each leading to lookouts with gorgeous views (I am sure), but we only had time for one route, which we took to Manly Beach. I'll be sure to spend more time in Manly on my next visit! It's a place with activities available for the whole family - lots of cafes, restaurants, shops and more. In all, Manly is a great laid back place that spells (and smells like) "WEEKEND"! :)

Hotties!. This is a great place to hangout on New Years!Everyone is so amped up about the fireworks, that the beach becomes total chill! We ended up bringing beers and ciders, night surfing!Wicked spot!

A taste of Home and Away!. What a great beach, typically Sydney. Rolling waves, surfers every where, beach volley ball, populated by tanned locals and tourists, its like a scene from that TV program, love it. (Wheres Alf)
Family friendly. Easy access from Sydney by ferry or car. Great place for families who like to spend a day at the beach.
Great spot, great beach. We have lived in the area for many years. We simply love it here! One of my favourite spots in the world.
Family friendly. Although it's fairly far out from Sydney, it's easy to get a boat from the harbour or a bus. Great day in Manly & lovely golden beach with interesting wildlife including parrots.

A must go to. Must see when you are in sydney!! Beautiful beach of Manly is something you must enjoy whilst you have a free day to relax.Loads of restaurants, bars and shops, you will always find something to do.

The best beach in the world!. Manly has got everything on offer. It is easily accessed by ferry, bus or car. There is lots to do here - from the shop to the beach volleyball nets, that are free to use! Not to mention the amazing restaurants and cafe around.
Plenty to do. Excellent day out. Plenty to see and do. Enjoy a surf or paddle board (available for hire), plenty of shopping and eating options. Beautiful place.

Beautiful every day. Manly beach is a must see top sight when visiting Sydney. Don't bother with Bondi unless you really must ride a wave. Manly has a beautiful community, excellent little town and beautiful restaurants cafés and bars. Eat at Bluewater for sure.

Nice seaside suburb. We took a trip across to Manly after going to the opera house and the zoo, so we were already quite tired. However, it was a nice place for a walk,. There was a good selection of shops and the subway at the ferry station served a decent sandwich.
Well worth a visit for a wander.
Great place to visit.. Busy and bustling.Lots of great places to eat.Markets on the weekend worth a look. Lovely walk to Shelley Beach.

Laid Back Beach Vibe. Manly was a nice way to spend a Sunday afternoon. It is a small beach town with little shops and restaurants. Felt a lot like the beach towns in Southern California (Manhattan Beach). Have a little walk after brekky or lunch on the path and look for sign to the car park, cross it and you see a not-well-marked trail up the cliffs. Be sure you're in suitable shoes for this - there are more than a few places you 'scramble.' At top you've a clear view of nothing but ocean. It's a great stop for the views and quiet relaxation. Very enjoyable day!

Our day out in Manly Beach. It was April when we went to Manly Beach and when we arrived , it was a bit windy and not warm enough to stay on the beach for long. However it was very sunny and we decided to hire bicycles and we had an amazing day. The guy in the shop told us a route to take and we had the most amazing views right across to Sydney Bridge and the Opera House. We cycled by little coves with lovely little cafes and they were sheltered from the wind so very pleasant. When we left back our bicycles we went shopping in the main shopping strip facing the beach and it was lovely. We finished our day with takeaway fish and chips and ate them on the wall outside. A great finish to a fabulous day
Fun in the sun. lovely boat ride out to Manly. great little shops. lovely beach with heaps of people, even at this time of year!! Would be the place to be in summer!!
Surf's up. Glorious by day, and spectacular under the stars of night. The city skyline is equally impressive on a sunny day or colorfully lit up at night.
Bellissimo!!. I came here on business for the second time and the feeling you get is always great!! Love this pleace

Manly Beach = Paradise. I have been living in Manly for a month now and I can say that I am living in the paradise! Beatiful beach, really clean, perfect for outdoor activities such as: running, biking, surfing. It also has great restaurants and pubs.

Beautiful town. Had a walk around the mall some good surf shops
Walked to beach was a beautiful day
Had drinks waiting for ferry

Beautiful . We almost didn't go to manly beach because it was a little out of the way and time was running short. It had been recommended by a friend, so we decided to do it anyway and I'm so glad we did! We had seen many beaches in Australia, but this one was definitely unique. We hit the beach right at sunset and the waves were so beautiful and calming. The beach wasn't as crowded as I'd expected. So glad we went!

Good place to learn to surf for beginners. This is an excellent beach to learn how to surf on. There are sometimes huge waves, so make sure you know your own capabilities. There are a few rip-tides, but these are clearly marked - keep a watch out. If you feel yourself being pulled out, don't panic and try to swim back to shore, instead swim parallel to the beach - you'll soon be out of the rip and be able to head to shore without tiring yourself out.If surfing isn't your thing, there are volleyball courts and other beach activities available, plus lots of shops, bars and restaurants nearby.
Lovely family beach. Its great because of restaurants and lifeguards on duty. White sand which I always like and safe for your kids to go off and explore
Quaint. A buzzing little town with shops, cafes, bars and the beach. The surf is strong and the surfers many.Its lovely to just sit and watch.Great promenade
Want to live here. Great shopping, lovely promenade to walk along watching surfers and waves. Lots of places to stay and to eat although we only sampled a couple of cafes the standard was good.

Tourist's must see. Amazing beach, lots of surfers & most stuff available cheap. The best thing is the view just before reaching the beach when one travels by a cruise. The aquarium on the beach is a good place to visit especially with children. Samosa is available in a small cafe outside the aquarium.

Beautiful beach town!. Beautiful beach town to visit! I love that manly gives off a more local vibe compared to bondi beach which focuses more on the touristic attractions. The town has a lot of wonderful restaurants , cafes, and scenic walking trails to check out! i would definitely recommend coming with family or friends!
Great fish and chips!. Manly is so fun to ride the ferry over to, explore the town, and grab fish and chips to eat on the beach. Beware the seagulls who love them too!

Beautiful beach and great ferry ride!. If you are vacationing in Sydney make the time to take a ferry from Circular Quay to Manly. The ferry ride (a bargain at only around $15 round trip) is like a tour of the harbour! We rode out at sunset and back in at night. Some of my best photos of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge are from this ferry. Once in Manly don't stop at the little beach you first see. Walk up the courso to the main beach. There is a great pub with 2nd story seating on the main road. Stop for a beer and relax in this great spot!

The day I met Will & Kate. On the hottest day of our trip we went to Manly beach. They had a display of the Nippers, the young lifesavers. It was a super display topped off by meeting Will & Kate. You don't really expect to go to the other side of the world to meet the royals but they were lovely.Manly beach was clean, not sure if that was due just to the above, and safe. Lots of great places to eat and shop, one of the best beaches I have visited.
Nice for a Sunday stroll. Lovely afternoon stroll and loads of restaurants on the prom from afternoon tea, watching the amateur surfers learning the ropes

great beach. I found this beach much better than Bondi beach. The bars have a great view on to the beach. and there is a board walk if you dont want to get sand in your shoes but want to enjoy the view.
amazing beach. I visited this beach while on holiday in Sydney. The beach is over three kms long. The south side is my favorite as your next to the coffee shops and restaurants.Go all year round.

Posh, Maybe. It's kept clean despite the numbers of tourists and locals alike who crowd in here on the weekend. Of course, Manly is a wealthy area, and the class of an area generally determines the level of public services it receives. Go here. It is lovely.

A Small Hidden Gem. A beautiful beach that contributes to Manly's reputation as a popular waterfront suburb. This public beach was well populated but it did not appear crowded. Trees line the sidewalks of the beach and offered shade and shelter from the sun which was a definite plus.
Great location. Nice to rent bikes and ride along the beach. If you can plan a surf lesson. It's great! Lunch at the Three Beans is wonderful (the clubsandwich).

Make sure you take the ferry across for a sensational day!. Manly is a beautiful part of Sydney and has a gorgeous beach as well as having so many options for accommodation as well as restaurants. We didn't want to leave!

Cycling in Manly. We hired bicycles to ride around Manly and it became on of the highlight of my trips to Sydney. Only 20 minutes' ferry away for Circular Quay. Do cycle up to North Head, it took me 4 hours (supposingly 20 minutes if I cycled the right director) to cycle up to North Head, but the view took my breathe away. It's magnificent I must say :)

One of my top 5 beaches. Love this beach, its so alive with a variety of people, who are all having fun. People of all ages come here from the elderly to little kids. A great place to have a walk along.The sand is beautiful and the waves are good, lots of people are always surfing here, but never to the point where it is overly crowded (from what I have seen). Filtered water fountains are an awesome touch for when you are out walking or exercising. Kids playgrounds entertain the little ones. Just a really nice scenic beach which is family friendly with lots going on.

Manly Beach = Heaven. Manly beach is such a great beach to go to. There are so many great pubs, cafes and restaurants.
Even go for a walk to the right of Manly and follow the walk way to shelley beach which has some great snorkelling. That whole area is now a wildlife sanctuary so you can imagine all the fish around the area.

Manly Beach. Make It YOUR Memory too!. I've been lucky to grow up near Manly and Manly Beach is indelibly part of my memories. Make Manly Beach one of yours when you visit Australia. It's a wonderful expanse of a gentle arc with waves for the surfers and sand for the sandcastle makers. A delight to be whether winter or summer. Enjoy the view and all to do.

15 minute of ferry, the best surfer beach in town. Out of the city, but so close. And full of surfers, all day long, every single day. Worth a visit, using the fast ferry from Circular Quay to Manly (the best way to see the harbor).
A place to live. If I was ever to live in Aussie this would be the place to be. It is beautiful. Everything about the place is superb
Great view from ferry trip. Fish n chips on the beach !! . Bondi beach is nicer but the ferry trip to Manly is a great way to see the Harbour & homes that grace it.

Very Nice Beach - Great Town Area. Manly Beach is easily accessible from the Circular Quay Ferry's that service this town, or is a short drive from Sydney. We chose to utilize the Ferry for convenience, and it is only a 2-3 block walk from the Wharf to the beach.The great thing about the beach is that is very very long - and it during the winter months it is hardly crowded. I would imagine during peak surfing times, that this area could get quite busy.Life guards are around certain areas of the beach, especially down near their building (Southern portion). The beach is a nice soft sand, and extremely picturesque. Water fountains, filtered water filling stations, benches, volley ball nets, and even some small shelters line the beach. There is a boardwalk area lined with the native trees. There is a big effort to increase the population of the trees.There are many restaurants and hotels just across the street. The main concentration of food/shopping is right down near the South End.The only thing that was worrisome is that there are warnings about swimming after a rain (24 hours), and there are large pipes going out into the water. I am assuming that these are for drainage of the town, and that is why there is the 24 hour warning.Wish we would of stayed here a couple of nights instead of just visiting.
Nice surfing. Lots of surfers even on a winter rainy day. Don't miss the Manly coastal walk (2 hrs) starting from the Manly beach.

was very relaxing but very windy. the fresh air and freedom after the busy shopping frenzy we had been on it is a place you can sit and relax or go to a nearby bar or coffee shop such as the Manly Pantry and sip coffee or a drink while watching the ocean
Beautiful Manly. Great place with great places to eat, drink and people watch. Also really convenient to get to by bus or ferry.
Lovely. Great place to visit, easy walk along the esplanade and lots too look at. Alway lots of people on the beach no matter the season

Great place to spend the day. It is hard to believe you are so close to Sydney in this peaceful seaside village. Both the harbour and the seaside are beautiful and relaxing. If you have a day to go there, take a step out of the city and enjoy. The ferry to Manly also offers great views of the opera, so have your camera ready!
Relaxation. Caught the ferry and sat on the beach with an icecream before going for a walk on the beach. Wonderfully relaxing.

A nice (but crowded) getaway. Manly is great for some fresh air, watching surfers while eating a burger seaside. The beach is not too spectacular, and beware on going during the winter months, as the weather can shift quickly.We ended up in a line stretching several hundred meters when going back home on the ferry due to bad weather, where people got really frustrated and pushy. The people working there had to do crowd control to avoid riots.
Good. Great patrolled beach quite clean but very busy. A great area but be ready for a bit of a crowd. Fantasic view from the beach looking round the land.

fab boat trip & beach.... I really enjoyed taking the ferry boat out to Manly...it was a great half an hour chill out..with fab views...then arriving at Manly with all its shops & bars...was cool..but i really liked the beautiful beach!
Beautiful place. So clean. Love the eateries nearby along with great shops. Always drawn to manly when in Sydney So easy to get to by ferry.
sunshine and seagulls. Lovelly beach the sun was shining but the seagulls were a nusiencewe spent sometime sitting watching the people on the beavh in the sun.
Good day trip. Good environment.. wonderful sights. ..perfect destiny to spend all day long in the sand or enjoying the stores and restaurants around the beach. .

Inviting place and good to spend time. Good environment and view sights. The beach in Manly is really relaxing and the city is inviting. Nice afternoon and a good way to spend time with family and friends

Fabulous!. I could live here it is so nice, even in the rain. The beach is gorgeous and the restaurants and cafés great. Only a 40 minute ferry ride from Sydney Circular Quay with one of the best views of the Bridge and the Opera House on the way there and back. What more could you want?

Bikes at Manly. Two of us hired a bike from a shop close to the ferry. We took them up into the park beyond the hospital. The weather was very wet but we stopped for a drink in the cafe near on the headland. It was excellent. On a dry day this would be fantastic. Views look over the harbour entrance. Beautiful. We then took thebikes to ths beack. The rain stopped and the suncame out. Manly beach was beautiful. The water looked great and the sands looked inviting. It was a bit difficult cycling along the path because there were heaps of people. But the views and atmospheere were good. We then took the beach along the harbour for a way but the road was hilly and not that exciting. We had to bike along the road rather than the walk path near the waters edge. We returned the bikes and stopped for a drink at the ferry terminal. A good way to spend a damp day.

Love it. Love the ferry trip over to Manly every time we visit Sydney we do this trip. The beach is a lovely area to just sit and watch the passing parade, enjoy the street performers in the mall and have a meal at one of the many eating places.

A walk along the broad walk. Never get tired of walking along Manly's broad walk and shopping corso. Spend the day browsing and do the Manly to The Spit walk which is easy but well worth doing. Catch a bus back to Manly if you like. Lots fish and chip shops to take away and and sit admiring the sea view
Who needs whale watching trip when we watched from a lookout.. We watched a pod of whales for almost an hour from the North Head Lookout. It was very windy so bring a jacket.

Nice time in Manly. We took the Manly fast ferry from Harbor pier and had a family discount offer. Manly beach is a short 2 minute walk from wharf. Though it was June(winter), weather was very nice and we had a nice picnic on the beach.

manly a families best beach. Manly is a great place to take your family a beach village atmosphere great attractions under water world, movies, markets,and great cafes and restaurants and the beach life guards on duty clean sand and clear water beautiful !

Very clean, gorgeous beach!. I love the vibe that you get, it makes you feel like one of the locals. The beach is gorgeous and always very clean, there is tons of activities to do and you will never be bored.

Beautiful. This is an amazing place to be, beaches all around and a must for backpackers. There are some good restaurants around as well. It's a beautiful place to walk around as well as swim in the sea.

Magnificent Manly. This is definitely a full day visit. Two beaches linked by the Corso which is full of shops, great selection of cafés and eateries. Beaches are exceptionally clean, great area for walking, cycling jogging etc along the main beach. Always surfers around to watch. Manly has a vibrant feel about it - it just buzzes. Regular ferry service to Circular Quay. Remember cameras and beach towel. Bondi is boring in comparison. I just love this place and feel certain that you will not be disappointed.

Manly beach (Feb 2013). We took the Manly ferry from Sydney harbour, the beach was just out of this world, it look so peaceful and hardly used. All the flags were flying, and the walk to the beach from the ferry was great, everything was far cheaper then in Sydney, so if you want to buy anything wait till you get here.
Stunning!. It is really hard to find a public beach like Manly anywhere in the world. The color of the water is unbeatable!
Lovely Beach. Spent a great day with family and friends on the beach. Water a bit chilly. Spent the day and got some takeaway from a nearby cafe.

World class. A fantastic ferry ride across to Manly from Circular Quay, the ferry terminal is full of eating places and you really need to have an Ice Cream here!! I loved the beachfront, so clean and inviting, and the weather was perfect, would certainly recommend it for a fantastic day out.

Manly Magic. We enjoyed a day at Manly, an ideal place for families and singles. Beautiful cafes and bars close to the beach. We took the ferry across a novelty for Melbournians, All we needed was a sun, a camera, comfortable shoes, a good appetite and a sense of fun. You could make your trip dear or cheap as you like. We opted for a lunch of chips and simple fare, a glass of wine and total relaxation at a large café/bar opposite the beach. We played on the beach, made sand castles and ate ice creams. What more in life could you want?

Beautiful and Peaceful. It is so serene with clean beach and with many interesting restaurants to choose from. We found it really wonderful and the walk from the Ferry dock to the beach and through the town was interesting.

Sun, sand and surf. The clean sand and hype of Manly beach is a must when we visit Sydney. A short stroll across the road from the beach and you can find some great little cafés and shops. Nice atmosphere.

Fun-Exploring. Had an Excellent Day at Manly... Traveled from Newcastle by Train to Sydney Central Station. Then onto Circular Key-Caught Ferry to Manly- Wowee what a Great Day Experience- Lunch was Perfect, Dining opposite the Beach Beautiful- Grabbed an Indulgent Icecream in a Cone & off for a Magnificent Stroll along the Manly Beach Promenade. Super Great Day Perfect Weather-Fabulous Food & Stunning Shops Tip Top Day.
Lovely beach community. Always amazes me that a beach community like this exists in a big city like sydney. It's a great area with a lot of food and drink on offer.. recommended.

Cold day didn't help. Our visit to the Beach probably wasn't helped by the low temperatures and cold winds. But it was easy to see why this stretch of sand has achieved iconic status. Clear blue water breaking onto "manicured" sand with a backdrop of tall pines. Impressive.

Clean and Beautiful. Great beach for swimming, sunning, strolling and running. I used the walkways right next to the beach for a few runs in the morning while traveling. (it is a 2 mile each way run from one side to the other - 4 mile roundtrip) The walkways are busy on the weekends if you don't go out early and you will find yourself surrounded by runners and swimmers, but in a good way - not too busy.

A Dream Vacation Place. We enjoyed our ride on a ferry from Circular Quay to Manly Beach. Huge crowd awaits us waiting for the ferry but we're impressed by the system of boarding, and the attitude of passengers to go with the smooth flow. We enjoyed the sights of Sydney and haven't experience any turbulence except maybe 2-minutes near the gateway to open sea. Together with our host family, we enjoyed walking around the crowded beach composed mostly by families. There's not much of benches to rest but anyway we're expected to be at the beach and the small restaurants/bars. It's a small village with all the amenities; potable tap water, decent restrooms, convenience stores, souvenir shops, variety of food joints, and pedestrian lanes with traffic lights. We enjoyed our meal of burger and fries but have to wait for 30 minutes for our order because of so many customers (sorry not to remember the name) chatting while sitting in a bench, and to cap our day with gelato before we ride the ferry back to the city. What a day to spend, relaxing in the company of different nationalities; indeed, a very nice world to live.
You can keep Bondi. Much better than overated Bondi Manly had much more going for it shops restaurants etc right next door

My husband last visited in 1963. My husband had told me how beautiful Manley Beach was in 1963, so although it took him 51 years to save up to take me, it was well worth the wait. A beautiful bay of soft sand, very picturesque. The couple of days we visited there were huge surfing waves. Just perfect.

What fun! Beautiful beach and exciting to watch surfers.. The beach is huge. The surfers are fun to watch. From the ferry you just have to walk across the street to the pedestrian walk through town to the beach. There are plenty of good places to eat and buy stuff.
nice beach, great bars. lovely way to spend a sunday afternoon, visiting the wharf bar, wandering the beach and enjoying a great meal, ferry ride over is a must for any tourist.

A great place for a summer holiday. Well we were there in winter and it was windy and cold, but could see that this would be a FANTASTIC destination for summer. Great mall, easy walks and a big clean beach

Excellent place for a relaxing morning breakfast.. Nice weather with lovely beach. Enjoy having breakfast along the Manly beach. Food was delicious and the service was good. Nice, relaxing and peaceful view. The tourist information center was near the ferry dock and it was very convenient.

I walked through the Corso to find the Copehagian Denmark Homemade Ice Scream. It was my birthday and it was a Sunday. My two friends Mary and Kellie. My childhood friends went walking through the Corso of Manly. They had market stands that day. Beautiful weather. We had lunch and we seen the dolphines waving bye. Everything that day was Gorgeous. Everyone must have some Homemade Ice Scream from Copehagian. Its Yummiee
Manly. What a beautiful place a short walk to this amazing beach. Bars/cafés on the waterfront relaxing and easy to get there with the ferries.
great beach. This was one of the best beaches that I have ever seen. With nice mountain and green environments, you can also enjoy great view of the ocean, offering a really great landscape.

Favourite day trip in Sydney. Away from the Bondi crowds but just as striking, Manly beach feels a bit more back to nature. It can be a bit windy, so take a jacket. Restaurants and shops line the road by the beach so plenty of choice on where to stop, and there are some nice walking trails that head off from the beach too.

Free wifi. Was allright
No too bad, pretty usuefull when u run out of data. So yeah it helps me a couple of time!!!!

Most beautiful beach in Australia. Took ferry from Circular Quay to Manly Beach and instantly fell in love with the place. Clean sand, beautiful sea and friendly locals. I could have sat all day watching all the different people running, playing volleyball, walking their dogs or working at the local cafes.We also enjoyed a beautiful breakfast whilst here in a small cafe directly off the beach.Wish I could snap my fingers and be back! Perfect!
another nice beach.... I spent a relaxing day at this beach: white sand, nice weather, restaurants around (fish&chips recommended)... perfect combination for a beach day

Decent place to spend a day. We had taken the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly Wharf on a cold, cloudy day. The ferry ride is a good beginning to the trip. Make sure you sit on the upper deck to get a good view of the Sydney Harbor Bridge as well as the Opera House. Once there, just laze around on the beach. There's enough options to eat right opposite the beach. On the ferry back to Circular Quay in the evening, take the upper deck again. The Harbor Bridge and Opera House look awesome when they're all lit up.
Take a ferry to Manly for lunch. Good place to visit for a lunch break and beach walk.Picked up fish and chips for a quiet break from the city.

Neat and Tidy. The maintenance of the beach, the sea-gulls fluttering about unmindful of the people around them, the surfers merrily going about enjoying their day, the more relaxed of the tourists sitting on the restaurant chairs and chatting about or sipping on their coffees - just beautiful indeed.

Amazing!. Wow !amazing beaches. If you go to Manly, you will truly enjoy the sandy beaches that stretches from the Queenscliff Beach up until the North Steyne Beach to Manly Beach. You will also be able to find rock pools after this stretch called the Shelly Beach and Fairy Bower. In the peninsula of Manly, you will also find a lot of beaches near or on the harbour. T

Easy to get there and enjoyed the boat ride. Manly beach has lots to see and great restaurants to choose from. I thought the atmosphere was electric and contagious . I would recommend taking the time to visit this gem of a place.
Scenic. Amazing beach, Scenic view & good food. It is my first visit to Manly beach. I was stunned by breath taking view.A must visit!

Beautifully picturesque. With plenty of cool food places to eat and a harbour one side, bike hires to explore the beautiful island and a large well maintained sandy beach I would thoroughly recommend this day trip! Fairly reasonable from Sydney Harbour and frequent boats it's definitely worth doing! Also whilst on the island definitely go to the viewpoint in the National Park, it is absolutely stunning!

Worth a visit. Had a visit to Manly whilst staying in Sydney. A short (30 mins) ferry ride from Circular Quay. Very quaint place. Felt friendly. Would go again. Would have been nice to have spent time on the beach but the weather was just a little windy.
Beauitifull Beach. Its been 40 years since my last time on this beach, Woo Hoo just like I remember it beautiful and full of life as always.

Beach, shopping, and a ferry ride. Manly is an amazing suburb of Sydney, not only for its beach, and it's collection of shops downtown in an outdoor mall, but it's end point to the Sydney ferry. I highly recommend traveling to Manly if your staying on the North shore and taking the ferry downtown, not just is it easier to find parking but the ferry ride is an attraction by itself.

Gorgeous. A short boat ride from Sydney and then a 10 minute walk from the Quay is Manly Beach. It is well worth the visit. Gorgeous sands, frontage and a very welcoming sea for surfers and swimmers alike. I imagine it can get busy in the peak season though,
I LOVE manly Beach. Visit Manly, it's amazing and worth it!! A lovely beach apart from when it's the fly season!! Stay away at fly season.

Manly food & wine festival. Food tasting,wine sipping! We had a great time enjoying the music performance,watching the cooking show,eating and sipping wines,doing people watching! Great way to spend our holiday :)

Lovely place to visit. The ferry ride from Circular quay was terrific - an inexpensive way to see the harbour - and the walk around Manly and the beaches on both sides made the trip worthwhile. Lots of interesting shops and no shortage of food places. I would expect that this would be full of tourists and locals in summer - fortunately for us it was a little cool so there weren't that many people around. Could spend hours walking along the beach.

"Confident and Manly" Beach. Easy ferry ride from Circular Quay with a beautiful view of the harbor. Great Corso with lots of shops and cafes. The beach is well guarded by the Manly Life Saving Club. Convenient beach umbrella and chair rental, along with boogie boards and surf boards. Facilities are nearby. Everyone is very friendly. Loved watching the surfing school. Manly Beach is a perfect day trip from Sydney Harbour.

Really enjoyed our visits. We just visited Manly Beach in June 2001 so it wasn't too warm. But, it is still a very nice visit because the town has a great atmosphere. The ferry ride to Manly is a beautiful ride and I enjoyed it very much. There are many shops and we did a lot of our shopping there. I found several items at a much reduced price than thet stores in Sydney. There are several restaurants, restrooms, and cheaper food alternatives there. They also have a pharmacy. We just enjoyed the people watching, but there were a lot of surfers as well. I would definitely recommend spending a morning or afternoon in Manly.

Peacefull & laidback. A short ferry ride from Sydney harbour & a delightful place to visit Wonderful beach & the town has many nice bars & restaurants Felt very peaceful & probably a nice area to live

It was a royal visit to Manly. We had planned to visit Manly Beaach and swim and spend the day, it was sheer coincidence that it was the day the Royal Family visited also. Lots of people andcrowds, yet still plenty of room for fun and it was mostly families and fun. A must-see beach for sure.

Beach town atmosphere. Manly beach is a nice ferry ride across the harbor, one of the best ways to see Sydney. Walking the town is easy and the beach is terrific. We ate at a local pub and had fantastic food. We also walked one of the trails taking us to several public parks in hopes of seeing the penguins. Unfortunately they weren't there. I liked Manly better than the other beaches in Sydney. Much more residential in feel. Relaxed atmosphere, definitely a must see.
Beautiful. We didn't swim, only watched, but it's a beautiful, unbusy area. Had lunch at a nearby cafe that looked out onto the beach.
Better than bondi Shelly beach a must. Casual relaxed beach with easy snorkelling at Shelly beach my favourite place for a quick easy underwater escape
Clean beach. Clean beach. The whole of Manly island has that homey feel. Too bad it was already dark when I reached Manly. Will definitely come again in future. Eateries are easy to find.
manly beach. This a a beautiful place, after taking the boat trip, which was a lovely view of Sidney harbour, we had lunch at manly. I had a bucket of prawns. all in all a lovely day.

Visit Manly Beach and stay for the Food. Take the ferry over, it's efficient and fast. There are restaurants of every nationality at Manly and you will need to be patient on weekends as it can get crowded.
relaxing. Nice stroll along the beach, and lunch by the beach. Really relaxing and peaceful. Only went to the beach area, did not go anywhere else.

the home of surfing. what a beach, from Queenscliff to South Steyne, this is and was the home of surf9ing, if you remember Midget Farrally and Nat Young you have to remember world champions in the making, you can see why at this great beach.

A beach with lots of Australians. It has a load of history and lots of sand with people surfing on small waves. It is not visually awesome and very few people were making sand castles. However it was good to see and I guess in the summer when it was warmer it would be heaving.

Beautiful. Just a short walk from the ferry wharf to enjoy the beautiful beach and great restaurants at Manly beach for lunch. Unfortunately we did not have time to fully enjoy this area. Will definitely make time next trip to include the walk to beautiful Shelly Beach.

Excellent with very nice scenic view. We actually went to the Manly Sea life Sanctuary and we took additional time to explore the beauty of the Manly beach. I can swy that it is as beauty as Bondi beach but not as crowded compared to Bondi beach.

Well worth a visit. It's just a really nice day trip. I'd have loved to stay here as a back packer, but now I'm married with a little girl, I'll have to settle for a day trip. The little market is great on a Sunday and theres a million places to buy amazing Ice Cream. Beach is also pretty good.

Can be crowded but worth the visit. A great beach (which others like too!) with lots of options to swim if the wind is blowing (open ocean side, inner harbour by the Aquarium, Shelly Beach). We often take visitors to Sydney to Manly for the day where we can leave them to some private time and arrange to meet later. The lay-out of town is simple with lots of food/coffee/dinner options, a bit of souvenir shopping or the market on weekends. Easy for visitors to feel comfortable without getting lost. Some we have catch the ferry from Manly back to Circular Quay where they get the 'wow' factor of coming in between the Opera House and Harbour Bridge.
Beautiful Manly. Manly is in my opinion better that Bondi, lots of shops, restaurants and the beach to die for, will be going back to stay.

Nice place. Arrive in Manly is already a great deal. Just take the ferry from Circular Quay and enjoy the view. But when you get there, it's simply awesome. The sand is great and the surroundings are wonderful. I really had the wish to live there. And Manly is a good place to buy souvenirs as well.

Great waves golden sand and warm water. Love Manley Beach excellent spot at end of the beach for body surfing. Nice walk up the pathway along the cliffs to Cabbage Tree Marine Reserve. Sidewalk café and swimming pool. Can't beat it on a nice day!

Manly Visit. Manly has something for everyone. A lovely visit would be to arrive by ferry , seeing the beauty of the harbour on the way. The beach here is calm , sandy , great for little children, the Aquarium is right there also many nice places to eat. Next stroll across the road to walk through the pedestrian mall, The Corso, lined with shops and eateries also. If you're lucky there is a great street market at the Ocean Beach side, natural products and unusual interesting souvenirs to take home .Then a great walk all the promenade , to the right is Shelley Beach, sheltered and good for snorkelling and diving, the National Park starts on the top of the hill, great for whale watching in season. The other direction takes you to Queenscliff end of Manly surf beach a little less busy. You could spend a few hours or all day enjoying the area, watch the surfers or have a go yourself. A must see sight in Sydney.

A day by the sea. A great day trip, take the ferry from Circular Quay, enjoying half an hour harbour cruise to Manley. The main street itself in Manly, that leads to the sea front is more than a little touristy, with many souvenir shops, some a little tacky. The the sea front is nice, whether just for a walk by the water on the promenade or beach, or even a swim 'n surfing in the ocean itself. As for food and refreshments, there is a good choice of bars and restaurants, the less touristy ones (and both better quality and less overpriced) being in the side streets and a couple on the sea front itself. So catch a morning ferry, have a look around, take some lunch, check out the shops if you wish, swim, have a few drinks or an ice cream and then back to Sydney in the later afternoon. An enjoyable 'day out' by the sea.

Surfing at Manly. I understand that, for many people, Manly has a more beauitiful beach than Bondi (unless one lives in Bondi of course). I cannot take sides on this one. However, even with a fairly calm sea, the surfing looked fun. Just watching the experts and the learners was great entertainment

Love Manly!. Must see when you are in Sydney. Take the ferry from Circular Quay! If you're really keen, take a taxi earlier and catch the sunrise (breathtaking). Oh, and make sure to take the boardwalk over to Shelley Beach.

Beautiful but..... it reminded me of New Zealand. Was so glad to find that Australia wasn't so different from home
Manly is gorgeous and def somewhere I'd consider living if I moved to Australia
Go and visit
Nice beach. pretty beach, clean sand, not too many people, good shopping. take the ferry ride there. no surf : (
A great beach!. Clean, friendly, nice waves. Great for a Sunday surf, brekky and coffee! Highly recommended for locals and travellers.
Nice place to live or visit!. We arrived at night on the ferry, and enjoyed a quick walk in the center of this upscale town before a great dinner at Hugo's.

Love Manly Beach!. Love the hot surfers, love the awesome chill atmosphere and the real Aussie welcoming smiles. Once you've been here, you'll want to stay here forever. Love the Dolphins. The fish n chips. The drink with your mates and the family atmosphere at the same time!

A Sydney Icon. Apart from the wonderful ferry ride from Sydney to Manly there is lots of wonderful sights to see. Manly aquarium, the pier with its shops and wonderful restaurants then there is the iconic beach. This is a Sydney landmark, 30 minutes from the centre of Sydney and you are at a wonderful sandy beach complete with excellent waves, the ecclectic food scene and the wonderful walks make this area sublime!
a beach is a beach is a beach. Lovely walk along, watching all that is going on. Very busy place-wonderful to people/dog/car watch.
First view I see it, I love it!. I came as recommended, and I was very happy that I came. It's a very relaxing town. Streets are clean, and the city even provides a free wifi fir visitors.

Manly Beach. Manly Beach rocks! Great for every age and stage of life. Come on down! We love the beach and restaurants and of course the ferry trip to Sydney is fabulous - particularly during the Vivid Festival.

Nice beach, great town near by. Catching the ferry from Circular Quay (pronounced "key") gives you a great view of the harbor and Sydney Opera House. Once you get to Manly beach a short walk off the docks through town will take you to Manly beach. The beach is very nice. What we liked best about Manly beach is that they have a very nice town with pretty good shopping and dining. During our visit they had a paella cooking festival going on, which was fun to see.

Best beach in Sydney?. In my opinion this is Sydney's beach to visit. The surf is usually decent and great for swimming in. There is always some more space here rather than Bondi. The Main Street behind the beach also boasts some cool shops and restaurants so go check it out!
Charming beach. Small charming and very clean beach with a lot of small shops and restaurants. The trip by ferry from Sydney is well organized and managed

Good place to shop. This is a great place if you want to buy souvenirs. We had been to a number of places in Australia (Gold coast, Brisbane, Melbourne) but we felt the stuff was cheaper here. A good beach too and many eateries. The sea life sanctuary was a big disappointment.
Surfs up.... Lovely beach, fantastic restaurants and a short stroll from the ferry port - although car parking is costly if you want a day at the beach.

great Beach. We rode the Ferry-over here and had no idea that we would find such a great Beach. if your into the beach, this would be a great one to spend the day, sunning, funning, swimming. the board walk is a great walk also. We found several restaurants and shops walking up the Main Street from the Ferry to the Beach.

Take a ferry to Manly for the day.. A perfect day trip from Sydney Circular Quay, is to hop on the Manly ferry. Pension concession only $2.50 for unlimited travel on ferries, buses and trains for the entire day. Head over early and have a big breakfast for only $10.00 down the beach end of the mall. The beach is beautiful, so on a warm day wear your swimmers. Great shopping, and to finish off have pizza and drinks at Hugo's at Manly Wharf before catching the ferry back. Highly recommend a fabulous day trip.

Best Beach in Sydney. "Seven Miles from Sydney, a thousand miles from care". This is how we describe Manly. Pristine beaches with beautiful promenades, easy walks and great places to eat. Good variety of food, markets, surfing lessons, snorkeling and diving opportunities. Hire a bike to cycle around Manly. Arrive by Ferry and stroll down the Corso toward the main beach and take in the relaxed and friendly atmosphere along the way. Plenty of cafés for great coffee! All this and only a ferry ride from the city!

Lovely place. We went on the ferry to Manly., it stopped along the way at different places so we had a lovely leisurely ride and sightseeing trip. Manly is one of these places you see and say to yourself "mmm I could live here !" it's very layed back and offers everything. Quiet, (probably not in peak season!) very clean, pretty, lots of nice shops in the mall ..just has a lovely feel to it. I would like to return some day and stay there as opposed to staying in Sydney.

Holiday Atmosphere. From the moment we got of the Ferry at Manly we said we wanted to live here. What a great place with a real relaxed holiday feel. The beach is clean, sandy and nice. Some good surf rolling in too. You can go for long strolls on designated paths that take you through a national park and also along a quaint seaside path to other little coves. Did quite a bit of walking around the center and enjoyed a lovely Saturday market in one of the side street malls. Plenty of eateries and bars and all priced OK. Spent whole day here enjoying the sun and surf and finsihed off with a few evening drinks relaxing at the beach before heading back on the Ferry to the hotel.
Prettier than Bondi. Much bigger and more picturesque than Bondi but I suppose not so good for surfers. More places to eat as well.

Better Then Bondi. Take the Ferry from Circular Quay to Manly and stroll down the Corso to Manly Beach. You might even like to take a right turn and walk to Shelly Beach for a Coffee before returning to Manly for Fish and Chips, but watch out for the seagulls as they want to pinch your meal. Don't throw them a chip as they will call all their mates over. If you don't like our gulls you can enjoy a meal at one of the outdoor eateries overlooking the beach. Don't forget your swimmers.

Catch the Ferry to Manly!. A great way to see the beaches & harbour as well. A great place for a walk & something to eat! Walk along the beach & visit over 3 surf clubs along the way in the Sun! Great restaurants & take away's as well. Enjoy Sydney @ it's best!

Love Manly. What a great way to spend a day, we went snorkelling then fish and chips on the beach followed by a nice cream as we strolled through the Corso down to the ferry terminal and the Manly Ferries

Extremely busy in Summer. I lived just up the road from Manly Beach for nearly ten years. Manly is a beautiful place and in the past few years has become very well-to-do (Don't be surprised if a Ferrari drives by!) The down side is in warmer months Manly Beach gets insanely busy and each time the ferry pulls in to the wharf another massive crowd makes it's way down the corso to the beach.

The Aussie beach tourists dream about. Manly is a beautiful long busy beach, the sort of beach many from overseas imagine when dreaming of visiting Oz. Far more real and family oriented than the farce that is Bondi beach, Manly is well worth a visit, whether for a dip in the surf, a stroll along the promenade to Freshwater, or grabbing a bite to eat at Manly Wharf, which has a couple of great bars with water views. The walk along the foreshore path to Shelley beach is also recommended.
An awesome beach with beautiful views and food. This is one of my fav beach in Sydney, love the whole atmosphere and proximity to various amenities....

At great summer's day. The whole family(2 adults, 2 children) took the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly. We left about 10.00am to avoid the morning rush hour. Had no trouble walking around the ferry inside and out and the views were spectacular. Arrived at Manly wharf and walked across the Corso to the beach side of Manly. Stocked up with drinks and nibblies at the Woolworths shop and headed to the beach. Went to the southern part of the beach where the flags were that day. Set up camp. I saw some there with umbrellas and small shade tents. Great idea if you are spending more that a few hours on the beach. It's damn hot! The water was fresh but warm enough for the kids to spent a lot of time swimming. The Corso provided lots of eating options for lunch. There's even a pub on the corner if your thirsty. It's really is a great day out even for locals. I rate Manly particularly for families.

Manly beach splendour. This is the beach to visit. I love taking the ferry there which makes me see the splendour of our harbour. The many wonderful cafe's to eat in, the spectacular walk along the promenade and the views to Shelley beach are a must to enjoy. I'm a Sydney-sider, however, I do visit Manly from to time to time as it makes you feel you are overseas, away from the hussle and bussle.

More than just Sand. A great beach but the surrounds are the jewels of this area. There are hidden cafes and shops down laneways, bush walks from the beach and through to the National Park and historical buildings to view and explore. The locals are friendly and always willing to invite you to join them in an early swim.

Must visit and easily accessible. Manly Beach is the main beach that I take overseas visitors to because you can get there on the lovely Manly Ferry very easily and the ferry trip is part of the experience. You can also walk around to the delightful Shelly Beach and there are plenty of amazing places to eat and shop in the mall right behind the beach.

Ok beach, very convenient location.. For me, Manly is less about the beach and more about the easy access to the harbour. But, if you catch a ferry there (recommended), then it's a nice beach to sit and have your lunch. Sydney has better beaches, but few in such close proximity to the rest of the harbour area.

A 'must do' for visitors to Sydney.. An easy, enjoyable and scenic crossing of the harbor by ferry from Circular Quay to colorful Manly dockside. A short walk down the wide shopping mall to the beach front, followed by a longer walk around the bay to the most southern point, while being able to enjoy the uninterrupted ocean/beach views - a delightful experience!

Sunday Outing. Sundays are a good day to visit Manly, best way to enjoy the day is by catching the ferry from Circular Quay and enjoy a relaxing ride across the harbour passing Fort Denison and the lovely shore line. Once there you can enjoy a stroll through the shopping precinct and the market stalls selling an array of gifts. At the end of the mall is the lovely beach that has a long boardwalk to enjoy a pleasant stroll or to sit at one of the cafés and enjoy a coffee or cool drink.

Best family seaside walks. Short ferry ride from Circular Quay (best to purchase a day tripper ticket) from the ferry wharf beautiful flat walks in either directions.  Along the surf side the other along the harbour. The surf side take a swim in the rock pools along the way and enjoy the fresh air sea breezes. Shower rooms available. Along the harbour side a few slight slopes with magnificent views of the harbour and surrounds.
Lovely. Great for families. Probably not as good or as wide as Bondi, but has a lovely park attached with heaps of shade.
Must visit. It is a nice beach to visit in Sydney.The weather was a bit chilly, but the beach is a worthwhile to be.Nice food, a lot to shop, and even an aquarium!You must visit Manly!

Better than Bondi. I visited Manly beach with a friend and get family and my personal opinion is it is better than Bondi which we also visited. I was expecting more from Bondi but found Manly much more family friendly.

Just 1 of the many beaches in Australia. Not worth visiting if you are on a tight schedule and have been to Gold Coast. If you are on a leisure schedule, chilling out at one of the many beach cafes or explore more into the neighbourhood would be nice.

Manly Lunch. Treat yourself to a pub lunch at Manly and you wont be disappointed
Priced well, tasted delicious, varied choice, fabulous views, good service

Such a great tool to be able to access the library and its facilties without question.... Manly Library is great….quiet and a productive environment….the staff are more than helpful :)
I recommend coming here to all book lovers and garner the free wi-fi...

Manley is magnificent. It's a little piece of heaven. Well worth the trip. Manley is clean, and beautiful. People are all very nice. Prices are much better then Sydney. I'd come to stay in manly if I were to come to Australia again.

So beautiful here. I love Manly! It is so beautiful. It feels so relaxed down there for being in Sydney which I find quite crazy and full of people :) they have lots of restaurants and cafes to enjoy after or during your time at the beach. Very nice.
fantastic beach. It's a wonderful place to visit! It has an amazing beach, and a lot of shopping. Highly recommended!

Perfect beach. As a English woman this was how I imagined Aussie beaches. Sunshine, surf, clean sand. Aussies surfing, playing volley ball. Beautiful walkway with amble seating to sit and watch the world go by. Lovely little shops and lots of cafes, with diverse choice of cuisine. I loved it.
Great atmosphere. Large beach, generally not too crowded, but definitely not a quiet beach. The shops around the beach are really nice.

Fast ferry to Manly great day out. We got the fast ferry to Manly for the day only took about 20 mins. Some lovely little shops on the way down to the beach and the day we were there (a Saturday) there was an open air market. We picked up a gorgeous canvas as a momento of our trip. The beach is lovely and we walked round to a little cove after we had had lunch. Highly recommend a visit here

Fab. Took a ferry over to manly beach. Nice stroll along the waters edge, found a nice little restaurant for some food and then up to the zoo. Was great to see the animals. Many of which we don't get to see in the uk.
Beautiful!. Sandy, long sweeping beach, great surf and fab water colour. So much to see and do watching the world go by! It's an absolute pleasure spending time on the beach.
Manly. Good beach with plenty shops nearby , easily reachable by ferry and worth a visit . Beware of strong currents and listen to the lifeguards

A beach culture. Hands down better than Bondi. This has a real beach culture a lot like Coolangatta in QLD. Manly is a beach town whereas Bondi is a beach on the edge of the city. Bondi is still OK, but I think Manly is under rated. Great cafe's, markets and casual shopping. Will stay there next time in Sydney.

Nice Way to Spend an Afternoon. We took the ferry over to Manly Beach. A very nice area to stroll up and down the shore with plenty of shops and restaurants. We found it clean and well taken care of. It was a bit breezy the day we were there and a little chilly so didn’t try the water. It is a great way to spend a leisurely stroll and afternoon. We thought it was a much nicer area than Bondi. It was enjoyable watching the surfers catch a wave. Use caution when swimming since there are signs that warn of pollution after rains.
Avoid the weekends, if you can. Very crowded on the weekends (but at the same time a steal if you purchase the Sunday Funday ferry ticket!) but certainly a must-see spot while in Sydney.

A good reason for taking a ferry. We just wanted to ride the ferry, so we chose Manly. It's a nice beach, lots of surfers and rescue swimmers, people sitting on the wall watching the action and the surf, and restaurants lining the pedestrian mall and beach road. It is pretty touristy, and most of the shops are geared towards young people who surf and swim, but it's a pleasant place to people and scenery-watch.

Beautiful clean family friendly beach. Having visited Bondi we found Manly to be beautiful, not too overcrowed and very clean. It had a very relaxed vibe and nice local shops too. A lovely ferry ride across from Circular Quay. Would recommend visiting in you have time when in Sydney.

Perfect for a Day Trip. We took a ferry from Circular Quay, and even just the sights going from downtown Sydney to Manly were breathtaking! The Manly visitors center is immediately to the right of the ferry terminal when you disembark and they have very useful maps there. Manly itself is very easy to navigate and perfect for shopping and getting lunch, but can be very expensive. The beach itself has public restrooms and is very big and very clean with lots of surfers and swimmers. It was a very nice view and it made the perfect day trip away from Sydney!

A lovely beach. Manly beach is a lovely beach fairly near to the city - either by car or by ferry from Circular Quay. There are eateries nearby, too. You can swim, surf, or just sit - either on the sand or on one of the seats on the concrete or on the grass. A picnic can also be nice. The beach is quite expansive and you can also take a walk/stroll along the sand. If you dine at one of the cafes or restaurants, a table where you have a good view of the beach is a great thing to enjoy. Many Norfolk Island pines line the whole beach and make for a lovely setting.

Nice ferry ride from Sydney. What you'd expect from your average beach. Large areas to play. A lot of variety shops near by. Especially enjoyed The Pantry for lunch, which is located right on the beach.

AWESOME BEACHVIEW. I got here from the ferry from circular quay after my trip to the taronga zoo. I got the whole day pass for transport so it's relatively cheap there. I also walked around and headed to the manly wildlife aquarium which is kinda small. There isn't much to see in the aquarium, but the beach is lovely and the port is bustling with food stalls. I was really tempted from the smell of the fish and chips from the many restaurants around. They just smelt lovely, just follow the crowd when you alight from the port and there is a path straight with stalls at the sides which sells a lot of food and drinks. Beware of the seagulls though cause they are a real pest. However, the beach was really awesome during summer time and there are a lot of people around surfing, swimming and just chilling by the coast. It was really windy and the sun was also really helping in creating the beach feel. So just stop by and head in there for a chilling time, either solo or with your partner.

It's a beach!. Australia is full of beautiful beaches and this is no exception. If you like bustling beaches backed by shop lined streets, this place is for you. Swimmers, surfers, body boarders, volley ballers, skate boarders - it has it all. If you don't like sand, there is a tree shaded grassy strip all along the promenade where you can enjoy the spectacle.

God's Country. Having moved from the UK to Australia, I've now been living in Manly for 4 years and love the place. There are so many other beaches than the beautiful main beach - Shelly Beach, Collins beach, Little Manly Cove, as well as the harbour side beaches further around the West Esplanade - Delwood and Fairlight.There are some excellent bars and restaurants. A few favourites are The Steyne, In-Situ, Manly Wharf Hotel (great on a Sunday afternoon), The Bavarian Beer Cafe for the sunsets, Hugo's, Garfish, Ouzeria for Greek food and 4 Pines for some fantastic locally crafted beer.The people are very relaxed and it has a great beachy vibe to the place. I would recommend everyone who visits Sydney to to take a day trip on the Famous Manly Ferry for a visit.Here's a little video I made of Manly to give you an idea....https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wGKxPBrv-0Q

A beach to beat beaches. Manly beach is awesome for swimming and surfing, for adults and kids and it's not overcrowded or too commercialized. It's easy to access by car and you don't have to fight the world for a parking and while there are cafés and restaurants in the area it's not too much. We had a wonderful time on Manly Beach, the water was a good temp, there were waves for surfing but areas in which our toddler could play, the setting is just amazing.

Great day trip. Recommend you explore Manly on a Saturday in order to catch the Farmers Market/Flea market that sets up in the town square. Manly beach is very nice with lots of restaurants lining the street next to the beach and an assortment of shops to explore.
Beautiful. This beach was beautiful! We took a nice walk along the seawall and I'm glad we did. Very nice and worth a visit!

Beautiful Beach & loved Corso. *) The best way to see Sydney from the water is from the back of the Manly ferry as it pulls away from Circular Quay. To the left is the Opera House and to the right is the Harbour Bridge. 30 minutes later the ferry arrives at the beautiful, laid back seaside village of Manly.*) Try to sit outside and enjoy the sunshine and the view.*) Cheap tickets, you can buy these in Circular Quay right near the train station. Short walk from the wharf in manly to the beach, go through the Corso.*) Excellent Views of Opera House from ferry.*) Carry a jacket, if you are sitting out, you will need it, especially in the evenings.*) Free wifi available on ferry.*) There is Max Brenner and Nandos at Manly Wharf. Hot Chocolates and Suckao at Max Brenner are very popular. White Suckao costs AUD 6.50.*) Very beautiful, and typical Australian beach with soft white Sands. Its beautiful.*) You have to cross the town via Corso to reach the actual beach.*) There were lots of restaurants nearby and an ALDI's supermarket in the wharf if you wanted food to eat along the beach.*) There is a popular Manly Scenic Walkway which I did not do.*) Take the Ferry back from Manly Wharf to Circular Quay. Walk around the area for sometime.For a detailed trip list feel free to visit http://sydneygoldcoastbrisbaneviasingapore.blogspot.com/

A perfect Australian beach. This is what Australia is about. Beautiful clean beaches and good pubs with good priced food and beer. The water is clean (unless after recent rain) and the beach is lovely. Good for people watching.
Great beach. Nice beach for relax with family and friends. I will reconmmend go there. It is bit expensive to buy food there

Manly Beach. Perfect spot for relaxing and watching the ocean waves rolling in. Beautiful clean sand and Corso, and you can walk and jog for a good distance comfortably. So good to be able to walk to all the cafe's and resturants

Beautiful beach, chilled community, lots of cafes and bars.. Manly has a great vibe and is surrounded by scores of excellent cafes and restaurants. The beaches are beautiful beach, thanks in part to the truly awesome pine trees. Take a stroll along the boardwalk, or head around to Shelly Beach, following the water front South, to the only West facing beach on the east coast. Plenty of funky small bars, relaxed eateries or cheap take-a-way.

Chillax beach. A little crowded when I visited - maybe it was during summer. I would really appreciate more info booths or something for tourists, casual dining and fast-food restaurants. Long and sun-kissed beach which is perfect for a friends or family hangout.

A fun area a bit different than Bondi. A little smaller and with an even more relaxing laid-back feel than Bondi Beach. Good restaurants (though think Bondi's food quality/options are a bit better) and the kids had a blast taking surfing lessons. Easy to get to via the harbor ferry- takes about 40 minutes and you get a nice view of the sunset and opera house if you time it right. Also has a nice shopping strip on the walk from the ferry to the beach. Something for everyone!

Worth the trip. We attempted to go to Manly on Easter Sunday - big mistake! Huge line ups. We changed our mind and went the following day - great decision. It's a lovely ferry ride over to Manly from the Sydney harbour, with a very neat cobble-stone type walking street lined with places to eat and shops to shop in, steering you towards the beach. We found this beach was much calmer than Bondi (no huge waves) and the attendees were mostly families. Very nice location.
Good even in the rain. After a bumpy trip on the ferry we HAD to walk on the beach in the rain. There seems as though there were hundreds of surfersout there in the water which were fun to watch.

Basic beach feel. We took the fairy to manly and after visiting bondi the day before we were not as impressed. Obviously a beautiful beach but I enjoyed the outdoor shops and overall feel better then the beach itself. If your deciding between bondi and manly go to bondi and do the bondi to coogey beach walk and you won't regret it!

Amazing. Firstly I would recommend catchin the ferry to Manley from circular quay or vise versa as this takes through some amazing scenery and straight past the opera house for some unprecedented photo opportunities!Manly itself is a vibrant interesting suburb with it's laid back surfer town vibe. The beach seems to stretch for miles of pristine sand and surf and you can choose to relax in the sun or grab a board and risk the surf!One little gem that I found was if you stand looking out to sea at the beach follow the path that follows the coast to the right. This will take you away from the crowds and to a lovely little area with a couple of cafés and a bay which is great for snorkling. Buy some bread and feed the fish!Overall a must do trip when in Sydney :)

Magical Manly - Great Beach - and More. I lived in Manly in 1968, returned for a visit in 2004 and again this March 2014. The white sand beach, of course, is spectacular, but the entire seaside resort town is so worth a visit. There is of course some 'new' but there is still much of the 'old' that is quaint and magical. Manly retains the essence of what a surf city should - it's all about the sun, the sand, the sea, and the simple pleasures in life.

Trip to Manley a nice change of scene. Ferry ride to Manley is spectacular, wonderful views of the Opera House, Harbor Bridge, Sydney skyline. Enjoyed exploring the shops and wandering around Manley. Had excellent fish & chips at the marina. Highly recommend a trip to Manley while in Sydney!

much better, and for all kind of ages. visiting Manly is very simple and the availability of the ferries are very high.the beach is very nice and relaxed.I managed to enjoy the atmosphere on the walking to the beach, having some breakfast there, and after that went to the beach. I finished my day with a beer on the corner.the reason I marked this title is because I met two colleagues (appr. twice my age...) before I left and they told me as well they enjoyed the atmosphere and just hanging around, though did not "use" the beach itself.I recommend it to couples and people who just want little bet of quiet from the city.
Better than Bondi. Far better than Bondi and bit easier to get to from the city by ferry. The coastal walks are lovely with lovely views to be seen. Like the small sculpture on the rocks.
Beats Bondi Handsdown. I love Manly beach, relatively uncrowded and a beautiful scenic walk to boot. Restaurants galore from inexpensive to expensive. Shopping is good too. Give it a go.

An evening on the Manly Beach. We reached Manly around 1600 hrs on our way back from the opera house. My 4 year old was too excited to reach the beach. We had to take a long walk along the beach to the kids beach area. It was exhausting, but the place was so beautiful that we enjoyed every bit of it.We stayed there until sunset, and signed off with a promise to visit the place again. One of the best beaches, I've visited !!
Hang out and chill out. A very charming part of Sydney, with the nice beach, but also streets with shopping, some market stands, and bars and restaurants.
Manly. Fabulous beach with lots of activities, including surfing. Very good restaurants close by. Very pleasant.

Awesome Beach away from Sydney. Manly Beach is a very happening place to visit. The Beach is huge and even in the rain people were out and about enjoying the sand and sea. Surfing, volley ball, boggy boarding, walking and just hanging around. Easy to get to from Sydney Circular Quay via the Ferries every 30 minutes or so.Tons of shops and places to grab a coffee or something to drink.

Lovely place to walk around. I can't believe I'd never been to Manly Beach before! We had a lovely afternoon catching the ferry from Circular Quay, then walking between the Bay side to the beach side of Manly. Following the beach around to a quiet inlet you can find a man set up a van selling toasted sandwiches in the shade. We skipped this and had lunch at the excellent Bower Cafe (the soft shell crab salad was delicious). I will definitely be back to Manly next time in Sydney...

Nice Beach. It was beautiful sunny day so I took the ferry to Manly beach from circular quay with good views of Opera House, the bridge and the Sydney skyline harbour on the way there, I spend some time walking the beach which was really enjoyable. When I returned back it was dark and Sydney harbour was all lighted up which was very nice.
Too commercial. Nice beach but very commercial. I found a lot of the shops a bit tacky and touristy. Worth the visit but wouldn't rush back.

Worth exploring a little further.. Great little beach with a lively pier and good services by ferry from Sydney Harbour. Walk along a little further and enjoy the seaside 'Beach Pool' and venture round the rocky point to enjoy the real Manly Beach.

Best Beach. Had some long walks along the beach once crowds have gone tranquil place. Has every facility you require. When you need refreshment short walk to the Corso for food and drinks.Impressed with the lifeguards on the beach. Really took care of all the swimmers

Brilliant day out from Sydney. Just caught the ferry over to Manly Island and wandered the pretty little streets. Spent the afternoon on the gorgeous sandy beach. Great day out and nice relax from the slog of sightseeing.

The Beach Rules. My wife and I were recently on holiday from the U.S. in Sydney. We were very fortunate to take the ferry from the harbor and visit Manly Beach during our visit. The ferry ride takes 30 minutes and cost $15 per person. The ferry ride has great scenic views of the Opera House, the Bridge and other nice view. We had a beautiful sunny day and were truly impressed with the area. They are plenty of restaurants and bars to choice from but ultimately the beach rules !! We were very impressed with the beach - it was clean with plenty of sun bathers, suffers, etc. Overall a great way to spend a day.
Go early. If going at weekend in good weather, on ferry from Circular Quay, make sure you go early to miss the later packed ferries. Great beach with lots going on.

Great escape from sydney. You can't imagine such quiet escape from Sydney is just 30min. ferry ride. Beaches are live and vibrant on weekends. Evening is calm with few people around. Good dinning options at night. Wide street, few people- very unlike Sydney. Manly beach, wharf, aquarium and silent walk. Quite refreshing.

Chillax. Manly beach is one of my favorites. It is such a relaxed town and the beach is nice and spacious. No one minds anyone else's business. You can swim, surf, paddle board. You can rent a surf board for 15 bucks an hour. Though sometimes, the rip current and the surf can be quite strong and big, so don't be surprised if no flags are raised for you to swim in between. At such times, you will hear lifeguard announcements that it is best not to swim and only surfers can go out into the water, until they can safely pitch flags for the swimmers. They are all about the public's safety so don't take it against them if they prohibit swimming for the meantime. Know that there's always a (cute) lifeguard looking out for you. In the meantime, you can enjoy walking around Manly, going to the shops, eating at their pubs, etc. This place is such a relaxed and laid back place, I love it!

Best beach in Sydney. Visited Manly beach over the Easter long weekend. We stayed three nights at the Novotel and walked and walked and took in the wonderful views from Queenscliff to Shelley Beach. Best beach in Sydney by far

Favourite stop in Sydney. Love Manly. Beautiful beach to walk along, but we visit in January/February and there is always blue bottle jellyfish in the water. I am not brave enough to swim. There are plenty of bars and restaurants straight across from the beach.

Leave early. Great beach and day out but by time we left the queue to get the ferry back to sydney harbour was huge. I'd suggest leaving a bit earlier if you don't want a long wait to get the ferry back.
Beautiful Views. The views from this beach are spectacular. There is a tree-lined walkway the length of the beach so if you're not swimming, you can still enjoy some time at the beach.

A calm place far from Sydney. This place is very peaceful comparing to the city of Sydney. the beach is average, good cafés and shops to stroll around.Nothing so special but I definitely prefer it comparing to bondi beach

Absolutely breathtaking. Caught the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly bay. Wonderful views as soon as you get off the ferry Short walk through the shops to the beach. Nice restraunts and coffee shops.Ferry ride is around 20 minutes from Sydney .Well worth a visit.

A must see in Sydney. Take a ferry from Sydney's Circular Quay to Manly, and view the "Heads" - where the harbour meets the ocean - as part of the ride. Manly is situated with harbour on one side and ocean on the other. It is a short stroll between both. While Bondi is the iconic Sydney beach, Manly is bigger and its tree lined foreshore makes for a pleasant stroll. It also has very friendly surf lifesavers. There are scenic costal walks that can be taken from Manly. Ask tourist information about these. Check out the mural painted on the telephone exchange and also the open air shopping mall with awesome children's play equipment. There are numerous eateries opposite the ocean with each eager to attract customers. Allow the best part of day to visit here to soak up the atmosphere.
Better than bondi. A great beach and backed by some good shops and facilities including places to eat and buy beach stuff so overall one of the better options in Sydney

Manly Beach is Nice. The ferry ride over from darling harbor was enjoyable but crowded. It was difficult to get a good seat. We learned for the ride back. We had a nice walk through some of the shops and had Fish and Chips and a beer at one of the Pubs on the Tasman Sea Side. It made for a nice afternoon.

Great Atmosphere. Manly has a great atmosphere, and while it can become busy during the holidays, it is still a beautiful place to visit. Be prepared to pay for parking if you spend more than two hours there, or if you park on the water front. The walk from Queenscliff to Shelly is really lovely and the foot paths are very wide. The surf can be a bit rough for people who are not strong swimmers, so I recommend those people to swim either at Queenscliff or Shelly Beach. Overall, I would recommend this beach to everyone.
Lunch on Manly. Ferry over to Manly walk up thru the mall to Manly Beach and then seafood lunch without much wait was terrific

Great day trip. Catch the ferry at circular quay, very well signed. Half hour trip to manly, great views of the harbour. Manly is a lovely seaside suburb, have breakfast or lunch on the beach front. Great walks and surf beach
Manly Beach. This beach is 2klm long and a wonderful spot for locals and tourists. This is the best beach in Sydney for tourists with its shops and restaurants and bars.

A truly beautiful part of Sydney. The view as soon as you get off the ferry is just breath taking. I met friends for lunch at Many. There is a beautiful pathway from the ferry. There were so many restaurants to choose from. After lunch my friends and I went for a walk to take in the beautiful views of Manly and to work lunch off!
Worth a visit. Lots to see and do for a full day, from the beach at the ferry, through the shopping area to beach and ocean views, a great day experienced
Fantastic beach and surrounds. Such a beautiful beach and surrounding area, walk the Corso it's just brilliant. enjoy great food and drinks at manly wharf. a great place to visit.
better than bondi. love this more than bondi. less backbackers, less commercialism. choices of restaurants were better and over all, i find this more elegant than bondi/
I would definitely recommend!. I love Manly beach! I'm not a huge beach person, but I have to say, this beach definitely has it's perks.

First rate beach ... Did as was suggested on here.. We took the ferry from Circular Quay for the 20 minute ride to Manly. The weather was overcast but ok.. when you leave the ferry just walk straight and follow the crowd. There are enough bars/ restaurants on the way so no one would go without. Lots of people surfing which was cool to watch. I,m actually over from the UK but I must say it didn't give me the wow factor like Bondi did.. All about opinions and all that.. Well worth a visit,,,

Must do. Just a short 30 min ferry ride from Circular Quay. A fantastic suburb of Sydney. Some excellent independent shops and bars and some fantastic fish and chip shops. Walk around the town and along the seafront. It is truly beautiful. Top off your visit to a fish and chip restaurant and a bottle of ice cold beer. Bliss!

Lovely Beach. we took the ferry from circular quay to manly what a lovely way to travel. Our 1st trip the weather was not brilliant so we had a wander round and walked to shelly beach and then up to the headland for a wonderful view, its quite a track and not well signed once you leave the car park but is worth it. we returned a second time and the weather was better and we had a lovely day sitting on the beach watching the surfers and everyone just having fun. lots of places to eat along the front and on the walk from the docking station to the beach which is about 5 mins walk. There is also lots of walks of which we didn't do. If you have time go and spend some time there.
Well worth the visit. Lovely bars, shops etc along the way to the beach. Definately worth a visit, especially if the weather is good. Quite good beach for surfing.

BEST BEACH IN SYDNEY. Manly beach, from South Steyne to Queenscliffe, has everything anyone needs when spending a day at a gorgeous beach. No crowding whatsoever, stunning clean clear ocean, enough food outlets to keep you fed forever, bike hire, board hire, amazing very experienced lifeguards, hotels aplenty, with entertainment at certain times.........NOTHING BAD could ever be said about Manly Beach...''THE'' one and only BEST BEACH IN SYDNEY.

Get away from Bondi and visit Manly. I am biassed because I live on the Northern Beaches but Manly is a must to visit. Start by getting there on the ferry from Circular Quay. They go every half hour. Once you get there you can walk to the beach, restaurants, cafes and bars. You will get a "local"feel here. Walk around the Shelly beach, have a coffee on the way. Dont forget ytour swimmers!!

My favorite day. Husband and I took a ferry to Manly and enjoyed the day. Fun watching kids find shells and marine life as we took in strolling along the beach. Would recommend this as a get away for the day from Sydney.
