For you guys who need less noise.. Bondi beach is the popular one in Sydney, but Manly beach is far beyond the atmosphere in there, less noise, much smaller, but the water is the same water :)

Catch the Ferry over to the famous Manly Beach. I loved the ferry ride over to Manly. Enjoy the beach and the lovely walk round to Shelly Beach.
Plenty of shops, restaurants, cafes in the area to enjoy and take it the waves and atmosphere.
a lot of seagulls. Nice enough place but too many seagulls after ones food the water taxi from the keyside passing by the cruise liners a wow

One of Sydney's best beaches. Everyone goes to Bondi, but Manly is a lot more accessible and the ferry trip makes it more of a vacation than battling the roads out to Bondi.
With miles of golden beaches, restaurants and shopping, this is a fun day out for the whole family. The kids can play in the spurting fountains and everyone can enjoy beachside food.
Not Sydneys best beach. Its easy to get to, I'll say that but as a sydneysider I never go there as its touristy and the locals hate people surfing there, so I never go
Great, even on a rainy day. No trip to Sydney is complete without a ferry journey to the Iconic Manly Beach. Beautifully prepared beach and a fascinating shopping precinct

Manly beach. What a brilliant beach, why bother with Bondi, Manly gives all you want in a beach, fantastic, clean sand, great surf and swimming waves, superb and professional lifeguards who are on the ball at all times to monitor the swimming. take a surf lesson, friendly staff. What an environment to live in, being a child brought up here, how brilliant!
Beautiful. Beautiful walk - lots of shops, plenty to do, you must get ice cream from the ferry station it was lovely!

Soak up the sun here. Having volunteered as a surf lifesaver here with a bronze medallion for two years I have grown a special place in my heart for Manly beach, a beach which truly lives up to it's name and glory. If you ever get the chance to come to this part of Sydney I would definitely recommend it to you. It is surrounded by a vast blue beauty known as the South Pacific Ocean, and is dotted along its shores with lavish apartments and of course, the infamous Manly Corso. A tourists must-visit attraction.

Charm by the sea. This touristy seaside town is well worth a visit. It has a wide sweeping bay with sea pools to swim in.There is a lot of surfing activity to watch, even if you don't surf yourself.The lifeguards are very much in eveidence keeping everybody safe.I believe that there are strong currents off this beach, I would check into it before entering the water.The town and seafront have many shops and restaurants, also there is a little market, we went on a Sunday.You can get to Manly from Circular Quay by one of the ferries.

Great place to spend a day!. Beautiful beach just a short 2-block walk from the ferry dock. Blocks of shops and restaurants surround the beach and wharf. Nice public restroom facilities and outdoor showers. Lifeguards were very conscious about keeping swimmers safe, occasionally moving the swimming area down the beach to avoid rip tides. Chair and umbrella rentals are available on the beach - $15/day for a chaise lounge..

Nice place for a few hours. Ferry crossing was fun and the beach is nice to hang out with family. Our daughter enjoyed it.Little casual restaurants along the water and shops. We ate at a small fish and chips which was ok. Nothing to write home about. Shops are also ok, didn't really run into anything special. Liked the beach and watching the surfers...

Enjoyed the ferry crossing. Take the ferry from Sydney Harbour (about every 1/2 hour), Manly Beach is as far as it goes. Disembark and walk through the shopping area (1/2 mile?) to the main beach. Good rollers, lovely sand (just right for paddling) and it was the surfing championships whilst we were there!

Average beach but really nice national park a few minutes away. The beach is alright but nothing special about it but you can have a very nice walk through the national park right next to it and it is very enjoyable.
Beautiful. Come see yourself it's one if the most best aces to shop eat and enjoy the beach. My Freind took me down here and I asked to come back several times during my visit.

Catch the ferry to this popular location. Regular ferry services travel to and from this popular location. The comfortable trip allows you to see all the sights on the harbour, then enjoy the beach overlooking the harbour, or a short walk through to the surf beach. The excellent art gallery a few steps from the ferry terminal is well worth a visit. There is a range of cafes, restaurants and take-aways overlooking the harbour beach.
Great day out. Nice walk from ferry to beach,lots of shops. Great lunch at cafe looking out over the beach, nice day out.

Better than Bondi. We took the ferry over from Circular Quay which was about a 30 minute ride. After getting off the ferry, it was a short walk through the town to the beach area. The town has lots of little shops and cafes along the way. The beach itself is quite large. A wooden boardwalk runs the length of the beach and goes around the hills for a scenic walk. Many trees line the boardwalk and give needed shade for those wanting to get out of the sun. The boardwalk also has benches, and between the benches and the street are many picnic tables.The beach was really nice, and we liked it better than Bondi. If I lived here, this is where I would go.

excellent. Travelled on the ferry to Manly from circular quay, walked along the CONSO (which I presume meant concourse) and hey presto manly beach. When I went to the beach there was a surfing contest (with people from afar afield as Brazil) and also a skateboarding contest, with, Professional bands playing on the beach. very clean - lots of hire shops.

Take a ferry from Sydney to Manly!!!!!!!!!!. We had a bunch of people tell us to go to Manly beach while in Sydney and we were so glad we listened! The caught a ferry and headed over. The town is very cute with lots of shops and places to eat! The beach is excellent and has life guards. There are also places to rent beach chairs and umbrella's. We really enjoyed walking the beach and tanning. The waves were great and we were facinated by the surfer's. We had a great day at Manly and I highly recommend a side trip here from Sydney!
Lovely place!. A lovely change to the city buzz of sydney, stunning beach and a great relaxed vibe. White sand, blue water and and somewhere to eat for every taste.

Best beach in sydney. Easily the best beach in sydney a lot nicer and more peaceful than the madness that is bondi.
Much less commercialised than bondi as well which trys too hard to impress

Sydney's best beach. Actually there are loads of beaches at Manly so choose one to suit your requirements. Snorkelling and diving at Shelly Beach, surfing at Manly's main ocean beach, and water-craft at the city beach. Plus many more. The sand is great. The restaurants & cafes are fantastic and there are some great pubs. Manly is super-easy to get to from the city - on a single scenic ferry ride.

Nice Day trip. We took the ferry out with anise view of the Harbor area. Upon arrival it is a short walk to the other side of town and the beach. Beautiful area worth seeing and plenty of places to eat and shop.A fun day out and nice walk along the beach.
Manly Beach. there is a nice walk path along the beach all the way to Shelly beach. The sand is clean and the water nice. Just make sure you swim between the flags as the current is very strong.

Great beach walk. The ferry ride from Sydney to Manley Beach is an easy and comfortable ride. The town itself has lots of casual restaurants that are good for lunch before walking around the area or for dinner after your walk. There is a path all around the beach that takes you to a more sheltered area. It is an easy walk and you can go for a further distance than we did. It is not as mobbed as Bondi Beach usually is and a good alternative, especially if you are not going surfing.

Magical Manly. Such a special place - privileged to work up on the hill and live only 20 minutes commute further up the beaches. Definitely worth the bucket list and don't miss the walk around to Shelley Beach on a visit.
Busy beach!. Lots of activity in and out of the water. Plenty of surfers with their boards, which can also be rented.Long, pretty beach. Several cafes/restaurants, mostly with views.

Love it. I can still remember all the wonderful days I spent at this beach and all the great memories with my Really close friends and people I love it's so close to the city yet a million miles away from the world. The best resturants line the esplanade especially ribs and rumbs

The Best Place on Earth. I have travelled to over 40 countries and even though I have seen many amazing places nothing compares to the beauty, location, accessibility, surf, bars, restaurants, beach, closeness to a city, peacefulness, people and hospitality. If you visit you won't want to leave!

over rated. I think that the beach is so popular because it's so close to the populations centers. The beaches near Noosa Head were much better, as were the waves. However, if you live in Sydney, this is a great alternative

Great beach and marketplace to shop. This beach was a great place to stop for the afternoon. Nice sand, lots of people swimming and surfing and really fun to watch. They have tons of shops to buy gifts. The day we went, on Saturday, they had a market on the streets where we were able to get really nice and interested hand made items from locals. I highly recommend going to Manly. Nice drive from Sydney with beautiful views along the way.
Wow. Best beach in the world, surrounded by fantastic cafes and only a short ferry ride from the city, i love it!

Manly Beach a great day out for everyone.. Going down to Manly Beach for lunch is one of my favourite things to do. We quite often meet my sister and her adult kids, who live at Elizabeth Bay, on a Sunday, and they love the trip across on the ferry. There are so many places to eat, it has real community feel about it, where people of all ages and cultures enjoy a great day out. After lunch its nice to walk off lunch along the promenade under the magnificent Pine trees that line the beachfront or around to Shelley Beach along the beautiful path beside the water, then up to Fairy Bower lookouts with views over the ocean and back towards Manly and Queenscliff.
Best place in the world. Serenity, beauty , fun and so much more all in one place. From snorkelling at shelly beach to riding the waves at manly you can not miss it

Love Manly. Manly has around 8 beaches, a beautiful Harbour, a National Park with a very cool walk, a Marine Life Sanctuary for diving and snorkeling and so many beautiful pine trees... Add to that lots of great cafes, restaurants, bars and pubs.

Never a dull moment.. I have travelled the world and been to lot's of beaches and I think Manly Beach and the Manly area is one of my fav's. With everything from walks to surfing, great food and plenty of drink options. Two thumbs up.

Nice atmosphere. We visited during the Australian Open Surfing Championships, but even then, the atmosphere was very relaxed and laid back. We took the ferry from Sydney, which is a lively journey in itself. We took a leisurely walk up to Cabbage Tree Bay, past the cute pieces of art, dotted along the path. We then came back in time for a lunch of fish and chips, eaten at the picnic tables beside the beach - this seemed a very popular choice with locals and tourists alike.

Better than Bondi. Manly Beach is as long as Bondi although Bondi is wider. The water is calmer at Manly so there are more families with children. It was less crowded than Bondi too. Bondi had more young people and a single vibe. To get to Manly you need to take the ferry which is more scenic than getting to Bondi. Also the town area around Manly seemed nicer than Bondi.
man o man. what a great place I rate it better than bondi, as more places to eat and drink and all within close proxy to the beach

Family Getaway. The weather was great and it was a beautiful walk to the beach from the ferry.
The beach was spotlessly clean which is very pleasing to see.
Our only criticism is the number of people. It was packed. But we had a walk in the water and sat near by and watched the water and had coffee. A great experience.

Worth a trip. The beach is amazing and very well managed by the lifeguards. Clean and huge. A wonderful walk along the promenade with some very interesting shops and cafes. Its super just going over on the ferry which enhances your day out. give it a try you will not be disappointed.

Don't leave Sydney without going to Manly!. Just half an hour far from the city, catch the Ferry at Circular Quay (less than $15 the round ticket). The journey itself is part of the adventure. The beach is just perfect! Planning to spend the entire day is the best idea so you can walk around the bay, get to the Manly Sanctuary and enjoy any of the many shops and cafés
Spent a day there, loved the walk up to Cabbage Tree Bay. It's a lovely walk to Cabbage Tree Bay, and the rock pool is great to swim in, with changing sheds very close

Fabulous ferry trip and beach area, must visit!!!. The Manly Ferry from Circular Quay is something every visitor should do when they are in Sydney. You will get perfect photos of both Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. The Harbour truly is gorgeous and one of the best attractions Sydney has to offer. It is a great trip and Manly is such a fabulous place to visit. Make sure you do the walk to Shelly Beach as it is well protected and a perfect location to go for a swim. There are some lovely shops, restaurants and bars to watch the world go by until you catch the ferry back. A great day out!

Space, so much space. You get to ferry it out there, the restaurants are fantastic as are the different pubs to choose from. It has the best prices for souvenir shopping and worth spending a whole day out there. This way you can return to Sydney at night and check that off the must do list as well.

The beach of my dreams. I am staying with friends who live on Wentworth Street in Manly. It's a block and a half walk to what I believe is Syndey's best beach. Awesome boogie boarding waves and they offer safe swim guarded areas. This beach stretches off to the left and the water is fresh and amazing. One time got stung by a blue bottle jellyfish . . . all a part of the Aussie experience. They have open showers on the beach. Get busier in the afternoon for sure. Bring your boogie board and off you go mate! Come early by Ferry as parking is expensive and hard to find!

perfect getaway. manly offers a lot of beaches aside from the main beach, you can enjoy the bluish water on the wharf were you can glance the famous manly ferry or get a 10 minute walk to the little manly beach or shelly beach with calming waters if you're not in for the waves... such a nice place to live there for awhile..

Bondi....pffftttt!. If you are an overseas traveler with limited time in Sydney, DO NOT go to Bondi. Get on the Manly Ferry and get the cheapest and finest travel experience in Sydney. In 30 minutes you will arrive in stunning Manly. I would suggest you walk the Corso, walk from Manly Beach to Shelly Beach, and/or walk around Manly Cove along North Harbour toward Fairlight Pool. If you have a car, visit North Head for lovely views of the harbour and Sydney Skyline Manly is World Class. Have a swim in the calm clean harbour waters beside the ferry wharf, or swim in the fantastic surf at the patrolled parts of Manly ocean beach or the calmer waters of Shelly Beach which is also great for snorkelling. For lunch I would suggest fish and chips at the beach or walk around to the eastern side of Manly Cove and have a reasonably price beer and meal at the Manly 16 foot Skiff Club.

Manly Beach. I love Manly, I grew up there, but now it is just a mediocre beach because it no longer has a Promenade from the Wharf side to the Aquarium side. Perhaps Manly Council will vote to rebuild it one day. I do hope so. The squared off area for swimmers is a poor replacement for what the Promenade provided.
Just perfect. Perfect place to take the kids for a swim, surfboard hire available to keep them amused for hours. Close to shops and cafes etc.

lovely beaches. very clean and tidy beaches. manly is a very nice place, some lovely places to eat. ferry from circular quay is about $16 return but we found getting an all day ticket for $23 was good value as it allowed you all day travel

Stunning!. Highly recommended for everyone! Beautiful scenery and fantastic beach for surfers! 30mins ferry ride from Sydney and all you know you will be at this wonderful beach.Ohh don't forget to dropby to North Head scenic area! Enjoy the view off the cliff and watch the whale swim across the ocean! Great place for picnic with your love ones as you watching the sunset over the city.A must to do!!!

Iconic!. Yes, Manly Beach is an icon in the world of surfers and beach lovers and well with a visit. Though bits of the town can be a bit too 'touristy' the beach itself, backed by groves of Norfolk Pines, is lovely and deserves its reputation.

Bicycling Manly!. We visited Manly Beach during the surfing competition, but found it very easy to walk about in the morning. We decided to rent cruisers from Manly Bikes, and they were very helpful with a good map of the area bike trails. The bike trail allowed us to explore much further and enjoy a very relaxing day. Afterward, we had lunch at Manly Grill - also excellent.
A great place. A fantastic place to visit - great ferry ride and on a perfect day - lots of people and a great atmosphere - lots of restaurants and a gorgeous beach.
Surf, Sun or Swim. The Beach is great, clean with several lifeguard towers and changing rooms, plenty of places to eat along the promenade, and there are lounge chair and surfboard rentals as well.

Surf, volleyball and beers with friends. Was here last fall for surf lessons and ended up playing volleyball with some locals and sharing a few beers. The atmosphere is so amazing and the people are so friendly, it's a great place to chill for the day. A quick ferry from Sydney and this should be a place you go for the day every time you visit Sydney...I do!
Beautiful Beach. We were lucky to be there on a beautiful sunny day, so the beach was gorgeous with lots of restaurants to choose from.

A must visit. Manly is just great - shops, beach, restaurants and the overall vibe of the place. Starts and ends with a great ferry ride from Circular Quay to take in the sights. I am lucky enough to be working in Australia and make this a weekend ritual

Clean and Relaxed. The little beach next to the Ferry Terminal is excellent for children, quiet, chilled out and clean. The big beach on the other side of Manly was a little mad on the day we were there, Lots of Surfers, Lots of kids Skateboarding (there was an exhibition in the town centre) Lots of Families, but it still kept its Chilled out Relaxed feeling, loved every minute at Manly.

Stunning. Take the ferry from Wharf 3 to Manly and you won't be disappointed. Apart from the lovely views en route, the place itself is a world apart from Sydney. Laid back and calm, many beaches and good walks. Well worth a visit.

Lovely beach after pleasant 1/2 hour ferry ride.. Very popular sandy beach with locals and tourists alike. Well served for shops, cafes and restaurants, banks etc along a pedestrianised area running down to the seafront. Nice long promenade.

Great beach just 30 minutes by ferry.. We highly recommend a sidetrip to Manly Beach...wonderful setting, swimming, surfing, wide beach. Stroll on the Corso among the various tourist shops, or have lunch at a side street restaurant or cafe. Just 30 minutes from downtown Sydney on the ferry, which offers plenty of Sydney Harbour views enroute. Do it!

One of the iconic beaches of the world. I have never understood why Manly Beach is not as famous as Bondi because it is a much much nicer beach and facilities are beyond comparison.From just a quick paddle of the toes to a full day of strolling along the esplanade, it should be on every to do list.Beware of the parking fees right at the beach - highway robbery would be a good description - if you turn up any of the side streets there a plenty of free spots or much cheaper spots.The food choices along the beach road and down the Corso will keep ANY taste well satisfied. Window shop a bit to find the best prices.

Beautiful beach. If you do the hop on, hop off bus, this is included as one of the places to go. Otherwise, you can get a city bus out there. It is a gorgeous beach, considered one of the top in the world. Be aware, tops are optional for women.

Great beach. If you visit Sydney, do yourself a favour, grab your swimmers and jump on a ferry to Manly. You'll see the harbour and be able to enjoy an iconic Sydney beach, then have great coffee at one of the seaside cafes.

Delightful. My husband and I spent our winter traveling - HI - Philippines - Thailand - Sydney .... and dare we say the beaches in Sydney are the most delightful. Manly Beach and the town are a delight. Clean clear water, not over crowded, friendly locals, great food/restaurants, very walkable town, and wonderful Manly walkway from Manly beach - Shelly Beach (must see) and Northern Beaches, fabulous weather, great transit (we easily took 2 trains and a ferry from Potts Point to Manly) and they have free filtered water stations everywhere to refill water bottles! Wonderful. I must see.

Manley Town and Beach - well worth a visit. Vist Manley and its fantastic beach by taking the ferry from Sydney. Ferry takes 30 minutes and is very nice taking you past all the major sites. The short walk from the ferry through to the beach is very pleasant and the beach its self excellent. There are changing facilities. In Manly apart from the beach you also get good shops and many good cafes and restaurants to suit all tastes and pockets.

Clean beaches. The views across Manly beach are stunning. There are sheltered bays for smaller children but also some good waves for body boarders or surfers. The nearby restaurants and bars have tasty menus, with most having lunch and dinner specials for $10!

So much to do. Manly, it has something for everyone. You can Ferry to Manly from the City, you can bus to Manly from nearly anywhere. There's harbour beach on one side, ocean beach on the other, restaurants too many to name & markets on the weekend. For a cheap & cheerful meal, try out the Manly 16 footers skiff club for a great meal at club prices - provided you don't live int he area!!

Beautiful seaside Sydney suburb. The most beautiful way to come to Manly Beach in Sydney is definitely on the Manly Ferry. The trip is stunning with amazing views of Sydney Harbour all the way up to North Head in Manly. Once we arrived we headed straight to the beach! It's a short 5 minute walk from Manly Wharf so make sure you don't get confused and think the small beach you see when you get off the ferry is the beautiful Manly beach! :p We enjoyed a great day and even rented a bike from Manly Bike Tours and rode a section of the Manly Scenic Walkway. There were so many restaurants, it was hard to chose, but we settled on the Steyne for a cold beer and then off to Four Pines (4 Pines) Manly's local brewery where we had excellent food and went on the Brewery Tour. It was a massive day but we loved every minute of it!
Lovely Beach. Easy trip to on a ferry fromCircular Quay. Lovely seaside town with a lovely beach. Plenty of shops and places to eat. A good place to have fish & chips.

Get it All at Manly Beach. Manly Beach is by far one of my favorite beaches! While I was in Manly, I was told Manly Beach is one of five of the world's surfing reserves and had to try a surf lesson while there. I hopped on the Manly ferry, walked through the Corso (the main street in Manly) and was right at the beach in no time. I enjoyed the waves, cool water temperatures, surfing and lying on the soft sand. Walking around Manly Beach was fun and easy too, with loads of shops and bars/restaurants/cafes to check out. I would for sure go back again and explore more at Manly Beach!
Great beach. Long white sandy beach, lots of restaurants and cafes. Shops etc. a bit like a typical UK seaside town in the sun. Nice trip on the ferry from Circular Quay.

Wow what a beach!. Short trip by ferry this is a must for any visitor to Sydney. Nice shops great beach but the best one is a small one to the SW called Shelley beach about 15 min walk from Manly. Everything is just so Australian from bronzed gods and goddesses to beautiful clean beaches. Just fantastic for a quiet and relaxing day out. Beach cafe was good vfm - alcohol with food only and no alcohol on the beach. Safe swimming and soft sand the Aussies have got it right here.

Best Beach in Sydney!. I absolutely LOVED this beach. Safe for swimming, lots of sand and great snorkelling. We actually snorkelled all the way from Manly to Shelly Beach and saw heaps of sea life. The surf was alright the couple of days we were there and the town of Manly is charming with lots of good shops and restaurants for either dine in or takeaway in the area.

Lovely area and easy ferry ride from Sydney. Fast, scenic and inexpensive ride from Sydney Harbour. Loved walking around this beach town. Watched the surfers for hours than did some shopping before haveing a light snack and beer. Quite a relaxing day in a lovely setting.

Forget the boring stuff.. head here.. Great beach, after a short walk from the ferry... great for all and plenty around it.. BUT... kids. Poor swimmers beware.. there are bad `Ripe tides` They basically drag u out to sea..

Sand not as good as Bondi, but less crowded. First beach we visited in Sydney and something to remember. Even though it is very touristy - it is spaced enough that even in summer it doesnt feel as crowded as Bondi sometimes can. Try the Manly walkway for a scenic break

Walk the length of Manly. I took the ferry from Central Key, to Manly, and walked the length of the high street to the opposite side of Manley, then walked to Cabbage Tree bay the walk was lovely taking in the views and watching the suffers, loved the whole experience. Cabbage Tree bay is a quiet bay with a few families who were enjoying the cool summer breeze, I wished I had taken my swimming costume as the water was so inviting. Climbed to the top of the hill to take in the views, waning if you don't like spiders don't do this walk!!Had a great lunch in a small restaurant overlooking Manley Bay, then took a slow walk back to the Ferry looking in the many shops.The Ferry trip back to Circular Key was great the sun was just starting to go down and views were amazing.

Great Sydney surfing beach. Huge expanse of sandy beach; Great for surfers and volleyball players. Great for families as well as long as you keep "between the flags" to avoid the rip tides. Excellent long promenade for walking, jogging, cycling (beware the speed- merchants!). Good selection of prom-side eateries for brekkie, brunch, lunch and dinner.

Good to see again. This is one of the "must see" places and its a very pleasant ferry journey to get there from Circular Quay in Sydney.There are a couple of great hotels down the road to the beach from the ferry and both have rooftop food and drink venues with spectacular views.Even on a busy day the beach has plenty of room but do swim where it is marked as safe to do so.

wet day at Manly. Weather was abit gloomy when I was there, on and off drizzling. They had lots of cafes and shops, its a perfect balance of beach, good food and shopping. every girls paradise! (Although some sun would had been nice)

Large beach with good waves. I am not a surfer but there are always a good number of surfers out on the water at Manly beach. There are also several beach volley ball nets on the beach. It's large enough to find a quiet spot too. Lovely golden sand!
Nice place to spend a day. Better than Bondi, a nice beach, promenade and shops. Only 25 mins on ferry from the circular quay. A nice easy going feel to the area.
Better than Bondi beech. A great beech we took the ferry from Cicular quay the3 sand was spotless and there's plenty of shops & food outlets to choose from well worth a visit
Beautiful beach. Hard to believe you are in a bustling city when you go to Manly. It is so calm and relaxed, great pub on the beachfront to have a drink. perfect sands and waves.

Wonderful Beach. Had enjoyable ferry ride there from Circular Quay and really liked this place, far better than Bondi. Much more character and quieter. A really nice setting and walk along front. Shops etc just away from beach is a nice area as well/ Thoroughly recommended.

Stunning. Much better and less busy than Bondi, plenty of decent shops, eateries and a really nice beach to soak up the sun or enjoy walks, even as you exit the wharf there is a little beach to the right which s lovely and next to a bar too as well as a worthwhile visit to Manly sea life centre, you could definetly make a couple of days out of Manly without a doubt and to catch the ferry too is great as they depart C. Quay early and depart Manly back there late so plenty of time to enjoy.

Great beach and shops. Starting the visit from sydney harbour you get the best view. Manley beach not a great swimming beach as lots of very dangerous rips, so swimming lane small. Fun watching surfers.
class resort. its like passing throught to the classic 20's in this elegant resort of sydney- fab beach - great bars resteraunts - shops - walks - well worth a day

As good as Bondi Beach. We had been recommended to visit Manly instead of Bondi. As it turned out we visited both. They were equally interesting although the food was generally cheaper at Manly and the variety of shops as you take the short walk from the ferry to the beach were more varied.
beautifull. This area of Australia is amaxzing a definate place to visit - trhe beach is perfect and has good shops
FUN. Manly Beach was one of my favorites. Breathtaking views...beaches..shops. Relaxed atmosphere that makes you feel at home. Ferry ride is 30 minutes but the views are amazing.

Beautiful. Manly beach is still one of the loveliest beaches in Sydney. Loads of nice tall old palm trees along the beach front. Always so clean & the sand is great not dirty & sticky. Lifesavers & flags so safe for swimming at.

Such a pretty quaint spot. It is a beach town and has lots of tourist shops, but it is also very pretty and the Corso street walkway is lovely. The views of the beach along the boardwalk were great. It has a great feel and the ferry ride over is stunning. It is a great spot to have lunch by the water.
Lovely beach. This is a great beach to visit with magnificient sand and lovely surf. We took lots of wonderful photos

another beach to visit. Taking a ship to Manly beach at weekend, walking around the manly beach and visiting a weekend market here. Lots of people and tourist around, kinda packed.. but it worth to visit..

Fantastic place. Such a good spot to either just sit and watch people go past or lay on the sand. was a really clean beach, always packed with people. Manly as whole was great, always a good pub or café you could stop at to eat, always something happening along the corso. definitely a place you must visit in Sydney.
Heaven right outside. I visited a friend who lives right in front of this beach. I wished I had her life. The inky thing I didn't like personally was that it was a little too packed with people.

Awesome Beach Environment. I had a great day at Manly. Not only did they have a surf competition, but the weather wasn't too hot so I was able to do the Manly scenic walk. After visiting the beach I would recommend doing the scenic walk around Manly you will find some hidden gems out in Manly.

Visit Manly when you are in Sydney- you won't regret it. Had free time today so hied over to Manly Beach. Wasn't able to take the ferry this time but the trip was worth it. Walked to one end which I've never visited- Shelly Beach where saw people snorkeling in the shallow waters. The hike took about 20 minutes with cooling gusty winds helping to keep me cool despite the afternoon sun. Spent some time checking out some of the stores lining up the street leading to the beach and ended the afternoon with some fish and chips and coffee. Good way to spend the afternoon.

Rustic and Beautiful Beach. This beach is stunning in its natural beauty. I did find swimming in the water more challenging than in beautiful Bondi Beach though. The water here is more murky and not as clean as at Bondi. Could have been the time of year too I suppose. It was fun watching the life guards practice though : )

lots of atmosphere. we went here a couple of times on the ferry from circular quay. There is a variety of things to do and lots of shops and eateries - I recommend The Fish Shack - along with two great beaches. What's not to love?

Manly Beach. Lovely stretch of beach to visit. Plenty of restaurants along the beach front and also the Manly Wharf area. Take a walk along the promenade to Queenscliff Beach. It takes about 20 minutes but just a lovely area to visit.
Beaches. If you want to choose between Manly and Bondi, in my opinion go to Manly, its just nicerBondi is ok, but a bit too commercial for me

stunning ocean beach. Huge surf on day we visited--great watching.hired bikes --great way to look around shore and out to heads(some moderate hills)stunning views back to city.found a fab restaurant for lunch on foreshore.

Very modest beach in Manly. Manly is one of Sydney’s most popular seaside destinations. Full of attractions and exciting activities including Manly Beach, Ocean world, kayaking, swimming, tennis, golf, beach volleyball, roller blading, scenic and historical walks, art, parasailing, scuba diving, fishing, dining and so much more. Manly is the perfect destination for Sydney visitors. To reach there, I took ferry from Circular Quay. Frequency of ferry is every half an hour for going to Manly. It takes thirty minutes to reach Manly Wharf from Circular Quay. Return fare is 14.80 AUD. The scenic ferry ride through the harbour passes close to The Heads, where the sandstone cliffs at the harbour meet the ocean. It's just a 5-minute walk along the Corso from Manly Wharf to the oceanfront promenade that's lined with Norfolk Island pine trees.Manly is one of the suburbs that you will find in the northern part of Sydney. It is in the state of New South Wales, Australia. Manly is only 17 kilometers from the central business district of Sydney, so get if you want to visit Manly. This is also the administrative center of Manly Council’s local government area. This is in the Northern Beaches Region.Manly is famous for its amazing beaches. The beaches in this place attract so many tourists. If you go to Manly, you will truly enjoy the sandy beaches that stretch from the Queenscliff Beach up until the North Steyne Beach to Manly Beach. In the peninsula of Manly, you will also find a lot of beaches near or on the harbour. The prominent icon that symbolizes the beaches and the ocean of Manly is the Norfolk Island Pine.The Corso is the central commercial area of Manly. This stretches from the harbour side down to the Manly Wharf until it reaches Manly Beach. There is a mall in Corso where most people go because it allows outdoor dining in the restaurants and cafes in the area. More cafes and restaurants surround the area in the neighboring streets near the place. These areas are very close to or on the beaches and harbour. It is a good place to explore Northern Sydney.
It Ain't Bondi. Beautiful beach and more of a locals beach. If you're in tourist mode, Bondi Beach and the walk to Coogie trump Manly every time.

Relatively unattractive. Compared to most Australian beaches Manly is unattractive, backed by unattractive buildings.
Personally I find the whole suburb...well...unattractive. Was disappointed by it.

Lovely ferry ride to and fro. The ferry ride to Manly beach makes the entire experience worth while. The beach is lovely but very little else at the beach area for tourists. Worth while but not a must while in Sydney

Hurley surf Competition week!. Having been in Sydney a couple of years ago we missed Manly, this time we went back, twice!
During the first weekend of the Hurley Surf Comp, loved it down there. Great atmosphere, a good selection of shops, nice beach. Much prefer it to Bondi I think, much more relaxed and laid back vibe here.

Love Manly Beach. Love the ferry trip over to Manly every time we visit Sydney we do this trip. The beach is a lovely area to just sit and watch the passing parade, enjoy the street performers in the mall and have a meal at one of the many eating places.

quite simply the best surf beach in the world. You want to surf - go here You want to tan - go hereYou want to watch the groovy people - go hereYou want clean beaches - go hereYou want clean clear surf to swim in - go hereYou want a golden sandy beach to lye on - go hereIts the best surf beach in the world - no question !GO here !!

Popular with tourists. It's a nice beach but small if it does not also include Queensliff and North Steyne beaches. Some nice cafes/restaurants to eat and wile away the day, people watching or just enjoying the atmosphere. Check out Dee Why beach nearby, just as nice a beach as Manly (nicer in my opinion) minus the hordes of backpackers and overseas visitors.

Magnificent!. A nice fine sand and a perfect blue water welcomes you as soon as you reach the pier to the beach. Shops are just 3-5 minutes walk away from the beach. A relaxing atmosphere perfect for hot sunny days. Great for families to spend their Sunday weekends as the ferry coming from CBD is cheap and comes in every 15-20 minutes.
Perfect surf beach. I visited this beach during the 2014 Australian surf open. Relaxing vibe and a great contrast to Sydney for the short ferry trip.Highly recommended

If You Like Big Surf. This is your place to be. Pretty expensive but beautiful restaurants, beaches so clean and so welcomed by all. You will have a great time. f you don't fancy being smashed by the waves then there are sea swimming pools or you could walk on down to Shelley Beach which is lovely as no surf and very gentle.....

Nice Beach Day. Coming in by ferry, we walked the few blocks to Manly Beach. Even though this was summer here, the beach was not overly crowded. There were lots of benchs available if you wanted to just people or ocean watch. Checked out a few of the stores along the way, and actually did a little shopping. Great little town with good food, even in the supermarket.
Busy beach. This is a safe sandy beach with life savers and warnings if the rip tide is coming in. But it is busy a holiday times but nobody seemed to care.

Beach is Beautiful!. Coming from sunny Queensland I thought our beaches were the best. Visiting Manly beach was wonderful stop on a sunny day. Didn't go swimming but the view is wonderful and the beach looked superb. Was a wonderfully good looking beach indeed!

This place is a must!. Especially if you have kids. If you're in Sydney on hols, you gotta go here. Gorgeous soft sand. Plenty of changing places and showers to clean off. But bring a beach towel, flip flops and a hat!. It's a nice surf, you can go out to sea to experience the waves. I went in Feb, beautiful sunny day @ 28 deg. The walk from the ferry to the beach takes you past shops, quite expensive, even for souvenirs. Walk round to Shelly beach. Got to be done. On the way theres a tidal pool, great for kids and large lizards in the grass
Great looking place.. I didn't go swimming but it has very relaxed atmosphere. The walk along its promenade was enjoyable and the restaurants and places near it add a great atmosphere.

Stunning.. Stayed in Manly so the walk to the beach was easy not so going back as it is quite hilly but the bus service is cheap and regular.Great beaches choose whatever suits you from lively to deserted.

The cool thing to do on a sweltering Sydney day. Heat waves sear Sydney with temperatures soaring to mid- 30 degrees. yep,its another Sydney scorcher and the only sane relief, is Manly beach,of-course. Skip driving,catch an A/C bus or cruisey ferry. Check your tote...towel,sunscreen,swimmwers & sunnies..check. Its a grand place with frolicky waves,white crested and glistening . The glimmering sun shines through the tall palm trees. Shoes off.... let your tootsies feel the bare feet therapy. Grab a beef kebab,filled generously....what else do you need? or grilled fish and chips? I asked for the chips to be cooked crispy,so the seagulls wont be getting any scraps. Sit on the pier and enjoy the uninterrupted ocean view... its heaven. We plunge into the cooling surf...simply magic. Later we settle into a cool bar for chilled drinkies. A beautiful day,long and so-so Sydney.
Lovely hidden gem of Sydney. We took the ferry over which went past all the sights of the Harbour. Lovely beach with great Cafes and sights to see. Would love to stay there in the future.
Very pretty ans tranquil spot. We did not spend much time on the beach, but it sure was nice to look at. Manly is such a nice get away from the hustle of Sydney.

Nice beach. Lots of people at manly but a lot quieter than Bondi. There's a nice walk you can do along the cliff. Shops are great and there's a pub on every corner just aboutFound the best cafe opposite the beach also with the best coffee.
Beautiful!. Much better than bondi - lovely beach to walk along with not so many tourists! Manly town was lovely as well :-)

Manly beach was very littered :(. We had heard that Manly beach was beautiful so took ferry out there. The place looked amazing, but unfortunately the beach and water was full of rubbish. Plastic bags wrapped around our legs as we waded in, floater in the water! Plastic cups, take out containers, etc...Coincidently, there were people on the pavements campaigning for litter free Manly beaches. I guess there is a problem there which is such a shame as the beaches and walks were amazingly beautiful. Would definitely go again though...

No place like Manly!. hmmmm what a glorious spot with the white sand and blue waters lapping the shoreline. Very relaxed and laid back with a huge choice of cafes to coffee and lunch at. The people are very friendly and helpful which relates to living in such a beautiful spot.Do it! you wont regret!
fantastic beach. visited manley beach the food was fantastic could not believe the oysters and sea food just unbelievable a real must If you visit sydney

Gorgeous beaches. Visited Manly for an afternoon which wasnt really long enough as the journey for us from Darling Harbour took about 1.5hours because of the wait between catching different ferries to get there. From Circular Quay it takes 1/2 hour. The beaches are really lovely and some are quieter, especially near where you catch the ferry.

A short ferry ride from Sydney Harbour. Manly beach was clean, safe, and relaxing. Tall pine trees line the walk and the beach. Restaurants galore. Only a few touristy shops and they were pleasantly reasonbly priced. Lounge chair rentals was $15 pp per day.

Worth a visit. We loved Manley many of the Australians we met on a cruise recommended we went there and we weren't disappointed. It is a such a lovely place the beach is spotless and the life guards take their jobs so seriously they are continually on the loud speakers reminding swimmers to stay in the safe area. We stopped for coffee in a beachside cafe and ended up eating lunch as the food looked and smelt so good.
Surfing!!!. I surfed here back in 2007 while I was in Australia for 22 days. It was a very nice and clean beach.

Very nice. The day we caught the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly, the lifeguards had closed the sea due to the dangerous tides/waves/rip. This did not spoil our trip, we had a great day then spent some time at Manly Wharf where the children swam in safety.

One of the many relaxing ways to enjoy a day in Sydney. Manly has a very holiday-like feeling, it's worth spending a day to explore both the "harbour beaches" and the "ocean beaches", walk up and down the corso, have some delicious fish... Manly helps you understand the many options Sydneysiders have when they decide to "go the beach". It's fun to watch the surfers, schoolkids actually seem to learn surfing as a part of their PE classes - how great is that?? If you see a funny bright blue thing washed up on the beach, be careful - it's a bluebottle jellyfish and you don't want to touch it!

What a beautiful beach and neighborhood!. We took a 30 minute beautiful ferry from Circular Quay in Sydney to Manly. The great beach is a ten minute walk from the ferry terminal, through the Corso, a pedestrian mall full of shops. The area is charming and well worth a visit, and lunch or a drink at one of the local joints. You'll like it.

Manly Beach - very busy. We took the packed ferry to Manly on New Years day, expected it to be busy and it certainly was. Great views from ferry of both Sydney Harbour and Manly. We stopped at the Bavarian bar on the harbour for a very good lunch and walked along through part of the town (nothing special) before joining the corso to take a leisurely stroll back to the ferry terminal. When we left Sydney Harbour the sun had been shining and it was very warm, at Manly it became overcast, misty with a much cooler feel as the breeze picked up. This did impact on our enjoyment of Manly, the breeze is something to be aware of if coming for a day trip, you may need a top with sleeves as it becomes cooler and if the sun is shining loads of sun screen. I was expecting Manly to be nicer than Bondi from the info I'd read, but both my partner and I can honestly say we preferred Bondi much more.

Great Place!. Love Manly Beach! Nice big long beach, plenty of room. Crystal clear water. Does get very busy on a nice day. Loads around on the foreshore. Can surf when there is swell! Lots of great looking girls around.Whats not to like!

Escape the heat. Always a strong breeze at Manly beach. It seems to be the place to be seen. There's loads of shops and cafes and it really is a great place to grab an icecream and escape the heat. Quite a few tables and seats along the foreshore in the shade of the pines too for those who don't want to get out on the sand
nice beach. A much better beach than Bondi and not as many people there.Plenty of places to eat and drink.There are a couple of nightclubs there that can get "a bit lively" at night
Yep, it's a beach. I've been to many beaches and I didn't think it was particular pretty or nice compared to the others. It was fun to watch the surfers/body boarders.

It's an Australian beach, what more do you want. Previous visitors told me that they favour Manly over Bondi, but I couldn't split them. After a couple of hours of variously swimming & people-watching, I ventured along the beach to the enclosed pool & beyond, where chatting to a local who recommended Freshwater Bay just over the hill which was also very good. Give it a try.jw

Manly Beach is full of fun!. Took the ferry to Manly and walked down to the beach a hot and sunny day in Sydney. Full of happy families and young people. Clean beach and park area, great atmosphere, lots of restaurants to chose from. Bought a "Fish Shack Pack" for late lunch, sat on the wall by the park to eat it, people watching. A wonderful experience I thought.

Manly. To get to Manly you travel on the ferry which gives you a great view of the harbour. Manly is great, a lovely beach nice bars/restaurants. Make sure you take a trip (we Cycled) to North Head. This gives you stunning views of the entrance to Sydney harbour and vistas of the city.

worth the day trip!. brilliant day out at Manly! the ferry ride there and back is beautiful! the market they had when we were there had a few fun souvenirs to buy, fabulous view of the sunset from the pier near Hugo's. make time on your trip and go to Manly!!

Manly Beach. This beach was so lovely we spent a morning here and would love to have spent more time on it!! Very clean and wasn't too busy either unlike Bondi. Some great little restaurants too just up on the road and also some fab shops!!

Don't underestimate the power of the sun. You catch the ferry from Sydney harbour which is quick. Get off and walk straight down one wide street with all sorts of shops (tip -the stuff gets cheaper towards the beach) onto the beach. It's was lively when we were there, with lots of activities going on. Whatever you do - be aware of the power of the sun - it is true - you need strong sun block, a hat and drink plenty of water. Just saying :-)

A Nice Day Trip. Hopping on the ferry to Manly Beach was a great way to see Sydney from the water and to get to a fun beach. The ferry only takes about half an hour so try to sit up on the top for the view if you can. Beside the beautiful beach, Manly has lots of shops and restaurants to spend time in. Only certain areas of the beach are advisable for swimming. Surfers are in other areas.

Beautiful beach, great shops. Take the ferry from Sydney harbour across the bay to Manley for a great day out. The half hour trip is great and offers fabulous views of all the harbour sights. Manley itself is compact with good bathing on both sides of the peninsula and a good selection of restaurants, bars, shops etc.. Great fun!

Fantastic Beach. Manly is a great place to visit or stay and enjoy the beach or the coastal walk. There is also The Pantry which is an awesome place for breakfast, lunch or dinner stiuated on the walkway/beach looking out over the ocean. A great way to spend a day!

Excursion to Manley Beach.. Caught the ferry to Manley Beach. Very hot and very busy, also a lot of flies. The locals prefer Manley to Bondi. I would rate them the same. The local shops are a must. Lots of variety and not too expensive

Good combo of scenic boat trip and relaxing beach resort. We took the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay (AUD$14.80 adult return) which was a good experience in itself - with picturesque views of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House, the Sydney Harbour area (including The Heads) and of Manly suburb. Although there are small strips of sand either side of the wharf, once docked, head straight over the road onto The Corso which is a pedestrianised shopping precinct with opportunities to pick up a souvenir. This leads to the main Manly Beach area which stretches for some distance.It’s mainstream, with a promenade and shoreline bordered with properties - some residential, some commercial. The bulk of the eating places appear to be at The Corso area of the promenade although we found a decent enough little café to have pizza for lunch further along North Steyne (left as you face the beach). The beach is golden sand, very spacious and attracts loads of surfers. We only paddled in at the edge of the water to cool our toes!The place wasn’t overly busy and I preferred it to Bondi Beach which is similar but appeared a bit more commercial.As others on TA mention, well worth a short trip if you’ve got a few hours to spare combining the scenic boat trip with a attractive beach location.
Amazing. Amazing place to rest and relax. One of the most beautiful place that I've ever seen. Good to walk or just relaxe.
Clean and relaxed. Great atmosphere at Manly. Watch out for the sharks though although the lifeguards are all over them!

Everything you expect an Aussie Beach to be!. Golden sand, wide walkway, loads of lifeguards, rowing teams racing in the bay, everything was as I had expected an Aussie Beach to be, loads of good coffee shops and other quaint shops, clean toilets and a really efficient ferry trip from Circular Quay across to Manly.Would happily go back again.

Manly Beach beats Bondi by fad. Manly Beach has it all. Beautiful beach within walking distance from the Corso, shops, fresh water, skate and surf shops, cool bars and restaurants all with views direct to the beach. Stayed at the Novotel with my son who is a keen surfer and skater.Definitely boho and laid back here. Boutiques and markets rock on the weekends. Going back for more.

Awesome!. Great beach. Awesome waves to swim in, just stay between the flags.
Awesome ferry ride from CQ. Get in line early so you have prime spot on the ferry ride.
Great place to rent a bike, go for a walk, or, just grab a beer or anything you want
Awesome place!
Rich....Stony Brook, NY USA

Beautiful Beach and promenade. Enjoy the beach area or the nearby shops and restaurants. Take the ferry back to Sydney for a scenic ride. We took a tour of Northern beaches and waterfronts from Sydney and the tour let us off at Manly beach. We then took a ferry back to Sydney.
Second best beach. I would say this is the second best beach in Sydney. After Bondi. Great beach to do surfing and there is a marathon track where we can have lovely walk along side the sea.

awesome day at manly beach sunshine and good times. This has to be one of the best beaches in Australia. Great cafes and bars, beautiful people and some epic waves to be had. Great time in manly and will definitely be back one day.

Manly is Awesome!. Rent some bikes and go for a spin! Great beach, scenery and eats!
Went for a 2 hour ride up to some great look outs and then down the coast on the way back.

Beautiful Beach. The beach here is quite something, with people using it in many ways. There is an extended sitting wall for watchers, a very wide expanse of the softest we have ever felt beach sand for sun bathers, a gentle grade into the water (we waded a bit) for the touch your toes in set, and some pretty good waves for surfers. Lifeguards in abundance were calling people in and out of the water from time to time.

Escape the city for a bit .... Manly Beach is a lovely ferry ride out of Circular Quay and gives you a chance to have a nice view of the Sydney Opera House from the water. It has a lovely Sandy beach but I enjoy the board walk that runs to the right hand side as you face the water from the beach. This takes you to a small bay where there is a great little restaurant called 'Le Kiosk' ... Nice for a lunch before walking back towards the main beach and town.

Lovely beach. Beautiful beach and reasonable selections of restaurants and bars nearby. Journey there on the ferry from Circular Quay lives up to its reputation and I would also recommend a (pricey) German beer at the Bavarian bar by the ferry terminal. Tschus!

Better than Bondi!. We visited this beach on our visit to Sydney and we thought it was way better than Bondi! The beach is spectacular and the color of the water is unbeatable!Nice places to eat and drink around.

More than a busy beach. Go exploring...... We got the public ferry from Central Quay to Manly. The ferry arrives on the opposite side of Manly from the main beach. Before you head to the main beach......Explore the area where the ferry drops you off. There are some nice places for fish and chips over looking the harbour. The beach on this side is also relatively quiet. Where the beach is on the ferry terminal side take a walk to the Sealife Centre, then keep walking past the Sealife Centre, along a path, up some stairs, and you'll have an amazing view from the top of the stairs. We sat at the top for ages just admiring the view. It's only a few steps, easy for all ages.For the main beach, you get off the ferry, and it's a very short walk down the main shopping street. The beach is very nice, and clean, and great for surfing, but it was also very busy as it was a public holiday. After half an hour we headed back to the beach near the ferry terminal as it was very quiet.Plenty of shopping opportunities, and places to eat. We very easily spent the whole day here relaxing. It feels a million miles away from the centre of Sydney when you're relaxing here but it's only a short ferry ride away.Well worth a visit

Best beach ever?. I have Manly up there with Cottesloe in Perth. The ferry trip itself (from Circular Quay) would make Manly special, and I also enjoyed the Corso and the cricket oval there.
Lovely beach, with gorgeous swimming at the south end, and only a short walk to Shelly Beach.
gorgeous. We were fortunate to be staying in Manly, so we tooj the opportunity to visit the beach here and it wss so nice. Very clesn, goof surf anf plenty of life guards.

Nice day at the Beach!. One of the great things about Sydney is that you can just hop on a ferry from Circular Quay and get to the beach any nice day. The ride over itself has beautiful harbor views. Manly Beach - a lovely scenic beach - ample sand to lay a blanket on, or there are stone steps that you can just sit on and watch the view. Nice beach to take a walk on. There are lifeguards at the beach who constanty monitor and move the signs/pennants so that you know exactly what part of the beach is safe to swim in. This is also a great place to eat your lunch although the seagulls can be quite loud and aggressive. There are many shops/restaurants/ice cream lining the walk to the beach. A wonderful afternoon or day stay .

Pretty beach, busy though. High energy beach that is very scenic. Busy place with crowds of people. The shops are a little disappointing but the beach is lovely. The ferry ride from circular quay is worth the trip!

Home Sweet Home. Like a dream, you walk to work on the beach in the morning, relax with friends over a coffee and watch the waves, enjoy time with friends on pure white sand and rolling waves... watch the sunset from your surfboard at dusk....walk along the beach home at dusk...

Nice suburb, with a great beach and some nice restaurants. To me Manly already starts at Sydney Circular Quay. Get a ferry ticket for 15$, wait a couple of minutes with some ice cream from one of the shops there. Get on the boat, enjoy the views for 30 minutes and get of the boat in Manly. Cross the mall and go to the beach, get some lunch or coffee and just walk around. At the wharf in Manly you can get some food, fancy meals with a view if you like or just grab a pizza of some thaifood and enjoy the view and sunset at the wharf.Life's good at Manly. Get back to the Circular Quay and realize, you wanna get back to Manly as soon as possible on a sunny day.

Volleyball on the beach!. What a cool walk form the Ferry to the beach! A lot of shops & restaurants. Now...when you get to the beach it's beautiful. What a fun vibe. One of the best parts it has sets of volleyball courts & you can get in a game easily. It helps that everyone is super friendly!

Not as nice as other beaches in Sydney. Went here but I didnt think it was anything compared to other beaches in Sydney like Palm Beach, Bondi and Coogee.The boat trip is lovely out here and its great to see and get away from the hustle and bustle of city life but nothing out of this world

Fun in the Sun. Not only is Manly Beach scenic, beautiful and relaxing, the trip there on the ferry is its own harbor tour. We didn't know how long we'd stay but we almost made a full day of it. After wandering down the Corso to the big beach, we had a leisurely stroll with gorgeous views on the boardwalk over to Shelly Beach. Back to Manly and a short walk in the surf, followed by a pub visit for drinks and lunch with a priceless beach view. We then visited the little weekend market, browsed the many shops, enjoyed a gelato and finally returned to Circular Quay. Sitting outside on the ferry offers unparalleled views of the iconic Sydney landmarks and scattering sailboats as the lumbering ferry parts the waters offer additional entertainment. Spectacular!
Beautiful!. Manly Was a beautiful beach to visit. It's one of my favorite beaches I've ever been to! Definitely recommend a visit here!

Nice friendly place. It is a great place and buzzing with people. The only problem we had was we were attacked by huge flies wherever we walked in Manly. I'm not sure why they loved our faces but they did even after spraying insect repellent, and so we left the beach alot sooner than we wanted :(

Great beach!. One of Sydneys greatest beaches and an altogether nice place to visit.Can be very busy at weekends but seems to add to the fun! Take the Manly fast ferry from the Aquarium on Darling Harbour ,great value stopping off at various different spots along the way to further enhance the experience!

Nice and Clean. After the ferry ride from Sydney we walked down to the beach along the walkway. Very nice and clean and surfing is permitted when the waves are high. Plenty of restaurants around and food variety is aplenty. nice day trip from the crowds in Sydney.

Paradise in Sydney. First, to get there make sure you take the old ferry, not the new one. That way you'll get a better view of the sights in the harbour and experience the rocking as you cross the heads. We loved being able to visit two distinct beaches - one on the harbor side and 150 yards away one on the Pacific Ocean. . You can't beat a fish and chips lunch on the sand.
beautiful. bit scared when a shark was sighted but beautiful beach with good waves for body boarding!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

best beach in Sydney. Although you have to do the tourist thing and go to Bondi and Coogee, most people seem to agree Manly is actually the nicer beach. It also requires a nice ferry ride so you get to see the whole length of the harbour as part of the outing which makes it special. good walks along the coast too.recommended

beautiful beaches and great walks. we caught the ferry from the Rocks for the day, was a great day, Manly is beautiful spot, great beach and great walk down to another sheltered beach for snorkelling. Plenty of great food places too.

Just fantastic. the people, the views, the vibe, the food, the relaxed atmosphere - everything about Manly is fantastic, cool but not in any way pretencious. Watch the sun rise and set at either end of the Corso and enjoy it.

Great Beach, better than bondi. This is a really nice Beach! In my opinion better than bondi. I took the ferry from the Circular Quay and after 20-30 minutes. I arrived at the beach. From the ferry you can see all the harbour, the opera house and the harbour bridge and a big view of the city. In Manly there are lots of cheap shops and lots of local people. The sea is clean and beautiful and the Beach is really enjoyable.

Beautiful beaches, lovely promenade.. Loved the walk to Shelly Beach, but found the Corso a bit like Sydney by the beach, which it is, but it almost felt you were not escaping anywhere. Loved the Water Dragons basking along the promenade.

Manly. Just go you will not be disappointed, once you get off the Ferry its an easy walk to the beach down the pedestrian walk way, passing lots of shops en route in case you need anything or want to grab a gift before going home.

Dirty. Steps to the beach were covered in rubbish, and locals sitting on steps drinking, locals showed thier dislike of visitors would not go again if it was not for the great resturant we went to called the garfish, and the awsome ferry trip to get there......toilets too were a disgrace ewww!!!!

Brilliant day out. I went to Manly for the day taking the ferry from the circular key. Firstly you have the pleasure of a ferry trip to Manly that lasts about 15-20 mins that takes you straight past the opera house and harbour bridge giving you perfect views and great opportunity for photos.Manly is like a seaside town as there are loads of shops, bars and restaurants to visit. The beach is very long and had some great waves. Manly was busy so not for anyone who does not enjoy busy beaches but I really enjoyed it. Overall i preferred Manly beach to Bondi.There is a little hidden jem beach at Manly if you head to the right of the beach. By taking a 10 minutes walk it takes you to a smaller beach that is quiter and will gives you great views of Manly beach, well worth the walk.
Brilliant. This is a lovely place to visit, taking the ferry form Sydney Harbour, there is a really lovely beach there and also lots to do there if you want to shop

Nice way to get there through ferry, but not much in Manly. The best of Manly Beach was the ferry way to get there. The ferry departuring from Circular Quay going to Manly allows you to take a great view of Sydney. Apart from that, Manly beach is a nice beach, but nothing more than that - Bondi is a more beautiful beach.

Cool beach and area. Didn't get to stay too long as we arrived near the end of the day, but it seemed like a cool area. The beach was less crowded than Bondi or Coogee, but then again maybe it was due to the time of day we were there. Waves seem calmer as well, compared to Bondi.
Better than Bondi. A much better beach than the overrated bondi. Cleaner beach and less people. My favourite beach hands down.
Super clean. We spent the morning there enjoying the sun and view. It was quiet when we were there but I would imagine this clean beach can become busy.

A must when in Sydney. Second visit to Manly. The boat trip is great and Manly is such a picturesque beach area with great cafes and bars. Try to be there for lunch and though we didn't have them this time the fish and chips are always a good bet! If it's a toss-up between Manly and Bondi then Manly wins every time.

Beautiful beach with variety. I've recently moved to the Sydney area and found Manly Beach right off. It seems by my observation that Bondi Beach is more trendy and for the must be seen types while I feel Manly is more laid back and down to earth with surfers and families alike. It has great surf (and the surf gets more challenging on beaches going north- Dee Why and Collaroy) but it also has a nice sheltered cove on the south end called Shelley beach with a great walking path and dragon lizard spotting in between. You can walk from the ferry terminal to the beach on the Corso where there are plenty of shops/cafes/grocer to get your beach needs or just shop as a tourist. Great restaurants and bars to wrap up the day. A little of something for everyone.
wow. I thought there was a lot of people at Bondi Beach but Manly Beach there looked more that twice the amount of people.
Nice beach so close to the city.... A quick ferry trip across the harbour and youll be at Manly beach, such a nice break from the city. Be careful when swimming following the flags,
Manly Beach. See my other post. It is relevant here. I already wrote things about this place. Lots of restaurants and coffee shops as well as stores and street fair

A wonderful relaxing day trip from Sydney. Manly Beach is a great little jaunt out of Sydney, starting with the ferry trip beginning at Circular Quay. We chose an outside seat since it was a beautiful day and we were rewarded with beautiful views of Sydney and surrounds as we travelled smoothly to the ferry dock at Manley. Once there, we stopped into the tourist info, where a friendly Sheila directed us to the beach and asked us if we had our "cossies" with us. We walked through the little town, crossing the tiny peninsula to the beach and spent a very enjoyable time swimming, sunning and taking in the view. I would recommend taking the stroll further on to Shelly Beach, where there is good snorkeling and more gentle waves. The waves at Manly were great for swimming, although the water cleared out quickly when an announcement was made about the blue bottle jellyfish washing in with the onshore breeze. After swimming, enjoy a Ben and Jerry's ice cream across from the beach before you rinse off the sand and head to the ferry back to Sydney.
Wow what a place. When you visit Sydney it is a must to visit Manley , great walks and views from all parts of Manly, great small restaurants on the promenade for lunch .

What a beach!!. Manly beach was probably the only beach I saw at leisure in Australia. I don't regret missing Bondi beach cos this one was awesome. Clear water, sand and sun with lines of restaurants behind you...what else would you want :)

Lovely bay,great day out.. This is a short ferry ride away from Sydney, the ride is a treat in itself. Manly is a clean and pretty bay with clean water, good swimming and a nice walk along the cliffs. Food was very pricy and the beach side cafes would not sell a drink with out food, so best to take one with you for the beach!

Loved this beach :). Just a short walk from the wharf, Manly beach is definitely worth a visit! Its a beatiful beach where you can swim, surf, sunbath, people watch or even start up a game of beach ball. The lifeguards do a fantastic job of keeping people safe in the water. Plenty of places to eat and shops close by. Has an awesome atmosphere :)

Catch up Manly. I'm a born and bred Sydneysider and like most my family and I love the beach. We are regulars at Eastern Sydney beaches but today my son and I went to Manly but we were very disappointed with the facilities there.Many families visit Manly beach over summer and the substandard, small facilities do not cut it. The surf clubs and the council needs to make improvements to the public facilities at the beach urgently.
always good. the ferry trip is worth it, I never get tired of it, for a very 'touristy' spot it still has a an Ozzie beach feel to it, lots of food variety and nice shops

Really enjoyable. A few minutes walk after getting off from the ferry, the beach is beautiful; also the walk by the side. One can sit, sun bath, run, whatever. It was a party time for young ones everywhere.

A breezy day out!. Love Manly, the beaches are superb and my daughter loved playing in the sea, she didn't want to get out. Followed by a gorgeous fish & chip supper and a wander around before catching the ferry back to Sydney. If we were to ever move up to the area I would want to live there!

NYE by the beach - Kids fireworks @9PM. Packed as can be: yesStressful: no, a big no!Caught the bus, stopped by the beach, enjoyed a picnic with friends and family, had a ball (the fireworks lasted forever, great!)On the way out there were gazillions of buses waiting for us…easy!If you’re looking for a great NYE with the kids, relaxed as can be – go to Mainly!
Lovely Beach - Laid Back Atmosphere. Easy to get to by ferry from Circular Quay, lots of shops and eateries, and the beach is great, sunbathe or surf....

Lovely walking trails. We took the ferry from Sydney to Manly it was about half an hour and nice views on the trip over and back. There is a great information center just were you dock in Manly. The people there are most helpful and they have walking guides and maps of the area. The seawall walk from the beach was wonderful and if you keep an eye on the trees you well be sure to see some Rainbow Lorikeets. With all the walking trails and shops it is easy to spend the day. Very relaxing and low key.

Magnificent Manly. What a wonderful beach. Manly is a hive of activity with a fabulous beach front. For those who prefer swimming in calmer waters, there are saltwater beach swimming pools at North Steyne and Freshwater Beach. The walk from Shelley Beach, past South Steyne, Manly, North Steyne to Freshwater beach is fabulous. Manly is a must visit on your Sydney visit.

Underwhelming. An average sort of beach, not especially pretty, a bit underwhelming to be truthful. Very busy, which was to be expected, it wasn't really worth the journey although we had some good views on the way.
superb. lots of people great to see all ages enjoying time together over xmas with friends and family. great people watching good food outlets & shops

Love it!. There's a different feel to Manly. There's so much to do. Beautiful beach, great shops, a variety of eateries and tourist attractions. A rally nice way to spend a day in Sydney. The ferry system makes it an easy location to get to. Fun day

Safe Beach. Manly is a great spot just outside Sydney, the ferry ride is great for views of Sydney harbour and the crossing takes 30 minutes and the ferries run every 20 minutes, the crossing can be rough on windy days.Manly has great restaurants, bars and shopping all in one area called Corsa and at the end is the main surf beach which is long and patrolled by lifeguards who leave you in no doubt where you can swim and where you can,t. A very clean beach and plenty of toilets and grassy areas to picnic, well worth a visit.

By ferry from Circular quay with overseas guests. Took our overseas guests to manly Beach by ferry - a reasonable way to have atrip across the Sydney harbour on a sunny Sunday - walked from the wharf side to the beach along the mall to the beach end. had some fish and chips on the beach and then took a walk to Shelley beach and back.

best beach in Sydney. Sorry Bondi, but Manly is The Beach in Sydney. Good environment and vibe. Best Fish and Chip shops, Ben & Jerry´s ice cream shop and options for everybody, surfing beaches steps away from calm bays.

Very busy beach and ferry. Manly beach is a lovely beach however the day we went it was extremely busy. The ferry over was a crush, think Disney Magic Kingdom at close without the Disney crowd control. However we did enjoy spending the day people watching and soaking up the atmosphere. The shops and restaurants nearby were packed but we had brought our own picnic so didnt have chance to try any of them.
Worth the trip. W think this would be a great place to stay. Lots of shops and restaurants and heaps of accommodation. What we didn't like is that it gets really busy.
Great experience. I love going to Manly, the water is always so beautiful and the atmosphere down by the corso is amazing, One of my fav places to go
Beautiful Beaches, yes there is more than one. Loved this more than Bondi. Great for families. Great, safe beach to learn to surf. Very interesting place. Worth a visit.

The jewel of sydney Beaches. Manly beach can offer surf and several breaks or a beautiful swim with goggles and snorkel around the point with abundant sea life that can include gropers, rays, cuttlefish and even fairy penguins, whales and dolphins. Beautiful soft sand and space for walking, swimming and exercising.
Great beach. This is one of my favourite sydney beaches - took the kids in the ocean at christmas time and they loved it. Lots of food and drinks nearby too
The only beach better than Bondi. Hard to believe, but I really think so. We had a couple of excellent days swimming and surfing. Great food and super cool relaxed crowd.

The Best Beach in the World. Arrive by ferry from Sydney harbour, walk down the Corsa with its colourful shops, and arrive at a magnificent beach, with cafes on the street and thousands' of people enjoying the golden beach and super surf.

Nice beach destination. A trip to Manly Beach offers not just a nice beach with fine sand, but also beautiful views of Sydney Harbour and the Opera House from the ferry. Corso was very crowded when we visited, and the overcast day made it a bit too cool for a beach day. We still enjoyed our trip there, though.

Fun. Just for the people watching it was worth the ferry ride from Circular Quay. We walked to Shelly Beach and noted that it was nice, but did not get in the water. Don't forget to keep your ticket when you pass through the gates at Circular Quay. You need it to get back.

Beginner Surfers in Manly Waters. I had one of the best breakfasts I've ever had at Manly Beach. We took the fairy over from Syndey for a few hours to explore. The waters were filled with novice surfers, which was a gorgeous sight, and we saw a group getting a surf lesson. There is a lovely sidewalk that makes it easy to stroll and enjoy the beach views.

Gorgeous Beach. Its a boat trip from Sydney Harbour to Manly, which is great you get to see the Opera house from the front. Manley Beach is just how you would imagine it. The sand is white and sea is turquoise. We sat on the beach and took our own picnic which was perfect and just watched all the surfers.

Average beach - and crowded. Did not like the Manly beach too much as it was quite crowded and very ordinary. Has become a tourist attraction so things will not get better for sure. On the plus side, there are many more secluded beaches just around the corner to relax.

Manly Beach - Beautiful Beach. Harbour Ferry from Circular Quay out to Beautiful Manly Beach. Short walk from Wharf where great eateries await tourists and locals. Main road from Wharf to Beach is Surf shops, Icecream shops, Chemists (Pharmacies) and pubs and why not? The buildings are of the era. I would love to return and spend more time just wondering along the beach and window shopping. Beach life at its best.
nice but totally packed. Nice beach and clean as well, but it was absoluetly packed reminded me of a beach in spain or so. if you wanted to go to the toilet to had to que 20min
Nice beach and a nice walk to Shelby beach. We got here via the ferry from Circular Quay . Lots of shopping in and around , some excellent fish and chips as well
Nice beach. A very nice beach, and a good place to enjoy sunny and people watch.A variety of food options nearby., in a few walking. Surfing lesson also available.

A place not to miss. We've been to Sydney three times now and to Manly each time. It is far nicer than Bondi in our opinion and has some great bars, restaurants and shops. The ferry ride is part of the experience, although you can get there by bus.
Beautiful.. Really loved Manly. It was so clean no litter no smoking on the sidewalks. Just such a clean pleasant beach to visit.

nothing special. I was rather disappointed by it. The beach itself wasn't anything special but the place is nice. When you walk from beach on main strip, there are lots of restaurants and shops and it's pleasant enough
Nice beach for people watching. Nice place to catch some sun and people watch. Lots of food options nearby. Surfing lesson also available.

Very exciting hub of Manly. We took the ferry over to enjoy the beach and it was absolutely packed with sun bathers and people just enjoying the water and beach. It was a bright sunny day and the tide was in. There are rifts but lifesavers are continually patrolling and ensuring people swim between the flags.
Hear the ocean. Beautiful clean beach with mesmerising breakers. The town behind is slightly tacky but friendly and quaint.
Lovely Afternoon. Spent a Lovely Afternoon at Manly Beach. Far superior to Bondi in every way. More restaurants, less crowded and more to do.,
Festive Beach. This area is a lot of fun. Laying on the beach is a treat, but just steps away are shops and restaurants. Easy to get to with the ferries.

a nice beach, and cute town. Manly has grown a lot since I was last there in 2000, but it's, for the most part, well done. The beach is still lovely and clean, and the shops and restaurants are largely of a good quality. Not honkey-tonk like a lot of large beach towns.

Good for a swim followed by a pleasant walk. I have often swam at Manly Beach and always enjoyed it. With the expansive beach on one side, then the Corso (filled with great shops, bars and eateries) linking it to the harbour on the otherwise it's a magical area. The Styene Promenade takes you all the way to Shelly beach. There is beach hire for umbrellas and sun lounges you can also hire bikes. Manly Beach is accessible by ferry, car or bus, with metered parking or paid parking in the council carpark if travelling by car. Be warned though parking can be hard to find in busy periods.
