Great place to spend a day. We had a great day at Manly. The ferry ride was like a small harbour cruise and the beach was very nice. We liked that there was the opportunity of restaurants and grocery stores close by to cater for lunch.

Awesome. Takes 30 minutes ride to reach from city.What a nice place to be.Beautiful promenade,lovely sights,nice place for swimming.
Many restaurants along the beachfront and numerous shopping facilities will make one happy.

BEAUTIFUL BEACH!!!!!. I was only in Sydney for 3 nights, so had to plan my time well, to do as much as possible. Everyone I asked, said I should definitely visit Manly Beach. It was well worth the visit. From the ferry ride there, that offered amzing views of Sydney Opera House, the Sydney Harbout Bridge etc. To the short walk from the Manly ferry terminal to the beach, through the nice collection of shops and eateries. To the very beautiful long beach itself. There was so much happening on the beach, but it still wasn't crowded at all. It was so relaxing after looking around the shops, to just sit and relax on the beach and watch things like the 'Learn To Surf' class that was on. The atmosphere at Manly beach simply felt great. With a short ferry ride to Sydney city, I would love to live in Manly!

Much better than Bondi. Bondi Beach might be internationally renowned, but if you're visiting Sydney, Manly Beach is far lovelier and enjoyable. It's a long stretch of beach with great surf (my mum even saw Layne Beachley getting out of the water!), rock pools and plenty of accessible cafes. The atmosphere is relaxed and the ferry ride over is enjoyable. Do it as a day-trip, or get some accommodation and chill-out there for a few days.

Love it. I love going to Manly beach when I am in Sydney as it is busy but not too crazy and does not seem as pretentious and jam packed as Bondi! I also think the food shops etc are better along the strip. Nice clean and safe beach!
Lovely Beach. Visited Manly Beach by ferry twice during our 7 night stay in Sydney as we enjoyed sitting on the large beach. Had great fish and chip lunch but cant remember the name of the shop.

Best beach in Sydney. There are many beaches in and around Sydney but, for us, Manly was the best due to location, wide sandy beach and the surrounding facilities. Unlike it's well known counterpart, Bondi, Manly is relatively easy to reach by ferry and your don't have to Attlee across the city's traffic.
Great Beach with nice sand. We spent an afternoon here just hanging out after taking the ferry from our hotel in downtown Sydney.

Great place to visit. There is a little beach straight off the ferry from Sydney Harbour and a fantastic German Bar which serves wonderful burgers and very tasty Mango beer!After a lunchtime stop there you can cross the road and after a short stroll enjoy a beautiful afternoon on Manly's main beach.it's just heaven!
A quiet piece of Paradise. A ferry to Manly let's you see the whole of Sydney Barbour, get great pics of the opera house and, if you want to chill on a lovely beach...you get that too.

Amazing views from the cliffs above the beach. Amazing views of the beach. The waves the day we visited were perfect chest high, marching in broad sets into the beach. From the cliff drive above the beach it was one of the most vividly sites I have experienced.

Great breakfast, great view!. This very relaxed little eatery serves up great coffee, a great breakfast and has a perfect view. It's like an upscale beach house with an yummy menu. The frittata I had was crispy in the right places and it was to munch down while watching the surfers.

A great day out. We took a day trip to Manly and really enjoyed it. The ferry over was lovely and Manly is a pretty town with plenty of shops and eateries.
The beach is gorgeous.....wish I was still there!! Definitely worth a day trip.
Diving on Manley Beach. Great location for a quick couple of dives. Clean, friendly beach with a great view. Easy shore entry and wihle there was a little current it was very nice easy diving.

Best Beach in Sydney. We really enjoyed both the ferry ride and our day at Manly. The beach is beautiful and there are lots of nice shops and restaurants. Try to get at the front or back of the ferry outside and enjoy the scenery especially pulling in and out of Sydney Harbour

Amazing place to be. Manly beach has a great number of options. Right from fitness lovers looking for a run, surfers, or a group with a volleyball, or a simple swim - the beach has it all. The sidewalk has a lot of places to sit down for the lazy bum as well. Amazing places to eat nearby with great Italian, Middle Eastern and Asian food. Good coffees and a lot of beer joints. Don't miss the entire section on what to eat in Manly on this website

An exciting beach. So much going on on the beach and around the area. It is beautiful and restful, provides great surfing and walking opportunities. I was impressed with the lifeguard service especially for the smaller kids.

Pretty tacky. One the one hand I do like Manly for its unpretentiousness. But am a bit bothered by all the shops selling cheap poor quality (*imported from the east*) goods. Good beach with normal folk hanging out here (ct Bondi where it's all about what you're wearing and how you look). As elsewhere near water, overpriced eateries.
It was cloudy!!. Because the weather was not so good, the beach was not at it's best. Manly beach and the promenade is relaxed and friendly. I wish I could of stayed longer.

A good alternative to Bondi. If you want to see an "iconic" beach which is not too crowded go to Manly : ) Its a lot less crowded than Bondi, yet it has a cool vibe of its own. A short ferry ride is an attraction in itself. Plenty of good cafes in there as well.
Excellent for a day out. Grab the ferry and go for the day - food and souvenirs are much more reasonably priced. The seaside feel is what you would expect - the views are not to be missed.

2 differing beaches. Fabulous sand. Breezy on the Pacific side where the surfing and volleyball in full action. Us oldies needed the fabulous smooth beach on the sheltered ferry side, and there's plenty of quiet beaches where youcan BBQ around the coves a relatively short ewalk away

Found a new favourite place for getaway. Located just 30 minutes ferry from CBD, and the ferry interval is 30 minutes. Walk straight from the wharf and enjoy the great view of the ocean :) Great getaway for a student like me
Favourite Spot. Take the Ferry from Circular Quay, walk through the village and you reach magnificent Manly Beach. Full of activities, great views and lovely people. Great day out of the city.

Nice trip from Central Sydney. Easy ferry ride from Circular Quays. Ferrys are every half hour. then about ten minutes through the town to a long curving sandy beach. Pleasant walk from the southern end out to a headland. Plenty of places to eat

Beach ruined by seagulls. I visited Manly beach on my recent trip to Oz and have to say the experience left me cold and not wanting to return.The problem with it are the flocks of seagulls that stalk it. You may ask how seagulls can ruin a trip there, but believe me they did not only for me but for everyone I talked to who were trying to eat their lunch on it.Basically if you are eating a roll or a sandwich or basicaly anything, you get dive bombed by utterly brazen seagulls who literally snatch the food out of your hands.My salad roll was taken and in the process my arm badly scratched. The lady next to me's daughter was left traumatized when a seagull dive bombed her and tried to snatch her sandwich, only to miss and scratch her face badly.And if you make the mistake of throwing a seagull any food at all it is then joined by dozens of others who rip the food to pieces and go berserk with each other over who gets a mouthfull.I visisted many beaches in Australia and Manly was the only one with this problem. So my advice is avoid it if you have small children or if you intend to eat your lunch there.

Surf's up. Great ferry ride out from Circular Quay, fantastic views of Harbour Bridge and Opera House ***try to get a seat at the back outside****. Beautiful huge, clean, sandy beach, great for people watching, good cafés and boutiques to browse around.

Great beach. If you are visiting Sydney, I would recommend a day to visit Manly Beach. Its best to travel by ferry and then you can spend the day on the lovely beach or browse the shops. There's a great selection of eating places too.

worth the trip across the water. beautiful views and great beach, lovely long walks along the beach where you can just soak up the atmosphere and views.Fantastic places to grab a bite to eat and enjoy the views

Worth a visit, if only for a few hours. The highlight of Manly Beach is the ferry ride from Circular Quay, which takes around half an hour. The beach is wide and not too crowded, better than Bondi and has good swimming - BUT beware of the strong rip tide. Nice but typical beach shops and restaurants surrounding
Love Manly. Great beach, great restaurants and the pub scene marvelous! Parking is horrendous so go by public transport or cab.

Lovely Beach...Cool place. My wife and I loved Manly beach. It's a short ferry ride away, but might as well be a different world. Everything slows down here and turns into an awesome beach town. Nice small shops and restaurants. The people are laid back and cool and the beach is gorgeous. I prefer manly over Bondi because it seems less commercial and more personal.

Urban pleasures. This is a great 'burb of Sydney. Yes the beach is good but the village ambience in the middle of the city is really cool. Check the street shopping, the children's beach on the inside, the kid's play park and for the adults a pretty good quaint and old art gallery.

Great beach and easy access from Sydney. Beautiful beach, many shops and eateries available. Easy access via the Ferry from Downtown Sydney (Circular Quay). Strongly recommended -- plan to stay and sunbathe, swim, surf, or just wander the shops and eateries.

Clean, pine tree-lined beach - take the ferry here.. The ferry ride here form Circular Quay is amazing. From there you walk a short distance down a pedestrian street to the beach. On the way are souvenir shops, fast food, and ice cream places, nothing amazing but good prices on souvenir shirts. The beach is well-tended, but note that when we were there swimming was restricted to one area due to heavy waves. The beach overall is a very pretty one, enjoyed the setting of the pine trees on one side and the ocean on the other. Public bathroom is crowded but acceptably clean.

Take the time to explore the rocks, Manly, all the harbour side attractions.. all who visit Sydney must have the chance to visit & take their time when doing so. Especially the harbour region, the rocks & all the fantastic hidden treasures around these areas. The little pubs up behind the convention centre have great atmosphere & food. The ferries are well worth a trip across the waters just to experience it. The Manly area is brilliant with the markets & cafes to delight your senses.

Everybody says go here - but only average. Nothing special - Like a lot of places that are made out to be fab, Manley is just another beach with a view surfers and a lot of lifeguards! The best part is the Ferry journey from Circular Quay - but rush for the seats near the front!!

Manly Wharf Meals. Lunch on the wharf at Manly was delicious.We arrived by ferry, disembarked and walked into a clean, spacious pub, for a great meal before visiting the wildlife sanctuary. I highly recommend this for those who have the time. The view over the water was really relaxing.Scrumptious food, well priced.

Day trip to Manly Beach. Catch the Manly Ferry across from Circular Quay to the lovely Manly. It is an "old" type town with plenty to see & do. Beach is set amongst the pubs, restaurants, shopping & a lovely esplanade. Another must see for tourists.

Take time to walk along the beach... It was a bit cold when I visited but really enjoyed walking around though the shops, cafes, along the shore. Even the ferry ride is exciting as there are a lot of boats at that time and it's fun to take photos of them
Stay a while.. Just a short walk from the ferry to the beach. Lots of cafes to eat then enjoy the beach. Nice just to walk the beachfront.

It's Called Manly, but I Find it Very Womanly Too. This is hands down one of my favorite locations in the Sydney area. There are great places to eat and drink as well as shop. The beach is also terrific and there are often events going on, such as volleyball tournaments, etc. And the people watching is also second-to-none!
Beautiful beach. We loved Manly. It was super easy to get to using the Ferries. Loved the shops and easy access to the beach.
Great beach. Some say that Manly Beach is better than Bondi, I don't know about that but I do know that it's well worth the ferry ride. More bustling than Bondi and a great day out

Our favorite beach Down Under. We took a ferry from darling harbor, changed ferries at Circular Quay to get to Manly beach. We loved it because it wasn't too crowded and was in the middle of a residential area. You can do a long walk/ loop from Manly thru the Sydney harbor national park to Fishers Bay. Or you could just hang out at Manly beach. Enjoy!

Great, nice option to Bondi Beach. Beautiful.. Chose Manly beach this trip. The ferry ride was 30 minutes with stunning views of the Sydney Harbor, Opera House and Harbor Bridge. The beach is fantastic, clean and a great place to get some sun, people watch and grab a bite to eat. We ate at a restaurant on the promenade and had some great seafood. The ferry runs every 30 minutes.

NIce ferry ride and beautiful beach. It takes about half an hour from Sydney to Manly, and the ferry ride allows you to get some good pictures of the Sydney opera house and Harbour bridge. Manly has some small shops, places to eat, supermarket etc, the beach is beautiful and not overly crowded. I would say this is a much better day-trip than Bondi beach.

Soooo Good!. Good Surf! Good looking life guards! Good Vibes!If you want to hire boards, towels, chairs and umbrellas their right on the beach. I loved every minute here. Way better than any other beach in Sydney.I recommend to all ages and all walks of lifeGo Manly!

A Good Location. This beach is too busy for my liking and of course we are spoiled for choice on this stretch of coastline.I think the positives are, a good length of beach; other things to do close-by; good food outlets nearby and a reasonably safe beach.This place outstrips Bondi by a mile (or is it a kilometre) in my view.I have added some photographs.

Beautiful long beach. Great atmosphere in & around!. Check the weather and if it's a sunny day it's well worth a day long trip :)We took the beautiful LONG ferry ride from Circular Quay. En-route you see these small islands as well as young and old riding their boats over a sunny weekend. The final approach is a bit deceptive as you'll see this tiny beach. But the actual Manly beach is a 5 mins walk inside through some bustling shops & restaurants.The beach is a loooooong one. Clean enough and you can find a quiet enough spot if you walk further down on the left from the entrance. Hubby and I had a lovely 2 hour nap on the beach then took an unplanned but well worth it de-tour towards Shelly beach. We did the nature walk from Shelly beach back to Manly which was an experience in itself. Beautiful! Be careful to have your GPS working as you may get lost during this trail. We ended the day at one of the restaurants at Manly wharf before we headed back around 10 p.m. Great thing is Ferries operate till past midnight so you don't have to rush back. Over all a great day and will visit again!
Wide, long, free ........ Wide, long, free from many people beach, convenient for surfing, swimming and beach sports among the attractive bay of idyllic town.Better vaunted over Bondi.

Excellent! One of my favorite spots in Sydney!!. There's just something about Manly that makes you never want to leave. Geat atmosphere, where surfers, kitesurfers, joggers and socialites blend, the beach is very clean and it has many shops, cafes and restaurants. Locals gather in the pier to watch the sunset over a glass of wine or ice cream. I suggest taking the ferry back to Sydney at dusk to see the sun setting behind the Opera.

Sun , sea and lots of sand. Great watching the lifeguards in action , they also seem to have total respect . Once they blow their whistle to get out of water ALL listen !!! Nice place to chill , great watching all levels of surfers

The Sydney Dream. Sydneysiders see themselves as bronzed surfers and Manly Ocean Beach is the place to see them at their best.Fabulous restaurants, especailly the Pantry which is right on the beach.Bring your swimsuit
Felt like we were in California, very nice.. The day we visited they had a surfing competition and the energy was very high and the people were super friendly and the beer was cold. LOL
Relaxing. The boat ride from Darling Harbour to Manly was very nice and the whole set-up of Manly is beautiful - beach town. Very family oriented.

Awesome food to go. A short visit to Manly Beach and I walked into a fabulous new little food to go called Four Fish.The freshest fish ever! Scallops,calamari,shrimp,fish laid out in front of you like a fish market and they cook it to go.wanted typical Oz food, so ordered a barramundi with a thai sauce and it was amazing $14.Ask if it is farm raised if you are interested..in the case of Barramundi, you want it to be fresh, not farm raised based on the environmental impact of cages.Enjoy!

Worth the ferry ride. We took the Manly ferry, stopping at Taronga Zoo on the way. The beach, like most in Australia is soft white sand. We rented a bike for 2 hours so that we could explore beyond the beach - the climb up to the hospital is exhausting but worth the effort when you reach the top.
Nice beach. Small beach with white, fine sand. Lots of local shops and interesting foods. Very picturesque. It was not very crowded in the beginning of November, but the weather was fairly cool.

Great way to see the Harbour - and the Ocean. you can walk across the isthmus from the ferry port to the ocean side. Unique visual aspects in that it was the only beach we saw that had a wind-break of large, rich green pine trees lining the beach walk. The beach front cafe's are a bit more affordable than some of the other beaches, and - from this reviewers perspective - the surfing looked better than Bondi on the day we were there. A very busy surfing class and a half-dozen beach volley ball games were in progress. More like a San Diego beach than an LA beach.
Fab beach. We went to Manly on the ferry from circular quay,the beach was amazing, really relax with great surf. The shop nearby is also great!

The sand is hot and the proximity to the city fab. Don't be misled by the small beach you see when you disembark! The larger beach is through the town.Watch the surfers, the beach patrol and even volleyball. Great place to sit and do nothing except enjoy the sun and sand!Went to Quay for drinks - great venue and views. The Ribs and Rumps for food and drinks - the view from the front is amazing over the beach! They sorted my chewy calamari no questions asked - excellent service!

We Love Manly. Why would you want to go anywhere else in Sydney - this is like a holiday when at home. We love the beach, the town centre, the casual lifestyle and most of all that its only 30min from the CBD. When we don't go down or up the cost we go to Manly.
Beautiful beach. A beautiful beach that should not be missed. Plenty of space for people to hang out even on a crowded weekend. Perfect for surfing, beach volleyball, swimming etc...

A beautiful beach. A beautiful beach that is easily accessible using the ferry from Circular Quay. There were lots of restaurants nearby and an ALDI's supermarket in the wharf if you wanted food to eat in the park along the beach. One thing of notice is how clean the whole area is even though Sydney has 4 million people in a crowded city.

Manly yes, hard-no. I think this is the closest spot from Sydney at circular quay. It is a very quick trip to Manly {named because of the Manly men} You land on 1 side, take a very short walk through the streets where there are shops, shops and more shops. When u get to the ocean {4 blocks} u can veg on the beach.
Manly it is great. A great place to visit especially if you have kids and are a keen surfer. Great strip shopping as well and heaps of eateries.

Very close to the Main Street. Beach was clean and long, with a variety of stations for surfing or swimming.Nearby schools used the beach during the day which was nice, the life guards regularly made announcements for safety purposes - with clear signage when the water was dangerous.Public loos and water stations were available with huge range of shops along the Corso to peruse.
Day trip. A great day out nice trip on the ferry from Circular Quay lots of eating places and the beach was fabulous and if you like walking this is a great place to go.
Nice beach.. Clean water and good waves and many eating places to choose. Good fun ferry ride across from the city.

A nice trip from Sydney. We took the ferry from Circular Quay over to Manly. It was very pleasant, nice views on the way. We ended up at the beach at the end of the Corso, and spent some time watching the surfers. I would've been happy to spend more time here, but we had limited time in the area and had to move on. But it was very nice, I highly recommend taking the time to visit.

lovely place to visit. Although this is local/home to many, Manly is still a great tourist spot. Masses of eateries, scenic views, great beach and an allround place to holiday or make a full day visit.

Beautiful beach. This is a very beautiful beach and you'll see many people sun tanning, jogging, walking their dogs, surfing etc. We walked half of the manly scenic walk as parts of the walk was cordoned off due to risk of bushfires, which was a pity. The walk was scenic and beautiful and we spotted many wild rabbits, lizards and birds and it was an enjoyable experience. We stayed till the evening for the sunset which was amazing and had our dinner overlooking the beautiful beach. Great day to spend the evening!
Manly. Manly is a beautiful spot to visit, it has the advantage of having two beaches within walking distance of the town centre, and the scenery is wonderful.
really nice beach. Manly is a great beach to spend the day it! I thoroughly enjoyed the day there. There's a bunch of walks around too ... i did have really bad sushi train there...

Lovely beach. We took the ferry, and had a fab view of Sydney harbour, the bridge and opera house as we left the pier.When you reach Manly it is just so clean and un-crowded, much like we found of a lot of places in Australia. The beach is just lovely, soft sand and lots of sun.Redfoo was doing a clip for his songs video when we were there, but even that didn't disrupt the rest of the resort. It was quite noisy though when passing by the filming.Overall a much better beach we felt than Bondi. It just feels more relaxed and less touristy. Well worth a visit when in Sydney.

Good day trip.. Spend some time at the beach. Take a bike and ride the foreshore. Stand up paddle board near the ferry dock in the bay. Have dinner on the wharf and catch a late ferry back to the city. Great day.

much nicer than bondi. you have to take the ferry to go there from the CBD, which is a very nice journeyI think the beach itself is much nicer than Bondy and less crowded. You have green instead of buildings which gives a better atmosphere.Many little shops around

Sun and Sand in Manly. We cauught the Manly Ferry and enjoyed the ride accross Sydney Harbour. Manly is a pleasant little place with one main street (The Corso) and a nice long wide beach. Unless you wish to sun worship there is not a lot to do and we found that after 2 hours we had walked the length of the beach looked in all the shops and were ready to return to Sydney. It is however a pleasant half day excursion and the return ferry trip is a good cheap way to see the opera house and Sydney Bridge from the water

Escape from the city for Sun, Sand and Scenery. If you are visiting Sydney, now voted the number two destination behind London to visit - take the Manly Ferry across Sydney Harbor to Manly. Firstly, I must say that I have a legitimate bias towards Many Beach! I grew up there and visit my mother there each year. I cannot wait to get on my walking shoes and head around Manly Beach to Shelley Beach, a protected marine reserve, for my morning walk. You can walk right around the point and look down over the Pacific and crashing waves below. Good breakfast and coffee to be had at the Bower cafe or for dinner Le Kiosk, a 5 star restaurant with and 5 star prices for that special occasion. The mornings for me are the best and usually the sun is just coming up over the ocean, the board riders are sitting off shore waiting for waves, the mothers with strollers are jogging along the promenade, people having their morning coffee together on the benches facing the ocean, the seniors having their morning swim winter and summer and the Manly life guards teaching children to board ride and many walking their dogs. The ocean is warm, seductive and safe. Always bathe between the flags! You can also walk north to Queenscliff along the beach. Craft markets on the weekends too offering all kinds of unusual gifts. Great eats everywhere to spend the day. Enjoy your visit!
Nice area. Very nice and clean. Nice restaurants and bar to enjoy late afternoon dining overlooking beach. Not crowded on our visit.
Expensive. It was worth the trip, but the restaurants are very expensive. Perhaps we visited on a weekend that had various events, but the area was extremely crowded.
Pines by the beach. Having lived in Florida, California and Hawaii. I have seen a lot of great beaches. But the row of huge pines lining the beach was really cool to see. Nice tourist spot.
Nice beach, very lively. Enjoyed visit, travelled by train, nice shops all around, really good atmosphere, very clean and extremely busy as it was half term.

Fantastic beach. We enjoyed a stroll on the main street, full of shops and good deals. Wonderful weather, wonderful beach, wonderful waves!
Local bars and restaurants are cool.
Take the ferry for the best views all around. Manly beach is worth it not just for the beach itself (Which I loved), but also the journey to get here. Worth the effort!
Average beach. Very average beach , not very outstanding compared to Bondi or St Kilda. Nearby Manly aquarium which is also not great compared to Sydney aquarium

laid back beach culture. a short ferry ride from circular quay, and you are in a different world it has a great small sandy beach, cafes selling great food and coffee without the hustle and bustle of sydney you can stroll around , (great shops) then sit eat and relax in the sunshine

Great beach and town is worth a look.. Obviously the beach is great with the compulsory surf "dudes" in attendance. Well worth wandering around the town though ...some great bars and cafes and check out the colonial syle buildings. Altogether well worth a visit.

A nice place to relax!. A short ferry ride from Circular quay, spent about 2 hours there, had some Mexican food by the pier then did some souvenir shopping, apart from numerous souvenir shops they also have other clothing shops,bars and restaurants :) then relaxed by the beach to enjoy the sunset..beautiful setting and not crowded at all. Really worth a visit when you're in Sydney!
worth going. Even though I was there in July, the water was still warm enough to go for a swim! A very nice beach, good atmosphere and a very cute street with touristy shops, cafés and restaurants.

Bondi, watch out!. Compared to Bondi, well there is no comparison. If you are a surfer then it's all here guys. If you love good fresh fish, it's all here guys. If you love bars and great restaurants, it's all here guys. Just a twenty minute ride on the beautifully clean and comfortable ferry from Circular Quay, and you're at Manly. Delightful, enjoyable, lovely people and lovely fish! Don't miss this little jam and walk the coastal path.

A nice beach, not too far from city. It's very nice beach, clean and 100% natural. Very friendly for family visitors and lots of shopping / restaurant options available around. From Sydney, it will take approx 45 mins by ferry. Remember to carry your sun cream..

Popular Beach!. It's a very popular Sydney beach, although not as famous as Bondi Beach. It's very nice, although I wasn't absolutely amazed as I have been at some other beaches (especially compared to some of those in Hawaii). I don't view this as a "must do" attraction at Sydney, although many tourbooks and locals will disagree with me.
Loved it!. Took a ferry to manly while staying in Sydney. Fabulous town with great beaches and bars. If we come back to Sydney would stay here and travel to Sydney instead
Summer already. How wonderful to see families, young and old out enjoying the beach for the day. Well done to the Surf Life Savers.

Beautiful beach, beautiful area. Great spot for swimming, people watching and surfing spot, easily accessible by ferry from downtown Sydney. Some great close shopping and wandering areas, always something going on to catch your eye. Water quality is good at the beach, highly recommend a day trip from the city.
nice. went here because of recommendation from hotel staffshe said that this is more local than bondi beach. so we went here and very satisfied with everything

nice day trip. Pick a nice day and take the ferry on beautiful Sydney harbor and beyond. Lunched at a trendy restaurant right off the ferry...a fantastic gourmet pizza place. Main street Manly is wide and closed to traffic. The beach is beautiful and family friendly. Crystal clear Pacific!

Manly Beach.............what a fabulous day out. Manly Beach is simply wonderful. There are dozens of restaurants. Many of them are along the beach and offer both inside and outside seating. It is fabulous laid back, friendly experience. The beach is great. Just a short and wonderful Ferry ride across Sydney Harbor. Then a short walk from the pier to the center of Manly beach. Enjoy the beach. Dine at one of the many terrific restaurants and then enjoy the beautiful ride on the Ferry back to Sydney.

Beach with a friendly feel.. We took the ferry, walked past the shops, lots to see if you are interested in souvenirs. Interesting ice cream parlours too. Lots of kids and families come to this beach. Great to see free filtered water filling taps available if you bring your own water bottles. They are located along the shopping strip and you will past them as you walk towards the beach. What a thoughtful council ;)

A great beach!. Catching the manly ferry and then walking on Manly beach is one of Sydney's treats for locals and tourists alike. There is a great restaurant serving vegan food on Darley road, about 5 mins from the beach - Pure Wholefoods.
Walk the full length of the beach or take the path south through to Shelley Beach.

Classic beach resort.. Surf or stroll, beach or promenade, so long as the sun is shining, Manly beach has it all. Enjoy the ferry ride from Circular Quay, camera at the ready. Truly a must-do for Sydney visitors.
Lovely Manly. A great place, two beaches, lots of shopping. A great atmosphere. Catch the ferry from here to Sydney - you won't be disappointed with the experience.

the best atound sydney. As soon as I got to the airport I was told to go and visit Manly beach, despite the non appropriate year season. Then I saw it from an helicopter flight around the bay and the town, so I decided to go and see it in person. It had bbeen a great idea. Wonderful environment, great restaurants, amazing shopping... people surfing even if july.... great great great! The main corso is the perfect place to have a relaxing walk all the days of the year

Manly - a beautiful beach in Sydney. If you want to take a short holiday - take a Manly ferry ( a beautiful 30 minutes Harbour Cruise) from Circular Quay just for a day or 2 in Manly is the best beach in Sydney.

Wonderful day trip in good weather. We took a ferry ride to Manley Beach as it was recommended by the Westin concierge. What a great trip. Small shops, bistro dining, a sunny beach walk to die for made for a great day. On our return trip we stopped at Watson's Bay for fish and Chips at Doyle's.

Iconic Aussie playground. Not much needs to be said about this beach - it's an absolute icon. Somewhat less crowded that it's southern counterparts and in my view far more attractive. The water is clean, there are plenty of spots for lunch or an ice-cream close by and the beach is long enough that you can find your own spot of sand without much hassle. Just swim between the flags if you aren't a strong swimmer and familiar with the beach.

Good beach area. Make a point of walking promenade to Cabbage Tree Bay. Stop for a cold drink or a coffee at cafe on the way, sit outside and watch the surfers. Note the sculptures in the rocks along the walkway.
well worth going to. go there you must .we prefered it to bondi beach over all. old buildings and new ones . fab beach .just as you get off ferry there is subway, aldis shop ! good walks and cafes

Always a Favourite. Taking the ferry to Manly beach is half the fun in the experience. Great shops along the way and even better when the market is there. Wonderful restaurants and cafes on the beachfront with great views of the sea. Although the beach is usually crowded and the surfers are plentiful it is still possible to have a swim and enjoy the scenery from the sand. Worth doing the Shelley Beach walk from the end of the beach.
Ok. Nice beach. Very warm that day. Just a nice resort. Lots of shops and very busy. Australian navy band singing in the street as part of the celebrations. Relaxed and laid back.

Jazz and excitement. We travelled over to hear the Jazz festival being run.. it was brilliant and there were hoards of people there.
Lots of eateries and great views down the beach.
The ferry over and back was great too !
Very enjoyable.

Beautiful beach. This beach is beautiful and would have to be a favourite., It is very clean, the only downside being it is very busy. Obviously 1st thing in the morning is a good time for a stoll along the beach before too many people come out to play. There are many things happening like volleyball, surfing, etc. The tracks beside the beach are great for walking along, and there is a pool at both ends of the beach. Lifeguards on duty.

Relaxing afternoon. We liked Many Beach. Nic walk at the beach and we actually also enjoyed sitting at the beacj next to the ferry peir and watch teh world go past, very nice there in the late afternoon as You can see the sunset.

Not to be missed. Now I understand why skin cancer so high the beach was packed with very brown bodies. I had my factor 50 on but others seem to little worry about the intense heat.just like the films very interesting to see the Australians at play

So, so. My husband and I decided to take the ferry to Manly after reading the reviews. The ferry does give you great views of the bridge and opera house. Once there, we were a bit disappointed. I'm not sure if it was because we had visited Cairns and the reef prior to coming to Sydney. There were a lot of tourist shops. We ate some fish and chips which weren't that great. The beach was nice, but not extraordinary. There were nothing but tourists. We liked the Esplanade in Cairns much better.

Nice half day trip. Took the ferry to Manly Beach, walked around the beaches and shops. Had lunch at a cute little fish place overlooking the beach and ocean. If he weather is nice, it is an enjoyable ferry ride (great view of the Opera house) and pleasant to walk around a cute beach town.

Great spot! Full of tourists, but fun!. Such a cool space - It is, admittedly, full of tourists, but you can immediately see why! Weather is fantastic, the views of the water are great. There are such neat shops and bike rentals.
Small gem. Manly Beach was quite a surprise. We thought i would be bigger, but we enjoyed the smaller, cozy feel!
LOVE LOVE LOVE. I Loved Manly! this is where I would live if I moved to OZ. We rented bikes an road up and down the beach. it was so pretty. they have an awesome sandwich stand on the beach too.

Best of the Sydney beaches. We caught a ferry from near the harbour bridge - great way to see the harbour - then enjoyed the 5-10minute walk down to the beach. Bought out lunch on the way - our party of 8 all wanted different foods, and all needs were met. The street was very busy though - sunny Saturday afternoon. The beach is beautifully clean, and we had a great afternoon watching the surfers and enjoying the atmosphere. Once we lost the sun, we crossed the road to the bar, then caught the ferry back to the City. We were recommended Manly over Bondi - haven't been to Bondi for some years to compare, but we were very happy with our choice. If that is how Sydney residents spend their winter afternoons, no wonder so many Brits want to move there! What a great lifestyle!

Pretty!. Manly is a beach that you can get a ferry to. Whilst you are on the ferry you get an amazing view of the Opera house and bridge. Sydneys harbolurs is just beautiful! and the ferry is the cheapest way to see it.Manly beach quite pretty with plenty to see also .

Full of life and plenty of shopping. Manly beach has a friendly and relaxed atmosphere, whether shopping, dining or just watching the world go by. we loved our time at Manly would definitely go there next time we are in Sydney,

Lovely Day Out from Sydney CBD. Travelled to Manly Beach from Darling Harbour for a day trip. Easy train connections to Circular Quay, then a 30 minute leisurely ferry ride on a bright, calm day. The beach is a 5 minute walk along the Corso, with plenty of shops and cafes en-route. On the day we visited, Redfoo was filming a music video, so bonus entertainment was provided at no extra cost! Our daughter loved it... The beach itself was clean, and although a little busy, it didn't feel overcrowded. The atmosphere was relaxed and casual, with locals and tourists sharing the space. Recommended for a day trip to escape the city if visiting Sydney.

Go on a sunny day. Catch the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay and it is about 20-30 minutes out to Manly Ferry Terminal. It is then a 5-10 minute walk to the beach. There are a good number of shops for the last minute essentials such as sunscreen and drinks. The restaurants and bars are all top notch. The beach was very clean and the water was clear as well.

Like it but a bit feral at night. the most beautiful beach I have ever seen in my life! We took the ferry (see my review) from Circular Quay to Manly and it was pleasant 15-20min ride away... The beach stretches for miles, each section offering a different view (more waves, ideal for surfing or more peaceful, some snorkeling. Lots to do in the area, as far as dining and shopping options are concerned. A must see, but at night I thought it was a bit feral with people in rugby jumpers fighting.
Manly Beach. I loved the Beach and especially enjoyed the shopping area. The casual atmosphere and stores were a great way to cap off a 2 week stay in Australia.
great place to visit. catch a ferry from sydney to manly and walk along the corso to the beach it is beautiful people swimming and surfing and just having fun

A great place to stay!. We stayed in OCEAN ROYALE APARTMENTS . These are directly overlooking Manly Beach - fantastic location and sea views ( from 6 am in morning you can see the surfers if you need time to adjust your hours ) . Better than a hotel .

It is a beach.... For some reason, this beach seems to be very popular but, it is just a beach. There isn't anything particular about the beach area or the shopping strip of Manly. It is an average beach of Australia and there are actually nice ones further north. I'm not sure what all the fuss is about...

Great place. Take a ferry from circular quay. Worth the trip.
Can see the city skyline and enjoy the sea breeze. The beach itself if beautiful and has high waves coming from the open Tasman Sea

Great beach. Take a short ferry ride from Circular Quay and enjoy a peaceful walk on a beautiful beach in Manly. Go to Hugo's for lunch. It is at the ferry port. Hugo's has really really good pizza!!!

Lovely ltitle beach. Lovely little beach. You can get some really nice fish and chips here with plenty of choice and then sit on the beach and enjoy watching the world go by or take a walk past the surf club and further on for some great views.

Bracing. This is the second time I have visited Manley Beach. On the first occasion it was extremely windy and quite chilly, so I thought I would visit on a warmer day. However, it was still very breezy and still not particularly warm. There were still a few people on the beach, sunbathing and relaxing, but it was too cold for me! I still enjoyed the walk along the prom, but didn't sit as much as I would have liked

Great Walking. We arrived by ferry, which was very convenient and we walked around. We weren't getting in the water because it was fairly cold when we went in August. In any event, it was a beatiful, relaxing walk.
Stayed on the beachfront. Beautiful beach, definitely better than bondi and certainly not as crowded! I what to manly beach nearly everyday, has volleyball nets and all! Very happy
If you are going to visit any beach in Sydney. If you are going to visit any beach in Sydney visit Manly and not Bondi. Of the two, Manly was the better of them
Better than Bondi. The atmosphere, waves and general ambiance, I much prefer Manly to Bondi. I went several times despite being closer to Bondi Beach!

The surfers beach. You cannot miss Manly Beach. The bach were you can see Australians doing their favorite sport : surfing. In September the water was icy but they were having a swim all the same. YOu'll realize they love the sea and water sports.

Manly Summer 2012. Sweet beach area. Loved the shops & restaurants on the Corso. Super easy & scenic ferry from Sydney. Liked it so much we stayed her for 3 nights after returning from the Hunter Valley

Beautiful beach. Manly beach is a beautiful spot for any one who likes to relax and read a book or hire a surfboard and hit the waves, the water is calm enough in the shallows for some relaxing swimming and the stretch of white sand is to die for, great shops in the area to grab a bite at and loads of clothing stores to get a bargain from! a must see!

this IS a beach. got to be seen . lovely little beach in a lovely little district. you enter from the harbour , walk across a little piazza with plenty of shops and restaurants to the beach which is on the tasman sea. WELL wotrh a hafl day visit- on the ferry back jump off at watson's bay and enjoy the fish and chips and a great view back into Sydney
Fun Town to Visit!. We spent one afternoon in Manly, enjoyed fish and chips and a nice walk on the beach. Nice shops and friendly locals.

nice. reminded me of cornwall, but warmer. Visited here on my last day in Australia. the weather had been terrible for days, but when we arrived here, out came the sun. a very pleasant beach and some nice shops and restaurants in the town. Reminded me of British summers in Cornwall.Made me want to go to Cornwall actually, which would have saved me the very expensive airfare!
Impressive. A lovely beach in a lovely place. Lots of surfing and beach games going on. A good shopping area leading to the beach and great restaurants. Very busy place, well worth a visit.

Beautiful beach, great location!. How fun to be able to visit fun little shops, eat at yummy restaurants and then walk along this pretty beach. We were visiting in "winter" so it wasn't swimming weather, but it was gorgeous nonetheless.
Gorgeous!. Gorgeous beach, short ferry drive from Sydney. I also enjoyed the walk along the coast. You also find there variety of shops, cafes etc,
Wonderful place. Took a trip to Manly beach by ferry from Sydney Harbour. Lovely location with lots of beach and sands to occupy everyone. A must do from Sydney Harbour.
Fantastic place ...I want to live there .... Just the relaxed atmosphere, peaceful surroundings, amazing views, and overall friendliness of the locals

Beautiful beach. Took the public ferry from circular quay. It takes 30 mins, regular service. Good views of opera house/ bridge along the way. Nice 5 mon walk from ferry terminal to the beach. Lots of restaurants and shops along the beach. Nice walkway along the edge. Water was cold to swim in August. We found it to be better than Bondi beach for the views/ferry ride/scenic walkway.
Cool beach. Love the beach, great place to people watch. Perfect for just a nice afternoon walk. Very clean and inviting.
Beautiful spot. Absolutely stunning spot, so plzd we visited. Highly rec to all. Hard Rock Cafe great place to eat, mall there is fantastic for shopping and the views wow

Great Beach. Even at the end of August it was warm enought to swim & board as the waves were a metre to 2 metres high.The sand is clean & white, plenty eating places & water fountains to top up water bottles.
Give Bondai a miss. Head to Manly beach for something less touristy, it's in a beautiful setting with lovely views and trees. We went in November and it was not busy at all, bit chilly though!

Forget Bondi - Go to Manly. So tourists coming to Sydney all talk about visiting Bondi Beach but don't be fooled. Take the time to hop a harbor ferry and land in Manly on the pier. Take a short walk to the beach and view the ocean like the locals...Clean, Friendly and great food in walking distance. Lots of seating if you don't want to lay on the beach but it is suggested, since it boasts some of the whitest and cleanest sand in the area outside of Palm Beach. So take a day, relax and feel like what it is to be Australian, whether summer or even winter as we experienced it. Can't wait to return
Nice for half a day.. Lovely clean and fairly quiet spot, nice for walking round the bay, lovely ride there from Circular Quay.

Don't miss a trip to Manly when you're in Sydney. Manly is just a beautiful place to have a walk around - whether you want to go to the beach, wander up and down the promenade and get some food/drink or just take a walk along the beach.It's always going to be busy in the summer, but it doesn't make the beach any less lovely. Also, if you take the Manly ferry across - you get some amazing views/pictures of Sydney along the way
Manly break. Beautiful beach for all ages of family and friends. Good walks, great food, and a lovely 1/2 hr ride from Circular Quay. Our favourite Sydney beach.
pretty cool beach. Another wonderful beach in Sydney. Easy to reach by ferry.  with stunning view of the opera house and the harbor bridge . beach super! pines around also good.:-)

Surfs up. Give Bondi beach a miss, and head to Manly beach. Get the Ferry boat from Circular Quay in the city, enjoy the harbor cruise and disembark at Manly wharf. Follow the throngs of people who will be heading up the Corso towards the beach, and the shops. Take a swim, take a walk, grab some fish and chips or a meat pie(watch out for the seagulls) and sit back and people watch.

Nice beach. It's good to hop on the ferry to Manly Island if you have time.
The view from the ferry is superb. Nice small island.
Manly Beach. Took fast ferry from city to Manly Beach - enjoyable lunch by the water - fish and chips. Walked around area close to wharf - filled in day nicely.

Amazing beach. Perfect lovely sandy long stretch beach. Great stunning view. We took the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay to Manly (30 min journey with great astonishing view of Sydney). From Manly wharf walk to Manly Beach via The Torso with shops & restaurants along the walk.

Excellent place to visit in Sydney. Nice atmosphere,several stores,many hotels,wifi in the beach, clean,easy access by ferry (30 minutes and beautiful views from Sydney) or by bus (1 hour) crossing the bridge.

Perfect Sandy Stroll. Long sandy beach, superfine sand, with a surf backdrop, distant views all up the coastline where the ocean breakers foaming against the rocks. It's a wonderful view. There are plenty of places to sit and stare, and relax. It's great to sit and unwind with the Norfolk Pines behind, filled with chattering birds. There are many food outlets in the Corso, the main strip running between the Ocean Beach and the Harbour Beach, and loads of places to buy coffee or icecreams. From the beach there is a stroll around the headland to Shelly Beach, which is the subject of another review. Sometimes there are too many tourists (like me?), too many children running around, too many teenagers doing what teenagers do, but nothing beats Manly Beach.

Lovely beach, great shopping, good atmosphere. Manly Beach has it all. Restaurants, a long boardwalk with shopping, a photographic beach at one end and the Manly Ferry whatf at the other. The only attraction I would avoid is the Manly Aquarium which, last year, was a tired unattractive building. This year I kept close to the Boardwalk and enjoyed eating an icecream on the beach. Plan your visit to Manly when the sun is shining because there won't be many people on the beach if it is raining.

Very pleasant enjoyable stroll. I spent a pleasant Sunday afternoon here with my friend. Took a ferry from Circular Quay over to Manly, had lunch and then walked down the length of the beach and just watched people. The weather was good so there were lots of people on the beach, playing volleyball, surfing, etc. There are water fountains at intervals along the whole stretch which is useful when you get thirsty. A good number of benches as well, if you feel like taking a break.

A great day out. The cheapest way to get out on the harbor! Catch the Manly ferry and take in the breathtaking views of the Opera House and Harbor bridge. Walk to the lovely manly beach and enjoy fish and chips or a kebab, while being lulled by the waves. Stroll back for a Gelato at the pier and then take in the harbor once again on the way home.

Manly Beach. We decided to take the ferry to Manly and then took a stroll to the beach. Even though it was approaching their winter the beach was being used, volley ball, swimmers and surfers. My wife took the opportunity to paddle in the sea as we walked along the beach. Manly itself has a good shops and plenty of places to eat along the sea front. Getting the ferry gives you great views of the Opera House / Bridge etc even better if you arrive back at dusk.

vibrant and colourful. Great place to visit. Small town with great shops and a fabulous beach. If you catch the ferry here from Sydney you will get great views of the opera house an bridge too. Beach is stunning. Much preferred Manly to Bondi.
Beautiful. Went over on the Ferry and had lunch at the Stein Hotel. Beautiful outlook over the beach. Thoroughly enjoyed by all.
A nice clean beach. A nice clean beach when you need to get away from the hustle & bustle of Sydney. Easily accessible and only a short walk from the Marina.
Loved it!. Opposite direction to Bondi and its opposite in every way as it was more beautiful, friendlier and had much more about it

Spend the day in Manly. Manly is one of my favorits beaches on the word. There are many nice beaches close to Manly, you can go walking or by bus. The shops in Manly are also good and the pubs very attractives!

beach vibes. Took a really short trip over to Manly but I loved it. It had a fun, beachy vibe. Once you get off the ferry you can walk straight down, through an area with some shops and to the beach. It's not a long walk, just depends on if you stop at the shops.
Memorable. The shops and restaurants are smaller than those around George street. A cozy and friendly feeling for us to walk around and just sit to enjoy the view over the beach.

Love going to Manly. A great ferry ride across the harbour to Manly and when you get there, many cafes, shops and resturants to choose from! We always go to manly when we go to Sydney. We recommend the kebabs and ice cream from the main mall!

Nice beach. Manly beach is small and located just to one side of the ferry dock. It's a beautiful beach, but it's right in town and could be crowded. We liked the views of the beach as we walked along.

Fantastic beach!. My family in Australia had mentioned that this is the best beach in Sydney and they were not wrong.One can easily access the beach from Circular Quay by taking the ferry. The ferry leaves every 30 minutes, so if you miss one, you can always catch the next one. Be ware that the ferry gates closes 5 - 10 minutes before the ferry actually leaves so you should be inside the ferry terminal in advance by 5 - 10 minutes.I think by far the cheapest way to visit Manly, if you also need to go around Sydney for the day and take Sydney's buses and train system, is to purchase a day pass. The day pass cost 22 auz dollars, but it would save you money in the end as a return trip to Manly cost approximately 15 dollars already.When you arrive at Manly Wharf, there is a straight road from the Wharf all the way to the beach at the end of the road. It is walkable and you do not need to take further public transport. The road is lined with many shops, from grocery stores, eateries to Billabongs and souvenir shops.The area is slightly overpriced, but this is once again a tourist area, so you should spend wisely if you are thinking of purchasing something from Manly.Also not far from the beach are hostels. They are definitely a great idea if you are in Sydney for a chilled holiday and all you want to do is lay on the beach or surf. As mentioned however, if you do decide to stay in Manly, you will be far away from Sydney (15 dollar ferry ride return) so it will be difficult for you to see the attraction in Sydney itself and there is not much to do in Manly besides the beach.The beaches of Manly are fantastic though. They are not crowded, and the beachfront is lined with pine trees, which give great shade under a hot summer sun. You will see plenty of people in the water surfing and kids building sandcastles on the beach. There are also tourists there, especially taking the "jump up when the wave comes in" photos. The beach is quiet and perfect for a relaxing time. Best of all, it is free to go on the beach, one of the gems of Sydney one must visit.
I'd live here. This is a beautiful respite from Sydney: great ocean beach, plenty of places to walk, pedestrian friendly,lots of little boutiques and eateries.

Glorious day out. This is a must!
The beaches are beautiful
The food is fresh
The homes are to die for
Great ferry ride

Take a picnic!. Beautiful! The water is gorgeous, the beach is beautiful, there are loads of restaurants and shops, but there are romantic inlets and lookout points as well. Wish we'd been able to spend more time there! Manly has lots of restaurants and places to get "take away" food. Perfect for a picnic on the beach or on the concrete steps if you want the view without the sand. =)
Time to spend. After many visits to Sydney on business over the last 50 years I finally had the time to spend most of a day at leisure at Manly. It was well worth the wait. Don't miss the walks.
Great beach. Took a bus,sun was shinning was amazed at how lovely this beach is,could imagine it being very crowded in the summer was a great day out worth visiting.
Awesome place to relax and unwind. Manly breach is an awesome place to relax and unwind, muxh better than the tourisy area of Bondy beach
Beautiful beach. Great beach - was very busy with people swimming, surfing, playing in the sand and just relaxing. Huge beach so plenty of room, cares across the road. Had a great time.
Spectacularly Beautiful Beach. This beach is beautiful. We sat on the beach and ate our muffin and drank our chia tea and marveled at the sound of the surf and the site of the waves. A must see.
Summer. Good beach, small waves, nice restaurants around, and the best is the ferry trip to get there! good times!

Great Day out from Sydney. We took the ferry from Circular Quays to Manly. The ferry costs $14.40 for a single adult return and is a great way to see the city from the water. Try and get a seat outside to get the best views. Manly is a nice beach but as we like peace and quiet we decided to grab a picnic lunch from the great deli on Corso and walk out to North Head via Shelly beach. It was lovely and we saw close up a Water Dragon. We sat on some rocks overlooking the sea, had our lunch and tried to spot a whale. No luck!Very nice day out and a change from Sydney and the city.

Great beach!. I stayed in Manly for a month and every morning i ran down the esplanade and round over to Esplanade park - when the suns coming up over manly cove there is no better run - it's short only about twenty minutes but it always brought a smile to my face - i can still picture the clear sea and the sun just coming over the horizon. Pure magic!

Catch the ferry for lunch. Plenty of cafes to pick from that look over the beach.
Even fish and chips sitting on the steps of the beach..lovely

Lovely way to spend a day.... Manly is lovely. Completely mad with tourists and especially college kids but worth a look regardless. One just need walk a few blocks to avoid the mayhem.
It is a real scene in the center but a lovely commuter suburb with a real tie to the natural surroundings.

Brief visit of the area. I had a few hours one Sunday morning before my flight back home.A slightly grey day in the City, but a complete transformation when I arrived at Manly Beach. I hired a car as it's the most flexible way to get about at your own pace, and after negotiating the traffic jams through Mosman (both ways) which I hear are the norm, I arrived at the beach in what seemed to be mid-summer. The beach front was packed, the restaurants were packed, the surfers were to be seen in force arriving on their bicycles, runners, skaters, families, swimmers, all it seems, determined to hang out on the beach for the day.All the parking was full, so not a very car friendly area which is OK with the amount of people wandering around and crossing the road between cafes and beach, plus the ever watchful police who pounce on you if you do happen to stop for a look.I was looking for somewhere quiet to gaze out over the ocean, so I kept on going to the next bay as this was just too busy for me.It looks like there is a shopping area as well if you don't find enough going on at the beach.Everything looked very clean and the public toilets were well maintained even with all the beach-folk.
Its a Beach. Since we went to Manly beach in the spring, we didnt get the full experience. Good location for inexperienced surfers. The waves were small.

Manly, the icon of Sydney beaches.. What is there not to like about Manly Beach. Escape the hustle and bustle of the eastern suburbs and enjoy a safe swim in either the harbour or ocean beach. Coupled with the fantastic beaches, Manly is blessed with some of the finest restaurants in Sydney. If you enjoy bike riding then hire a bike from one of several hire shops and travel along clearly marked bike tracks on level grounds from Queenscliff to Fairy Bower or catch the bus to North Head for spectacular views Sydney harbour and the Ocean.

Best Beach in Sydney. Manly Beach is the best and most public accessible beach in Sydney for all visitors. It has a beautiful stone boardwalk that stretches for miles so that all visitors can either walk along the boardwalk or walk on the beach itself. The Beach offers public conveniences, also has a rock pool and has a plathora of shops and dining (a la carte or cafe) experiences and places to just sit and enjoy the ocean view along the way. The beach is a safe place to swim as it has a proactive lifeguard unit who help and advise visitors when needed. For overseas visitors it is a must to take heed of the warming flags in order for you to swim safely and keep enjoying the day at Manly beach. You can take the public Manly ferry from Sydney (Circular Quary) or a public bus and or drive. The walk between Manly and Fairy Bowers is also a lovely leisurely walk and on weekends especially you will see most families take advantage of this walk beach to beach. On weekend, you will often find market stalls to add more to the lovely cultural village effect. Definitely worth a visit to Manly beach, a great day's outing.

A beach that you can not miss it. One of the best beaches in Sydney. Seafood restaurant around the place where you can sit down having your food and enjoy the great sea view. Tourist attraction coastal walk. It will lead you to a place where you can see dolphins passing through. Also a great place to exercise as both directions that will lead you to other places, you can see great sea view at the same time.
A Sydney Must. A great way to spend a day. The ferry to Manly. a Swim in the clean ocean and lunch to follow. A beer in the pub and the great trip back through the harbour. It doesn't get better.

ONE OF THE BEST BEACHES. The water is so clean and clear and the people are so kind. The sand is clean, there is next to no rubbish. So relaxing and one of Sydneys most beautiful beaches.Plus, Ellen DeGeneres came to Manly Beach!

Great beach, surfing and bars. We spent the day at Manly and took in the beach, coast and a bar or two.Nice chilled vibe to the beach area as well as the bars and restaurants which have a surfing feel to them.They've even got a Ben and Jerry's Ice Cream Parlour which we took advantage of while walking along the beach front and coastal path.

Best beach. Lovely beach. You can just sit there all day and watch then waves and the Surfers. Fab day out. There is a real sense of peace and tranquillity and as the dusk settles, find a bar to overlook the beach. Its a great sunset.

Very Touristy. I went again to Manly recently and was disappointed to see it overun with people and cheap trashy shops all geared for the tourist trade. It has just become too touristy now to enjoy. There are too many other great beaches to enjoy.
Beautiful Beach. This is the best beach around Sydney, surfing and nice sand. Lots of shops, and places to eat. The prices for souvenirs are much lower at Manley Beach than in Sydney

Manly + Bondi beach - a must see when u are in Sydney. One of the best in Sydney. The ferry takes u to Manly island in less than 30minutes and the view from the ferry is just amazing!!!! u have the whole sydney panorama which amazing and also the natural shape of the coast is really nice to observe. The beach is long and beautiful. Recommended!
Go and visit. Nice place to visit. Like that it has 2 beaches for different weather conditions. Have to visit! So nice!
Great Beach. Such a great beach to visit and walk the full length of. You can also walk around to a little beach at Fairy Bower - beautiful.

Fantastic beach. Manley was a lovey beach and very lively with a lot of surfers about. Not so nice was the decidedly tatty pedestrianised area which was full of fried food stalls leading from the ferry down to the beach which gave the initial impression of a down at heel seaside resort . Don't be put off however as the front itself and the beach pis lovely.

Worth a visit. This beach is actually nicer than Bondi unless you are surf mad. great spot with load of beach side restaurants to choose from. Half an hour by ferry from Circular Quay.Nice town to walk through on the way to the beach.

Great day. Such a lovely beach. we took the ferry over from Sydney. Rented a tandem bicycle and rode all around the beach. Had the best fish and chip at a cafe on the beach. Lovely beach town and beautiful beach.

Another lovely coastal beach walk. On Sunday mornings the promenade along Manly beach is full of walkers enjoying the fresh air and sunshine strolling or seriously walking along its pathway. The coffee shops are full of patrons and the atmosphere in this delightful area is wonderful. It's a great place to catch up with friends or take the family especially on a fine morning of which Sydney has many. It's a place we return to often. Great for families, friends, and everyone.
If the weather is good, must do!. If you want something a little lest "touristy" than Bondi, catch the ferry to Manly, walk down The Corso, get some fish and chips and you'll have a great day.

Fantastic place, makes you want to live there. It seems that everyone staying in this area are fit, have a healthy life style and are glowing from wellness and I can understand why. The beach, the views, the sea... wow... I just want to retire here. Loads of beach front cafes and restaurants for the hungry as well. It is a pity that I had only a short 2 hours to explore this haven.

Wonderful walk from Manly Beach to Shelly Beach. It was winter. cold and windy. but it was a great walk from Manly Beach to Shelly Beach. Along the way, the kids had fun on the rocks, looking for crabs, fishes and sea sponges! it was fun! It was supposed to be a short walk. In the end, we took 2-3hrs because of all the fun we had! It was sunset when we got back to Manly Beach. Lunch at watervue alfresco and fish&chips dinner from the takeaway shop next to watervue. we had ice-creams too! YUMMY! what a wonderful afternoon!

Sydney's best beaches. Manly has it all - glorious beaches, great varied cuisine, markets, so much to offer. It is very family friendly. Take a walk rom Manly Beach to Shelly Beach and check out the funky rock sculptures along the way.

My favorite beach.. Manly Is great every year, even when is not summer they have loads of festivals going on (specially the wine festival) and at summer time the sunset is great.. you can enjoy some good beer very close to the sand.

Beautiful Beach. Two beaches in 1 day. Morning went to Bondi, after lunch we took ferry from Circular Quay to Manly Wharf. Just a short walk to reach Manly Beach. We saw a beautiful beach/gold sands/sunset in 1 shot. We didn't plan to swim, cause it's winter time. We only stood in front of the beach to enjoy the view and walked to look around Manly.Manly has St. Matthews Church, many shops, cafe / restaurant, convenience store, etc. Before got ferry back to Circular Quay we stopped by at Aldi to buy some packs of chocolate & biscuits. We took nice pictures of Sydney Opera & city at nights before ferry approached to Circular Quay. We think Manly beach is better than Bondi.

This is the best beach on the PLANET - let alone Sydney!. Manly has it all - great surf along the main beach, sheltered swimming at Shelley, countless cafes and restaurants, shopping along the Corso - all with a laid-back, village atmosphere. Don't waste your time at Sydney's more famous beach - skip the posers and experience the real deal.

Delightful. Stroll the Corso from the ferry terminal to reach the beach area. Fill up your water bottle with free fresh water in the Corso area on the way. Great seating to view the beach and ocean. Clean facilities too. Well worth a visit and maybe a swim.
A beautiful day out at Manly. Wow Manly Beach you are AMAZING. The sand is golden and so fine, the cafes and restaurants are great, the shops fun...love it at Manly.

Friendly. This was very busy but I loved every minute of it. the trip there and then getting there and people every where. so nice and warm on a winters day. Sydney weather was great while we were there :)
Absolutely loved it. We caught the ferry to Manly and absolutely loved it. What a beautiful beach and walk to Shelly Beach! Must do when you visit Sydney!
Just love Manly. Great ferry ride to Cosmopolitan Manly. Get fish and chips from the last f&c shop on the right & enjoy them on the beach.
Probably the best beach in the world. Manly Beach has everything, perfect sand, safe swimming, surf, lifegurads, restaurants and cafes, the Corso for shops and beautiful people.

warmer than Irish sea in winter. A quick swim at manley washed away the hangover and cobwebs from last night's celebrations of the Lions victory.
Sea warmer than Dublin and full waves make it invigorating.
Overrated. I enjoyed this beach, but I thought that for all the hype it was overrated. I've seen nicer beaches in Hawaii and California. Nothing special. Just my opinion.

Nice Day Trip from Sydney!. We enjoyed the beach and the lovely town. There was lots to do and see! Also, many restaurants to grab a bite to eat. We were there on a Sunday so there was also an outdoor market to shop in!
Slightly over rated. Not the best beach a bit too touristy.. Head up the coast for a better quieter spot..At least its close to some good bars so a nice place for a sunday sesision

Terrific View & People Watching. We really enjoyed our day at Manly Beach, spent a few hours here at the tail end of our Australia trip last summer. The ferry ride itself from Sydney was quite scenic and enjoyable, and only 30 minutes. Manly is a cute little town, great boardwalk to walk along, even in the winter. There are lots of places to stop and watch the surfers, or to grab a bite to eat or drink. I recommend Whitewater, nice fish and chips and beer choices, and with outdoor seating, across the road from the boardwalk.
Sand for Africa,um, No Australia.. Love getting to Manly and spending time on the boulevard, visiting all the waterfront |hotels and cafe's. Always take the time to get over and have a look around.

Terrific whether it be main beach or small one. The esplanade is totally flat, with bars and restaurants and some quiet areas.both main beach and small beach to right looking out to sea are a joy to sit and play on and can be enjoyed by all ages

Nicest beach in Sydney. This is a lot nicer than Bondi beach. beautiful coastal area, with a very nice, scenic walk right along the beach, nice both summer presumably, and winter. restaurants along the way.Between the ferry arrival (the easiest way to get there) and the actual coast it takes about 5-10 minutes walking through a shopping area with the usual not exactly pretty tourist traps, and all the souvenir junk expected.

How cool can you get. The place was sunny (20oC) even in winter and really modern. Not pretentious. Nice feel to it. Seemed to be a young crowd which is hardly surprising. The beach is clean. Waves not daunting.

Good for walking. Not one to tackle the waves but love to walk along the esplanade. Queenscliff to Shelly Beach and back on a fine day is a wonderful way to spend a morning or afternoon. It can be enjoyed by people of all ages and one of the pleasures is seeing all age groups walking, roller-skating or working hard on their scooter skills. Lunch or a coffee can be obtained at Fairy Bower or Shelly Beach. We recently shared this experience with a friend from the States who found it a good introduction to the country.

Nice neighborhood to hang out. It was winter, and expected quieter. But it was not. This was because it was the one week school holiday. So the area was vibrant with activities and people. Beach was clean, and to watch the surfers was nice.
Great waves but town is dated. Great waves but town seems stuck in a 50's or 60's time warp. Obviously it may be different in the summer.

Great beach area. Easy to get to with lots of shopping and food right on the beach. There are lifeguards here to help you feel safe as well. You could easily spend the day wandering around and exploring this part of town.

Experience Manly Whilst Visiting Sydney. The beach is an Australian icon with the wonderful trees, great clean sandy beach and if you are lucky. reasonable waves for body surfing or board riding.The abundant restaurants within this area are great to suit any budget and ceratinly a walk from the beach to the harbour is a must eating one of the great icecreams available from one of the many vendors. Markets are also held and the local crafts are great to purchase as a souvenir.
Golden sand!. Lovely golden sand, a lovely wide sweeping beach. We were surprised the large amount of surfers even for winter. Seems they surf all year round!

Go Manly!. If you ever been to South Beach in Miami, you'd feel like you are in the twin city of it. Manly has such a Great vibe, beautiful beach, good for surfers and lots of food options as well. I wish i could spend there more than just the one day i did

Ordinary beach. Being a Brazilian, I have seen beaches. Manly beach is not extraordinary, except for the small ocean pool on the north side of the beach, near Farm Cove. But there are pools like that in Bondi and Bronte also, so nothing special.
Great Place to Visit. Did this trip twice on the Ferry on our recent stay in Sydney. The beach was lovely and nice to walk along the shore front. Plenty of shops and cafes to potter around in.

Lovely beach. Golden sandy beach. Lots of restaurants a stones throw from the beach - prefer Manly to Bondi!
Defintely worth a visit.

Manly Beach. Lots of little cafes & restaurants & shops, lovely to sit & watch the surfers catching a wave or a walk along the boardwalk, great little walk to the right around the cliff to a cute little beach with a lovely restaurant called 'The Kiosk" sit outside under the umbrella's or inside, wonderful food,.great water view.

Enjoy the day in Manly. I always love to go there for fresh air and walk around the coastline. There's a lot to do, like going to the Aquarium, or have lunch in the marina, or browse around the Flea market. This place is a tourist attraction.
Epic surf spot. Great spot to people watch and soak in the rays! Lots of food places to choose from, beach sand not as white as in the West but a beautiful place to visit

Little bit of Southern California beach life in Australia. Relatives in Adelaide insisted we take The Manly Ferry here for a day of sightseeing and skip Bondi Beach. They were right on! It was a gorgeous late fall day. Very warm with kids on a school holiday. Enjoyed watching surfing schools for little kids and wished we had had our grand kids with us. We really did think we were back in the states walking along Hermossa Beach. Very laid back like southern California and the beach was beautiful. Walked from one end to the other which is a hike but worked up an appetite for a wonderful seafood lunch at a local restaurant, Le Kiosk, looking out at the water on Shelley Beach. Spent a couple of hours walking the town. Very touristy. Good place to by gifts for kids at home. Found Aboriginal Dreamtime Fine Art Gallery at 36 the corso with lovely Aboriginal Art for sale. Could not convince my husband we needed to add this art work to our home but I thought she had the best selection we had seen. Understanding the history of each painting and the artist creating it is worth spending time in these galleries. Loved getting my feet wet in the Manly Bay and soaking up the sun. If we had not had ballet tickets at the Opera House that evening, we would have stayed, rented bicycles and enjoyed a sunset dinner. If we were ever to return to Sydney, I would plan a few days staying at one of the small boutique hotels advertised in Manly literature.
Manly a Definite Must to Visit. Australia really know how to do beaches, this one is perfect especially the sand and no litter, good work Manly.

just a beach. With soooo many awesome beaches this is OK. If in town and over at Manly you should go down for a look, but it doesn't inspire me to want to go for a swim when I'm there - even in summer. But then again I do live near some of the finest beaches around so may be a bit biased.
Forget Bondi!. Manly is SOOO much better than Bondi beach. Beautiful white sands, clear blue sea, less crowd. And you get to take a ferry from the scenic Circular Quay

Absolute Gem. My favourite beach in NSW by far. Even getting the ferry over there from Circular Quay adds to the lovely atmosphere of heading to Manly for the day. Once you get there there's lots of nice little shops and restaurants to walk past before you get to the beautiful long stretch of sand and sea.
A must when in Sydney. A must visit when in Sydney.take the manly water taxi and spend some time in this beautiful beach culture environment.

See the surf. Got the Ferry to Manly whilst staying in Sydney. Had been before 5 years ago but it was a must for me this time. Although the weather was a little showery I still enjoyed the walk along the beach and the surf was absolutely spot on.
Grate Beach. This is one of the best beaches in Sydney. You also have a big variety in terms of restaurants close by and options to spend a fun afternoon.

If you've got the time, DO THIS!. Hmmm...was it from Pier 9? Not sure, but take one of the ferries from Sydney Harbor over to this place. It's really neat. Despite having a great beach and pedestrian friendly touristy shopping... Q station is also a cool visit, too. Taxi or bus can take you there...and it's a walk down the historic process of immigration in Australia. VERY interesting!!! :) On the way home, make sure to sample the ice creams at the ferry station! YUMMY!

great walk. the walk along either the promenade or waters edge is really nice. Sit around and people watch. Walking pass Manly and around to Cabbage Tree Bay and beyond is excellent. Some beautiful scenery, nice small beaches, good eateries, lots of places to sit and relax. Continuing onwards and upwards becomes a bushwalk with excellent views along Manly and the northern beaches. One can keeping walking to North Sydney Head
A must in Summer. What a beautiful beach just wishing I came here in summer but still a great place to see all year round. Grab some fish and chips for lunch and enjoy the atmosphere

Surf's up!. Tourists from interstate - of course we had to visit Manly Beach. We dodged a torrential downpour, then bought our fish and chips to eat on the beach. Cold day, big surf with several "ironmen" braving the conditions.This was the Manly Beach we'd heard so much about over the years. We weren't disappointed.

Great Place. Caught the ferry over to Manly as had a few hours to pass before going to the airport. Very easy to get ferry. Glad i did. It has a lovely beach. There was quite a few surfers about for a Tuesday morning. What a life style. There are also heaps of cafes restraunts along the beach. There is a great mall area known as the Corso. Would recommend a visit to Manly. Will go there next time i'am in Sydney and have more time.

The best. Great sandy beach, with loads of folk enjoying it. Can get busy, particularly along the prom at the rear of the beach, but "nice busy" not crowded. Lots of places to eat and bars nearby. A great spot.

Relaxing beach... A short walk from the drop point of manly ferry is the manly beach. A nice beach in the shape of arc but could not spend much time in the water nor the sand as it was quite cold. There were many in water, particularly kids.It has a nice walk path and seating area, spent the afternoon here and then walked on the path till the top of Shelly beach. It has beautiful natural views all the way through and did not disappoint me at all.

Good fish & chips. The beach is always busy no matter what time of the year for surfers and sun lovers. Great spot to people watch. Grab fish & chips from The Fish Cafe and eat them on the corso. Get there from Circular Quay on a ferry.
