Flesh beach. We went on New Years Day - bad mistake ....it was like a seal colony of trippers , hardly any sand to see and very noisy ...better to go on a quieter day !!

what a place. i enjoyed manly more than bondi sitting on the beach watching the surfers eating the best fish and chips I have ever had was wonderful it was easy to get to on the ferry the town was small but very welcoming and you could spend a far few hours here

Loved every inch of this place...not to miss!. This place has everything...hiking the Sydney National Park...overlooking cliffs to the ocean. Watching people surf and play volleyball. Shopping in the little shops; eating great seafood and the best gelatto around.

great place away from city. I took the ferry from circular quay to manly which takes 30 mins.
It is a nice cruise passing through the bridge and opera house so you can take good photos.
there're many good restaurants around manly beach too.
it's a good place to go and enjoy the sea breeze.

Disappointed looking run down. Caught the manly ferry from circular quay which is a must - but manly ipad not visited for about 5 years, looked run down and lots of homeless people. Beach was a bit dirty and shops looked run down. I stayed about 2 hours and got back on ferry to Sydney, beach was ok for swim but I did not feel safe leaving my things on beach so stayed close by.

Fantastic beach. The Manly beach is great. It is near the shops and cafes and is long and clean. Everything you want from a beach. We were staying in Manly so it was handy but still worth a visit and only a short walk from the ferry.
Beautiful. Best fish & chips ever had..shops are very shopper friendly.. some upper scale and the rest perfect for that special souvenir.

Still my favourite beach in Sydney. Noosa and Manly both have something special for me - hard to define - but they both feel more natural than the concrete jungle of Bondi.Still good for swimming, lovely to walk down - a good variety of cafes and restaurants nearby - parking may be the only issue as it is difficult at times to park near where you want to be.

Wasn't aware of the topless section until.... Fortunately I wasn't traveling with my family, but I had walked from the ferry directly to the beach and found a spot, by 1pm, I realized that this prime spot was topless. There is a family friendly spot about a 100 meters down the beach.

Mellow beach. Hope to visit when weather is warmer.. Manly seemed liked the perfect beach for the avid SUPer or the beginner surfer. The weather was too cold when we visited for us to do this, but there were some die-hards out there. The experienced surfers are on the more adventuresome beaches
Great beach. Too many people but nice to have a nice beach close by and still enjoy amenities, nice place to chill with friends, go for a walk and ejoy the sunshine

just as good if not better than Bondi Beach. Manly beach is just as good if not better than Bondi Beach. You can get the Manly Ferry from the city and it only takes around 35 mins. Manly has lots of great restaurants from take aways to fine dinning. Well worth a visit .

Perfection on a sunny day. This ticks all the boxes when the weather is nice and sunny and the sea is calm. Water is very clean and the beach is fine golden sand - ideal to relax, do some sunbathing, then take a good swim. If it's a bit more windy you could walk SE along the promenade to Shelley Beach for more shelter.

Some inspiration as to how to spend some of that Lottery winning prize money!. So, you have toured the city centre of Sydney, made good use of the decent metro system, and happily snapped away at the Harbour Bridge. Or, you may have just arrived early morning from a long haul flight, and need to çlear the cobwebs away'.Take the Manly ferry from Circular Quay, and if possible, sit outside on deck for the lovely journey across the Harbour to Manly. It has some very nice 1930s apartments and buildings, a beautiful beach, where you can watch those who perhaps before being brave enough to surf at Bondi, come here to practice, and there is a wide choice of places to have lunch or coffee. Certainly, a trip to Manly should be part of a visit to Sydney, but it is also a very civilized way to spend part of your day in this amazing city. Now, where did I put that real estates phone number?!

Beautiful. No other word to discribe it, a well thought out design along the beach front, plenty of seats in shaded area, plenty of filtered water fountains, lovely sand and rolling waves to view. I was there on a balmy 24 degree day during May so not over crowded with tourists or locals, a must have are fish'n'chips on the foreshore.

"Man!". The travel on the ferry was good. Once my son and I were there we went for a look at the beach, and a feed. Good fish and chips, the baramundi is beautiful and moist. Walked along and around the bay to the right, there was a pool inset to the beach. A few people were swimming in the pool, my son joined in, it was so relaxing! There were people from Spain, and Greece, who were friendly, the sun was scorching, so sorbet all around! Plenty of shops, people friendly.

Love Manly Beach. I lived close by to Manly so I was a frequent visitor of the cafes and restaurants and bars. The guys are gorgeous and there's plenty of surf. Such a beautiful location and I would recommend this spot to anybody visiting.
Biking fun. Traveled with my almost 10 year old daughter to Manly...We took the ferry to Manly and rented bikes. The day could have not been more fun or perfect... A MUST Do.

Plan to spend 1/2 day at least. Great to do.. Take the public ferry and enjoy the harbor views. It's a touristy little town, but a lot going on, lots of places to eat and have ice cream, and a very nice beach to spend time at. Would highly recommend if you have time. The ferry ride is worth going for even if you come right back. Reasonably priced for Sydney
Relax at Manly. Some nice restaurants & cafes in Manly and of course a wonderful beach. Catch the ferry from the city and be knocked out by the best harbour in the world.
A great stop while on a bus tour. We walked into the shopping area to look for souvenirs, got ice cream, then sat by the beach watching surfers. Lots of shops, great walking on or by the beach.

Must Do. Great ferry from Circular Quai. Nice walking, shopping and dining options. Great place to people watch with the large waves and surfers. We enjoyed an early supper at one of the restaurants overlooking the beach.

Less touristy than Bondi. Nice beach, easy to get to via ferry from Circular Quay. Shopping strip was also nice to wander through. Was very busy when we were there and had no intention of getting into swim attire due to nursing sunburn from two days prior. Many jellyfish sightings here from what we could gather.

Good place for lunch and a stroll ,or for tourists. This isnt our best beach. Its nice due to the buzz of people and wide choice of places to eat. Most are pretty good. There is a market here on weekends. Its nice to get here by Ferry from the city. Parking in Manly is hard, very hard and expensive. It isnt a very safe place at night. At night and on weekend nights it does not have the best reputation. You really should go in a group.

Nice getaway from Sydney. We liked the slower pace; easier going over at Manly. Spent an afternoon over here and strolled through the pedestrial mall in the center of town as well as hit the brewery which was serving up a nice selection of beers.
nothing special. its a beach, maybe great for surfing, I don't know. For families, its like a busy WA beach anywhere with more yellow sand. Didn't excite us. Manly itself was beautiful.

Nice beach and great shops. Manly has 1) A nice ferry ride associate with it (from Circular Quay), 2) Many shops and food choices (had Kangaroo Burger and Barramundi Fish and Chips), and 3) nice beach.From the ferry, you have to walk across the town to get to the beach side. There are maps everywhere directing you how to get around Manly.If you forgot sunscreen, there are many "Discount Shops" that will sell it from $10 (100ml tube) to $12 (200ml tube).After 3PM (when I went) the trees shade the beach a little too much cooling it down (-1 star). The waves are unpredictable as well. The first day I went they were 4-6 feet. The second time I went, they were less than a foot.Overall I would recommend this as one of the things to do in Sydney.
Great Serenity. Manly beach is full of activity! There are great cafes, restaurants and shops lining the water, always plenty to do, or you can sit and relax on the waters edge.

One of the best days ever!. We drove to Manly as we were staying south of the City. We tried to park on the front overlooking the beach but realised it was short stay and very expensive so we headed towards one of the 3 or 4 other car parks that were signed and found a reasonably priced multi-story just a short walk from the beach. We played with our 3 and 6 year old kids on the beach all day and they thoroughly enjoyed being in and out of the sea in the safe swimming area. It's the furthest I've ever been in the sea (wet hair!!) and smiled all day. Do not (unlike the fool we watched have to be rescued) ignore the flags!The beach was clean and the loos were fine. Picnic area was great and a good shady break from the sun. Ben and Jerrys Ice Cream parlour was a pleasing find too. I count down the time 'til we can return to this fantastic beach!

Lovely beach with good views. We too the walk from one end of manly beach to the other and enjoyed it. The only reason I haven't gone with 5 starts is that the bit where it joins the street from Manly Ferry is really busy with both people and seagulls. The seagulls are really aggressive and will try to pinch whatever you are eating.

Perhaps the best beach in Sydney. What a great beach this s. better than Bondi as there less effort to get onto the beach and what a great venue. Judging by the evident popularity this is the favored recreational beech in Sydney area! The surrounding cafe's, restaurants and eateries are all popular and appear to be serving good food! The crowds of obvious locals indicate its popularity! What better recommendation?
great sydney. you must go to the Manly Beach. With shore club hotel ,mexico resteraunt and great beach, it can be very fun for couples and families.have fun.

A must for a trip to Sydney. Gloriouos day, lots of interesting folk, great fish and chips - just watch the seagulls - they can sneak a bit of fish from your fingers while you are otherwise engaged by the view!
Manley. Well we went twice to Manley first time not so good second was a lovely spring day plenty off ppl about and lovely fish and chips worth a trip on a lovely day the ferry trip over is nice too
better than Bondi. Not only is Manly a lovely beach, the ferry ride is great and you get the harbour too. Beautiful walk around to shellybeach.

Paradise. If you visit Manly Beach you also get the shopping, many, many restaurants to suit all tastes and $'s, and more than just Manly Beach. There is the great little walk around to Shelly Beach and also the harbouside walk around through Fairlight. There's also the Aquarium on the harbourside of Manly. Walk from the ferry through the Corso to the beach end. Have a drink or lunch in one of the restaurants or pubs or just fish and chips by the beach. Fabulous

Seven miles from Sydney and thousand miles from care!. 7 Miles from Sydney and 1000 miles from care was the slogan used by the Port Jackson & Manly Steamship Company in 1940 and it still holds true. If you have come to the bustling city of Sydney and not visited the carefree Manly beach you have missed out on the saner side of the city. Cnnected to the Circular Quay by the Manly ferry service, this 30 minutes of sailing takes you to paradise. There are bicycles for hire and you can walk or jog as you please. This is the beach on the northern side of Sydney and has beach patrol and life savers besides a host of sporty youth trying their hand in beach volleyball.

2 lovely beaches. 2 nice beaches on either side of the isthmus, also an enclose area for those who don't like the open sea. Lovely walk around Federation point. Water looked very clear and clean though I didn't swim. Only small waves for surfers, but I guess this is just the prevailing conditions

Beautiful urban beach escape!. What a gorgeous beach in the middle of a city! The waves were substantial and the beach looked very clean. We just walked upon the promenade and enjoyed watching the surfers wait for a perfect wave. I'd likely rank it 5 stars if we'd hung out longer/gone in the water.
Beautiful beach with room to move. Popular spot reminds me of Adelaide's Glenelg Beach good shop's close by and great atmosphere just like Glenelg

What!? We need to go back!. We had no idea what a 'find' Manly is until we visited on our final day in Australia. So much fun shopping, dining & beach time to be had! Would definitely stay HERE vs. in Sydney if we'd known better. Very affordable food compared to anywhere we found in Sydney - and it had the ONLY full Grocery Market/Store we saw our 2 full weeks in Australia! Love the laid-back, 'surfer' vibe & all the Families enjoying the area!
Fun Beach Town. Great Beach, lots of beach shops, pubs, and restaurants. A great place to spend some time. We loved watching the kayaking teams practicing.
Manly Beach. A busy public beach but it has lots of anemities, washrooms, change rooms and outdoor showers. You can rent surf boards by the hour as well as towels. Fun vibe to the area.
Great body surfing beach. Warmer than Melbourne beaches and good waves. Short walk from ferry with interesting shops along the way. Lovely place in Sydney
Beautiful beach. We were at the beach recently and found it very clean. Wonderful wall on which to sit if you didn't have a beach chair or large towel. Lovely walk over to Shelly Beach.

Good trip and nice beach. Very pleasant trip on the ferry across the harbour with good views of Sydney, the bridge and the opera house. Beach at Manly very child friendly and good coastal walk and swim at Shelly bay.

Lovely walk from the Split bridge to Manly beach. A great easy walk from the Split bridge to Manly beach. Very lovely in Manly, lots to see and eat there and you can catch the ferry from Manly wharf back to Circular Quay certainly a nice way to see sydney harbour.
Spend an hour. Take a ferry and spend an hour. Lovely beach and good location for pubs and restaurants. The area is clean and the vibes friendly and good. Bring the camera.

Manly beach quiet and picturesque. Visited on a wet day so it was quiet. A few surfers in the water trying to catch a wave and one or two people walking about in the rain. Clean and tidy and pleasant surroundings. It is a place well worth a visit but seems to be wrongly overshadowed by more famous local beaches.

Quiet beach. If you want to enjoy quiet beach with surfers and a few exercising men and women on the water front it is ideal.You can take a bus ride for about an hour from CBD or Manly ferry from circular quay

Good beach. Still can't get over the pine trees lining up the beach as opposed to palm trees, very different! Nice to see the surfers and people enjoying the beach. Took the ferry to Manly and walked the Corso to get to the beach. Would visit again
Lovely Beach. This is a lovely beach and is easy to get to on the Manly Ferris. We saw dolphins the day we went. The water is warm and clear a great day out.

Beautiful & bustling. Have been to Manly Beach several times while visiting Sydney, it is a lovely place to visit, catching the ferry over from circular Quay..it is a must do for tourists to Australia.. To have a swim, or just sit & have fish & chips..always enjoyable..

Great beach. After a journey on the Manly ferry we arrived a walked through the town to the surfing beach where we spent some time it was a beautiful day the beach was busy with people enjoying the various facilities from surfing beach volleyball and generally lazing about in the sun it seems to be the place to live the Aussie lifestyle.Hard to fault it really.

Wish we'd had more time.... ...to spend here. Beautiful beach, wonderful sand, blue, blue sea and sky...what more could you want? Shops?... very sensibly positioned at right-angles to the beach, a whole street of them, offering anything you might wish to buy! Public toilets right on the seafront were handy too.

Better than Bondi. Catch the ferry from Circular Quay for $9.80 and walk thru to the beach, if you go on Sunday there is also a small market to look thru. Manly beach is awesome, plenty of space, surf, patrolled, and board hire/lessons. Plenty of bars and restaurants as well as takeaways and some great walks.

I LOVE MANLY. Manly has such a good feel to it, whenever I go there I feel like im on holiday and not in Sydney!Shelly beach is lovely and only a short walk. A great place to go for a drink in Manly wine and Sugar Lounge!

Manly Beach. Ferry was crowded, but a terrific Sunday deal - Enjoyed lunch outdoors, great people watching.We returned to our caravan park at Lane Cove by bus and train for a different view of parts of the city.
A must-do trip, and an easy way to go to the beach. This excursion combines the harbor with a charming seaside town, and the beach is a short stroll from the ferry. Spend an hour or spend the day.
Beautiful. Absolutely brilliant beach with amazing views and very clean. Have a drink in one of the bars/cafes looking over the beach
A sunday fun. Clean, supervised beach with well-kept but basic public toilets/changing rooms and restaurants & other services close by.

Kayaking. WE shared double kayaks from Manly beach (pre-booked as we were a large group), paddled to a secluded beach (just us) with safety boat follwing, spent an hour swimming, playing games, etc, then paddled back,. It was a highlight of our visit to Sydney

A good place for a few days vacation and relaxing. The Ferry ride to Manley Beach was very nice, you get to see so much of the harbor, and the Sydney Harbor is a very busy place. Walked down to the beach, it is beautiful, clean and inviting, we did not have a lot of time so we could only look and enjoy the area that way. So happy we took the time to go

Treat. This beach is really wonderful.Worth the walk from the ferry.Very long and wide.Great rollers here.Lifegaurd patrol.Soft clean white sand.Watch out for the water dragons which are in abundance here and a protected species.

Take the Ferry. Rather than spend a fortune on boat trips around the harbour take the Manly ferry to Manly Beach. It costs a fraction of what you'd pay for 'tour boat with commentary' and you get great views of the Opera House and Bridge. Manly is a nice seaside sort of place place with good bars to eat and drink in and as the beaches are clean and patrolled by life guards it's safe to go in the sea. I thought this was one of the best bargins I had on my holiday, I was advised to use the ferry by a chap I got talking to on the 'Hop on - hop off' bus, which is another good value attraction.
Worth the visit. This is a beautiful sandy beach, the sea is ideal for surfing or body boarding.very clean lots of places to eat, and numerous water fountains to refill your water bottles.
Excellent beach!. Manly beach is really beautiful and good for swimming and surfing! We had a great time here and would definitely recommend it!

Very Crouded. thought we better go to a sydney beach whilst here, went on the manly ferry from circular quay. the beach is very crouded but i suppose it will be! lifeguard on duty all day. great surf shops from the ferry down to the main big beach. many many other shops also. on the whole i have been to alot nicer beaches but worth a trip to see an sydney beach!
A walk around Manley. We walked around Manley , the beach is nice but the walk around coast to the North Harbour was really nice , you can walk to the Spit but that is a longer walk - up to 2 hours.

What a great place to spend a Saturday afternoon or any afternoon.. I think this is my favourite beach in all of Sydney. What a place to spend a Saturday afternoon or indeed any afternoon for that matter. In my view, if you only have a few days in Sydney then a visit to Manly via one of the large ferries - Narrabeen, Collaroy, Freshwater or Queenscliff (they are named after some of the Northern beaches) is a must. They take up to 1100 passengers and if you are observant you can see the counters at Circular Quay/Manly which show the number of spaces left on each ferry. It can be a bit 'choppy' when you come to the Gap (open sea to your right) going to Manly but that only lasts for a few minutes.There are lovely walks both to the left and right when you come to the seafront at Manly via the corso (pedestrian mall with all the shops) from the ferry terminal. The beach is perhaps predictably busy around here but usually I head to the left and if you are lucky you may be rewarded by being able to watch a game of beach volleyball - quite mesmerising and very watchable in some respects! It is a very relaxing and undemanding walk to North Steyne beach and then Queenscliff with the 'trademark' Norfolk pines to the left. If you are energetic you could even walk to Freshwater beach and keep on going to beach after beach heading north!Doubling back and going past the corso, the very small Shelly beach is well worth a visit - again a nice walk round there and from here you can see the Northern beaches away in the distance. In my opinion, Manly is a very well presented and maintained set of beaches and promenade walks, mainly devoid of the backpacker brigade which is a definite plus. Plenty of 'bathroom' facilities and seats available. A classy area and even the dogs are nice breeds and well behaved - seriously.At weekends, the crafts market is defintely worth a visit - nice locally produced goods and if you are there mid to end of January then Humphreys newsagents in the corso really reduces the prices of the Northern beaches calendars which generally you can't get in Sydney itself- great value.In summary, Manly is a must visit.

Many is a Nice area and Beach. I have been to Manly beach several times by ferry from Circular Quey. The shops and beach are really relaxing and lay back. I love the trees along the walk area and just lounging in the shade. I went to one on the pubs and had a great lunch a while ago but cant remember the name of it. For a great day at the beach and a nice lunch it is a must.
Nice enough beach but on a busy road. The beach is nice enough but Manly is so hectic and has become a bit of a backpacker scene. Lots of traffic on the road and noisy bars etc.

Great sandy beach. You alight from the ferry at Manly Wharf in Manly Cove, and ignoring the pretty nice scenery already surrounding you, cross the street into the pedestrianised street called The Corso. Walk along here (about 400 metres I'd estimate) and you then emerge onto South Steyne. The other side of this road is a grassy and tree-lined esplanade beyond which is Manly Beach. Strictly speaking this runs south (to your right) but becomes North Steyne Beach and then Queenscliff Beach to the north (your left). As far as the visitor is concerned you can regard this all as one, and magnificent it is too with beautiful light yellow sand and warm Pacific water. There are various sections given over to different pursuits such as volleyball and the obligatory surfing and this separation is well enforced. We were there on a sunny Sunday, but even though busy it was nothing like the zoo that European beaches can be. The road is lined with eateries of varying kinds as well as other shops and indeed The Corso is much the same. If you want to picnic or get a take-out there are benches and tables available on the grassed area. Do the walk along to Shelly Beach (very easy,1 km max) and look out for the water dragons en route. Be as active or sedentary as you wish, this is just a fantastic place - a Sydney must-do.

Ferry trip to Manly Beach - easy for tourists to do!. We asked enough questions of our tour guide (who was leaving us after a week package tour), as well as our hotel concierge. Once armed with enough information, we bought all-day transit passes, walked from our downtown hotel, took a bus to Circular Quay in Sydney Harbour, then took the next ferry out to Manly Beach, after a nice ~30 minute scenic boat ride. We knew enough to walk straight ahead, thru the street of souvenir, food and surf shops, to Manly Beach, on the other side of the shopping walkway. The beach was crowded, since it was a warm weekend, we enjoyed walking around the beach, and had a good time. When we had seen enough, we walked back to the Ferry and returned to Sydney. It was a fun side trip, easy enough to do (for those like us that were tourists, visitors), and without a car or our own transportation (relied on all public transit). It was a fun visit and glad that we got to see Manly Beach.
Great beach - much prettier than Bondi - which is over rated. Good surfing beach and some nice places to eat. Lots of atmosphere - quite busy so if you want a quiet time - try somewhere else!

Lovely place and not far from the hustle and bustle of Sydney. Across to Manley by ferry - easy to do. Nice little bay on arrival. Cross the road and walk through the town centre to the other beach which was very good.

Best Beach in Sydney. You must visit Manly and Shelly beach ... just beautiful, relaxing and sums up the cafe culture in its finest. Coffee watching the waves in the sunshine ... perfect morning without a doubt, definatly Sydneys best beach.

nice long sandy beach and easy to reach !. we took the ferry from circular quay in sydney harbour and after a 30 minute trip we arrived at manly beach. just a 10 minute walk straight ahead from the ferry wharf and voila you see the wonderful pacific ocean. nice beach and very hot in march. dont forget the sun screen !really a gorgeous day trip or have a drink at night in one of the numerous bars and restaurants. last ferry at 11.40 pm or something so you have plenty of time :)not to be missed !by the way the one and only inexpensive supermarket in sydney is in the manly terminal , aldi ! so get some food on your way back haha
Beautiful. Gorgeous long sandy beach. We went by ferry and walked up through the street full of lovely shops, then sat on the beach eating the famous Manly fish and chips..... Fantastic!

Worth seeing. We took the ferry out to Manly beach - it was definitely worth seeing. The waves were huge the day were were there and they were telling people to stay out of the water, though quite a few went in anyway. It is a very urban beach experience (more like Brighton Beach Brooklyn than the Caribbean) but the beach was clean, the people were nice, the facilities were clean and there were plenty of restaurants and shops. A great, quick, easy, day trip from the city.
paradise. if you are in sydney this is a must to take a day and travel out by ferry to this beautiful place - we spent the day beside the beach and enjoyed the day immensely

A Great Ferry Trip. Manly beach is found within easy access of the ferry taken from Central Quay to Manly. This gives a wonderful boat trip in essence. So rather than pay for a cruise of the harbour, if you are on a budget, the trip to Manly gives you spectacular views of the Sydney Harbour Bridge and also the Opera House - a real photo opportunity! Manyly itself is a charming seaside town with lots of eateries and you can fill up your drinking water bottle from taps in the street. The beach is clean and has huge breakers with floury white sand. To my mind this is easier to get to and more enjoyable than Bondi!

Windy, beautiful waves. Took the ferry over and walked the beach. Just as we arrived they closed the beach to swimmers due to large waves. Never seen so many volleyball nets on a beach. The street leading between the ferry dock and the beach was interesting to walk down. The walk on the beachfront by the ferry was pretty. Did not see any of the penguins the signs kept telling us to watch out for.

Probably the best Beach in the World. This beach has everything, great surf, safe bathing, lots of activities and the Corso for entertainment; plus great bars next to the beach. The crowds make this a great place to be seen at!
Manly beach. The admosphere is nice and it is great to get away from the big city of Sydney. However it is difficult to cycle for the map is not very clear on where you have to go.

Such a lively beach. This is one of the best beaches to go to when visiting Sydney. It is super close (we would take the ferry from Darling Harbor). The beach itself is great, but the restaurants and shops and people around there make the whole atmosphere something special. You must go here when in Sydney.

Beautiful beach. It was great to take the Manly ferry from Darling Harbor to Manly and walk down to this beach. It was not too crowded when we went (late afternoon) was had a nice track alongside the beach to walk on. It was a good change of scenery after visiting various places in and near CBD Sydney for a few days.
Had a Superb Lunch. Travelled here for holiday over New Years had lunch so close to the beach on a beautiful day fantastic place, awesome beach great location.

Local Knowledge. As I liver locally, I spend a lot of time in and around Manly but of particular interest is the walk from Manly to Shelly Beach. As you walk around by Cabbage Tree Bay, you will see little water dragons sunning themselves on the rocks, people enjoying a coffee at Fairy Bower, dogs on leads taking their humans for a leisurely stroll and another beautiful, peaceful beach at the end of it with views back to Manly and the Northern Beaches. What more could you want.

nice getaway from the city. i enjoyed the beach its a great getaway from the busy city. australias currency is so strong right now so i was skint by the end of my trip, so if youre from europe make sure you save up!!! the beach was nice though.

Lovely Beach. You think of Sydney and most people think of Bondi Beach, but I think Manly Beach is just as good if not better. Large clean beach with lots of little resturants, bars and shops catering for everybody. Get the ferry from Circular Quay which takes 30mins, well worth it.

Great way to spend a day in Sydney. Take the ferry from the main wharf area in Sydney, enjoy the views of the Opera House, Bridgeand the Sydney skyline. Walk from the Manly Wharf down the Corso(pedestrian street lined with stops, restaurants, etc.) to the beach. Even on a day that may be cloudy, the beach will becrowded. Enjoy the surfers, the food, the crowds and then head back to Sydney on the 1/2 hourferry ride. It's a great way to spend part of a day in beautiful Sydney.

Two Beaches. We were told by an Australia who lives in Sydney that the best beaches are found at Manly (not Bondi). We took the ferry to Manly. There is a small beach beside the ferry terminal and the open sea on the other side of the peninsula - a walk of about 10 mins from the ferry terminal. When we were there the far beach had powerful waves and some youngsters were surfing. The beach beside the ferry terminal, being protected by the estuary, was wave-free.
What a Beach. Love Manly. Head over on the ferry. Check out the shop. Grab some Fish and chips. Head to the Beach. Go for a swim. Build a sandcastle. Great family day.

Beautiful, world class beach.. Manly beach is my favourite of all the Sydney beaches. Even if its too chilly for a swim. Love spending an afternoon by the water eating fish and chips and taking n the view. Absolutely beautiful spot.

Don't need to go as far as Bondi. We liked this beach area better than Bondi, which likely is more famous. Great sand for relaxing, ocean views with losts of surfers to watch, great walks and easy access to shops and food. What more would you need? Do go.

Beautiful beach. Beautiful day out getting the Manly ferry from Circular Quay Sydney Harbour. Ferries are a fantastic way to get about. The Wharf at Manly is very quiet and small, but walk down the connecting main street, which has lots of shops and eating places, and the surfing beach is fab and gets the sun all day. Fantastic Deli on the main street..makes a change from ordinary food.
Beautiful beach. We took the ferry to Manly Beach and really liked the shopping and the beach area. We liked it so much, that we took the ferry the next night & had dinner on the beach.

Beautiful. Such a lovely beach. we took the ferry over from Sydney. Rented a tandem bicycle and rode all around the beach. Had the best fish and chip at a cafe on the beach. Lovely beach town and beautiful beach --Great day

Busy surfing beach. Manly is a bit over hyped I think. It is nice, it's two bays and a wharf with restaurants. There is a shopping street too with a mix of shops, parking is expensive as it is everywhere!
Relaxed day out. A fun beach with loads of funky surf stores, to buy your newest bikini. The beach is great for people watching and having a relaxed day in the sun!

Surfing, Volley ball, paddle boards all here to see and do.. A Wonderful esplanade to stroll along and watch the swimmers, surfters, everyone having a lovely relaxed time. Or sit in one of the numerous coffee bars or restaurants and watch the world go by.

Manly Beach Well Worth A Visit or Two. During our recent journey to Australia, my wife and I visited Manly Beach twice. We reached there by taking the easy ride on the Sydney Ferry that leaves Circular Quay and arrives at Manly about 1/2 hour later. That was fun, plain and simple.I rate this beach as number two in the area as I have a yen for Bondi Beach first. But Manly Beach is still worth a visit or two. The beach is pretty good. Like all surf beaches, you have to be safe and swim only when told it is safe and always stay between the flags. It saves lives and seems simple enough even when there and in the water.One big thing that Manly Beach has going for it is The Corso shopping area. On The Corso, one can find lots of good souvenirs in all price ranges, and also lots of places to eat at. It is well worth the visit and it just would not feel like being at Sydney if we had not gone at least once. There is more beach life to see than just Bondi and Manly is very good in its own right.My wife is disabled and finds it hard and painful to walk. For those reasons, we took none of the local walks in. I wish we could have, but it was out of the question for us.

Waves and all. A nice sandy beach which is very popular, there are large waves which suits the surfers.Manly itself is very good, loads of shops and places to eat. If you are looking for relaxing on the sands, then you might need to look elsewhere.

Nice beach for surfing. Lovely beach for surfing or sunshine.... sky is very bright in Australia especially in Bondi beach and Mainly beach. you can either just lying down on the sand to read your book or you can surf, the waves here are very good for surfing.

Wow !. The beach was closed to swimmers the day we went but this didn"t matter.....just watching the waves smash onto the beach was quite an experience. A vast expanse of white sand and lovely rocky outcrops at the side of the beach. There are lots of delightful cafes and interesting shops in Manly.

Beautiful and clean beach. Most people talk about Bondi Beach as the best, but I found Manly to be just as nice. It is still crowded, but it is a clean beach with beautiful views around it. There are lots of restaurant and snack shops for food, as well as bathroom facilities. I suggest you try both beaches if you have time.
We were surprised at how nice Manly Beach was. Enjoyed it more than Bondi.. Lots of fun little shops and restaurants. Really happy we decided to visit Manly Beach. Nice semi-sheltered beach.

The Best City Beach in the World. Hard to believe that you are less than 7 miles from Sydney the ride over on the ferry was worth the money alone. The harbour area is beautiful, short walk then you hit the beach gorgeous, relaxed, clean,beautiful safe.What more do you want great promanade with lots of drinking water fountains and play areas for the children. My advise forget Bondi.

"Love it". It was my first visit to Manly beach & I was amazed at the amount of people that come over from the city during the weekend & that are just happy to sit at the beach & watch the world go by. On the sand there isn't as many people so there isn't any over crowding.Part of the beach is also patroled.

Laid back beach. Great area with cute shops, quirky cafes and eateries and funky bars. One of the best suburbs of Sydney. Doesn't have the pretension of some of the other beach areas, but still imparts that classic Aussie surf vibe with a touch of the cosmopolitan.

Best beach in Sydney. I love Manly beach. I live in the city and commute here to work. Each day at lunch I take a stroll and have a bite to eat on the sand or beach front. The vibes are good, the people are friendly, and the views are spectacular!
beautiful beach. manly is one of the most beautiful beaches i have been to and there is so many activities to do on many beach and if you love surfing well dont miss manly beach

Best City Beach in the World (Except Cobacabana). Easy access by Manly Ferry. Cristal clear water. Always swimmable. Great walks along the main beach and along the rocks to smaller secluded spots or natural rock pools. Wide views. Shopping center for everything. Nice bars and restaurants along the beach.

Man-Town Beach. Manly beach is an incredible destination. If you are traveling to Sydney, Australia then Manly Beach must be on your list of sites to see. In my opinion Manly beats out Bondi on any given day. The Corso is always pumping with people, action, and great bars and restaurants. Beach front restaurants are great as well! Manly offers many great scenic walking tours and such. Great sites to see for sure!
Norfolk Palms. It's easy to get to from the ferry terminal and a good ferry ride across the harbour. Manly is quite extensive so leave yourself time to wander about. A variety of things to see.
Like the miami beach of sydney. Really nice relaxed vibe on this beach. Not too crowded like Bondi, and plenty of shops and restaurants near by.
Sydney. A great tourist place to go. Beach is nice and wonderful place to be just a wonderful tourist. Beach was nice and nice restaurants. A must vist.

Ended up living here. Manly beach in my opinion outshines Bondi by a mile. It has a chilled, laid-back feel and many cafes and bars and shops to browse. The ferry ride from Sydney is epic and the walks around North Head and Manly to the Spit are a welcome side-trip. At nights take a drink at the North Steyne Hotel or the Old Boatshed if you're after some live music. The Four Pines Brewery will also serve you some home-brewed pale ale, lager or cider.
Nice watching the locals unwind after a days work. A nice ferry ride from Sydney and just over a five minute walk from the Manly ferry terminal. Enjoyable.
Too touristic. If you wanna see tourists dressed in jeans and going into the water then this is your place but i would rather suggest bondi beach.

Some city beaches have it all. We visited on a stormy day, so no swimming or any other beach activity possible. Many come here from the city suburbs just to get away from it all anyway, so we just walked up and down The Corso (main street) and looked at the souvenir shops, checked out the eateries, enjoyed the architecture, and hung out between showers. One side of Manly is the sea with a decent surf coming in and quite spectacular. The harbourside is more protected, but it was still relatively rough. The shark netted area for swimming isn't very large and I imagine it would be crowded on a good day. But this is a city beach, so don't expect pristine white sand with acres of privacy. We enjoyed the visit and would probably come back on the sunny day for a swim and relax - hopefully not too crowded, but i think it would be. We took a car over from the city, but that was because we had another destination to go to, but otherwise the ferry ride is cheap and relaxing, so definitely go that way.

Enjoy the day. I recommend you take the ferry out to Manly. It's a short ride and you can enjoy the amazing views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge (make sure you bring your camera). The beach is very pleasant and has a nice atmosphere to it. There are lots of shops and pubs along the way and even a local market during the weekends.
Its sandy. I guess all the beaches are very similar, lots of sand and lots of people. Maybe I'm not really much of a beach person - seen one seen them all. Restaurants are fine. Its fine.

Manly Beach, Sydney, Australia. I visited Manly Beach in February, 2013. I took a ferry from Sydney Harbour and had an excellent experience while on the ferry and even more enchanting one when there at Manly Beach. One can get a day pass for $22 to travel, unlimited, on ferries, trains and buses in 24 hours. I being a student got it for only $11. Its worth more than that. The ferry ride is twenty minutes one way from Sydney Harbour to Manly Beach. You travel in clear blue waters,seeing the Sydney skyline, Harbour Bridge and Opera house from vantage points. Once you reach Manly Beach it has its own enchanting landscape. For me the word is "enchanting" when i think of Manly Beach. Translucent sea green water at the edges, merging into vivid blues beyond, bordered by small cliffs is my idea of enchanting. There is Museum of Contemporary Art for those who are interested in Arts/museums. A choice of restaurants and fast food is available too. Once there, walk around to explore the area, particularly climb the cliff beyond the Museum, approachable through stairs as well and then climb down to the beach from different places, each place offering a different "enchanting" view.Strongly recommended, a must visit when in Sydney

Take the ferry from Sydney to Manly Beach. It's well worth it to take the ferry from the Circular Quay to Manly Beach (about 30 minutes). You arrive at a small beach and can walk to the end of one of the streets to a large beach where there are lots of surfers. Plenty of shops and outdoor cafes.It was a little too breezy near that surfing beach to dine at an outdoor cafe, so we found a spot closer to where the ferry dropped us off. On a Thursday evening, it was filled with locals having a wonderful time. There are various food options and you just grab a spot at a table and order food from a counter. We really enjoyed the atmosphere.

A most relaxing day. With the help of a rented beach umbrella and chair, our day at this beautiful beach was the perfect antidote to a hectic travel schedule. (You can even rent a beach towel if you forgot to pack one and don't want to take one of your hotel's.) This is one of Sydney's most popular beaches; so there will be lots of people on its broad expanse, but it has lifeguards. Popular with surfers and because it has a surfing school, you can watch groups of surfers from novice to expert. Across the street, there is a row of restaurants of all varieties and price levels.

Clean and Clear. what a great beach as a alternative to Bondi..the sands are clean and the walks along the prom are exhilarating and very healthy.. there are plenty of shops and eating places across the road.. altogether a delightful place which I would have no hesitation in recommending.

Unimpressive. Im from Australia and ive been abroad to some of the most beautiful beaches in the world,and VERY few Australian beaches even meet European standards. Manly beach is okay compared to Bondi (which is APPALLING) but its not a scratch on Europe.

A beach to fall in love with!. Even though we have visited some of the most known beaches in the world, the Manly one touched us in a special way.
It is not the best sand, or the best facilities or anything else.
It is the whole picture of it that just take you awake to a romantic trip!
Beautiful Beach and Views. Manly beach is a classic wide-expanse of a beach with swimming, surfing and laying about the order of the day. Great place to get away for a day or stay a while.
Very Pleasant. Went with a friend, lots to do like para-sailing and jet boating. The beach is particularly nice with a vast area of soft sand :)
Superb. Very nice clean beach in a curved bay and ideal for swimming. Also quite close to Sydney. Lots of cafes just across the road. This beach is far superior to Bondi which seems very run down.

A bit boring if you are not a beer addict. A place you can visit in a day, The atmopsphere is like California and Florida. Great spaces and attempts to copy the european seasides. Since there shops are not fashionable as in Cote d'Azur and drinking beer is the local entertrainment, Italians can find it a bit boring. But the ability of Australians, as it is for Americans, to organize their spaces at the best is remarkable. We Italians have a lot to learn from them. On the whole, nice beaches with wonderful seawater pools and some beautiful pubs on the promenade. As for the foods, I would recommend oysters..
Go! Do it. I grew up around these parts, the beach is to die for the place has busy areas and yet still has private places as well. Can be a bit pricey but it is well worth the experience

Not Impressed. why all the seaweed on the beach? I arrived by ferry which was very convenient. Lovely little shops to stroll around. I also went to the museum which is very small but very cute...art displays from local schools. It was a cloudy day so not so appealing as my Bondi Beach day. I took the main ferry but I think thee is a ferry that offers a guide through the cruise.
Classy seaside suburb. Forget Bondi. Manley is definitely the upmarket beach. Great shops, lovely beach, fab surf, chill out pubs & easy to get to from circular quay on ferry. A must!!

Manly is cool but it's even better if you walk around when the ferry leave you. Many people go to the crowed part of Manly which is across the port. To be honest, I loved better the beach in the side where the ferry leave you. This is much quieter, cool and better.

surfer beach. visited with friends .a nice enough beach quite busy.well gaurded.the surf was good enough for surfers,!but would excercise caution if taking children,life gaurds had to warn several unattended children that the currents were very dangerous!a nice day out .worth a visit.

Best fish and chips ever. Reminded me of a California Beach. Bought some fish and chips and enjoyed a picnic lunch at the beach, great way to meet other folks as well. Quaint seaside village, definitely recommend.

The Best!. had the best time at Manly Beach. the surf was great, and had a blast messing around in the sea. Wish i'd booked up with the surf school and came back for a return trip.if you like craft beer, theres an excellent craft brewing place Murrays just by the beach before you reach the Corso, that does great beer and even better pizzas!
It's a typical beach. Locals love it but I failed to see the special magic. The sand was fine the trees were fine, everything was fine

White pristine beach even better than Bondi. Plenty of eye candy on show from first rate beach volleyball teams to the lifeguards and plenty of Sydneysiders and tourists enjoying the sunshine and beach life.

Beautiful beach, but..... We took the ferry over to Manly Beach and walked the gauntlet of shops and restaurants to the beach. It is a lovely and wide strip of perfect sand and we walked the length of it. The reason that I didn't give it 5 stars is that we were looking forward to a couple of beach chairs and a bucket of beer with lunch on the beach. Not happening. All the restaurants are across the street and we saw no beach chairs for rent. Still, it was a fun day.

Seven miles from Sydney, a thousand from care.... Take the slow ferry out to Manly and enjoy the fantastic views of the Opera House and Bridge as you leave. Manly is beautiful, beach clean, surf good. If you prefer less vigorous swimming then Try Shelly Beach or the beach on the Harbourside. Lots of places to eat and a really relaxed vibe. You could believe you are farther than 7 miles from the city.
The beach. Manly is one of the nicest beaches along the city coast. Easy to access from the harbour and full of restaurants and shops. Parking is very difficult
Best Beach in Sydney. Views to die for and the walk on the beach front is fantastic. This beach has everthing, swiming, surfers, sun bathing and views.

the Golden Mile. Avert long stretch of beach that is very popular with teenagers. The front is quite pleasant for walking or jogging but there are more beautiful beaches around the coast...freshwater, Curl Curl and Dee Why
Love this beach!. Sydney has so many great beaches, but Manly is a little quieter and old timey, which I love! Grab fish and chips and sit on the bench.

Nice beach - Blue bottles though. We spent New year's eve day on the beach. The sand is pretty fine. No shells but a clean. Unfortunatley there were blue bottles in the water so we did not swim. We rented beach chairs for $10 for 3 hours

Relaxing. After Bondi a must for an aged surfer. Plenty to see with kids being taught to surf by a number of surf school instructors. The weather and surf was great on the day we visited. The town is a typical beach resort but very clean and tidy.

Looks like a SoCal Beach. Reminded me of Newport Beach, CA. Restaurants were nice, people friendly. Less traffic than in a similar the town in the State.
OK place to visit
Lovely trip. Great trip from Sydney. Well worth a visit. Like dthe cool vibe and the busy surf beach. Lots of great eateries.
Busy Beach. Very nice beach but very busy when we were there. Very attentive lifeguards which are needed as the current is often strong and stingers about when we were there too.
Ferry trip to Manly Beach. This is an excellent excursion when in Sydney. Beach okay but wondering around the town lovely. Ambiance of whole place very relaxed and pretty.

Nicer than Bondi. Comparing Manly Beach and Bondi beach is more about personal taste. Manly is nicer, slightly more upscale, and cleaner than Bondi. On the other hand, it is farther from the CIty Center, for most it requires a Ferry to get there, and at least when I was there, the waves weren't as good as Bondi.
It's not just the beach.... I'ts not just the beach, it's the neighbourhood. Highly worth the ferry ride. Terrific restaurants, terrific shopping. Althought the beaches up in Newcastle are better....
Day trip. Nice walk to Manly beach from ferry terminal,a nice shopping avenue lovely clean picturesque beach, the clear blue, warm sea, spent a lovely day there.

great place to relax. What a nice spot! It's an easy stroll from the ferry and even walking along the promenade is fun. Very convenient drinking water fountains to refill your water bottle.There are life guards along the beach and it was very re assuring that they kept an eye out for bathers with frequent updates and warning via loud speakers.There are public changing rooms available, although at our time of visit not very clean.

Manly Beach. On the day we visited this Beach (in November) as part of a bus trip of the northern Sydney area, it was very blustery so the only people in the water were die-hard surfers. Still had a wonderful visit though, visiting the many stores and shops nearby. The beach is very beautiful and the grounds nearby well-kept. It's obviously an area visited by locals- joggers, walkers, and Moms pushing strollers were common place. Only wish we could have spent more time investigating the various coffee shops; restaurants; and other stores. Must admit though, that it was a bit daunting to have our bus driver explain that the nets in the water (very close to shore) were to keep the sharks from "nibbling on people's feet".

Popular, rather crowded beach.. Manly Beach itself is a lovely wide stretch of sand with the beautiful ocean, which attracts many tourists and locals alike, making it somewhat crowded, but worth a visit. There is a lovely grassed and palm lined walkway above the beach and lots of shops, restaurants and pubs across the road. After our scenic walk we enjoyed some cheese and wine at a pavement table of a trendy pub/restaurant and watched the world go by. Very pleasant experience.

One of the nicest beaches. Sydney is probably one of the prettiest cities around the world, have travelled to more than 70 cities worldwide. The scores of great beaches, do play a part in its popularity. It was a cool Sept day for me but some diehard surfers were taking advantage of high surf. The fast and efficient Manly Ferry is a pleasant ride to this attraction, with many restaurants and shops.

Better than Bondi. This beach was more fun than Bondi Beach. Still gotta watch out for those bluebottles though! Scary things... Nice sand- too bad about the crazy sun that burns like hell if you stay in it for too long.

A great beach, with some excellent bars and restaurants. A great beach, with some excellent bars and restaurants. There are lots of lifeguards to keep everyone safe - which is necessary as the shark alarm was sounded several times whilst we were there. Visit the 'Pantry' for lunch - great views and great food.

2 very different but beautiful beaches - something for everyone!. Where you get off the ferry there is a fairly small, but beautiful beach, with clear, still water and a netted off area where it is safe to swim. There are boats all around, and I am told that sometimes the water can be oily, but when we were there it was crystal clear! On the other side of Manley, a 5 minute walk from the ferry, is the main beach, which is very long, with choppy, wavy sea perfect for surfing. Towards the far end of the beach it is calmer and that seems to be where most of the swimmers go. When we were there, they had shark signs up, and the alarms were going off so they got everyone out of the water, but none of the surfers seemed to bother, and it only seemed to affect one end of the beach. There was a lifeguard on a jet ski following the shark and trying to scare it off, and a helicopter flew over looking for it which was quite exciting!! But needless to say we chose to swim at the other netted beach where the water was calm! There are loads of shops selling refreshments and suncream/beach wear etc... so you will be well catered for. There are also fountains with drinking water, it doesn't taste great, but is perfectly drinkable if you are on a budget. I would definitly go to Manley again!

Atmosphere rocks. Easy acess by ferry, lots of eating and drinking options, swim in the ocean or in the rock pool. Energetic, walk the headlands national park and view Sydney Harbour at the heads, you will feel like the only person there. Loved the german restaurant with the best mussels ever. Only problem with Australian Tourism is the high cost of food and travel and accommodation - hear this from lots of travellers.

This is home. If you see an old bloke with stumpy legs and a white beard, it may be me. All the people are friendly. Best eating: in Many, or along the coast, south from South Steyne, or over the road from North Steyne. In Manly itself, check out the lanes behind the Corso shops

Worth the Trip!. Its a long, long way down under. I have always loved Sydney, its harbor, the zoo by ferry, the Royal Botanic Gardens, the opera house--all in walking distance of the parking garage! After this third trip, I think it may be the most beautiful city in the world. I reluctantly rate the harbor more attractive than my own magnificent Chicago lakefront. If you count the folks gathered on a Sunday, the harbor wins out hands down. On this trip, I finally made it to Manly. Wow. An upscale wonder beach with bright sun, tons of sun worshippers and in spite of the crowds, spotlessly clean with big rolling waves reminiscent of the South Jersey shore. The ride over on the ferry was no less a delight as we passed through more than 100 sail boats, many in full race along the sparkling waves. Even a regatta of retired America's cup size racers out for a spint and loaded with water loving Sydneyites and tourists.A week's worth of fun and delight with the days at Manly well worth the trip.

Is this the best beach in Australia?. It must come close with the ocean beaches on one side and the sheltered harbour beaches on the other. Add the Corso with its array of shops and the excellent casual restaurants. I believe it gets a bit rowdy late at night late in the week but have never heard of any other negatives in 30 years of visiting Manly.

Not good as in Bali, but very enjoy. Watching a groups of birds flying with the voice of the wave, eating ice cream, fried potatos or a cup of coffee, hmmm its feel like sitting in front of Kuta Bali Beach, wanna try ???
very popular. This was very busy when we went. It was a lovely beach, although we did notice that there only a very small section of the water that could be used for swimming in.

Sydney's Surfers Paradise. if you love surfing, this place is for you, it is a typicall Aussie place by the beach, very safe and refreshing. it is packed during the weekends and there are a lot of other things to do there like shopping and having budget meals as well as expensive ones.

Visit Manly by ferry, walk to the beach, lunch!. An ideal way to see the Pacific, take in the harbour and have a decent pavement lunch.
Swimming is safe and very well patrolled. You're more 10000 times more likely to be run over crossing from the station than being attacked by a shark.
But swim in patrolled ares only as the rips are pretty nasty.
iconic. a bit crowded but a great reward for taking the trip to see it ... having a swim would make it even better. Also a photographers dream ... views natural and native make good subjects

Worth it just for the ferry ride from Circular Quay. We went to Manly beach and then to supper at Hugo's, the day was grand and ended on a high note for supper. The ferry ride at night let us view the Sydney Opera House lit a t night from all angles - wow!

A perfect day trip from Sydney!. Manly beach is an easy, fun getaway from city. Full of restaurants, bars and shops, it is fun to stroll around town and grab a drink or a bite to eat. The beach is beautiful. Great people watching. Well worth a trip! One of our favorite parts of Sydney.

Manly BEach is Paradise. Another side to Sydney area and so relaxing. Do not miss this beach. Take the ferry over. Walk the harbor up to the picnic areas. Stay the night. Wonderful!! Fabulous area. Loved it!

Great beach and lively atmosphere. Manly is a great place to visit, you can walk the promenade, swim or surf the beach, walk down the main street to/from the beach and ferry harbour. Lots of restaurants and shops and don't forget to have an ice cream and people watch. Great place to spend an afternoon!
A must do. Smooth sand, lots happening on the beach without it being too over crowded and walk the the river at the end which runs into the sea. It's only a short walk and very picturesque

Surf's Up!. We took a walk all around Manly and found it quite charming. The beach area had a lot of lifeguards and also lots of people enjoying the water. There's a walk that winds up around the rocks and offers great photo opportunities. We were there when a storm was approaching, so headed to the ferry earlier than we had planned, but it was still a place I'm glad that we visited.

Great beach to relax or play some volleyball. I went there via the Manly Beach Ferry (which was a terrific ride, and for the price, better than a harbour cruise) with a few friends and just chilled out on the beach for the day. It's a gorgeous beach with loads of shops along the way. There are beach volleyball courts that can be used along the beach. It can get a little crowded, but out of Bondi, Coogee and Manly, I feel Manly is the best of the 3. Don't forget to try local fish n chips as well! The only downside when I was there is that the wind was coming in off the water and bringing in small, stinging (non-lethal) jelly-fish called "blue bottles." You had to go in the water at your own risk for this reason.

A must when in Sydney. Take the ferry to this Sydney institution, you will not regret it. You will find a long nice beach and lots of shopping, it has a nice vacation feeling. Dont miss the views of Sydney as you take the ferry back.
SO crowded. It would be much better to go to one of the more private beaches. However at manly they do have beach towels available for rent, which is nice because my husband refused to buy one.
Great getaway!. Great get away from the heat of Sydney. Enjoyed the beach and watching people. Good choice of restaurants and shops to keep family entertained.

A favourite with locals. Usually plenty of room on Manly Beach but watch out for the flags if you're taking a dip. And don't forget to grab a bite to eat from one of the many food outlets along the Corso!

A bit crowded, but a beautiful beach. We visited on a particularly hot Sunday and the whole of Manly was heaving with people, not just the beach. Plenty of shops were open and there were crowds everywhere. However, there was a fantastic atmosphere and we were particularly impressed by the number of lifeguards both in and out of the water, making sure that people were safe. It was good to see that the majority of swimmers and surfers responded to instructions, although there were several instances of people needing assistance simply because they hadn't listened. We were also impressed by the cleanliness of the beach and the whole area.We walked along the beach front and round the headland to Shelly Beach - a glorious walk made all the more special by the sighting of Water Dragons beside the path. Well worth the effort.

Not impressed. Some people love Manly, but having visited on the way back from Palm beach, I wasn't that impressed. Bondi is much much nicer and cheaper to get to, in my opinion, as is the cliff top walk towards Coogee.
Beautiful. It's a very clean beach with nice waves.Also good shops nearby.The waves are not too big to enjoy a nice swim.
Surfers paradise. Great beach for learning to surf. Waves good.Lovely golden sand.Some say better than Bondi - me, I think so too!

Better than bondi!. I liked manly and I really liked the beach it for me was way better than bondi which struck me a place where people go because it's bondi and it's famous!
It's clean, beautiful and right off the town which has everything! I loved the bbq's down there, makes for a great day out in the sunshine!
Forget that you are close to a city. It's a great escape and less "trendy" than Bondi can be. Not as surf oriented and has great little cafes and what not around
Amazing beach!. I was not expecting it to be such a great beach and place. Really nice shops and the beach was just beautiful. Like a paradise.
Surf. No surf the day we went but the beach is super and as its close to the town it has a wonderful promenade. Imagine Brighton or Weston-Super-Mare and add sunshine and heat!

Much nicer than Bondi. The ferry out to manly is great way to see the harbour, manly itself has a nice relaxed feel and the the beech is great. The arae also has a couple of micro brewery pubs offerring good beers and lunches
What do Bondi when you can do manly?. Such a Gem of a beach, plenty of room, awesome cafes, and the best part is the Ferry Trip if you come from the City... No parking or traffic queue!
gorgeous. this beach was pristine with fine white sand and picture perfect blue water and made for an enjoyable last day in sydney. the ferry from sydney only added to pleasurable experience.
manly beach. quite a nice beach but sewerage is discharged onto it in heavy rainfall. Warning notices are visible

Manly Beach. its nothing special but then its a beach where you see people are swimming, and surfing..I say its very good because its a good recommendation for tourist esp if Bondi beach is full and theres this small playing ground for kids who likes to roller skates and skateboard..

Manly > Bondi. If you can only choose one Sydney beach to go to, make it Manly. It's way better than Bondi.We had time to do both, and got the MyMulti 1-day pass, which covers the quick and comfortable ferry to Manly, and the long and crowded crappy bus to Bondi.There's a cute, quirky bar called Hemingway's right on the beach that does $5 drinks at happy hour, which is a huge steal for such an amazing location. Loved everything about Manly!

beach ok, commercial area less so. Roughly in the middle range of quality of Sydney beaches, but liking or disliking is more likely to be determined by how you react to The Corso and the surrounding shopping areas which are very tourist oriented (but not with the awful atmosphere of its main tourist-trap competitor Bondi).

Surf, chillingly relaxed. If you have done your share of Bondi, head over to Manly for some bohemian surf. Plenty of ice cram, food stalls and just good looking surfers and lifeguards, what are you waiting for!

Be Careful. This is actually a great beach, but can be dangerous with the water, so unless you are a strong swimmer, be cautious in the water. Also, I was surprised to find that there were not very many places right along the beach to eat or take a drink. You had to almost sit on the beach to enjoy the ocean air, otherwise in the afternoon you would find yourself sitting in the constant shadow, which put a little dampener on the time beside the beach.

Sydney-siders recommend. We asked the locals which beach to head for Bondi or Manly and they all said Manly -so we went.Its a beach dammit:- breeze, surf, sun - clean and well maintained. The bay is fabulous, the palm-shaded walk along the front lovely. There is masses of food from pubs, burger bars, and fish and chips, to premium location cafe/restaurants . However --We popped into the supermarket on the short walk up The Corso from the Ferry Terminal (its on the quieter Harbour side so well hidden from the beach). We bought water, drinks, snacks, rolls and cheese and meat from the deli counter - and feasted right on the beach - totally fabulous and heartily recommended.We enjoyed it so much we came back again.
worth the ferry trip. A quaint town with wonderful eateries,pubs and shops. Not to mention the the extensive beach areas, boardwalks, and of course waves !
Good place to sit and watch the world go by. Seats and shelters in which to watch the world go by or the world enjoy itself on the beach. Plenty going on
Great beach but not much else. If you like beach swimming or visiting surf shops this the place for you. Otherwise, not terribly much to do here. Nice hike to the North Head but quite a long way.
Lovely Beach. Lovely beach which I guess means you have to accept lots of people want to visit it! Within easy walk of the ferry so if you want a quieter beach you probably need to go a bit further.

Disappointing weather or are we just not lucky!. Although it was december! Summer in Sydney and in the afternoon, that day it was sunny and so warm. The beach was almost empty, windy and not so pleasant!There is not service like sunbeds or soft drinks. The waves were strong and the water was a bit cold. For us it was just a experience and we will never go there again.
Paradise. Surfers paradise on a windy day. Make sure you have sunscreen as the sun can be extremely hot. Early arrival guarantees a good spot as it gets very busy as the day goes by

Pure sand, clean water. The beaches in Sydney are pure clean sand -- no pebbles. The water is crystal-clear.
You take a ferry to Manly, and then walk through the town-- 5-10 minutes, and pass restaurants, cafes etc. there are also some stores closer to the beach.
The beach is packed- as busy as Bondi or Bronte, but fun nonetheless

Excellent beaches, and lots of activities, come prepared though!. We have two kids (6 & 8) and Manly beach was a total hit. We were directed to a calmer beach all the way in the back (I think it was called shelly beach). it was better for the kids to swim there. Two cautions. There are no stores there to rent swim or snorkelling gear. So please rent your gear before you get to that area. it is a pain to reach there, and find out you were out of luck. Second there are no lifegaurds in that area. So if you prefer the assurance of lifegaurds stay on the main beach where all the surfing is happenning. I would be nuetral either way. the suppossedly safer beach had calmer waters for sure, but wasnt too shallow for my comfort level.

So lovely. The huge pines planted all along the water front are really great. l spoke to one of the lifeguards, and he was very informative and friendly. l had visited Bondi, and Manly beats it in every way.

Cute beach town beautiful beach. Take the ferry to manly. Totally worthit. All the beach shops. Adorable little stores and restaurants were awesome. There were actually 2 shark sightings when I was there so I really felt like I was down under. Water is beautiful. Crisp clean and sooooo refreshing!
Forget Bondi... Clean tidy, fill of beautiful people. Toilets, showers and other facilities close to hand. An escape from the city and the Menzies Hotel...

Another great Urban beach. A little more laid back than Bondi, the scene in Manly seems to be more families with children than young adults strutting their stuff!. Shopping and cafes in the area good and not too far from central Sydney for a day trip.

Best sydney day trip. Best Beach with walks to be proud of.surrounding the sweep of tree line beach. Excellent eating around of all types such as Blue water restaurant and great coffee all over the place
Miles better than Bondi!. Seaside community with a beautiful ferry ride from Circular Quay. Fabulous fish and chip or fine dining! Easy to walk the entire area and great beach.

A good beach to visit. It's nice to visit this beach simply because you have to take a ferry to get there- already a fantastic experience ( take plenty of photos of the Opera House and Harbor Bridge!) But if you live in Sydney I would suggest eastern suburbs beaches like Bondi, Bronte, Coogee...

Very Commercial. Probably didnt help that we went there on a drizzly overcast day but we found manly beach and the area to be a bit too commercialised. Lots of tacky shops etc. Nice little ferry ride across which made it ok for a visit and great sweet kiosk in the ferry station but overall not great.

A great spot for a break. Manly beach seems to have all you would want. Clean water and well patrolled. If the surf is too rough try Shelly Beach at the southern end. The Promenade is great for an early morning or late evening walk but watch out for the bikes and skateboards.
Busy, Busy, Busy. It was fabulous to watch the world go by. Such a friendly place. You must visit the beach - a taste of Australia.

One fine day, must be in your trip plan. Going to Manly beach with Sydney Furry is worth a trip. Should plan to go there in the morning. either go for a beach walk or enjoy the beach is fine. Make sure to buy Fish and Chip or other cooked seafood from" Manly Ocean Foods" for picnic on the beach. It is the best. A bit long queue but worths waiting. If you come withe the family, plan to go over the weekend, then buy " Family Fun Day Tickets". Which cost only AU$2.50 each. This helps a lot of saving both train and furry or any combine modes of transportation.
Peaceful. So close to the city easy to get to & a chance to see the penguins at night really worth the effort.

A nice afternoon. Travelled on the ferry from Circular Quay took about 25 minutes. Very busy as New Years Day. A short stroll along a pedestrianised shopping street to Manly beach. Very crowded but plenty of room still available. My only quibble is that there are no large sun shades to rent. Not good if you cannot sunbathe.The lifeguards were very busy and eventually closed two sections as they were becoming dangerous for swimmers. So well organised.Lunch at a local Bar was ok and we walked and then returned to the City.

Beautiful. A great beach with lots of local restaurants and good walking. We were there on the first day of summer and it was busy. The beach is large though so there was still plenty of room. If you take the ferry from Circular Quay, remember the later day departures get really busy in summer.
Nice ocean views.... ...but watch out for rough surf. The seagulls are also very aggressive, so if you bring food down to the beach, be prepared to defend it!

Manly the best beach in Sydney. Two beaches less than 100 yards apart with two distinct characters. The main beach is more traditional a long stretch of sand and a promenade with the usual shops and cafes. Very enjoyable.Manly harbour beach is smaller and very busy with the harbour itself being the hub with bars and restaurants. Great place to spend a Sunday afternoon
Gorgeous beach. Stunning beach which seems to be mostly populated by locals rather than tourists who seem to only go to bondi. Highly recommended, nice way to spend a day

Worth a visit even in the rain. It was pouring down with rain the day we went to Manly but it was still very enjoyable. The ferry ride from Circular Quay and back is really worth the trip. The scenery from the ferry is magnificent and you get amazing views of the Harbour Bridge and the Opera House. A wander up and down Manly Corso window shopping and then enjoying looking at the pristine beach is so benificial to the soul.
Windy but gorgeous. We went at the suggestion of a co-worker. We were glad we did. We had a few brews at the pub on the beach. Did a little shopping. Loved this place and will definitely go back!
A place in the sun. THe beach at Manly is well worth a swim but make sure to swim between the flags. The eating areas are also a great place to enjoy a bite to eat.

Not much has changed in 12 years. The trip over in the ferry is always a highlight, Manly is beautiful however taken over by now far to many trashy souvenier shops. Make the effort and do the short walk south around the water to the point and over look the north head entrance.

Fun and beautiful views. The cockatoos are hilarious and some awesome little sidewalk cafes, (some are a little pricey). We drove up to North Head to view Sydney at Sunset, took hundreds of photos, not too many people there either.

Dive With the Sharks. It's was a bit cold to go surfing for me. The water was 14C. So we ventured over to the aquarium and went scuba diving with the sharks. What a safe and incredible experience. The hosts were excellent instructors. The gear was top notch. The sharks were friendly and curious. I highly reccommend this for any adventurous person or new scuba diver. Get the full picture package. You'll want the photo of you and the 4 meter shark smiling for the camera together.

Great Waves-but crowded. Crowded beach but everyone seemed friendly. Waves were a little too rough for a non-surfer. Walking distance to clean restrooms and plenty of places to shop and eat along the way.
A reasonable beach. The views from the ferry ride over are just as good as the beach. Worth a day trip for the beach, dinner and drinks with plenty of cafes to choose from
Beautiful. Manly is beautiful no matter what time of year... Blistering cold and rainy and it was still a great place to visit... felt like we were having another holiday within a holiday
Get up and go or sit and watch. Great to watch everyone surfing or learning life saving skills or to go for a swim or walk along the prom!
The best place to hang out at the beach. We spent 2 days here walking the beach, watching people play volleyball, enjoying the surfers try to surf and hanging out at all the shops and restaurants.

Good surfing. From the Manly ferry walk across town to the Ocean side where the breakers attract surfers who provide entertainment for the rest as they fall into the breakers.
Plenty of shops arsdand cafes here for those who enjoy less energetic pursuits.

What a beautiful beach!. We had originally planned to visit the world famous Bondi Beach, but having learnt of our plan, several friends advised us to visit Manly Beach instead. And we were just so totally wowed by this magnificent beach! Totally beautiful and clean!

The ferry trip is worth it alone. Manly ferry would be one of the iconic trips to take, and to paraphrase "its the journey that counts, not the destination". Manly unfortunately seems to have become a little tired, and certainly not worth the journey if not by ferry.

Local & relaxing. Only 5-10min walk from the Manly ferry. Lots of beach product stores and a full stretch of restaurants (fast food AUD10~ and the more fancy AUD30+ places).This beach is awesome and not over crowed. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Sydney.I didn't spot any showers though. I may have missed it. In any case, there's a simple changing room; VERY simple wooden hut and mildly smelly [ladies room].

Beautiful beach!. The ferry trip from circular quay to manly is awesome! Great views of the opera house and bridge. Manly beach is very beatiful and great for surfers. Shelley beach (near Manly) is great for snorkel. The Corso is the street that goes from the wharf to the beach, and it has got many coffe shops, stores, a supermarket, etc. Steynes is a pub in the corner of Corso and Steyne St, excellent place to eat. On mondays all the food is half price!!! Best beach of Sydney.

Only one Manly. A 1/2 hr trip from Circular Quay to Manly on the ferry and a nice walk up the Courso to the Manly beach. Great sand and good surf for swimmers with Life guards always in attendance. A lovely walk to Fairybower beach, and fish and chips in the Course on the home journey, fills in a very pleasant day.

Perfect Beach for having a good time. Even though crowded on a Sunday, the beach and the area didn't let me down. Buzzling and happening, especially when you are on your own. Plenty of food choices and the usal shopping. A nice ferry ride just rounds up the experience.
Tourist area.. This beach is very good. Very spacious and near the shops. On hot days the beach gets very crowded from the hoards of people walking off the ferry in search of the waves.

Forget Bondi!. Manly beach rocks, in my option it is way better than Bondi more to see and slightly less busy. Travelling by boat also gives you some great. Views over the harbour too, better than a sweaty bus! Definatly worth a visit!
kevin w. Best Beach in N.S.W. along with Shelley Beach which is just along from Manly Beach, and one of the nicest walks you will do with a Cafe/Bar to finish off a great day out.

Beautiful beach. The beach is just beautiful. Lots of restaurants on the esplanade overlooking the beach. The town itself is what you'd expect -- lots of tourist shops. Suggest walking toward Shelly Beach - the views are wonderful.

Protected Beach...Reminds Me of Seven Mile Beach, Cayman Islands. Enormous beach a few minute walk from the Manly Ferry.Seems there is a coffee shop every 100 feet. Only a slight exaggeration.In mid-December, some swimmers wore wet suits, but seemed unnecessary to this American. Change areas and indoor showers open to public without cost.Tip: Walk 15 more minutes south of Manly Beach area for the protected cove of Shelly Beach. Calmer waters, and more suited to small children.

Best beach in Sydney. Ive been to Coogee and Bondi and can honestly say that Manley is the nicest beach in Sydney. You need to catch the ferry from circular key which will take around 40 mins and the ferry shows you a great view of the harbour.
