A short 5min walk to the beach and you are met with beautiful nice sandsBe sure to watch out for the breeze, after 20 mins i had burnt my bum. Grab some fresh grilled fish from accross the road. John Dory is the nicest fish!

Quite lovely sandy beach.. Manly like plenty of other places along the Sydney skyline is quite simply gorgeous. It has plenty of shops, restaurants , drinking places, but for me what I like the most about Manly is the beach, it is well looked after, as are plenty of other beaches around the area, but my personal preference is manly beach. I realise other's will not agree with me, however this is my personal choice, it is sometime's quite hard to put into word's why you prefer one place over another, well for me this is certainly one of the best, clean and well tended a place where you somehow feel safe.

Catch a ferry to this 'masculine' beach. Get off the ferry at Manly Cove where Australia's first Governor, Phillip, was speared by a "manly" or "masculine" Aboriginal (that's how it got its name!). Buy some take away from one of the shops on the way to the famous ocean beach "Manly Beach" sit down and watch the surfers ride the breakers.
A very nice Beach. A place that you would not want to miss. The sand is fine and the breeze is cool. The beach is clean and it is not noisy.

One of Our Top Beaches. Having been very disapointed with Bondi we were hoping for somthing completely different from Manly. We were not disapointd again. Manly has the best of both, the ocean beach with great expanses of sand and surf and the harbour beach which is more suited to sailing and canoes.A stroll along the Corso from the ferry wharf soon has you on the ocean beach prommenade which offers great views in either direction. Follow the path to the righ. As you face the sea and you will arrive atcanother small bay.Manley is also a great place to stroll amongst the shops or take busc135 to north head for spectaculsr views of the harbour and Sydney.
Manly Beach. Its the best beach in Sydney by far...not as seedy as the other 'popular' Sydney Beach. This place is great for normal people...Aussies and tourists.

Ultimate beach in Australia. People often asks me Whats the best beach in Sydney? Manly! hands down. it has a truly Australian sense as well as incredible food, shopping, sports, surfing and people watching. Good pubs, Fun clubs and fine dining. This is Australia at its best! (...well just ignore the crazy drunken 18 year olds)
Great Beach. Lovely place to spend the day. Walk through the Corso, enjoy the shops, Cafe's & Restaurants. Ice creams are a favourite thing to do. Buy Fish & Chips, go to the beach to enjoy eating.
Take the ferry. Just 45 minutes from the city centre - a lovely beach and good shopping. Also found good snack places for luncg - a good day.
Surfers dream. Huge horseshoe beach. We visited on the Manly Jazz weekend so it was quite busy but still with plenty of room. We had a great time just sitting and watching the surfers.

Surf Watching. Poor swimming conditions when we were there -- one area was available but we rented beach chairs for the day with an umbrella for 2 ($45) and watched the paddle boarders, surfers hit the waves. Great day in the sun..
Manly Beach. This beach is great for people watching. It is nice and clean and when we went was packed full of people.

Darling Darling Harbour. Darling Harbour is a not to be missed part of the fabulous city of Sydney. I used to live very near here in Glebe back in the seventies and a great deal has changed since then. Walk down Sydney's Market Street and across the now pedestrianised Pyrmont Bridge and behold this lovely scene of what was once rough docklands and has been magically transformed into a paradise of bars and restaurants. The Sydney Maritime Museum is on the other side of the Pyrmont Bridge along with the now rejuvenated Pyrmont Hotel with 24 hour opening times. Moored alongside the museum is an Australian Naval warship, submarine and what I assume to be a replica for the Endeavour. Stroll away from the bridge in the direction of Chinatown through fountains and parkland and arrive at Paddy's Market for another great shopping mall and food court. A full day/night out.
The ferry trip is worth the trip. Loved the ferry ride to Manly. A fun place to visit even for a short time. Great variety of restaurants on the beach with good people watching.
Chill out with the locals. A nice beach with good facilities too. We spent the day here on the beach and in the local cafes. GREAT
Beautiful beach. But the water was ice-cold in the middle of their summer! Taking shadow pics while standing in the ice-cold surf was great fun.

It's great if you love crowds. The beach is stunning, don't get me wrong. But you'll be swamped by thousands of other visitors. Nice for a morning run or a swim, though. Take a hike to North head instead.

Beautiful beach, much activity, good walking paths. Manly beach was a great visit on a Sunday. Manly is a resort-type town with one good street of shops and then a wide sidewalk next to the beach. Kids are doing their surfing training on Sunday, families enjoying the beach and good surft if that is your thing. Great walks from the beach up in to a park. The ferry ride from Sydney was short and very pleasant as well. Definitely worth a day while in Sydney - a weekend day makes it more interesting because all of the locals are out!

A nice beach. Manly beach offers the feeling as if you are in Florida with the amazing long walk with shops on both side. A secret tip, take a drive to the Head, located about 5 min drive from Manly, for an amazing breathtaking view of Sydney City

PURE WHITE AND VERY CLEAN SAND. The beach by the ferry terminal is quite and ideal for children as bathing is really safe. Through the town is the other beach, much more suited to sun worshipers and surfers, but non-the-less a beautiful white sandy beach for all.

nice place. had a lovely walk along the beach in the rain watching the many surfers taking advantage of the weather and high waves.
very clean and tidy place too!

Buzzing. The beach was well patrolled by life guards. There is natural shade from the trees that are on the promenade behind the beach - they through a good range of shadows.The place is just buzzing with families, friends and singles. It is the place to go on a Sunday. Ferry is busy back into Circular Quay but they take 400+ so ample space and if not they are every half hourGreat shopping, local markets, good eateries and Coles Supermarket close to the quay for provisions!

Great escape. great escape from the hustle and busle of sydney. lovely trip out there on the ferry and well woth a trip if you are ever in sydney with a few hours to spare and want a bit of a change, also some good eating places and a super beach

great scenic walk. the town is very much family focused. The best thing is to take a left when you exit the pier and walk along the coast. There is a great scenic walk along the water that ends at a point where you can take a bus back to town.

Well worth a visit. I stayed on the rocks and got the Ferry across to Manly. This was such a seamless process and a great day out. Manly is so relaxed, great shops and do go and dine at The Manly Winery - great wine and food. The beach is clean and chance to sit back and watch the surfers. Make sure you bring your suncream - the rays are seriously dangerous and you will burn without it.

Family friendly Beach. Just gorgeous. The Aussies are very spoiled with their beaches. I was not a big fan of Bondi. Was very crowded and unable to find a park anywhere. Didnt like the type of people in Bondi either. manly on the otherhand had a friendly family feel to it. The beach itself is very clean, apparently was dirty back in the 80s. Lots of greenery around and some neat little cafes. I highly reccommend you take the Ferry from Circular Quay. What a journey that is, the only way to get there. Makes for a great day out!

Nice beach.. If you want to go to the beach without the huge crowds (like Bondi) then this is the place. Close to the manly ferry and lots of great shops including Fish and Chips that you can eat whilst looking out at the ocean. The only downside were the changerooms at the beach, They were clean but I think they need to be a bit bigger, the shower rose was fixed and, if you had your clothes in the change section of the cubicle you'd end up with wet clothes. Apart from that we enjoyed our trip :)

Bike tour this beach it is worth it.. Take the ferrie over to Manly and then bike around the community it is beautiful and the national park has the greatest photos looking at Sydney harbour...(dress for the breeze) and do it at sunset ....the ferry ride back looking at the city at sunset is beautiful.

love this place !!!. i love manly !! possibly prefer manly to bondi great beach great shops just a great place in general. the walk from manly to shelly is a must and keep a look out for the water dragons along the way !

Not what expected.. We went to Manly on the ferry as is traditional but once we arrived we did not enjoy Manley. The beach is narrow and crowed. The bins were over flowing and for some unknown reason just was not immpressed with Manly .

good day trip out of the city. Great spot to waste a morning and afternoon. Grab the ferry from the city and then wander through the mall to the beach, plenty of bars and lunch spots. head back and have a drink while you wait for the ferry to come back.

Beautiful beach!. Fabulous - gorgeous sandy beach and great surf for those inclined. We had take-away fish and chips from one of the shops near the front - beautifully cooked and reasonable too. Take a stroll along the prom and enjoy the ambience. Great place.
8th Wonder..... Just love it here....everything about the beach and surrounds are relax. Great places to eat, drink and be outside with friends.

Great beach just off the Ferry launch.. Great beach, great waves, great people and the sand and water are stunning. Can be very crowded at the height of the season but, this is AUS, and the culture is deeply rooted at the beach. Watch all the little nippers learn about the surf. Grab a sanga, a drink, and enjoy!
Great place. I could live here. Very cute town with shops and seaside cafes. the ferry ride to Manly is also very nice. It has a great beach with surfing and volleyball.

Beautiful beach, less crowded than Bondi. Manly beach is a bit further to reach from Sydney city center, compared to Bondi, Maroubra or Cogee. You'd have to travel by ferry from Circular Quay or if you go by car , through the underwater tunnel. But having seen all the beaches above, for me Manly is the nicest one in terms of neatness, cleanliness and surrounding areas. Toilet is quite near , and quite clean. Restaurants are also only across the street. Lovely tall trees alongside the beach with benches to sit. There's small fountains coming out of the floor in the promenade where the restaurants are. Kids love playing with it. Only thing I would recommend is that to be more careful in picking a restaurant to eat. We ate at the restaurant called "WATERVUE" right on the promenade across the beach. Food was so bad, the steak was so tough and thin, the fish and chips looks factory made (all the exact shape and size) and worst of all the manager is disrespectful and rude (only because we ask to open the umbrella where we sit). Probably because its a tourist area, they don't really care to give good service, since most people will only come once (especially foreign tourists). better to just eat at hungry jacks or other restaurant.And it turns out I wasn't the only one with bad experience there , a lot of reviewers on tripadvisor have the same experience.In conclusion if you have only short amount of time to spend in Sydney and you can't go to all the beaches there, Manly is the one to go to.

NICE PLACE TO SPEND 1/2 DAY. Took ferry to manly. Walked about 3 blocks from ferry station to beach. Nice community, clean, lots of shops. Good candy store in ferry terminal. Lots of places to eat and sit. If open, stop in at the Anglican church on walk to beach.

beautiful and restful. i was here mid-week and it was quiet and peacful - I would have liked to see more but we are not staying long in australia. also the ferry trip from sydnew is the best way to get to manly beach

Sit back and relax. ....unless you want to swim or surf of course. We chose the sitting and looking option, and enjoyed people-watching. Beach clean, ample room for all and well patrolled by life-guards. Cafes and shops nearby

Nicer than Bondi Beach. In my opinion Manly Beach is much nicer than Bondi Beach. People think they are similar. But i reckon Manly Beach is not as busy as Bondi Beach. But still busy enough not be bored. There are more locals and not as many tourists as at Bondi Beach.

Manly beach. We chose to walk around away from the main beach. Was very nice, great beach bars too. Fantastic attitude to drinking, could only purchase alcohol with food and had to be consumed in bar not on the beach.
Only downside is that dispite the generous and well signposted bins it could be a bit cleaner.

A world renowned beautiful beach - Forget Bondi!. A short walk from the Ferry down the Corso and you see a 3-4 kilometre golden beach lined with Norfolk Island Pines. Plenty of seats, walks and swimming areas. Walk to Shelly beach and see crystal clear water and another pretty beach. A lovely day out!

Great for surfing. Manly Beach is a very popular surfing beach. It's a great place to go people watch, relax and take a nice refreshing dip in the ocean. It's close to the shops so you don't have to travel far to get lunch or ice cream. There are also lifeguards on duty.
Beautiful. One of the Best beaches I have been to so far...I went there when there was a kite festival.Cold waters but really nice, claen beach to spend time.
Shopping and Crowded. Don't go to manly beach unless you like people watching and large crowds. We enjoyed it because it gave us a chance to buy gifts for people abroad.

Probably the best beach. I just love this beach. Usually you can find people playing beach sports on the sand. The sand is smooth, the beach gradually drops away into the sea and the waves are great for surfing (so I'm told). LOL

Take the ferry to Manly and walk through to the beach. This beach was bustling with swimmers and sunbathers enjoying a day in the sun. We wandered along the foreshore, looking at shops and enjoying an ice-cream. We felt safe and relaxed amongst a wide age range of beach-goers.

Young ish?. love strolling around manly beach just to feel young again. There are many surf shops you can have window shopping or buying. And walk around the beach is just awesome. You can catch a ferry from Circular Quay, it takes 30 minutes from the city to get to manly beach. You should go and see while you r in Sydney.

not much to do there except touristic shops. I took the ferry to Manly. The only advantage of that trip was the nice view of Sydney harbor when the ferry leaves the harbor. In Manly you would find 2 streets full with over priced restaurants and shops, and nothing interesting to do unless you head for some swiming

Lots of space and good waves. Suprisingly Manly Beach was clean and there was heaps of space to wander and find rockpools, good surf spots and away from the main beach its ws pretty quiet and relaxed, def take hats and swimmers and loads of sunscreen

Famous Aussie Beach. Hot a bad time - Aquarium under renovations so the features we travelled to see weren't there (or in temp quarters). I found the whole Manly thing quite pricey for what I consider a pretty average beach.
Cool beach town, scenic ferry ride over. Nice surf town, not too crowded and not as popular as Bondi. good day trip. Try the newly remodeled Hotel (bar) close to the beach. Great rooftop area.

Clean and great location. We stayed in Manly over Christmas and it was a beautiful spot. The views are great, its close to town. Toilets and showers are close by. The beach was clean and as it is huge we never felt too over crowded.

Nice beach and waterfront. Everybody says go to Manly beach Instead of Bondi.Well I've been to them both and enjoyed them both as much.Manly has a small beach on the harbour side and if you walk through the town you will come to the beach on the seaward side where all the surfers are.There are volley ball courts on the beach also.There are plenty of bars and places to eat.A pleasant place to spend the day.

From the ferry to manly. Its beautiful. firstly, we actually didnt want to visit manly, due to limited time. we just wanted to use the ferry to take good pictures around sydney opera house (most tour operator charge ridiculous price for boats) as expected, the ferry passed by sydney opera house for quite a while. so its really-really cheap compared to those idiots who rent out a boat or boat tours. great photos as well!! highly recommended. (the ferry trip to manly)manly - small town. nothing much to do here. a whole stretch of beach and houses. quite expensive. so it was OK. stayed there for a while right before sundown we're board on ferry.god, the view is amazing. arrived abt 10 km to sydney opera house. i've got crazy pictures there.conclusion, dont visit manly 1 whole day. go in the afternoon & take good photos of the sydney opera house in the day. stay in manly for a few hours. go back to sydney. even at night, the view is breathtaking.

Pretty town. Manly was a prettier town than your basic tourist spot. We were there on a Sunday afternoon and found an outdoor market which was a nice surprise - full of toys and Christmas ornaments, scarves, and clothing - not just touristy junk! It was a lovely walk from the ferry to the beach with lots of choices (restaurants, tourist stores, Aborginal art/jewely store, ect).

Nice Beach. Manly beach is a long golden sand with a lovely promenade running alongside it. It’s not the best beach I’ve been to and I would prefer Shelly Beach which is a short walk from Manly but it’s still a nice long beach. When we were there we had sunshine, beautiful white sand and clear blue sea what more could you ask for!
Weekend Markets a Must See!. Manly Ferry is the way to see the harbour, then Manly is a great place full of shops, and markets on the weekend. Don't miss the beach of course!!!!

Filthy. What a disappointment. The ferry ride over was pleasant but was let down as soon as we arrived. Very crowded and commercial. When we finally made it to the beach we could not believe the amount of trash everywhere. To get to the water you had to watch every step. If you wanted to sit down you definitely had to look hard to find a clean spot. Definitely not worth the trip if you are looking for a nice day at the beach!

Perfect visitor's day out. The beautiful ferry ride form the city is only the beginning. With gorgeous harbour beaches both sides of the ferry wharf in Manly, it's worth a short walk along the Corso to the sea side of Manly. The ocean beach is spectacular, and second to none as a suburban city beach with miles of white sand and clear pacific water. An afternoon stroll to Shelley Beach is a must. Plenty of cafes and restaurants to temp the hungry.If you're a walker, turn left off the ferry and walk along the harbour to Fairlight. Beautiful aspect and if you're really keen walk all the way to Spit Bridge Mosman and catch a bus back! Beautiful views and natural bushland, especially in the autumn or spring.
Fun fun fun. Nice and clean, lots of space because most of the tourists are at Bondi. While you are there why not try roller blading or the surf school?

Extremely well-developed beach. My followers know that I generally dislike beaches -- too much sand on them. However, Manly is backed by civilization, manned by stalwart-looking lifeguards, and surrounded by a very well planned boardwalk. That and it has an excellent surf when the wind from Peru arrives. It's easily reachable from the ferry so even I had no excuse for avoiding it. Thankfully, I did not. The dislikable sand is fine, there were few rocks further out the no-swim areas (due to cross currents) were well marked. It is also a family beach, which I prefer, meaning that all ages were present when we attended, lending a casual ambiance to things. Highly recommended -- especially because you'll enjoy the ferry ride as well.

Better Beaches Elsewhere. Manly/Bondi, everyone does these, but they are a bit tacky. Personally i prefer the northern beaches near Mona Vale, north of Manly. They are spectacular&not nearly so busy. If staying in the city, the L90 bus from Central Station will get you all the way to beautiful Palm Beach&others on the way. Pre-pay before you board, though. If you are lucky enough to know a northern beaches local, get them to drive you to the "Bible Garden" - funny name/gorgeous lookout over Palm Beach. Wow.
Great Afternoon Out. Took the ferry over and had a leisurly afternoon at the beach, loads of great little restaurants and bars are the ferry dock. lots of posing going on at the beach

Sun and Sand. The quayside a syou arrive on the ferry is a pleasant enough spot on its own, with restaurants and bars. The walk uphill towards the promenade is quite pleasant with a variety of shops.The promenade is stunning, a wide walkway with plenty of picnic tables and great views of the bay. The beach is wonderful and the sea is perfect for surfing. Just off the promenade in a road parallel to the main street is a superb fish and chip shop. Select you fish or other sea food from the fantastic display of fresh produce and the wait a few minutes while it is cooked for you, then retire to a picnic table on the promenade and perhaps follow up with an excellent ice-cream from the sea front parlour, wonderful

Ocean on one side, Harbour on the other. It's actually part of three beaches forming one continuous stretch of golden sand and rolling, but not dangerous, surf. Reached by visitors travelling on the Manly Ferry, the shops fronting the Corso, the main street leading from the Harbour to the beach, can be tacky tourist traps, but the beach itself is clean, fresh and user-friendly.

Great afternoon. Took the Manly Ferry across to Manly Beach. Good 30min trip over. Fortunate enough to see Whales on our trip across. Had good coffee at Gloria Jeans on arrival, wandered down to Manly Beach through the boulevarde of shops. Grat afternoon out
A place to relax. Calm and clean with blazing sun, white sands and blue sea, enjoy and relax the place and the atmosphere, also you have lots of choices for food and beverages around

A must. We bought the 60 dollar travel card, which we used o n the bus, tram, trains, and the ferries. We took the the ferry to Manly, which gave us an amazing view of the harbour. Manly beach is a must, and the scenic walk is great.

Must do. the Manly Ferry trip is a good start, the beach in Manly is very clean(when it does not rain), had a good swim, restaurants are all over and prices not as high as in Sidney, food is fantastic. If lucky you could spot a whale passing by!
Better than Bondi !!!!. Laid back, typical northern beaches. Great restaurants . Good shops. Great trip from the city . Seven miles from Sydney ,one thousand miles from care.

Manly Beach - The best in Sydney!. Its a great day out. Take the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly. A great 30 minute boat ride. Arrive at Manly wharf which has bars restaurants and coffee shops. Beautiful views of the harbour. Walk through The Corso with all it's shops and restaurants (and water feature that kids play in) until you reach the beachfront (yes, the ocean is both ends of Manly) where you will see the surfers and swimmers whatever the weather. The walk along to shelley beach is great. Pass the built in swimming pool and watch out for the water dragons which live along this section. A cafe and a restaurant at Shelley beach and DIY BBQs. I think Manly has it all, especially on a hot sunny day!
coastal walk. Catch the ferry to Manly from Sydney for about 7 dollars and then take a walk along the coast path = lovely
Relax & recharge. I love Manly Beach. Certainly a great spot to relax & recharge. Lots of food options nearby. The seagulls will help themselves to your lunch if you're not careful!!!!

A very nice beach... but not much more. It's a great beach, but I am not sure what's so special about it? Having seen some really amazing (and uncrowded) beaches in Brazil, North America and even Pakistan, I found Manly underwhelming. Especially after a 30 minute ferry ride to get there from Sydney itself. Given it was the tail end of winter (and early spring weather), the beach was not overly busy I was told. But there were still enough visitors there (sitting, tanning, walking, shopping) for me to consider it over-crowded.
Spectacular and soothing. Vey calming atmosphere,even with lot's of people around. Suggest shopping on the street to the beach, and bringing a snack while you watch the waves and scenery.

The other great beach of Sydney Harbour. Spent Christmas Day at Manly with my daughter and realy enjoyed how the Aussies make an outdoor Christmas their thing. Three and four generation would gather on the grass with their "eskies" , wine,m food etc. and really enjoy the outdoor life.

Manly Beach a Sydney must see.. What a wonderful beachside suburb, shops, surf, families, tourists, cafes, hotels, and each ferry arriving with more and more people coming to enjoy the very pleasant surroundings. Very family friendly.
Very nice beach. Spent a few hours on here and really enjoyed it plenty to do as there were people Surfing and plenty of Volleyball nets if you wanted something to do.
Worth a visit. Loved the whole atmosphere of Manly. Great place to walk around and lots of shops too. Great sitting on the beach watching the surfers. Well worth the visit.

Two kilometers of sand. Great beach which can be accessed from Sydney via the ferry. The saying " Seven miles from Sydney and a thousand miles from care" has been the motto for Manly beach for decades. Try the fish and chips on the beachfront. Yum!
Manly beach. Took the ferry over which leaves every 30 minutes. Unfortunately it was the holidays and there were 100's on the beach so very crowded. Great art galleries to visit..

Great day trip from Sydney with lots to offer!. For a great day trip for both families or shoppers - take the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly! Shops along the Corso (pedestrian mall) include surf wear shops like Quicksilver, Billabong, Roxy and others. There is also a small playground suitable for younger kids in the middle of the corso and another not far along the beachfront. Lots of different cafes, restaurants and bars from the wharf, throughout the Corso and along the beachfront. Not to mention all the ice-cream shops! Beach is nice and not too crowded. Also lots of walking paths (or hire bikes!) By chance we happened to go when the Manly Jazz Festival was on which was great - lots of free jazz music plus markets and kids activities (for a fee) along the beachfront which made for an awesome atmosphere (though very busy!) Ferry trip also offers many great photo opportunities of the Sydney Harbour Bridge, the Opera House, Kirrabilly and Sydney city view. Highly recommend this as a day trip!

Beautiful!. Well worth going to! Great space, clear water, layed back atmosphere, never feels too crowded. If your up for it there is a walk that circles around and you can hike up to some higher views of the beach.

A great beach. Fabulous beach in a great spot, reached easily by the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay in Sydney, heaps of tourist attractions when you get there, step off the ferry and walk up through the Mall to the beach at the other end, go for a stroll along the beach and around the corner at the end to the next beach, there are lots of cafes and coffee shops plus a fair sprinkling of shops to browse through, it's a good day out!

Great Place. Went there by ferry, nice trip with great views. Manly is Nice with some real good spots to sit down near the water for some great food and drinks. Has also a nice beach and plenty of things to do

SIMPLY AUSTRALIA. Australia is full of beaches, surfers and beach Babes and that a common trait!Clean, Beautiful and golden. A built up area but has loads of cafes, resturants and shops.COME ON IN THE WATERS LOVELY!
great. beach is awesome, girls are lovely, food is epic especially the fish. the pedestrianized beach front is a wonderful idea and works well. surf not amazing but its a much better beach than bondi
It is all Australian. Busy, fantastic boardwalk and nice and long. Great shops and restaurants the real Sydney, I particularly like the Bacino bar cafe for its coffee.

Crowded, but fun!. Typical beach town...the beach itself was super crowded (for a Monday!) but that might be because no one was allowed into the water due to a shark sighting. We enjoyed lunch and then walked the beach before boarding the ferry back to Sydney.

Jazz Festival Weekend. A long time since I have been to Manly and pleasantly surprised at how it has improved. Went on the October Jazz Festival weekend and was surprised that we could sit down and have lunch with meals priced at less than $20. Manly used to be so much more expensive 20 years ago so perhaps it is learning it is better to get volume business. Food was good. There were five tents set up for the festival and large crowds. We spent a beaut afternoon sitting in the sun enjoying the music and ambience.

wouldnt mind living here. Beautiful beach that looked clean and with lovely views. Much prefered it to Bondi. The town is also nice with the usual offering of shops, cafes, bars and restaurants. You can enjoy a long walk along the promenade with the local dog walkers, joggers, familes and tourists. There's water fountains if you get caught out with a drink on a hot day. Toilets and bathing facilities.
Must go. Take the ferry around 9 am to avoid big groups. Small place with good things to see and eat. You can spend 3 hours untill all day
take the ferry. perfect beaches. wonderful to walk in Manly to shop and to see the place. it is a small town that has to be enjoyed

Not as nice as Expected. Coming from Queensland perhaps I expected more from the famed Manly beach but left underwhelmed,not by the beach itself but from the boorish, childish and rude people living or visiting here. It started on the ferry with young kids especially girls dressed like 2 cent hookers and swearing like military sailors. My wife and two daughters were gob smacked. I but my tongue and turned my IPod volume up the entire trip otherwise I may have had to belt more thanone teenage idiot...got to the mall heading to the beach and as my 18 y/o daughter said, " where is their class ", it all seemed rather feral to us, we could not wait for lunch and get home. Imagine if we caught the last ferry back with those young freaks..give me Qld beaches any day...

Better than Bondi. When tourists visit Sydney they head straight for Bondi. What a mistake! manly is far better. Great beach town and lovely views from the ferry. I love coming here for a weekend to visit family and enjoy the sun, sea and surf.
Great place. Great beach great place to have some lunch looking at the ocean and then later stroll along with an icecream
Great Beach Town. Easy to get to from anywhere in Sydney. Nice beach, ample bathrooms, & walkways . Many different restaurant options so it's good for families, couples and individuals.
Beautiful spot. Manly has a nice beach with plenty of tall pine trees lining the Esplanade.Several restaurents and cafes cater for tourists and one canget there by ferry from Circular Quay

Been there; done that. Went for the ferry ride. The beach was nice, but wasn't impressed with the shops or cafes.
The first place we tried at 11.30am (The Pantry) told us they were now serving lunches so we couldn't just have a coffee.
The next (Sugar Lounge) took forever to serve us and completely forgot the Muffin we'd ordered.

Plenty to see and do. Catch the ferry for a beautiful trip from Circular Quay to Manly Beach. When you reach Manly, you can walk from the harbour end of Manly to the ocean end of Manly. Plenty of retail shops and eating places selling food at very reasonable prices. Great holiday vibe in Manly. Wonderful walk along the ocean side of Manly beach and a great place to eat take-away fish and chips.

Good for people watching. I'm not a beach person but had to wait here for a friend so sat in one of the little shelters watching all the school kids having a great time. Like most Australian beaches the sand is white, the sea is beautiful and the people are having a great time. Loved the closeness to the shopping mall where lots of interesting stuff was happening. I'll go here again next time I'm in Sydney just to have a good relax.

Avoid the seagulls. Manly is a great place to visit and people watch, sea watch and wine and Dine. If you go for fish and chips, watch the seagulls, they are feral and the shire needs to do something. The morons feeding them don't help but they are taking food out of your hand half way to your mouth, bouncing off your head. They are very skilled at swiping your meal whilst still in hand. Other than pesky gulls, Manly is full of vibrant shops, restaurants, cafe's and people

Beautiful. The beach front is immaculate, so clean. This is surfers paradise. There are lots of beach front cafes and bars and small shopping centre just set back from the main road. Take a walk along Marine Parade to see some amazing houses with spectacular views.

Worth an afternoon visit. take a ferry from Sydney to Manly beach and stroll around the town and beach. We went when it was a nice brisk temperature but not warm enough to swim. Instead my wife and I found a nice small cozy place to have some snacks and wine.

My favourite part of Sydney. Manly is my no.1 spot to visit in Sydney. The ferry ride is lovely and relaxing, the beach is great and the walkway a he ned of the beach past Fairy Bower to Shelley Beach is magical!
Less famous but more beautiful. Really nice swimming and surfing beach. Lovely walk from the beach to Shelly beach and great fish and chips to be had close to the beach.

must visit. this is just awesome. We took ferry from circular quay to manly beach. the beach is beautiful & the plaza is equally beautiful with shops, restaurants, cafes & bar. You can buy aboriginal art paintings from there.

Manly Beach & Corso. Manlys is definitely laid back beach culture. Great for a stroll along on a sunny day with a delicious ice cream, simply enjoying the mix of shops, cafes & the variety of shops. Grab some fish n chips & go down the beach or stop for lunch at one of the hotels & its a good day out.
Lovely beach !. lovely beach. It was a little bit cold for us to go for a swim nonetheless the beach was packed. A lot of people playing beach volleyball, a lot of surfers etc.

Day Trip. If you only have a day and need to see the beach, Manly is very nice. Try ordering food to go and eat at the beach. Check for warning flags to find out the best spot to swim. Bathrooms are available to change.

worth a visit!. beautiful, you see a lot of nature, water, you pass the many rockpools (swimming away from the sharks), you can watch the surfers and you can choose to take a long or short walk. I must admit that somewhere I got lost (but that's probably me) but a very nice mother and her daugther brought me back to the ferry station. Also worthwile to go to Northead, from where you have a panoramic view over the sea.

Can't wait to go back. A lovely break from the hussle and bustle from the city. The ferry across is picturesque and relaxing, you arrive and spoilt for choice with eateries. Manly Deli (on The Corso) has an amazing selection of everything you could ever want and perfect for a beach picnic. I can't fault Manly: amazing beaches, relaxing and quiet, good shops. Am looking forward to going back and staying there for longer than a few hours.
Never pass up the chance to go here!. Lovely! I did not want to leave! Beautiful A must do if your in Sydney! Would love to have got to spend more time here!

Great day out. There are two manly beaches for either swimming /surfing or for families. They are separated by a street full of shops and cafes. The beaches are clean and safe and are very picturesque, unlike Bondi. There is a very efficient ferry service to Circular Quay at Sydney which runs frequently.
Nice but nothing special. I think is overestimated. It was nice but nothing special, like every other beach. We have visited this because we were visiting a friend in Manly.

Overhyped. High rise, modern and ugly towers let the place down. It is one of the places most tourists go, but I think it is lacking in charm and far inferior to many of the other more beautiful and natural beaches in Sydney.

Best sand beach I have seen. Very nice cresant shaped sand beach. Great for just walking/wading or if the waves are up surfing! People watching is pretty good here also. Only detracting thing was two storm drain pipes across the beach empting into the ocean.
Worth a visit!. Take the ferry from the Circular Quay for $14 return, superb beaches and coastal walk especially if the weather is good!
Great beach. Maybe not the bests beach in the world but it's a great abeach to visit and getting the ferry there and back increases the experience enfold.
Manly. Many has fond memories for me from my childhood and even my courting days long walks along the beach front and the many attractions

Great Perspective. great way to spend a half day from Sydney. nice ferry ride with a great view of the entire city. the walk to the beach has lots of shopping and dining options. the beach is great and packed with surfers.

Could be nicer than Bondi!. The title says it all, Bondi has the reputation, whereas Manly is more refined... you can choose. I thoroughly enjoyed my time on the beach where the crowd is not quite as young and more family orientated, at least from my point of view.
Nice beach. Pretty tourisy area especially near the beach area. There are plenty of novelty shops and restaurants to choose from.

nice beach.... Manly Beach is a wonderful beach....great beach to try lots of fun-filled water sports..you can also do some shopping from the stores nearby the beach...to go to the beach you need to take a ferry ride from Circular Quay, which is wonderful and memorable ride..i enjoyed being there....
Large beach area, steps from shops!. Beautiful blue water! We went in the wintertime so we ended up renting bikes and rode up and down Manly Beach. Great photo op!
Take The Ferry. A short Ferry ride from Circular Quay, this is a very accesible and friendly beach that you can easily reach from downtown Sydney. Worth a day trip for the views, and very walkable.

Prefer this to Bondi. Bondi maybe an Aussie institution but personally I prefer Manly for its more laid back feel. Some may say Manly is more up market but I think you can find decent grub at fair prices too. Can't find the restaurant here for review but "Sushi at Manly" is pretty nice with mid day flat rate per plate special.Feels more family orientated vs. the more hippy surfer rebel delinquent feel at Bondi.
Nice spot!. Taking the ferry from The Rocks area to Manley is really nice. Walk to the beach and watch the surf!
Great Surf beach. Had a great lazy day on the beach after NYE. Loved every part of it and only a little time away from the city.

I live in Sydney so know what I am talking about. what is not to like about Manly Beach... we used to go there as youngsters and it is as beautiful as ever. The Corso has shops and cafe's and at the end of it is Manly Beach... relaxing and just plain beautiful.
Pretty. It was a cold windy day so we really were not able to enjoy the beach as much as we would've like to, but I have heard it is wonderful in the summer time. Beautiful nevertheless.

Beautiful. Great beach and a great place to break for a bite and people watch. It was a sunny gorgeous day with friends so what can I say? Excellent is the word that comes to mind. We actually went in March/April time frame but no longer an option on the "when did you visit" bar below. Sorry it took so long to post my experience.
Coffee location. Lovely sunsets ... great place to have coffee even in winter. It's a public beach... unless you surf, not much else to do.

Beautiful Beach with tons of Surfers. While in Sydney I just had to make my way over to the iconic Manly Beach and I was glad I did. Although it was a little cold and windy when I went the beach was beautiful and there were still tons of surfers out in the water. The beach is lined with various different shops and restaurants and is a great place to spend the day. The ferry ride from Circular Quay takes exactly 30 minutes and is a pleasant ride through the Harbor. I would highly recommend this day trip to anyone. You can even go for a few hours.

Nice long beach, mediocre promenade :(. The beach would rate very good but I'm taking into account the shops and the promenade nearby. Not a lot of character and really hadn't changed all that much in the last 15 years. Parking is a nightmare too.

The Pantry Restaurant Manly Beach. The Pantry on Manly beach is simply sensational and you will be hard pressed to find a better location in the day time together with a inventive menu and great service. The beach and surrounding cafes and shops is far and away the best in Sydney. Bondi is not a patch on this part of paradise!!

This is Manly Beach in Winter 6 August 2012. I live in Manly, Sydney and I am always amazed at some of the incredible sights. Just two weeks ago a large humpback whale and her calf were swimming in the waters near my house. It's so beautiful. It was an incredible winter's day. It was 23C, sun shining a crystal clear blue waters. Photos are attached.

The Bavarian Bier Café. After waiting for service to take our order it took another 20 minutes for coffee which was then offered to the table in front of us. When we did get a new coffee it was just warm. Breakfast service was equally bad. 45 minutes later and i had to check where it was as the waitress could not be found. The order was waiting with 6 or so others going cold. Our order for poached eggs came fried, mine were luckily ok and so we waited even longer for another order of eggs. We were not alone in our wait as others were asking and even leaving. Maybe if we were told there was a wait we would have been able to understand the delay. Only 1 of 2 dishes were satisfactory.

Go for fish and chips. We caught the ferry from the harbour to Manly. Walking through the shops we weren't sure what to find, but at the far side there was a stunning beach, people surfing and a hige array of places serving fish and chips. We sat on the walkway watching the world go by, one fo my favourite memoires.

Beautiful beach. Great views, took the ferry and walked all over Manly. Very touristy area but the beach is clean, has lots of volley ball nets. Watched surfing school and great walking. Good food in area but pricey!
Better than Bondi. Bondi Beach may be more famous, but Manly Beach is my choice. The Promenade area is a great place to sit and watch people and with free 2-hour parking, you can't go wrong.

Best beach in Sydney!. Ive been in a lot of beaches and I think this one is the BEST. I love go from the city to manly by ferry. And then walk throught a way to a small beach next to manly. If you go up a little hill over there you can take good pictures!

What a Beautiful Place. If I lived in Sydney, this is where I'd live as its one beautiful place. Our son lives there so we met him at the Manly Ferry Terminal and took a ten minute walk up the beach to his flat and spent the evening on his deck over looking the bay. We didn't see any whales but understand they are not uncommon a couple times of the year. It's easy to see why residents love this place, who wouldn't if you can get up in the morning, go surfing or swimming before going to work, ride a ferry to/from work and then watch the sunset looking at the ocean...heaven.

LOVED IT!. My favorite beach in Sydney. Bondi is great too, but I really liked Manly. Easy to get to by ferry, a nice couple of block stroll past several stores (huge walkway, no car traffic) in an open, cross the street and you are at the beach. We strolled up and down, ate dinner at one of the restaurants facing the beach and really just enjoyed the time there. Only drawback... the ferries back are normally very busy and you may very well wait 20 - 30 minutes, but I honestly didn't care and had no issue with that.

Brilliant beach!!. Lovely beach, gets very busy and crowded on a weekend so go during the week if you can!! Very clean, lots of places to eat!!! The journey there is nice as well, if you go on the ferry!!

Manly is a must do experience for visitors!. Manly beaches must surely be amongst the worlds finest.Choose between riding a wave or floating in the crystal clear warm water at Shelley beach.Manly is sparkling clean and has a wide range of fantastic eateries many offering some of the most panoramic views in the world.One gripe is the bargain/junk shops that dominate the Corso

Bit of a trek but worth visiting!. I visited coogee and bondi before manly and I'm so glad I did as they weren't a patch on this beach! The whole area has a really relaxed vibe about it and doesn't seems commercial as bondi and isn't as small as coogee - beach beach in Sydney :)

Nice Beach. I'm a bit hard to impress when it comes to beaches as the ones i'm used to in West Australia are so good. But Many was great. The day i was there the weather was absolutely perfect with hardly and breeze and the water was really flat. It wasnt crowed as it was mid-week but there were still plenty of people around enjoying the beach front and park. There are lots of places to get food and nice places to sit and look at the ocean. Sand was nice and white and its only a short walk up the corso from the ferry stop in the bay to the ocean. A Recommended trip if you're visiting Sydney

Beautiful. I have been there tice and it's a very beautiful place. Once it as raining and you should have seen the vei when the rain stopped it was awesome. We sa the rainbow also.:-). Really enjoyed the walk in the coast.
A Walk Along The Beach. After a nice Ferry Trip over from Circular Quay talk a walk along the beautiful Manly Beach, grab some fish and chips and enjoy the view
Clean. Very clean place but very busy, it is a good place to eat near the water and maybe do a bit of fishing.

Much better than I expected. Getting there by ferry is such a pleasure! I found the beach far less crowded than I expected. I kept going back. I enjoyed the walk along the coast, the restaurants, an outdoor film festivaL A really nice beach to hang around.

The Seaside.. Visited Manly a few weeks ago with our son his wife & family. It looked almost exactly like an old British seaside town.Plenty of restuarants, cafes, & pubs.Food reasonable.The only difference is the surf, Manly has lots of surfers all hanging around waiting for the waves.We certainly had a nice family day out but would we go back ???Probably not.
Muh!. I really don't know what all the fuss was about. It's a nice beach but it's nothing special. We have nicer beaches in the UK!

Fun All Around. Manly Beach is wonderful. Very pretty beach, nice clean sand, great waves and surf. The lifeguards on this beach are very dutiful and keep a watchful eye on everyone in the water. There are two flags staked in the sand and all swimmers must stay between the two flags, and the lifeguards will remind those who stray outside of the flags with their loud megaphones. They have good reason though; there are some strong riptides and the flagged area is chosen because it's the safest portion of the water to be in. That being said, the waves are high and a lot of fun to jump over! The water is cold but it feels great on a hot summer day. The beach is really popular and is packed during the summer. There are a lot of great places to shop and eat; the fish and chips here is particularly spectacular. There's one fish and chip shop that's very close to the beach on the main strip that has a HUGE line, and for good reason! I can't remember the name of it but it's a small place with a good selection of fresh fish. I developed my fondness for Barramundi here.While you're here, definitely take a stroll down the Manly Scenic Walkway to Shelly Beach. Even better, get a cone from Copenhagen to enjoy during your walk.l
Amazing. Beautiful walk, very nice trip in ferry. Shops and restaurants. One of the most beautiful beach in Sydney

Surprise package. A short ferry ride to the bay in Manley that is very scenic and beautiful, around the motor boats and sail boats you feel relaxed. The many boutique food joints along the main beach offer variety and choice, good views and walkways around to the point
Nice one. The beach is good. Its not that big, but great fun. Water activities are fine. Mainly, the ferry ride from Circular Quay to Manly is superb.

Fun in the sun!. The beach was clean and sand nice and soft. No rubbish along or in the sand.
Very popular beach - lots of locals and tourists around.
Excellent location. Not hard to get too plus lots of shops and places to eat where you can take in the sights of the beach.

Cabbage Tree Bay an absolute beauty. If you aren't one of the surfing dudes and old enough to have adult kids of your own then maybe simply gazing at the waves and sunbakers of Manly Beach just isn't enough. If that's the case then you are in for a real treat. When facing the ocean turn right and follow the path all the way round the bay to what seems like a small private beach right at the far end. It's called Cabbage Tree Bay and is an absolute gem with a small kiosk and restaurant there as well. Quieter, peaceful, scenic as hell. During the last part of the walk there don't miss the quirky, idiosyncratic little images embedded in the rock wall on your right.
Sunset on the Beach. There seemed to be really nice friendly rolling waves. Lot os beautiful, really colorful (but loud) birds. Really glad I went! I would recommend it to anyone.

Not a ton to do. There really isn't a ton to do in Manly Beach. If you have limited time in Sydney, you might even skip it. If you have an afternoon or even just a few hours to kill, it's nice to go and get a "local feel". There isn't anything touristy or any sights to see but we got some great fish & chips and enjoyed sitting on the beach and people-watching. The best way to get there from Circular Quay is the Manly Ferry which is a nice, direct ride. Overall, though, I wouldn't put this on the "can't miss" list.
Great beach. Safe waves.. Great place to spend a day at the beach. Waves were strong yet consistant. Pair this daytrip from Sydney with a fabulous and relaxing ferry ride.

Wonderful Scenes and Great outlook. One of the best scenic beaches in Australia with outstanding surf and a great foreshore .Plenty of choices re restaurants, excellent accommodation options.Spectacular beach area.

Perfect, even in winter time!. I went to Manly on a cold day and had a great time. Lots of people walking their dogs, kids with bikes and suffers everywhere. As you get out of the ferry or the bus, you will be greeted by the main street, full with retail shops and cafes. Keep walking and head to the beach, where free entertainment is provided by experienced suffers. Hungry? No worries! Mainly is packed with restaurants to please all tastes and all budgets. Options available: Asian, Mexican, Italian, and Greek and even Australian fusion. Prices vary, so I recommend looking around. On the budget? Get yourself some fish and chip and, if it’s not raining and wind is not to strong, eat them on the seashore. The best!
Better than Bondi. The beach isn't so famous as Bondi but bigger. As a bonus, the village is charming and nice for a stroll.
Wonderful town and Beach. We watched a world class surfing competition when we were here and had a great time on the beach and walking around the town. Great day!

Nice, even in winter!. It's worth the trip and time to get to Manly beach from Sydney. It's nice and there's lots to do. On a sunny day during the winter, it doesn't get too cold and you can still lay on the beach and enjoy the sun.
manly beach. Forget Bondi, Manly beach is long, pure, clean, peaceful. Manly town is just like a 1950's English seaside resort, Exquisite time shift experience!
Great beach. Had a great day at Manly Beach and it was lovely to people watch
Worst Beach in the world. cafes rubbish, shops worse, surf clubs especially n steyne poor - dont come you would hate it. i have to suffer every weekend month after month
Sydney's best beach. Beautiful in every way, stunning sandy beach , beautiful surf and swimming, glorious sunshine, cafes galore,nstunning walks and vistas....I want to live there...

Best beach in Sydney!. Manly Beach is by far my favorite beach that I have visited in Sydney. The town is small enough to feel like you're away from the city, but also had loads of things to do. Manly has dozens of fantastic restaurants and shops. I would highly suggest eating at one of the restaurants on the beach front while enjoying the great view of the beach. Manly offers many fun activities also, such as kayaking, surfing, and renting bikes. The hike to Northside is also beautiful and gives you a chance to see different views of Sydney. The ferry from Circular Quay to Manly also gives you the chance to see the Opera House, the bridge, and the Sydney Harbour from the water, and they are beautiful! I definitely recommend visiting Manly Beach!
Not one of Sydney's best beaches. Overcrowded, grubby and full of tourists and day trippers, so many better beaches for visitors to enjoy, Manly leaves me cold.
Lots to do. Manly is always busy and interesting. 2 nice beaches to visit, good cafes with great food. Lots to see. Stay in Manly for a change from city centre.

Worth the ferry ride. Beautiful beach and a cute town. We had a free day in Sydney and some of us opted to take the ferry to Manly and walk around. The town is cute with shops, cafes, a mall, etc... The beach is the real attraction with beautiful large trees and lots of families enjoying the lovely weather. I really enjoyed sitting quietly on the beach, watching the water, and enjoying the scenery. Definitely worth the ferry ride over.

Too rough to swim. We took the ferry on a warm April day. The beach was very busy but the water was so rough that the guards had to close the beach, except for surfers. It was great to just lay on the sand, which was clean. There were change rooms and washrooms at the beach. There are a variety of shops and places to eat near the beach and there were small, calm beaches near the ferry terminal. The ferry ride was good and reasonable.
Shopping!. Had a great shopping spree there. Found a few shops with great deals for souvenirs.
do go dont miss it. What a lovely place to swim ,relax ,enjoy the sun and views plus eat and dring
Beautiful. Nice clean beach, golden sands and nice café's, shops and bars in close proximity.

Manly Beach. Its a beach with a reputation. Very busy in summer but obviously a lot quiter in the winter months. Parking is a nightmare in summer but better in winter. Take a ferry ride from Circular Quay and enjoy the views during the ride.

One of my favourite beaches year round. Manly beach has something for everybody, all year round. In swimming weather there is plenty of sand to spread out on , flags and lifeguards at both ends of the beach.There is two ocean pools and also rockpools and a sea cave to explore. If not swimming there is a great paved walkway and bike track where anything with wheels can go. There is also playgrounds for the kids and grassed areas for picnics. There is also plenty of cafes, restaurants and shops to enjoy after.
Beautiful Beach. One of the best beaches in Sydney. Beautiful and quite charming.

Nice day trip for lunch. great way to relax for the day, caught the ferry across and had lunch in a nice cafe on manly beach, then walked it off soaking up the sun walking the length of the beach to queenscliff.. Glorious day!

Aussie Rays. Not much feels more Aussie than walking along a beach with your thongs (flip flops), togs (swimsuit) and sunnies (sunglasses). The waves aren’t too strong and they have lifeguards to help you look after your kiddos and loved ones. There is plenty of sandy beach to share and if you get hungry or want some shade there are lots of restaurants and cafes nearby. We really enjoyed the afternoon we spent here and would recommend it to our friends and family… including kids.
Good memories. We liked Manly beach even though it was evening when we arrived and starting to get very cold, we still swam in the sea!! The little town is nice, lots of tourist shops.

Good day trip. If you want to see the beach, Manly is a good option. It Is a 25 minute ride by ferry from Circular Quay and lovely on a nice day. You can stroll the main street, wander in and out of the shops,watch the surfers, take a dip in the ocean, sit on the beach, or just have ice cream. Nice day.

One of our great beaches to visit. This is a great place to visit, You can catch the ferry over, get off, walk a short distance to the end of the street and swim at this great beach, what more could you want... there are also plenty of cafes etc where you can purchase all varieties of foods

A great aussie beach. We took the ferry over to manly beach from Circular Quay, the ferry ride was short and sweet about 15-20 minutes. The town of manly was buzzing with buskers and people everywhere!! The beach is so picturesque but the current is very strong so make sure you swim between the flags, We had lunch at a great pub on the corner called Hotel Steyne it was a great open pub with great food!!!

Enjoy your day on the way. Take a ferry to Manly, you will have the best view of Opera house and bridge during the 20min trip. The sand is great there. Can have a nice walk along the beach. Quite developed area.

A great day out. This is well worth a trip on the ferry. Only costs about 10 dollars and you get some of the best views of Sydney on the way there and back. Manly has a great beach and a very nice walk along the tree line promenade.
Lovely sand. The beach was clean, the walk was full of little surprises. Lovely atmosphere. The sand was clean and soft.

So much to see and do!. A visit to Manly can be a fantastic full day trip. Starting with the scenic ferry ride over from Circular Quay and ending with the ride back again, it can be quite an experience. Not only can you sunbathe on the beach and swim in the ocean, but also partake in the activities that always seem to be on at Manly. There is an abundance of shops, from Sportsgirl to unique one-off stores, Manly a great place to do a bit of shopping. There are also many good restaurants, cafes, ice cream shops etc. Whatever the cuisine you are after you will most likely find it here. Make sure you also check out neighbouring Cabbage Tree Bay aquatic reserve. Follow the path to the right when facing Manly beach. It takes you past the Fairy Bower Pools and leads to a small beautiful beach (Shelly Beach), popular with learning scuba divers. Have a look around the area, walk up the hill to get some amazing views and maybe spot the odd water dragon lizard in the bushes.
Nice beach. Pleasant beach even when the weather is cold in winter. I recommend catching the ferry to Manly
The poor cousin of Sydney's East. The beach is okay. The pubs and restaurants behind are good. But it's no Eastern Suburbs...
Very rough. On the open ocean, went to go surfing but waves and weather not agreeable. Suspect you need to be a local to catch the good days.

Beautiful beach close to the city. Manly beach can easily reached by an half hour ferry ride from Circular quay (ferries leave from wharf 3) .It is a clean and well kept, and very popular with surfers. The beach has volleyball nets too. My tip would be to head to either far end when it is busy - people seem to congregate in the middle so it is more crowded there. You can also walk round to Shelly beach, which is sheltered from the waves and a popular diving and snorkelling spot, with a cafe and restaurant right next to it.

Perfect Australian city beach. The esplanade walk all the way along the beachfront is perfect. It's flat, wide and easy for strollers/elderly. Plenty of restaurants and cafes along the way over the road and plenty of action and people watching to do while strolling along with an ice cream. Quintessential Sydney at its most relaxed.

THE beachy place. Reminds me of Southern California ... beach vibe with plenty of smaller shops to find "off the beaten path" garb and collectibles, not to mention smaller restaurants offering interesting but delictible choices. The beach is fantastic. Many surfers. Lots of little kids - but it was a Sunday afternoon and the ferry was running a cheap "family rate".

Lovelly Beach. Lovelly beach to visit and great shopping area. Was told it was a must and could spend a day in Manly, we are not sure why. Nothing much in Manly. Shopping and the beach no places of intrest to visit.

Way Over-rated. The cruise to Manly was nice, but the walk down the Corso was a cattle walk in a sea of people-- nothing but people as far as the eye can see. The local shops and restaurants were as touristy as can be imagined. Think Ft. Walton Beach or Myrtle Beach. The beach itself is perfectly fine. Once you get off the main walkways, there are some nice neighborhoods, but it takes some exploring to find the gems here. Do more research and find the quieter, out-of-the way places with more character than Manly.

Sydney local- one of my favourite places. Born and bred in Sydney, I love Manly beach. The is something for everyone. Catch the ferry from the city and enjoy our wonderful harbour. When you arrive at Manly, the bay on the wharf side is beautiful and you may see the local fairy penguins! There are bars and restaurants here but make sure you walk through the Corso to the main beach. We love to walk south to Shelley beach- there is a good vantage point from the headland, or north to Queenscliff beach. The area is fairly flat, sothe walk is not strenuous at all. Have a swim if the weather permits. Enjoy a snack and coffee of even a glass of wine or two overlooking the beach. The are plenty of cafes and restaurants to choose from. A "must do" day out for every visitor to Sydney.

Loved Manly!. A beautiful beach in a quaint, cute beach town. We went in spring (September) and the weather was fantastic, hot, sunny, lots of people on the beach, restaurants and bars all open and everyone enjoying beer and food. The ferry to and from Manly was a great way to see how gorgeous the harbor is. If you're in Sydney this is a total must.

Lets the drunks go to Bondi - go to Manly for the best beach!. Take the Ferry from the city, stroll up the Corso and when you hit the beach turn right to the southern end of the beach, its call South Steyne. Its the most protected so has smaller waves. If you want better waves and fewer people walk to the northern end, called Queenscliff and hang out with the locals.
Can't beat aussie beaches. even on a wet and windy day it still looks good,but best on a sunny day walk along the prom and get some lunch

Beautiful beach..... Just outside Sydney, you reach a small seaside town, funny. All of a sudde you are away from the hustle and bustle of the city and can enjoy a fantastic beach. Kids played on it for hours... Een in the winter.
Quiet but happening beach. The waves are not too big & dangerous like in bondi beach , But still it's beautiful ! not enough "shelter" place though .
Good for a day trip. Easy to get round, friendly, lots cafes, small market, easy walk to beach, fifties style architecture, would have liked to stay longer but time was too short -maybe next time
Beach. Beach feeling only 30 minutes away from busy Central Sydney. The ferry trips ads to this.
Lots to do. You can try scuba diving, surfing, or just plain old swimming and then there's plenty of cafes nearby for lunch.
Great Beach. Great beach if you are able to find a place to sit. Manly is a tourist resort for the folk of Sydney, it does not reflect Australian society.
must see. the home of australian surfing is a great day on the ferry and the beach. don't miss it and be sure to get some fish and chips while you are there.

Beautiful surf town. This place is lovely a beautiful relaxed surf town but only miles from Sydney where all the pretty girls hang outThe beach is clean as is the water plus thereis a wonderful walk up into the high cliffs looking directly out over the pacificThis is like many similar places in the world except its only minutes from Sydney .Take the ferry it's cheaper than a taxi or a car
Nice walking area. I had a lunch with my family and took a walk. It was really nice and relaxing area to visit.

great beach and ambience.. Drove there with a friend when visiting, so missed the ferry.Good lunch overlooking the beach and a swim after in the harbour at the other end of the main street .Pleasant shopping street.Worth a trip.
30 minutes jaunt from Circular Quay. Well worth the $14 return trip by ferry. Get off and head up the Corso to the beach. Lots of shops and restaurants with a gorgeous view of he ocean surf.
Clean beach. The water was cold and refreshing, the sand was clean and not littered with garbage like some beaches I've seen.The little park at the end was enjoyable.

Lovely beach minutes from Sydney. Sydney is a lovely and vibrant city. If you fancy a stroll on a beach nearby catch the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly. The shopping area, known as the Corso, is interesting and there are plenty of pubs and restaurants to have a meal in or sit and watch the world go by. On the beachfront is a path that leads to nearby beaches with great views out over the sea. Its well worth a day trip to Manly when visiting Sydney.

Fantastic Beach!. Beautiful surf town with an excellent beach for all types of people. Cove allows for different breaks so you can find any wave size, even calm water for the kids. Great restaurants and you can learn to surf!
fab beach. take the ferry to Manley and enjoy this glorious beach
Never disappoints. Whether its for a walk or shopping, Manly beach is our preferred beach. The free parking in one of the many garages next to the beach adds to the attractiveness.
Awesome.. Just a great beach with a fun surf surrounded by cheap good restaurants! Perfect day out!

Nice sea walk. Nice sea walk along the water with many little critters running about. Didn't get a chance to go in the water, but wasn't too keen on it since the swim boundaries seemed very tight and crowded.

Nice place. We went for a day trip just to have lunch. Very easy to get there. Nice place to walk around and there is a scenic walk which we did not so. Very lively lot of places to eat very nice place

Worth a ferry ride. Took the Manly ferry. About a 30 minute ride. Had a couple beers at Four Pines Brew Pub directly across the street from the ferry terminal. Great staff and we highly recommend their stout. You can't go wrong.

Better than Bondi. Taking the ferry from Circular Quay is the most scenic way to visit this fantastic beach suburb. Great atmosphere and great places to eat from take away to first class dining. Everything is here from the traquil harbourside beach and the Manly Aquarium, strolling up The Corso, and a great surf beach.

Beautiful beach and town. Beautiful beach and town. Highly recommend spending a day in this area. Enjoy the beach, take part in as little or much of the scenic walkway as you can endure, dine in the fantastic local restaurants, and enjoy a few beers from the independent breweries. I'm so glad my husband and I decided to spend the day here, absolutely worth it! Very relaxed vibe that is an excellent addition to the city scene of Sydney.
Great spot. We breakfasted at a beachfront cafe. The service was great and the view spectacular. Manly is a very clean location.

JUST A FERRY RIDE AWAY FROM SYDNEY. It's a ferry ride out of Cirular Quay near the Opera House. Easy, picturesque ride...great views of the Opera House and Bridge from the water. Beautiful beach town to unwind....Stroll around the Corso...many shops, bars, and places to eat. Souvenirs are less expensive than Sydney. Bathrooms are right at the beach....Watch the surfing lessons ...Walk the paved scenic trail lined with grass, trees and benches around the beach/water....Great town to visit...change of pace from Sydney....don't miss it
Top Beach. This is another one of Sydney's great beaches, not only in summer but winter months as well. Pop up to the Corso for a great time and people watch to your hearts desire!
Beautiful. Manly provided a nice day excursion by ferry from the Opera House. The beach was lovely and there were a number of shops and restaurants. A nice diversion for an afternoon out of Sydney
beautiful. there is nothing negative about any of the beaches in Sydney.
DOWN TO EARTH. Manly is a very down to earth place away from the glitz of Sydney. It's a good beach on the Pacific with plenty of activity - volleyball nets etc. Can be pretty wild and windy

The place to live!. Manly is a small city with a lot of beaches around... people over there is very sporty and you can do a lot of activities like surf, snorkel, diving, go to the manly scenic walk...I have just spent 4 months over there, and it was the best time in my life. I thought to live a dream! Really a lot to do... even during the night. Corso is full of pubs or discos and there is a lot of young people!

Plenty of surfers.. This beach is nice because once you get off the ferry you walk thru a little strip area with plenty of pubs and shopping. The views were nice and the surfers seemed to be enjoying the waves..
Deservedly iconic beach. One of the most famous beaches in Sydney, and for good reason. Golden sands in a great setting.

great little beach. lovely beach for kids to swim - &lovley clifftop walk above - if you don't mind spiders ! Lots of beautiful water dragons lounging around , especially near the ( very good ) cafe & restaurant!

Over rated. There were thousands of people there for the renault volley ball tournament. It was over crowded, grass/tree area run down. Restaurant service was poor, expensive. Town very prepared for lots of tourist.
Think it was a $14 return trip ferry ride. Very crowded at the terminal and on board....
Surf, shop, play. Manly is a perfect little beach community close to Sydney. Collect shells, watch surfers, enjoy the waves - you won't be disappointed.

Nice Beach. Its Nice beach, you need to take the ferry from Opera house (Circular Quay station) to reach Manly beach. You need to walk 500 mts across the market to reach the beach. Nice place to spend the time

Fun Day!. It is definitly worth a day while you are in Sydney to take the ferry over to manly Beach. Great restaurants,and cafes and the shopping is good as well. The walks and surfing was great as well.

Beautiful Manly Beach. We took the ferry to Manly and walked through the lovely town to the beautiful beach.There is a picturesque walk or bike ride around the point from the beach and we highlyrecomend it as a "not to be missed" area to visit while in Sidney. Ferries are a greatway to see the entire area. We bought a one week pass and used it every day.
Engagement Party. Awesome location - sunny and the cafe reminded me of Melbourne :)
A million times better than Bondi. Lovely beach, lovely town, great vibe. If you're coming to Sydney find time to unwind in Manly.
Under utilised!. I was disappointed with Manly Beach. The adjoining beach-front seems to be a little barren and unexciting. The beach itself is lovely.

Take a surfing lesson. So much fun. I had never been on a surfboard before. The teachers really know how to teach and in a matter of minutes, I was able to stand up on the board and ride a wave in. Definitely an awesome experience that I hope to do again some day.
Beautiful!. Lovely clean beach, a wonderful day out. Perfect for families!

Lovely beach and great surfing action to watch. Manly has a great feel to it and the beach even more so. It is the centre of all activity in Manly and it was great to watch the surfers and families at play.
The beach was clean and the restrooms were too!
An ideal beach for families, friends and fitness freaks!
Manly is a beautiful beach. Very clean. Plenty of nice restaurants close by.. We liked the beautiful clean beach and lovely restaurants.
Great views, too pretty. Such a cute wee beach, surrounded by bars, restaurants, shops and cafes. Great to visit and soak up some sun.
Great spot. Nice beach, great eating places very relaxing place to go for lunch

Love the waves there. great beach onthe ocean (not an inner harbour beach!) close to the city, although a bit full during the main season. Also nice the option to wander to Shelley beach if one is keen to swim in calmer waters or enjoy the sunset in the cove.
Peace and Food. Stroll down the beach. The Bower restaurant (on the way to Shelley Beach) is to die for - modern australian. For outstanding " posh" fish and chips, go to Mongers near Coles
Fantastic Day Away from Sydney. Loved the ferry trip, the harbour, fish n chips on the beach, great shops and coffee and must see.

RIGHT IN THE MIDDLE OF WHATS GOING ON IN MANLY. Gets a bit overcrowded in holiday season,but the beach is fantastic and clean lots going on,surfing,beach volley ball,long boarding,lifeguards everywhere just sit back and watch world go by

You should go to Manly. Manly Beach is a nice place to see. It is very relaxed and Oceanworld is in Manly. Many surfers and surf stores. Plus, try out the resturant The Pantry. They have great food and a perfect veiw of the ocean.
Go to Bondi. Manly was ok - it was a regular beach. If you are a tourist and want to see the type of beach in all of the brochures go to Bondi.

Worth a day trip. I went to Manly Beach on a Saturday on the ferry, which was easy to catch. The beach is only a short walk through a mall. There were some great artisan markets near the beach, which were worth wandering around. The beach was clean and had heaps of places to sight and enjoy the view. The choices of restaurants and cafes were endless along the beach, as well as the side streets.

A little bit grubby :(. We had limited time in Sydney and the day we took the ferry to Manly beach was a cool and overcast so, in fairness, maybe that shed a slightly different light on the place but we honestly couldn't see what all the fuss was about.Manly beach was deserted and, i'm sorry to say, it just looked tried and a bit grubby. There was even a sign warning about sewage in the sea when he tide is high (which didn't exactly tempt me to go for a dip).As others have said, the concessions are quite a walk from the beach itself and we did find a nice cafe for some fish 'n' chips which was pretty much the highlight of our trip.If i'm fortunate enough to visit sydney again, i'll be giving this place a miss.

Marvellous Manly. This a great trip. Take the ferry for a goo 40 min crossing drinking in Sydney harbour and then arrive a Marvellous Manly. Worthwhile. Its a little township on a beautiful beach with wonderful walks and great surf all the shop owners are so friendly.

great for surf watching. could sit on this beach for hours watching all the surfers! the beach is very clean and has water stations all along the beach which is super handy! only 5 mins from the manly ferry too
Nice beach typically Australian. Really, what there not to like. Beautifully sunny day, clean beach, perfect waves and warm. People were extremely friendly and definately worth a visit

Beach is huge, concessions are not very close. Unlike Bondi, the concessions are located a bit of a walk from Manly Beach. The main area for concessions are on the road connecting the ferry to the beach. It's a decent beach for sunning, swimming and surfing. However, if you can only see one beach in Sydney, definitely go to Bondi, which is better developed and has a better vibe to it.

Very tired looking. Manly beach & the surrounding shopping mall/streets really need a major clean-up. Yes, there are interesting cafes & restaurants but there are many areas much better. Night time is questionable & I felt decidedly unsafe as the area changed from a sunny pleasant spot to a horrible drunken hangout for louts & idiots.

Definitely worth the visit. I am not a beach person AT ALL but I recommend going to visit Manly. You don't even have to go in the water but it's a nice place to walk around and relax. We took the ferry from Sydney (included in our transport pass but can be bought separately for about 7 dollars I think) and stayed for the afternoon. The main street is Il Corso and it has your typical tourist souvenir shops and restaurants. Our guide book said to avoid buying food on this street since it was usually mediocre and expensive. So we managed to find a bakery on the adjacent street (31 Sydney Road) that sold a lot of appetizing things (sandwiches, pizza, etc) for not too much. We found a nearby bench and had a nice lunch in the shade. We then made our way toward Shelly beach, very close by. Overall, a very pretty location. Water was warm and the sun was beaming. Only mishap was almost stepping on a dead fish on the sand...

liked it. the beach is standard for Austrlaian beaches, lots of fine sand, clear blue water and on the day that we went, clear blue skies as well. There is pleanty to do nearby, shopping for souvenirs, plenty of restaurants, and the general hullabloo of tourists from many lands. It is well worth a visit.
Looks tired. Sahme such an iconic landmark looks like it needs a good clean
Lovely. Pretty beach, really different as fir trees grow around the beach--lots of activities and things to do in the area, great for families

Iconic and fabulous!. Manly Beach never changes - except for the old Manly Hospital model being removed! I love the trees that define the area, the terrific restaurants across the road, and the fact that it's within walking distance to the ferry, down the Corso.
Must see when in Sydney. Great beach and harbour well worth the ferry trip to visit
Manly Beach is nice, but Bondi is the best!. If you want the beach, the shops and the tourist...Manly is best option. If you want an incredible, incredible beach go to Bondi!
The relaxing beach community. Just a laid back beach community, a short ferry ride from Circular Quay, with a spacious walkway to a beautiful beach. Come relax!
A clear white sandy beach. We loved this beach, very clean white sand, and facilities nearby

Wow what a place - could live there. Our son recommended we visit here and we were so glad we did. An easy ferry trip from Circular Quay. Fab beach with good surf. Lots of shops and snack bars. A really chilled place. We loved everything about the place. We will return.

Beautiful!. First of all, to get there, you travel by ferry and admire fabulous views of Sydney harbour, Opera House and CBD. When you get to the beach, you will be surprised how many people surf there, exercise in the park or just chill out. It is a wonderful place to relax and have a drink/food in one of pubs or restaurants.
