A bit touristy. Swimming here is a bit variable, with the surf often quite flat. The foreshore is lines with expensive cafes and the shops on the Corso are generally pretty tacky. It's time for an update. The ferry ride to get there is great!

World-Class Surf Beach PLUS one of the World's largest natural harbours, in one big offering.... Just a 15 min Fast Ferry ride f. Manly offers a relaxed, cosmopolitan, seaside ambiance, just 15 mins from Sydney's CBD. The locals are always out taking advantage of the many delights on offer, so be sure to make yourself known to them and ask for their latest tips on what you should see and do. Manly is very safe, so be sure to walk 'off the beaten track' and discover the countless shops, cafes and seaside bars. In short, there is a very good reason that Manly is known around the world as being "Seven miles from Sydney and a thousand miles from care".
Manly rocks!. Manly is one of the most magic urban locations. Gets little press compared with more famous Bondi but definitely preferable to its more glitzy rival

Great way to spend the day!. Great ferry ride from Sydney. We found this gem on our last full day of vacation. Our group all agreed it was our favorite day. Enjoyed the beach & restaurants. Great food, beautiful scenery, friendly locals. Gorgeous beach. We saw lifeguards directing the crowd. They were very much aware of safety by all. Great place to take the kids or just have a romantic couple's stroll. We hope to get back for another visit some day!

Beautiful Beach, Great Kebabs!. Manly beach is perfect way to spend an afternoon by the water in Sydney. Take the ferry there, walk over to the beach, grab a super tasty kebab on the way, and spend some quality relaxing time on the sand.

just great. We had a great day on the beach. One son paddled in the sea, another dug a hole in the sand. It is well organised, with regular announcements from the life guards, and flagged areas for swimming. Loved it.

Jumping off point for the Manly Ferry. Manly Beach is another surfers' beach. The village of Manly adjacent to the beach is charming, although lined with souvenir shops - too many of them all carrying the same things. Our purpose of going to Manly was to catch the Manly Ferry to Sydney Harbour - a MUST DO!!
A great urban beach.... Sydney's beaches right near the city are amazingly clean and beautiful. Just a ferry ride away from the main attractions.
Nice beach. Right near the Many ferry terminal it's easy to get to and the sand is clean. Lots of shops nearby too.

A must-see when you visit Sydney. Take a very relaxing and scenic ferry trip to Manly from the Quay....plenty of great lunch options and a swim on the famous beach make for a great half or full day out.

it feels like smaller version of Santa Monica and the Promenade. lovely beach. no where near as crowded as bondi so the atmosphere is a lot more relaxing and safer. lovely shops and there is a fish and chip shop right at the beginning of the beach/shopping street, excellent salmon.

A Sydneysider says. Hi The family has lived in Sydney and visited Manly all our lives. Always a delight. Catch the ferry, walk straight ahead to the Main beach. Buildings from late 1800's...shops, eating. Markets on the weekend. On the right of main beach the headland goes around the point to Shelly Beach to the right.(Fairly Bower). At the harbour end where you started,you can also sign into the 16ft skiff club eastern hill opposite the wharf. Short trip up to nth Head by car. Aquarium on the opposite side of cove. Fantastic. You'll love it.
Super. À faire en ferry. You see thé city from thé other side of thé Town.

Just across the harbour. This is one of the most fascinating beach areas in Australia. The walk from the Ferry Terminal to the beach is really interesting - many unusual shops. The beach itself is beautiful - soft clean sand surrounded by multi-coloured sandstone cliffs. The Manly Wharf Hotel Restaurant is wonderful for a relaxed lunch or evening meal. There are many places that we have eaten at in Manly - just log onto any site "Manly+eating" and you will be overwhelmed with the choice- better still just roam and discover. I would not recommend going to Manly when the weather is wild on the ferry unless you are OK with rough seas, Some friends love it when it is wild as they say its part of the experience- upto you!

Manly is lovely. Love the ferry trip there and back... There are a couple of pubs near the surf beach which serve good, reasonably priced food, no need of hungry jacks here. Adriano Zumbo has an outlet just off the Corso, a delicious treat if you feel like it. Movenpick has the nicest ice creams, try the rhubarb, it is divine. Lovely just to sit on one of the benches facing the surf beach and watch the world go by with a takeaway coffee or an ice cream on a nice day. A great place to take the kids, or even a solo trip....

Beach Therapy at its Finest. If you enjoy beach culture and what any beach has to offer this is the place for you. Beautiful scenery, warm water with great waves, lots of shopping and places to eat, and best of all the most interesting people to meet and talk to.
Holiday Down Under. Went there and had lunch the beach is even better than Bondi Beach for surfing.
Loved this beach town!. Much less crowded than Bondi and loved the small town feel!

This is Paradise!. I wish I could stay longer. I've been in many beaches, in Hawaii, in Brazil, Caribbean... Manly has something special, maybe the calm and clear water, maybe that pool alongside the ocean, maybe the walk between the ferry and the beach.

Good beach!!!. It is a nice beach and able to spend sometime. Mostly this beach is suitable for Adults to play volleyball and other activities. Kids have space to do their activities but good for adults. Plenty of restaurants in the Manly Corsa. To reach manly beach then take a ferry from Circular quay. If you go by car then don't miss the North head which you can see the entire Sydney CBD and especially on the night view is beautiful.

Ferry nice. Almost free (well not expensive) the Manly high speed Cat takes around 20mins from Circular Quay to get to Manly, A short walk across the isthmus will take you to Manly beach, a nice sandy stretch with surfer dudes doing there thing. Be sure to walk down the Corsa on the way back to the ferry for food, beverage and shopping opportunities all with a very Aussie / Mediterranean feel
One of the best beaches we have been on. We travelled a lot in Australia, and we decided it was probably the best Beach of them all
Manly for lunch. Busy busy beach, mostly from day trippers. Best part of going to Manly Beach is the ferry trip across!

Manly Food Co-Op. Like any place that wears its ideals on its sleeve, a Food Co-op can evoke rage, admiration and all the emotions in between. Est. in 1998, the Co-op, with about thou-zillion members who can enjoy savings of up to 40 percent on groceries, is one-of-a-kind, located in a place where Captain Arthur Philip once remarked, "Their confidence and manly behaviour made me give the name of Manly Cove to this place", referring to the local Guringai people he found living in the area.The tribe at the Co-op are voluntary, unpaid, eclectic-transient mix of members which draws out a bushel of opinions. People off the street (future members) are welcome to shop without joining but pay a slight mark-up for items.What could be described something between an earth-crunchy food haven and a communist-style storage pantry facility, with bins, jars & bottles all around...Enter, welcome to the Co-op. Note to self: wash your hands first. Sink – soap – hand towels provided on entering.Most of the Co-op goods are aimed to ideals of chemical free, biodynamic, focus on local sourcing, ethical production and non-packaging. Co-op encourages self-serve in the quantity you want using various sized clean glass containers you can weigh at the entrance, mark it up and the difference is calculated when you check out. Brown paper bags supplied incur a cost at the checkout. Bargain: White Vinegar , sheap as cheeps (Kiwi accent – cheap shot)The rest of the Co-op I’ll leave for you to discover. If you’re thinking of volunteering, (i.e. helping out through marketing & website, finance & ordering, cleaning, stock taking, working in the shop, literally anything you can think of.) try and test yourself to get past the trouble outweighing the advantages of volunteering and careful not to over commit your time, energy and resources.For me, no amount of spirulina (I currently dislike equally along with coriander) will stop me visiting a local food co-op.OPEN Tuesday – Sunday 10am-3pm Closed Monday21B Whistler Street, MANLYwww.manlyfoodcoop.org

What a great beach in the city!!!. Firstly, you get there on the manly ferrie from circular quay which is a beautiful trip in of itself. Then it's a short walk (4 mins) to one of the best surf beaches you could hope for so close to town (bondi and cogee are great too). You can travel the world looking for great beaches and some are like heaven....but never this clean whilst only a hop skip and jump from a major city. And warm enough to swim in the middle of autumn.!! Clearly I love it and so did my daughter. We went for a fun school holiday away from Melbourne where the water is warmer.
Beautiful beach. This beach was beautiful as was the promenade and area surrounding

Pine Trees Along the Beach. So you have a shade! Manly Beach is easy to reach. Swimming in the ocean requires additional precautions against the sharks, stingrays and jellyfish. Make sure you swim within the flags and the nets.

Manly. I took some visitors over to Manly to show them a different aspect of Sydney. Still very beautiful....nothing too much has changed. Nice walk through the town. Many surf stores and many restaurants. Very casual atmosphere and lovely coastal views all around. Better atmosphere than Bondi Beach. Well worth it to spend a day here and go to Shelly Beach for lunch or a drink which is just on the other side of the peninsula, if you have the time. Shelly is a very sheltered quiet beach if you don't come on a weekend. The restaurant, which is on the beach, is very popular so try not to come on a weekend.
Great beach. This is a really beautiful beach. Great surf and very clean.
Fantastic Beach. Lovely long beach, walked along the waters edge. Surf school on beach.

West or East or South from Ferry - all amazing. Step off the Ferry and A) Head West for a quiet river beach with a tree lined surround, at the end is a great water slide park for kids and a surf club with ocasional glimpses of local swimming legends.B) head forwards then right into the main shopping/restaurant strip into the main surf beach. Awesome.C) head straight right (East) for fabulous restaurant, or go to B) then head south on the boardwalk to a beautiful inlet for truly scenic delight, bodysurfing and cafe. Bill Bryson details his visit here in his book about Australia. Its not that scary! You might also see the Tony Abbott ( the opposition leader) there in his red speedos!

Great beach for doing whatever you like. We appreciated the seats in the shade where we could sit and watch all the energetic people doing whatever they wanted to.Very clean and lots of cafes and places to eat.
lovely. some nice places to eat - had a lovely walk from the beach to the shopping area - good cheap supermarket nearby too :)

Beautiful!. The beach itself is so beautiful and it spans for ages. There are great shops to eat and go shopping, like ben and jerry's and copenhagen. There are great little stores that sell handmade antiques or quirky jewellery which is fabulous!
Great beach!. Great restaurants along the beach. Short and easy walk from the ferry terminal.
Perfect beach stop. To sit here with a milkshake and enjoy the day was great. School kids working out, free water, shops nearby. Sand, sunshine, sea and not too overcrowded such as Bondi.
Relaxing. Manly beach is a great beach with plenty of people still swimming in April. The atmosphere is relaxing and the waves are great for those that surf or just want to have fun in the water.

Surfing and sand, food and fun. The stroll from the ferry up the hill and down ageing to Manly beach was perfect, not too short and not too steep. The beach then opens up and stretches away on both sides, where surfers abound. Those less sportive can stroll the long esplanade, take lunch in the many cafes and enjoy the sea air whilst perusing the other visitors. Very relaxing or very active; the choice is yours.

Perfect Sunday Plan.. Do you want to do some early exercise? Or maybe just breakfast while watching people pass? Oh, did you have a late night out? What about brunch before getting some sun? Mainly Beach is a great place to spend your Sundays while in Sydney. People is gorgeous, restaurants and pubs are fantastic and food is awesome almost everywhere. Plus, you get to come by ferry and enjoy the sights.

Nice big surf beach. Can't say how good the surfing was as I don't surf but there were a LOT of surfers in the water when I visited on a Sunday. Not a lot of space to swim that day as the rip current was strong. However, lots of beach to lie on/ play on/ walk/jog on; Plenty of snacks and shopping as well. You couldn't go 100 feet without running into an ice cream shop.
Clean. Manly beach was very clean and pretty I'd go again in a flash

Different beach. Not as popular as Bondi Beach and a bit harder probably to get there, it's a different beach but quite big. Seems people tend to be gathered near the ferry dropoff point rather than a bit farther off.
All you want. I am sure this is one of the best Sydney beaches. Speakes for itself.
Beautiful!. A crowded beach especially on nice weekend/holidays, but it's beautiful and there are lots of restaurants, cafes, stores and people watching. Must visit!
Go Kayaking!. Get a Kayak and go explore around the coast, there's a whole bunch of secluded beaches that make you feel like you're completely isolated. It's pretty spectacular.

Very nice beach. a lot of restaurant are arround
a lot of shops and you can really have a nice day there

Great slice of Australian beach life. If you have a few days in Sydney and you wake up one day and it's sparkling blue sky, jump on the ferry from Circular Quay from the City and head to Manly. You won't regret it, there are some fantastic cafes, surf shops, lots of sand and ice cream. Walk along the Esplanade to Cabbage Tree Bay and watch the snorklers and scuba divers gazing into azure waters. You will feel a whole other side of Sydney life in Manly.
Surf beach on North, Harbourside on South. Popular beach and very pretty. Much better than Bondi. It is not recommended to swim on the harbourside beach as it does not get flushed out well.
Fabulous. On a sunny day, it's to die for, so much going on, fantastic beach, buskers, families picknicking, everyone ,just hanging out, so casual, yet soo close to a major city. A real escape
Pleasant, laid back on a week day. lots of great eateries and not the rush rush rush of other areas in Sydney we visited. Felt a bit more natural and not as contrived as Bondi.

Great beach. The beach at Manley is beautiful and surprisingly well organised as well. Apart from the great standard surf, we were able to hire an umbrella and deck chairs (that took me back to my childhood) also. The lifeguards are well organised and are patched into the sound system along the beach to ensure people do not forget how strong the rip tide can be on the majority of Austalia's Pacific facing beaches. This was a great experience and a beach I would revisit again and again. If you want to sit and watch the the world go by, there are plenty of restaurants along the promenade and Los of water fountains and sheltered seating and trees along the promenade if you want to escape the sun for a while. I can see why this place is popular with visitors and people from Syndney. I would definitely visit again and again, in fact I will consider staying in Manley on my next visit to Sydney.
Scenic walk to Shelly Beach. The walk from Manly and Shelly is best. Even better if you snorkel all the way to Shelly!

Best of both worlds. Having the quiet harbour one side, walking through the Corso to the surf breach the other, it is just divine. Going early in the day would be better with less crowds just sitting quietly and enjoying the scenery is great, hiring a surfboard and getting into it even better
Beautiful Area. Took the ferry to Manley and did the hike (about 6 miles) along the coast, through the brush, and then along the cliffs overlooking the ocean - very beautiful!

Sun, sea and surf. Good surfing beach where you can spend the day watching the surfers and the kids in surf school.
Only a short walk through the town from the ferry terminal.

A gorgeous beach. This is a lovely, long ferry ride from Sydney. Manly is one of the prettiest beaches I've visited, and there's a stunning walk from the harbour to the ocean's face. There are some nice beachfront dining spots, and it feels less touristy than Bondi. I wish I'd come here earlier in my business stay- I might have visited every weekend!
great day out. Had a great day with my 11yr old daughter on Manly beach surfing the waves.
Wonderful beach!. Although i went on a rainy day,the beach is clean,clorful,white sands with enough people to be bustling but not crowded. The Corso boardwalk is full of cafes,shops,hostels,etc.

The best fish and chips. We go to Manly for the wonderful ferry ride over and the fish and chip experience as the beach itself does not appeal (but is nice). The fish and chips without a doubt are the best I have found in Sydney - outside of fine dining. Take your pick from the many shop owners, but be sure to visit the ones with the biggest queues as it is worth it. The fish is sooo fresh.The reason it gets a very good rating instead of 5 stars is Manly really is for those who like the water - there isn't much else around except for that and pubs where we went. The main thoroughfare has shops (mainly food places) but it is besieged with seagulls so isn't a comfortable spot to rest up and eat! The ferry is the stock standard commuter ferry which we found cheap and a really nice trip. There is plenty of opportunity for great photos on the way to Manly and this is just as good as taking one of the cruise vessels.
Manly. Lovely beach knocks spots of Bondi its clean plenty of places to sit on the grass if you dont want to get covered in sand, nice walk around the side by the surf school

Ferry so-so - trip fantastic!. Most of the ferries are so old you wonder if they are safe! But maybe that's part of the charm. It IS the only way to do your Manly visit - far better and cheaper than taking the hydrofoil or the long way round by road. You get to view the best harbour in the world from the water, fell the wind in your hair, and maybe get a little seasick if the water's choppy crossing the heads.
Manly Beach is as good as Bondi. Beautiful sandy beach that is large enough that even busy days don't feel crowded. Lots of restaurants nearby to choose from when hunger strikes.
See this before bothering with Bondi. really nice Ferry ride, walk through manly, and then a great beach, with superb walks in all directions. We had a great day out.

Delightful area. A short ferry ride from the Harbour lands you in Manley, a delightful beach front "suburb" with a beautiful beach, a promenade, and loaded with many shops and restaurants. It was nice to get away from the hubub of the city to find this little jewel just a short ferry ride away!
Manly Beach. I'm not a beach bum so not a good choice to ask but, this was informative and the sand was beautiful and on a clear day the view was amazing.
Amazing place. Amazing beach, sights and restaurants. Manly Ferry is fantastic.

What a fun and interesting place!. I took the ferry over and spent a day....I saw everything from Buskers, to fun things for kids to do, and a multitude of shops for the people like me who like trinkets and authentic souvenirs alike. It was a very hot day when I was there so be prepared with water and cash for a coffee stop!

Great beach!. Loved Manly Beach! It wasn't too crowded when I went on a Sunday. The wind and water were cool and refreshing. I enjoyed just sitting on the sand and watching surfers and other people on the beach. Lovely spot for photographers too! Then after you tire of the beach, you can spent time shopping or eating in the shops and restaurants of Corso
Food heaven. Great pub meal overlooking the beach and well priced.
Cute shopping area!. A nice day trip, go by ferry in Sydney a 20 minute ride thru the harbor, beautiful views! Nice restaurants and shops, great sandy beaches where you can sit and watch the surfers.
Fun ferry ride. This is a very cool town. A "must see" when in Sydney

Clear beach, white sand and the great sights. Manly beach is a great sight of the Sydney beaches. The beautiful white sandy beach stretching over a vast length, the activity on a hot summer day, with crowds of people walking the promenade, the beach, or bathing in the surf, and the amazing trees along the length of a city beach, all add to its pleasing allure.Seeing the grommets practicing their surf patrol, or the true activity of a surf contest, with the paddle boards, swimming and beach run, gives Manly Beach it's best features. The close proximity of the shopping mall, the Steyne Bar for a refreshment or meal, but the overall view, the fresh salty sea water, and the variety of people enjoying the warmth of a summers day at the beach, all supports a visit to Manly Beach.
Best Fish and Chips. Been to Manly many times over the years, went with my in-laws from Scotland and they said that they had the best fish and chips ever.

Great beach. Went to a family wedding and stayed a few days just off the Corso. Went to Manly beach several times and it has certainly been cleaned up and very well presented compared to when I was a teenager. The beach was very clean and well patrolled. There was only a small strip where the flags were compared to the large length of the beach! The Lifesavers kept announcements up regarding the rips which were in the area which kept everyone safe. There are heaps of little cafe's and restaurants and bars to eat at along the way. There is also umbrellas for hire $10 for three hours - quite expensive compared to where I usually holiday in SEA. Overall very good and a pleasant surprise.

Beautiful Beach Town with Something for Everyone. Manly Beach is a beautiful beach community just outside the city. It is easily accessed via Ferry at Circular Quay ($7AU each way). There is something for everyone in the town of Manly. Shopping, restaurants, pubs, hiking, surfing, people watching, etc... It is a favorite beach of the locals in Sydney and can become quite crowded on a nice day. Definitely worth visiting.
surf dude paradise. exactly what you imagine an ozzie beach to look like - blue sky, crashing surf, bronzed life guards

Worth the walk to Shelly Beach... manly is a lovely beach but usually over crowded, there is a long walk way down to a little beach called shelley beach where there is great snorkeling and bbq facilities. really worth the walk

A beautiful beach. Nothing prepares you for the experience when walking down The Corso fron the Manly Ferry to Manly beach. To see the great expanse of water is amazing. There is a promenade walk along the beach and many cafes there as well as in the Corso. A visit is worthwhile.

great surf beach. If you come to Sydney, you have to go to Manly, even just for the ferry ride. Feels like a vacation spot over there, despite the proximity to the city. We took surf lessons at the Manly Surf school which I would recommend as well.
Great sight. Even better than we imagined.We were lucky as the Australian Open Surfing Championship was taking place when we were there. Beach very clean and well staffed

Nice for Surfing. Was getting there by ferry from Circular Quay taking us around 30 minutes to get there. The weather was a bit cold, A lot of people compare to Hyams Beach (Jervis Bay). I like watching people surfing walking around and people are so friendly. Lot of stores and restaurants.

Charming beach!. No trip to Sydney should be complete without a visit to Manly Beach, only a 30-minute ferry trip from Circular Quay in the centre of Sydney. Manly Beach is pleasant and very good for surfing. You can also rent a bike there, go rollerskating or enjoy a barbecie or a meal at one of its many restaurants. Really worth visiting.
fish and chips at the beach. Great fish and chips at the beach - gorgeous day - Kelly Slater - what more could you ask for? Good surf...

SURF'S UP!. I caught the ferry from the city to Manly.. pleasant ride. When I arrived at the beach I instantly ran into the waves.. it was awesome and could not fault it!! (except that dunk I had!! :) ) After a few hours I headed to a nearby Organic Cafe' for a good lunch and then back home.. wonderful day out in Sydney!

A spectacular beach plus outstanding walks. We visited Manly in March and also stayed several nights around Christmas and New Year. Manyly beach is a Sydney must. Either stroll to the beach from your accommodation in Manly or from one of the most pcituresque and enjoyable ferry trips in the world originating from Circular Quay. The beach is terrific and the waves are loads of fun. If you want more calm waters, walk south along Manly Beach to the shore path to Shelly Beach. Manly Beach is also the start of a great 1.5-2 h walk to the North Head. The walk includes great views of the Pacific, bush track, a war memorial area closer to the Head and that glorious view from the North Head itself. The return to Manly Beach via Manly cove and the corso is a pleasant way to end.
Meh...nly. Dirty, rubbish everywhere, syringe-laden beaches, overpriced food and dying trees and overcrowded. Avoid if at all possible.

The place to be outside of sydney. Manly beach is a beautiful beach lined with nice restaurants and bars, i suggest rather than staying in sydney you rent an apartment in manly its the perfect spot for beach lovers with a great shopping district, all your aussie brand names line that beach, its also a great spot to learn how to surf. Theres a surf school on the beach with very friendly instructors, its the safest beach i went to in the sydney area, with lifeguards during the day beach volleyball and beautiful walking paths that line the coast. If your not a beach lover the shopping district is beautiful all your brand name stores, ice cream shops serving the very best and freshest ice creams. The manly ferry can take you anywhere you need to go in Sydney and the ferry system is much faster than driving, if you enjoy skiing and snowboarding the blue mountains are 45 minutes outside of sydney where u can enjoy hitting the slopes in a t-shirt and shorts. Manly is the ultimate destination in Sydney i prefered its beach over all the famous beaches including bondi beach. Also for the party in you just off the manly ferry are some tremendous outdoor bars and clubs take in the sights with a good drink overlooking the beautiful harbours of Sydney, guaranteed you wont regret a moment, and you'll never want to leave.
Lovely !!. Great place - we were advised to visit Manly rather than Bondi - less commercialised..lovely beach and wonderful atmosphere.

Iconic and easy to get to. take the Ferry from Circular Quay and walk through the Corso to see this great beach. Then walk along to the South for the foot path walk around to little Shelley Beach. from there you can take a great photo back towards Manly.

Awesome event in February - worth planning a trip around!. There's a huge annual event (amongst many other) held in Manly in Feb.Surf, Skate, Street and Music.8 days of free entertainment with hundreds of thousands of people visiting.Youth orientated - but something for everyone.It's worth visiting at this time, but you will need to book accomodation well in advance!! Otherwise, take the trip over on the ferry to enjoy for a day!There was a massive skate bowl shipped in from the USA on the beach with a national competition.The surfing event featured Occy, Parko, Taj etcMusic was a large stage on the beach with The Living End and Sneaky Sound System.All FREE and insane! The place pumped all day, and all night, with the last weekend the biggest!Perfect for the kids who could get up close and personal with their heros! Generally crowd was 15-35 year old.See the photos - AMAZING!
my home. it is a beautiful beach with life guards during swimming hours.Safe and a lot of fun.Plenty of restaurants and night clubs.
Very busy... ..but on a fine day a lovely place to spend a couple of hours in the sun - and then a nice lunch at one of the 'locals'
FANTASTIC. Relaxed, chilled, beautiful and typically Aussie. Well worth the ferry journey for the fabulous views of Sydney Harbour.

Just Lovely.. Sand, palm trees, fish and chips. It's a lovely, atmospheric beach. It's famous, but it's still full of Aussie atmosphere. See the kids learning to surf and training to be lifeguards. See the families enjoying a day at the beach. Build a sand castle. Relax! Definitely worth the ferry ride from the city to experience this lovely place.
Ferry to Manly. Trip over, walk the mall, a fish meal, the Aquarium - a wonderful day!

Great Ferry Ride and lovely beach town. You can't find finer views of Sydney Bridge and Opera House than the ferry boat to manly. We rode out in daylight and returned in the dark. Amazing views. And we stayed in Manly for dinner, which was a bonus.
Beautifull. So bad that the day we spent there, swimming was not allowed because of heavy waves and strong currents...

Manly beach and manly area one of best holiday places in world. Manly beach stretching almost 2 k is magnificant. It is well patrolled by lifesavers and safest swimming areas clearly indicated leaving other areas for board riders. white sands and Norfolk pines on the esplanade present a welcoming sight. The area has numerous well priced small restaurants and take away. the walk way around to Shelly Beach is one of the nicest and most picturesque walks I have had the pelasure to do. We close to live in the area moving from Canada and have never regreated it. when we take visitors they are overwhelmed by the sheer beauty. Easy access via the ferry from the city again an inexpensive way to see the glorious harbour rather than an expensive tour.

Try the scenic walk, too!. The scenic coastal walk is very enjoyable - along Manly Bay and through parts of town. I enjoyed this walk and not too many people were on the trail on a Sunday morning. Manly Beach itself was very clean and enjoyable. Lots of surfers. I did not do any water activities, but walked around the beach and over to the adjacent beach and enjoyed the scenery. The walk along the Corso did not yield any impressive eateries, but many conveniences were offered (like beverages, sunscreen, hats, etc.) if needed and one side of the pedestrian walkway was always in the shade, which was nice on a hot, sunny day.
A great place to stop and unwind for a while. Beautiful beach, great sand and swimming... A short walk from the Manly Ferry, and surrounded by great places to eat or buy souvenirs
Very clean beach area with lots going on. Nice to visit, the ferry journey lets you see all of the bay sights. Lots of restaurants / bars etc but not the cheapest to eat / drink out

Manly adventure. We left Sydney to stay at Manly for a few days and are so happy we did. The beach was beautiful and the climate more relaxing. There are plenty of nice restaurants and shops. If you want some exercise, try the Spit to Manly coastal walk. It is 10K over some interesting terrain. The Aussie's called it a "gentle to moderate" walk. I'm a walker and would have labeled it more difficult than that, but the scenery is not to be missed!

Cowabunga. Cool beach at the end of best ferry ride in Sydney Harbor. Beach is right there next to town center. Go over for lunch and a beer and stroll around, or spend the day at the beach. Lots of surfers.

Not that great.. Coming from the Santa Cruz, CA area, we have high expectations for a surf beach. In December it was very windy and there weren't many surfers. It was Australia summer, but it was cold and not comfortable to sit on the beach. Limited shopping experience. Every store had the same T-shirts and hats. A friend of mine who lived in Sydney for a short time loved Manly Beach, so maybe it was just a bad time of season.

A lovely beach with something for everyone. I went to Manly Beach for a few hours before I had to leave to get my flight in the afternoon.It was lovely weather and the ferry out from Circular Quay cost us about 14 AUD I think. The ferry ride itself is very enjoyable. Manly is lovely and has plenty of shops and places to eat. The beach is fantastic so it's great to sit around there, go for a swim, or there are some lovely walks you can do.
Magnificent Manly. This beach was absolutely beautiful and also quite packed the day we chose to visit. Since there is a riptide here, there are limited areas designated for safe swimming.

Manly Pier Hotel - don't miss it!. When you catch the ferry to Manly stop at the Manly Pier Hotel. You'll see it off to your right. It has a wonderful atmosphere and you can get a drink at normal pub prices and a great pub meal. There is an excellent laid back ambience and wonderful views. If you just want a drink there are dozens of restaurants within a 5 min walk.
Excellent Beach and Ferry Ride. A definite visit. Excellent and cheap ferry ride from circular quay. Once their remember to try the ice creams :)
beach. A busy eatery and plenty to do along the waterfront. A well developed environment.

Must be one of the worlds great beaches. Manly beach offers just about everything a visitor could want. Beautiful white sand, safe swimming, well patrolled by lifesavers; a lovely shaded concourse and crowds of happy people. Add to this a great range and choice of eating places and the fascination of the walk on the Corso to the Ferry Terminal or the one to Shelly Beach. It's a pleasure and a joy to watch and hear so many tourists from all around the world wandering the concourse and enjoying this beautiful pplace.
excellent day at the beach. we loved manly beach ther was a sand artist weh really liked the art work and taking a swim was good the resturant across from the beach had good fish & chips Cool!
Crowded Manly Beach. I will admit, we were there in the middle of February, so it was hot but the beacj was incredibly crowded. There were locker available so that was a plus.
wonderful. what a delight, get off ferry on harbour side and its lake like, walk up the street to the other side and hey presto a mini surfers paradise !

Beautiful Beach. Honestly i have never been to Manly before, just on the day i had mix feelings of whether i should or should not go but i did ended up going. I went to Manly beach by ferry. The ferry trip was enjoyable but crowed. the beach in Manly is so beautiful. the clear blue water and the sand dunes make this beach one of the most beautiful beach i have ever seen. I went on a hot summer day and there was nothing else i would rather do than looking out at the beach and the horizon. Overall, it is a happy place to visit and just chill out with ur friends and family.

Best of all the beaches. I do think Manly beach is the best of all the famous beaches.It is easy to get to by using the Manly ferry and there is alot to doand see there besides the beach. Lots of good places to eat too.Nice short trip there from the city of Sydney. Enjoyed the ferry ride.
As Americans, it was to American. Kind of like going to Daytona beach. Touristy and plastic. I suppose I was expecting a less corny experience.
Surfing Excellence. Great beach for surfing watching or a stroll along the promenade.

Short trip from downtown Sydney to Manly Beach. While we weren't able to get to the highly popular Bondi Beach while staying in Sydney, we did hop on the Manly ferry, took the 15 minute stroll through town to enjoy the Manly Beach. Even in the late afternoon, there were still tons of people out with the wonderful weather that day.

Manly your the place I love. Manly is such a beautiful place, from the wharf, to the corso and market stalls, always live music and events going on, including the Australian open of surfing.The beaches are stunning and less touristy than Bondi, beautiful location

It's the ocean!. It's the ocean. There's nothing like a refreshing and healing dip in the salty ocean water. Lots of activity on the beach--volleyball, surf lifesaving, walking, swimming, coffee shops. Have I mentioned it's the ocean?
Loved it. Great beach lovely weather all only from 30mins ferry from Sydney great area n shops with happy ppl
Our favourite Place. Lovely town, beautiful beaches, nice restaurants and cafes, brewery, scenic long walks, pretty houses - what more can I say

Cockatoos by the Beach. We were out for an early morning walk, deciding to walk from Freshwater Beach to Manly. We were wow'd by beauty of this expanse of beach lined by pine trees and separated by a seawall/walkway that stretched from one end to the other. Early morning joggers and surfers were heading out for their pre-work day exercise. As Canucks leaving our winter behind, we were envious of them. We picked up our pace. Along the way, we were awestruck by the beauty of about 20 large Cockatoos under the shade of the trees. People walked by like it was nothing. There we were, in awe of these majestic birds - and so many of them in one place. Surely, this couldn't be an every day event? We soaked in this sight - alone, we realized we didn't bring our camera.
Excellent family beach. Nice beach for all ages with plenty of cafe's and restaurants nearby. Ride on the ferry to Manly - great view of the bridge and opera house.
Even the trip there is good.. Get the Manly Ferry from Circular Quay, stroll through the shops, have a coffee and then you end up at the beach. Always lots going on here.

Between the Flags. We visited Manly Beach on Australia Day so it had a tremendous atmosphere with people dressed up in outfits made from the Australian Flag. What impressed us most was that although there was great merry making we saw no drunkeness. The beach is a no smoking zone and was therefore very clean. It was the first time I understood the significance of swimming between the flags. The swimmers swim in a designated area leaving the surfers outside the flags. The lifeguards were very attentive assuring safety at all times.

A popular Northern Sydney icon. You could be forgiven for thinking you were at a beach overseas when visiting Manly. On our last visit we encountered quite a number of young people from Brazil and we were often mistaken for being a fellow South American given the girls' honey tan. Cosmopolitan in feel and atmosphere, especially if travelling in by ferry or one of the Cats. A short walk from Manly Wharf through the shops lined The Corso, sees you arriving at the steps to Manly Beach. Great shopping, food and atmosphere especially on a weekend with market stalls or music from the pubs and some eateries. Great for a picnic with family and friends or a swim and then a lazy leisurely lunch at one of the eateries across the road from the beach. Accessible from most parts of Sydney by ferry, bus or car.
Best view of Harbour Bridge. There's Luna Park and the best view of the Sydney Harbour Bridge, close up and awesome
Lovely Beach. Lovely sitting in the sun watching the busy beach, families & surfers everywhere. Nice clean beach.Good reasonable eating places.
Great beach for families. Good place for kids to play, shaddy areas too. Bit busy with lots of shops and tourists. Parking difficult at busy times but not impossible.

Beautiful beach!. I really liked Manly Beach. You can't really go wrong...The beach is very clean. Very close to shops and restauarants and just a short walk from the ferry. I liked Manly more than Bondi.
Full on. A great beach, buzzy beautiful and busy. Visited on a surf carnival day, what a sight with so much action. Water great.
Surfing. Great to sit and watch the surfers. Cafes cheaper here than Rocks area as were shops generally.

Where Sydney's wealthy commuters live. It's a buzzing town. Plenty to do. Plenty to see. Great bars and restaurants. But I guess its all about the beach and the ferry into Sydney, that makes this place popular.
Sometimes you feel like you've sneaked into some little seaside gated community for wealthy Australians. But they dont seem to mind

A typical Australian seaside resort.. Great to visit for a day out. When the weather is fine this is the place to go for a safe swim. Fab beach and super gentle sea. Have some chips or a pizza or visit the Aquarium. We love it here.
day trip. really good for a day trip and a stroll around the area. expensive restaurants but awesome views.

Typical beach front. Okay, so if you love beaches and love surfing (Manly just finished hosting the Australian National surfing contest), this is a good place to go. But the famed, "Corso" is really just a well-maintained and broad walk across the isthmus from the pier to the beachfront. Along the way are very nice pubs, local eateries with great seafood to take to the beach with you (watch out for the aggressive gulls!), and a plethora of tourist gift shops.However, getting away from Sydney's high rise buildings and reverberating traffic noise is worth it! Take a stroll from the Manly Cove along the cliffs to Fairlight beach to escape the tourists and the seagulls.

awesome beach, plenty of things to see, eat, do. i love going over to manly, the kids really enjoy it, and there is great walks, the beach is massive and clean, and frankly there is mountains of great places to eat.
Surfs Up. We went to watch the Surf Championships. A great beach, very clean and good facilities.
Pretty beach. Probably my favourite in Sydney. Worth a visit if you are in town with time to spare.
One of the best. Hire a board and make like a pro, golden sand, great shopping, this is life in Aussie.

Shame the sea was too rough. We had a choice to either go to Manly beach or Bondi on the only real hot day before we came home. Manly beach won,We took the ferry which was about 30 mins. Is a large ferry and its very busy, if its gets too full you will have to wait for the next one.We followed everyone through the open air shopping precinct to the main Many beach, where surfers are predominant,The beach is sandy and stretches quite a way.There was also beach parasols and sunbeds for hire for $15 each for the whole day, which is the first time I have ever seen in Australia, Even Surfers paradise dont have beach hire, you have to buy your own parasols and chairs.The downside to this beach was the weather had been quite bad and created dangerous riptides and the lifeguards closed the sea to everyone barring experienced surfers.There is a small beach where the ferries land and I was able to swim for the first time of my holiday, as there was no waves as such.It was very hot 28 degrees and you do need a hat, sunscreen and plenty of water to drink. What the promenade does have which we could with over here, are filtered drinking water fountains that you can fill up water containers or cups to drink.Plenty of shops for either retail therapy or eating, but a bit on the expensive side,
Ice Cream. Get a Ben and Jerry's icecream and sit on the beach, its fantastic

Manly beach is good for wave-play but Manly wharf is perfect for a chilled sunbather.. Loved Manly full stop. Lovely little town, cute little shops and cafes, great Manly beach with good surf weather dependent, can get busy but still enjoyable. We left the beach and re-located to Manly wharf which is just perfect - still waters and chilled out vibe. We rented out Stand up Paddle boards which are stationed right next to the wharf on the smaller side near the boats and it was money well spent - the calm water is perfect for picking up the sport and the rates are really good value. There were 4 of us and we rented 2 for an hour and shared them about...was a brilliant day.
Awesome beach. Big waves and beautiful little area. Have to go here, and lots of good inexpensive shopping to do.
not much to see. no life guards, no surfers, nothing special, disappointing :(

A bit of Eupope in Sydney. Relaxed, lots of pubs, bars and restaurants, nice beach (awesome waves).The locals claim it to be a bit of Europe in Sydney, Í dont know for sure, but its agreable.Strolling down from the ferry to the beach, there are worse ways to spend an afternoon.

Spend some time at the Corso!. We took a Grayline 1/2 day tour to Manly Beach. After the tour, we sat on the beach to watch the surfers and people walking by. We had the best Movenpick (Swiss company) ice cream and great dinner with an ocean view. The corso is a small shopping area filled with surf shops, aboriginal art, ice cream and eateries. It's a MUST do in Sydney.

Not as Good as the Gold Coast. Overall I liked Manly, but its main attraction was the headland where the harbour starts rather than the beach itself. The beach is rather small and very crowded so after living on the Gold Coast it really didn't compare. If you want to experience the best of Australia's coastlines, head away from the cities for a start. My favourite beach of all is Bunbury in Western Australia, even if it is a bit remote for most people.
Lovely. Great Beach, great ferry ride, nothing you will regret at all. Florida atmosphere

Lovely beach :D. We visited Manley during the week and caught the ferry over which was great. The weather wasn't particularly good but we wandered around the shops-staff were helpful and there was a good variety. The beach was very quiet apart from a few surfers, there was good surf, clean sand and a lovely feel to the area. I imagine in summer it's very popular!! We had a lovely meal by the water at a little Mexican place, the food was excellent and it was reasonably priced.

go go go. After a 30 minute ferry ride from Circular Quay, I arrived at famous Manly Beach. It was beautiful and full, on a week day, of happy people wanting to catch some sun rays. It was a quick 10 minute walk to the main beach area which stretched for a while but I didn't feel like walking too much that day and risk getting sunburned by the strong Australian sun so I ducked into like half of the shops along the way, made sure to repeatedly apply sunscreen, and only stayed in the sun for about an hour. If you go in the water, make sure to stay within the flags or else you'll get yelled at and maybe pulled under. Went to the best fish and chips shop half a block off of the beach for some lunch, awesome.

Best beach in the world. Convenient whether staying for a few days or just a day trip by ferry.
The beach is safe, the restaurants wonderful and life can't get
better than relaxing at Manly Beach - try dinner at the Pantry at Manly - wonderful tapas style food and very affordable.

Worth the visit. Lovely property see how the rich live! Good beach lovely walk around to the right. A really lovely bay.
Pretensions restaurant right on the front would not serve 'just' coffee on a wet day (it was empty)

So beautiful and yet so in need of a good loofa. The beach is second to none. Sorry Bondi worshippers, there is something enchanting about the wide, straight, goes on for days appeal of Manly. I love the Esplanade and a casual walk with the family. I love getting an ice cream and walking a snails pace to the wharf to watch the Manly Ferry. I love the "thought" of all the restaurants and bars but in the end there is that certain patchouli smell that you just can't shake.

Magnificent Manly. It's a great day out! Take the ferry from the Circular Quay across the harbour and past the choppy heads to Manly. Stroll through the town centre, soak up the market atmosphere, enjoy an Aussie pub lunch and head on over to the beach for an afternoon of sun, sand and surf. Watch volleyballers practice their moves, walk the rocky path around the headland at the south of the beach and, on the way back to the ferry, choose an exotic ice cream to complete the perfect day.
Pleasant, sunny walk but disappointing surfing this time. If the swells are from the south go to Bondi Beach. If from the north, then Manly Beach does the trick.

Just a busy beach, in my opinion.. Just another beach, in my opinion. There are more beautiful beaches to see in Sydney. Waves and wind were really strong, so doubtful this would be a good swimming beach. Very crowded, and lots of young adults seem to gravitate here.
quiet beach. It's a quieter beach than bondi and has a lots of room. Wasn't really there on a great day but would good back!

Better than Bondi. We stayed with friends who live in an apartment directly opposite the beach so very handy for us to spend a few hours on the beach.We visited Bondi for half a day and it was very busy, I would say I preferred Manly beach to Bondi any day. Less crowded, we had one part of the beach to ourselves one day.Learn to surf with the Manly Surf Club, attempt to swim in the manic ocean or just chill on the beach for the day...worth a visit.The best beach of our visit...bar Whitehaven of course!
Pacific Gem. Lovely beach, great food, shops and good policing, nice palce for a great day out

Great day outing in the sun. Lots of eye candy. It's a 1920s-1930s place, updated to meet the needs of 20 and 30somethings of today, crowded on a Sunday with families. The beach is wide and sandy with surfers and surf boating away from the swim areas. Lots of eye-candy. The local "corsa" is lots of fun with interesting shops and very good bars and coffee shops.
Surfers haven. This is the place to be for a walk to the beach from the ferry. Great place to watch the surfers, spend some time in the ocean, and enjoy a good lunch.

Tourist trap. As many of my precedence fellow writers here watch it, full of backpackers this guys look like they are in Africa tattoos all over, bottles of water hung on the neck, pubs and drunks if you like this, you are on the right place, you could become famous after a Saturday night brawl on the crime section. Just like Bondi avoid at all cost, just read the press it is a competition for brain bashed damaged tourists between Bondi and Manly, I think Bondi is winning, nope I wouldn't go there even if I won a prize.

From the Ferry Wharf on Sydney Harbour you can stroll to Manly Beach and view several other beaches.. Manly is only one the many beaches you can view from here to the north in the distance is Palm Beach.
:). Stunning beach, very clean, with a lovely swimming pool cut into the rocks a little way up the path (to the right of the beach if you are facing the sea). Go here
Beautiful. Not to be missed, it seemed to be more popular than Bondi Beach.

Waste of time. If you want to enjoy beautiful beaches go to the Gold Coast.If you want an atmosphere at the beach try the Eastern Suburbs beaches of Sydney.Manly has nothing going for it, the beach is dirty and the surrounding areas are nothing special.

Touristy, but good beach and excellent restaurants nearby. Touristy, super touristy. Not as bad as Bondi, but would come a close second. While annoying, it is not without merit, Manly is a good beach and has many facilities nearby. The Manly ferry is the best way to get here, alternatives include local buses from across the North Shore, but it does take some time to get through the local roads and traffic. To reach the beach, there is a main walkway lined with restaurants and touristy shops with souvenirs. Along the beach, there are many excellent eateries to choose from, depending on what tickles your fancy. For the touristy experience, Manly is a great day spent at the beach in Sydney.
Spend a day here. Walk the beach. Swim. Grab a meal at a local restaurant (there's lots of them). Learn to surf. Jump in the waves. This is a great beach.

One panorama that must not be missed. Long powder-fine white sandy beach. Relax playing ball sports with other revelers. Restaurants offering varying cuisines and beach view. A 3-5 minute walk from the Manly ferry terminal. No better venue to de-stress and just "be".

Free, Clean, & Very Close to the City. Manly Beach is a short 30 minute water taxi ride from downtown Sydney, and is very much worth the stop. Great beach, with loads fo dining options abound. The water taxi ride is worth it by itself for the great views, and lands a few short blocks from the beach.

tourist packed but still my favourite. its jammed with tourist, and overflows with people during summer, but it is still my favourite beach. the concourse has loads of shops for clothing, souvenirs, food etc...

Manly Beach. It is hard to drive to from the city there is always alot of traffic congestion, but there are ferries frequently from Circular Quay. This is probably what makes Manly so relaxing it's kind of secluded, like you have escaped the hustle and bustle of the city for a beach holiday.

Lovely clean beach away from the city. I am a bondi lass BUT Manly beach is beautiful and well worth a visit or holiday. It is extremely clean, beautiful sand and always busy with things going on to see and do. There are lots of lovely cafes and bars looking out onto the water, and some great shopping to be had in manly. A half hour ferry trip from circular quay gets u here and it's well worth the trip. There is also an express ferry if you need to be in the city quicker.

Marvellous Atmosphere. Right in front of "The Corso" which is most likely Manly's best and busiest shopping street, this beach is stunning yet quite elegant. The high trees all around it give the place a more sofisticated air. An amazing place for jogging, dog walking or simply admiring the sunset.
PARADISE. What more can you ask for? This is the best Sydney beach by far - leaves Bondi for dead!
Beautiful. This is the prettiest beach and with the best fish and chips on the planet, I feel like a kid again here

Great place to spend an afternoon. Took the Ferry up to Manly from Circular Quay. Spent the day lounging in bars on the waterfront and strolling around the Corso and the Waterfront. It is a good way to spend an inexpensive day enjoying the sun and sea that Sydney has to offer.The beach is well patrolled by surf lifesavers and when we were there the sea looked very managable for swimming, with good clear water.

First stop on our trip. The first thing we did when we got to Sydney was hop on a ferry to Manly Beach. Got great views of the harbour and then had a nice day on the corso/beach. There's a whole lot of action on the corso. We parked ourselves on the balcony of the New Brighton bar/restaurant for a lunch and a few pints and peoplewatched for a little while. Then headed down to the beach and relaxed. Nice, clean, active beach.

It has it all. Great restuarants, cafes, people watching, excellent views everywhere with Sydney Harbour one side and Manly surf beach the other side. Access to the Manly Ferry, and Aqurium. Penguins are frequent visitors which is an amazing sight to see in a big city like Sydney.
My home beach. What can I say, it's my local and it's great. Go up to the northern end (Queenscliff) and escape some of the tourist crowds.
Bit packed out for me!. A very touristy beach, crowded like Bondi, but very beautiful! Manly stands out on its own, great restaraunts too!
Try Freshwater. Very touristy and bogan. Water is nice enough but area is tacky and not enough facilities.
Great place to chill out. The perfect beach to spend an hour or a day, with shady spots, sun, surf, showers, shops and more.
better than bondi. manly has every thing for the family along with a perfect beach

Manly Beach - Wow!. Fantastic beach which is just a ferry trip away from the centre of the city (or even shorter by hydrofoil) and it has marvellous restaurants along the waterfront (both beach and harbour sides) and long walks with beautiful views. Must see when visiting Sydney.
Close to the City. Just a ferry away from the city with a beautiful beach and plenty of dining options. Shelly Beach is just a stroll along the promenade as well.

If you enjoy crowds, you will LOVE this place!. I am from Melbourne, Victoria and Manly reminded me of the the look, wind and holiday vibe of Phillip Island but with the snobbish undertones of Brighton. Being summer holidays the entire area was packed, so packed it made Bondi look secluded and quiet!! But overall, it was relaxed, filled with a great variety of shops and eateries. A good day out.

Excellent beach. Easy to get to, ferry ride then 400 yards through corso. Nice clean beach, not too busy on a weekday. Wide promenade with trees offering shade and a host of different style restaurants. Promenade walk extends well beyond the beach for longer exploring walks.

Must do in Sydney. Definitely take a ferry to Manly. The ferry itself is a wonderful experience because you have the perfect view of the harbor, the Opera House and all the surroundings. Once you get to Manly, walk to the other side where the beaches are amazing, grab lunch at a little cafe and spend the day walking and lounging around.
Good location, but known for stealing. Needs better patrolling for stealing and leaving things behind because it's such a busy beach. Extremely beautiful with good shops though.

Great beach. Great for a pleasant afternoon walk. No need to go on the sand if you don't like, there is a path all along the beach. If you love walking, follow the path down to Shelly Beach. There are plenty of nice surprises along the walk and it is an enjoyable walk. There are plenty of water bubblers to fill up you water bottle at Manly Beach, which is great, and also plenty of places to have Fish and Chips.

If you can only do one ferry ride.... Takes you past all the icons and then past the heads. Once you land its just a short walk to the beach past lots of shops and cafes. Take your togs and towel if its a sunny day.

Away from the bustle. Take the slow ferry from Circular Quay rather than the more expensive fast one, not only do you you see more but the excellent value combined ferry/train pass is valid on this trip. Manly is a small resort with excellent coastal walks, expensive houses and plenty of places to eat and drink.
Quintessential Beach Community. Very relaxing place to spend a summer day. Hiking adjacent if you are not a sun-worshipper. Take the ferry from Circular Quay which runs every 30 minutes.
just a ferry trip away. great beach,restaurants,bars & atmosphere,something for everyone..

Manly is Okay. Manly has changed over the years it is looking tired and run down now the best part for us was the ferry harbour trip getting therewhere the ferry docks is a small beach but if you walk through the shopping center to the main beach you are in for a surprise this beach is lovely with golden sand it is busy during the holidays and weekendsManly can be reached by car or Ferry a trip on the ferry and lunch in Manly makes it a really nice day out

Beautiful!. Simply beautiful the day we visited, long stretch of sandy beach with cafes along the way, best thing to do, and we did too, was to have an ice cream while enjoying the view.There were heaps ice cream shops.
Lovely spot..... So much better than other well known beachs in the Sydney area. Good cafe's, pretty safe and secure. Lovely spot, probably one of the best in Sydney.

Went surfing. Kids had a surf lesson while I waited on beach. Beach had been closed the day before due to Jellyfish and it being too rough. Nice enough beach and lifeguards being very careful with people who were still swimming outside the flags.
Not much to see here!. Honestly, there isn't much here although the ferry trip is lovely. Some Amazing views during twilight.
Excellent, mostly. Love Manly, excellent beach, very good restaurants and caffes to make the atmosphere. But for the odd bogan or two, it would be the perfect place.

Must see!. If you haven't been to Manly then it is worth jumping on the ferry and heading over. Only takes 30mins on ferry which is a great trip. The Beach is beautiful, sandy and longer than you expect. There are plenty of people there jogging, swimming or like me strolling along the foreshore. Worth the visit.

Great views, fresh air. Loved our afternoon in Manly. We had a quick pizza as we got off the ferry and it was excellent, brick fired cooking. We the went to the beach area and walked the beautiful paved path and watched the surfers. It is a well kept area and great views.We stopped after our long walk at one of the outdoor seafood cafes for a light bite that was also very good and generous portions.
worth a visit. great waves and lots of coffee shops and kool places 2 shop
Forget Bondi...... Manly's where it's at. A long, uncluttered surf beach with nearby Shelly beach at the south end which is calmer for swimming or paddling.

Very crowded.. The Manly area is a great place to visit, with that wonderful beach atomosphere. However, when we were during the frist week of January, the beach was absolutely packed with people. If your young and single, and wanting to meet other young single people, this would be the place to go. If your a family, or someone who would like room to swim and/or run on the beach without stepping on people, then you should find another beach.

A great beach and day out for a tourist. A great beach and well worth a day out from Sydney across the Harbour on the Manly ferry for any overseas tourist. You combine the beach and a harbour cruise all in one.

Probably my favourite Sydney beach. This well-kept beach is huge, but set up so the public can really enjoy it. The walkways all along, the shaded park beside the beach, the rock pools, the eateries, kayaking, paddleboarding, surfing----I could stay for a month.

Great Beach. There are 2 sides of the beach at Manly. On arrival by ferry there are a few stretches of sand on the bayside where waters are calm and good ares for sun baking or relaxing. A short walk takes you to the open ocean side where you can surf or sun bake but the winds were stronger. Manly has many, many good restaurants and we made a day of vistings this great seaside location.
Yum.. Go on the shoulder season. Walk slowly. Explore the area around the beach.If you have to pick between Bondi and Manly, pick Manly. It totally wins.
Surf and food. This is the beach rather than Bondi...better beach and better food and good walks, interesting shops. And a holiday feel at the end of the Manly Ferry.

a great destination beach!!!. When you get off the ferry you expect to see snow skis or something!!! The path to the beach makes you think you are in Breckenridge or Vail with the shops and such. The beach is good for surfing and about everything else. Be a great Spring Break spot!!!

Lovely. Visited here on the ferry from Circular Quay in Sydney. Ferry trip takes about 20 minutes and you get great views of the harbour. Manly is very pretty and was busy when we were there (Saturday). My second favourite beach near Sydney.

Long pleasant beach. Last time I was there, I also had the chance to watch beach volleyball. Manly's ocean beach is only a short walk along a nice mall from the ferry terminal, and the harbour baths, so you have a choice of surf or flat beach swimming.

The most beautiful beach in Sydney that is easily accessed by public transport. A must see when you visit Sydney is Manly Beach. Catch a ferry from Circular Quay and enjoy the amazing views of Sydney harbor before arriving at a beautiful swimming beach. There are plenty of cafes and fish and chip places and this place has a lovely atmosphere.

Used to be great- was full of litter. We took the kids here to experience what we once considered a great beach, but to our disgust a lot of rubbish was laying around, and too many seagulls. Fish and chips were great!!
better than Bondi!. Great beach, if not overcrowded a little. Head to the north end where its a little quieter.
Beautiful!!!. A short walk from the ferry station, plenty of shops,eat in or take away and an amazing beach.Ther is also a walking tract for those interested.

I found this beach to be very touristy. I went to both Bondi beach and Manly and I definitely preferred Bondi. As soon as you come off the ferry, you see the 'Corso' which is a street full of touristy shops and restaurants, geared at families. It was 5:30 PM and I wanted to rent a bike. When I went to the shop, I was told that it closes at 6PM. In the summer, the sun goes down at 8PM in Sydney so I was surprised. Yes, Bondi beach itself is more for the meat market crowd but the walk from Bondi to Coogee is absolutely stunning and well worth it. I would not go back to Manly if I go to Sydney again.
Beautiful beach and more ..... We went to Manley Beach on the way to the airport and it is a super stop - great shopping and easy to chat with locals
A must see. If your into beaches this is a must see, and is worth the walk up from the ferry to the beach, and have a nice lunch and head back to the city. A large busy beach on warmer days.

A Must see and do in Sydney. At Circular Quay Sydney jump on a Manly Ferry for a wonderful trip across Sydney Harbour to Manly Beach. Manly has a beautiful beach, cafes, restaurants and pubs. There are plenty of scenic walks. Take a lovely walk from Manly to Shelly Beach, walk or drive to North Head for marvelous views of Sydney Harbour. I recommend Manly to tourists and locals as a must do in Sydney. If there is one thing you should do in Sydney please visit Manly.
Manly Beach v Bondi Beach. Manly Beach is lovely and much better than Bondi by far. We had a lovely day on the beach and trip on the Manly ferry
Nice. Not as famous than Bondi so its quieter, really nice place.

A Beach with Character. I much prefer this beach to Bondi as it has more character, and is more interesting. Even walking there from the ferry is interesting, and there are some nice restaurants nestled away along the beach
A must for tourists. Better beaches to the north though has the best atmosphere on the Northern Beaches

Manly, South and North Steyne Beaches.. This is a truly family location and the walk along the esplanade is not to be missed. Try a walk to Shelly Beach on the south of the esplanade and be pleasantly surprised.
Worth a day trip. Take the ferry from Circular Quay and make a day of it in Manly. For me, it is a better beach than Bondi and the town beside it offers more in way of shops/cafes/bars.

Beachin it!. I really like this beach and its easy to get to from the Sydney Harbor. Take a quick ferry and you'll be surrounded by ice cream shops, eateries and a fun beach crowd. Bring some picnic stuff and make a day of it.

Surfs up. Some wonderful cafes,bistros and bars in the area. A lot of surf shops and beach related shopping. The beach is so clean and surfs there all the time even in the rain. Worth a visit for a few hours.
Great position. A beautiful area of the Northern Beaches where you can catch a ferry to Sydney.

The ferry ride is better than the beach. An iconic beach in Sydney only the brave would swim there after a storm - the quality of the water is very questionable. Enjoy the ferry ride and a walk around the village but save the swim for Palm Beach or Bondi

Average Beach. The beach was no way a replacement for missing to go to Bondi Beach with beach almost without much people. But ya all amenities were available at the beach.
Some Indian Tours while booked from India offer going to Manly beach. Please donot replace Bondi with Manly.
Seaside atmosphere. nice walk along the beach, trekking possible on the peninsula, nice view from the ferry

Dont go on new years day. We have been many times on a travels to sydney and have loved each time. In particular the walk to shelly beach and swimming in the marine park of shelly beach is delightful for young and old. BUT dont go on new years eve unless you plan to swim with a million other people and dont need to put your towel down on the sand because you wont find any!

Great Aussie beach. Our family had a quick one hour visit to Manly beach to check it out. On the day we visited it was sunny and plenty of people about. The beach facilities were good but it could do with more toilets and changing rooms. The esplinade was a great walk with plenty of shade and seats to relax on and watch people enjoying themselves. Parking is expensive and driving there is a challenge, so if you're able to, catch public transport; ferry or bus.

Nice beach but drunken people can be a problem. We visited Manly Beach on Jan 2. It was very crowded due to the Xmas holidays. The beach is at the end of an entertainment corso and there lies the problem. The corso has many pubs and there is a strong drinking culture amongst young people. We visited Manly by ferry and you have to walk through this corso to get to the beach. We encountered many drunken people at 2pm in the afternoon both on the corso and at the beach. They can be quite intimidating when you have young children with you. This problem magnifies the later you stay at the beach as the pubs are open all day and night. In order to get back to the ferry you have to navigate through drunk people again. At this time of year the ferries are in great demand so very long queues wait to catch each ferry. Unfortunately alcohol and waiting in line do not mix so we experienced a bit of pushing and shoving as people tried to get onto the ferry. My advice is , if you have young children steer clear of Manly Beach.
manly beach. $16.00 for a return ferry ticket - great value. Nice walk down to the beach. Had a great meal at one of the local pubs. Missed Adriano Zumbo's shop though!

Swim, Surf, Beach Volleyball, eat fish and chips, have an ice cream. Too many things to do from this wonderful beach. I have lost MANY weekends here either doing adventurous things or wining dining and drinking the nights away.A must place to visit if in Sydney
Further to investigate at Manly. Surrounds are dull but walk along to Fairybower and it's very sweet.

Watch the surfers and look out for jellyfish. We went on the Sunday before Christmas. Was fun to just stick your fet in the water, watch the guy making a big sand sculpture, and get to go sushi rolls. Odd to be in the Southern Hemisphere around Christmas as so warm but all decorated for the holidays. Wonderful too.
Great day out. We caught the ferry from Circular Quay, had lunch at the Chinese Restaurant with a great view over the bay and then a few drinks at the hotel. A very enjoyable day,lots of shady trees.
Fabulous. So glad we made time in our busy schedule to visit Manly Beach. What a lively and happening beach, shopping area and restaurants. It is a great piece of Sydney culture.
Simple the best.. Easy to get to and surrounded by fabulous restaurants and bars.

Manly beach, more than a beautiful beach!!. Visiting Manly Beach was recommended and it was an absolute treat!! The ferry from Circular Quay to Manly Beach was awsom with great views. Once I arrived at Manly wharf I rented a bike for 2 hours and toke a ride to the North Head area of the Sydney Harbour National Park. I absolutely recommend to follow the scenic drive within the National Park. You will find some amazing sights of a beautiful nature with cliffs and the South Pacific ocean, but you'll also have a great view of the skyline of Sydney. WOW! After the effort of that biketrip I went to the beach, had a swim and watched those surf enthousiasts enjoying the waves. That was for me the ideal way to relax.One the way back with the ferry we enjoyed a sailing race event just before arriving in Sydney harbour. It was really spectacular!If you're visiting Sydney, this has to go on your to do list!! It'll certainly be on mine when I go back!
Great visit, Great food. We took the ferry there one day and spent the entire day there. The Norfolk pines amazed me, the size of them. The food was wonderful there

Fabulous beach. to get to Manley Beach, you take a very scenic ferry ride. The ferry ride alone is great. if you are looking for a great restaurant whilst at Manly, visit Fusion Point. Their menu prices are reasonable and the selections are healthy and delicious.

Worth the ferry ride. Think of Brighton but with more sun , bit of a trek to get to but it's a nice 25/30 min ferry ride from circular quay ( make sure you get a multi pass which covers the ferries otherwise it's $15 return ) Nice way to pass a day ....

Better than Bondi. OK, a busy seaside location, but it felt much classier than Bondi; there was a pleasant walk to the next bay, and the shops were more extensive and closer to the beach. Much handier for the ferry.

Overcrowded in summar and limited safe (and patrolled) areas to swim. Redeemed by the coastal walking track which makes it a great pedestrian area and many benches in the esplanade for scoffing fish and chips and people watching.

Take the ferry over for the day.. It's a great way to spend the day. We enjoyed the ferry ride, hiring bikes and of course, a beautiful beach. Lots of small restaurants for fish and chips or just an ice cream.

Loved it. It's old and new at the same time.. Lots to do in Manly....Surf Lessons are at the top of many people's lists as it is a place to get off the ferry, walk a short distance, and you're on the ocean side of the city. There are biking paths, rentals, shops, restaurants, and history to be soaked up in this lovely little town. Don't miss this one.

A day at Manly. Catch the Manly ferry from Circular Quay and experience our wonderful harbour and end up spending the day at Manly. An interesting place to walk around, swim and visit the Aquarium if you are interested in that sort of thing.
Worth a visit. Take a stroll along the Prom and stop off at one of the cafe's that are located on the seafront

ocean and harbour beaches in one place. classic sydney - get the ferry from circular quay. the walk up the corso is typical sydney beach and much more pleasant than bondi. the ocean beach has great surf and is well patrolled. at the southern end is a v sheltered little bay (shelley beach) which has great views of manly beach proper and is wonderful for small kids - shells, rocks, no big waves and The Kiosk restaurant. A fantastic day out.

Great Boardwalk. My sister lives in Manly and when we visit it is so nice to walk down by the beach and there are so many different places that you can get a nice meal or just a quick snack. There is also a great variety of shops.

Great beach with a good mall. A great place for a short trip, but not at night. It's got lots of food shops and souvernir shops. Perhaps go from Manly Wharf to the Old Quarantine Station (Ghost Tours)
Great beach. I liked Manly beach but thought the pipeline right in the middle was ugly. Friendly locals and nice pubs for lunch.
Beautiful people beautiful views!. The walk from Manly to the other beach (only one that faces west) includes some cool sculptures along the sidewalk! The Manly Fish Market was delicious too.

Australian city beach... Try it after bondi... But allow much more time to explore. Great food, great walks to Shelley beach, good for diving and beautiful views.Fora great adventure bring or hire a bike! And ride around the national park.. You can even stay at mirvac it's great fun!
Manly Beach. In my view the better beach in Sydney, give me manly anyday over Bondi.

A short beach but worth the visit. Its not Bondi, or Coogee, but the beach has great sand. Its at the pier, so no surfing, the rocks in the area make for a fun picture taking experience and the sunset here is breath taking. Lots of places to eat, grab souvenirs, and enjoy the Sydney weather.
Not too busy - just right. We spent a day at Manly Beach and there are plenty of restaurants and shops on the walk from the wharf to the beach. Showers and more restrooms would be appreciated.

Much better than Bondi!. We rode the ferry to Manly beach and loved it. Less crowded than Bondi and much cleaner. Lots of shops and restaurants. My daughter rented a board and went surfing. It was very easy and convenient.
A must do!. The ferry ride was great by itself. Manly Beach was very interesting, even on a so-so day, weather-wise. My wife loved the shopping. I loved the ferry ride!

One of Sydney's great beaches. My wife and I took the ferry from Circular Quay to Manley Beach to experience the typical "life at the beach". It was everything one would expect. There were people from all walks of life, enjoying a chance to lie in the sun, surf in the sea, walk with their dog, sit in the shade, or just watch other people. Luckily, we were guided by a local lady, who was walking a pretty golden retriever, to walk out to the Cabbage Tree Reserve. We truly enjoyed walking into a secluded area that led out on a ridge that divided the bay from the ocean. On the way we spotted a water dragon, and were informed by an older gentleman that they eat the extremely poisonous spiders that are found in the area, and therefore, "He is a lovely animal." We enjoyed seeing the many groups of school children who were apparently on field trips to learn about water safety.

nice for a city beach. the walk is nice, ride on the ferry bit expensive but it is worth if u are returning to city after dark, amazing views. Also nice fish and chips and kebabs if you fancy cheaper dining options
I feel like out of Sydney. When I was there, I didnt feel like I was in Sydney. When you want a getaway from the city centre, yes, this is where you can get.
A great day trip. Catch the ferry and enjoy Manly ... another great Sydney beach to people watch.
Must visit Manly.. Best beach in Sydney at Manly.And great steak houses in Manly too. Lots of great bars to go to too. Definitely visit Manly.

All that one would want in a beach. AS far as beaches go, it is difficult to think what more one could want than that which is on offer at Manly Beach. Warm, golden sand and a stretch of coast which on one side bubbles with white water from five-feet swells and on the other flows calmly enough to allow a leisurely swim.Inland, Manly offers up a vibrant promenade and shopping precinct with several restaurants, shops and ice cream or kebab parlours. Plenty to keep one's mind and palette occupied. It has a real seaside, surfer feel about it and it is a very cool place to be.The surf on Manly can be some of the best in Sydney and the beach is about as safe as any with attentive and plentiful lifeguards. It is difficult to think why Manly wouldn't stack up against the best beaches on offer in New South Wales.

Nothing Manly about this. Nothing much else to do at Manly except go to the beach. The local shops are very touristy and the eateries a bit ordinary. I visited just over 12 months ago as I hadn't been for many years and my memories from childhood were better than what greeted me!
Just a Ferry Trip away!. Great Food, shops, beautiful beach to relax on for the day. Also close to university.

Nice day at the beach. It's hard to remember all we did other than walk around and enjoy the sights. We didn't go there to lay on the beach as much as we went there just to see it. We toured one of the suggested walks and enjoyed the scenery. We also ate a a nice brick oven pizza place near the ferry that we very good.

Worth a trip.. Took the ferry to Manly not knowing what to find. Found an amazing ferry ride, seeing the sites from the water was amazing too. Manly was a wonderful suprise.
