A lovely clean beach with great eateries. Make sure to check out the great beer and food at Four Pines Brewing. The locals their told us about a walk to take around the beach and it was wonderful. If you want to see some surfers and take in the ocean this is a wonderful place to go, you can even hire a board and suit!

Absolutely beautiful.. My idea of a perfect beach. In winters, its just the locals down for a walk or a swim. During summers, it can get very crowded but less than Bondi.There are small, quaint little shops and cafes around the promenade.Plus, the ferry ride to and from the beach is a treat in itself.
Full of poeple despite the temperature!. The temperature is Coldplay but there is surfers in the Water untel late at night. They really love the sea. The restaurants are full
Miles away. Love Manly beach it feels soo different and miles away from the rest of Sydney and the many other beaches

It's only a beach, for goodness' sake.... But because it's an Aussie icon, you feel you have to go there. The good news is that you can go by ferry (very nice), walk along Manly beach to Shelly Bay (which is MUCH prettier) and back just in time to catch another ferry (about 55 minutes). If you go to Shelly, check out the whimsical sculptures beside the boardwalk- I really enjoyed them!

Worth the trip. Get the ferry from circular quay about 45 minutes and its relaxing and very scenic. Alight at the ferry terminal and walk straight down the mall till you hit the beach. A hive of activity and restaurants await. Wine dine and enjoy the view of a great big beach.

An iconic beach. This beach is an iconic beach in Sydney and lovely to sit around and watch the world pass by. For those who want to be near the beach but not get sand between their tows, there's always The Corso and restaurant / pub dining close by, or perhaps a walk or even shopping !!

Classic Sydney Beach. More than Bondi, Manly is a real Sydney beach. There is great surf, walk up the beach and you may catch some world-class surfing. Surrounding restaurants are pretty good, and you should take the stroll (from the south end) around to Shelly Beach for some pretty good snorkelling. Large, and I mean large, blue groupers (and yes, they are VERY BLUE) swim around the rocks and are easy to find and fairly tame.

Beautiful and pleasant. Beautiful beach and very quite compared to Sydney's other famous beach--Bondi. Beautiful views and some great restaurants. If you're looking to do the beach, spend the day. Otherwise, if you want to see the beach, a half-a-day excursion is probably sufficient to experience the beach and have a nice meal. Plus if you're visiting from the city, a ferry to and from the beach makes for a fun day.

Really nice Beach Community Perfect for Families with Kids. The beach is just a few blocks from the ferry landing which you get to on a pedestrian only street lined with shops and restaurants. The beach is clean and has lots of surf schools and day camps for kids. Take the walk out to the headland above the town for views and access to secluded coves.
Disappointing. The water is beautiful, but we were really disappointed because there didn't seem much to do, and the shopping there was the same in Sydney.
very enjoyable day at Manly. highlight of the day lunch at The Garfish Rest.,great service greatdrinks and grea.......t food
delightful village. We went by ferry from circular quay to many for lunch. Walked around the interesting shops bought a couple of different things, had a really lovely day.
Beautiful beach. The beach is definitely worth going to. It is just beautiful and there are lots of shops and restaurants, too.

Great beach. A very long sufers beach. Even if you're not into surfing this is a great place to go to. Excellent people watching, everybody is there young, old, babies.....you name it. Great facilities for changing and water fountains to fill up your water bottle with excellent tasting water.

Very Beautful, could use some cleaning.. This beach was great, although there was no swimming allowed on the ocean side.. surfing only... the beach itself needed a good cleaning...seaweed, and trash can be found the full length, but easily avoidable.

Manly Beach!. Hop on a ferry @ Circular Quay (pron. KEY) and head over to Manly for some fish & chips or walk along their path and check out some surfers! It's a great little beach town and an enjoyable excursion!

Fairy Bower is the best. When you get off the ferry at Manly walk straight along The Corso to the Ocean and then turn right and follow the walkway to along the ocean to Fairy Bower. Have a swim at the pool or in the ocean and then continue on to Shelly Beach for lunch. It's one of the perfect Sydney experiences!
Family beach. We prefer this beach than overrated Bondi. This beach is suitable for couple, family or just to relax.
Beaches manly. Lovely beaches with plenty of sitting areas on the esplanade. Good eating, drinking and shopping facilities at all beaches.
Great area. Manly was a lovely surprise. It's charming and there are lovely breezes for strolling, shopping and enjoying the beach.
Gorgeous. Great beach! Reminds me of South Beach Miami because one side of the road has beach and the other has shops and restaurants. Great spot to spend a day!
Manly. Great place to go to get away from the traffic. Lovely walks and an amazing facility on Sydney's doorstep. Very few swimmers .

Less busy than Bondi Beach!. I went to Bondi Beach and Manly Beach, but I preferred Manly Beach. It is less crowed and more family oriented. It has more of a seaside town feel to it. Also, the water is warmer. If you are young, you will prefer Bondi. However, if you are past your early 20s, you might want to go to Manly.

Nice. Good beach for surfing
Easy to get to from Manly Ferry terminal
Toilet facilities
Beach is a beach

A great place to visit. Stay a while - a few days is best.
Great for shopping, eating places are plentiful.
Such a walkable place.

The best shopping and beach experience. I love that unlike Bondi the beach is so near the the corso and the shops. It was easy to swim in the harbour with the kids or in the surf and then to go to a restaurant or cafe for something to eat. Beautiful

Crowded, dirty - not really a world class attraction. Went to Manly Beach on a Sunday afternoon - it was extremely crowded and dkirty. Did not have much atmosphere and my fellow travellers were disappointed as we had been to Santa Monica pier earlier in the year and was expecting some comparisons - we were wrong! Been there but am in no hurry to go back!

Watch out for the seagulls. A brilliant beach - much better than the overrated Bondi Beach. There were loads of surfers there and it was great just to sit on the wall and watch the action.The fish and chips at Manly is good but watch out for the seagulls if you sit on the beach wall to eat your meal - they are quite vicious!

Great focus for the Manly Ferry Ride. We went to Manly beach for the first time in several decades, catching the ferry over, strolling down the Corso, had a swim, then repeated the return journey.All in all a reasonably priced outing, certainly lots of eating places and an ice cream shop for dessert on the ferry wharf on the way home.
Great. Best beach I have ever been to - go to see Shelly Beach
nice addition to the Sydney area. Manly Beach was a nice trip by boat. The beach was nice and we enjoyed walking around the area

Everything a beach town should be.... The beach is beautiful and don't hesitate to try the numerous food shops along the walk between the ferry terminal and the larger beach.Beyond the main tourist drag is a cute little community that seems a bit removed from the tourism spectrum. One of those places that reminds me of California seaside towns....Venice beach, Santa Monica, etc.

What a great day!!. We took the Manly Ferry at Circular Quay around 11 am. The cost of the ferry was $13.20 AUD return. The trip took about 30 min but it was a great way to see the Harbour and the ferry offers free Wi-Fi. Once in Manly, we walked down the Corso to the beach. The Corso is a pedestrian street with wall to wall stores. The beach itself was fantastic. The temperature reached 37C that day and the waves were plentiful. We had a fantastic time in the water, trying to body surf , swim and also relaxing while sun tanning. Surf boards, lawn chairs and umbrellas are available for rent but we just used our beach towels to lie down on the beach. There were many surfers that day and it was very nice to see them trying to ride the waves. Lifeguards were present and they worked hard to ensure that the swimmer were in the water a safe distance from the surfers. There are several small shops to buy pop and ice cream. Public toilets were accessible and clean.

Beach and Harbour Magnificent-Corso very ordinary. I grew up in Manly and left the area 20 years ago. I have had a few return trips over the years, love the beach front(sorry Bondi) and of course the harbour. The Corso is the pedestrian precint between both and is still looking very sad and dated. The paving is drab and grubby and apart from a few traders who have spent a lot on their shops there is no character or interest in the pedestrian precinct. A good makeover and garden landscaping, a la Darling Harbour, would make it's unique location between the Harbour and the sea world class. However it appears the local council and chamber of commerce must think ordinary is good.Parking fees are $4 an hour, probably one of the highest for a "premier" beach location in the country.Cafes and restaurants along the beach front ,as well as the beach esplanade itself have had considerable money spent on them and are looking great.The "famous" Manly Wharf has a great pub and restaurant, unfortunately the rest of the wharf is rather grubby and draughty. Come on manly, get with the 21st Century
best beach in sydney. loved the beach and the ferry ride...the place is so much fun and the spit to manly walk is just amazing

Do it every day. If you can stay at Circular Quay when visiting Sydney,take the ferry over.
Try the fast ferry and the slow one,top deck front seats.
We did it nearly every day,some great restaurants to choose from and an inclosed ocean swimming pool.
This this is a must.

Give Manly beach wide berth. filled with rubbish, every eating table along the beachfront is covered with seagull poop. the seagulls being so bad that they fly in and grab your food out of your hand. However take the time to walk around past the life saving club to the headland. there is a tiny swimming cove there, and also a walk up the heads where the view is lovely. the corso also needs better eating shops, the only place you can get a sandwich is subway, unless you want a kebab or something fried in oil.

Take the 1 hour minibus tour for views. Really enjoyed the ferry to Manly. Not being sure where to go upon disembarking, we went to the tourist office and were recommended the 1 hour minibus tour. It was worth the $10, offered fantastic views of Sydney from the hills, several stops to stop pictures, and heard lots of little known facts.Spent some time visiting the shops in Manly & taking in the atmosphere and sights.

Nice enough, but not Bondi. Clearly a popular place - plan ahead to catch the ferry - but somewhat less spectacular than Bondi. The strip leading to the beach is extremely tourist-ey and doesn't feel very authentic. Nonetheless, a beautiful beach. Watch out for bluebottles.
Except I saw the guy peeing. I did not know that peeing in public is allowed in Australia. One of the hostel (hotel?) was also overbooked.
Get a bike. Rent a bike and go to North Point - sensational views of Sydney
Manly. When you consider the great beaches of Australia Manly is pretty average, not a big fan unfortunately
easy to get to on the ferry. A fun ferry ride, then a fun day on the beach. Hugo's was great for lunch.

What a wonderful way to spend a sunny day when you are in Sydney.. Take the ferry from Circular Quay to Manly Beach. It's a short walk from the dock to the beach. I didn't stop in all the stores along the way, but if you're a shopper, there are plenty of stores to keep you busy. I got to the beach as soon as I could. On a sunny day, Manly Beach is beautiful. The sand is white. The water is a lovely aqua. Everyone is enjoying the water, and some are enjoying the hike along the shore.I took a walk and took in the views from several different perspectives. There are several viewing spots with benches. They enable one to take a photo or to rest their legs if they need to. People are friendly here. I met a nice couple from America with their baby and enjoyed a nice conversation with them. Many mothers were wheeling their baby carriages enjoying the day.What a wonderful way to spend a sunny day when you are in Sydney. Try not to miss Manly.

lots of action at manly beach. Bavarian Bier Cafe on the wharf at Manly was excellent. Packed full of people, lots of beer and the food looked great...would have stayed to eat if we had not already booked somewhere else.

Love everything about Manly. Love everything about Manly... here are my picks:
Best Restaurant = Manly Pavillion
Best Coffee = Cartel
Best Icecream = Ben & Jerrys
Best Family Swim = Shelly Beach
Best Takeaway = Burger Me
Best Breakfast = Whitewater
nice side trip. Just catch a ferry at Circular Quay and its a 30 min sail. A nice friendly little town and picturesque beach

Beautiful - and the ride is half the fun. We took the ferry to Manly from Circular Quay in Sydney. The ride across the harbour is worth mentioning; you have to love public transportation on water. The ride takes about 40 mins. (on the regular, not high-speed, ferry) and, if you snag a seat outside, it's absolutely beautiful, with great views of the harbour's attractions (Opera House, etc.) and beautiful waterside homes all around the harbour. When you dock at Manly, you walk the promenade over to the beach. Simply put, it's a gorgeous Pacific beach, with great sand and great views. Beyond enjoying the beach itself, there are lots of trails, etc. for exercising, great people watching, and several stores and places to eat. You can easily spend an entire day here as a visitor; if you love the beach, maybe more than one! There is a place called the Bavarian Bier Cafe right next to the ferry terminal; it's a nice place to stop for a beer prior to boarding the ferry for the ride back to Sydney. If you're planning a trip to Sydney, Manly is a must-do.

Not disappointed. Good beach area. Make a point of walking promenade to Cabbage Tree Bay. Stop for a cold drink or a coffee at cafe on the way, sit outside and watch the surfers. Note the sculptures in the rocks along the walkway. Take in the peace of Cabbage Tree Bay and sit awhile. Bliss!
Great walk!. You can take just a half day or even an evening to do this and take the ferry there and back.

Crowded but nice.. We did go hear on a weekend. What a zoo. Felt like millions of people everywhere. the surf guards seemed really uptight but I understand that this place is full of tourists so they are always pulling people out. It's a pretty beach yes, but it's only a beach. Waikiki in Oz ;)Still there are some good food places and it was fun to people watch.

Much better than Bondi. I loved it here. Much better beach that Bondi. It was quiet, but there was still a really good atmosphere. It's much more relaxing that Bondi, and although there isn't as many places to buy food/drink, there is still a really good feel about the place. I loved it here. I learned to surf here too, so will always have fond memories of the place.

Great place. Take the ferry to Manly for a nice afternoon. It's great for families or couples. We just walked around, had lunch and some drinks. If you don't plan on going to the beach itself you'll still find plenty to see and do.

Ride to the North Head. While you're in Manly, rent a bike (just across the street from the ferry) and ride up to the North Head. The ride starts with a moderately steep rise, but you get great views across the harbor back to the city.

Brilliant snorkelling, open water laps, coffee on the rocks, 7 miles from Sydney. Fairy Bower is a small rock outcrop on an esplanade which goes from one of Sydney's iconic surf beaches, Manly Beach to Shelly Beach, a pretty north-facing cove. Dive into the water and you are snorkelling in Cabbage Tree Bay Aquatic Reserve. This is a special area that provides protection and sanctuary for the weedy sea dragon, elegant wrasse, black rock cod and the blue groper. There are large underwater rock crevasses which house big schools of fish and paddocks of seaweeds in toward Shelly.There is a shower by the small ocean pool and a dressing shed. Fairy Bower Cafe makes great coffee, either takeaway to drink on the warm rocks with a croissant or have it at the cafe, sit outside and watch the passers by (they have a good breakfast and lunch menu).One more treat along the esplanade are the water dragons - lizards (monitors) which grow to quite a size and who live in among the rocks and stare impassively at you, not in the slightest bit fazed by humans.Manly Corso is a great walk, with plenty of cafes and restaurants for lunch or dinner. There is quite a Brazilian flavour along this stretch now as it is seems to be a popular weekend place for South American students.It is amazing to have such pristine water so close to a major city - Sydney which is just a ferry ride away, across Sydney's beautiful harbour.

Very Relaxing. Manly is a beautiful beach and I was so happy that one of my colleagues suggested a trip out there. From what I understand, it is far less touristy than Bondi, but equally as beautiful. The beach wasn't terribly crowded, the water was clean, and there were a number of wonderful places to stop for lunch. It was the ideal little beach town. Plus, you get the added bonus of a beautiful ferry ride out there should you choose that mode of transporation and that alone made the trip worth it.

35 minutes from Sydney, but like being on holiday!. Manly Beach is long and sandy with good surfing for those who do not necessarily want 20-meter waves. There is a great walk to Shelly Beach with its little cafes, restaurants and public BBQ places. Climb up to the top of the cliff and you could be lucky enough in springtime to see whales passing by! You can swim, surf, dive or snorkel at Manly. Keep a lookout for the Water Dragons, large lizards that come out in the late afternoon to catch the sun. In Manly itself there are good shops and plenty of places to eat.
My favourite Place in OZ!. I love Manly, the nightlife, beach life and shops! There are also weekend markets. Plenty of cool hip resturants
Nice place to go for a walk.. It was a sunny day and we went there to take a walk and have a beer by the beach. It was fun.

clean and relaxing. The beach is beautiful, and eating out is easy and inexpensive. There are also a few shops to look around and you can also hire bicycles or surf boards. The sea is very noisy but accommodation balcony doors cancel out most of the noise
surf and sand. We chose to go to Manly rather than Bondi and were not disappointed. An interesting walk through the national park gave good views of the surrounding area and other small beaches.

Fleeting Visit. Just walked up one side of the street, on to the beach, and back the other side - very crowded, but very pleasant. Not a lot to do if you don't intend to play on the beach, but worth seeing
Well worth a visit. A must see if you are in Sydney, even if you are on a tight schedule. Makes you understand why people move to Australia.
A Must do if in Sydney. Catch the ferry to Manly Beach. It is not only a beautiful Ferry ride but the beach and beach area is wonderful. Just do it.

Seaside town with an inviting scenery. Loved the bike ride from the center to the cliff that looks out towards Sydney Harbor. A plethora of restaurants to choose from, shops, not too outlandish with tourists, the drive from Manly to Sydney is fun to cruise down once or twice. Enjoyed Manly very much so.

Excellent beach and very friendly Town...kids preferred it to Bondi!. We just came upon this little gem of a a beach / town by chance but it was just precious. Wonderful beach, town and shops and a lovely boat trip accross harbour. Would definately return.

Great excursion from Sydney CBD. We took a short trip out of Sydney to Manly - and boy, was it good. There is a direct ferry from Wharf 3 at Circular Quay that comes every half hour ... and you can then enjoy the view from the ferry - amazing.The Corso, the main drag along Manly, has lots of shops and food, and the beach at Manly is really nice too - wide and sandy, with good surfs.Do take time to at least do the walk along the Manly Beach scenic walk, which could lead you to either North Head (longer, more difficult), or Sydney Harbour National Park (shorter, pleasant walk). The views will reward the endevour.

Gorgeous beach and great day out. Spent the day in Manly - catch the 20 minute ferry from circular quay (get some good pics looking back towards the opera house and harbour bridge) eat breakfast in a beachfront cafe, do some shopping, walk along the coast and through the nature reserve to see waterdragons, birds, scenery etc. Surf, play volleyball or just lay in the sand. Finish up with food/drink in the manly wharf hotel over looking the bay.

Manly is the bomb!. We went to Manly towards the end of the day and were rushed to get back to Sydney center so we only stayed for about an hour. But we liked it so much we decided to go back the next day and have dinner and shop. Its a great place, very nice to walk around. Beach is nice and the surroundings festive. We took the ferry back at sundown and got some great pics.

A fantastic day out.. Manly Beach is a great day out. We caught the ferry from Circular Quay, Sydney. Its cheap and is a great crossing. You get first class views of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House and get stunning views of the rest of Sydney Harbour. Once at Manly Beach, we hired bikes and cycled off to the Sydney Harbour National Park. This was a great 1 - 2 hours of cycling to work up an appetite for lunch and gave us great views of the Sydney skyline. We ended up at Shelly Beach Park for a couple of hours sunbathing. There is a restaurant and cafe there and the usual excellent showers and toilets you would expect in Sydney. The beach is gorgeous sand with some rocks so great for snorkling. We then went for lunch at Bower's Restaurant which is on the esplanade between Shelly and Manly Beaches (a short walk). An awesome little restausrant (not on TA unfortunately), great food and great value and right on the esplande front. The views of the sea and the potential for people watching is great. Then Manly Beach itself is a great sandy beach with great facilities for surfers and families topped off with some great shops and bars. An excellent day out.
Love Manly.... Manly has some amazing beaches.... Try Shelly Beach, Little Manly, Queenscliff plus a handfull of fantastic Harbour Beaches..

Good afternoon program when ferrying over from Sydney. Manly is a tourist village with nice beaches and promenades. Went to Southern Lookout through National Park. Great location to relax and walking. Ferry from Sydney offers nice sights to surroundings.

Manly reminded me of how the English seaside used to be. We were staying in Sydney and decided to drive over to Manly for the day as it's not very far. It was such a lovely place. There seemed to be two different beaches, one on each side of Manly so we parked up on the street (which was easy to do unlike lots of places !) and walked to the first beach we came to, it was lovely but a bit strange that you are not allowed to go in the water in many areas as the surfers have priority ! We had a great lunch at a beachside bar, much to my sons delight you could see all the wonderful views on the beach whilst eating ! ( he thinks aussie girls are amazing ). We took a walk around the shops which are on a pedestrianised area and very nice whilst the boys walked along the prom, it really reminds you of old english seaside towns, but with more sun of course :-) yet at the same time it had a very cool vibe. I would love to go back to actually stay for a few days instead of a day trip. It was great and less manic than the wonderful Sydney can be.

Would love to return. A great daytrip. Perfect Sydney antidote.. We are a family of father, mother, 2 young boys (6 and 2.5 yo). We were in Sydney for 4 nights total. Didn't really plan on going to Manly as we haven't decided between Bondi and Manly. We were walking around Circular Quay and on a whim, decided to take the ferry to manly as it was leaving in 5 minutes. That was the correct decision! We had a lovely time on the ferry. Short enough to be exciting instead of boring. Easy walk on the Corso to the beach. We did not do much. In fact we just sat around on the steps to the beach while the kids played on the sand. Had a quick lunch at a small Japanese hole in the wall by the library. While the young one napped, the elder one played in the mini playground in the middle of Corso and we did some shopping. Scored some super cheap Merrells at Platypus store. Got kiddie sized ice cream at Royal Copenhagen with non-stop sprinkles. Walked back to ferry dock and there was even a candy bar with about 100 types of candy to complete the kids' day.Perhaps it's because it was our first time in Sydney and I was thoroughly disheartened by the pace of it, but Manly was the perfect antidote. It was cheap too with the ferry (and Sydney so expensive). Would heartily recommend this daytrip.

great memories of happy manly. i visited manly with friends on christmas day while touring oz.watched the kids with xmas trees on the beach while the sun shone.we were invited to a local hotel and given a free plate of food and some seaview champange,certainly a great christmas,i returned a few days later and found it a great little town would love to return sometime the ferry trip from circular quay is a bonus.malcolm annan visit was dec 25th 2001

A Great Day Out at Manly. Partner and I spent a lovely day out at Manly. The iconic ride on the Manly Ferry followed by shopping on the Corso, very nice. Stopped for a delicious seafood lunch at the BlueWater Cafe on the beachfront which had quick and friendly service, and then worked it off with a bike ride (hired) along the beach and through the back streets to the lookout at Cabbage Tree bay. Before leaving we stopped in at The Four Pines microbrewery for a sample of their fine ales and watched a beautiful sunset across the harbour on the return ferry to Circular Quay. What more can be said!

A genuine, iconic, Aussie beach!. plain and simple. Easily accessed from greater Sydney, the beach is beautiful, ideal for a swim, a surf or just a stroll along the sand.  Literally just across the street from the Manly Corso and just a short walk from the Manly Ferry Terminal, it is perfectly located for a day at the beach, with restaurants and snack-bars just a minute away.  Great to combine with a trip on the Manly Ferry and a shop. Manly Beach – make a day of it!

If you were to go Nude in Manly ....... chances are you'd get arrested!!!. I don't know where trip advisor got their advice but, seriously, you would be hard pressed to find anyone sun bathing topless - definitely no nudies about. Manly is a beautifully clean city beach. It's hard to believe you're so close to a city of 5 million people when enjoying the clean sand and clear blue ocean of Manly Beach. It's a family destination by day and a party place by night - a suburb of split personalities with lots of walkers, joggers, cylclists and roller bladers in the morning morphing into a great night spot with something for everyone.

Touristy city beach. Both Manly and Bondi are city beaches. Handy if you are short on time and staying in the city, but if you want to see some real aussie beaches you are better off heading further north to Narrabeen or south to Cronulla. Better still, head out of the city and to the north or south coast.

Lovely sites, nice walks. My friends who have visited Sydney almost exclusively said that I must visit Manly, and if I had time for only one beach visit, to visit Manly over Bondi. I would add that the reason for that is not necessarily because Manly Beach is "better" but because it's more diverse. Manly, apart from the main beach also features the Shelley Beach, a smaller, more intimate place connected to the main beach by a scenic walkway exclusively for pedestrians and bicyclists. There is also the North Head park with walking trails that is a must see as it gives a lovely panoramic view of the city and amazing rock formations with crashing waves to add to the ambiance. You can either rent a bicycle and tour around or walk. I took one of the city busses to a mid point and walked the rest of the way, so from city center to North Head and back took me 2 hours. The trails are super easy to walk and very relaxing. You'll see numerous spider webs with enormous spiders. Since Australia has some of the most poisonous snakes and spiders, I kept my distance but still managed to take pictures. There are other critters around such as the goanas and nocturnal mammals, but I didn't see any. It also has neat vegetation most of which is short due to the hight of the rocks and the wind. I really enjoyed spending the afternoon there. I did not go to the Oceanworld as I've been to some of the best in the world.
Sun Fun Surfers and Girls!!. Wonderful beach and even better town to do beach shopping.

Any day at the beach is a good day. We visited Manly in winter, and this was the only beach we visited due to the cold weather, so we can't compare it to the other surrounding beaches. The kids were out for July holidays (remember that's the winter down there) and it was a sunny Sunday, and the place was really packed. We walked along the ticky-tacky shops that you expect at the beach along the Corso, and grabbed some lunch to take to sit on the steps of the ocean beach. We then walked down to Shelley beach, and up onto the park hill for some ocean views. I couldn't say there was anything particularly special about this place, but it's the beach and any day at the beach is a good day.

Great little beach and seaside town, def worth a day trip!. We visited here in winter so it was a little windy and damp but you can still tell how lovely the beach is, would be packed on a summers day, the town is lovely too, lots of alfresco eating, little cafes, seafood restaurants, and little souvnier shops, there is an aquarium, bike rental to explore the area and plenty of watersports available also. Def worth a day trip on the ferry from Sydney

Nice trip, okay beach. The ferry ride to Manly was very nice, although we enjoyed better views from the ferry to Darling Harbour. We didn't spend much time at Manly beach though, as there was not much to do unless you are interested in surfing or maybe sunbathing. The beach was clean and very quiet (we visited in winter), but I think there are more interesting places in and around Sydney, especially if you are short on time. Not bad, but nothing special either.

great getaway for a day. Manly beach is a very nice beach and it's very easy to access it by ferry. No need to prepare and commute for a long time, just hop on the ferry and you're there in 30 minutes. And the ferry ride gives you a great opportunity to see the harbour. It's cheap, it's simple and it's always great to go to the beach! Even if you don't want to spend the day and carry all your beach stuff, just go for an afternoon, sit on the steps instead of the sand and you'll have a great time just watching the surfers and work on your tan!

Better Than Bondi. We went during the summer so the beach was still really packed. We went diving at an area called Shelly Beach and that was a little more secluded. Overall it was a swell beach and didn't have as many teenagers as Bondi.

A slice of Heaven. In the summer this is fantastic. Beautiful water, and warm sand. Waves are pretty good, but not for surfers. It's better than Casey's Beach in Batemans Bay for boogie boarders (Thats for sure!).
Come here for a great time! Stay for the dinner at the restaurants.

overrated. compared to other beaches in the northern sections of Sydney, Manly is not one of the best. crowded, dirty, claustrophobic. the local scenery (adjacent shops, hotels, etc) is depressingly shabby. I wold travel further north to narrabeen, collaroy, etc.

could have spent the time better.... Going to Manly was the only disappointing thing we did in our 3 weeks in Australia. The ride across the Harbor from Sydney is okay but views are more interesting on other rides, when you arrive you have to walk thru blocks of shops selling identical trinket tourist junk before getting to the main beach. Worth going if you want to spend time on the beach, otherwise there are many lovlier towns and more interesting beaches in Oz. Rather than stay any longer once there, we took the next ferry back.

Magnificent sun, surf and setting. This Sydney beach is far preferable to Bondi Beach.The ferry trip from Circular Quay is fun, with passengers watching the city-bound ferry cresting the waves on a day when earlier, the ferry had stopped operating for an hour or so due to treacherous berthing conditions at Manly Wharf.Arriving at Manly Wharf on an idyllic December day, I took a short walk down the Corso through the pedestrian mall and then viewed a popular, though not overcrowded, most attractive beach with reasonable surf that on many days can be even better.The golden sand glistened, the two lifesavers on duty stretched out in a casual way but still scanned the horizon and all beachgoers seemed to be enjoying themselves.I hope that most visitors to Sydney experience Manly and its delights.

Best beach we visited. Our title says it all. the best beach we visited. Great surf, my husband, a keen surfer couldn't get enough. We were greeted with wonderful weather, great people, nice trendy shops, good food. Next time we visit, and we will make sure that there is a next time, we will base ourselves here. Manly, you are a winner.

Our Next trip to Sydney will be in Manly. We loved this place. We loved the shops, the people, the surf, the beach. Great food too! We ended up visiting here throughout our stay and really had a blast there. We liked it better than Bondi. This place has a CA feel to it, but has beautiful pine trees, nice beach. I have to warn people that night can pose problems in the Corso area, but no worse than other world cities. Great food, great shops. If you want souvenirs like shirts, etc, this is the place to go. The ferry ride here is alone worth from the trip (from Quay). We sat on the beach and just watched the surfers, some of whom were VERY good. The surf is for beginners, yet still dangerous. We saw whales frequently here as well. A must-do for any Sydney visit. Next time I have business in Sydney, if ever, I am going to stay in Manly and commute. LOVED THIS PLACE!

Manly Beach - Amazing Surf. No surf - are you kidding?You obviously don't surf! Manly has been host to many a world championship surfing contest... and on many days is the best spot to surf in the Sydney region.It catches the same swell that North Narrabeen gets - a world class break.At the moment its 4ft and perfect! Like all beaches worldwide - surf conditions vary.... there is no guarentee of waves.Depending on the swell Manly and other local breaks (deadmans) can range from 1 ft to 15ft - search deadmans on youtube and see the footage for yourself!As for posers - the world wide base is located at Bondi where you thongs match you swimmers and your sunglasses.Manly is relaxed, casual and local.... explore all the hidden laneways and off shoots to find where all the locals like to hang out!
love it!. best beach in sydney - and the world!

Very clean. We went to Manly beach for the day on new years day (as opposed to Bondi Beach). The beaches were actually closed that day as the swell was too high but the beach was still packed with people, although not too busy to find ourselves a spot! The ferry from Sydney harbour was lovely and the walk from the ferry to Manly beach took your through the high street. Worth going to if you;re after a day of relaxation and sunbathing! I didn;t notice the posers (as some others have mentioned) but there were a lot of sun tanned people which can be annoying when it's the first few days of your holiday and you're still lilly white!

best place for a morning run in the World. I stayed in Manly for a month and every morning i would run down the esplanade and round over to Esplanade park - when the suns coming up over manly cove there is no better run - it's short only about twenty minutes but it always brought a smile to my face - i can still picture the clear sea and the sun just coming over the horizonWhat a magical beach!

Posers Posers everywhere and priced accordingly. Nice setting until you realize that its an overated Huntington Beach with no real surf to speak of (not what we went for as we live in Hawaii). Lots of people pretending to be surf folk though and lots of the usual trendy surf shops. Also seems to be choked with youth hostels and lots of young hostel people (no offense, but this was billed as a vacation spot, right?) Sunrise was beautiful though and the Lorikeets in the Cook Pines in the evening cant be beat for city side bird watching. Didnt get to Bondi, heard it was preferable...so, unless you just want a nice, crowded beach walk, skip it for something else or take the ferry from Sydney for the day...unless, of course, you are in that under 25 crowd with a backpack!GT
Rubbish. Overrated big time. Just like the Spanish Costas but without the ambience. Bondi wins hands down everytime.

Honeymoon Heaven. My husband and I chose Australia as our honeymoon destination and being inexperienced travelers, we ended up in downtown Sydney. We are from a very samll town in Canada and the busy city was far from the relaxed getaway we'd hoped for. Once we'd become familiar with the city, we found Manly and the second we stepped off the ferry, we instantly fell in love. We decided to cancel our reservations in the city and move to Manly immediatly. Once we were there we visited the Manly Dive Center and with the friendly and helpful staff (hi Dave, hi Shmoolie) we couldn't resist getting our recreational dive certificates. It was the most amazing experience and made Manly even more memorable. The Manly aquarium is great and you can watch the sharks having a feed. There's also a healthy-foods shop on the corso I loved that had the best yogurt cups with real fruit. There's a local artist that arrives at night and does paintings with only spraypaint and random pieces of paper as his tools. I would recommend staying in Manly to anyone intimidated by the unfamiliarity of the big city.

Lived in Manly and loved it !. I used to live in Manly while studying English at College. I loved its colors, the friendly people, the magic atmophere expecially in spring and summer. The sunsets are those that anybody can't forget! Autumns are warm, and you can even go to the beach before winds comes from the sea and makes the air chilly. The wharf is so close to shops, supermarket and the most wonderful beaches I've ever seen in my life: walking along the Corso is something challanging for your eyes, meeting people, drinking something at cafes and visiting the diverse shops - and it's even more surprising at Christmas time! There are many buses and coaches if you want to go to Palm Beach or to Frenchforest... where a lovely swimming poool is waiting for you. I could go to Sydney City by ferry: and the view to the skyline approaching is something absolutely stunning! The ferry is fast, and the jetcat even faster... it was so great to go to the Opera House for some night performance, and immediately take the jetcat and get home in Manly in fifteen minutes!

Stayed in Manly. Instead of staying in Sydney, we opted to stay in Manly and ferry to other attractions. The beach was magnificent, the shops were very diverse, and the people were all friendly. Just a few blocks walk between the beach side and the wharf side (through shops and cafes) made it simple to hop on a ferry to Sydney's Circular Quay, and anywhere else from there. Definitely no reason to rent a car at all. Loved it!

What a wonderful Beach. Manly Beach is a must see. Just a short boat ride from Circular Quay. On the boat ride to Manly you will get an up close look at the Sydney Harbor bridge and the Opra House (great photo ops.) when you get there you just follow the croud along a wide open street lined with cute gift shops, resturants, and ice cream shops. When you hit the beach, all you see is ocean. You can meet people from all over the world at Manly, and everyone is very friendly. the Beach is beautiful and the sand is soft. If you like the beach Manly is a must see. I much prefered Manly over Bondi.
